title: Vegan Omelette
raw_text: 5. Vegan Omelette: 300 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains chickpea flour, India.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup chickpea flour
- 1 cup water
- 1 tablespoon nutritional yeast
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/2 teaspoon onion powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1/2 cup chopped bell peppers
- 1/2 cup chopped onions
- 1/2 cup chopped tomatoes
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
- cooking oil
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, whisk together the chickpea flour, water, nutritional yeast, turmeric, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper until well combined. let the batter rest for about 10 minutes.
2. heat a little cooking oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
3. add the bell peppers, onions, and tomatoes to the skillet. sauté for about 5 minutes until the vegetables are slightly softened.
4. pour the chickpea batter over the sautéed vegetables in the skillet, spreading it out evenly.
5. cook the omelette for about 5-7 minutes, until the bottom is golden brown and set.
6. carefully flip the omelette using a spatula and cook for another 5-7 minutes until the other side is golden brown and cooked through.
7. remove the vegan omelette from the skillet and garnish with fresh cilantro.
8. cut into wedges and serve hot. enjoy your vegan omelette!
ingredients_list: chickpea, flour, water, yeast, turmeric, garlic, powder, onion, powder, salt, pepper, taste, bell, pepper, onion, tomato, fresh, cilantro

title: Granola with Soy Milk
raw_text: 10. Granola with Soy Milk: 550 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains nuts (varies by brand), United States.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 3 cups rolled oats
- 1 cup nuts (e.g. almonds, walnuts, or pecans)
- 1 cup dried fruits (e.g. raisins, cranberries, or chopped dates)
- 1/4 cup honey or maple syrup
- 1/4 cup melted coconut oil or vegetable oil
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- pinch of salt
- soy milk (for serving)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 325°f (165°c).
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the rolled oats, nuts, dried fruits, honey or maple syrup, melted coconut oil or vegetable oil, vanilla extract, ground cinnamon, and salt. mix well to ensure all ingredients are evenly coated.
3. spread the granola mixture evenly onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat.
4. bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the granola is golden brown and crispy, stirring once halfway through to prevent burning.
5. remove the granola from the oven and let it cool completely on the baking sheet. this will allow it to harden and become crunchy.
6. once cooled, transfer the granola into an airtight container for storage.
7. serve the granola with soy milk, topping your desired amount with a generous splash of soy milk.

enjoy your homemade granola with soy milk!
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, nut, almond, walnut, pecan, dried, fruit, raisin, cranberry, date, honey, maple, syrup, coconut, vegetable, vanilla, extract, ground, cinnamon, pinch, salt, soy, milk

title: Tempeh Bacon and Hash Browns
raw_text: 19. Tempeh Bacon and Hash Browns: 1000 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains soy, Indonesia.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 ounces tempeh
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon maple syrup
- 1 tablespoon liquid smoke
- ¼ teaspoon garlic powder
- ¼ teaspoon paprika
- ¼ teaspoon black pepper
- 4 medium-sized potatoes, peeled and grated
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. begin by preparing the tempeh bacon. slice the tempeh into thin strips.
2. in a bowl, mix together soy sauce, maple syrup, liquid smoke, garlic powder, paprika, and black pepper.
3. place the tempeh strips in the marinade and let them marinate for at least 15 minutes, or longer if desired.
4. heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and add 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil.
5. fry the marinated tempeh strips in the skillet until crispy and browned on both sides, about 2-3 minutes per side. remove from heat and set aside.
6. in a separate bowl, combine the grated potatoes and chopped onion. season with salt and pepper.
7. heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in the same skillet over medium heat.
8. add the potato-onion mixture to the skillet, spreading it out evenly. press it down gently with a spatula.
9. cook the hash browns until golden brown and crispy on one side, then flip and cook on the other side. this should take about 5-7 minutes per side.
10. once the hash browns are cooked, remove them from the skillet and serve alongside the tempeh bacon.

enjoy your tempeh bacon and hash browns!
ingredients_list: ounce, tempeh, soy, sauce, maple, syrup, liquid, garlic, powder, paprika, black, pepper, potato, onion, vegetable, salt, pepper, taste

title: Vegan Breakfast Parfait
raw_text: 28. Vegan Breakfast Parfait: 300 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts (granola and toppings), United States.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup of dairy-free yogurt
- 1/2 cup of granola
- 1/2 cup of fresh berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)
- 2 tbsp of chia seeds
- 2 tbsp of maple syrup
- 1/4 cup of nuts (such as almonds, walnuts, or pecans)
- optional: 1 tbsp of shredded coconut or cacao nibs for topping
preparation:
1. in a glass or a bowl, add a layer of yogurt at the bottom.
2. sprinkle a layer of granola on top of the yogurt.
3. add a layer of fresh berries over the granola.
4. sprinkle a layer of chia seeds over the berries.
5. drizzle a little bit of maple syrup over the chia seeds.
6. add another layer of yogurt on top of the chia seeds and maple syrup.
7. repeat the layers by adding granola, berries, chia seeds, and maple syrup.
8. finally, top the parfait with a few nuts and optionally, shredded coconut or cacao nibs for added texture and flavor.
9. serve immediately and enjoy your vegan breakfast parfait!
ingredients_list: dairy, yogurt, granola, fresh, berry, strawberry, blueberry, raspberry, chia, seed, maple, syrup, nut, almond, walnut, pecan, shredded, coconut, cacao, nib, topping

title: Vegan Breakfast Energy Balls
raw_text: 39. Vegan Breakfast Energy Balls: 50 calories per portion, 6 portions, contains nuts (varies by recipe), United States.
ingredients:
ingredients for vegan breakfast energy balls:
- 1 cup rolled oats
- 1/2 cup almond butter
- 1/4 cup maple syrup
- 1/4 cup ground flaxseed
- 1/4 cup shredded coconut
- 1/4 cup chopped nuts (such as almonds or walnuts)
- 1/4 cup dried cranberries
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- pinch of salt
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the rolled oats, almond butter, maple syrup, ground flaxseed, shredded coconut, chopped nuts, dried cranberries, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and salt.
2. mix well until all the ingredients are evenly combined and the mixture becomes sticky and holds together.
3. place the mixture in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes to firm up.
4. once firm, remove from the refrigerator and scoop about a tablespoon of the mixture into your hands.
5. roll it between your palms to form a ball shape. repeat with the remaining mixture.
6. place the energy balls on a parchment-lined baking sheet or a plate.
7. optional: you can roll the energy balls in additional shredded coconut or ground flaxseed for extra flavor and texture.
8. place the energy balls back in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour to set and become firmer.
9. once set, store the vegan breakfast energy balls in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.
10. enjoy as a nutritious and energizing breakfast or snack.
cooking_style: no cooking style is indicated in this recipe.
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, almond, butter, maple, syrup, ground, flaxseed, shredded, coconut, nut, almond, walnut, dried, cranberry, vanilla, extract, cinnamon, pinch, salt

title: Vegan Breakfast Bibimbap
raw_text: 46. Vegan Breakfast Bibimbap: 700 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains soy, South Korea.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup cooked rice
- 1 cup diced tofu
- 1 cup finely chopped kale
- 1 cup shredded carrots
- 1 cup bean sprouts
- 1 tablespoon sesame oil
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
- 1 teaspoon sesame seeds
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh cilantro for garnish
preparation:
1. in a large skillet, heat the sesame oil over medium heat.
2. add the diced tofu and cook until golden brown and crispy, about 5 minutes. remove from skillet and set aside.
3. in the same skillet, add the kale and shredded carrots. cook until slightly wilted, about 2-3 minutes.
4. add the bean sprouts and cook for an additional 1 minute.
5. in a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce and rice vinegar. pour the mixture over the vegetables in the skillet and stir well to combine.
6. add the cooked rice to the skillet and stir until everything is evenly mixed and heated through.
7. season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. transfer the bibimbap to serving bowls and garnish with sesame seeds and fresh cilantro.
9. serve the vegan breakfast bibimbap hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: rice, tofu, kale, shredded, carrot, bean, sprout, sesame, soy, sauce, rice, vinegar, sesame, seed, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Vegan Breakfast Muesli
raw_text: 47. Vegan Breakfast Muesli: 650 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts (varies by recipe), Switzerland.
ingredients:
ingredients for vegan breakfast muesli:
- 1 cup rolled oats
- 1 cup plant-based milk (such as almond or soy milk)
- 1 tablespoon chia seeds
- 1 tablespoon flaxseed meal
- 1 tablespoon maple syrup or agave nectar
- 1/4 cup unsweetened shredded coconut
- 1/4 cup chopped nuts (such as almonds, walnuts, or pecans)
- 1/4 cup dried fruits (such as raisins, cranberries, or apricots)
- fresh fruits for topping (such as bananas, berries, or sliced apples)
preparation:
1. in a medium-sized mixing bowl, combine the rolled oats, plant-based milk, chia seeds, flaxseed meal, and maple syrup or agave nectar. mix well to ensure all the ingredients are well combined.
2. let the mixture sit overnight in the refrigerator, or for at least 2 hours, to allow the oats and chia seeds to absorb the liquid and become soft.
3. once the muesli has soaked and thickened, remove it from the refrigerator and give it a good stir.
4. add the unsweetened shredded coconut, chopped nuts, and dried fruits to the muesli mixture. mix well to distribute the ingredients evenly.
5. to serve, portion the muesli into bowls or jars.
6. top each serving with fresh fruits of your choice.
7. enjoy your vegan breakfast muesli immediately or keep it refrigerated for up to 3 days.
cooking_style: no cooking style is indicated in this recipe as it is a no-cook recipe.
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, plant, milk, almond, soy, milk, chia, seed, flaxseed, maple, syrup, agave, nectar, unsweetened, shredded, coconut, nut, almond, walnut, pecan, dried, fruit, raisin, cranberry, apricot, fresh, fruit, topping, banana, berry, apple

title: Vegan Breakfast Tofu Bowl
raw_text: 48. Vegan Breakfast Tofu Bowl: 600 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains soy and nuts (optional), United States.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 block of firm tofu
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/2 teaspoon onion powder
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 cup cooked quinoa
- 1 cup sautéed vegetables (such as bell peppers, mushrooms, and spinach)
- 1 avocado, sliced
- 2 tablespoons nutritional yeast
- fresh cilantro or parsley, for garnish
preparation:
1. drain and press the tofu to remove excess moisture. cut the tofu into small cubes.
2. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
3. add the tofu cubes to the skillet and sprinkle with turmeric, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper.
4. cook the tofu for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until it becomes golden brown.
5. in a separate bowl, combine the cooked quinoa and sautéed vegetables.
6. divide the quinoa and vegetable mixture into serving bowls.
7. top each bowl with the cooked tofu cubes and sliced avocado.
8. sprinkle nutritional yeast over the bowls for an extra cheesy flavor.
9. garnish with fresh cilantro or parsley.
10. serve and enjoy your vegan breakfast tofu bowl!
ingredients_list: tofu, olive, turmeric, garlic, powder, onion, powder, salt, pepper, taste, quinoa, saut, vegetable, bell, pepper, mushroom, spinach, avocado, yeast, fresh, cilantro, parsley, garnish

title: Vegan Breakfast Vegetable Stir
raw_text: 50. Vegan Breakfast Vegetable Stir-Fry: 500 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains soy, China.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, thinly sliced
- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 zucchini, thinly sliced
- 1 cup mushrooms, sliced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- salt and pepper to taste
- 2 cups baby spinach
- 1/4 cup nutritional yeast
- 1/4 cup soy sauce or tamari
- 1/4 cup vegetable broth
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. add the onion, bell pepper, zucchini, and mushrooms. cook until vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes.
3. add the minced garlic, turmeric, paprika, salt, and pepper. stir well to coat the vegetables evenly with the spices.
4. add the baby spinach and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes.
5. in a small bowl, whisk together the nutritional yeast, soy sauce (or tamari), vegetable broth, and lemon juice.
6. pour the sauce mixture over the vegetables in the skillet. stir well to combine.
7. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, until the sauce has thickened slightly.
8. remove from heat and serve hot.
9. garnish with fresh herbs or sesame seeds, if desired.

enjoy your vegan breakfast vegetable stir-fry!
ingredients_list: olive, onion, thinly, red, bell, pepper, thinly, zucchini, thinly, mushroom, clove, garlic, minced, turmeric, paprika, salt, pepper, taste, baby, spinach, yeast, soy, sauce, tamari, vegetable, broth, lemon

title: Vegan Breakfast Fried Rice
raw_text: 52. Vegan Breakfast Fried Rice: 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains soy, China.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups cooked rice
- 1 cup mixed vegetables (such as carrots, bell peppers, peas)
- 1/2 cup diced tofu
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons sesame oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 teaspoon ginger powder
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 green onions, chopped
preparation:
1. in a large skillet or wok, heat the sesame oil over medium heat.
2. add the minced garlic and diced tofu to the skillet, and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until tofu is lightly browned.
3. add the mixed vegetables to the skillet and stir-fry for an additional 3-4 minutes, until they are tender.
4. add the cooked rice to the skillet and mix well with the vegetables and tofu.
5. in a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, ginger powder, turmeric powder, and black pepper. pour the sauce over the rice mixture and stir everything together until well-coated.
6. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the rice is heated through.
7. remove from heat and garnish with chopped green onions.
8. serve hot and enjoy your vegan breakfast fried rice!
ingredients_list: rice, vegetable, carrot, bell, pepper, pea, tofu, soy, sauce, sesame, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, powder, turmeric, powder, black, pepper, green, onion

title: Vegan Breakfast Stuffed Peppers
raw_text: 53. Vegan Breakfast Stuffed Peppers: 350 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains nuts (optional), United States.
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 4 bell peppers, halved and seeds removed
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 cup cooked quinoa
- 1 cup baby spinach, chopped
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1/2 cup black beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- salt and pepper to taste
- vegan cheese, grated (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. place the bell pepper halves in a baking dish, cut side up.
3. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
4. add the onion and garlic and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
5. add the cooked quinoa, spinach, cherry tomatoes, black beans, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper to the skillet. stir well to combine.
6. cook the mixture for another 5 minutes, until the spinach is wilted and the ingredients are heated through.
7. spoon the quinoa mixture into the bell pepper halves, filling them evenly.
8. if desired, sprinkle grated vegan cheese on top of each stuffed pepper.
9. cover the baking dish with foil and bake for 20-25 minutes, until the peppers are tender.
10. remove the foil and bake for an additional 5 minutes, until the cheese (if used) is melted and bubbly.
11. serve hot and enjoy your vegan breakfast stuffed peppers!
ingredients_list: bell, pepper, halved, seed, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, quinoa, baby, spinach, cherry, tomato, halved, black, bean, ground, cumin, paprika, salt, pepper, taste, vegan, cheese

title: Vegan Breakfast Shakshuka
raw_text: 55. Vegan Breakfast Shakshuka: 250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts (optional), Middle East.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tbsp olive oil 
- 1 onion, thinly sliced 
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced 
- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced 
- 1 yellow bell pepper, thinly sliced 
- 1 can diced tomatoes 
- 1 tsp ground cumin 
- 1 tsp ground paprika 
- 1/2 tsp ground turmeric 
- salt and pepper to taste 
- 1 cup spinach 
- 4-6 tofu scramble patties 
- fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. 
2. add the sliced onion and sauté until translucent, about 5 minutes. 
3. stir in minced garlic and cook for another minute. 
4. add the sliced red and yellow bell peppers and cook until they start to soften, about 5 minutes. 
5. pour in the diced tomatoes and their juices. 
6. stir in the ground cumin, paprika, turmeric, salt, and pepper. 
7. bring the mixture to a simmer and let it cook for 10-15 minutes, until the flavors meld together. 
8. stir in the spinach and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes. 
9. create little wells in the tomato mixture and carefully place the tofu scramble patties in each well. 
10. cover the skillet and cook for 5-7 minutes or until the tofu patties are heated through. 
11. remove from heat and garnish with fresh parsley. 
12. serve the vegan breakfast shakshuka with warm crusty bread or pita on the side. enjoy!
ingredients_list: olive, onion, thinly, clove, garlic, minced, red, bell, pepper, thinly, yellow, bell, pepper, thinly, tomato, ground, cumin, ground, paprika, ground, turmeric, salt, pepper, taste, spinach, tofu, patty, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Vegan Breakfast Frittata
raw_text: 56. Vegan Breakfast Frittata: 200 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains nuts (optional), Italy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 cups diced vegetables (such as bell peppers, mushrooms, spinach, or zucchini)
- 1 cup chickpea flour
- 1/4 cup nutritional yeast
- 1 cup water
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric
- salt and pepper, to taste
- fresh herbs, for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).

2. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the onion and garlic and sauté until soft and fragrant, about 3-4 minutes.

3. add the diced vegetables to the skillet and cook until they are tender, about 5-7 minutes. stir occasionally to prevent sticking.

4. in a medium bowl, whisk together the chickpea flour, nutritional yeast, water, turmeric, salt, and pepper until well combined and smooth.

5. pour the chickpea flour mixture into the skillet with the vegetables. stir everything together until the vegetables are evenly coated.

6. transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the frittata is firm and lightly golden on top.

7. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes. garnish with fresh herbs, if desired.

8. slice the frittata into wedges or squares and serve warm. enjoy your vegan breakfast frittata!
ingredients_list: olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, vegetable, bell, pepper, mushroom, spinach, zucchini, chickpea, flour, yeast, water, turmeric, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, herb, garnish

title: Vegan Breakfast Stuffed Tomatoes
raw_text: 59. Vegan Breakfast Stuffed Tomatoes: 50 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts (optional), United States.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large tomatoes
- 1 cup cooked quinoa
- 1 cup black beans, drained and rinsed
- 1/2 cup corn kernels
- 1/2 cup red bell pepper, diced
- 1/4 cup red onion, diced
- 2 tablespoons nutritional yeast
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- salt and pepper, to taste
- fresh parsley, for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cut the tops off the tomatoes and scoop out the pulp and seeds, leaving a hollow tomato shell. set aside.
3. in a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, black beans, corn kernels, red bell pepper, red onion, nutritional yeast, cumin, paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. mix well to combine.
4. spoon the quinoa mixture into each hollow tomato shell, filling them generously. place the stuffed tomatoes in a baking dish.
5. bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the tomatoes are tender and the filling is heated through.
6. remove from the oven and let cool slightly before serving.
7. garnish with fresh parsley and serve warm.

enjoy your vegan breakfast stuffed tomatoes!
ingredients_list: tomato, quinoa, black, bean, corn, kernel, red, bell, pepper, red, onion, yeast, cumin, paprika, garlic, powder, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Vegan Breakfast Sweet Potato Hash
raw_text: 65. Vegan Breakfast Sweet Potato Hash: 750 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts (optional), United States.
ingredients:
here's the recipe for vegan breakfast sweet potato hash:

ingredients:
- 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and diced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 green bell pepper, diced
- 1 onion, diced
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh parsley for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
2. add the sweet potatoes and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they start to soften.
3. add the diced peppers, onion, and minced garlic to the pan. cook for another 5-7 minutes, until the vegetables are tender.
4. add the paprika, cumin, turmeric, salt, and pepper to the pan. stir well to evenly coat the vegetables with the spices.
5. continue cooking for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sweet potatoes are fully cooked and slightly crispy on the outside.
6. remove from heat and garnish with fresh parsley, if desired.
7. serve hot as a delicious vegan breakfast option.

enjoy your vegan breakfast sweet potato hash!
ingredients_list: vegan, sweet, potato, hash, sweet, potato, red, bell, pepper, green, bell, pepper, onion, clove, garlic, minced, olive, paprika, ground, cumin, turmeric, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Vegan Breakfast Chili
raw_text: 69. Vegan Breakfast Chili: 550 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains nuts (optional), United States.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and diced
- 1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes
- 1 can (15 oz) black beans, drained and rinsed
- 1 can (15 oz) kidney beans, drained and rinsed
- 1 cup frozen corn
- 1 tablespoon chili powder
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
preparation:
1. heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
2. add diced onion and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes.
3. add minced garlic, diced red bell pepper, and diced jalapeno pepper. cook for an additional 3 minutes.
4. add diced tomatoes, black beans, kidney beans, frozen corn, chili powder, cumin, smoked paprika, salt, and black pepper. stir well to combine.
5. pour in vegetable broth and bring the mixture to a simmer.
6. cover the pot and let it cook for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally.
7. remove the cover and cook for an additional 5 minutes to thicken the chili.
8. stir in chopped cilantro before serving.
9. serve the vegan breakfast chili hot and enjoy!

title: Vegan Breakfast Lassi
raw_text: 71. Vegan Breakfast Lassi: 450 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts (optional), India.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 ripe banana
- 1 cup plant-based yogurt
- 1/2 cup almond milk
- 1 tablespoon maple syrup
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 tablespoon chia seeds (optional)
- ice cubes (optional)
preparation:
1. peel the banana and cut it into small pieces.
2. in a blender, add the banana, plant-based yogurt, almond milk, maple syrup, ground cinnamon, and vanilla extract.
3. blend all the ingredients until smooth and well combined.
4. if desired, add chia seeds and blend again for a few seconds.
5. if desired, add a few ice cubes to make the lassi colder and blend again until the ice is crushed and mixed well.
6. pour the prepared vegan breakfast lassi into glasses and serve chilled.
7. garnish with a sprinkle of ground cinnamon or chia seeds, if desired.
8. enjoy your refreshing and nutritious vegan breakfast lassi!
ingredients_list: banana, plant, yogurt, almond, milk, maple, syrup, ground, cinnamon, vanilla, extract, chia, seed, ice, cube

title: Vegan Breakfast Miso Soup
raw_text: 83. Vegan Breakfast Miso Soup: 850 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains soy, Japan.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 cups vegetable broth
- 2 tablespoons miso paste
- 1 block tofu, cubed
- 1 cup sliced mushrooms
- 1 cup chopped kale or spinach
- 1 green onion, sliced
- 1 teaspoon sesame oil
- 1 teaspoon soy sauce
- 1 teaspoon minced ginger
- 1 teaspoon minced garlic
- pinch of salt and pepper
preparation:
1. heat sesame oil in a large pot over medium heat.
2. add minced ginger and garlic, sauté for a minute until fragrant.
3. add mushrooms and sauté for another 2-3 minutes until they start to soften.
4. pour in vegetable broth and bring to a boil.
5. reduce heat and add tofu, kale (or spinach), and sliced green onion.
6. simmer for about 5-7 minutes, until the kale wilts or spinach cooks down.
7. in a small bowl, whisk together miso paste and a few tablespoons of the warm broth until smooth.
8. gradually pour the miso mixture into the soup pot, stirring well.
9. add soy sauce, salt, and pepper to taste.
10. continue simmering for another 2-3 minutes.
11. remove from heat and let it cool slightly before serving.
12. serve hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: vegetable, broth, miso, paste, tofu, mushroom, kale, spinach, green, onion, sesame, soy, sauce, minced, ginger, minced, garlic, pinch, salt, pepper

title: Vegan Breakfast Stuffed Mushrooms
raw_text: 85. Vegan Breakfast Stuffed Mushrooms: 750 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts (optional), Worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large portobello mushrooms
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 red bell pepper, finely chopped
- 1 cup spinach, chopped
- 1/2 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1/4 cup nutritional yeast
- 1/4 teaspoon turmeric
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh parsley for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. clean the portobello mushrooms and remove the stems. place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
3. heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat. add onion and garlic, sauté until they become translucent and fragrant.
4. add red bell pepper, spinach, and cherry tomatoes to the pan. cook for another 2 minutes until the vegetables are slightly softened.
5. sprinkle nutritional yeast, turmeric, salt, and pepper over the vegetable mixture. stir well to combine.
6. spoon the vegetable mixture into the portobello mushrooms, filling each cavity generously.
7. bake the stuffed mushrooms in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until the mushrooms are tender.
8. remove from the oven and garnish with fresh parsley.
9. serve hot as a delicious vegan breakfast option!

enjoy your vegan breakfast stuffed mushrooms!

title: Berry Smoothie
raw_text: 12. Berry Smoothie: 150 calories per portion, makes 2 portions, contains nuts (if using almond milk), originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)
- 1/2 banana
- 1 cup yogurt (any flavor)
- 1/2 cup milk (dairy or non-dairy)
- 1 tablespoon honey (optional, for sweetness)
- ice cubes (optional, for a chilled smoothie)
preparation:
1. wash the berries and remove any stems or leaves.
2. peel and slice the banana.
3. in a blender, combine the mixed berries, banana, yogurt, milk, and honey (if using).
4. blend until smooth and well combined.
5. if desired, add a few ice cubes to make the smoothie chilled and blend again briefly.
6. pour the smoothie into a glass and serve immediately.
7. enjoy your refreshing berry smoothie!

title: Stuffed Dates
raw_text: 16. Stuffed Dates: 80 calories per portion, makes 6 portions, contains nuts, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- medjool dates
- cream cheese
- chopped walnuts or almonds
- honey
preparation:
1. using a knife, carefully make a lengthwise cut in each date, stopping before reaching the end. gently open the date to create a pocket.
2. take a small spoonful of cream cheese and stuff it into the pocket of each date.
3. stuff a few pieces of chopped walnuts or almonds into each date, on top of the cream cheese.
4. drizzle a small amount of honey over each stuffed date.
5. serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve. enjoy!

title: Vegan Protein Bars
raw_text: 17. Vegan Protein Bars: 220 calories per portion, makes 4 portions, contains nuts, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cups rolled oats
- 1 cup plant-based protein powder
- 1/2 cup almond butter
- 1/4 cup maple syrup
- 1/4 cup almond milk
- 1/4 cup ground flaxseed
- 1/4 cup chia seeds
- 1/4 cup chopped nuts of your choice (e.g. almonds, walnuts)
- 1/4 cup dried fruits of your choice (e.g. cranberries, raisins)
- 1/4 cup vegan chocolate chips (optional)
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the rolled oats and protein powder. mix well.
2. in a separate microwave-safe bowl, heat the almond butter and maple syrup together until smooth. stir in the almond milk.
3. pour the almond butter mixture into the mixing bowl with the dry ingredients. mix together until all the dry ingredients are well coated.
4. add the ground flaxseed, chia seeds, chopped nuts, dried fruits, and vegan chocolate chips (if using). mix until everything is evenly distributed.
5. line a square baking dish with parchment paper. transfer the mixture into the dish and press it down firmly, using the back of a spoon or your hands.
6. place the baking dish in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours, or until the bars are firm and set.
7. once the bars are set, remove them from the refrigerator and cut into desired sizes.
8. store the vegan protein bars in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week. enjoy as a quick snack or pre/post-workout fuel!
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, plant, protein, powder, almond, butter, maple, syrup, almond, milk, ground, flaxseed, chia, seed, nut, almond, walnut, dried, fruit, cranberry, raisin, vegan, chocolate, chip

title: Vegan Omelette with Tofu
raw_text: 18. Vegan Omelette with Tofu: 300 calories per portion, makes 2 portions, contains soy (tofu), originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 block of firm tofu
- 1 small onion, diced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon nutritional yeast
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh herbs (such as parsley or chives) for garnish
preparation:
1. start by pressing the tofu to remove any excess moisture. place the tofu between two kitchen towels or paper towels, and place something heavy on top (like a plate or a heavy pot). let it sit for about 10-15 minutes.

2. once the tofu is pressed, crumble it into a bowl using your hands or a fork.

3. in a heated non-stick skillet, add the diced onion, bell pepper, and minced garlic. sauté for about 5 minutes until they become soft and fragrant.

4. add the crumbled tofu to the skillet, along with the nutritional yeast, soy sauce, turmeric, salt, and pepper. mix everything together and cook for another 5-7 minutes until the tofu is heated through and slightly golden.

5. taste and adjust the seasoning if needed.

6. serve the vegan omelette hot, garnished with fresh herbs. you can also add additional toppings or fillings such as vegan cheese, spinach, mushrooms, or tomatoes if desired.

enjoy your delicious vegan omelette with tofu!
ingredients_list: tofu, onion, bell, pepper, clove, garlic, minced, yeast, soy, sauce, turmeric, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, herb, parsley, chive, garnish

title: Peanut Butter and Jelly Sandwich
raw_text: 19. Peanut Butter and Jelly Sandwich: 350 calories per portion, makes 1 portion, contains gluten, originated in the United States.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 slices of bread (white, wheat, or your choice)
- 2 tablespoons of peanut butter
- 2 tablespoons of jelly or jam (grape, strawberry, or your choice)
preparation:
1. take one slice of bread and spread the peanut butter evenly on one side.
2. take the second slice of bread and spread the jelly or jam evenly on one side.
3. place the peanut butter side and the jelly side of the bread together, creating a sandwich.
4. press the bread slices together gently, ensuring that the peanut butter and jelly are evenly distributed.
5. cut the sandwich in half or into quarters, if desired.
6. serve and enjoy your peanut butter and jelly sandwich!
ingredients_list: bread, white, wheat, peanut, butter, jelly, jam, grape, strawberry

title: Carrot Cake Overnight Oats
raw_text: 20. Carrot Cake Overnight Oats: 300 calories per portion, makes 2 portions, contains nuts (if using nut butter), originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1/2 cup rolled oats
- 1/2 cup grated carrots
- 1/4 cup chopped walnuts
- 1/4 cup raisins
- 1 tbsp chia seeds
- 1/2 tsp ground cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp ground nutmeg
- 1 cup almond milk (or any other milk of your choice)
- 1 tbsp maple syrup (optional)
- 1/2 tsp vanilla extract
preparation:
1. in a jar or airtight container, combine the rolled oats, grated carrots, chopped walnuts, raisins, chia seeds, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
2. stir in the almond milk, maple syrup (if desired), and vanilla extract.
3. mix well, ensuring all the ingredients are fully incorporated.
4. close the jar or container and refrigerate overnight or for at least 4 hours.
5. in the morning, give the mixture a good stir and add additional toppings like more nuts, raisins, or grated carrots if desired.
6. enjoy your delicious carrot cake overnight oats straight from the fridge.
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, carrot, walnut, raisin, chia, seed, ground, cinnamon, ground, nutmeg, almond, milk, milk, maple, syrup, vanilla, extract

title: Sweet Potato Toast with Avocado
raw_text: 23. Sweet Potato Toast with Avocado: 180 calories per portion, makes 2 portions, contains gluten (if using bread), originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 large sweet potato
- 1 ripe avocado
- salt to taste
- black pepper to taste
- optional toppings: sliced radishes, microgreens, sesame seeds, hot sauce
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. slice the sweet potato into 1/4-inch thick slices.
3. place the sweet potato slices directly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
4. bake the sweet potato slices in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes or until lightly browned and softened.
5. while the sweet potato toasts are baking, peel and mash the ripe avocado in a bowl. add salt and black pepper to taste and mix well.
6. once the sweet potato toasts are done, remove them from the oven and allow them to cool slightly.
7. spread a generous amount of the avocado mash onto each sweet potato toast.
8. garnish with desired toppings such as sliced radishes, microgreens, sesame seeds, or a drizzle of hot sauce.
9. serve immediately and enjoy your delicious sweet potato toast with avocado!
ingredients_list: sweet, potato, avocado, salt, taste, black, pepper, taste, topping, radish, microgreens, sesame, seed, hot, sauce

title: Vegan Banana Muffins
raw_text: 31. Vegan Banana Muffins: 200 calories per portion, makes 4 portions, contains gluten, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 ripe bananas
- 1/3 cup melted coconut oil
- 1/2 cup maple syrup
- 1/4 cup almond milk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 3/4 cups whole wheat flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/2 cup chopped walnuts (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c). line a muffin tin with paper liners or grease with oil.
2. in a mixing bowl, mash the ripe bananas until smooth. add in the melted coconut oil, maple syrup, almond milk, and vanilla extract. stir well to combine.
3. in a separate bowl, whisk together the whole wheat flour, baking soda, salt, and ground cinnamon.
4. gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, stirring until just combined. be careful not to overmix.
5. if using, fold in the chopped walnuts.
6. spoon the batter into the prepared muffin tin, filling each liner about 3/4 full.
7. bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
8. remove from the oven and let the muffins cool in the tin for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely. enjoy!
ingredients_list: banana, coconut, maple, syrup, almond, milk, vanilla, extract, whole, wheat, flour, baking, soda, salt, ground, cinnamon, walnut

title: Roasted Almonds
raw_text: 34. Roasted Almonds: 100 calories per portion, makes 2 portions, contains nuts, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups of whole almonds
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
- 1 teaspoon of salt
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. in a mixing bowl, combine the whole almonds, olive oil, and salt. toss well to coat the almonds evenly.
3. spread the coated almonds in a single layer on a baking sheet.
4. roast the almonds in the preheated oven for about 10-15 minutes, or until they turn golden brown. stir them once or twice during baking to ensure even cooking.
5. remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the roasted almonds cool completely before serving.
6. store the roasted almonds in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks. enjoy!
ingredients_list: whole, almond, olive, salt

title: Vegan Protein Bites
raw_text: 39. Vegan Protein Bites: 150 calories per portion, makes 8 portions, contains nuts, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup oats
- 1/2 cup peanut butter
- 1/4 cup maple syrup
- 1/4 cup vegan protein powder
- 1/4 cup chopped nuts (optional)
- 1/4 cup dried berries (optional)
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, combine oats, peanut butter, maple syrup, protein powder, chopped nuts, and dried berries (if using).
2. mix well until all ingredients are evenly combined.
3. using your hands or a spoon, form the mixture into small bite-sized balls.
4. place the protein bites on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
5. place the baking sheet in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes to set.
6. once set, transfer the protein bites to an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for up to one week.
7. enjoy these vegan protein bites as a quick and nutritious snack!
cooking_style: there is no cooking involved in this recipe.

title: Homemade Vegan Trail Mix
raw_text: 40. Homemade Vegan Trail Mix: 150 calories per portion, makes 4 portions, contains nuts, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup raw almonds
- 1 cup cashews
- 1 cup walnuts
- 1 cup pumpkin seeds
- 1 cup dried cranberries
- 1 cup dried apricots, chopped
- 1 cup dark chocolate chips (vegan option)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. spread the almonds, cashews, walnuts, and pumpkin seeds onto a baking sheet.
3. roast the nuts and seeds in the preheated oven for about 10-15 minutes, or until they are slightly toasted. keep an eye on them to prevent burning.
4. remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the nuts and seeds cool completely.
5. in a large bowl, combine the roasted nuts, seeds, dried cranberries, chopped dried apricots, and dark chocolate chips.
6. mix well to combine all the ingredients evenly.
7. once mixed, transfer the trail mix to an airtight container or divide it into smaller snack-size bags for easy portioning.
8. store your homemade vegan trail mix in a cool, dry place for up to two weeks.

enjoy your delicious homemade vegan trail mix as a nutritious snack on-the-go or for a quick energy boost during outdoor activities!
ingredients_list: raw, almond, cashew, walnut, pumpkin, seed, dried, cranberry, dried, apricot, dark, chocolate, chip, vegan, option

title: Vegan Breakfast Wraps
raw_text: 43. Vegan Breakfast Wraps: 300 calories per portion, makes 2 portions, contains gluten (in tortilla), originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large tortilla wraps
- 1 cup of tofu, crumbled
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
- 1/2 teaspoon of turmeric
- 1/2 teaspoon of paprika
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 green bell pepper, sliced
- 1 small red onion, sliced
- 2 cups of baby spinach
- 1 avocado, sliced
- hot sauce or salsa for serving
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. add crumbled tofu to the skillet and sprinkle with turmeric, paprika, salt, and pepper. cook for 5-7 minutes, until tofu is heated through and slightly browned.
3. remove tofu from the skillet and set aside.
4. in the same skillet, add the sliced red and green bell peppers and red onion. sauté for about 5 minutes, until the vegetables are softened.
5. add the baby spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes.
6. warm the tortilla wraps in a separate skillet or the microwave.
7. to make the wrap, lay a tortilla on a clean surface and place a portion of the cooked tofu, sautéed vegetables, and sliced avocado in the center.
8. roll the tortilla tightly, tucking in the sides as you go.
9. repeat with the remaining tortilla wraps and filling ingredients.
10. serve the vegan breakfast wraps with hot sauce or salsa on the side. enjoy your delicious vegan breakfast!
ingredients_list: tortilla, wrap, tofu, olive, turmeric, paprika, salt, pepper, taste, red, bell, pepper, green, bell, pepper, red, onion, baby, spinach, avocado, hot, sauce, salsa

title: Vegan Cereal Bars
raw_text: 44. Vegan Cereal Bars: 200 calories per portion, makes 4 portions, contains gluten, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups rolled oats
- 1 cup unsweetened shredded coconut
- 1/2 cup almond butter
- 1/2 cup maple syrup
- 1/4 cup dried cranberries
- 1/4 cup chopped almonds
- 1/4 cup pumpkin seeds
- 1/4 cup mini vegan chocolate chips
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- pinch of salt
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c) and line a baking dish with parchment paper.
2. in a large bowl, combine the rolled oats and shredded coconut.
3. in a separate microwave-safe bowl, heat the almond butter and maple syrup together until melted and well combined.
4. pour the melted almond butter mixture over the oats and coconut mixture. stir well to combine and ensure all the ingredients are evenly coated.
5. add in the dried cranberries, chopped almonds, pumpkin seeds, mini vegan chocolate chips, vanilla extract, and pinch of salt. mix everything thoroughly.
6. transfer the mixture into the prepared baking dish and press it down firmly and evenly.
7. bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the top turns golden brown.
8. remove from the oven and let the cereal bars cool completely in the baking dish.
9. once cooled, carefully lift the parchment paper, along with the bars, out of the dish. place it on a cutting board and use a sharp knife to cut into bars or squares, as desired.
10. store the vegan cereal bars in an airtight container at room temperature for up to a week. enjoy them as a quick and tasty snack!
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, unsweetened, shredded, coconut, almond, butter, maple, syrup, dried, cranberry, almond, pumpkin, seed, vegan, chocolate, chip, vanilla, extract, pinch, salt

title: Vegan Chocolate Mousse
raw_text: 46. Vegan Chocolate Mousse: 150 calories per portion, makes 4 portions, contains nuts, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup of silken tofu
- 1/2 cup of vegan dark chocolate chips
- 2 tablespoons of maple syrup
- 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract
- a pinch of sea salt
preparation:
1. melt the vegan dark chocolate chips in a microwave-safe bowl or in a double boiler on the stove until smooth and creamy.
2. in a food processor or blender, combine the melted chocolate, silken tofu, maple syrup, vanilla extract, and a pinch of sea salt.
3. blend the mixture until it is smooth and creamy, scraping down the sides as needed.
4. pour the chocolate mousse mixture into serving bowls or glasses.
5. chill the mousse in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours, or until it is firm.
6. serve chilled and enjoy your vegan chocolate mousse!
ingredients_list: silken, tofu, vegan, dark, chocolate, chip, maple, syrup, vanilla, extract, pinch, sea, salt

title: Vegan Chia Seed Pancakes
raw_text: 48. Vegan Chia Seed Pancakes: 200 calories per portion, makes 4 portions, contains gluten, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup flour
- 2 tablespoons chia seeds
- 1 tablespoon baking powder
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup non-dairy milk (such as almond or soy milk)
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, chia seeds, baking powder, sugar, and salt.
2. in a separate smaller bowl, whisk together the non-dairy milk, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract.
3. pour the wet mixture into the dry mixture and mix until just combined. do not overmix, as this can result in tough pancakes.
4. preheat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat. lightly grease it with oil or cooking spray.
5. scoop about 1/4 cup of batter onto the hot skillet for each pancake. cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes, until cooked through.
6. repeat with the remaining batter, adding more oil to the skillet as needed.
7. serve the pancakes warm with your favorite toppings, such as fresh fruits, maple syrup, or vegan butter. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, chia, seed, baking, powder, sugar, salt, dairy, milk, almond, soy, milk, vegetable, vanilla, extract

title: Fruit and Nut Yogurt Bowl
raw_text: 49. Fruit and Nut Yogurt Bowl: 250 calories per portion, makes 2 portions, contains nuts, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup of greek yogurt
- 1/2 cup of mixed fruits (such as berries, banana, and mango)
- 1/4 cup of chopped nuts (such as almonds, walnuts, and pistachios)
- 1 tablespoon of honey or maple syrup (optional for sweetness)
- 1 tablespoon of chia seeds (optional for added nutrition)
preparation:
1. in a serving bowl, spoon the greek yogurt.
2. arrange the mixed fruits on top of the yogurt.
3. sprinkle the chopped nuts over the fruits.
4. if desired, drizzle honey or maple syrup over the bowl for added sweetness.
5. for extra nutrition, sprinkle chia seeds on top.
6. mix everything together gently or eat as layered.
7. enjoy the delicious and nutritious fruit and nut yogurt bowl as a breakfast, snack, or dessert.
ingredients_list: greek, yogurt, fruit, berry, banana, mango, nut, almond, walnut, pistachio, honey, maple, syrup, sweetness, chia, seed

title: Vegan Potato Pancakes
raw_text: 54. Vegan Potato Pancakes: 250 calories per portion, makes 2 portions, contains gluten (if using regular flour), originated in Germany.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 medium-sized potatoes
- 1 medium onion
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 tablespoons ground flaxseeds
- 1/4 cup water
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- oil for frying
preparation:
1. peel and grate the potatoes. place them in a large bowl.
2. finely chop the onion and add it to the bowl with the grated potatoes.
3. in a separate small bowl, mix the ground flaxseeds and water. allow it to sit for 5 minutes to form a gel-like consistency.
4. squeeze out any excess liquid from the grated potatoes and onions using a clean kitchen towel or cheesecloth.
5. add the flaxseed mixture, flour, salt, and black pepper to the bowl with the grated potatoes and onions. stir well until all ingredients are combined.
6. heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
7. take a spoonful of the potato mixture and carefully drop it into the hot skillet. flatten it slightly with the back of the spoon.
8. repeat step 7 until the skillet is filled with pancakes, leaving some space between them.
9. cook the pancakes for about 4-5 minutes on each side, or until they turn golden brown and crispy.
10. once cooked, transfer the pancakes to a paper towel-lined plate to remove any excess oil.
11. repeat steps 7-10 until all the potato mixture is used.
12. serve the vegan potato pancakes warm with your favorite toppings or dipping sauce. enjoy!
ingredients_list: potato, onion, flour, ground, flaxseed, water, salt, black, pepper

title: Cucumber and Hummus Bites
raw_text: 58. Cucumber and Hummus Bites: 150 calories per portion, makes 2 portions, contains sesame (in hummus), originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 large cucumber
- 1 cup hummus
- fresh dill, chopped (optional)
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. start by washing the cucumber thoroughly. pat dry with a towel.
2. slice the cucumber into round discs, about 1/4 inch thick.
3. lay the cucumber slices on a clean surface or serving platter.
4. spoon a small dollop of hummus onto each cucumber slice.
5. if desired, sprinkle fresh dill over the top of each cucumber and hummus bite.
6. season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. serve immediately and enjoy!
ingredients_list: cucumber, hummus, fresh, dill, salt, pepper, taste

title: Vegan Protein Donuts
raw_text: 59. Vegan Protein Donuts: 250 calories per portion, makes 4 portions, contains gluten, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup vegan protein powder
- 1/2 cup coconut sugar
- 2 tsp baking powder
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1 cup almond milk
- 1/4 cup coconut oil, melted
- 1 tsp vanilla extract

for the glaze:
- 1 cup powdered sugar
- 2-3 tbsp almond milk
- 1/2 tsp vanilla extract
- vegan sprinkles (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c) and grease a donut pan with a little coconut oil.
2. in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, vegan protein powder, coconut sugar, baking powder, and salt until well combined.
3. in a separate smaller bowl, whisk together the almond milk, melted coconut oil, and vanilla extract.
4. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. be careful not to overmix, as this can result in dense donuts.
5. spoon the batter into the greased donut pan, filling each mold about 3/4 full.
6. bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the donuts comes out clean.
7. remove from the oven and let the donuts cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
8. while the donuts are cooling, prepare the glaze by whisking together the powdered sugar, almond milk, and vanilla extract in a small bowl. adjust the consistency by adding more powdered sugar or almond milk as needed.
9. once the donuts have cooled, dip each one into the glaze, ensuring they are evenly coated. place them back on the wire rack to allow the glaze to set. if desired, sprinkle vegan sprinkles on top before the glaze sets.
10. allow the glaze to harden for about 10-15 minutes before serving. enjoy your homemade vegan protein donuts!
ingredients_list: flour, vegan, protein, powder, coconut, sugar, baking, powder, salt, almond, milk, coconut, vanilla, extract, glaze, sugar, almond, milk, vanilla, extract, vegan, sprinkle

title: Vegan Blueberry Scones
raw_text: 61. Vegan Blueberry Scones: 180 calories per portion, makes 4 portions, contains gluten, originated in the United Kingdom.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup granulated sugar
- 1 tablespoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup vegan butter, cold and cubed
- 1/2 cup non-dairy milk (such as almond or soy milk)
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 cup fresh or frozen blueberries
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
3. using a pastry cutter or your fingers, cut in the cold vegan butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
4. in a separate small bowl, whisk together the non-dairy milk and vanilla extract. pour this mixture into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
5. gently fold in the blueberries, being careful not to crush them.
6. transfer the dough onto a lightly floured surface and lightly knead it a few times until it comes together.
7. shape the dough into a circle about 1-inch thick. use a sharp knife to slice the dough into 8 even wedges.
8. place the scones onto the prepared baking sheet and bake for 15-18 minutes, or until they are golden brown on top.
9. remove from the oven and let the scones cool on a wire rack before serving.
10. enjoy your vegan blueberry scones!
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, baking, powder, salt, vegan, butter, dairy, milk, almond, soy, milk, vanilla, extract, fresh, frozen, blueberry

title: Chocolate Avocado Mousse
raw_text: 62. Chocolate Avocado Mousse: 150 calories per portion, makes 4 portions, contains nuts, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 ripe avocados
- 1/4 cup cocoa powder
- 1/4 cup honey or maple syrup
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- pinch of salt
- optional toppings: whipped cream, berries, chopped nuts
preparation:
1. cut the avocados in half, remove the pit, and scoop out the flesh into a blender or food processor.
2. add the cocoa powder, honey or maple syrup, vanilla extract, and a pinch of salt to the blender or food processor.
3. blend or process until the mixture is smooth and creamy, scraping down the sides as needed.
4. taste the mousse and adjust the sweetness or cocoa powder if desired.
5. transfer the mousse to serving bowls or glasses and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to set and chill.
6. once chilled, you can serve the mousse as is or top it with whipped cream, berries, or chopped nuts.
7. enjoy the chocolate avocado mousse chilled!
ingredients_list: avocado, cocoa, powder, honey, maple, syrup, vanilla, extract, pinch, salt, topping, cream, berry, nut

title: Vegan Date and Nut Bars
raw_text: 63. Vegan Date and Nut Bars: 180 calories per portion, makes 4 portions, contains nuts, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 1 cup dates, pitted
- 1 cup mixed nuts (such as almonds, walnuts, and cashews)
- 1/2 cup rolled oats
- 1/4 cup almond butter
- 1/4 cup maple syrup
- 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/4 teaspoon sea salt
preparation:
1. in a food processor, combine dates, mixed nuts, rolled oats, almond butter, maple syrup, vanilla extract, and sea salt. process until the mixture is well combined and sticky.
2. line a baking dish with parchment paper or lightly grease it. transfer the mixture from the food processor into the dish, and press down firmly to create an even layer.
3. place the dish in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour to allow the mixture to firm up.
4. once the bars are firm, remove them from the refrigerator and slice into desired-sized bars or squares.
5. store the vegan date and nut bars in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week. enjoy!
cooking_style: no cooking style required for this recipe as it is a no-bake recipe.
ingredients_list: date, pitted, nut, almond, walnut, cashew, rolled, oat, almond, butter, maple, syrup, vanilla, extract, sea, salt

title: Vegan Protein Balls
raw_text: 69. Vegan Protein Balls: 180 calories per portion, makes 4 portions, contains nuts, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup of rolled oats
- 1/2 cup of almond butter
- 1/4 cup of maple syrup
- 1/4 cup of vegan protein powder
- 2 tablespoons of chia seeds
- 2 tablespoons of flaxseed meal
- 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract
- 1/4 cup of vegan chocolate chips (optional)
- 1/4 cup of shredded coconut (for rolling)
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the rolled oats, almond butter, maple syrup, vegan protein powder, chia seeds, flaxseed meal, and vanilla extract. mix well until all ingredients are evenly incorporated.
2. if desired, fold in the vegan chocolate chips to add some chocolatey goodness to the protein balls.
3. once the mixture is well combined, use your hands to roll it into small balls, about 1 inch in diameter.
4. pour the shredded coconut onto a plate or a shallow bowl. roll each protein ball in the shredded coconut, pressing lightly to adhere it to the surface.
5. place the protein balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to firm up.
6. once chilled, the vegan protein balls are ready to eat. enjoy them as a post-workout snack or a quick energy boost throughout the day. store any leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, almond, butter, maple, syrup, vegan, protein, powder, chia, seed, flaxseed, vanilla, extract, vegan, chocolate, chip, shredded, coconut, rolling

ingredients:

title: Vegan Energy Muffins
raw_text: 71. Vegan Energy Muffins: 200 calories per portion, makes 4 portions, contains gluten, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup almond flour
- 1/2 cup rolled oats
- 1/4 cup flaxseed meal
- 1/4 cup chia seeds
- 1/2 cup coconut sugar
- 1 tsp baking powder
- 1/2 tsp baking soda
- 1/2 tsp cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp salt
- 1 cup almond milk
- 1/4 cup maple syrup
- 1/4 cup coconut oil, melted
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- 1 ripe banana, mashed
- 1/2 cup grated zucchini
- 1/2 cup grated carrot
- 1/2 cup chopped nuts (e.g. walnuts, almonds)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c) and line a muffin tin with paper liners.
2. in a large bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, almond flour, rolled oats, flaxseed meal, chia seeds, coconut sugar, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
3. in a separate bowl, mix together the almond milk, maple syrup, melted coconut oil, vanilla extract, mashed banana, grated zucchini, and grated carrot.
4. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. do not overmix.
5. gently fold in the chopped nuts.
6. divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups, filling each about 2/3 full.
7. bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
8. remove from the oven and let the muffins cool in the tin for 5 minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. enjoy these vegan energy muffins as a healthy snack or breakfast option. store leftovers in an airtight container for up to 5 days.

title: Easy Homemade Granola
raw_text: 72. Easy Homemade Granola: 180 calories per portion, makes 4 portions, contains nuts, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients for easy homemade granola:

- 3 cups rolled oats
- 1 cup nuts (such as almonds, walnuts, or pecans), chopped
- 1/2 cup seeds (such as sunflower seeds or pumpkin seeds)
- 1/2 cup unsweetened shredded coconut
- 1/4 cup honey or maple syrup
- 1/4 cup melted coconut oil or vegetable oil
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup dried fruits (such as raisins, cranberries, or chopped apricots)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 300°f (150°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat.

2. in a large bowl, combine the rolled oats, chopped nuts, seeds, and shredded coconut.

3. in a separate bowl, whisk together the honey or maple syrup, melted coconut oil or vegetable oil, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and salt.

4. pour the liquid mixture over the dry ingredients and stir well until everything is evenly coated.

5. spread the mixture evenly onto the prepared baking sheet.

6. bake in the preheated oven for about 30-35 minutes, or until the granola is golden brown and crispy. stir the mixture every 10-15 minutes to ensure even browning.

7. remove the baking sheet from the oven and allow the granola to cool completely. it will continue to crisp up as it cools.

8. once cooled, stir in the dried fruits.

9. transfer the granola to an airtight container and store at room temperature for up to 2 weeks.

note: feel free to customize your homemade granola by adding other ingredients such as chocolate chips, coconut flakes, or spices like nutmeg or cardamom.
cuisine: The cuisine type of this recipe is: Breakfast.
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, nut, almond, walnut, pecan, seed, sunflower, seed, pumpkin, seed, unsweetened, shredded, coconut, honey, maple, syrup, coconut, vegetable, vanilla, extract, cinnamon, salt, dried, fruit, raisin, cranberry, apricot

title: Vegan Cinnamon Sugar Donuts
raw_text: 73. Vegan Cinnamon Sugar Donuts: 150 calories per portion, makes 4 portions, contains gluten, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 2 tsp baking powder
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1 tsp ground cinnamon
- 1 cup unsweetened almond milk
- 1/4 cup coconut oil, melted
- 1 tsp vanilla extract

for the cinnamon sugar coating:
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 1 tbsp ground cinnamon
- 1/4 cup vegan butter, melted
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (180°c) and grease a donut pan with non-stick spray.
2. in a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon.
3. in a separate bowl, mix together the almond milk, melted coconut oil, and vanilla extract.
4. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. do not overmix.
5. spoon the batter into a piping bag or a plastic bag with the corner snipped off.
6. pipe the batter into the prepared donut pan, filling each cavity about 2/3 full.
7. bake for about 12-15 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into a donut comes out clean.
8. remove the donuts from the oven and let them cool in the pan for a few minutes.
9. while the donuts are cooling, prepare the cinnamon sugar coating. in a shallow bowl, mix together the granulated sugar and ground cinnamon.
10. dip each donut into the melted vegan butter, then roll it in the cinnamon sugar mixture until evenly coated.
11. repeat with all the donuts until they are all coated.
12. serve the vegan cinnamon sugar donuts warm and enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, baking, powder, salt, ground, cinnamon, unsweetened, almond, milk, coconut, vanilla, extract, cinnamon, sugar, coating, sugar, ground, cinnamon, vegan, butter

title: Roasted Red Pepper Hummus Dip
raw_text: 79. Roasted Red Pepper Hummus Dip: 200 calories per portion, makes 4 portions, contains sesame (in hummus), originated in the Middle East.
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 2 large red bell peppers
- 1 can (15 ounces) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 3 tablespoons tahini
- 3 tablespoons lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika
- salt, to taste
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley (for garnish)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 450°f (230°c).
2. place the red bell peppers on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and roast them in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes, or until the skins are charred and blistered.
3. remove the peppers from the oven and immediately transfer them to a ziplock bag. seal the bag and let the peppers steam for about 10 minutes. this will make it easier to peel off the skins.
4. once the peppers have cooled, carefully remove the charred skins and discard them. cut the peppers in half, remove the seeds and membranes, and roughly chop them.
5. in a food processor or blender, combine the roasted red peppers, chickpeas, minced garlic, tahini, lemon juice, olive oil, cumin, smoked paprika, and salt. process until smooth and creamy.
6. taste and adjust the seasoning as desired, adding more salt or lemon juice if needed.
7. transfer the hummus dip to a serving bowl and garnish with chopped fresh parsley.
8. serve with pita bread, crackers, or sliced vegetables. enjoy your roasted red pepper hummus dip!
ingredients_list: red, bell, pepper, ounce, chickpea, clove, garlic, minced, tahini, lemon, virgin, olive, ground, cumin, smoked, paprika, salt, taste, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Vegan Chia Seed Pudding
raw_text: 80. Vegan Chia Seed Pudding: 250 calories per portion, makes 2 portions, contains nuts, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:

- 1/4 cup chia seeds
- 1 cup plant-based milk (such as almond milk, soy milk, or coconut milk)
- 1-2 tablespoons maple syrup or sweetener of choice (optional)
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- fresh fruits, nuts, or granola for topping (optional)
preparation:
1. in a medium-sized bowl, combine the chia seeds, plant-based milk, sweetener (if using), and vanilla extract.
2. stir the mixture well until all the chia seeds are evenly distributed and there are no clumps.
3. let the mixture sit for 5 minutes to allow the chia seeds to absorb some of the liquid.
4. after 5 minutes, give the mixture another stir to prevent clumping. cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or overnight.
5. after the pudding has chilled and thickened, give it a final stir to ensure proper consistency.
6. serve the chia seed pudding in bowls or glasses and top with fresh fruits, nuts, or granola if desired.
7. enjoy immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve. the pudding will keep in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.
ingredients_list: chia, seed, plant, milk, almond, milk, soy, milk, coconut, milk, maple, syrup, sweetener, vanilla, extract, fresh, fruit, nut, granola, topping

title: Vegan Cinnamon French Toast
raw_text: 82. Vegan Cinnamon French Toast: 300 calories per portion, makes 2 portions, contains gluten, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 4 slices of bread (preferably thick-cut)
- 1 cup unsweetened almond milk
- 1 tablespoon ground flaxseed
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1 tablespoon maple syrup
- cooking spray or vegan butter for greasing the pan
preparation:
1. in a shallow dish, whisk together almond milk, ground flaxseed, vanilla extract, ground cinnamon, nutmeg, and maple syrup until well combined.
2. place each slice of bread into the mixture, letting it soak for about 20 seconds. flip and soak the other side for the same amount of time.
3. in the meantime, preheat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat.
4. lightly grease the heated skillet with cooking spray or vegan butter.
5. transfer the soaked bread slices onto the skillet, being careful not to overcrowd the pan.
6. cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side until golden brown and crispy.
7. once cooked, transfer the french toast to a serving plate.
8. repeat steps 5-7 with the remaining bread slices.
9. serve the vegan cinnamon french toast warm with toppings of your choice like sliced banana, berries, or a drizzle of maple syrup.
10. enjoy!
ingredients_list: bread, preferably, unsweetened, almond, milk, ground, flaxseed, vanilla, extract, ground, cinnamon, nutmeg, maple, syrup, spray, vegan, butter, greasing

title: Almond Joy Energy Bites
raw_text: 83. Almond Joy Energy Bites: 150 calories per portion, makes 8 portions, contains nuts, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
sure! here's the recipe for almond joy energy bites:

ingredients:
- 1 cup dates, pitted
- 1 cup almonds
- 1/2 cup shredded coconut
- 2 tablespoons cocoa powder
- 2 tablespoons almond butter
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- a pinch of salt
- optional: 1/4 cup chocolate chips for topping
preparation:
1. place the dates in a bowl of warm water and let them soak for about 10 minutes to soften.
2. drain the dates and place them in a food processor.
3. add the almonds, shredded coconut, cocoa powder, almond butter, vanilla extract, and salt to the food processor.
4. process the mixture until it forms a sticky dough-like consistency.
5. take a tablespoon of the dough and roll it into a small ball with your hands. repeat until all the dough is used up.
6. if desired, melt the chocolate chips in the microwave or on the stovetop.
7. drizzle or dip the energy bites into the melted chocolate to coat the top. place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
8. allow the energy bites to set in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour before serving.
9. store the almond joy energy bites in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week.

enjoy your homemade almond joy energy bites!
ingredients_list: almond, joy, bite, date, pitted, almond, shredded, coconut, cocoa, powder, almond, butter, vanilla, extract, pinch, salt, chocolate, chip, topping

title: Baked Maple Glazed Donuts
raw_text: 84. Baked Maple Glazed Donuts: 200 calories per portion, makes 4 portions, contains gluten, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup milk
- 2 large eggs
- 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted
- 2 tablespoons maple syrup
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

for the glaze:
- 1 cup powdered sugar
- 3 tablespoons maple syrup
- 1-2 tablespoons milk
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c) and grease a donut pan.
2. in a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
3. in a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, eggs, melted butter, maple syrup, and vanilla extract.
4. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. do not overmix.
5. spoon the batter into a piping bag or a ziplock bag with the corner cut off. pipe the batter into the donut pan, filling each cavity about 2/3 full.
6. bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the donuts are lightly golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
7. remove the donuts from the oven and let them cool in the pan for a few minutes. then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
8. to make the glaze, whisk together the powdered sugar, maple syrup, and milk in a small bowl until smooth and creamy. adjust the consistency by adding more milk if needed.
9. dip each cooled donut into the glaze, allowing any excess to drip off. place the glazed donuts back on the wire rack to set.
10. let the glaze firm up for about 15 minutes before serving. enjoy your delicious baked maple glazed donuts!
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, baking, powder, salt, milk, egg, unsalted, butter, maple, syrup, vanilla, extract, glaze, sugar, maple, syrup, milk

title: Vegan Protein Bars with Almonds
raw_text: 87. Vegan Protein Bars with Almonds: 220 calories per portion, makes 4 portions, contains nuts, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup dates, pitted
- 1 cup almonds
- 1/2 cup protein powder (vegan, of your choice)
- 1/4 cup almond butter
- 1/4 cup maple syrup
- 2 tablespoons chia seeds
- 2 tablespoons flax seeds
- 2 tablespoons water
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- pinch of salt
preparation:
1. place the dates in a bowl and cover them with warm water. allow them to soak for about 10 minutes to soften.
2. in a food processor, add the almonds and pulse until they are finely ground. you can leave some larger pieces for texture if desired.
3. drain the soaked dates, remove any excess water, and add them to the food processor with the ground almonds.
4. add the protein powder, almond butter, maple syrup, chia seeds, flax seeds, water, vanilla extract, and salt to the food processor.
5. process the mixture until everything is well combined and forms a sticky dough.
6. line a baking dish with parchment paper. transfer the dough to the dish and press it down evenly.
7. place the dish in the refrigerator and let it chill for at least 2 hours, or until firm.
8. once firm, remove the protein bar mixture from the dish and cut it into desired bar shapes.
9. wrap each bar individually in parchment paper or store them in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

enjoy your homemade vegan protein bars with almonds as a convenient and nutritious snack!

title: Vegan Gingerbread Cookies
raw_text: 88. Vegan Gingerbread Cookies: 150 calories per portion, makes 10 portions, contains gluten, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup molasses
- 1/2 cup coconut oil, melted
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 1/4 cup almond milk
- 1 tablespoon ground ginger
- 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cloves
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, ginger, cinnamon, cloves, baking soda, and salt. mix well.
2. in a separate bowl, whisk together the melted coconut oil, molasses, brown sugar, and almond milk until well-combined.
3. gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, mixing until a soft dough forms.
4. divide the dough in half and form two disks. wrap each disk in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or until firm.
5. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
6. on a lightly floured surface, roll out one disk of dough to about 1/4-inch thickness. use cookie cutters to cut out gingerbread shapes.
7. transfer the cut-out dough shapes to the prepared baking sheet, leaving some space between each cookie.
8. repeat steps 6-7 with the remaining dough.
9. bake the cookies in the preheated oven for 8-10 minutes, or until the edges are set and lightly golden.
10. remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
11. once the cookies have cooled, you can decorate them with icing or enjoy them as is.
12. store the cookies in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 week.
ingredients_list: flour, molasses, coconut, brown, sugar, almond, milk, ground, ginger, ground, cinnamon, ground, clove, baking, soda, salt

title: Vegan Cinnamon Funnel Cake
raw_text: 92. Vegan Cinnamon Funnel Cake: 300 calories per portion, makes 2 portions, contains gluten, originated in the United States.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
- 2 tablespoons granulated sugar
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- ½ teaspoon salt
- 1 cup unsweetened almond milk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- vegetable oil, for frying
- powdered sugar, for dusting
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt.
2. gradually whisk in the almond milk and vanilla extract until you have a smooth batter. the consistency should be similar to pancake batter.
3. heat vegetable oil in a large shallow pan over medium heat. you'll need about 2 inches of oil in the pan.
4. once the oil is hot, pour the batter into a funnel or squeeze bottle, holding your finger over the end to prevent it from flowing out.
5. carefully remove your finger and drizzle the batter in a circular motion into the hot oil, creating a spiral or lattice pattern. be cautious not to overcrowd the pan.
6. cook the funnel cake for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and crispy. flip it with tongs or a slotted spoon to cook both sides evenly.
7. once cooked, transfer the funnel cake to a paper towel-lined plate to absorb excess oil.
8. repeat steps 4-7 with the remaining batter, adding more oil to the pan as needed.
9. once all the funnel cakes are cooked, dust them generously with powdered sugar.
10. serve the vegan cinnamon funnel cakes warm and enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, baking, powder, ground, cinnamon, salt, unsweetened, almond, milk, vanilla, extract, vegetable, sugar

title: Maple Pecan Energy Balls
raw_text: 93. Maple Pecan Energy Balls: 150 calories per portion, makes 8 portions, contains nuts, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup rolled oats
- 1/2 cup pecans, chopped
- 1/2 cup dates, pitted
- 2 tablespoons maple syrup
- 1 tablespoon chia seeds
- 1 tablespoon almond butter
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
- pinch of salt
preparation:
1. in a food processor, blend the rolled oats until they break down into a coarse flour-like texture.
2. add the chopped pecans, dates, maple syrup, chia seeds, almond butter, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and salt to the food processor.
3. process the mixture until it comes together and forms a sticky dough. you may need to scrape down the sides of the food processor a couple of times to ensure everything is well combined.
4. once the dough is ready, use your hands to roll it into small balls, about 1 inch in diameter.
5. place the energy balls on a lined baking sheet or airtight container and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to allow them to firm up.
6. serve chilled and enjoy as a healthy and energizing snack!
