title: Roasted Tomato Bruschetta
raw_text: 95. Roasted Tomato Bruschetta: 250 calories per portion, makes 2 portions, contains gluten (in bread), originated in Italy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4-5 medium-sized tomatoes
- 2-3 cloves of garlic
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- salt, to taste
- pepper, to taste
- fresh basil leaves, chopped
- baguette or italian bread, sliced
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. wash and slice the tomatoes in half. remove the seeds and core.
3. place the tomato halves on a baking sheet, cut side up.
4. drizzle the tomatoes with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
5. peel and crush the garlic cloves. sprinkle the minced garlic evenly over the tomatoes.
6. roast the tomatoes in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, until they are soft and slightly caramelized.
7. meanwhile, slice the baguette or italian bread into ½-inch thick slices.
8. brush each slice with olive oil and toast them in a preheated oven or on a grill until they are golden brown.
9. remove the roasted tomatoes from the oven and allow them to cool slightly.
10. chop the roasted tomatoes into small pieces and place them in a mixing bowl.
11. add the chopped fresh basil leaves to the bowl and mix gently to combine.
12. season the tomato mixture with additional salt and pepper if desired.
13. spoon the roasted tomato mixture onto the toasted bread slices.
14. serve the roasted tomato bruschetta immediately as an appetizer or snack. enjoy!
ingredients_list: tomato, clove, garlic, olive, salt, taste, pepper, taste, fresh, basil, leaf, baguette, italian, bread

title: Vegan Zucchini and Corn Fritters
raw_text: 96. Vegan Zucchini and Corn Fritters: 180 calories per portion, makes 4 portions, contains gluten, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups shredded zucchini
- 1 cup corn kernels
- 1/4 cup finely chopped onion
- 1/4 cup finely chopped red bell pepper
- 1/4 cup flour
- 1/4 cup nutritional yeast
- 2 tablespoons ground flaxseed
- 3 tablespoons water
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 tablespoons olive oil, for frying
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, mix together the ground flaxseed and water. set aside for 5 minutes to create a flax egg.
2. in a large bowl, combine the shredded zucchini, corn kernels, chopped onion, chopped red bell pepper, flour, nutritional yeast, garlic powder, smoked paprika, salt, and black pepper.
3. add the flax egg to the mixture and stir until well combined. the mixture should be sticky but hold together when pressed.
4. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
5. take about 1/4 cup of the mixture and shape it into a patty. place the patty onto the heated skillet. repeat with the remaining mixture, leaving some space between each patty.
6. cook the fritters for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and crispy. flip gently to avoid breaking them.
7. once cooked, transfer the fritters to a plate lined with paper towels to absorb any excess oil.
8. serve the vegan zucchini and corn fritters hot with your favorite dipping sauce or as a side dish. enjoy!
ingredients_list: shredded, zucchini, corn, kernel, onion, red, bell, pepper, flour, yeast, ground, flaxseed, water, garlic, powder, smoked, paprika, salt, black, pepper, olive

title: Vegan Peanut Butter and Jelly Overnight Oats
raw_text:
100. Vegan Peanut Butter and Jelly Overnight Oats: 250 calories per portion, makes 2 portions, contains nuts, originated worldwide.

Please note that the calorie count may vary depending on the specific brands and measurements used in the recipes. Also, be sure to check the labels of any store-bought ingredients to ensure they are vegan and free from all potential allergens.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup rolled oats
- 2 tablespoons chia seeds
- 1 1/2 cups almond milk (or any plant-based milk)
- 2 tablespoons peanut butter
- 2 tablespoons maple syrup (or sweetener of choice)
- 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/4 cup fresh berries (strawberries, raspberries, or blueberries)
- 2 tablespoons fruit jam (strawberry, raspberry, or grape)
preparation:
1. in a bowl or container, combine the rolled oats and chia seeds.
2. in a separate bowl, whisk together the almond milk, peanut butter, maple syrup, and vanilla extract until well combined.
3. pour the liquid mixture over the oats and chia seeds and stir until all the ingredients are evenly combined.
4. cover the bowl or container and refrigerate overnight (or at least 4 hours) to allow the oats and chia seeds to absorb the liquid and soften.
5. in the morning, give the oats a good stir and adjust the consistency by adding a splash of almond milk if desired.
6. top the overnight oats with fresh berries and a dollop of fruit jam.
7. enjoy your delicious vegan peanut butter and jelly overnight oats!
cooking_style: no cooking style mentioned, as the recipe is for overnight oats.
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, chia, seed, almond, milk, plant, milk, peanut, butter, maple, syrup, sweetener, vanilla, extract, fresh, berry, strawberry, raspberry, blueberry, fruit, jam, strawberry, raspberry, grape

title: Banana Bread
raw_text: 6. Banana Bread: 180 calories per portion, 8 portions, contains gluten and nuts (United States)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, softened
- 3/4 cup brown sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 2 cups mashed bananas (about 4 ripe bananas)
- 1/4 cup milk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c) and grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan.
2. in a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt. set aside.
3. in a large mixing bowl, cream together the butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
4. add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
5. stir in the mashed bananas, milk, and vanilla extract until well combined.
6. gradually add the dry ingredients to the banana mixture, stirring just until the flour is incorporated. be careful not to overmix.
7. pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan, spreading it evenly.
8. bake for 60-70 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
9. remove the banana bread from the oven and let it cool in the pan for 10 minutes.
10. transfer the bread to a wire rack to cool completely before slicing and serving.
ingredients_list: flour, baking, soda, salt, unsalted, butter, brown, sugar, egg, banana, banana, milk, vanilla, extract

title: Veggie Wrap
raw_text: 7. Veggie Wrap: 350 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten (International)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- whole wheat tortilla wraps
- assorted vegetables (e.g. lettuce, tomatoes, cucumber, bell peppers, carrots, red onions)
- hummus or your favorite spread
- avocado (optional)
- feta cheese or any other cheese (optional)
- salt and pepper for seasoning
preparation:
1. wash and prepare all the vegetables. slice the tomatoes and cucumbers, shred the lettuce, thinly slice the bell peppers, grate the carrots, and finely chop the red onions.
2. spread a generous amount of hummus or your favorite spread onto the whole wheat tortilla wraps.
3. place a layer of lettuce leaves on top of the spread.
4. add the sliced tomatoes, cucumbers, bell peppers, grated carrots, and chopped red onions on top of the lettuce.
5. if desired, add some sliced avocado and crumbled feta cheese or any other cheese of your choice.
6. sprinkle a pinch of salt and pepper on top for seasoning.
7. carefully roll up the tortilla wraps, tucking in the sides as you go.
8. slice the wrapped veggie wraps in half diagonally or leave them whole and serve immediately.

enjoy your delicious veggie wrap!
ingredients_list: whole, wheat, tortilla, wrap, assorted, vegetable, lettuce, tomato, cucumber, bell, pepper, carrot, red, onion, hummus, spread, avocado, feta, cheese, cheese, salt, pepper, seasoning

title: Energy Balls
raw_text: 19. Energy Balls: 100 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains nuts (International)
ingredients:
ingredients for energy balls:
- 1 cup rolled oats
- 1/2 cup nut butter (e.g., almond, peanut, or cashew butter)
- 1/4 cup honey or maple syrup
- 1/4 cup ground flaxseed
- 1/4 cup mini chocolate chips
- 1/4 cup chopped nuts (e.g., almonds, walnuts, or pecans)
- 1/4 cup dried fruit (e.g., raisins, cranberries, or chopped dates)
- 1-2 tablespoons chia seeds (optional)
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine rolled oats, nut butter, honey or maple syrup, ground flaxseed, mini chocolate chips, chopped nuts, dried fruit, chia seeds (if using), and vanilla extract.
2. stir well until all the ingredients are evenly distributed and the mixture becomes sticky.
3. if the mixture seems dry, you can add a little more nut butter or honey/maple syrup to help bind it together.
4. once the mixture is well combined, cover the bowl and place it in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes. chilling makes it easier to roll and shape the energy balls.
5. after chilling, take small portions of the mixture and roll it into bite-sized balls using your hands.
6. repeat this process until all the mixture is used.
7. place the energy balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to firm up.
8. once the energy balls are firm, you can transfer them to an airtight container for storage.
9. energy balls can be kept in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks or in the freezer for up to 3 months.
10. enjoy these nutritious and delicious energy balls as a quick snack or on-the-go pick-me-up!
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, nut, butter, almond, peanut, cashew, butter, honey, maple, syrup, ground, flaxseed, chocolate, chip, nut, almond, walnut, pecan, dried, fruit, raisin, cranberry, date, chia, seed, vanilla, extract

title: Spinach and Mushroom Quesadilla
raw_text: 26. Spinach and Mushroom Quesadilla: 300 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten (Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 2 large flour tortillas 
- 1 cup fresh spinach, chopped 
- 1 cup mushrooms, sliced 
- 1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese 
- 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese 
- 1/4 teaspoon dried oregano 
- 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder 
- salt and pepper to taste 
- olive oil for cooking
preparation:
1. heat a drizzle of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. add the sliced mushrooms and cook until they start to brown, about 5 minutes. remove from the skillet and set aside. 
2. in the same skillet, add the chopped spinach and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes. season with salt and pepper. remove from the skillet and set aside. 
3. place one tortilla on a clean surface. sprinkle half of the mozzarella cheese evenly over one half of the tortilla. 
4. top the cheese with half of the cooked mushrooms, followed by half of the cooked spinach. sprinkle with half of the crumbled feta cheese, dried oregano, and garlic powder. season with salt and pepper. 
5. fold the tortilla in half, pressing down gently. repeat the same process with the remaining tortilla and ingredients. 
6. heat a drizzle of olive oil in the skillet over medium heat. carefully place one quesadilla in the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until the tortilla is golden brown and the cheese is melted. 
7. repeat with the second quesadilla. 
8. remove the quesadillas from the skillet and let them cool slightly before slicing into wedges. serve warm and enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, tortilla, fresh, spinach, mushroom, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, feta, cheese, dried, oregano, garlic, powder, salt, pepper, taste, olive

title: Vegan Bagel with Cashew Cream Cheese
raw_text: 30. Vegan Bagel with Cashew Cream Cheese: 400 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains nuts (United States)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 vegan bagel
- 1 cup cashews, soaked overnight
- 1 tablespoon nutritional yeast
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- salt and pepper to taste
- optional toppings: sliced tomatoes, cucumber, sprouts, or fresh herbs
preparation:
1. drain and rinse the soaked cashews.
2. in a food processor or high-speed blender, add the soaked cashews, nutritional yeast, lemon juice, minced garlic, salt, and pepper.
3. blend until smooth and creamy, scraping down the sides as needed.
4. toast the vegan bagel until warm and slightly crispy.
5. spread a generous amount of the cashew cream cheese onto both sides of the bagel.
6. add any optional toppings of your choice, such as sliced tomatoes, cucumber, sprouts, or fresh herbs.
7. press the two sides of the bagel together and enjoy your delicious vegan bagel with cashew cream cheese!
ingredients_list: vegan, bagel, cashew, soaked, yeast, lemon, clove, garlic, minced, salt, pepper, taste, topping, tomato, cucumber, sprout, fresh, herb

title: Vegan Banana Bread Muffins
raw_text: 34. Vegan Banana Bread Muffins: 160 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (United States)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 ripe bananas
- 1/2 cup of coconut sugar
- 1/4 cup of melted coconut oil
- 1/4 cup of almond milk
- 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract
- 1 and 1/2 cups of whole wheat flour
- 1 teaspoon of baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon of baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon of salt
- 1/2 cup of chopped walnuts (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c) and line a muffin tin with paper liners.
2. in a large mixing bowl, mash the bananas until smooth.
3. add the coconut sugar, melted coconut oil, almond milk, and vanilla extract to the mashed bananas. mix well to combine.
4. in a separate bowl, whisk together the whole wheat flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
5. gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix until just combined. be careful not to overmix.
6. fold in the chopped walnuts, if using.
7. divide the batter evenly among the prepared muffin cups, filling each one about 3/4 full.
8. bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
9. remove the muffins from the oven and let them cool in the tin for 5 minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. once cooled, enjoy your delicious vegan banana bread muffins!
ingredients_list: banana, coconut, sugar, coconut, almond, milk, vanilla, extract, whole, wheat, flour, baking, powder, baking, soda, salt, walnut

title: Pita Bread with Baba Ganoush
raw_text: 35. Pita Bread with Baba Ganoush: 180 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten (Middle East)
ingredients:
sure! here is the recipe for pita bread with baba ganoush:

for the pita bread:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon active dry yeast
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup warm water
- olive oil for greasing

for the baba ganoush:
- 2 large eggplants
- 3 cloves of garlic
- juice of 1 lemon
- 2 tablespoons tahini
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh parsley for garnish
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the flour, yeast, sugar, and salt for the pita bread. gradually add the warm water and knead well until a smooth dough forms. cover the bowl with a damp cloth and let it rest for about 1 hour or until the dough doubles in size.

2. preheat your oven to 475°f (245°c). divide the dough into 8 equal portions and shape them into balls. roll out each ball into a circle about 1/4 inch thick.

3. place the rolled-out dough on a baking sheet greased with olive oil and bake for 5-7 minutes until the bread puffs up and turns golden brown. remove from the oven and let them cool.

4. while the pita bread is baking, prepare the baba ganoush. preheat your grill or broiler. prick the eggplants with a fork and place them on the grill or under the broiler. cook for about 10-15 minutes, turning occasionally until the skin is charred and the inside is soft.

5. remove the eggplants from the heat and let them cool slightly. peel off the charred skin and chop the flesh into small pieces. place the eggplant in a bowl.

6. crush the garlic cloves and add them to the bowl with the eggplant. add the lemon juice, tahini, olive oil, cumin, salt, and pepper. mix well until all the ingredients are combined and the mixture has a creamy consistency.

7. transfer the baba ganoush to a serving dish and garnish with fresh parsley.

8. serve the freshly baked pita bread alongside the baba ganoush for a delicious appetizer or snack. enjoy!
taste:
For the pita bread: No key taste profile specified.

For the baba ganoush: Bitter
ingredients_list: pita, bread, baba, ganoush, pita, bread, flour, yeast, sugar, salt, water, olive, greasing, baba, ganoush, eggplant, clove, garlic, lemon, tahini, olive, ground, cumin, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Vegan Apple Cinnamon Muesli
raw_text: 39. Vegan Apple Cinnamon Muesli: 220 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts (Switzerland)
ingredients:
ingredients:

- 1 apple, grated
- 1 tablespoon maple syrup
- 1 tablespoon chia seeds
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/2 cup almond milk (or any plant-based milk)
- 1/4 cup chopped nuts (such as almonds or walnuts)
- 1/4 cup dried fruits (such as raisins or cranberries)
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the rolled oats, grated apple, maple syrup, chia seeds, and cinnamon.
2. stir in the almond milk and mix well until all the ingredients are fully combined.
3. cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight to allow the flavors to meld and the oats to soften.

title: Pumpkin Spice Latte
raw_text: 40. Pumpkin Spice Latte: 150 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains nuts (United States)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup milk
- 1/2 cup pumpkin puree
- 1/4 cup granulated sugar
- 1 tablespoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice
- 1/2 cup strong brewed coffee or espresso
- whipped cream (optional)
- ground cinnamon (optional)
preparation:
1. in a small saucepan, combine the milk, pumpkin puree, granulated sugar, and pumpkin pie spice. 
2. heat the mixture over medium heat, stirring continuously, until it begins to steam. do not let it boil.
3. remove the saucepan from heat and stir in the vanilla extract.
4. pour the mixture into a blender and blend until smooth and frothy.
5. pour the mixture back into the saucepan and heat over low heat to keep warm.
6. in a separate cup, make your preferred amount of strong brewed coffee or espresso.
7. pour the coffee or espresso into serving cups, filling them about 3/4 full.
8. slowly pour the pumpkin mixture over the coffee or espresso, dividing it evenly between cups.
9. stir gently to combine.
10. top with whipped cream and sprinkle with ground cinnamon, if desired.
11. serve hot and enjoy your homemade pumpkin spice latte!
ingredients_list: milk, pumpkin, puree, sugar, vanilla, extract, pumpkin, pie, spice, strong, brewed, coffee, espresso, cream, ground, cinnamon

title: Chocolate Peanut Butter Smoothie
raw_text: 44. Chocolate Peanut Butter Smoothie: 220 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts (International)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 ripe banana
- 2 tablespoons of peanut butter
- 1 tablespoon of cocoa powder
- 1 cup of milk (dairy or non-dairy)
- 1 tablespoon of honey or maple syrup (optional)
- 1 cup of ice cubes
preparation:
1. peel the banana and break it into chunks.
2. in a blender, add the banana chunks, peanut butter, cocoa powder, milk, and sweetener (if using).
3. blend on high until all the ingredients are well combined and smooth.
4. add the ice cubes and blend again until the smoothie becomes thick and creamy.
5. taste and adjust the sweetness or peanut butter according to your preference.
6. pour the chocolate peanut butter smoothie into a glass and serve chilled.
7. enjoy your delicious and creamy chocolate peanut butter smoothie!

ingredients:

title: Mango Coconut Chia Pudding
raw_text: 52. Mango Coconut Chia Pudding: 240 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts (International)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 ripe mango
- 1 cup coconut milk
- 1/4 cup chia seeds
- 1 tablespoon honey (optional)
- a pinch of salt
preparation:
1. peel and pit the mango, then cut it into chunks.
2. in a blender or food processor, blend the mango chunks until smooth.
3. in a bowl, combine the blended mango with coconut milk, chia seeds, honey (if desired), and a pinch of salt.
4. stir well to mix all the ingredients together.
5. cover the bowl with plastic wrap or a lid and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or overnight.

7. serve the mango coconut chia pudding chilled, and optionally garnish with fresh mango slices or shredded coconut.
8. enjoy!

title: Sweet Potato Toast with Peanut Butter
raw_text: 53. Sweet Potato Toast with Peanut Butter: 300 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains nuts (United States)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 large sweet potato
- peanut butter (smooth or crunchy)
- toppings of your choice (such as sliced bananas, honey, chia seeds, etc.)
preparation:
1. start by washing and drying the sweet potato thoroughly.
2. slice the sweet potato lengthwise into even 1/4 inch thick slices. you can leave the skin on or peel it off, depending on your preference.
3. toast the sweet potato slices using a toaster or in a preheated oven at 400°f (200°c) for about 10-15 minutes, or until they become light golden and slightly crispy around the edges. flip them halfway through the cooking time if necessary.
4. once the sweet potato slices are toasted, allow them to cool slightly.
5. spread a generous amount of peanut butter onto each sweet potato slice.
6. add your desired toppings, such as sliced bananas, a drizzle of honey, or a sprinkle of chia seeds.
7. serve immediately and enjoy your delicious sweet potato toast with peanut butter!

ingredients:

title: Vegan Vegetable Samosas
raw_text: 60. Vegan Vegetable Samosas: 300 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten (India)
ingredients:
ingredients:

- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 cup vegetable oil
- 1/4 cup water

for the filling:
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon grated ginger
- 1 potato, peeled and diced
- 1 carrot, peeled and diced
- 1/2 cup peas
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1 teaspoon garam masala
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric
- salt to taste
- fresh cilantro, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, mix together the flour and salt. add the vegetable oil and water. knead until a smooth dough forms. cover with a damp cloth and let it rest for 30 minutes.

2. in a large pan, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. add the chopped onion, minced garlic, and grated ginger. saute until the onion is translucent.

3. add the diced potato and carrot to the pan. cook for about 5 minutes until vegetables slightly soften.

4. stir in the peas, ground cumin, ground coriander, garam masala, turmeric, and salt. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together. remove from heat and let the filling cool.

5. preheat oven to 375°f (190°c). line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

6. divide the dough into small balls. roll each ball into a thin circle on a lightly floured surface.

7. cut the circle in half. take one half and fold it into a cone shape, overlapping the edges. moisten the edges with water to seal. fill the cone with the cooled vegetable filling.

8. moisten the edges of the cone again and pinch to seal it completely. repeat with the remaining dough and filling.

9. place the filled samosas on the prepared baking sheet. brush the tops with a little vegetable oil.

10. bake for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy.

11. garnish with freshly chopped cilantro before serving.

enjoy your delicious vegan vegetable samosas!
ingredients_list: flour, salt, vegetable, water, filling, vegetable, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, potato, carrot, pea, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, garam, masala, turmeric, salt, taste, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Vegan Pumpkin Pie Smoothie

ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup canned pumpkin puree
- 1 banana, frozen
- 1 cup almond milk

- 1/2 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice

preparation:

2. blend until smooth and creamy.
3. if desired, add a few ice cubes and blend again to achieve a colder consistency.

5. optional: garnish with a sprinkle of pumpkin pie spice or a dollop of whipped coconut cream before serving. enjoy!
ingredients_list: canned, pumpkin, puree, banana, frozen, almond, milk, maple, syrup, pumpkin, pie, spice, vanilla, extract, ice, cube

title: Walnut Energy Bars
raw_text: 69. Walnut Energy Bars: 170 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains nuts (International)

ingredients:

- 1/2 cup rolled oats
- 1/4 cup honey or maple syrup
- 2 tablespoons almond butter
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- pinch of salt
preparation:
1. in a food processor, pulse the walnuts until coarsely chopped.

title: Vegan Cornbread
raw_text: 70. Vegan Cornbread: 180 calories per portion, 6 portions, contains gluten (United States)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup cornmeal
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 tablespoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup almond milk (or any non-dairy milk)
- 1/4 cup applesauce
- 1/4 cup maple syrup
- 1/4 cup melted coconut oil
- 1 cup canned corn kernels, drained
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c) and lightly grease a 9-inch square baking pan.
2. in a mixing bowl, whisk together the cornmeal, flour, baking powder, and salt.
3. in a separate bowl, whisk together the almond milk, applesauce, maple syrup, and melted coconut oil.
4. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. do not overmix.
5. gently fold in the canned corn kernels.
6. pour the batter into the prepared baking pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
7. bake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
8. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

enjoy your vegan cornbread!

title: Vegan Cinnamon Roll Pancakes
raw_text: 72. Vegan Cinnamon Roll Pancakes: 280 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten (United States)
ingredients:
ingredients:
for the pancake batter:
- 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
- 1 tablespoon baking powder
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- ¼ teaspoon salt
- 1 ½ cups unsweetened plant-based milk
- 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil

for the cinnamon filling:
- ¼ cup vegan butter, melted
- ¼ cup brown sugar
- 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon

for the glaze:
- ½ cup powdered sugar
- 1 tablespoon unsweetened plant-based milk
- ½ teaspoon vanilla extract
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt.
2. in a separate bowl, combine the plant-based milk, apple cider vinegar, and vegetable oil. stir well to combine.
3. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. do not overmix; some lumps are fine.
4. in a small bowl, prepare the cinnamon filling by mixing together the melted vegan butter, brown sugar, and ground cinnamon.
5. heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat. once hot, pour a ¼ cup of pancake batter onto the skillet.
6. immediately drizzle 1 tablespoon of the cinnamon filling onto the center of the pancake.
7. cook until bubbles form on the surface of the pancake, then flip and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until cooked through.
8. repeat steps 5-7 for the remaining batter and filling.
9. in a small bowl, whisk together the powdered sugar, plant-based milk, and vanilla extract to make the glaze.
10. drizzle the glaze over the cooked pancakes and serve warm.

enjoy your delicious vegan cinnamon roll pancakes!

title: Lemon Poppy Seed Muffins
raw_text: 75. Lemon Poppy Seed Muffins: 220 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (United States)
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 2 cups all-purpose flour 
- 1 cup granulated sugar 
- 1 tablespoon baking powder 
- 1/2 teaspoon salt 
- zest of 2 lemons 
- 2 tablespoons poppy seeds 
- 1 cup milk 
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted 
- 2 large eggs 
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c). line a muffin tin with paper liners or grease the cups with cooking spray. 
2. in a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, lemon zest, and poppy seeds. 
3. in a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, melted butter, eggs, and lemon juice until well combined. 
4. gradually pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. do not overmix; it's okay if there are a few lumps. 
5. spoon the batter into the prepared muffin tin, filling each cup about 2/3 full. 
6. bake for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean. 
7. allow the muffins to cool in the tin for 5 minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, baking, powder, salt, zest, lemon, poppy, seed, milk, unsalted, butter, egg, lemon

title: Vegan Banana Chia Pudding
raw_text: 77. Vegan Banana Chia Pudding: 230 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts (International)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 ripe bananas
- 1/4 cup chia seeds
- 1 cup almond milk (or any non-dairy milk)
- 1 tablespoon maple syrup (optional)
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- fresh fruits for topping (optional)
preparation:
1. in a blender or food processor, add the ripe bananas, almond milk, maple syrup (if desired), and vanilla extract. blend until smooth and creamy.
2. pour the banana mixture into a bowl or jar.
3. add chia seeds to the bowl or jar and stir well to combine.
4. let the mixture sit for about 5 minutes, then stir again to prevent clumping.
5. cover the bowl or jar and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight to allow the chia seeds to thicken.
6. once the pudding has thickened, give it a good stir before serving.
7. serve the vegan banana chia pudding in individual bowls or jars, and top with fresh fruits if desired.
8. enjoy!
ingredients_list: banana, chia, seed, almond, milk, dairy, milk, maple, syrup, vanilla, extract, fresh, fruit, topping

title: Vegan Almond Milk Smoothie
raw_text: 79. Vegan Almond Milk Smoothie: 200 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts (International)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup almond milk
- 1 ripe banana
- 1 cup frozen mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)
- 1 tablespoon almond butter
- 1 tablespoon maple syrup or agave syrup
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- ice cubes (optional)
preparation:
1. in a blender, add almond milk, banana, frozen mixed berries, almond butter, maple syrup or agave syrup, and vanilla extract.
2. if desired, add a few ice cubes for a thicker and colder smoothie.
3. blend on high speed until all ingredients are well combined and smooth.
4. taste and adjust sweetness if necessary by adding more maple syrup or agave syrup.
5. pour into glasses and serve immediately.
6. enjoy your vegan almond milk smoothie!
ingredients_list: almond, milk, banana, frozen, berry, strawberry, blueberry, raspberry, almond, butter, maple, syrup, agave, syrup, vanilla, extract, ice, cube

title: Rice Paper Spring Rolls
raw_text: 82. Rice Paper Spring Rolls: 200 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (Vietnam)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 rice paper wrappers
- 1 cup cooked vermicelli noodles
- 1 cup shredded lettuce
- 1 carrot, julienned
- 1/2 cucumber, julienned
- 1/2 red bell pepper, julienned
- 1/4 cup fresh mint leaves
- 1/4 cup fresh cilantro leaves
- 1/4 cup chopped peanuts

for dipping sauce:
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon honey
- 1 teaspoon sesame oil
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1/2 inch ginger, grated
preparation:
1. prepare a shallow dish with warm water. dip one rice paper into the water for a few seconds until it softens. place it on a clean surface.
2. begin by placing a small amount of vermicelli noodles on the bottom third of the rice paper.
3. layer shredded lettuce, carrot, cucumber, red bell pepper, mint leaves, cilantro leaves, and chopped peanuts on top of the noodles.
4. roll the bottom of the rice paper over the filling tightly, tucking it in to secure the ingredients.
5. fold the sides of the rice paper inward and continue rolling tightly until it forms a neat cylinder. repeat with the remaining ingredients.
6. in a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, sesame oil, minced garlic, and grated ginger to make the dipping sauce.
7. serve the spring rolls with the dipping sauce on the side. enjoy!
ingredients_list: rice, wrapper, vermicelli, noodle, shredded, lettuce, carrot, cucumber, red, bell, pepper, fresh, mint, leaf, fresh, cilantro, leaf, peanut, dipping, sauce, soy, sauce, rice, vinegar, honey, sesame, clove, garlic, minced, ginger

title: Baked Tofu Fingers
raw_text: 85. Baked Tofu Fingers: 220 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten (International)
ingredients:
sure! here's the recipe for baked tofu fingers:

ingredients:
- 1 block firm tofu
- 1/2 cup breadcrumbs
- 1/4 cup nutritional yeast
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c) and lightly grease a baking sheet with olive oil.
2. drain and press the tofu to remove excess moisture. cut the tofu into finger-sized pieces, around 1/2 inch thick.
3. in a shallow bowl, combine the breadcrumbs, nutritional yeast, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and black pepper. mix well.
4. in a separate bowl, whisk together the soy sauce and olive oil.
5. dip each tofu finger into the soy sauce mixture, making sure all sides are coated.
6. roll the tofu finger in the breadcrumb mixture, pressing gently to adhere the crumbs.
7. place the coated tofu fingers on the prepared baking sheet, leaving space between each piece.
8. bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the coating is crispy and golden brown, flipping the tofu fingers halfway through baking.
9. once baked, remove from the oven and serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce.

enjoy your baked tofu fingers!
ingredients_list: baked, tofu, finger, tofu, breadcrumb, yeast, garlic, powder, paprika, salt, black, pepper, soy, sauce, olive

title: Vegan Raspberry Muffins
raw_text: 86. Vegan Raspberry Muffins: 240 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (International)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 2 tsp baking powder
- 1/2 tsp baking soda
- 1/4 tsp salt
- 1 cup unsweetened almond milk
- 1/3 cup vegetable oil
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- 1 cup fresh raspberries
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c) and line a muffin tin with paper liners.
2. in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
3. in a separate bowl, mix together the almond milk, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract.
4. make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and pour in the wet ingredients. stir until just combined. be careful not to overmix - a few lumps are okay.
5. gently fold in the fresh raspberries. avoid smashing them, you want them to remain intact.
6. spoon the batter into the prepared muffin tin, filling each cup about 3/4 full.
7. bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
8. remove from the oven and let the muffins cool in the tin for 5 minutes. then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. enjoy these vegan raspberry muffins as a delicious and healthy treat!
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, baking, powder, baking, soda, salt, unsweetened, almond, milk, vegetable, vanilla, extract, fresh, raspberry

title: Fruity Nice Cream
raw_text: 87. Fruity Nice Cream: 180 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts (International)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 ripe bananas
- 1 cup frozen mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)
- 1/4 cup almond milk (or any plant-based milk of your choice)
preparation:
1. peel and slice the bananas into small pieces.
2. place the banana slices in a ziplock bag or airtight container and freeze them for at least 2 hours or overnight.
3. take out the frozen banana slices and let them thaw for a few minutes.
4. in a blender or food processor, add the frozen banana slices, mixed berries, and almond milk.
5. blend on high until smooth and creamy consistency is achieved. you may need to stop and scrape down the sides occasionally.
6. if the mixture is too thick, add a splash of almond milk and blend again until desired consistency is reached.
7. pour the fruity nice cream into bowls or glasses.
8. serve immediately and enjoy as a refreshing and healthy treat!
ingredients_list: banana, frozen, berry, strawberry, blueberry, raspberry, almond, milk, plant, milk

title: Vegan Pumpkin Spice Muffins
raw_text: 88. Vegan Pumpkin Spice Muffins: 260 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (United States)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger
- 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
- 1/4 teaspoon ground cloves
- 1 can (15 ounces) pumpkin puree
- 1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce
- 1/2 cup maple syrup
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 1/4 cup vegetable oil
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 cup chopped walnuts (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c) and line a muffin tin with paper liners or grease it with cooking spray.
2. in a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, and cloves.
3. in a separate bowl, mix together the pumpkin puree, applesauce, maple syrup, brown sugar, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract until well combined.
4. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. avoid overmixing.
5. if desired, fold in the chopped walnuts.
6. fill each muffin cup about 2/3 full with the batter.
7. bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
8. remove from the oven and allow the muffins to cool in the tin for 5 minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. enjoy these fluffy and flavorful vegan pumpkin spice muffins as a delicious fall treat!
ingredients_list: flour, baking, powder, baking, soda, salt, ground, cinnamon, ground, ginger, ground, nutmeg, ground, clove, ounce, pumpkin, puree, unsweetened, applesauce, maple, syrup, brown, sugar, vegetable, vanilla, extract, walnut

title: Vegan Granola with Almond Milk
raw_text: 90. Vegan Granola with Almond Milk: 220 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts (International)
ingredients:
ingredients:

- 2 cups rolled oats
- 1/2 cup nuts (such as almonds, cashews, or walnuts), chopped
- 1/4 cup seeds (such as sunflower or pumpkin seeds)
- 1/4 cup dried fruit (such as raisins or cranberries)
- 2 tablespoons maple syrup or agave syrup
- 2 tablespoons coconut oil, melted
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- pinch of salt
- non-dairy milk (such as almond milk) for serving
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the rolled oats, chopped nuts, seeds, dried fruit, maple syrup (or agave syrup), melted coconut oil, vanilla extract, ground cinnamon, and a pinch of salt. mix everything together until well combined.

3. spread the granola mixture out evenly on the prepared baking sheet.

4. bake in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the granola is golden brown and crispy. make sure to stir the granola every 5 minutes or so to ensure even cooking.

5. once the granola is done baking, remove it from the oven and let it cool completely on the baking sheet. it will continue to crisp up as it cools.

6. once the granola is cooled, transfer it to an airtight container for storage.

7. to serve, pour some almond milk (or any non-dairy milk of your choice) over a serving of the granola and enjoy!

note: feel free to customize this recipe by adding other ingredients such as shredded coconut, chocolate chips, or spices like nutmeg or ginger. you can also adjust the sweetness by adding more or less maple syrup/agave syrup to suit your taste.
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, nut, almond, cashew, walnut, seed, sunflower, pumpkin, seed, dried, fruit, raisin, cranberry, maple, syrup, agave, syrup, coconut, vanilla, extract, ground, cinnamon, pinch, salt, dairy, milk, almond, milk

title: Tofu and Veggie Buddha Bowl
raw_text: 91. Tofu and Veggie Buddha Bowl: 350 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains soy (International)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 block of firm tofu
- 1 cup of cooked quinoa
- 1 cup of mixed vegetables (such as broccoli, bell peppers, carrots)
- 1/2 cup of sliced mushrooms
- 1/2 cup of bean sprouts
- 1/4 cup of chopped green onions
- 2 tablespoons of soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon of sesame oil
- 1 tablespoon of rice vinegar
- 1 teaspoon of minced garlic
- 1 teaspoon of grated ginger
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. press the tofu to remove any excess water. cut the tofu into cubes or slices and set aside.
2. in a small bowl, combine soy sauce, sesame oil, rice vinegar, minced garlic, and grated ginger. mix well to make the marinade.
3. place tofu in a shallow dish and pour the marinade over it. let it marinate for at least 15 minutes.
4. while the tofu is marinating, prepare the quinoa according to package instructions.
5. heat a skillet or wok over medium heat and add a drizzle of oil. add the marinated tofu and cook for about 5-7 minutes, or until crispy and golden brown. set aside.
6. in the same skillet, add the mixed vegetables and mushrooms. stir-fry for about 5 minutes, or until they are cooked but still slightly crunchy.
7. add the bean sprouts and green onions to the skillet and cook for another 2 minutes.
8. season the vegetable mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
9. in a serving bowl, assemble the buddha bowl by placing a scoop of quinoa at the bottom. top it with the cooked tofu and mixed vegetables.
10. garnish with additional green onions, sesame seeds, or a drizzle of soy sauce if desired. serve and enjoy!
ingredients_list: tofu, quinoa, vegetable, broccoli, bell, pepper, carrot, mushroom, bean, sprout, green, onion, soy, sauce, sesame, rice, vinegar, minced, garlic, ginger, salt, pepper, taste

title: Vegan Pear and Walnut Bread
raw_text: 92. Vegan Pear and Walnut Bread: 240 calories per portion, 6 portions, contains gluten and nuts (International)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 cup whole wheat flour
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg
- 1/2 cup coconut oil, melted
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 1/2 cups ripe pears, peeled and chopped
- 1 cup walnuts, chopped
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c) and grease a loaf pan.
2. in a large bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
3. in a separate bowl, whisk together the coconut oil, brown sugar, applesauce, and vanilla extract until well combined.
4. pour the wet mixture into the dry mixture and stir until just combined.
5. fold in the chopped pears and walnuts.
6. pour the batter into the greased loaf pan, spreading it evenly.
7. bake for about 60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
8. remove from the oven and let cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely before slicing. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, whole, wheat, flour, baking, powder, baking, soda, salt, ground, cinnamon, ground, nutmeg, coconut, brown, sugar, unsweetened, applesauce, vanilla, extract, pear, walnut

title: Quinoa Sushi Rolls
raw_text: 93. Quinoa Sushi Rolls: 210 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (Japan)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup quinoa
- 2 cups water
- 4 nori sheets
- 1 small cucumber, cut into thin strips
- 1 small carrot, cut into thin strips
- 1 avocado, sliced
- 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- wasabi and pickled ginger for serving (optional)
preparation:
1. start by rinsing the quinoa thoroughly under cold water to remove any bitterness.
2. in a saucepan, bring the water to a boil and add in the rinsed quinoa. reduce the heat, cover, and let it simmer for about 15 minutes or until the water is absorbed and the quinoa is cooked.
3. remove the cooked quinoa from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
4. once the quinoa is cool enough to handle, sprinkle the rice vinegar over it and mix well to incorporate the flavor.
5. lay out a bamboo sushi mat on a clean surface and place a nori sheet on top, shiny side down.
6. moisten your hands with water to prevent the quinoa from sticking to them. take a handful of quinoa and evenly spread it over the nori sheet, leaving about an inch of space at the top.
7. arrange the cucumber, carrot, and avocado slices in a line across the middle of the quinoa-covered nori sheet.
8. using the sushi mat, carefully roll up the nori sheet, applying gentle pressure to keep the filling intact. wet the top inch of the nori sheet with some water to seal the roll.
9. repeat the process with the remaining nori sheets and filling ingredients.
10. once all the rolls are made, use a sharp knife to cut each roll into bite-sized pieces.
11. serve the quinoa sushi rolls with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger if desired. enjoy!
ingredients_list: quinoa, water, nori, sheet, cucumber, strip, carrot, strip, avocado, rice, vinegar, soy, sauce, wasabi, pickled, ginger

title: Vegan Blueberry Chia Pudding
raw_text: 94. Vegan Blueberry Chia Pudding: 200 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts (International)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup of blueberries
- 4 tablespoons of chia seeds
- 1 cup of almond milk
- 1 tablespoon of maple syrup
- 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract
- optional toppings: fresh blueberries, shredded coconut, chopped nuts
preparation:
1. in a blender or food processor, blend 1/2 cup of blueberries until smooth.
2. in a bowl, combine the blended blueberries, chia seeds, almond milk, maple syrup, and vanilla extract. mix well.
3. let the mixture sit for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent clumps. the chia seeds will absorb the liquid and thicken the mixture.
4. after 15 minutes, give the mixture a final stir and transfer it into serving glasses or jars.
5. cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or overnight, to allow the pudding to fully set and thicken.
6. before serving, top the pudding with the remaining 1/2 cup of blueberries and any other desired toppings like shredded coconut or chopped nuts.
7. enjoy your vegan blueberry chia pudding as a healthy and delicious dessert or breakfast option!
ingredients_list: blueberry, chia, seed, almond, milk, maple, syrup, vanilla, extract, topping, fresh, blueberry, shredded, coconut, nut

ingredients:

ingredients:

title: Vegan Banana Walnut Bread
raw_text: 99. Vegan Banana Walnut Bread: 220 calories per portion, 6 portions, contains gluten and nuts (United States)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 3 ripe bananas
- 1/2 cup coconut sugar
- 1/4 cup melted coconut oil
- 1/4 cup almond milk
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- 1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 1/2 tsp salt

preparation:

title: Healthy Veggie Nachos
raw_text:
100. Healthy Veggie Nachos: 300 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten (Mexico)

Please note that the calorie counts and origins listed may vary depending on the specific ingredients and cooking methods used.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 bag of baked tortilla chips
- 1 cup of diced tomatoes
- 1 cup of diced bell peppers (red, green, and/or yellow)
- 1 cup of cooked black beans
- 1 cup of corn kernels
- 1 cup of shredded lettuce
- 1 cup of shredded cheese (cheddar or a blend of cheeses)

preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. arrange the tortilla chips on a large baking sheet in a single layer.
3. sprinkle half of the shredded cheese evenly over the chips.
4. in a mixing bowl, combine the diced tomatoes, bell peppers, black beans, and corn. season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. spoon the vegetable mixture evenly over the cheese-covered chips.
6. sprinkle the remaining shredded cheese over the vegetables.
7. place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for about 10 minutes, or until the cheese has melted and the vegetables are heated through.
8. remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes.
9. top the nachos with shredded lettuce, sliced jalapenos, sliced black olives, and chopped cilantro.
10. serve the healthy veggie nachos with guacamole, salsa, and sour cream on the side. enjoy!

title: Spicy Mango Salsa
raw_text: 9. Spicy Mango Salsa: 260 kcals per portion, makes 4 portions, contains nightshades (Origin: Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 ripe mangoes, peeled and diced
- 1 red bell pepper, seeded and diced
- 1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and finely chopped
- 1/4 cup red onion, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
- juice of 1 lime
- 1 tablespoon honey
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a medium bowl, combine the diced mangoes, red bell pepper, jalapeno pepper, red onion, and cilantro.
2. in a small bowl, whisk together the lime juice and honey until well combined.
3. pour the lime-honey mixture over the mango mixture and gently toss to coat.
4. season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. let the salsa sit at room temperature for at least 10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. serve the spicy mango salsa as a dip with tortilla chips, as a topping for grilled meats or fish, or as a side dish with mexican inspired dishes.
7. enjoy!
