title: Roasted Vegetable Skewers
raw_text: 21. Roasted Vegetable Skewers: 500 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains nightshades (Origin: N/A)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 red bell pepper
- 1 yellow bell pepper
- 1 zucchini
- 1 red onion
- 8 cherry tomatoes
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper, to taste
- wooden skewers, soaked in water for 30 minutes
preparation:
1. preheat your grill or oven to 400°f (200°c).

2. cut the red and yellow bell peppers, zucchini, and red onion into bite-sized pieces.

3. in a large bowl, combine the olive oil, minced garlic, dried oregano, salt, and pepper.

4. add the prepared vegetables to the bowl and toss until they are evenly coated with the marinade.

5. thread the vegetables onto the soaked wooden skewers, alternating between different types of vegetables.

6. place the skewers on the grill or on a baking sheet if using the oven.

7. roast the vegetable skewers for about 15-20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and slightly charred, turning them occasionally during cooking.

8. remove the skewers from the heat and let them cool slightly before serving.

9. serve the roasted vegetable skewers as a side dish or as a main course with rice or salad. enjoy!
ingredients_list: red, bell, pepper, yellow, bell, pepper, zucchini, red, onion, cherry, tomato, olive, clove, garlic, minced, dried, oregano, salt, pepper, taste, wooden, skewer, soaked, water, minute

title: Sweet and Sour Tofu
raw_text: 30. Sweet and Sour Tofu: 680 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains soy (Origin: China)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 block of firm tofu
- 2 tablespoons cornstarch
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 small onion, sliced into wedges
- 1 small bell pepper, sliced
- 1 small carrot, sliced
- 1 cup pineapple chunks
- 3 tablespoons ketchup
- 2 tablespoons rice vinegar
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons brown sugar
- 1/2 cup vegetable broth
- salt to taste
- sesame seeds for garnish (optional)
- green onions for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. carefully drain and press the tofu to remove excess water. cut the tofu into bite-sized cubes.
2. place the cornstarch in a shallow dish and coat the tofu cubes in the cornstarch, shaking off any excess.
3. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. add the coated tofu cubes and cook until crispy and golden brown on all sides. remove the tofu from the skillet and set aside.
4. in the same skillet, add the onion, bell pepper, and carrot slices. stir-fry for a few minutes until the vegetables start to soften.
5. add the pineapple chunks, ketchup, rice vinegar, soy sauce, brown sugar, and vegetable broth to the skillet. stir well to combine all the ingredients.
6. bring the sauce to a simmer and let it cook for about 5 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together. taste the sauce and adjust the seasoning with salt if needed.
7. return the crispy tofu cubes to the skillet and gently toss to coat them in the sweet and sour sauce. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the tofu is heated through.
8. remove from heat and garnish with sesame seeds and green onions if desired.
9. serve the sweet and sour tofu over cooked rice or noodles, and enjoy!
ingredients_list: tofu, cornstarch, vegetable, onion, wedge, bell, pepper, carrot, pineapple, ketchup, rice, vinegar, soy, sauce, brown, sugar, vegetable, broth, salt, taste, sesame, seed, garnish, green, onion, garnish

title: Vegan Buffalo Cauliflower Wings
raw_text: 33. Vegan Buffalo Cauliflower Wings: 740 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains wheat (Origin: N/A)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 large head of cauliflower
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 cup unsweetened almond milk
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1 teaspoon onion powder
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 cup buffalo sauce
- 2 tablespoons melted vegan butter
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 450°f (230°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. cut the cauliflower into florets, discarding the tough stem.
3. in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, almond milk, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, salt, and black pepper until smooth.
4. dip each cauliflower floret into the batter, allowing any excess to drip off, and then place it on the prepared baking sheet. repeat until all the cauliflower is coated.
5. bake the cauliflower in the preheated oven for 20 minutes, flipping halfway through, until it becomes golden brown and slightly crispy.
6. while the cauliflower is baking, mix together the buffalo sauce and melted vegan butter in a small bowl.
7. once the cauliflower wings are cooked, transfer them to a separate large bowl and pour the buffalo sauce mixture over them. toss gently until the wings are evenly coated.
8. return the sauced cauliflower wings to the baking sheet and bake for an additional 10 minutes to allow the sauce to soak in and the wings to become crispy.
9. remove the cauliflower wings from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.
10. serve the vegan buffalo cauliflower wings with your favorite dipping sauce, such as vegan ranch or blue cheese dressing. enjoy!
ingredients_list: head, cauliflower, flour, unsweetened, almond, milk, garlic, powder, onion, powder, paprika, salt, black, pepper, buffalo, sauce, vegan, butter

title: Lentil Sloppy Joes
raw_text: 35. Lentil Sloppy Joes: 780 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains legumes, wheat (Origin: N/A)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup dried brown lentils
- 2 cups vegetable broth
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 onion, diced
- 1 green bell pepper, diced
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 can (14.5 oz) diced tomatoes, undrained
- 1/4 cup tomato paste
- 2 tablespoons brown sugar
- 1 tablespoon yellow mustard
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon chili powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 burger buns
preparation:
1. in a medium saucepan, combine the lentils and vegetable broth. bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for about 25 minutes or until the lentils are tender and most of the liquid is absorbed. drain any excess liquid if needed.

2. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the diced onion and green bell pepper. cook for about 5 minutes or until softened.

3. add the minced garlic to the skillet and cook for an additional minute, stirring constantly.

4. stir in the cooked lentils, diced tomatoes (with the liquid), tomato paste, brown sugar, yellow mustard, soy sauce, smoked paprika, and chili powder. mix well to combine.

5. season with salt and pepper to taste. reduce heat, cover, and let simmer for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.

6. while the mixture is simmering, lightly toast the burger buns if desired.

7. once the lentil mixture has thickened and the flavors have melded together, remove from heat.

8. spoon the lentil sloppy joes mixture onto the toasted burger buns. serve hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: dried, brown, lentil, vegetable, broth, olive, onion, green, bell, pepper, clove, garlic, minced, tomato, tomato, paste, brown, sugar, yellow, mustard, soy, sauce, smoked, paprika, chili, powder, salt, pepper, taste, burger, bun

title: Tempeh Stir
raw_text: 38. Tempeh Stir-Fry: 840 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains soy (Origin: Indonesia)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 block of tempeh, cut into cubes
- 1 tablespoon oil
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 small onion, sliced
- 1 bell pepper, sliced
- 1 cup broccoli florets
- 1 carrot, thinly sliced
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon hoisin sauce
- 1 tablespoon sesame oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- optional toppings: sesame seeds, green onions
preparation:
1. heat oil in a large pan over medium heat.
2. add minced garlic and sliced onion to the pan, sauté until fragrant and slightly softened.
3. add tempeh cubes to the pan and cook for about 5 minutes, or until lightly browned on all sides.
4. add bell pepper, broccoli florets, and carrot slices to the pan. cook for an additional 5-7 minutes, or until vegetables are tender-crisp.
5. in a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, hoisin sauce, and sesame oil. pour the sauce over the stir-fry mixture in the pan and stir well to coat everything.
6. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, until the sauce has thickened slightly and everything is well combined.
7. season with salt and pepper to taste. 
8. serve the tempeh stir-fry hot, garnished with sesame seeds and green onions if desired.
9. enjoy!
ingredients_list: tempeh, cube, clove, garlic, minced, onion, bell, pepper, broccoli, floret, carrot, thinly, soy, sauce, hoisin, sauce, sesame, salt, pepper, taste, topping, sesame, seed, green, onion

title: Jackfruit Tacos
raw_text: 40. Jackfruit Tacos: 880 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains wheat, soy (Origin: N/A)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups young jackfruit, canned or fresh (rinsed and shredded)
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon chili powder
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional, for extra heat)
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 8 small tortillas
- toppings: diced tomatoes, chopped cilantro, sliced avocado, lime wedges
preparation:
1. in a pan, heat olive oil over medium heat. add chopped onions and minced garlic, sauté until onions become translucent.

2. add shredded jackfruit to the pan, along with chili powder, cumin, paprika, cayenne pepper (if desired), salt, and pepper. stir well to coat the jackfruit with the spices.

3. cook the jackfruit mixture for about 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until it starts to brown slightly.

4. while the jackfruit is cooking, warm up the tortillas individually in a separate dry pan or in the oven.

5. once the jackfruit is done cooking, remove from heat and transfer it to a serving bowl.

6. serve the warm tortillas along with the jackfruit filling. allow everyone to assemble their own tacos, topping them with diced tomatoes, chopped cilantro, sliced avocado, and a squeeze of lime juice.

7. enjoy your delicious homemade jackfruit tacos!
ingredients_list: jackfruit, canned, fresh, shredded, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, chili, powder, cumin, paprika, cayenne, pepper, salt, pepper, taste, tortilla, topping, tomato, cilantro, avocado, lime, wedge

title: Vegan Butter Chicken
raw_text: 42. Vegan Butter Chicken: 920 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains nuts, soy (Origin: India)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups soy chunks
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 onion, chopped
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1-inch piece of ginger, grated
- 1 can diced tomatoes
- 1 cup cashews
- 1 cup water
- 1 teaspoon garam masala
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional)
- 1 cup plant-based yogurt
- 1/2 cup plant-based cream
- fresh cilantro, chopped (for garnish)
- salt, to taste
preparation:
1. place the soy chunks in a bowl, cover with boiling water, and let sit for 10 minutes. drain the water and set aside.
2. heat the vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat. add the onion, garlic, and ginger, and sauté until the onions are translucent.
3. in a blender, combine the diced tomatoes, cashews, water, garam masala, cumin, coriander, turmeric, paprika, and cayenne pepper (if using). blend until smooth.
4. add the tomato-cashew mixture to the pan with the onions, garlic, and ginger. stir well and let simmer for a few minutes.
5. add the soy chunks to the pan and mix until they are well coated with the sauce. cook for another 5 minutes.
6. stir in the plant-based yogurt and cream. reduce the heat to low and let simmer for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
7. adjust the salt to taste.
8. garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot with rice or naan bread. enjoy your vegan butter chicken!
ingredients_list: soy, vegetable, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, tomato, cashew, water, garam, masala, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, turmeric, paprika, cayenne, pepper, plant, yogurt, plant, cream, fresh, cilantro, garnish, salt, taste

title: Vegan Meatballs with Marinara Sauce
raw_text: 44. Vegan Meatballs with Marinara Sauce: 960 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains wheat (Origin: N/A)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups cooked lentils
- 1 cup breadcrumbs
- 1/2 cup nutritional yeast
- 1/4 cup ground flaxseed mixed with 1/2 cup water (flaxseed egg)
- 1/4 cup finely chopped onion
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons tomato paste
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 2 teaspoons italian seasoning
- salt and pepper to taste
- olive oil for frying

for the marinara sauce:
- 1 can (14 ounces) crushed tomatoes
- 1/4 cup tomato paste
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon sugar
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, combine the cooked lentils, breadcrumbs, nutritional yeast, flaxseed egg, onion, garlic, tomato paste, soy sauce, italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. mix well until everything is evenly incorporated.
2. shape the mixture into meatball-sized balls and set aside.
3. in a large skillet, heat a small amount of olive oil over medium heat. place the meatballs in the skillet and cook for about 5 minutes, or until browned on all sides. you may need to cook them in batches.
4. while the meatballs are cooking, prepare the marinara sauce. in a saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the minced garlic and sauté until fragrant.
5. stir in the crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, basil, oregano, sugar, salt, and pepper. simmer for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. once the meatballs are browned, add them to the simmering marinara sauce. cook for an additional 10-15 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
7. serve the vegan meatballs with marinara sauce over your favorite pasta or on a bed of rice. enjoy!
ingredients_list: lentil, breadcrumb, yeast, ground, flaxseed, water, flaxseed, egg, onion, clove, garlic, minced, tomato, paste, soy, sauce, italian, seasoning, salt, pepper, taste, olive, marinara, sauce, ounce, tomato, tomato, paste, clove, garlic, minced, olive, dried, basil, dried, oregano, sugar, salt, pepper, taste

title: Vegan Sushi Burrito
raw_text: 45. Vegan Sushi Burrito: 980 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains soy (Origin: Japan)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 nori seaweed sheets
- 1 cup sushi rice
- 1 avocado, sliced
- 1 carrot, julienned
- 1 cucumber, julienned
- 1/2 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1/2 cup purple cabbage, shredded
- 1/4 cup pickled ginger
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 2 teaspoons rice vinegar
- 2 teaspoons sesame oil
- salt, to taste
- sriracha sauce (optional)
preparation:
1. cook sushi rice according to package instructions. once cooked, season with rice vinegar, sesame oil, and salt. set aside to cool.
2. lay out a nori seaweed sheet on a clean surface.
3. spread a thin layer of sushi rice evenly over the nori sheet, leaving about an inch empty at the top.
4. arrange a diverse combination of avocado slices, carrot, cucumber, bell pepper, and purple cabbage horizontally over the rice.
5. add a few pieces of pickled ginger on top of the vegetables.
6. drizzle some soy sauce and a few drops of sriracha sauce (if desired) over the filling.
7. carefully roll the nori sheet tightly, starting from the bottom, to create the sushi burrito. moisten the top edge of the nori with water to seal the roll. repeat the process with the second nori sheet.
8. using a sharp knife, cut the sushi burrito in half or into smaller sections for serving.
9. serve the vegan sushi burrito with additional soy sauce or sriracha sauce on the side for dipping. enjoy!
cooking_style: n/a (this is a raw sushi recipe with no cooking involved)
ingredients_list: nori, seaweed, sheet, sushi, rice, avocado, carrot, cucumber, red, bell, pepper, thinly, purple, cabbage, shredded, pickled, ginger, soy, sauce, rice, vinegar, sesame, salt, taste, sriracha, sauce

title: Vegan Lentil Burgers
raw_text: 54. Vegan Lentil Burgers: 480 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains wheat (Origin: N/A)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup cooked lentils
- 1/2 cup cooked quinoa
- 1/2 cup bread crumbs
- 1/4 cup finely chopped onion
- 1/4 cup finely chopped bell pepper
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons ground flaxseed
- 2 tablespoons water
- 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, mash the cooked lentils with a fork or potato masher until they are partially mashed but still have some texture.
2. in a small bowl, mix together the ground flaxseed and water. let it sit for a few minutes until it thickens to a gel-like consistency.
3. add the cooked quinoa, bread crumbs, onion, bell pepper, garlic, smoked paprika, cumin, salt, black pepper, and the flaxseed mixture to the mashed lentils. stir until well combined. 
4. let the mixture rest for about 10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
5. heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
6. shape the lentil mixture into patties and place them in the skillet. cook for about 4-5 minutes on each side until lightly browned and crispy.
7. serve the lentil burgers on buns with your favorite toppings and condiments. enjoy!
ingredients_list: lentil, quinoa, bread, crumb, onion, bell, pepper, clove, garlic, minced, ground, flaxseed, water, smoked, paprika, cumin, salt, black, pepper, olive

title: Vegan Thai Coconut Curry Soup
raw_text: 55. Vegan Thai Coconut Curry Soup: 520 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains nuts (Origin: Thailand)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon coconut oil
- 1 small white onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon ginger, grated
- 1 tablespoon red curry paste
- 1 can (13.5 ounces) coconut milk
- 3 cups vegetable broth
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 medium carrot, sliced
- 1 zucchini, sliced
- 1 cup sliced mushrooms
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon lime juice
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh cilantro for garnish
- cooked rice or noodles, optional for serving
preparation:
1. in a large pot, heat coconut oil over medium heat. add the diced onion, minced garlic, and grated ginger. sauté for 2-3 minutes until the onion is translucent and fragrant.
2. stir in the red curry paste and cook for another minute.
3. pour in the coconut milk and vegetable broth. stir well to combine.
4. add the sliced red bell pepper, carrot, zucchini, and mushrooms to the pot. bring the soup to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for about 15-20 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
5. stir in the soy sauce and lime juice. season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. remove from heat and garnish with fresh cilantro.
7. serve the soup hot, either on its own or over cooked rice or noodles if desired. enjoy your vegan thai coconut curry soup!
taste: The key taste profile is: savory/umami
ingredients_list: coconut, white, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, red, curry, paste, ounce, coconut, milk, vegetable, broth, red, bell, pepper, carrot, zucchini, mushroom, soy, sauce, lime, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, cilantro, garnish, rice, noodle

title: Vegan Chickpea Salad Sandwich
raw_text: 56. Vegan Chickpea Salad Sandwich: 560 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains wheat (Origin: N/A)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 can of chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1/4 cup of vegan mayonnaise
- 1 tablespoon of dijon mustard
- 1 stalk of celery, finely chopped
- 1/4 red onion, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup of fresh parsley, chopped
- 1/4 teaspoon of garlic powder
- 1/4 teaspoon of onion powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 slices of bread
- lettuce and tomato slices for garnish
preparation:
1. in a medium-sized bowl, mash the chickpeas using a fork or potato masher until they achieve a chunky texture.
2. add vegan mayonnaise, dijon mustard, celery, red onion, parsley, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper to the mashed chickpeas. mix well to combine all the ingredients thoroughly.
3. taste and adjust seasonings if needed, adding more salt, pepper, or spices to suit your preference.
4. toast the bread slices lightly if desired.
5. divide the chickpea salad mixture between two slices of bread, spreading it evenly.
6. top with lettuce and tomato slices, and cover with the remaining bread slices to make a sandwich.
7. cut in half if desired and serve your vegan chickpea salad sandwich immediately.
enjoy!
ingredients_list: chickpea, vegan, mayonnaise, dijon, mustard, stalk, celery, red, onion, fresh, parsley, garlic, powder, onion, powder, salt, pepper, taste, bread, lettuce, tomato, garnish

title: Vegan Broccoli Cheddar Soup
raw_text: 59. Vegan Broccoli Cheddar Soup: 680 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains nuts, soy (Origin: N/A)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small white onion, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 3 cups vegetable broth
- 4 cups broccoli florets
- 1 cup shredded vegan cheddar cheese
- 1 cup unsweetened almond milk
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
2. add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the pot. cook for about 5 minutes or until the onion is translucent.
3. pour in the vegetable broth and bring it to a boil.
4. add the broccoli florets to the pot and simmer for about 10 minutes or until the broccoli is tender.
5. use an immersion blender to blend the soup until smooth. if you don't have an immersion blender, you can transfer the soup in batches to a regular blender and blend until smooth. be careful when blending hot liquids and allow some ventilation to prevent pressure buildup.
6. return the blended soup to low heat and stir in the shredded vegan cheddar cheese. stir until melted and well combined.
7. pour in the unsweetened almond milk and stir until heated through.
8. season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. remove from heat and serve hot. optionally, you can garnish with extra shredded vegan cheddar cheese if desired.
10. enjoy your vegan broccoli cheddar soup!
ingredients_list: olive, white, onion, clove, garlic, minced, vegetable, broth, broccoli, floret, shredded, vegan, cheddar, cheese, unsweetened, almond, milk, salt, pepper, taste

title: Vegan Black Bean Quesadillas
raw_text: 60. Vegan Black Bean Quesadillas: 720 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains wheat (Origin: Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 whole wheat tortillas
- 1 cup cooked black beans
- 1/2 cup diced bell peppers (any color)
- 1/2 cup diced red onions
- 1/2 cup sliced black olives
- 1/2 cup frozen corn kernels, thawed
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 cup vegan shredded cheese (such as daiya or violife)
- fresh cilantro leaves for garnish (optional)
- salsa, guacamole, or vegan sour cream for serving (optional)
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked black beans, diced bell peppers, diced red onions, sliced black olives, and thawed corn kernels.
2. add the ground cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper to the mixing bowl. stir well to evenly distribute the spices.
3. heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat.
4. place one whole wheat tortilla in the skillet and spread about 1/4 cup of the vegan shredded cheese evenly on half of the tortilla.
5. spoon about 1/2 cup of the black bean mixture onto the cheese side of the tortilla, spreading it evenly.
6. fold the tortilla in half to create a quesadilla and press it down gently with a spatula.
7. cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until the tortilla is crispy and the cheese is melted. repeat this step for the remaining tortillas and filling.
8. once the quesadillas are cooked, remove them from the skillet and let them cool for a minute or two before cutting them into triangles.
9. serve the vegan black bean quesadillas with fresh cilantro leaves on top for garnish. you can also serve them with salsa, guacamole, or vegan sour cream if desired. enjoy!
ingredients_list: whole, wheat, tortilla, black, bean, bell, pepper, color, red, onion, black, olive, frozen, corn, kernel, thawed, ground, cumin, chili, powder, garlic, powder, salt, pepper, taste, vegan, shredded, cheese, daiya, violife, fresh, cilantro, leaf, garnish, salsa, guacamole, vegan, sour, cream

title: Vegan Teriyaki Tofu Bowl
raw_text: 62. Vegan Teriyaki Tofu Bowl: 800 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains soy (Origin: Japan)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup of cooked brown rice
- 12 ounces of firm tofu, pressed and cubed
- 1/4 cup of low-sodium soy sauce (or gluten-free tamari for gf version)
- 2 tablespoons of maple syrup
- 2 tablespoons of rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon of cornstarch
- 1 tablespoon of sesame oil
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon of grated ginger
- 1 cup of broccoli florets
- 1 cup of sliced bell peppers
- 1 cup of sliced carrots
- sesame seeds for garnish (optional)
- green onions for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. combine soy sauce, maple syrup, rice vinegar, cornstarch, minced garlic, and grated ginger in a small bowl to make the teriyaki sauce.
2. heat sesame oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
3. add tofu to the skillet and cook until golden brown on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. remove tofu from the skillet and set aside.
4. in the same skillet, add broccoli florets, bell peppers, and carrots. stir-fry for about 5 minutes or until vegetables are tender-crisp.
5. return tofu to the skillet and pour the teriyaki sauce over the tofu and vegetables.
6. stir everything together to coat evenly and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the sauce thickens.
7. serve the teriyaki tofu mixture over cooked brown rice.
8. garnish with sesame seeds and green onions if desired.
9. enjoy your vegan teriyaki tofu bowl!
ingredients_list: brown, rice, ounce, tofu, sodium, soy, sauce, gluten, tamari, version, maple, syrup, rice, vinegar, cornstarch, sesame, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, broccoli, floret, bell, pepper, carrot, sesame, seed, garnish, green, onion, garnish

title: Vegan Tomato Bruschetta
raw_text: 63. Vegan Tomato Bruschetta: 840 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains wheat (Origin: Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 ripe tomatoes, diced
- 1/4 cup fresh basil leaves, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
- 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 baguette, sliced
preparation:
1. in a medium bowl, combine the diced tomatoes, chopped basil, minced garlic, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, and black pepper. mix well.
2. allow the tomato mixture to marinate for at least 30 minutes, allowing the flavors to blend together.
3. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
4. place the baguette slices on a baking sheet and toast them in the preheated oven for about 5 minutes, or until they become crispy.
5. remove the toasted baguette slices from the oven and let them cool slightly.
6. spoon the tomato mixture onto each toasted baguette slice, spreading it evenly.
7. serve immediately and enjoy!
ingredients_list: tomato, fresh, basil, leaf, clove, garlic, minced, virgin, olive, balsamic, vinegar, salt, black, pepper, baguette

title: Vegan Buffalo Cauliflower Pizza
raw_text: 66. Vegan Buffalo Cauliflower Pizza: 960 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains wheat (Origin: N/A)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 medium head of cauliflower
- 1/2 cup buffalo sauce
- 1/4 cup tomato sauce
- 1 pizza crust (vegan, if desired)
- 1/4 cup red onion, thinly sliced
- 1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
- 1/4 cup vegan ranch dressing
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. wash and cut the cauliflower into small florets, removing any tough stems.
3. in a bowl, mix the cauliflower with buffalo sauce until all the florets are coated. let it marinate for about 10 minutes.
4. while the cauliflower is marinating, spread the tomato sauce evenly over the pizza crust.
5. place the marinated cauliflower florets on top of the sauce, spreading them evenly across the pizza.
6. season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. bake the pizza in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the cauliflower is tender and slightly crispy.
8. once the pizza is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it cool slightly.
9. top the pizza with sliced red onion and chopped cilantro.
10. drizzle the vegan ranch dressing over the top.
11. cut the pizza into slices and serve while still warm. enjoy!
ingredients_list: head, cauliflower, buffalo, sauce, tomato, sauce, pizza, crust, vegan, red, onion, thinly, fresh, cilantro, vegan, ranch, salt, pepper, taste

title: Vegan Peanut Butter Energy Bars
raw_text: 68. Vegan Peanut Butter Energy Bars: 80 kcals per portion, makes 12 portions, contains nuts (Origin: N/A)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup pitted dates
- 1 cup rolled oats
- 1 cup roasted peanuts
- 1/4 cup creamy peanut butter
- 1/4 cup maple syrup
- 1/4 cup mini dairy-free chocolate chips
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
preparation:
1. in a food processor, combine dates, rolled oats, roasted peanuts, peanut butter, maple syrup, and salt. blend until the mixture comes together and forms a sticky dough.
2. add mini dairy-free chocolate chips to the dough and pulse a few times to evenly distribute.
3. line a 9x9-inch baking dish with parchment paper, leaving some excess paper hanging over the edges for easy removal.
4. press the dough evenly into the prepared baking dish, making sure to compact it tightly.
5. place the dish in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour to set.
6. once set, lift the mixture out of the dish using the excess parchment paper and transfer it to a cutting board.
7. using a sharp knife, cut the mixture into desired bar sizes.
8. store the vegan peanut butter energy bars in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to two weeks. enjoy as a quick energy snack!
cooking_style: no cooking style specified. this recipe does not require cooking.
ingredients_list: pitted, date, rolled, oat, roasted, peanut, creamy, peanut, butter, maple, syrup, dairy, chocolate, chip, salt

title: Vegan Mexican Street Corn
raw_text: 70. Vegan Mexican Street Corn: 160 kcals per portion, makes 4 portions, contains nuts (Origin: Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 corn cobs
- 1/4 cup vegan mayonnaise
- 1/4 cup vegan sour cream
- 2 tablespoons lime juice
- 1/2 teaspoon chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/4 teaspoon smoked paprika
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
- optional toppings: vegan cotija cheese, lime wedges
preparation:
1. preheat the grill or preheat the broiler in your oven.
2. peel the husks off the corn cobs, leaving some inner layers intact for a rustic look. remove the corn silk.
3. grill or broil the corn cobs for about 10-15 minutes, turning occasionally, until the kernels are charred and tender.
4. in a small bowl, mix together the vegan mayonnaise, vegan sour cream, lime juice, chili powder, ground cumin, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper.
5. once the corn is cooked, brush each cob generously with the mayo mixture.
6. sprinkle the chopped cilantro over the corn and add additional toppings if desired.
7. serve the vegan mexican street corn immediately with lime wedges on the side for extra lime flavor. enjoy!
ingredients_list: corn, cob, vegan, mayonnaise, vegan, sour, cream, lime, chili, powder, ground, cumin, smoked, paprika, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, cilantro, topping, vegan, cotija, cheese, lime, wedge

title: Vegan Roasted Cauliflower Bites
raw_text: 72. Vegan Roasted Cauliflower Bites: 240 kcals per portion, makes 4 portions, contains nuts (Origin: N/A)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 head of cauliflower
- 3 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 teaspoons paprika
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/2 teaspoon onion powder
- 1/2 teaspoon cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c). line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. cut the cauliflower into small florets and place them in a large mixing bowl.
3. in a smaller bowl, whisk together the olive oil, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, cumin, salt, and black pepper.
4. pour the spice mixture over the cauliflower and toss until the florets are well coated.
5. spread the cauliflower evenly on the prepared baking sheet.
6. roast in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the florets are golden brown and tender when pierced with a fork.
7. remove from the oven and let cool slightly before serving.
8. serve the roasted cauliflower bites as a side dish, snack, or even as a main course in a salad or wrap. enjoy!
ingredients_list: head, cauliflower, olive, paprika, garlic, powder, onion, powder, cumin, salt, black, pepper

title: Vegan Breaded Zucchini Sticks
raw_text: 74. Vegan Breaded Zucchini Sticks: 320 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains wheat (Origin: N/A)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 medium zucchini
- 1 cup breadcrumbs (preferably whole wheat)
- 2 tablespoons nutritional yeast
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/2 cup unsweetened almond milk
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 425°f (220°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. wash the zucchini, then cut off the ends. slice the zucchini into sticks, resembling french fries.
3. in a shallow dish or bowl, mix together the breadcrumbs, nutritional yeast, garlic powder, paprika, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper.
4. pour the almond milk into another shallow dish or bowl.
5. dip each zucchini stick into the almond milk to coat it, then roll it in the breadcrumb mixture, pressing gently to make the breadcrumbs stick.
6. place each breaded zucchini stick on the prepared baking sheet, making sure they are evenly spaced apart.
7. bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the zucchini sticks are golden brown and crispy.
8. remove from the oven and let them cool slightly before serving.
9. vegan breaded zucchini sticks can be served as an appetizer or a side dish. enjoy them with your favorite dipping sauce, such as marinara sauce or vegan ranch dressing.
ingredients_list: zucchini, breadcrumb, preferably, whole, wheat, yeast, garlic, powder, paprika, dried, oregano, salt, black, pepper, unsweetened, almond, milk

title: Vegan Turkish Delight
raw_text: 75. Vegan Turkish Delight: 360 kcals per portion, makes 4 portions, contains nuts (Origin: Turkey)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup cornstarch
- 1 cup powdered sugar
- 2 cups water
- 1/4 cup rose water
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1 tablespoon red food coloring
- 1/2 cup chopped pistachios (optional)
preparation:
1. in a medium-sized mixing bowl, combine cornstarch and powdered sugar. mix well and set aside.
2. in a saucepan, add water and bring to a simmer over medium heat.
3. slowly add the cornstarch and powdered sugar mixture to the simmering water, stirring constantly.
4. add rose water and lemon juice to the mixture, stirring continuously until the mixture thickens and starts to resemble a pudding-like consistency.
5. remove the saucepan from heat and divide the mixture into two separate bowls.
6. in one bowl, add the red food coloring and mix well until the color is evenly distributed.
7. lightly grease a square baking dish or silicone mold with vegetable oil.
8. pour half of the white mixture into the greased dish, spreading it out evenly.
9. next, pour the red mixture on top of the white mixture in the dish, again spreading it out evenly.
10. if desired, sprinkle the chopped pistachios on top of the mixture.
11. let the turkish delight set at room temperature for at least 4 hours or overnight.
12. once set, remove the turkish delight from the dish and cut it into small squares or rectangles.
13. dust the squares with powdered sugar to prevent sticking.
14. serve and enjoy your homemade vegan turkish delight!
ingredients_list: cornstarch, sugar, water, rose, water, lemon, red, pistachio

title: Vegan Roasted Red Pepper Dip
raw_text: 77. Vegan Roasted Red Pepper Dip: 440 kcals per portion, makes 4 portions, contains nuts (Origin: N/A)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 red bell peppers
- 1/2 cup raw cashews
- 2 tablespoons nutritional yeast
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1/4 teaspoon smoked paprika
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. cut the red bell peppers in half, remove the seeds, and place them on a baking sheet, cut side down.
3. roast the peppers in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes until the skin is charred and blistered.
4. remove the peppers from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
5. meanwhile, soak the cashews in boiling water for about 10 minutes to soften.
6. drain the cashews and place them in a blender or food processor along with the roasted red peppers.
7. add nutritional yeast, lemon juice, minced garlic, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper to the blender.
8. blend the ingredients until smooth and creamy, adding a few tablespoons of water if needed to achieve desired consistency.
9. adjust seasoning to taste, adding more salt, pepper, or lemon juice if desired.
10. transfer the dip to a serving bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving to allow the flavors to develop.
11. serve the vegan roasted red pepper dip with your favorite crackers, chips, or sliced vegetables. enjoy!
ingredients_list: red, bell, pepper, raw, cashew, yeast, lemon, clove, garlic, minced, smoked, paprika, salt, pepper, taste

title: Vegan Spinach and Artichoke Crostini
raw_text: 79. Vegan Spinach and Artichoke Crostini: 520 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains wheat, nuts (Origin: N/A)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 french baguette
- 1 cup of spinach, chopped
- 1 cup of canned artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
- 1/2 cup of vegan mayonnaise
- 1/4 cup of nutritional yeast
- 1 clove of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon of lemon juice
- salt and pepper, to taste
- olive oil, for brushing
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. slice the french baguette into 1/2-inch thick slices.
3. place the sliced baguette on a baking sheet and brush each side with olive oil.
4. bake the slices in the oven for about 8-10 minutes, or until they are golden and crispy.
5. in a mixing bowl, combine the chopped spinach, artichoke hearts, vegan mayonnaise, nutritional yeast, minced garlic, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. mix well until all the ingredients are evenly distributed.
6. adjust the seasonings according to your taste.
7. once the crostini slices are ready and slightly cooled, spread a generous amount of the spinach and artichoke mixture onto each slice.
8. serve immediately and enjoy!
ingredients_list: french, baguette, spinach, canned, artichoke, heart, vegan, mayonnaise, yeast, clove, garlic, minced, lemon, salt, pepper, taste, olive, brushing

title: Vegan Baked Falafel Bowl
raw_text: 82. Vegan Baked Falafel Bowl: 640 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains wheat, sesame (Origin: Middle East)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 can chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1/2 cup fresh parsley
- 1/2 cup fresh cilantro
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 3 cloves of garlic
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/4 cup flour (use gluten-free flour if needed)
- 4 cups cooked quinoa
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, sliced
- 1 small cucumber, sliced
- 1/4 cup sliced red onion
- 1/4 cup kalamata olives, sliced
- 2 tablespoons tahini sauce or dressing
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a food processor, combine the chickpeas, parsley, cilantro, onion, garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, cumin, coriander, salt, and black pepper. process until well combined but not completely smooth.
3. transfer the mixture to a mixing bowl and stir in the flour until the mixture holds together.
4. shape the mixture into small falafel balls and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
5. bake the falafel in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes until golden brown and crispy, flipping halfway through.
6. while the falafel is baking, prepare the quinoa according to package instructions.
7. once the falafel is ready, assemble your bowls by dividing the cooked quinoa among four bowls.
8. top each bowl with falafel, cherry tomatoes, cucumber slices, red onions, and kalamata olives.
9. drizzle each bowl with tahini sauce or dressing.
10. serve and enjoy your vegan baked falafel bowls!
ingredients_list: chickpea, fresh, parsley, fresh, cilantro, onion, clove, garlic, olive, lemon, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, salt, black, pepper, flour, gluten, flour, needed, quinoa, cherry, tomato, cucumber, red, onion, kalamata, olive, tahini, sauce

title: Vegan Indian Samosa Chaat
raw_text: 85. Vegan Indian Samosa Chaat: 760 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains wheat (Origin: India)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 small vegan samosas
- 1 cup boiled chickpeas
- 1 large onion, finely chopped
- 1 large tomato, finely chopped
- 2 green chilies, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh coriander leaves
- 1/4 cup tamarind chutney
- 1/4 cup mint chutney
- 1/2 teaspoon chaat masala
- 1/2 teaspoon roasted cumin powder
- salt to taste
- sev (crunchy chickpea flour noodles) for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c). place the samosas on a baking tray and bake for about 15 minutes or until they are crispy and golden brown.
2. in a mixing bowl, combine the boiled chickpeas, chopped onion, tomato, green chilies, and coriander leaves.
3. add chaat masala, roasted cumin powder, and salt to taste. mix well to combine all the flavors.
4. once the samosas are baked and slightly cooled, break them into bite-sized pieces.
5. place the broken samosas in a serving plate or bowl.
6. pour the tamarind chutney and mint chutney over the samosa pieces, drizzling it generously.
7. top it off with the prepared chickpea mixture.
8. garnish with some sev and additional chopped coriander leaves.
9. serve the vegan indian samosa chaat immediately and enjoy!
ingredients_list: vegan, samosa, boiled, chickpea, onion, tomato, green, chilies, fresh, coriander, leaf, tamarind, chutney, mint, chutney, chaat, masala, roasted, cumin, powder, salt, taste, sev, crunchy, chickpea, flour, noodle, garnish

title: Vegan Almond Joy Energy Balls
raw_text: 87. Vegan Almond Joy Energy Balls: 840 kcals per portion, makes 4 portions, contains nuts (Origin: N/A)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup pitted dates
- 1 cup almonds
- 1/4 cup unsweetened shredded coconut
- 2 tablespoons cocoa powder
- 2 tablespoons almond butter
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 2 tablespoons dairy-free chocolate chips
preparation:
1. in a food processor, combine the pitted dates, almonds, shredded coconut, cocoa powder, almond butter, vanilla extract, and salt.
2. process the mixture until it forms a sticky dough-like consistency.
3. transfer the dough to a bowl and fold in the dairy-free chocolate chips.
4. scoop about 1 tablespoon of the dough and roll it into a ball between your hands. repeat with the remaining dough.
5. place the energy balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
6. refrigerate the energy balls for at least 30 minutes to firm up.
7. once chilled, the vegan almond joy energy balls are ready to be enjoyed. store them in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.
cooking_style: no cooking style is indicated in this recipe as it involves no heat or cooking process.
ingredients_list: pitted, date, almond, unsweetened, shredded, coconut, cocoa, powder, almond, butter, vanilla, extract, salt, dairy, chocolate, chip

title: Vegan French Onion Dip
raw_text: 89. Vegan French Onion Dip: 920 kcals per portion, makes 4 portions, contains nuts (Origin: France)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large yellow onions, thinly sliced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 cup vegan sour cream
- 1/4 cup vegan mayonnaise
- 1 tablespoon nutritional yeast
- 1 teaspoon worcestershire sauce (vegan variety)
- 1/2 teaspoon onion powder
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- salt and pepper to taste
- chopped fresh chives for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. add the sliced onions and cook until caramelized, stirring occasionally, for about 20-25 minutes. set aside to cool.
2. in a mixing bowl, combine the vegan sour cream, vegan mayonnaise, nutritional yeast, minced garlic, worcestershire sauce, onion powder, paprika, salt, and pepper. mix well.
3. once the caramelized onions have cooled down, add them to the mixing bowl with the other ingredients. stir until everything is well combined.
4. taste and adjust seasoning if needed, by adding more salt or pepper.
5. transfer the dip to a serving bowl and garnish with chopped fresh chives if desired.
6. refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving to allow the flavors to meld together.
7. serve with your favorite chips or fresh vegetables. enjoy your vegan french onion dip!
ingredients_list: yellow, onion, thinly, olive, clove, garlic, minced, vegan, sour, cream, vegan, mayonnaise, yeast, worcestershire, sauce, vegan, variety, onion, powder, paprika, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, chive, garnish

title: Vegan Southwestern Black Bean Salad
raw_text: 90. Vegan Southwestern Black Bean Salad: 960 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains legumes (Origin: N/A)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cans of black beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 cup of corn kernels
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 small red onion, diced
- 1 tomato, diced
- 1/4 cup of fresh cilantro, chopped
- 1 avocado, diced
- juice of 2 limes
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- 1 teaspoon of cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon of chili powder
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, combine the black beans, corn kernels, bell pepper, red onion, tomato, and cilantro. mix well.
2. in a separate small bowl, whisk together the lime juice, olive oil, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
3. pour the dressing over the bean mixture and toss until well coated.
4. gently fold in the diced avocado.
5. chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. serve chilled and enjoy!
ingredients_list: can, black, bean, corn, kernel, bell, pepper, red, onion, tomato, fresh, cilantro, avocado, lime, olive, cumin, chili, powder, salt, pepper, taste

title: Vegan Carrot Cake Energy Balls
raw_text: 92. Vegan Carrot Cake Energy Balls: 80 kcals per portion, makes 12 portions, contains nuts (Origin: N/A)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup dates, pitted
- 1 cup rolled oats
- 1/2 cup shredded carrots
- 1/2 cup walnuts, chopped
- 1/2 cup unsweetened shredded coconut
- 1/4 cup almond butter
- 1 tsp ground cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp ground ginger
- 1/4 tsp ground nutmeg
- 1/4 tsp vanilla extract
- pinch of salt
preparation:
1. in a food processor, add dates and process until they form a sticky paste.
2. add rolled oats, shredded carrots, walnuts, shredded coconut, almond butter, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, vanilla extract, and salt to the food processor.
3. process until all ingredients are well combined and a thick, doughy mixture is formed.
4. scoop about a tablespoon of the mixture and roll it between your palms to form a ball. repeat with the remaining mixture.
5. place the energy balls on a plate or baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
6. refrigerate the energy balls for at least 30 minutes to firm up.
7. once firm, store the vegan carrot cake energy balls in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to one week. enjoy as a healthy snack or dessert!

title: Vegan Mediterranean Hummus Bowl
raw_text: 93. Vegan Mediterranean Hummus Bowl: 120 kcals per portion, makes 4 portions, contains sesame (Origin: Middle East)
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 1 cup cooked quinoa
- 1 cup canned chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1 cup cucumber, diced
- 1/2 cup kalamata olives, pitted and halved
- 1/4 cup red onion, thinly sliced
- 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped
- 1/4 cup fresh mint, chopped
- 1/4 cup roasted red pepper, chopped
- juice of 1 lemon
- 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- salt and pepper to taste
- optional toppings: avocado slices, toasted pine nuts, falafel balls
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, kalamata olives, red onion, parsley, mint, and roasted red pepper.
2. in a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, minced garlic, ground cumin, salt, and pepper until well combined.
3. pour the dressing over the quinoa and vegetable mixture. toss gently to coat all the ingredients.
4. taste and adjust seasoning if needed.
5. divide the mixture into serving bowls.
6. top each bowl with optional toppings like avocado slices, toasted pine nuts, or falafel balls.
7. serve immediately and enjoy your vegan mediterranean hummus bowl!

title: Vegan Spinach and Mushroom Puff Pastry
raw_text: 94. Vegan Spinach and Mushroom Puff Pastry: 160 kcals per portion, makes 4 portions, contains wheat (Origin: N/A)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 sheet of vegan puff pastry
- 2 cups fresh spinach, chopped
- 1 cup mushrooms, sliced
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 2 tablespoons nutritional yeast
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon dried thyme
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 180°c (350°f).
2. in a medium-sized pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
3. add the diced onion and minced garlic to the pan and sauté until translucent.
4. add the sliced mushrooms to the pan and cook until they release their moisture and start to brown.
5. add the chopped spinach to the pan and cook until wilted.
6. stir in the nutritional yeast, salt, black pepper, and dried thyme. remove from heat and let the mixture cool slightly.
7. roll out the puff pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface.
8. cut the puff pastry into desired shapes, such as squares or rectangles.
9. place about 1-2 tablespoons of the spinach and mushroom mixture in the center of each pastry shape.
10. fold the pastry over the filling, forming a pocket, and press the edges together to seal.
11. place the pastry pockets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
12. bake in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown and crispy.
13. remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving.
14. enjoy your delicious vegan spinach and mushroom puff pastry!
ingredients_list: vegan, puff, pastry, fresh, spinach, mushroom, onion, clove, garlic, minced, olive, yeast, salt, black, pepper, dried, thyme

title: Vegan Thai Papaya Salad
raw_text: 95. Vegan Thai Papaya Salad: 200 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains peanuts (Origin: Thailand)
ingredients:
ingredients for vegan thai papaya salad:
- 1 green papaya
- 1 carrot
- 3-4 cherry tomatoes
- 1/4 cup green beans
- 1/4 cup crushed peanuts
- 2 fresh red chilies (adjust according to spice preference)
- 2 cloves of garlic
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons lime juice
- 1 tablespoon brown sugar
- fresh cilantro for garnish
preparation:
1. peel the green papaya and carrot, then shred them using a julienne peeler or a grater. place them in a large mixing bowl.
2. slice the cherry tomatoes in half and add to the bowl.
3. trim the ends of the green beans and cut them into bite-sized pieces. blanche them in boiling water for about 1-2 minutes, then drain and transfer to the mixing bowl.
4. in a mortar and pestle, crush the garlic and chilies to make a paste. if you don't have a mortar and pestle, finely chop them.
5. in a small bowl, combine the soy sauce, lime juice, brown sugar, and the garlic-chili paste. whisk well to dissolve the sugar.
6. pour the dressing over the shredded papaya and vegetable mixture. toss well to combine, ensuring all the ingredients are coated.
7. taste and adjust the seasonings, adding more soy sauce, lime juice, or sugar if desired.
8. transfer the salad to a serving plate and sprinkle crushed peanuts on top.
9. garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.
10. enjoy your vegan thai papaya salad as a refreshing appetizer or as a side dish to complement your main course.
ingredients_list: green, papaya, carrot, cherry, tomato, green, bean, peanut, fresh, red, chilies, spice, preference, clove, garlic, soy, sauce, lime, brown, sugar, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Vegan Mediterranean Flatbread Pizza
raw_text: 98. Vegan Mediterranean Flatbread Pizza: 320 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains wheat (Origin: Mediterranean)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pre-made vegan flatbread
- 1/2 cup marinara sauce
- 1/2 cup sliced kalamata olives
- 1/2 cup sliced cherry tomatoes
- 1/2 cup sliced red onion
- 1/2 cup sliced roasted red peppers
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
- 1/4 cup vegan feta cheese (optional)
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
2. place the pre-made vegan flatbread on a baking sheet.
3. spread the marinara sauce evenly over the flatbread, leaving a small border around the edges.
4. top the sauce with the sliced kalamata olives, cherry tomatoes, red onion, and roasted red peppers.
5. drizzle the olive oil over the toppings and season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. transfer the baking sheet to the oven and bake for approximately 12-15 minutes, or until the flatbread is crispy and the toppings are slightly browned.
7. remove from the oven and sprinkle with chopped fresh basil, parsley, and vegan feta cheese (if desired).
8. cut the flatbread into slices and serve hot. enjoy your delicious vegan mediterranean flatbread pizza!

title: Vegan Zucchini Noodles with Pesto
raw_text: 99. Vegan Zucchini Noodles with Pesto: 360 kcals per portion, makes 2 portions, contains nuts (Origin: N/A)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 medium zucchini
- 1 cup fresh basil leaves
- 1/4 cup pine nuts
- 2 cloves garlic
- 1/4 cup nutritional yeast
- juice of 1 lemon
- 1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. using a spiralizer or a vegetable peeler, cut the zucchini into thin noodle-like strips. set aside.
2. in a food processor, combine the basil leaves, pine nuts, garlic, nutritional yeast, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
3. while the food processor is running, slowly drizzle in the olive oil until a smooth pesto-like consistency is achieved.
4. in a large skillet, heat a tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. add the zucchini noodles and sauté for 2-3 minutes or until slightly softened.
5. remove the skillet from heat and stir in the pesto until the noodles are well-coated.
6. serve the vegan zucchini noodles with pesto immediately. garnish with additional basil leaves or pine nuts, if desired. enjoy!
ingredients_list: zucchini, fresh, basil, leaf, pine, nut, clove, garlic, yeast, lemon, virgin, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Vegan Japanese Mochi
raw_text:
100. Vegan Japanese Mochi: 400 kcals per portion, makes 4 portions, contains nuts (Origin: Japan)

Please note that the portion sizes and calorie counts are approximate. It's always a good idea to adjust the recipes based on your personal dietary needs and preferences. Additionally, make sure to check the labels of any store-bought ingredients for potential allergy warnings. Enjoy your snacks!
ingredients:
ingredients:

- 1 cup mochiko flour (sweet rice flour)
- 1/4 cup white sugar
- 3/4 cup water
- 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract
- cornstarch or potato starch (for dusting)
preparation:
1. in a microwave-safe bowl, combine the mochiko flour and sugar. mix well.
2. stir in the water and vanilla extract until the mixture is smooth.
3. cover the bowl loosely with plastic wrap, leaving a small vent, and microwave on high for 2 minutes.
4. remove the bowl from the microwave and stir the mixture with a wet spatula until smooth.
5. cover the bowl again and microwave for an additional 1 minute.
6. once again, remove the bowl from the microwave and stir well with a wet spatula until the mixture is smooth and shiny.
7. bring out another bowl and dust it lightly with cornstarch or potato starch.
8. transfer the mochi mixture onto the dusted bowl and allow it to cool for about 5 minutes or until it is cool enough to handle.
9. dust a clean work surface with cornstarch or potato starch.
10. transfer the mochi mixture onto the prepared surface and knead it gently until it becomes smooth and pliable.
11. divide the mochi dough into small portions and shape them as desired.
12. serve immediately or store in an airtight container at room temperature. enjoy the vegan japanese mochi!
ingredients_list: mochiko, flour, sweet, rice, flour, white, sugar, water, vanilla, extract, cornstarch, potato, starch

title: Sushi Roll
raw_text: 9. Sushi Roll: 250 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains soy and seaweed, origin: Japan
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 2 cups of sushi rice
- 4 sheets of nori seaweed
- assorted fillings (e.g. fresh fish, cucumber, avocado, carrots)
- soy sauce
- wasabi
- pickled ginger
preparation:
1. rinse the sushi rice with cold water until the water runs clear. 
2. cook the rice according to the package instructions or use a rice cooker. 
3. while the rice is cooking, prepare the fillings by cutting them into thin strips. 
4. once the rice is cooked, let it cool before using. 
5. lay a bamboo sushi mat on a clean surface and place a sheet of nori seaweed on top. 
6. wet your hands with water to prevent sticking and take a handful of sushi rice. spread it evenly on the nori, leaving a small border on top. 
7. arrange the fillings in a row across the middle of the rice. 
8. carefully roll the sushi by starting at the edge closest to you and using the mat to help create a tight roll. 
9. continue rolling until the nori is completely wrapped around the rice and fillings. 
10. dampen a sharp knife with water and slice the sushi roll into smaller pieces. 
11. repeat the process with the remaining ingredients. 
12. serve the sushi rolls with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger. enjoy!
ingredients_list: sushi, rice, sheet, nori, seaweed, assorted, filling, fresh, fish, cucumber, avocado, carrot, soy, sauce, wasabi, pickled, ginger

title: Veggie Fajitas
raw_text: 25. Veggie Fajitas: 300 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains wheat, origin: Mexico
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 green bell pepper, sliced
- 1 yellow bell pepper, sliced
- 1 onion, sliced
- 1 zucchini, sliced
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- salt and black pepper to taste
- tortillas
- optional toppings: guacamole, sour cream, salsa
preparation:
1. heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. add the sliced bell peppers and onion to the skillet. sauté for about 5 minutes until they start to soften.
3. add the sliced zucchini to the skillet and continue to cook for another 5 minutes until all the vegetables are tender-crisp.
4. in a small bowl, mix together the cumin, chili powder, paprika, salt, and black pepper. sprinkle this seasoning mixture over the vegetables in the skillet. stir well to evenly coat the vegetables.
5. continue to cook for another 2-3 minutes until the seasoning is fragrant and well incorporated.
6. warm the tortillas according to package instructions.
7. serve the vegetable fajitas on the tortillas and garnish with your desired toppings like guacamole, sour cream, and salsa.
8. roll up the tortillas and enjoy your delicious veggie fajitas!
ingredients_list: olive, red, bell, pepper, green, bell, pepper, yellow, bell, pepper, onion, zucchini, cumin, chili, powder, paprika, salt, black, pepper, taste, tortilla, topping, guacamole, sour, cream, salsa

title: Ratatouille Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms
raw_text: 26. Ratatouille Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms: 300 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains garlic, origin: France
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large portobello mushrooms
- 1 eggplant, diced
- 1 zucchini, diced
- 1 yellow squash, diced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 yellow bell pepper, diced
- 1 onion, diced
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes
- 1/4 cup fresh basil, chopped
- 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped
- 1/4 cup olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- grated parmesan cheese (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c). clean the portobello mushrooms and remove the stems.
2. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the onion and garlic and cook until softened.
3. add the diced eggplant, zucchini, yellow squash, red and yellow bell pepper to the skillet. cook for about 5-7 minutes until the vegetables start to soften.
4. stir in the can of diced tomatoes (including the juices) and season with salt and pepper. simmer for another 5 minutes.
5. remove the skillet from heat and stir in the fresh basil and parsley.
6. place the portobello mushrooms on a baking sheet. fill each mushroom cap with the ratatouille mixture.
7. bake in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, until the mushrooms are tender and the filling is heated through.
8. serve the stuffed portobello mushrooms hot, optionally sprinkled with grated parmesan cheese on top. enjoy!
ingredients_list: portobello, mushroom, eggplant, zucchini, yellow, red, bell, pepper, yellow, bell, pepper, onion, clove, garlic, minced, tomato, fresh, basil, fresh, parsley, olive, salt, pepper, taste, parmesan, cheese

title: Jamaican Rice and Peas
raw_text: 29. Jamaican Rice and Peas: 350 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains coconut, origin: Jamaica
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup of kidney beans, soaked overnight
- 1 cup of long grain rice
- 1 can (13.5 oz) of coconut milk
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 sprigs of fresh thyme
- 1 scotch bonnet pepper (optional)
- 1 teaspoon of salt
- 1 teaspoon of allspice
- 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper
- 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil
preparation:
1. drain and rinse the soaked kidney beans. place them in a large pot and add enough water to cover the beans. bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for about 1 hour or until the beans are tender. 
2. drain the cooked beans and set aside.
3. in the same pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. add the diced onion, minced garlic, and fresh thyme. cook until the onion is translucent and fragrant, about 3-4 minutes.
4. add the cooked kidney beans, coconut milk, and scotch bonnet pepper (if using) to the pot. stir in the salt, allspice, and black pepper. bring the mixture to a boil.
5. once boiling, add the long grain rice to the pot. reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and has absorbed the liquid.
6. remove the pot from the heat and let it sit covered for 5 minutes.
7. fluff the rice with a fork, remove the sprigs of thyme and scotch bonnet pepper, and serve hot.

enjoy your jamaican rice and peas!
ingredients_list: kidney, bean, soaked, long, grain, rice, coconut, milk, onion, clove, garlic, minced, sprig, fresh, thyme, scotch, bonnet, pepper, salt, allspice, black, pepper, vegetable

title: Couscous Salad
raw_text: 32. Couscous Salad: 300 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts and wheat, origin: Africa
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup couscous
- 1 cup boiling water
- 1 cucumber, diced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1/2 red onion, finely chopped
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped
- juice of 1 lemon
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a heatproof bowl, pour the boiling water over the couscous. cover the bowl with a plate or plastic wrap and let it sit for 5 minutes or until the couscous absorbs the water.
2. fluff the couscous with a fork to separate the grains.
3. in a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked couscous, cucumber, red bell pepper, red onion, cherry tomatoes, and fresh parsley.
4. in a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper. pour the dressing over the couscous mixture and toss everything together until well combined.
5. adjust the seasoning according to taste, adding more salt, pepper, or lemon juice if desired.
6. serve the couscous salad chilled or at room temperature. enjoy!
ingredients_list: couscous, boiling, water, cucumber, red, bell, pepper, red, onion, cherry, tomato, halved, fresh, parsley, lemon, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Tomato Basil Pasta
raw_text: 34. Tomato Basil Pasta: 450 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat, origin: Italy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 oz. pasta
- 2 tbsp olive oil
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 can (14 oz.) diced tomatoes, undrained
- 1/2 cup fresh basil leaves, chopped
- salt and pepper to taste
- parmesan cheese, grated (optional)
preparation:
1. cook the pasta according to package instructions. drain and set aside.
2. in a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
3. add minced garlic to the skillet and sauté for about 1 minute until fragrant.
4. pour in the diced tomatoes (including the liquid) and bring to a simmer. cook for about 5 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
5. stir in the chopped basil and season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. add the cooked pasta to the skillet and toss to coat the pasta in the tomato basil sauce.
7. allow the pasta to heat through for a minute or two.
8. serve the tomato basil pasta hot, garnished with grated parmesan cheese if desired.
9. enjoy!

title: Stuffed Zucchini
raw_text: 36. Stuffed Zucchini: 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts, origin: Mediterranean
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 medium zucchini
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1/2 onion, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 red bell pepper, chopped
- 1/2 cup cooked quinoa
- 1/2 cup black beans, rinsed and drained
- 1/2 cup corn kernels
- 1/2 teaspoon chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon cumin
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 cup shredded cheese (such as cheddar or mozzarella)
- fresh cilantro, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cut each zucchini in half lengthwise and scoop out the seeds, creating a hollow cavity.
3. place the zucchini halves on a baking sheet and set aside.
4. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
5. add the chopped onion, minced garlic, and red bell pepper to the skillet and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
6. stir in the cooked quinoa, black beans, corn kernels, chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper. cook for another 2-3 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
7. remove the skillet from the heat and let the mixture cool slightly.
8. spoon the quinoa and bean mixture into the hollowed-out zucchini halves, dividing it evenly.
9. sprinkle the shredded cheese on top of each filled zucchini half.
10. place the baking sheet with the stuffed zucchini into the preheated oven and bake for about 20-25 minutes, or until the zucchini is tender and the cheese is melted and golden brown.
11. remove the stuffed zucchini from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving.
12. garnish with fresh chopped cilantro, if desired.
13. serve the stuffed zucchini as a main dish or as a side dish alongside a salad or grilled protein. enjoy!
ingredients_list: zucchini, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, red, bell, pepper, quinoa, black, bean, corn, kernel, chili, powder, cumin, salt, pepper, taste, shredded, cheese, cheddar, mozzarella, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Mediterranean Quinoa Bowl
raw_text: 39. Mediterranean Quinoa Bowl: 200 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains nuts, origin: Mediterranean
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup quinoa
- 2 cups vegetable broth
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1 cup cucumber, diced
- 1/2 cup kalamata olives, pitted and chopped
- 1/2 cup red onion, thinly sliced
- 1/2 cup feta cheese, crumbled
- 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped
- 1/4 cup fresh mint, chopped
- 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. rinse the quinoa under cold water and drain well.
2. in a saucepan, bring the vegetable broth to a boil. add the quinoa and reduce the heat to low. cover and simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until the quinoa is cooked and the broth is absorbed.
3. remove the cooked quinoa from heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
4. in a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, kalamata olives, red onion, feta cheese, parsley, and mint.
5. in a small bowl, whisk together the extra-virgin olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
6. pour the dressing over the quinoa mixture and toss well to combine.
7. taste and adjust the seasoning if needed.
8. serve the mediterranean quinoa bowl as a main dish or side dish. enjoy!

title: Chickpea Tikka Masala
raw_text: 40. Chickpea Tikka Masala: 300 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains mustard, origin: India
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 can of chickpeas
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
- 1 teaspoon of ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon of ground coriander
- 1 teaspoon of ground turmeric
- 1 teaspoon of paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon of chili powder (adjust to taste)
- 1 cup of tomato puree
- 1 cup of coconut milk
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh cilantro for garnish
preparation:
1. in a large pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
2. add the diced onion and minced garlic to the pan and cook until they are softened and fragrant.
3. add the ground cumin, ground coriander, ground turmeric, paprika, and chili powder to the pan. stir well and cook for about 1 minute to toast the spices.
4. drain and rinse the chickpeas from the can, then add them to the pan.
5. stir in the tomato puree and coconut milk. season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until the flavors have melded together and the sauce has thickened slightly.
7. serve the chickpea tikka masala over rice or with naan bread. garnish with fresh cilantro. enjoy!
ingredients_list: chickpea, onion, clove, garlic, minced, olive, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, ground, turmeric, paprika, chili, powder, taste, tomato, puree, coconut, milk, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Roasted Vegetable Salad
raw_text: 43. Roasted Vegetable Salad: 250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts, origin: Multiple
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 red bell pepper
- 1 yellow bell pepper
- 1 zucchini
- 1 eggplant
- 1 red onion
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 4 cups of mixed salad greens
- ¼ cup of feta cheese, crumbled
- 2 tablespoons of balsamic vinegar
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. slice the red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, zucchini, eggplant, and red onion into bite-sized pieces.
3. place the sliced vegetables on a baking sheet and drizzle them with olive oil. sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste.
4. toss the vegetables until they are evenly coated with oil, salt, and pepper.
5. roast the vegetables in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes or until they are tender and slightly charred.
6. while the vegetables are roasting, prepare the salad greens by washing and drying them thoroughly.
7. once the roasted vegetables are done, let them cool for a few minutes.
8. in a large serving bowl, combine the roasted vegetables with the salad greens.
9. sprinkle crumbled feta cheese over the salad.
10. drizzle the salad with balsamic vinegar.
11. toss the salad gently to mix all the ingredients together.
12. adjust the seasoning with additional salt and pepper if needed.
13. serve the roasted vegetable salad as a side dish or main course. enjoy!
ingredients_list: red, bell, pepper, yellow, bell, pepper, zucchini, eggplant, red, onion, olive, salt, pepper, taste, salad, green, feta, cheese, balsamic, vinegar

title: Soba Noodle Stir
raw_text: 47. Soba Noodle Stir-Fry: 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat and soy, origin: Japan
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 ounces soba noodles
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 onion, thinly sliced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 cup mushrooms, sliced
- 2 cups broccoli florets
- 1 carrot, julienned
- 1 cup snap peas
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons oyster sauce
- 1 tablespoon hoisin sauce
- 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon sesame oil
- 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes (optional)
- 2 green onions, chopped
- sesame seeds, for garnish
preparation:
1. cook the soba noodles according to package instructions. drain and set aside.
2. in a large pan or wok, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
3. add the onion and garlic and cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant and slightly softened.
4. add the red bell pepper, mushrooms, broccoli, carrot, and snap peas to the pan. stir-fry for 5-6 minutes until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
5. in a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, oyster sauce, hoisin sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, and red pepper flakes (if using).
6. pour the sauce over the vegetables in the pan and stir to coat evenly.
7. add the cooked soba noodles to the pan and toss everything together until well combined.
8. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes to heat through.
9. remove from heat and sprinkle with chopped green onions and sesame seeds for garnish.
10. serve the soba noodle stir-fry hot and enjoy!

title: Greek Stuffed Peppers
raw_text: 49. Greek Stuffed Peppers: 200 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts, origin: Greece
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large bell peppers
- 1 cup cooked quinoa
- 1 cup canned chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 1/2 cup diced cucumber
- 1/2 cup diced tomatoes
- 1/4 cup chopped kalamata olives
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cut off the tops of the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes. set aside.
3. in a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, chickpeas, feta cheese, cucumber, tomatoes, olives, parsley, lemon juice, olive oil, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. stir well to combine all the ingredients.
4. stuff each bell pepper with the quinoa mixture until they are completely filled.
5. place the stuffed peppers on a baking dish and cover with aluminum foil.
6. bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the peppers are tender and the filling is heated through.
7. remove the foil and bake for an additional 5 minutes, or until the tops of the peppers are slightly browned.
8. remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.
9. serve the greek stuffed peppers as a main dish or as a side dish with a salad. enjoy!
