title: Quinoa Chili
raw_text: 52. Quinoa Chili: 350 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains soy, origin: United States
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup quinoa
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 onion, diced
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 jalapeno pepper, diced (optional for spiciness)
- 1 can diced tomatoes
- 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
- 1 can kidney beans, drained and rinsed
- 2 tablespoons tomato paste
- 2 tablespoons chili powder
- 1 tablespoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1 teaspoon oregano
- salt and pepper to taste
- optional toppings: shredded cheese, sour cream, cilantro
preparation:
1. rinse the quinoa under cold water to remove any bitter coating.
2. heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. add onion, garlic, bell pepper, and jalapeno pepper (if using). cook until the vegetables are soft and fragrant.
3. add the diced tomatoes, black beans, kidney beans, tomato paste, chili powder, cumin, paprika, oregano, salt, and pepper. stir well to combine all the ingredients.
4. add the rinsed quinoa to the pot and stir to mix it with the other ingredients.
5. pour in 2 cups of water and bring the mixture to a boil. reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the quinoa is cooked and the chili has thickened.
6. taste and adjust the seasonings if needed.
7. serve the quinoa chili hot with your favorite toppings, such as shredded cheese, sour cream, and cilantro, if desired. enjoy!
ingredients_list: quinoa, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, bell, pepper, jalapeno, pepper, spiciness, tomato, black, bean, kidney, bean, tomato, paste, chili, powder, cumin, paprika, oregano, salt, pepper, taste, topping, shredded, cheese, sour, cream, cilantro

title: Ratatouille Tart
raw_text: 54. Ratatouille Tart: 450 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains wheat, origin: France
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 sheet of puff pastry
- 1 medium-sized eggplant
- 1 medium-sized zucchini
- 1 medium-sized yellow squash
- 1 red bell pepper
- 1 yellow bell pepper
- 1 onion
- 3 cloves of garlic
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- fresh basil leaves, for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. roll out the puff pastry sheet and place it on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. prick the pastry with a fork to prevent it from puffing up too much during baking.
3. bake the pastry in the preheated oven for about 10 minutes, or until it turns golden brown. remove from the oven and set aside.
4. meanwhile, prepare the vegetables. slice the eggplant, zucchini, yellow squash, red bell pepper, and yellow bell pepper into thin rounds. thinly slice the onion and mince the garlic.
5. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. add the sliced onion and minced garlic, and sauté until they become translucent and fragrant.
6. add the sliced eggplant, zucchini, yellow squash, red bell pepper, and yellow bell pepper to the skillet. stir in the dried thyme, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. cook for about 10 minutes, or until the vegetables are slightly softened.
7. remove the skillet from the heat and let the vegetable mixture cool slightly.
8. spread the cooked vegetable mixture evenly over the pre-baked puff pastry.
9. sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese over the vegetables.
10. return the tart to the preheated oven and bake for another 15-20 minutes, or until the cheese melts and turns golden brown.
11. once baked, remove the tart from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
12. garnish with fresh basil leaves before serving.
13. cut into slices and enjoy your delicious ratatouille tart!
ingredients_list: puff, pastry, eggplant, zucchini, yellow, red, bell, pepper, yellow, bell, pepper, onion, clove, garlic, olive, dried, thyme, dried, oregano, salt, pepper, taste, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, fresh, basil, leaf, garnish

title: Teriyaki Tofu Bowl
raw_text: 57. Teriyaki Tofu Bowl: 300 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains soy, origin: Japan
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 block of firm tofu
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons maple syrup
- 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon minced ginger
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 cup cooked rice
- 1 cup sliced bell peppers
- 1 cup sliced carrots
- 1 cup broccoli florets
- 2 green onions, sliced
- sesame seeds, for garnish
- vegetable oil, for cooking
preparation:
1. press tofu: place the tofu on a plate lined with paper towels. put another layer of paper towels on top and weigh it down with a heavy object, like a book or a pan. let it sit for 20-30 minutes to remove excess moisture.
2. mix teriyaki sauce: in a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, maple syrup, rice vinegar, minced ginger, and minced garlic. set aside.
3. cut tofu: once pressed, cut the tofu into bite-sized cubes.
4. cook tofu: heat vegetable oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. add the tofu cubes and cook until they turn golden brown on all sides, about 8-10 minutes. pour the teriyaki sauce over the tofu and toss to coat evenly. cook for another 2-3 minutes until the sauce thickens. remove tofu from the skillet and set aside.
5. stir-fry vegetables: in the same skillet, add a little more oil and stir-fry the bell peppers, carrots, and broccoli over medium-high heat until they are slightly tender but still crisp, about 4-5 minutes.
6. assemble the bowl: divide cooked rice among serving bowls. top with the stir-fried vegetables and teriyaki tofu. garnish with sliced green onions and sesame seeds.
7. serve: serve the teriyaki tofu bowl immediately and enjoy!
ingredients_list: tofu, soy, sauce, maple, syrup, rice, vinegar, minced, ginger, clove, garlic, minced, rice, bell, pepper, carrot, broccoli, floret, green, onion, sesame, seed, garnish, vegetable

title: Chickpea Buddha Bowl
raw_text: 58. Chickpea Buddha Bowl: 250 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains nuts and soy, origin: Multiple
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup cooked quinoa
- 1 can chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved

preparation:

2. in a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, olive oil, minced garlic, cumin, salt, and pepper.
3. pour the dressing over the quinoa mixture and toss to coat evenly.
4. serve the chickpea buddha bowl immediately and enjoy!
ingredients_list: quinoa, chickpea, cherry, tomato, halved, cucumber, shredded, carrot, avocado, red, onion, thinly, fresh, parsley, lemon, olive, clove, garlic, minced, cumin, salt, pepper, taste

title: Roasted Brussels Sprouts and Quinoa Salad
raw_text: 64. Roasted Brussels Sprouts and Quinoa Salad: 450 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts, origin: Multiple
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved
- 1 cup cooked quinoa
- 1/4 cup dried cranberries
- 1/4 cup chopped walnuts
- 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar
- 2 teaspoons honey
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. place the brussels sprouts on a baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil. season with salt and pepper, then toss to coat.
3. roast the brussels sprouts in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until they are tender and lightly browned. stir occasionally to ensure even cooking.
4. in a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, dried cranberries, chopped walnuts, and crumbled feta cheese.
5. in a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, honey, salt, and pepper to make the dressing.
6. pour the dressing over the quinoa mixture and toss to combine.
7. once the brussels sprouts are roasted, let them cool slightly, then add them to the quinoa salad. gently toss to incorporate.
8. serve the roasted brussels sprouts and quinoa salad warm or at room temperature. enjoy!
ingredients_list: brussels, sprout, halved, quinoa, dried, cranberry, walnut, feta, cheese, olive, balsamic, vinegar, honey, salt, pepper, taste

title: Lentil Biryani
raw_text: 65. Lentil Biryani: 400 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains mustard, origin: India
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup lentils
- 2 cups basmati rice
- 1 large onion, thinly sliced
- 2 tomatoes, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1-inch piece of ginger, grated
- 1 cinnamon stick
- 2 cardamom pods
- 1 teaspoon cumin seeds
- 1 teaspoon coriander powder
- 1 teaspoon turmeric powder
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon garam masala
- 2 cups vegetable broth
- 2 tablespoons ghee or vegetable oil
- salt, to taste
- fresh cilantro, for garnish
preparation:
1. rinse the lentils under running water and soak them in water for about 30 minutes. drain and set aside.
2. rinse the basmati rice until the water runs clear. soak the rice in water for about 30 minutes. drain and set aside.
3. heat a large pot over medium heat and add the ghee or vegetable oil.
4. add the sliced onions to the pot and sauté until they turn golden brown and crispy.
5. add the minced garlic, grated ginger, cinnamon stick, cardamom pods, and cumin seeds to the pot. sauté for a couple of minutes until fragrant.
6. add the diced tomatoes and cook until they soften.
7. add the drained lentils to the pot and stir them well with the other ingredients.
8. add the coriander powder, turmeric powder, chili powder, and salt to taste. stir everything together.
9. add the vegetable broth to the pot and bring it to a boil.
10. once the broth is boiling, add the soaked and drained basmati rice to the pot. stir everything together gently.
11. reduce the heat to low, cover the pot with a tightly-fitting lid, and let the biryani cook for about 20 minutes or until the rice and lentils are cooked through.
12. once the biryani is cooked, remove the pot from the heat and let it sit covered for about 5 minutes.
13. fluff the rice gently with a fork and garnish with fresh cilantro.
14. serve the lentil biryani hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: lentil, basmati, rice, onion, thinly, tomato, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, cinnamon, cardamom, pod, cumin, seed, coriander, powder, turmeric, powder, chili, powder, garam, masala, vegetable, broth, ghee, vegetable, salt, taste, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Vegan Ravioli
raw_text: 66. Vegan Ravioli: 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat, origin: Italy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup water
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 cup vegan ricotta cheese
- 1 cup chopped spinach
- 1/4 cup nutritional yeast
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/2 teaspoon onion powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- marinara sauce for serving
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour and salt.
2. gradually add the water and olive oil to the flour mixture while stirring with a fork or your hands.
3. once the dough starts to come together, transfer it to a floured surface and knead for about 5 minutes until smooth and elastic. if the dough is too sticky, add a little more flour; if it's too dry, add a little more water.
4. cover the dough with a clean towel and let it rest for 20 minutes.
5. in the meantime, prepare the filling by mixing together the vegan ricotta cheese, chopped spinach, nutritional yeast, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
6. after the dough has rested, divide it into two equal portions.
7. roll out one portion of the dough on a floured surface to about 1/8 inch thickness.
8. spoon small dollops of the filling onto the rolled-out dough, leaving enough space between each dollop to later cut out individual ravioli.
9. roll out the second portion of dough and carefully place it on top of the filling-covered dough.
10. press the dough around each dollop of filling to seal the ravioli. use a ravioli cutter or a knife to cut out individual ravioli.
11. repeat the process with the remaining dough and filling.
12. bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. carefully drop the ravioli into the boiling water and cook for about 3-4 minutes or until they float to the surface.
13. remove the cooked ravioli from the water using a slotted spoon and serve with marinara sauce.
14. optional: garnish with fresh basil or vegan parmesan cheese. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, salt, water, olive, vegan, ricotta, cheese, spinach, yeast, garlic, powder, onion, powder, salt, pepper, taste, marinara, sauce

title: Veggie Korma
raw_text: 67. Veggie Korma: 300 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains mustard and nuts, origin: India
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon ginger, grated
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional, for heat)
- 2 carrots, diced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 zucchini, diced
- 1 cup cauliflower florets
- 1 cup broccoli florets
- 1 cup canned chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1 cup coconut milk
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- salt and pepper, to taste
- fresh cilantro, for garnish
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
2. add the chopped onion and sauté until translucent.
3. add the minced garlic and grated ginger, cooking for an additional minute.
4. stir in the ground cumin, ground coriander, ground turmeric, and cayenne pepper (if using), and cook for a minute to toast the spices.
5. add the diced carrots, bell pepper, zucchini, cauliflower, and broccoli to the skillet, and stir to combine.
6. pour in the coconut milk and vegetable broth, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low. cover and let cook for about 15-20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
8. stir in the chickpeas and cook for another 5 minutes to warm through.
9. taste and adjust the seasoning if needed.
10. serve the veggie korma over steamed rice or with naan bread, garnished with fresh cilantro. enjoy!
ingredients_list: vegetable, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, ground, turmeric, cayenne, pepper, carrot, bell, pepper, zucchini, cauliflower, floret, broccoli, floret, canned, chickpea, coconut, milk, vegetable, broth, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Vegan Soba Noodle Salad
raw_text: 71. Vegan Soba Noodle Salad: 250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains soy, origin: Japan
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 ounces soba noodles
- ¼ cup soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon sesame oil
- 1 tablespoon maple syrup
- 1 teaspoon grated ginger
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1 cup shredded carrots
- 1 cup thinly sliced cucumber
- ¼ cup chopped green onions
- ¼ cup cilantro leaves
- 2 tablespoons sesame seeds
preparation:
1. cook the soba noodles according to package instructions. drain and rinse under cold water to cool them down.
2. in a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, maple syrup, grated ginger, and minced garlic to make the dressing.
3. in a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked soba noodles, shredded carrots, sliced cucumber, chopped green onions, and cilantro leaves.
4. pour the dressing over the noodle mixture and toss well to coat everything evenly.
5. sprinkle sesame seeds over the salad, and give it a final toss.
6. let the salad sit for about 10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
7. serve chilled and enjoy!
cuisine: Vegan Soba Noodle Salad is of Japanese cuisine.
ingredients_list: ounce, soba, noodle, soy, sauce, rice, vinegar, sesame, maple, syrup, ginger, clove, garlic, minced, shredded, carrot, thinly, cucumber, green, onion, cilantro, leaf, sesame, seed

title: Vegan Pastrami Reuben Sandwich
raw_text: 73. Vegan Pastrami Reuben Sandwich: 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat, origin: United States
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 slices of vegan pastrami
- 4 slices of vegan rye bread
- 4 slices of vegan swiss cheese
- 1/2 cup of vegan sauerkraut
- 1/4 cup of vegan russian dressing
- vegan butter or margarine for spreading
preparation:
1. preheat a skillet or griddle over medium heat.
2. butter one side of each slice of bread.
3. place 4 slices of bread, buttered side down, on the skillet.
4. layer each slice of bread with a slice of swiss cheese, 2 slices of vegan pastrami, and 2 tablespoons of sauerkraut. 
5. spread 1 tablespoon of russian dressing on the remaining 4 slices of bread and place them on top of the sauerkraut, dressing side down.
6. press the sandwiches down lightly with a spatula and cook for about 3-4 minutes, until the bread is toasted and the cheese is melted.
7. carefully flip the sandwiches over and cook for another 3-4 minutes until the other side is golden brown.
8. remove the sandwiches from the skillet and let them cool for a minute or two before cutting them in half.
9. serve the vegan pastrami reuben sandwiches warm and enjoy!
ingredients_list: vegan, pastrami, vegan, rye, bread, vegan, swiss, cheese, vegan, sauerkraut, vegan, russian, vegan, butter, margarine, spreading

title: Summer Rolls
raw_text: 74. Summer Rolls: 450 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains soy, origin: Vietnam
ingredients:
ingredients:
- rice paper wrappers
- rice noodles
- shredded carrots
- sliced cucumber
- fresh mint leaves
- fresh basil leaves
- cooked shrimp
- bean sprouts
- lettuce leaves
- peanut dipping sauce
preparation:
1. cook rice noodles according to package instructions. drain and set aside.
2. fill a shallow pan or dish with warm water. dip one rice paper wrapper into the water and let it soften for about 10-15 seconds.
3. carefully remove the rice paper from the water and place it on a clean, damp surface.
4. arrange a small amount of rice noodles, shredded carrots, cucumber slices, mint leaves, basil leaves, cooked shrimp, bean sprouts, and lettuce leaves on the lower third of the rice paper.
5. fold the sides of the rice paper over the filling, then tightly roll the wrapper from the bottom, tucking in the filling as you go.
6. repeat these steps with the remaining ingredients.
7. serve the summer rolls with peanut dipping sauce on the side.
8. enjoy your refreshing and delicious summer rolls!
ingredients_list: rice, wrapper, rice, noodle, shredded, carrot, cucumber, fresh, mint, leaf, fresh, basil, leaf, shrimp, bean, sprout, lettuce, leaf, peanut, dipping, sauce

title: Vegan General Tso's Tofu
raw_text: 77. Vegan General Tso's Tofu: 300 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains soy, origin: China
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 block of firm tofu
- 1/4 cup cornstarch
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 4 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 teaspoons grated ginger
- 1/3 cup soy sauce
- 1/4 cup rice vinegar
- 3 tablespoons maple syrup
- 1 tablespoon tomato paste
- 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes (optional)
- 1/4 cup water
- green onions, thinly sliced (for garnish)
- sesame seeds (for garnish)
preparation:
1. press the tofu to remove excess water, either by using a tofu press or wrapping it in a clean kitchen towel and placing a heavy object on top for about 30 minutes. cut the tofu into bite-sized cubes.
2. in a bowl, toss the tofu with cornstarch until all pieces are evenly coated.
3. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. add the tofu cubes and cook until they are golden brown and crispy on all sides. remove the tofu from the skillet and set aside.
4. in the same skillet, add the minced garlic and grated ginger. sauté for a minute until fragrant.
5. in a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, maple syrup, tomato paste, red pepper flakes (if using), and water. add this sauce mixture to the skillet with garlic and ginger.
6. cook the sauce over medium heat until it thickens slightly, stirring occasionally.
7. add the tofu back into the skillet and toss gently to coat each piece with the sauce. cook for an additional 1-2 minutes until the tofu is heated through.
8. remove from heat and garnish with sliced green onions and sesame seeds.
9. serve the vegan general tso's tofu over steamed rice or noodles. enjoy!
ingredients_list: tofu, cornstarch, vegetable, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, soy, sauce, rice, vinegar, maple, syrup, tomato, paste, red, pepper, flake, water, green, onion, thinly, garnish, sesame, seed, garnish

title: Vegan Fettuccine Alfredo
raw_text: 81. Vegan Fettuccine Alfredo: 250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat, origin: Italy
ingredients:
here's a recipe for vegan fettuccine alfredo:

ingredients:
- 8 ounces fettuccine noodles
- 1 cup cashews, soaked in water for 4-6 hours
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- ¼ cup nutritional yeast
- 3 tablespoons lemon juice
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon salt
- ½ teaspoon black pepper
- fresh parsley, chopped, for garnish
preparation:
1. cook the fettuccine noodles according to the package instructions. drain and set aside.
2. drain and rinse the soaked cashews.
3. in a blender, combine the soaked cashews, vegetable broth, nutritional yeast, lemon juice, minced garlic, olive oil, salt, and black pepper. blend until smooth and creamy.
4. in a large pan, heat the creamy sauce over medium heat, stirring constantly, until heated through.
5. add the cooked fettuccine noodles to the pan with the sauce. toss well to coat the noodles evenly.
6. cook for an additional 1-2 minutes until the noodles are warmed.
7. serve the vegan fettuccine alfredo garnished with fresh parsley.
8. enjoy!

note: you can also add sautéed mushrooms, roasted cherry tomatoes, or steamed vegetables to the dish for added flavor and variety.
meal_type: the meal type of the recipe is "vegan".
ingredients_list: vegan, fettuccine, alfredo, ounce, fettuccine, noodle, cashew, soaked, water, hour, vegetable, broth, yeast, lemon, clove, garlic, minced, olive, salt, black, pepper, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Quinoa Stuffed Bell Peppers with Cashew Cream
raw_text: 82. Quinoa Stuffed Bell Peppers with Cashew Cream: 300 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts, origin: Multiple
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 bell peppers
- 1 cup quinoa
- 2 cups vegetable broth
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 cup mushrooms, sliced
- 1/2 cup frozen corn
- 1/2 cup black beans
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped

for the cashew cream:
- 1 cup raw cashews, soaked in water for at least 2 hours
- 1/4 cup water
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- salt, to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c). 
2. cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes. set aside. 
3. rinse quinoa under cold water in a fine-mesh sieve. 
4. in a medium saucepan, bring vegetable broth to a boil. add the quinoa, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 15 minutes or until all the liquid is absorbed. 
5. in a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. add the diced onion and minced garlic, sauté until onions are soft and translucent, about 3-4 minutes. 
6. add the sliced mushrooms, frozen corn, and black beans to the skillet. cook until mushrooms are tender, about 5 minutes. 
7. stir in the cooked quinoa, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. cook for another 2 minutes to let the flavors meld. 
8. remove the skillet from heat and stir in the fresh cilantro. 
9. stuff each bell pepper with the quinoa mixture and place them in a baking dish. 
10. bake the stuffed bell peppers for 30-35 minutes or until the peppers are tender and the filling is heated through. 
11. while the peppers are baking, prepare the cashew cream. drain the soaked cashews and transfer them into a blender or food processor. add water, lemon juice, and salt. blend until smooth and creamy. 
12. once the stuffed bell peppers are done, remove them from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes. 
13. serve the stuffed peppers drizzled with cashew cream on top. enjoy!
ingredients_list: bell, pepper, quinoa, vegetable, broth, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, mushroom, frozen, corn, black, bean, cumin, paprika, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, cilantro, cashew, cream, raw, cashew, soaked, water, hour, water, lemon, salt, taste

title: Vegan Tamales
raw_text: 83. Vegan Tamales: 400 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains wheat, origin: Mexico
ingredients:
ingredients for vegan tamales:
- 2 cups masa harina (corn flour)
- 1 ½ cups vegetable broth
- ½ cup vegetable shortening
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 ½ cups cooked black beans
- 1 cup corn kernels
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced
- 1 tablespoon chili powder
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- salt and pepper to taste
- corn husks, soaked in warm water for 30 minutes
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the masa harina, vegetable broth, vegetable shortening, baking powder, and salt. stir until well combined and a soft dough forms. set aside.

2. in a separate mixing bowl, combine the black beans, corn kernels, red bell pepper, jalapeno pepper, chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper. stir until well combined.

3. drain the corn husks and pat them dry. take one corn husk and spread about ¼ cup of the masa dough onto the center of the husk, leaving a border around the edges.

4. spoon about 2 tablespoons of the black bean and vegetable mixture onto the center of the masa dough.

5. fold the sides of the corn husk towards the center, enclosing the filling, and fold the bottom of the husk up. secure the tamale by tying it with a piece of kitchen twine or a strip of soaked corn husk.

6. repeat the process with the remaining corn husks, masa dough, and filling.

7. place a steamer basket in a large pot and add enough water to reach just below the basket. arrange the tamales vertically in the steamer basket, keeping them upright.

8. cover the pot and steam the tamales over medium heat for about 1 to 1 ½ hours, or until the masa dough is cooked through and the tamales easily come out of the husks.

9. carefully remove the tamales from the steamer basket and let them cool slightly before serving. serve warm and enjoy your delicious vegan tamales!
ingredients_list: masa, harina, corn, flour, vegetable, broth, vegetable, baking, powder, salt, black, bean, corn, kernel, red, bell, pepper, jalapeno, pepper, seeded, minced, chili, powder, ground, cumin, salt, pepper, taste, corn, husk, soaked, water, minute

title: Roasted Vegetable Wrap
raw_text: 84. Roasted Vegetable Wrap: 450 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts, origin: Multiple
ingredients:
ingredients for roasted vegetable wrap:
- 1 zucchini
- 1 yellow bell pepper
- 1 red onion
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 large whole wheat tortillas
- 1 cup hummus
- 1 cup mixed greens
- ½ cup crumbled feta cheese (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
2. slice the zucchini, yellow bell pepper, and red onion into thin strips.
3. place the sliced vegetables and cherry tomatoes on a baking sheet.
4. drizzle with olive oil, and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
5. toss the vegetables to coat them evenly with the oil and seasonings.
6. roast the vegetables in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly browned.
7. remove the vegetables from the oven and let them cool slightly.
8. spread ¼ cup of hummus on each tortilla, leaving a border around the edges.
9. layer the roasted vegetables, mixed greens, and crumbled feta cheese (if using) on top of the hummus.
10. roll up the tortillas tightly, tucking in the sides as you go.
11. slice the wraps in half diagonally and serve.

enjoy your delicious roasted vegetable wrap!
ingredients_list: zucchini, yellow, bell, pepper, red, onion, cherry, tomato, olive, salt, pepper, taste, whole, wheat, tortilla, hummus, green, feta, cheese

title: Vegan Sausage and Peppers
raw_text: 85. Vegan Sausage and Peppers: 400 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains wheat, origin: Multiple
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 vegan sausages
- 1 green bell pepper, sliced
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 yellow onion, sliced
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon dried basil
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- salt and pepper, to taste
- optional toppings: fresh parsley, vegan cheese
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. add the vegan sausages to the skillet and cook them according to the package instructions until they are browned and cooked through. remove the sausages from the skillet and set them aside.
3. in the same skillet, add the sliced peppers and onions. cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they start to soften.
4. add the minced garlic, dried oregano, dried basil, paprika, salt, and pepper to the skillet, and cook for another 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
5. slice the cooked vegan sausages into bite-sized pieces and return them to the skillet with the peppers and onions. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes to reheat the sausages and allow the flavors to meld together.
6. remove from heat and serve the sausage and peppers mixture on a plate or in a bun. optional: top with fresh parsley and sprinkle with vegan cheese if desired.
7. enjoy your delicious vegan sausage and peppers!
ingredients_list: vegan, sausage, green, bell, pepper, red, bell, pepper, yellow, onion, clove, garlic, minced, olive, dried, oregano, dried, basil, paprika, salt, pepper, taste, topping, fresh, parsley, vegan, cheese

title: Vegan Bao Buns
raw_text: 87. Vegan Bao Buns: 300 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains wheat and soy, origin: China
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 ½ tsp active dry yeast
- 1 tbsp sugar
- ½ cup warm water
- 1 tbsp vegetable oil
- 1 tsp salt

for the filling:
- 1 cup mushrooms, finely chopped
- 1 cup firm tofu, crumbled
- 1 tbsp soy sauce
- 1 tbsp hoisin sauce
- 1 tbsp sesame oil
- 1 tsp sugar
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 tsp ginger, minced
- 2 green onions, chopped

for the garnish:
- fresh cilantro
- sliced cucumbers
- sriracha sauce
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, dissolve the sugar in warm water. add the yeast and let it activate for about 5 minutes until frothy.

2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the flour and salt. make a well in the center and pour in the yeast mixture and vegetable oil. mix until a dough starts to form.

3. transfer the dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead for about 5-7 minutes until smooth and elastic. place the dough in a greased bowl, cover with a damp cloth, and let it rise in a warm area for about 1 hour or until doubled in size.

4. in the meantime, prepare the filling. in a pan, heat the sesame oil and sauté the garlic and ginger for a minute. add mushrooms, tofu, soy sauce, hoisin sauce, and sugar. cook for about 5 minutes until the mushrooms release their water and the mixture becomes slightly dry. stir in the chopped green onions, then remove from heat and set aside.

5. once the dough has risen, punch it down to release any air bubbles. divide the dough into 8 equal parts. roll each part into a small circle about ¼-inch thick.

6. place a spoonful of the filling in the center of each dough circle. gather the edges to seal and twist the top to create a bao bun shape. repeat for all the buns.

7. arrange the buns on a steamer lined with parchment paper. leave space between each bun for them to expand during steaming. cover the steamer with a lid and let the buns rise for 10-15 minutes.

8. fill a large pot or wok with water and bring it to a boil. place the steamer over the boiling water and steam the buns for about 15-20 minutes or until they become fluffy and cooked through.

9. once cooked, remove the buns from the steamer and let them cool slightly. garnish with fresh cilantro, sliced cucumbers, and a drizzle of sriracha sauce.

10. serve the vegan bao buns warm and enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, yeast, sugar, water, vegetable, salt, filling, mushroom, tofu, soy, sauce, hoisin, sauce, sesame, sugar, garlic, clove, minced, ginger, minced, green, onion, garnish, fresh, cilantro, cucumber, sriracha, sauce

title: Mushroom Risotto Stuffed Peppers
raw_text: 92. Mushroom Risotto Stuffed Peppers: 350 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains wheat, origin: Italy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large bell peppers, any color
- 1 cup arborio rice
- 2 cups vegetable broth
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 medium onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 8 ounces mushrooms, sliced
- 1/4 cup dry white wine (optional)
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- salt and pepper, to taste
- fresh parsley, for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove their membranes and seeds. set aside.
3. in a medium-sized pot, bring the vegetable broth to a simmer. keep it simmering on low heat while you prepare the risotto.
4. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the chopped onion and garlic, and sauté until they become translucent and fragrant.
5. add the sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook until they have released their liquid and become browned. this should take about 8-10 minutes.
6. add the arborio rice to the skillet and stir to coat it with the oil. cook for about 2-3 minutes to lightly toast the rice.
7. if using, pour in the white wine and cook until it has evaporated.
8. begin adding the simmering vegetable broth to the rice, one ladleful at a time. stir continuously and allow the rice to absorb the liquid before adding more. continue this process until all the broth has been added and absorbed, and the rice is creamy and cooked al dente. this usually takes about 20-25 minutes.
9. stir in the grated parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper to taste.
10. stuff the cooked risotto into the prepared bell peppers, evenly distributing it among them.
11. place the stuffed peppers on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the peppers are soft and lightly browned.
12. remove the stuffed peppers from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes. garnish with fresh parsley before serving.
13. enjoy your mushroom risotto stuffed peppers!
ingredients_list: bell, pepper, color, arborio, rice, vegetable, broth, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ounce, mushroom, white, wine, parmesan, cheese, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Chickpea Tacos
raw_text: 94. Chickpea Tacos: 450 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains wheat, origin: Multiple
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 can of chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- 8 small tortillas
- toppings of your choice: salsa, avocado, lettuce, tomatoes, sour cream
preparation:
1. heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
2. add the drained chickpeas to the skillet and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3. in a small bowl, mix together cumin, chili powder, smoked paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
4. sprinkle the spice mixture over the chickpeas in the skillet and stir to coat evenly. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes to let the flavors meld.
5. warm the tortillas in a separate skillet or microwave according to package instructions.
6. fill each tortilla with a scoop of the spiced chickpeas.
7. top with your favorite toppings such as salsa, avocado, lettuce, tomatoes, and sour cream.
8. serve the chickpea tacos warm and enjoy!
ingredients_list: chickpea, olive, ground, cumin, chili, powder, smoked, paprika, garlic, powder, salt, pepper, taste, tortilla, topping, salsa, avocado, lettuce, tomato, sour, cream

title: Quinoa Stuffed Tomatoes
raw_text: 96. Quinoa Stuffed Tomatoes: 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts, origin: Multiple
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large tomatoes
- 1 cup cooked quinoa
- 1/2 cup diced onion
- 1/2 cup diced bell pepper
- 1/2 cup corn kernels
- 1/2 cup black beans, rinsed and drained
- 1/2 cup chopped fresh herbs (such as parsley, basil, or cilantro)
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cut off the tops of the tomatoes and scoop out the seeds and pulp using a spoon. set the hollowed tomatoes aside.
3. in a large mixing bowl, combine cooked quinoa, diced onion, diced bell pepper, corn kernels, black beans, chopped herbs, parmesan cheese, olive oil, salt, and pepper. mix well to combine all the ingredients.
4. stuff each hollowed tomato with the quinoa mixture until they are full.
5. place the stuffed tomatoes on a baking dish or tray and drizzle with a little olive oil.
6. bake the tomatoes in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the tomatoes are tender and the filling is heated through.
7. remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.
8. serve the quinoa stuffed tomatoes as a delicious and healthy side dish or a light meal on its own. enjoy!

title: Vegan Moroccan Tagine
raw_text: 97. Vegan Moroccan Tagine: 300 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains nuts, origin: Morocco
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 onion, chopped
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon coriander
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1 teaspoon turmeric
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- 1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes
- 1 can (14 oz) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1 cup diced carrots
- 1 cup diced zucchini
- 1 cup diced eggplant
- 1 cup diced bell peppers
- 1 cup diced potatoes

- cooked couscous or rice for serving
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a large pot or tagine over medium heat.
2. add the chopped onion and minced garlic, and sauté until softened and fragrant.
3. stir in the cumin, coriander, paprika, turmeric, and cinnamon, and cook for another minute to release their flavors.
4. pour in the vegetable broth and diced tomatoes with their liquid. stir to combine.
5. add the drained and rinsed chickpeas, diced carrots, zucchini, eggplant, bell peppers, and potatoes. mix well.
6. season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the pot or tagine. let it simmer for about 30-40 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
8. once cooked, taste and adjust the seasoning if needed.
9. serve the vegan moroccan tagine over cooked couscous or rice.
10. garnish with fresh cilantro leaves and enjoy.
