title: Lentil and Vegetable Bolognese
raw_text: 99. Lentil and Vegetable Bolognese: 200 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains wheat, origin: Multiple
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 1 cup lentils
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 carrot, diced
- 1 zucchini, diced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 can (14 ounces) crushed tomatoes
- 1 can (6 ounces) tomato paste
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- salt and pepper, to taste
- cooked pasta, for serving
- grated parmesan cheese, for serving (optional)
preparation:
1. rinse the lentils thoroughly and cook them according to the package instructions until they are tender. drain and set aside.
2. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the diced onion and minced garlic, and cook until they are softened and fragrant.
3. add the diced carrot, zucchini, and red bell pepper to the skillet. cook for about 5 minutes, or until the vegetables have slightly softened.
4. stir in the crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, dried oregano, and dried basil. season with salt and pepper to taste. bring the mixture to a simmer and let it cook for about 10 minutes.
5. add the cooked lentils to the skillet and stir them into the vegetable mixture. let the bolognese sauce simmer for an additional 5 minutes to allow the flavors to blend together.
6. serve the lentil and vegetable bolognese sauce over cooked pasta. if desired, top with grated parmesan cheese. enjoy!
ingredients_list: lentil, olive, onion, garlic, clove, minced, carrot, zucchini, red, bell, pepper, ounce, tomato, ounce, tomato, paste, dried, oregano, dried, basil, salt, pepper, taste, pasta, parmesan, cheese

title: Vegan Kimchi Fried Rice
raw_text: 33. Vegan Kimchi Fried Rice: 400kcals per portion, serves 4, contains gluten, soy (Korea)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups cooked rice
- 1 cup vegan kimchi, chopped
- 1/2 cup frozen peas
- 1/2 cup carrots, diced
- 1/2 cup bell peppers, diced
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon sesame oil
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 green onion, chopped
- sesame seeds for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
2. add minced garlic and sauté for about 1 minute until fragrant.
3. add diced carrots and bell peppers to the skillet and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until slightly softened.
4. add frozen peas and chopped vegan kimchi to the skillet and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes until heated through.
5. push the veggies to one side of the skillet and add cooked rice to the other side. break up any clumps of rice with a spatula.
6. drizzle soy sauce and sesame oil over the rice and stir-fry everything together for 3-4 minutes until the flavors are well combined.
7. taste and adjust seasoning if needed.
8. remove from heat and garnish with chopped green onions and sesame seeds if desired.
9. serve hot and enjoy your vegan kimchi fried rice!
ingredients_list: rice, vegan, kimchi, frozen, pea, carrot, bell, pepper, clove, garlic, minced, soy, sauce, sesame, vegetable, green, onion, sesame, seed, garnish

title: Vegan Ratatouille Stuffed Portobello Mushroom
raw_text: 39. Vegan Ratatouille Stuffed Portobello Mushroom: 200kcals per portion, serves 2, gluten-free, contains nuts (France)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 portobello mushroom caps
- 1 small eggplant, diced
- 1 zucchini, diced
- 1 yellow bell pepper, diced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 onion, diced
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 4 tablespoons olive oil, divided
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c). 
2. remove the stems from the portobello mushroom caps and gently scrape out the gills with a spoon. set aside.
3. heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. add the diced eggplant, zucchini, bell peppers, onion, and minced garlic. sauté for about 5-7 minutes until the vegetables are slightly softened.
4. add the dried basil, dried oregano, salt, and pepper to the skillet. stir well to coat the vegetables with the spices. cook for another 2-3 minutes until the flavors meld together.
5. in a separate grill pan or skillet, heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. place the portobello mushroom caps in the pan and cook for about 3-4 minutes on each side until they become slightly tender.
6. once the mushroom caps are cooked, transfer them to a baking dish with the underside facing up.
7. spoon the sautéed vegetable mixture into each mushroom cap, filling them generously.
8. bake the stuffed mushrooms in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes or until the mushrooms are cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
9. remove from the oven and let cool slightly before serving. enjoy the vegan ratatouille stuffed portobello mushrooms as a delicious main course or as a side dish.
cuisine: Vegan Ratatouille Stuffed Portobello Mushroom has "French" cuisine.
ingredients_list: portobello, mushroom, cap, eggplant, zucchini, yellow, bell, pepper, red, bell, pepper, onion, clove, garlic, minced, olive, dried, basil, dried, oregano, salt, pepper, taste

title: Vegan Bibimbap Bowl
raw_text: 41. Vegan Bibimbap Bowl: 450kcals per portion, serves 4, contains gluten, soy (Korea)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup of cooked brown rice
- 1 cup of shredded carrots
- 1 cup of sliced cucumber
- 1 cup of bean sprouts
- 1 cup of sliced mushrooms
- 1 cup of spinach
- 1 tablespoon of sesame oil
- 2 tablespoons of soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon of rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon of gochujang (korean chili paste)
- 1 tablespoon of maple syrup
- 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil
- sesame seeds for garnish
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, combine the cooked brown rice, shredded carrots, sliced cucumber, bean sprouts, and sliced mushrooms.

2. in a small bowl, whisk together the sesame oil, soy sauce, rice vinegar, gochujang, and maple syrup to make the sauce.

3. heat the vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat. add the spinach and sauté until wilted, about 2-3 minutes.

4. remove the spinach from the pan and add it to the rice bowl.

5. in the same pan, add the sliced mushrooms and sauté until they release their liquid and become tender, about 5-7 minutes.

6. add the mushrooms to the rice bowl.

7. pour the sauce over the rice and vegetables in the bowl. toss everything together until well coated in the sauce.

8. sprinkle sesame seeds on top for garnish.

9. serve the vegan bibimbap bowl immediately and enjoy!
ingredients_list: brown, rice, shredded, carrot, cucumber, bean, sprout, mushroom, spinach, sesame, soy, sauce, rice, vinegar, gochujang, korean, chili, paste, maple, syrup, vegetable, sesame, seed, garnish

title: Vegan Tikka Wrap
raw_text: 53. Vegan Tikka Wrap: 350kcals per portion, serves 2, contains gluten (India)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup canned chickpeas, rinsed and drained
- 1 cup diced vegetables (such as bell peppers, onions, and tomatoes)
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 tablespoon tikka masala spice mix
- 4 whole wheat wraps or tortillas
- 1/4 cup vegan mayonnaise
- handful of fresh cilantro, chopped
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a bowl, coat the chickpeas and diced vegetables with olive oil and tikka masala spice mix. season with salt and pepper to taste.
2. preheat a large skillet over medium heat. add the chickpea and vegetable mixture to the skillet and cook until vegetables are tender and chickpeas are crispy, about 8-10 minutes. stir occasionally to avoid burning.
3. while the mixture is cooking, warm the wraps or tortillas in a separate skillet or in the microwave.
4. once the chickpeas and vegetables are cooked, remove from heat and let them cool slightly.
5. to assemble the wraps, spread about 1 tablespoon of vegan mayonnaise on each wrap. top with the cooked chickpea and vegetable mixture.
6. sprinkle fresh cilantro over the filling and roll each wrap tightly, making sure to tuck in the sides as you go.
7. serve the vegan tikka wraps immediately or wrap them in foil to enjoy later. they can be enjoyed warm or cold.
ingredients_list: canned, chickpea, vegetable, bell, pepper, onion, tomato, olive, tikka, masala, spice, whole, wheat, wrap, tortilla, vegan, mayonnaise, handful, fresh, cilantro, salt, pepper, taste

title: Vegan Mapo Tofu
raw_text: 62. Vegan Mapo Tofu: 400kcals per portion, serves 4, contains gluten, soy (China)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 medium onion, finely chopped
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon grated ginger
- 1 tablespoon sichuan peppercorns, crushed
- 1 tablespoon red pepper flakes (adjust according to your spice preference)
- 1 block tofu, diced
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons rice vinegar
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- 2 tablespoons cornstarch
- 2 tablespoons water
- 2 green onions, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. add the chopped onion, minced garlic, and grated ginger to the skillet. cook until the onion becomes translucent and fragrant, about 5 minutes.
3. stir in the crushed sichuan peppercorns and red pepper flakes. cook for an additional minute.
4. add the diced tofu to the skillet and gently stir to coat it in the spiced onion mixture.
5. in a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, rice vinegar, and vegetable broth. pour this mixture over the tofu in the skillet.
6. in a separate small bowl, combine the cornstarch and water to make a slurry. pour the slurry into the skillet and gently stir to thicken the sauce.
7. reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the tofu is heated through and the sauce has thickened to your liking.
8. remove from heat and garnish with chopped green onions.
9. serve the vegan mapo tofu over steamed rice or noodles. enjoy!
ingredients_list: vegetable, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, sichuan, peppercorn, red, pepper, flake, spice, preference, tofu, soy, sauce, rice, vinegar, vegetable, broth, cornstarch, water, green, onion, garnish

title: Vegan Phyllo Pie
raw_text: 66. Vegan Phyllo Pie: 400kcals per portion, serves 4, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 12 sheets phyllo pastry
- 1 cup cooked chickpeas
- 1 cup cooked lentils
- 1 cup chopped spinach
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- 1 tablespoon nutritional yeast (optional)
- salt and pepper to taste
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. add the onion and garlic, and sauté until they become translucent.
3. add the diced bell pepper, spinach, cooked chickpeas, and cooked lentils to the skillet. stir well.
4. season the mixture with dried oregano, dried thyme, nutritional yeast (if using), salt, and pepper. cook for about 5 minutes until all the flavors combine. remove from heat and let it cool slightly.
5. grease a baking dish with a little olive oil.
6. lay one sheet of phyllo pastry in the baking dish, brushing it with olive oil before adding the next sheet. repeat until you have used half of the phyllo sheets.
7. pour the vegetable and legume mixture on top of the phyllo layers and spread it evenly.
8. continue layering the remaining phyllo sheets, brushing olive oil between each layer.
9. brush the top layer with some olive oil and sprinkle with a pinch of salt.
10. bake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, until the phyllo pastry turns golden brown.
11. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
12. enjoy your vegan phyllo pie!
ingredients_list: sheet, phyllo, pastry, chickpea, lentil, spinach, red, bell, pepper, onion, clove, garlic, minced, dried, oregano, dried, thyme, yeast, salt, pepper, taste, olive

title: Vegan Quesadillas
raw_text: 70. Vegan Quesadillas: 300kcals per portion, serves 4, contains gluten (Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 tortillas (preferably whole wheat)
- 1 cup cooked black beans
- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 yellow onion, thinly sliced
- 1 cup corn kernels (fresh or frozen)
- 1 cup vegan cheese (such as shredded vegan cheddar or mozzarella)
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- optional toppings: salsa, guacamole, vegan sour cream, chopped cilantro
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. add the sliced onion and bell pepper, and sauté until they begin to soften, about 5 minutes.
2. add the corn kernels and cooked black beans to the pan, and continue cooking for another 2-3 minutes until heated through.
3. season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste, then remove from heat.
4. heat a separate pan or griddle over medium heat. place a tortilla in the pan and sprinkle a layer of vegan cheese evenly on one side of the tortilla.
5. spoon a generous amount of the vegetable and bean mixture onto half of the cheese-covered side of the tortilla.
6. fold the other half of the tortilla over the filling to create a half-moon shape. press down gently with a spatula to flatten the quesadilla.
7. cook for 2-3 minutes on each side, until the tortilla is crispy and golden brown, and the cheese has melted.
8. remove the quesadilla from the pan and repeat the process with the remaining tortillas and filling ingredients.
9. cut the quesadillas into wedges and serve warm with desired toppings such as salsa, guacamole, vegan sour cream, and chopped cilantro.
10. enjoy your delicious vegan quesadillas!
ingredients_list: tortilla, preferably, whole, wheat, black, bean, red, bell, pepper, thinly, yellow, onion, thinly, corn, kernel, fresh, frozen, vegan, cheese, shredded, vegan, cheddar, mozzarella, olive, salt, pepper, taste, topping, salsa, guacamole, vegan, sour, cream, cilantro

title: Vegan Swedish Meatballs
raw_text: 75. Vegan Swedish Meatballs: 250kcals per portion, serves 4, contains gluten (Sweden)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups cooked quinoa
- 1 cup cooked lentils
- ½ cup breadcrumbs
- ¼ cup nutritional yeast
- 2 tablespoons ground flaxseeds
- 3 tablespoons water
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- ½ teaspoon ground black pepper
- ¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg
- ¼ teaspoon salt
- 3 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 cups vegetable broth
- 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
- 1 cup unsweetened almond milk
- fresh parsley, for garnish
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, lentils, breadcrumbs, nutritional yeast, ground flaxseeds, water, soy sauce, minced garlic, chopped onion, cumin, thyme, black pepper, nutmeg, and salt. mix well until all ingredients are evenly incorporated.
2. form the mixture into small meatball-sized balls using your hands. set aside.
3. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. add the meatballs to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
4. in a small bowl, whisk together the vegetable broth and flour until well combined. pour the mixture into the skillet with the meatballs.
5. stir in the almond milk and bring the mixture to a simmer. cook for an additional 10 minutes, or until the sauce thickens slightly.
6. serve the vegan swedish meatballs with the sauce and garnish with fresh parsley. enjoy!
taste: The key taste profile in this recipe is savory/umami.
ingredients_list: quinoa, lentil, breadcrumb, yeast, ground, flaxseed, water, soy, sauce, clove, garlic, minced, onion, ground, cumin, dried, thyme, ground, black, pepper, ground, nutmeg, salt, olive, vegetable, broth, flour, unsweetened, almond, milk, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Vegetable Pad Thai
raw_text: 84. Vegetable Pad Thai: 450kcals per portion, serves 4, contains gluten, soy (Thailand)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 oz rice noodles
- 2 tbsp vegetable oil
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 small onion, thinly sliced
- 1 bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 carrot, julienned
- 1 cup bean sprouts
- 1 cup tofu, diced
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 1/4 cup roasted peanuts, chopped
- 2 green onions, chopped
- lime wedges, for serving
- fresh cilantro, for garnish

for the sauce:
- 2 tbsp soy sauce
- 2 tbsp tamarind paste
- 2 tbsp brown sugar
- 1 tbsp fish sauce
- 1 tbsp lime juice
preparation:
1. cook the rice noodles according to package instructions. drain and set aside.
2. in a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, tamarind paste, brown sugar, fish sauce, and lime juice to make the sauce. set aside.
3. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat. add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
4. add the sliced onion, bell pepper, and carrot to the skillet. stir-fry for about 3-4 minutes until the vegetables are slightly tender.
5. push the vegetables to one side of the skillet and add the diced tofu to the empty side. cook for 2 minutes to lightly brown the tofu.
6. move the vegetables and tofu to one side of the skillet and pour the beaten eggs into the empty side. scramble the eggs until cooked through.
7. add the cooked rice noodles to the skillet and pour the sauce over them. toss everything together until well combined and heated through.
8. add the bean sprouts and toss for an additional minute to lightly cook them.
9. remove the skillet from heat and garnish with chopped peanuts, green onions, and fresh cilantro.
10. serve hot with lime wedges on the side for squeezing over the dish. enjoy your vegetable pad thai!
ingredients_list: rice, noodle, vegetable, clove, garlic, minced, onion, thinly, bell, pepper, thinly, carrot, bean, sprout, tofu, egg, roasted, peanut, green, onion, lime, wedge, fresh, cilantro, garnish, sauce, soy, sauce, tamarind, paste, brown, sugar, fish, sauce, lime

title: Vegan Tofu Katsu Curry
raw_text: 89. Vegan Tofu Katsu Curry: 400kcals per portion, serves 4, contains gluten, soy (Japan)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 block of firm tofu
- 1 cup panko breadcrumbs
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon paprika
- 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/4 teaspoon onion powder
- vegetable oil, for frying

for the curry sauce:
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 carrots, peeled and diced
- 2 potatoes, peeled and diced
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons curry powder
- 1 tablespoon tomato paste
- 2 cups vegetable broth
- 1 cup coconut milk
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon maple syrup
- salt and pepper, to taste

for serving:
- cooked rice
- steamed vegetables (broccoli, cauliflower, or any of your choice)
preparation:
1. start by pressing the tofu to remove excess water. wrap tofu in a kitchen towel or paper towels and place on a plate. put something heavy on top (like a cast iron skillet) to weigh it down. leave it for about 15 minutes, then unwrap the tofu and cut it into rectangular pieces.

2. in a shallow bowl, combine the panko breadcrumbs, flour, salt, pepper, paprika, garlic powder, and onion powder.

3. dip each piece of tofu into the breadcrumb mixture, ensuring it is coated on all sides. set aside.

4. heat enough vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. once hot, add the breaded tofu pieces and cook until crispy and golden brown on each side. place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.

5. in another large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. add the chopped onion, carrots, and potatoes. cook until they start to soften, stirring occasionally.

6. add the minced garlic, curry powder, and tomato paste. stir well to coat the vegetables with the spices.

7. pour in the vegetable broth, coconut milk, soy sauce, and maple syrup. bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for about 15-20 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. season with salt and pepper to taste.

8. to serve, place a portion of cooked rice on a plate. top with the tofu katsu and steamed vegetables. ladle the curry sauce over the tofu and vegetables. enjoy your vegan tofu katsu curry!
ingredients_list: tofu, panko, breadcrumb, flour, salt, black, pepper, paprika, garlic, powder, onion, powder, vegetable, curry, sauce, vegetable, onion, carrot, potato, clove, garlic, minced, curry, powder, tomato, paste, vegetable, broth, coconut, milk, soy, sauce, maple, syrup, salt, pepper, taste, rice, vegetable, broccoli, cauliflower

title: Mediterranean Couscous Stuffed Bell Peppers
raw_text: 90. Mediterranean Couscous Stuffed Bell Peppers: 350kcals per portion, serves 4, contains gluten, nuts
ingredients:
sure! here's the recipe for mediterranean couscous stuffed bell peppers:

ingredients:
- 4 bell peppers (any color)
- 1 cup cooked couscous
- 1/2 cup feta cheese, crumbled
- 1/2 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1/4 cup chopped kalamata olives
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh basil
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cut off the tops of the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes. set the peppers aside.
3. in a mixing bowl, combine the cooked couscous, feta cheese, cherry tomatoes, kalamata olives, parsley, basil, olive oil, lemon juice, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. mix well to combine.
4. stuff the mixture into the bell peppers, dividing it evenly among them. press down gently to compact the filling.
5. place the stuffed bell peppers in a baking dish and cover with aluminum foil.
6. bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the peppers are tender and the filling is heated through.
7. remove the aluminum foil and bake for an additional 5 minutes to lightly brown the tops.
8. once done, remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
9. serve the mediterranean couscous stuffed bell peppers hot as a main dish or as a side dish. enjoy!

note: you can garnish the stuffed bell peppers with additional chopped parsley or basil, if desired.
ingredients_list: mediterranean, couscous, stuffed, bell, pepper, bell, pepper, color, couscous, feta, cheese, cherry, tomato, halved, kalamata, olive, fresh, parsley, fresh, basil, olive, lemon, dried, oregano, salt, pepper, taste

title: Vegan Shawarma
raw_text: 95. Vegan Shawarma: 400kcals per portion, serves 4, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup seitan or tempeh, thinly sliced
- 1 onion, thinly sliced
- 1 bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 pita breads
- vegan tzatziki sauce for serving (optional)
- chopped fresh herbs (such as parsley or cilantro) for garnish
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, combine the seitan or tempeh, onion, bell pepper, minced garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, soy sauce, smoked paprika, cumin, coriander, turmeric, salt, and pepper. mix well to evenly coat the ingredients in the marinade. let the mixture marinate for at least 30 minutes, or overnight in the refrigerator for more flavor.
2. heat a large skillet over medium heat. add the marinated seitan or tempeh mixture to the skillet and cook for 8-10 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the seitan or tempeh is browned and slightly crispy.
3. while the seitan or tempeh mixture is cooking, warm the pita breads in a toaster or oven.
4. once the seitan or tempeh mixture is cooked, divide it evenly among the warmed pita breads. top with vegan tzatziki sauce, if desired, and sprinkle with chopped fresh herbs.
5. serve the vegan shawarma immediately and enjoy!
ingredients_list: seitan, tempeh, thinly, onion, thinly, bell, pepper, thinly, clove, garlic, minced, olive, lemon, soy, sauce, smoked, paprika, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, ground, turmeric, salt, pepper, taste, pita, bread, vegan, tzatziki, sauce, fresh, herb, parsley, cilantro, garnish

title: Vegan Sushi Sandwich
raw_text: 97. Vegan Sushi Sandwich: 450kcals per portion, serves 4, contains soy (Japan)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 nori sheets
- 2 cups sushi rice
- 1 avocado, sliced
- 1/2 cucumber, sliced
- 1/2 red bell pepper, julienned
- 1 carrot, julienned
- 1/4 cup pickled ginger
- 1/4 cup soy sauce or tamari
- 1 tbsp rice vinegar
- 1 tsp sugar
- sesame seeds for garnish
preparation:
1. cook the sushi rice according to the package instructions. once cooked, let it cool slightly.
2. in a small bowl, mix together the rice vinegar and sugar until the sugar dissolves. pour this mixture over the sushi rice and gently mix to combine.
3. lay a nori sheet on a clean surface, such as a bamboo sushi mat or a cutting board.
4. spread about 1/2 cup of the sushi rice evenly over the nori sheet, leaving a small border at the top.
5. place a layer of avocado slices, cucumber slices, red bell pepper, carrot, and pickled ginger on top of the rice.
6. gently roll the nori sheet tightly, starting from the edge closest to you and using the sushi mat or your hands to assist in the rolling process. seal the roll by wetting the top border with a bit of water.
7. repeat this process with the remaining nori sheets and ingredients.
8. using a sharp knife, slice each sushi roll into bite-sized pieces.
9. arrange the sushi sandwiches on a plate and sprinkle some sesame seeds over the top for garnish.
10. serve with soy sauce or tamari for dipping. enjoy your vegan sushi sandwiches!
ingredients_list: nori, sheet, sushi, rice, avocado, cucumber, red, bell, pepper, carrot, pickled, ginger, soy, sauce, tamari, rice, vinegar, sugar, sesame, seed, garnish

title: Vegan Butternut Squash Ravioli
raw_text: 99. Vegan Butternut Squash Ravioli: 350kcals per portion, serves 4, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 medium-sized butternut squash
- 1 package of vegan wonton wrappers
- 1/4 cup of nutritional yeast
- 1 teaspoon of dried thyme
- 1 teaspoon of dried sage
- 1/2 teaspoon of salt
- 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper

for the sauce:
- 2 tablespoons of vegan butter
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 cup of vegetable broth
- 1/2 cup of unsweetened coconut milk
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh parsley for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c). cut the butternut squash in half lengthwise and remove the seeds. place the squash halves on a baking sheet, cut side down, and roast in the oven for about 45 minutes or until the flesh is tender.

2. once the squash is roasted and cooled slightly, scoop out the flesh and place it in a mixing bowl. use a fork or blender to mash the squash until smooth.

3. add the nutritional yeast, dried thyme, dried sage, salt, and black pepper to the mashed squash. stir well to combine.

4. lay out a wonton wrapper on a clean surface. spoon a small amount of the butternut squash mixture onto the center of the wrapper. dip your finger into water and moisten the edges of the wrapper. fold the wrapper over the filling to form a triangle, pressing the edges firmly to seal. repeat with the remaining wrappers and filling.

5. bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. carefully add the ravioli and cook for about 4-5 minutes, or until they float to the surface. remove with a slotted spoon and set aside.

6. in a separate saucepan, melt the vegan butter over medium heat. add the minced garlic and sauté for about 1 minute, until fragrant. add the vegetable broth and coconut milk, then bring to a simmer. let the sauce cook for about 5 minutes to thicken slightly. season with salt and pepper to taste.

7. to serve, place the cooked ravioli onto plates and drizzle with the sauce. garnish with fresh parsley. enjoy your delicious vegan butternut squash ravioli!
taste: The key taste profile in this recipe is savory.
ingredients_list: butternut, vegan, wonton, wrapper, yeast, dried, thyme, dried, sage, salt, black, pepper, sauce, vegan, butter, clove, garlic, minced, vegetable, broth, unsweetened, coconut, milk, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Quinoa breakfast bowl
raw_text: 2. Quinoa breakfast bowl: 250kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains nuts, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup quinoa
- 2 cups water or vegetable broth
- 1 cup almond milk (or any plant-based milk)
- 1 tablespoon maple syrup
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- toppings of choice (e.g., fresh berries, sliced bananas, nuts, seeds, dried fruits)
preparation:
1. rinse quinoa under cold water to remove any bitterness.
2. in a medium saucepan, bring water (or broth) to a boil. add quinoa and reduce heat to low. cover and simmer for about 15 minutes or until all the liquid is absorbed.
3. in a separate small saucepan, heat almond milk over medium heat until warm but not boiling. stir in maple syrup, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and salt.
4. once the quinoa is cooked, fluff it with a fork and transfer it to a bowl. pour the warm almond milk mixture over the quinoa.
5. stir well to combine and let it sit for a few minutes to allow the flavors to blend together.
6. add your favorite toppings, such as fresh berries, sliced bananas, nuts, seeds, or dried fruits.
7. serve and enjoy your delicious quinoa breakfast bowl!
ingredients_list: quinoa, water, vegetable, broth, almond, milk, plant, milk, maple, syrup, vanilla, extract, cinnamon, salt, topping, fresh, berry, banana, nut, seed, dried, fruit

title: Banana pancakes
raw_text: 4. Banana pancakes: 300kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 ripe banana
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1 tablespoon granulated sugar
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- pinch of salt
- butter or oil for greasing the pan
preparation:
1. peel the banana and mash it in a mixing bowl until smooth.
2. add the flour, milk, sugar, baking powder, vanilla extract, and salt to the mashed banana. stir well until all the ingredients are combined and no lumps remain.
3. heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat. grease it with butter or oil.
4. pour a scoop of the pancake batter onto the heated pan. if desired, use the back of a spoon to spread the batter into a round shape.
5. cook the pancake for about 2-3 minutes, or until bubbles form on the surface. flip it over and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until both sides are golden brown.
6. repeat the process with the remaining batter, greasing the pan lightly between each pancake.
7. serve the banana pancakes warm with your favorite toppings, such as maple syrup, fresh fruit, or yogurt. enjoy!
ingredients_list: banana, flour, milk, sugar, baking, powder, vanilla, extract, pinch, salt, butter, greasing

title: Overnight oats with peanut butter
raw_text: 8. Overnight oats with peanut butter: 400kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains nuts, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1/2 cup rolled oats
- 1/2 cup milk (any type of milk you prefer)
- 1 tablespoon peanut butter
- 1 tablespoon honey or maple syrup
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- optional toppings: sliced banana, chopped nuts, chocolate chips
preparation:
1. in a mason jar or airtight container, combine the oats, milk, peanut butter, honey or maple syrup, and vanilla extract.
2. stir well until all the ingredients are incorporated.
3. cover the jar or container and refrigerate it overnight or for at least 4 hours.
4. in the morning, give the oats a good stir to make sure everything is mixed together.
5. if desired, add your favorite toppings like sliced banana, chopped nuts, or chocolate chips.
6. enjoy your creamy and delicious peanut butter overnight oats!
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, milk, milk, peanut, butter, honey, maple, syrup, vanilla, extract, topping, banana, nut, chocolate, chip

title: Spinach and feta breakfast quesadilla
raw_text: 9. Spinach and feta breakfast quesadilla: 350kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Mexico/Turkey
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large flour tortillas
- 1 cup fresh spinach
- 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 2 eggs, beaten
- salt and pepper to taste
- olive oil or cooking spray
preparation:
1. heat a large skillet over medium heat.
2. add a small amount of olive oil or cooking spray to the skillet and spread it around.
3. place one tortilla on the skillet and cook for about 1-2 minutes, or until it starts to brown slightly.
4. flip the tortilla and cook for another 1-2 minutes.
5. remove the tortilla from the skillet and set it aside.
6. in a separate bowl, combine the beaten eggs, spinach, and feta cheese. season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. pour the egg mixture onto the skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, until the eggs are fully cooked.
8. place the cooked eggs onto one half of the tortilla on a plate, and fold the other half over to cover the filling.
9. return the quesadilla to the skillet and cook for another 1-2 minutes on each side, or until the tortilla is crispy and the cheese is melted.
10. remove from the skillet and cut into wedges.
11. serve hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, tortilla, fresh, spinach, feta, cheese, egg, salt, pepper, taste, olive, spray

title: Zucchini fritters
raw_text: 10. Zucchini fritters: 180kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 medium-sized zucchinis
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 green onions, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 2 large eggs, beaten
- vegetable oil, for frying
preparation:
1. grate the zucchinis using a box grater or a food processor with a grating attachment.
2. place the grated zucchinis in a colander and sprinkle with salt. let them sit for about 10 minutes to drain excess moisture.
3. transfer the grated zucchinis onto a clean kitchen towel or a cheesecloth. squeeze out as much liquid as possible.
4. in a mixing bowl, combine the grated zucchinis, flour, baking powder, salt, black pepper, minced garlic, chopped green onions, grated parmesan cheese, and beaten eggs. mix well until all ingredients are well combined.
5. heat vegetable oil in a frying pan over medium heat.
6. spoon about 2 tablespoons of the zucchini mixture into the hot oil, spreading it slightly to form a fritter. cook for about 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown.
7. remove the cooked fritters from the pan and transfer them to a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.
8. repeat the process with the remaining zucchini mixture until all fritters are cooked.
9. serve the zucchini fritters warm as a side dish or a snack. optionally, you can serve them with a dollop of sour cream or tzatziki sauce. enjoy!
ingredients_list: zucchini, flour, baking, powder, salt, black, pepper, clove, garlic, minced, green, onion, parmesan, cheese, egg, vegetable

title: Bircher muesli
raw_text: 12. Bircher muesli: 350kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, origin: Switzerland
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 1 cup rolled oats
- 1 cup milk (dairy or non-dairy)
- 1/2 cup plain yogurt
- 1 tablespoon honey or maple syrup
- 1 apple, grated
- 1/4 cup raisins or dried cranberries
- 1/4 cup chopped nuts (e.g., almonds, walnuts)
- optional toppings: fresh berries, sliced banana, shredded coconut
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine the rolled oats, milk, yogurt, and honey or maple syrup.
2. stir well until all the ingredients are well combined.
3. cover the bowl and place it in the refrigerator overnight or for at least 4 hours to allow the oats to soften and absorb the liquid.
4. once the oats are soft and have absorbed the liquid, remove the bowl from the refrigerator.
5. add the grated apple, raisins or dried cranberries, and chopped nuts to the mixture. stir until everything is evenly distributed.
6. if desired, top the bircher muesli with fresh berries, sliced banana, or shredded coconut.
7. serve cold and enjoy!
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, milk, dairy, dairy, plain, yogurt, honey, maple, syrup, apple, raisin, dried, cranberry, nut, almond, walnut, topping, fresh, berry, banana, shredded, coconut

title: Blueberry muffins
raw_text: 14. Blueberry muffins: 350kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, origin: USA
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 2 tsp baking powder
- 1/2 tsp baking soda
- 1/4 tsp salt
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 1 cup milk
- 2 large eggs
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- 1 1/2 cups fresh or frozen blueberries
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c) and line a muffin tin with paper liners.
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
3. in a separate bowl, whisk together the melted butter, milk, eggs, and vanilla extract.
4. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. be careful not to overmix.
5. gently fold in the blueberries.
6. divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups, filling each about 2/3 full.
7. bake for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
8. remove the muffins from the oven and let them cool in the tin for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. serve and enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, baking, powder, baking, soda, salt, unsalted, butter, milk, egg, vanilla, extract, fresh, frozen, blueberry

title: Oatmeal with almond milk and berries
raw_text: 16. Oatmeal with almond milk and berries: 300kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains nuts, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup of old-fashioned oats
- 2 cups of almond milk
- 1 cup of mixed berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)
- 2 tablespoons of honey or maple syrup (optional for sweetness)
- 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract (optional for flavor)
preparation:
1. in a medium-sized saucepan, bring the almond milk to a boil over medium heat.
2. add the oats to the boiling almond milk and reduce the heat to low. stir well to combine.
3. cook the oatmeal for about 5 minutes, or until it reaches your desired consistency, stirring occasionally.
4. if using, stir in the honey or maple syrup and vanilla extract for added sweetness and flavor.
5. remove the saucepan from the heat and let the oatmeal cool for a few minutes.
6. serve the oatmeal in bowls and top with the mixed berries.
7. you can also drizzle additional honey or maple syrup on top if desired.
8. enjoy your delicious oatmeal with almond milk and berries!
cuisine: The cuisine type of the recipe is "Breakfast"
ingredients_list: fashioned, oat, almond, milk, berry, strawberry, blueberry, raspberry, honey, maple, syrup, sweetness, vanilla, extract, flavor

title: Tomato and basil bruschetta
raw_text: 17. Tomato and basil bruschetta: 250kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Italy
ingredients:
ingredients:

- 4 large ripe tomatoes
- 1 small bunch of fresh basil
- 2 cloves of garlic
- 4 slices of crusty bread
- extra-virgin olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. slice the tomatoes in half, remove the seeds, and dice them into small pieces.
3. finely chop the fresh basil leaves.
4. peel and mince the garlic cloves.
5. in a bowl, combine the diced tomatoes, chopped basil, minced garlic, and a drizzle of olive oil. mix well.
6. season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
7. place the slices of crusty bread on a baking sheet and toast them in the oven until golden brown, about 5-7 minutes.
8. once the bread is toasted, remove it from the oven and let it cool slightly.
9. rub each toasted bread slice with a peeled garlic clove to give it a subtle garlic flavor.
10. spoon the tomato and basil mixture onto each bread slice, spreading it evenly.
11. drizzle a little more olive oil on top of each bruschetta.
12. optionally, you can sprinkle some extra chopped basil leaves on top for garnish.
13. serve immediately and enjoy your tomato and basil bruschetta as an appetizer or snack.
ingredients_list: tomato, bunch, fresh, basil, clove, garlic, crusty, bread, virgin, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Vegan breakfast burrito
raw_text: 18. Vegan breakfast burrito: 400kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and soy, origin: Mexico
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 cup diced tomatoes
- 1 cup black beans, drained and rinsed
- 1 cup tofu, crumbled
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 4 large tortillas
- fresh cilantro, diced (optional)
- salsa (optional)
preparation:
1. in a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
2. add diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet and sauté until onions are translucent.
3. add diced bell pepper to the skillet and cook for a few minutes until it becomes slightly soft.
4. stir in diced tomatoes, black beans, crumbled tofu, ground cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. warm up the tortillas in a separate pan or in the oven.
6. divide the filling mixture evenly among the tortillas, placing it in the center.
7. optional: sprinkle fresh cilantro over the filling.
8. fold the sides of the tortillas inward, then tightly roll them up.
9. serve the vegan breakfast burritos with salsa on the side, if desired.
10. enjoy your delicious vegan breakfast burritos!
ingredients_list: olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, bell, pepper, tomato, black, bean, tofu, ground, cumin, paprika, salt, pepper, taste, tortilla, fresh, cilantro, salsa

title: Halloumi and vegetable skewers
raw_text: 22. Halloumi and vegetable skewers: 250kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: Cyprus
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 wooden skewers
- 1 block of halloumi cheese, cut into cubes
- 1 red bell pepper, cut into chunks
- 1 yellow bell pepper, cut into chunks
- 1 zucchini, sliced
- 1 red onion, cut into chunks
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. soak the wooden skewers in water for about 30 minutes to prevent them from burning on the grill.
2. in a small bowl, mix together the olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, dried oregano, salt, and pepper to make the marinade.
3. thread the halloumi cheese, bell peppers, zucchini, and red onion onto the skewers, alternating the ingredients.
4. place the skewers in a shallow dish and pour the marinade over them, making sure to coat all sides. let them marinate for at least 30 minutes.
5. preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
6. place the skewers on the grill and cook for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until the halloumi is golden and the vegetables are tender.
7. remove the skewers from the grill and serve hot.
8. optional: serve with a side of tzatziki sauce or hummus for dipping. enjoy!
ingredients_list: wooden, skewer, halloumi, cheese, cube, red, bell, pepper, yellow, bell, pepper, zucchini, red, onion, olive, lemon, clove, garlic, minced, dried, oregano, salt, pepper, taste

title: Broccoli and cheese quiche
raw_text: 23. Broccoli and cheese quiche: 350kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: France
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 deep-dish pie crust
- 1 cup chopped broccoli florets
- 1 cup grated cheddar cheese
- 3 large eggs
- 1 cup milk
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/4 teaspoon onion powder
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. place the deep-dish pie crust in a pie plate and set aside.
3. in a pot of boiling water, blanch the chopped broccoli for 2-3 minutes. drain and set aside.
4. in a medium-sized bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, black pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder until well combined.
5. spread the blanched broccoli evenly over the bottom of the pie crust.
6. sprinkle the grated cheddar cheese on top of the broccoli.
7. pour the egg mixture over the cheese and broccoli, making sure it is evenly distributed.
8. carefully transfer the quiche to the preheated oven.
9. bake for 35-40 minutes or until the center is set and the top is golden brown.
10. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving. enjoy your delicious broccoli and cheese quiche!
ingredients_list: pie, crust, broccoli, floret, cheddar, cheese, egg, milk, salt, black, pepper, garlic, powder, onion, powder

title: Vegan cinnamon rolls
raw_text: 26. Vegan cinnamon rolls: 400kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, origin: Sweden
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 3/4 cups all-purpose flour
- 2 1/4 teaspoons instant yeast
- 2 tablespoons granulated sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup unsweetened almond milk
- 1/4 cup dairy-free butter, melted (plus extra for greasing)
- 1/4 cup warm water
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

for the filling:
- 1/2 cup packed brown sugar
- 2 tablespoons ground cinnamon
- 2 tablespoons dairy-free butter, softened

for the icing:
- 1 cup powdered sugar
- 2 tablespoons unsweetened almond milk
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, yeast, sugar, and salt.
2. in a separate microwave-safe bowl, heat the almond milk and melted butter until warm (not hot). stir to combine.
3. pour the warm milk mixture into the dry ingredients. add the warm water and vanilla extract. mix until a dough forms.
4. transfer the dough onto a floured surface and knead for about 5 minutes, until smooth and elastic.
5. grease a clean mixing bowl with dairy-free butter. place the dough in the bowl, cover with a clean towel, and let it rise for about 1-2 hours, or until doubled in size.
6. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c) and grease a baking dish with dairy-free butter.
7. roll out the dough on a floured surface into a large rectangle, about 1/4 inch thick.
8. in a small bowl, mix together the brown sugar and cinnamon for the filling. spread the softened butter evenly over the rolled-out dough, then sprinkle the cinnamon sugar mixture over the butter.
9. starting from one of the longer sides, tightly roll up the dough into a log. using a sharp knife, cut the log into 12 equal slices.
10. place the cinnamon rolls in the greased baking dish, spacing them evenly. cover with a towel and let them rise for an additional 30 minutes.
11. bake the rolls in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown.
12. while the rolls are baking, prepare the icing by whisking together the powdered sugar, almond milk, and vanilla extract until smooth.
13. once the rolls are done, remove them from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before drizzling the icing over the top.
14. serve warm and enjoy your vegan cinnamon rolls!
ingredients_list: flour, yeast, sugar, salt, unsweetened, almond, milk, dairy, butter, greasing, water, vanilla, extract, filling, brown, sugar, ground, cinnamon, dairy, butter, sugar, unsweetened, almond, milk, vanilla, extract

title: Vegan breakfast tacos
raw_text: 30. Vegan breakfast tacos: 350kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Mexico
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, diced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 green bell pepper, diced
- 1 small zucchini, diced
- 1 cup diced mushrooms
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon chili powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 tortillas (preferably corn)
- 1 cup cooked black beans
- 1 avocado, sliced
- fresh cilantro, for garnish
- hot sauce, for serving
preparation:
1. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
2. add the diced onion and sauté until translucent.
3. add the diced red and green bell peppers, zucchini, and mushrooms to the skillet. sauté until the vegetables are tender.
4. sprinkle the cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper over the vegetables. stir well to evenly coat them with the spices.
5. warm the tortillas in a separate skillet or oven until they are pliable.
6. assemble the tacos by placing a spoonful of the cooked vegetable mixture onto each tortilla.
7. top with some cooked black beans, avocado slices, and fresh cilantro.
8. serve the vegan breakfast tacos with hot sauce on the side for those who like it spicy.
9. enjoy your delicious vegan breakfast tacos!
taste: The key taste profile for this recipe is savory.

title: Chocolate peanut butter smoothie bowl
raw_text: 32. Chocolate peanut butter smoothie bowl: 400kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains nuts, origin: -
ingredients:
sure! here's the recipe for a chocolate peanut butter smoothie bowl:

ingredients:
- 2 ripe bananas
- 1/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
- 2 tablespoons peanut butter
- 1/2 cup almond milk (or any milk of your choice)
- 1 tablespoon honey or maple syrup (optional, for added sweetness)
- 1/2 cup ice cubes
- toppings of your choice (e.g. sliced bananas, chopped peanuts, chocolate chips)
preparation:
1. peel and slice the bananas, then freeze them for at least 2 hours.
2. once the bananas are frozen, place them in a blender.
3. add the cocoa powder, peanut butter, almond milk, honey or maple syrup (if using), and ice cubes to the blender.
4. blend all the ingredients until smooth and creamy. if the mixture is too thick, add a bit more almond milk.
5. pour the smoothie into a bowl.
6. top with your favorite toppings, such as sliced bananas, chopped peanuts, and chocolate chips.
7. enjoy your delicious chocolate peanut butter smoothie bowl with a spoon!

note: feel free to customize your smoothie bowl by adding other ingredients like protein powder, chia seeds, or shredded coconut.
ingredients_list: chocolate, peanut, butter, smoothie, banana, unsweetened, cocoa, powder, peanut, butter, almond, milk, milk, honey, maple, syrup, sweetness, ice, cube, topping, banana, peanut, chocolate, chip

title: Cucumber and cream cheese sandwiches
raw_text: 35. Cucumber and cream cheese sandwiches: 250kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 slices of bread
- 1 cucumber
- 8 oz cream cheese
- fresh dill
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. begin by washing and thinly slicing the cucumber.
2. in a bowl, combine the cream cheese, salt, and pepper. mix well until smooth.
3. take 4 slices of bread and spread a generous amount of cream cheese mixture on each slice.
4. arrange cucumber slices on top of the cream cheese mixture, making sure to cover the entire slice of bread.
5. sprinkle fresh dill over the cucumber slices.
6. take the remaining 4 slices of bread and place them on top of the cucumber slices, creating 4 sandwiches.
7. press down gently to secure the sandwiches.
8. using a sharp knife, cut off the crusts from the sandwiches.
9. cut the sandwiches into desired shapes, such as triangles or rectangles.
10. serve the cucumber and cream cheese sandwiches immediately, or refrigerate until ready to serve. enjoy!
ingredients_list: bread, cucumber, cream, cheese, fresh, dill, salt, pepper, taste

title: Baked oatmeal with apples
raw_text: 37. Baked oatmeal with apples: 350kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: USA
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups rolled oats
- 1/2 cup chopped apples
- 1/4 cup chopped nuts (optional)
- 2 tablespoons brown sugar
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup milk
- 1/4 cup maple syrup
- 2 tablespoons melted butter
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c) and lightly grease a baking dish.
2. in a mixing bowl, combine the rolled oats, chopped apples, chopped nuts (if using), brown sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt.
3. in a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, maple syrup, melted butter, and vanilla extract.
4. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until everything is well combined.
5. transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish and spread it evenly.
6. bake in the preheated oven for about 30-35 minutes, or until the top is golden and the oatmeal is set.
7. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
8. serve warm and enjoy your baked oatmeal with apples.

title: Veggie and cheese toastie
raw_text: 39. Veggie and cheese toastie: 300kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 slices of bread
- 1/2 cup of mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, mushrooms, and onions)
- 1/4 cup of grated cheese (such as cheddar or mozzarella)
- 2 tablespoons of butter
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. heat a pan over medium heat.
2. in the pan, add 1 tablespoon of butter and let it melt.
3. add the mixed vegetables to the pan and sauté until they are tender. season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. remove the vegetables from the pan and set aside.
5. spread the remaining tablespoon of butter on one side of each bread slice.
6. place one bread slice, buttered side down, on a separate pan or a sandwich press.
7. layer half of the sautéed vegetables onto the bread slice, followed by the grated cheese.
8. top with the remaining sautéed vegetables and place the other bread slice, buttered side up, on top.
9. if using a pan, cook each side of the sandwich over medium heat until the bread turns golden brown and the cheese has melted. if using a sandwich press, cook according to the manufacturer's instructions.
10. once cooked, remove the toastie from the pan or sandwich press.
11. slice the toastie diagonally and serve hot.

enjoy your veggie and cheese toastie!
ingredients_list: bread, vegetable, bell, pepper, mushroom, onion, cheese, cheddar, mozzarella, butter, salt, pepper, taste

title: Vegan chocolate chip muffins
raw_text: 40. Vegan chocolate chip muffins: 400kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 1/2 cup cocoa powder
- 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup dairy-free milk (such as almond or soy milk)
- 1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce
- 1/4 cup vegetable oil
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 cup dairy-free chocolate chips
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c) and line a muffin tin with paper liners.
2. in a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt until well combined.
3. in a separate bowl, mix together the dairy-free milk, applesauce, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract until smooth.
4. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. be careful not to overmix.
5. fold in the dairy-free chocolate chips until evenly distributed throughout the batter.
6. spoon the batter into the prepared muffin tin, filling each liner about 3/4 of the way full.
7. bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
8. remove the muffins from the oven and let them cool in the tin for a few minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. enjoy your vegan chocolate chip muffins!

title: Tomato and mozzarella frittata
raw_text: 41. Tomato and mozzarella frittata: 200kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: Italy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 6 eggs
- 1 tomato, sliced
- 1/2 cup mozzarella cheese, shredded
- 1/4 cup fresh basil leaves, chopped
- 1/4 cup milk
- salt and pepper to taste
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. in a mixing bowl, beat the eggs together with the milk, salt, and pepper until well combined.
3. heat the olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
4. pour the beaten eggs into the skillet and cook for about 3-4 minutes until the edges start to set.
5. arrange the tomato slices evenly on top of the eggs, followed by the shredded mozzarella cheese and chopped basil leaves.
6. transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for approximately 10-12 minutes until the frittata is set and the cheese is melted and slightly browned.
7. remove the frittata from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. carefully slide a spatula around the edges of the skillet to loosen the frittata, then gently slide it onto a serving plate or cutting board.
9. slice the frittata into wedges and serve warm. enjoy!

title: Veggie sausage and egg muffin
raw_text: 43. Veggie sausage and egg muffin: 400kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 veggie sausages
- 2 eggs
- 2 english muffins
- 2 slices of cheese
- salt and pepper to taste
- butter or oil for frying
preparation:
1. heat a skillet over medium heat and cook the veggie sausages according to package instructions. (usually 5-7 minutes on each side)
2. while the sausages are cooking, crack the eggs into a bowl and whisk them together. season with salt and pepper.
3. in another skillet, melt some butter or heat oil over medium heat. pour the beaten eggs into the skillet and cook until they firm up, stirring occasionally to scramble them.
4. cut the english muffins in half and lightly toast them.
5. once the veggie sausages are cooked, slice them in half lengthwise.
6. place half a sausage on the bottom half of each toasted english muffin. top with a slice of cheese.
7. divide the scrambled eggs evenly between the muffins, placing them on top of the cheese.
8. cover each muffin with the top half of the english muffin.
9. serve immediately and enjoy your veggie sausage and egg muffins!
