title: Peanut butter and banana overnight oats
raw_text: 45. Peanut butter and banana overnight oats: 400kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains nuts, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 ripe banana, mashed
- 1/4 cup peanut butter
- 1 cup rolled oats
- 1 cup milk (dairy or plant-based)
- 1 tablespoon honey or maple syrup
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- optional toppings: sliced bananas, crushed peanuts, drizzle of honey
preparation:
1. in a medium-sized bowl, mix together the mashed banana and peanut butter until well combined.
2. add the oats, milk, honey (or maple syrup), and vanilla extract to the bowl with the banana and peanut butter mixture. stir until all the ingredients are thoroughly combined.
3. divide the mixture into individual airtight containers or mason jars with lids.
4. place the containers/jars in the refrigerator overnight, allowing the oats to soak and soften.
5. in the morning, give the oats a good stir and add any desired toppings, such as sliced bananas, crushed peanuts, or a drizzle of honey.
6. enjoy the peanut butter and banana overnight oats chilled straight from the fridge!
ingredients_list: banana, peanut, butter, rolled, oat, milk, dairy, plant, honey, maple, syrup, vanilla, extract, topping, banana, peanut, honey

title: Roasted vegetable tart
raw_text: 46. Roasted vegetable tart: 300kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 sheet of puff pastry
- 1 red bell pepper
- 1 yellow bell pepper
- 1 zucchini
- 1 yellow squash
- 1 red onion
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- salt and pepper to taste
- 100g goat cheese
- fresh basil leaves for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. slice the red and yellow bell peppers, zucchini, yellow squash, and red onion into thin strips or rounds.
3. in a large baking dish, toss the sliced vegetables with olive oil, thyme, salt, and pepper until well coated.
4. roast the vegetables in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until they become tender and slightly caramelized.
5. while the vegetables are roasting, roll out the puff pastry sheet on a floured surface to fit the size of your tart dish or baking tray.
6. place the puff pastry into the tart dish or baking tray, pressing it gently into the edges.
7. prick the bottom of the pastry with a fork to prevent it from puffing up too much during baking.
8. once the vegetables are done, remove them from the oven and let them cool slightly.
9. spread the roasted vegetables evenly over the puff pastry.
10. crumble the goat cheese on top of the vegetables.
11. bake the tart in the oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the edges of the pastry turn golden brown and the cheese melts.
12. remove the tart from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
13. garnish with fresh basil leaves before serving.
14. cut into slices and enjoy warm or at room temperature.
ingredients_list: puff, pastry, red, bell, pepper, yellow, bell, pepper, zucchini, yellow, red, onion, olive, dried, thyme, salt, pepper, taste, goat, cheese, fresh, basil, leaf, garnish

title: Vegan blueberry scones
raw_text: 47. Vegan blueberry scones: 400kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup granulated sugar
- 2 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup vegan butter, cold and cubed
- 1 cup frozen blueberries
- 1/2 cup plant-based milk (such as almond or soy)
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
3. add the cold vegan butter to the bowl and use a pastry cutter or your fingers to cut it into the dry ingredients until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
4. gently fold in the frozen blueberries.
5. in a separate small bowl, whisk together the plant-based milk, vanilla extract, and lemon juice.
6. pour the milk mixture into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. be careful not to overmix.
7. transfer the dough onto a lightly floured surface and pat it into a 1-inch thick circle.
8. cut the dough into wedges or use a round cookie cutter to shape the scones.
9. place the scones onto the prepared baking sheet and brush the tops with a little plant-based milk.
10. bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the scones are golden brown and cooked through.
11. remove from the oven and let the scones cool on a wire rack before serving. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, baking, powder, salt, vegan, butter, frozen, blueberry, plant, milk, almond, soy, vanilla, extract, lemon

title: Banana nut bread
raw_text: 49. Banana nut bread: 350kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and nuts, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, softened
- 3/4 cup brown sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 4 ripe bananas, mashed
- 1/2 cup chopped walnuts or pecans
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c). grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan and set aside.
2. in a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt. set aside.
3. in a large mixing bowl, cream together the softened butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
4. beat in the eggs, one at a time, followed by the vanilla extract.
5. gradually add the mashed bananas to the wet mixture. mix well.
6. gradually add the dry flour mixture to the banana mixture, stirring just until combined. do not overmix.
7. fold in the chopped walnuts or pecans.
8. pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
9. bake for about 55-60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the bread comes out clean.
10. remove the bread from the oven and let it cool in the pan for 10 minutes.
11. transfer the bread to a wire rack to cool completely before slicing and serving.
ingredients_list: flour, baking, soda, salt, unsalted, butter, brown, sugar, egg, vanilla, extract, banana, walnut, pecan

title: Mushroom and spinach breakfast wrap
raw_text: 50. Mushroom and spinach breakfast wrap: 400kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large tortilla wraps
- 8 large mushrooms, sliced
- 2 cups fresh spinach
- 4 eggs
- 1/4 cup grated cheddar cheese
- salt and pepper to taste
- olive oil for cooking
preparation:
1. heat a drizzle of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
2. add the sliced mushrooms and cook for 5-7 minutes until they start to soften and turn golden brown. remove from the skillet and set aside.
3. in the same skillet, add the fresh spinach and cook until wilted, about 2-3 minutes. remove from the skillet and set aside.
4. in a small bowl, beat the eggs and season with salt and pepper.
5. heat a touch of olive oil in the skillet over medium heat and pour in the beaten eggs. cook, stirring occasionally, until scrambled and set, about 3-4 minutes. remove from heat.
6. warm the tortilla wraps in a dry skillet or microwave for a few seconds, just to make them more pliable.
7. spread a spoonful of scrambled eggs onto each tortilla wrap.
8. top with sautéed mushrooms, wilted spinach, and a sprinkle of grated cheddar cheese.
9. fold in the sides of the tortilla and roll it up tightly to form a wrap.
10. repeat the process with the remaining tortilla wraps and filling ingredients.
11. serve the mushroom and spinach breakfast wraps warm and enjoy!
ingredients_list: tortilla, wrap, mushroom, fresh, spinach, egg, cheddar, cheese, salt, pepper, taste, olive

title: Vegan tofu and vegetable scramble
raw_text: 51. Vegan tofu and vegetable scramble: 300kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains soy, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 block of firm tofu
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 cup of mushrooms, sliced
- 1 cup of spinach, chopped
- 2 tablespoons of nutritional yeast
- 1 tablespoon of soy sauce
- 1 teaspoon of turmeric
- 1/2 teaspoon of cumin
- salt and pepper, to taste
- olive oil, for cooking
preparation:
1. drain and press the tofu to remove excess moisture. crumble the tofu into small pieces using your hands or a fork.
2. in a large skillet, heat some olive oil over medium heat.
3. add the diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet. sauté for 2-3 minutes until the onion becomes translucent.
4. add the diced red bell pepper and sliced mushrooms to the skillet. cook for another 3-4 minutes until the vegetables are slightly softened.
5. add the crumbled tofu to the skillet along with the nutritional yeast, soy sauce, turmeric, cumin, salt, and pepper. stir well to combine all the ingredients.
6. cook the tofu and vegetable mixture for about 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the tofu is heated through and slightly browned.
7. add the chopped spinach to the skillet and cook for an additional 2 minutes until the spinach is wilted.
8. taste and adjust the seasoning if needed.
9. remove from heat and serve the vegan tofu and vegetable scramble hot.
10. optional: serve with whole-grain toast or tortillas for a complete meal. enjoy!
ingredients_list: tofu, red, bell, pepper, onion, clove, garlic, minced, mushroom, spinach, yeast, soy, sauce, turmeric, cumin, salt, pepper, taste, olive

title: Oat and berry breakfast muffins
raw_text: 52. Oat and berry breakfast muffins: 300kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cups rolled oats
- 1 cup milk
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 1/4 cup vegetable oil
- 1/4 cup unsweetened applesauce
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup mixed berries (blueberries, raspberries, strawberries, etc.)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c) and line a muffin tin with paper liners.
2. in a medium bowl, combine the rolled oats and milk. let it sit for about 5 minutes to allow the oats to soften.
3. in a separate large bowl, whisk together the flour, brown sugar, vegetable oil, applesauce, and vanilla extract until well combined.
4. add the soaked oats mixture to the large bowl and mix well.
5. stir in the baking powder, baking soda, and salt until everything is evenly combined.
6. gently fold in the mixed berries until they are evenly distributed throughout the batter.
7. spoon the batter into the prepared muffin tin, filling each cup about 2/3 full.
8. bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
9. allow the muffins to cool in the tin for a few minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. serve the oat and berry breakfast muffins and enjoy!
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, milk, flour, brown, sugar, vegetable, unsweetened, applesauce, vanilla, extract, baking, powder, baking, soda, salt, berry, blueberry, raspberry, strawberry

title: Maple pecan granola
raw_text: 53. Maple pecan granola: 400kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains nuts, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 3 cups rolled oats
- 1 cup chopped pecans
- 1/2 cup maple syrup
- 1/4 cup coconut oil, melted
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 cup dried cranberries (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 325°f (160°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a large bowl, combine the rolled oats and chopped pecans.
3. in a separate small bowl, mix together the maple syrup, melted coconut oil, salt, cinnamon, and vanilla extract.
4. pour the maple syrup mixture over the oats and pecans. stir well to ensure everything is evenly coated.
5. spread the mixture onto the prepared baking sheet in an even layer.
6. bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the granola turns golden brown, stirring once or twice during cooking for even toasting.
7. remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the granola cool completely on the sheet. it will continue to crisp up as it cools.
8. once the granola is completely cool, stir in the dried cranberries if desired.
9. transfer the granola to an airtight container for storage. it will keep well for up to 2 weeks.

enjoy your homemade maple pecan granola as a delicious breakfast or snack!
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, pecan, maple, syrup, coconut, salt, cinnamon, vanilla, extract, dried, cranberry

title: Cheesy broccoli and tomato quiche
raw_text: 54. Cheesy broccoli and tomato quiche: 300kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: France
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pre-made pie crust
- 1 cup broccoli florets, chopped
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 4 large eggs
- 1 cup milk
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. roll out the pre-made pie crust and press it into a 9-inch pie dish. trim any excess crust from the edges.
3. in a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, and black pepper.
4. sprinkle the shredded cheddar cheese into the pie crust.
5. scatter the chopped broccoli florets and halved cherry tomatoes on top of the cheese.
6. pour the egg mixture over the vegetables and cheese.
7. place the quiche in the preheated oven and bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the center is set and the crust is golden brown.
8. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
9. enjoy your cheesy broccoli and tomato quiche!
ingredients_list: pie, crust, broccoli, floret, cherry, tomato, halved, shredded, cheddar, cheese, egg, milk, salt, black, pepper

title: Vegan banana pancakes
raw_text: 55. Vegan banana pancakes: 300kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 ripe bananas, mashed
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup unsweetened almond milk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- coconut oil, for frying
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the mashed bananas, flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
2. add the almond milk and vanilla extract to the bowl, and stir until all the ingredients are well combined. the batter should be smooth and slightly thick.
3. heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat and lightly grease with coconut oil.
4. spoon about 1/4 cup of the batter onto the skillet for each pancake. cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook the other side until golden brown. repeat until all the batter is used.
5. serve the vegan banana pancakes warm with your favorite toppings such as maple syrup, fresh fruit, or chopped nuts. enjoy!
ingredients_list: banana, flour, sugar, baking, powder, baking, soda, salt, unsweetened, almond, milk, vanilla, extract, coconut

title: Vegan coconut and mango chia pudding
raw_text: 60. Vegan coconut and mango chia pudding: 300kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains nuts, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup of coconut milk
- ¼ cup of chia seeds
- 1 ripe mango, peeled and diced
- 2 tablespoons of maple syrup
- ¼ teaspoon of vanilla extract
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the coconut milk, chia seeds, maple syrup, and vanilla extract. stir well until all the ingredients are evenly mixed together.
2. let the mixture sit for about 5 minutes, and then stir again to prevent the chia seeds from clumping.
3. cover the bowl with plastic wrap or a lid and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or preferably overnight, to allow the chia seeds to absorb the liquid and create a pudding-like consistency.
4. after the chia pudding has set, take it out from the refrigerator and give it a good stir to make sure the texture is smooth and even.
5. in serving jars or bowls, layer the chia pudding and diced mango alternately. start with a layer of chia pudding, followed by a layer of diced mango, and repeat until all the ingredients are used.
6. you can garnish the top of the pudding with additional diced mango or any other desired toppings, like shredded coconut or sliced almonds.
7. serve chilled and enjoy your delicious vegan coconut and mango chia pudding!
ingredients_list: coconut, milk, chia, seed, mango, maple, syrup, vanilla, extract

title: Vegan chocolate peanut butter smoothie
raw_text: 62. Vegan chocolate peanut butter smoothie: 400kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains nuts, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients for vegan chocolate peanut butter smoothie:
- 1 ripe banana
- 2 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder
- 2 tablespoons peanut butter
- 1 cup non-dairy milk (such as almond milk or coconut milk)
- 1 tablespoon maple syrup or any other sweetener (optional)
- 1/2 cup ice cubes
preparation:
1. peel the banana and break it into chunks.
2. place the banana chunks, cocoa powder, peanut butter, non-dairy milk, and sweetener (if using) into a blender.
3. add the ice cubes to the blender.
4. blend the ingredients on high speed until everything is well combined and smooth.
5. if the smoothie is too thick, add more non-dairy milk until desired consistency is reached.
6. pour into glasses and serve immediately.
7. you can optionally garnish with some grated chocolate or crushed peanuts on top.
enjoy your vegan chocolate peanut butter smoothie!
ingredients_list: banana, unsweetened, cocoa, powder, peanut, butter, dairy, milk, almond, milk, coconut, milk, maple, syrup, sweetener, ice, cube

title: Tofu and vegetable breakfast burrito
raw_text: 63. Tofu and vegetable breakfast burrito: 350kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, origin: Mexico
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 block of firm tofu, drained and crumbled
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 onion, diced
- 1 cup of mixed vegetables (such as corn, peas, and carrots)
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
- 1 teaspoon of ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon of paprika
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 4 large tortillas
- toppings: salsa, avocado slices, vegan cheese (optional)
preparation:
1. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
2. add the diced onion and bell pepper to the skillet and sauté for 5 minutes or until softened.
3. add the minced garlic and crumbled tofu to the skillet and cook for another 3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. stir in the mixed vegetables, ground cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. cook for an additional 5 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
5. warm the tortillas in a separate skillet or on a griddle.
6. divide the tofu and vegetable mixture evenly between the tortillas, placing it in the center of each tortilla.
7. fold the sides of the tortillas towards the center, then roll them up tightly to form burritos.
8. serve the tofu and vegetable breakfast burritos with your favorite toppings such as salsa, avocado slices, and vegan cheese if desired. enjoy!
ingredients_list: tofu, bell, pepper, onion, vegetable, corn, pea, carrot, clove, garlic, minced, olive, ground, cumin, paprika, salt, pepper, taste, tortilla, topping, salsa, avocado, vegan, cheese

title: Vegan apple cinnamon muffins
raw_text: 64. Vegan apple cinnamon muffins: 300kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 tablespoon baking powder
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 cup vegetable oil
- 1 cup unsweetened almond milk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 1/2 cups diced apples
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c). grease or line a muffin pan with paper liners.
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt.
3. in a separate bowl, whisk together the vegetable oil, almond milk, and vanilla extract.
4. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
5. gently fold in the diced apples.
6. spoon the batter evenly into the prepared muffin pan, filling each cup about 3/4 full.
7. bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
8. remove the muffins from the oven and allow them to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, baking, powder, ground, cinnamon, salt, vegetable, unsweetened, almond, milk, vanilla, extract, apple

title: Spinach and cheese breakfast strata
raw_text: 67. Spinach and cheese breakfast strata: 350kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 slices of bread
- 2 cups of fresh spinach, chopped
- 1 cup of shredded cheese (cheddar or mozzarella)
- 6 eggs
- 2 cups of milk
- 1 teaspoon of salt
- 1/2 teaspoon of pepper
- 1/2 teaspoon of dried oregano
- 1/4 teaspoon of garlic powder
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
3. arrange half of the bread slices in a single layer at the bottom of the dish.
4. sprinkle half of the chopped spinach evenly over the bread.
5. sprinkle half of the shredded cheese over the spinach.
6. repeat the layers with the remaining bread, spinach, and cheese.
7. in a mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, pepper, dried oregano, and garlic powder until well combined.
8. pour the egg mixture evenly over the layered bread, spinach, and cheese.
9. gently press down on the bread to ensure it absorbs the liquid.
10. cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and let it sit in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or overnight to allow the flavors to meld.
11. once ready to bake, remove the dish from the refrigerator and let it sit at room temperature for 10-15 minutes.
12. bake the strata, covered with foil, for 30 minutes.
13. remove the foil and continue baking for an additional 20-25 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the eggs are set.
14. allow the strata to cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving. enjoy!
ingredients_list: bread, fresh, spinach, shredded, cheese, cheddar, mozzarella, egg, milk, salt, pepper, dried, oregano, garlic, powder

title: Apple and cinnamon French toast
raw_text: 69. Apple and cinnamon French toast: 300kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 slices of bread
- 2 eggs
- 1/4 cup milk
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1 apple, thinly sliced
- 2 tablespoons butter
- maple syrup (optional, for serving)
preparation:
1. in a shallow bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, and cinnamon.
2. dip each slice of bread into the egg mixture, making sure to coat both sides.
3. melt butter in a large pan over medium heat.
4. place the dipped bread slices into the pan and cook until golden brown on both sides, about 2-3 minutes per side.
5. remove the french toast from the pan and set aside.
6. in the same pan, add the apple slices and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
7. place the cooked apple slices on top of the french toast.
8. serve warm with maple syrup if desired. enjoy!
ingredients_list: bread, egg, milk, cinnamon, apple, thinly, butter, maple, syrup

title: Grilled halloumi and mushroom sandwich
raw_text: 72. Grilled halloumi and mushroom sandwich: 350kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: Cyprus
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 slices of halloumi cheese
- 8 large mushrooms, sliced
- 4 slices of bread (sourdough or whole wheat)
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh basil leaves, for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.
2. in a small bowl, combine the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, minced garlic, salt, and pepper. mix well.
3. place the sliced mushrooms in a large bowl and pour the marinade over them. toss to coat the mushrooms evenly.
4. place the marinated mushrooms on the grill or grill pan and cook for about 5-7 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly charred. flip them halfway through cooking.
5. while the mushrooms are grilling, place the halloumi cheese slices on the grill or grill pan and cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side until they are golden brown with grill marks.
6. remove the grilled mushrooms and halloumi from the heat and set aside.
7. toast the bread slices if desired.
8. assemble the sandwiches by placing a slice of halloumi on a slice of bread, followed by a layer of grilled mushrooms. top with another slice of bread.
9. optional: garnish with fresh basil leaves.
10. cut the sandwiches in half and serve immediately. enjoy!
ingredients_list: halloumi, cheese, mushroom, bread, sourdough, whole, wheat, olive, balsamic, vinegar, clove, garlic, minced, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, basil, leaf, garnish

title: Spinach and ricotta stuffed mushrooms
raw_text: 74. Spinach and ricotta stuffed mushrooms: 350kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: Italy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 large mushrooms
- 2 cups spinach, chopped
- 1 cup ricotta cheese
- 1/2 cup parmesan cheese, grated
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. remove stems from mushrooms and set aside. clean the mushroom caps.
3. heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat. add minced garlic and sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
4. chop the mushroom stems and add them to the pan. cook for another 2-3 minutes until softened.
5. add chopped spinach to the pan and cook until wilted.
6. in a bowl, combine the sautéed mushroom stems and spinach mixture with ricotta cheese, parmesan cheese, dried thyme, salt, and pepper. mix well.
7. place the mushroom caps on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
8. stuff the mushroom caps with the spinach and ricotta mixture, pressing it down gently.
9. bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the mushrooms are cooked through and the stuffing is golden brown on top.
10. remove from the oven and serve as a delicious appetizer or side dish. enjoy!
ingredients_list: mushroom, spinach, ricotta, cheese, parmesan, cheese, clove, garlic, minced, olive, dried, thyme, salt, pepper, taste

title: Vegan blueberry and almond breakfast cookies
raw_text: 77. Vegan blueberry and almond breakfast cookies: 250kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and nuts, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup rolled oats
- 1 cup almond flour
- 1/4 cup coconut flour
- 1/4 cup ground flaxseed
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup almond butter
- 1/4 cup maple syrup
- 1/4 cup unsweetened almond milk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 cup fresh or frozen blueberries
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the rolled oats, almond flour, coconut flour, ground flaxseed, baking powder, and salt.
3. in a separate bowl, whisk together the almond butter, maple syrup, almond milk, and vanilla extract until smooth.
4. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until well combined.
5. gently fold in the blueberries, being careful not to crush them.
6. using a tablespoon or cookie scoop, drop spoonfuls of the dough onto the prepared baking sheet, spacing them about 2 inches apart.
7. flatten each cookie slightly with the back of a spoon.
8. bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
9. remove from the oven and let cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. enjoy these vegan blueberry and almond breakfast cookies as a nutritious and delicious way to start your day!
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, almond, flour, coconut, flour, ground, flaxseed, baking, powder, salt, almond, butter, maple, syrup, unsweetened, almond, milk, vanilla, extract, fresh, frozen, blueberry

title: Broccoli and cheddar breakfast muffins
raw_text: 78. Broccoli and cheddar breakfast muffins: 350kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups broccoli florets, chopped
- 1 cup cheddar cheese, shredded
- 1/2 cup cooked bacon, crumbled
- 1/4 cup green onions, chopped
- 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 large eggs
- 1 cup milk
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter, melted
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c). grease a muffin tin or line with baking cups.
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped broccoli, shredded cheddar cheese, crumbled bacon, and green onions.
3. in a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, and black pepper.
4. make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and add the eggs, milk, and melted butter. mix everything together until just combined.
5. pour the wet mixture into the bowl with the broccoli and cheese mixture. stir gently until all the ingredients are evenly distributed.
6. spoon the batter into the prepared muffin tin, filling each cup about 3/4 full.
7. place the muffin tin in the preheated oven and bake for 18-20 minutes, or until the muffins are golden brown and cooked through. use a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin to check for doneness.
8. remove the muffins from the oven and let them cool in the tin for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. serve the broccoli and cheddar breakfast muffins warm or at room temperature. enjoy!
ingredients_list: broccoli, floret, cheddar, cheese, shredded, bacon, green, onion, flour, baking, powder, salt, black, pepper, egg, milk, unsalted, butter

title: Tomato and cream cheese breakfast tart
raw_text: 82. Tomato and cream cheese breakfast tart: 350kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 sheet puff pastry
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1/2 cup cream cheese
- 1 tablespoon chopped fresh basil
- salt and pepper, to taste
- olive oil, for brushing
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c). 
2. roll out the puff pastry and transfer it to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
3. spread the cream cheese evenly over the puff pastry, leaving a small border around the edges.
4. arrange the cherry tomatoes on top of the cream cheese.
5. sprinkle the chopped basil, salt, and pepper over the tomatoes.
6. drizzle a little olive oil over the tart.
7. fold in the edges of the puff pastry slightly to create a border.
8. brush the edges of the pastry with olive oil.
9. bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown and crispy.
10. remove from the oven and let it cool slightly before serving.
11. cut into slices and serve warm as a delicious breakfast tart. enjoy!
ingredients_list: puff, pastry, cherry, tomato, halved, cream, cheese, fresh, basil, salt, pepper, taste, olive, brushing

title: Vegan spinach and mushroom breakfast sandwich
raw_text: 83. Vegan spinach and mushroom breakfast sandwich: 350kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 cup sliced mushrooms
- 2 cups spinach leaves
- 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 4 slices of vegan bread
- vegan mayonnaise or any preferred vegan spread
- sliced tomatoes, for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
2. add the sliced mushrooms and cook until they become tender and browned, usually around 5-7 minutes.
3. stir in the spinach leaves and cook until they wilt, approximately 2-3 minutes.
4. season the mushroom and spinach mixture with garlic powder, salt, and pepper to taste. remove from heat.
5. toast the slices of vegan bread until they become golden brown.
6. spread vegan mayonnaise or any preferred vegan spread on each slice of toast.
7. divide the mushroom and spinach mixture evenly and place on two slices of toast.
8. top with sliced tomatoes if desired.
9. cover with the remaining slices of toast to create a sandwich.
10. cut the sandwich in half and serve warm.

enjoy your vegan spinach and mushroom breakfast sandwich!
ingredients_list: olive, mushroom, spinach, leaf, garlic, powder, salt, pepper, taste, vegan, bread, vegan, mayonnaise, vegan, spread, tomato, garnish

title: Chocolate chip banana bread
raw_text: 84. Chocolate chip banana bread: 300kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, softened
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 4 ripe bananas, mashed
- 1/4 cup sour cream
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 cup chocolate chips
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c). grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan.
2. in a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt. set aside.
3. in a large mixing bowl, cream together the softened butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
4. add the eggs to the butter mixture, one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
5. stir in the mashed bananas, sour cream, and vanilla extract until well combined.
6. gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, stirring until just combined. be careful not to overmix.
7. gently fold in the chocolate chips.
8. pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan and smooth the top.
9. bake in the preheated oven for 60-70 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
10. remove the banana bread from the oven and let it cool in the pan for about 10 minutes.
11. transfer the bread to a wire rack to cool completely before slicing and serving. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, baking, soda, salt, unsalted, butter, sugar, egg, banana, sour, cream, vanilla, extract, chocolate, chip

title: Broccoli and cheddar breakfast quesadilla
raw_text: 91. Broccoli and cheddar breakfast quesadilla: 350kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Mexico
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large flour tortillas
- 1 cup broccoli florets, chopped
- 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 2 eggs, beaten
- salt and pepper to taste
- olive oil for cooking
preparation:
1. heat a small amount of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
2. add the chopped broccoli florets to the skillet and sauté for about 3-4 minutes until tender. remove from heat.
3. in a separate bowl, beat the eggs and season with salt and pepper.
4. in the same skillet, pour the beaten eggs and cook until scrambled. remove from heat.
5. lay one flour tortilla on a clean surface and sprinkle half of the shredded cheddar cheese on one half of the tortilla.
6. spread half of the scrambled eggs and half of the sautéed broccoli florets on top of the cheese.
7. fold the other half of the tortilla over the filling to form a half-circle shape.
8. repeat steps 5-7 with the remaining tortilla and the rest of the ingredients.
9. heat a little olive oil in a large skillet or griddle over medium-high heat.
10. carefully transfer one quesadilla to the skillet and cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side until the tortilla is golden brown and the cheese is melted.
11. remove the cooked quesadilla from the skillet and repeat with the second one.
12. once both quesadillas are cooked, let them cool for a minute before cutting them into wedges.
13. serve the broccoli and cheddar breakfast quesadillas warm and enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, tortilla, broccoli, floret, shredded, cheddar, cheese, egg, salt, pepper, taste, olive

title: Vegan blueberry and lemon muffins
raw_text: 92. Vegan blueberry and lemon muffins: 300kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients for vegan blueberry and lemon muffins:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 2 tsp baking powder
- 1/2 tsp baking soda
- 1/4 tsp salt
- 1 cup plant-based milk (such as almond or soy milk)
- 1/4 cup lemon juice
- 1/4 cup vegetable oil
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- zest of 1 lemon
- 1 cup fresh blueberries
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c) and line a muffin tin with muffin liners.
2. in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
3. in a separate bowl, mix together the plant-based milk, lemon juice, vegetable oil, vanilla extract, and lemon zest.
4. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. do not overmix; a few lumps are okay.
5. gently fold in the fresh blueberries.
6. spoon the batter into the muffin tin, filling each cup about 3/4 full.
7. optional: sprinkle some additional sugar on top of each muffin for a sweet crunchy topping.
8. bake for about 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
9. allow the muffins to cool in the tin for a few minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. enjoy your vegan blueberry and lemon muffins!
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, baking, powder, baking, soda, salt, plant, milk, almond, soy, milk, lemon, vegetable, vanilla, extract, zest, lemon, fresh, blueberry

title: Spinach and mushroom breakfast sandwich
raw_text: 93. Spinach and mushroom breakfast sandwich: 350kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 english muffins
- 4 large eggs
- 1 cup spinach leaves
- 4-6 button mushrooms, sliced
- 2 slices cheddar cheese
- salt and pepper to taste
- butter or cooking oil for frying
preparation:
1. heat a skillet over medium heat and add a little butter or cooking oil.
2. add the sliced mushrooms and cook until they start to brown, about 4-5 minutes. remove from the skillet and set aside.
3. in the same skillet, add the spinach leaves and cook until wilted, about 2-3 minutes. remove from the skillet and set aside.
4. crack the eggs into a bowl and whisk them together. season with salt and pepper.
5. in the same skillet, melt a little more butter or add cooking oil if needed. pour the whisked eggs into the skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, until they are scrambled and cooked to your liking.
6. split the english muffins in half and toast them. 
7. on each english muffin half, layer 1/4 of the scrambled eggs, a slice of cheese, sautéed mushrooms, and wilted spinach.
8. top with the other half of the english muffin. serve immediately and enjoy your spinach and mushroom breakfast sandwich!
ingredients_list: muffin, egg, spinach, leaf, mushroom, cheddar, cheese, salt, pepper, taste, butter

title: Vegan sweet potato and black bean breakfast burrito
raw_text: 94. Vegan sweet potato and black bean breakfast burrito: 400kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, origin: Mexico
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 large sweet potato, peeled and diced
- 1 can black beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 small red onion, diced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 4 large tortillas (flour or corn)
- avocado slices, for serving
- fresh cilantro, for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. place the diced sweet potato on a baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil. sprinkle with salt and pepper and toss to coat. roast in the oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until tender and slightly browned.
3. meanwhile, heat a tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. add the diced red onion and bell pepper and sauté for 5-6 minutes, until softened. add the minced garlic and cook for an additional minute.
4. stir in the black beans, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. cook for 3-4 minutes, until heated through.
5. once the sweet potatoes are done roasting, add them to the skillet with the black bean mixture. stir to combine and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
6. warm the tortillas in a dry skillet or in the oven for a few seconds to make them pliable.
7. scoop a generous amount of the sweet potato and black bean mixture onto each tortilla. top with avocado slices and fresh cilantro.
8. fold the sides of the tortilla inward and roll tightly to form a burrito.
9. serve immediately and enjoy your delicious vegan sweet potato and black bean breakfast burrito!
ingredients_list: sweet, potato, black, bean, red, onion, red, bell, pepper, clove, garlic, minced, cumin, paprika, salt, pepper, taste, tortilla, flour, corn, avocado, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Raspberry and almond breakfast cake
raw_text: 95. Raspberry and almond breakfast cake: 300kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and nuts, origin: -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup almond flour
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, softened
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1 cup fresh raspberries
- 1/4 cup sliced almonds
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c). grease and flour a 9-inch round cake pan.
2. in a medium-sized bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, almond flour, baking powder, and salt. set aside.
3. in a large bowl, cream together the softened butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
4. add the eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition. stir in the vanilla extract.
5. gradually add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture, alternating with the milk. begin and end with the dry ingredients, mixing just until combined.
6. gently fold in the fresh raspberries, being careful not to crush them.
7. pour the batter into the prepared cake pan, spreading it evenly.
8. sprinkle the sliced almonds over the top of the batter.
9. bake in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
10. remove the cake from the oven and let it cool in the pan for 10 minutes.
11. carefully transfer the cake to a wire rack to cool completely before serving.

enjoy your delicious raspberry and almond breakfast cake!
ingredients_list: flour, almond, flour, baking, powder, salt, unsalted, butter, sugar, egg, vanilla, extract, milk, fresh, raspberry, almond

title: Vegetable Scramble
raw_text: 5. Vegetable Scramble: 250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains eggs. Origin: Various.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 zucchini, diced
- 1 cup mushrooms, sliced
- 1 cup spinach, chopped
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 4 large eggs
- 1/4 cup shredded cheese (optional)
preparation:
1. heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. add diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet. sauté until the onion becomes translucent.
3. add bell pepper, zucchini, and mushrooms to the skillet. sauté for about 5 minutes, or until the vegetables are slightly tender.
4. stir in chopped spinach and season with salt and pepper. cook for an additional 2 minutes until the spinach wilts.
5. in a separate bowl, beat the eggs with a fork until well mixed. pour the eggs over the sautéed vegetables in the skillet.
6. cook the mixture, stirring occasionally, until the eggs are cooked to your desired consistency. some prefer a soft scramble, while others prefer a firmer scramble.
7. optional: sprinkle shredded cheese on top of the vegetable scramble and cover the skillet for a minute until the cheese melts.
8. season with additional salt and pepper if needed.
9. serve the vegetable scramble hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, bell, pepper, zucchini, mushroom, spinach, salt, pepper, taste, egg, shredded, cheese

title: Mushroom and Tomato Omelette
raw_text: 21. Mushroom and Tomato Omelette: 300 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains eggs. Origin: Various.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 eggs
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1/4 cup sliced mushrooms
- 1/4 cup diced tomatoes
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 tablespoon chopped parsley (optional)
preparation:
1. in a bowl, beat the eggs until well mixed. season with salt and pepper.
2. heat the olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
3. add the mushrooms and sauté for about 2-3 minutes until they start to brown.
4. add the tomatoes and cook for another 2 minutes until they soften.
5. pour the beaten eggs over the mushrooms and tomatoes in the skillet.
6. let the eggs cook undisturbed for about 2-3 minutes, or until the edges start to set.
7. gently lift the edges of the omelette with a spatula and tilt the skillet to allow the uncooked egg to flow underneath.
8. once the omelette is mostly set but still slightly runny on top, carefully fold it in half using the spatula.
9. cook for an additional minute or until the eggs are fully cooked and the omelette is lightly browned.
10. transfer the omelette to a plate and garnish with chopped parsley, if desired.
11. serve hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: egg, olive, mushroom, tomato, salt, pepper, taste, parsley

title: Banana Pancakes
raw_text: 23. Banana Pancakes: 300 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat and dairy. Origin: Various.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 large ripe banana
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 tablespoon granulated sugar
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup milk
- 1 large egg
- 1 tablespoon melted butter
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, mash the ripe banana until smooth.
2. add the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt to the bowl with the mashed banana. mix well.
3. in a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, egg, and melted butter.
4. pour the wet ingredients into the banana mixture and stir until just combined. do not overmix, a few lumps are okay.
5. heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat. you can lightly grease it with butter or cooking spray if necessary.
6. ladle about 1/4 cup of the pancake batter onto the hot pan for each pancake. 
7. cook until bubbles form on the surface of the pancakes, then flip and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until golden brown.
8. serve the banana pancakes warm with your favorite toppings, such as sliced bananas, maple syrup, or honey.
9. enjoy!
ingredients_list: banana, flour, sugar, baking, powder, salt, milk, egg, butter

title: French Toast
raw_text: 24. French Toast: 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat and dairy. Origin: France.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 thick slices of bread
- 2 large eggs
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- pinch of salt
- butter, for cooking
- maple syrup, for serving
preparation:
1. in a shallow dish, whisk together the eggs, milk, vanilla extract, ground cinnamon, and salt.
2. heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat and melt a knob of butter.
3. dip each slice of bread into the egg mixture, making sure both sides are coated.
4. place the coated bread slices in the hot skillet or griddle and cook until golden brown on each side, about 2-3 minutes per side.
5. repeat step 4 for each slice of bread, adding more butter to the skillet or griddle if needed.
6. serve the french toast immediately with maple syrup drizzled on top. enjoy!
ingredients_list: bread, egg, milk, vanilla, extract, ground, cinnamon, pinch, salt, butter, maple, syrup

title: Feta and Spinach Muffins
raw_text: 26. Feta and Spinach Muffins: 300 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat and dairy. Origin: Greece.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 tablespoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 cup fresh spinach, chopped
- 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup milk
- 1/4 cup olive oil
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c) and grease a muffin tin.
2. in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, and black pepper.
3. add the chopped spinach, crumbled feta cheese, and grated parmesan cheese to the dry ingredients. mix well.
4. in a separate bowl, beat the eggs. then, add the milk and olive oil. mix thoroughly.
5. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. be careful not to overmix.
6. spoon the batter into the greased muffin tin, filling each cup about 3/4 full.
7. bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
8. remove from the oven and let the muffins cool in the tin for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. serve the feta and spinach muffins warm or at room temperature. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, baking, powder, salt, black, pepper, fresh, spinach, feta, cheese, parmesan, cheese, egg, milk, olive

title: Zucchini and Parmesan Muffins
raw_text: 30. Zucchini and Parmesan Muffins: 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat and dairy. Origin: Italy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper
- 1 cup grated zucchini
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 1/4 cup olive oil
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c) and grease a muffin tin or line it with paper liners.
2. in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and black pepper.
3. add the grated zucchini, parmesan cheese, and chopped basil to the dry ingredients. mix well to combine.
4. in a separate bowl, beat the eggs. then add the buttermilk and olive oil. whisk until well combined.
5. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. stir until just combined, being careful not to overmix.
6. spoon the batter into the prepared muffin tin, filling each cup about 2/3 full.
7. bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
8. remove from the oven and let the muffins cool in the tin for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. serve the zucchini and parmesan muffins warm or at room temperature. enjoy!

title: Tomato Basil Quiche
raw_text: 31. Tomato Basil Quiche: 400 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains eggs and dairy. Origin: France.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pie crust
- 4 large tomatoes, sliced
- 1 cup fresh basil leaves, chopped
- 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1 cup milk
- 4 eggs
- ½ teaspoon salt
- ¼ teaspoon black pepper
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. roll out the pie crust and press it into a 9-inch pie dish.
3. arrange the tomato slices evenly over the pie crust.
4. sprinkle the chopped basil leaves over the tomatoes.
5. in a medium bowl, whisk together the milk, eggs, salt, and black pepper.
6. pour the egg mixture over the tomatoes and basil.
7. sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese over the top.
8. bake in the preheated oven for about 40-45 minutes, or until the quiche is golden and set in the center.
9. allow the quiche to cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
10. enjoy the tomato basil quiche warm or at room temperature.
ingredients_list: pie, crust, tomato, fresh, basil, leaf, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, milk, egg, salt, black, pepper

title: Sourdough Toast with Almond Butter
raw_text: 32. Sourdough Toast with Almond Butter: 250 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains wheat and nuts. Origin: Various.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 slices of sourdough bread
- 4 tablespoons almond butter
preparation:
1. toast the sourdough bread slices in a toaster or on a stovetop until golden brown.
2. spread 2 tablespoons of almond butter on each slice of toasted sourdough bread.
3. serve the sourdough toast with almond butter immediately and enjoy!

title: Maple Pecan Granola with Yogurt
raw_text: 33. Maple Pecan Granola with Yogurt: 350 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains nuts. Origin: Canada.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups rolled oats
- 1 cup pecans, chopped
- 1/2 cup pure maple syrup
- 1/4 cup coconut oil, melted
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup yogurt of your choice
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 325°f (160°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a large bowl, combine the rolled oats and chopped pecans.
3. in a separate small bowl, whisk together the maple syrup, melted coconut oil, vanilla extract, and salt.
4. pour the maple syrup mixture over the oats and pecans, and stir until well combined.
5. spread the mixture evenly on the prepared baking sheet.
6. bake for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown, stirring halfway through to ensure even cooking.
7. remove from the oven and let cool completely.
8. once cooled, transfer the granola to an airtight container.
9. serve with yogurt and enjoy!

note: you can store the maple pecan granola in an airtight container for up to two weeks.
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, pecan, pure, maple, syrup, coconut, vanilla, extract, salt, yogurt

title: Chia Seed Pancakes
raw_text: 34. Chia Seed Pancakes: 300 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat. Origin: Various.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 tablespoons chia seeds
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup milk
- 2 tablespoons oil
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, chia seeds, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
2. in a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, oil, and vanilla extract.
3. add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
4. let the batter sit for about 5 minutes to allow the chia seeds to soften and absorb some of the liquid.
5. heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat.
6. spoon about 1/4 cup of batter onto the skillet for each pancake.
7. cook until bubbles form on the surface of the pancake, then flip and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until golden brown.
8. repeat with the remaining batter, adding more oil to the skillet if necessary.
9. serve the chia seed pancakes warm with your favorite toppings, such as maple syrup, fresh fruit, or yogurt. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, chia, seed, sugar, baking, powder, salt, milk, vanilla, extract

title: Baked Oatmeal
raw_text: 35. Baked Oatmeal: 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts. Origin: Various.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups rolled oats
- 1/2 cup packed brown sugar 
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon 
- 1/2 teaspoon salt 
- 1 cup milk 
- 1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce 
- 1/4 cup melted butter 
- 2 tablespoons honey 
- 1 large egg 
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 
- 1/2 cup dried cranberries (optional)
- 1/2 cup chopped nuts (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine rolled oats, brown sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt.
3. in a separate bowl, whisk together milk, applesauce, melted butter, honey, egg, and vanilla extract.
4. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until well combined.
5. if desired, stir in dried cranberries and chopped nuts.
6. grease a 9x9-inch baking dish and pour the oatmeal mixture into it, spreading it evenly.
7. bake for about 30-35 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the center is set.
8. remove from the oven and let it cool slightly before serving.
9. cut into squares and serve warm. enjoy!

title: Aloo Paratha (Potato Stuffed Flatbread)
raw_text: 38. Aloo Paratha (Potato Stuffed Flatbread): 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat. Origin: India.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups whole wheat flour
- 1 cup mashed potatoes
- 1 teaspoon cumin powder
- 1 teaspoon coriander powder
- 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
- 1/2 teaspoon garam masala
- salt, to taste
- water, as needed
- ghee or oil, for cooking
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat flour and a pinch of salt. slowly add water and knead the flour to form a soft dough. set it aside for 15-20 minutes to rest.
2. in a separate bowl, mix the mashed potatoes, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. mix everything well until the spices are evenly incorporated into the potatoes.
3. divide the dough and potato mixture into equal portions. taking one portion of the dough, roll it into a small circle on a lightly floured surface.
4. place a portion of the potato filling in the center of the circle. bring the edges of the dough together and seal it properly, ensuring the filling is completely enclosed.
5. gently flatten the filled dough ball and roll it out into a flatbread, approximately 6-8 inches in diameter, using a rolling pin and additional flour, if necessary.
6. heat a tawa or skillet over medium heat. place the rolled paratha on the hot tawa and cook for about 1-2 minutes or until you notice small bubbles forming.
7. flip the paratha and brush some ghee or oil on top. cook for another 1-2 minutes, pressing down gently with a spatula to help it cook evenly.
8. repeat the process for the remaining dough and filling.
9. serve the hot aloo paratha with yogurt, pickle, or any desired side dish. enjoy!
ingredients_list: whole, wheat, flour, potato, cumin, powder, coriander, powder, red, chili, powder, turmeric, powder, garam, masala, salt, taste, water, needed, ghee

title: Veggie Breakfast Wrap
raw_text: 39. Veggie Breakfast Wrap: 350 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains wheat. Origin: Various.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 large tortilla wrap
- 1/2 cup of diced bell peppers
- 1/2 cup of diced onions
- 1/2 cup of diced tomatoes
- 1/2 cup of sliced mushrooms
- 1/2 cup of baby spinach leaves
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1/4 cup of shredded cheddar cheese (optional)
preparation:
1. heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. add the diced bell peppers, onions, tomatoes, and mushrooms to the skillet. sauté them for about 5 minutes or until they are tender.
3. add the baby spinach leaves to the skillet and cook until wilted.
4. season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
5. meanwhile, heat the tortilla wrap slightly in a separate skillet or in the microwave for a few seconds.
6. place the cooked vegetable mixture in the center of the tortilla wrap.
7. if desired, sprinkle the shredded cheddar cheese on top of the vegetables.
8. roll the tortilla wrap tightly, folding in the sides as you go.
9. heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil in the skillet over medium heat.
10. place the wrapped breakfast burrito seam-side down in the skillet and cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until the tortilla is crisp and golden.
11. remove from the skillet and allow it to cool slightly before serving.
12. slice it in half diagonally or into smaller pieces, if desired.
13. serve the veggie breakfast wrap warm and enjoy!
ingredients_list: tortilla, wrap, bell, pepper, onion, tomato, mushroom, baby, spinach, leaf, olive, salt, pepper, taste, shredded, cheddar, cheese

title: Cranberry Orange Muffins
raw_text: 40. Cranberry Orange Muffins: 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat and nuts. Origin: Various.
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 1 cup cranberries, fresh or frozen
- 2 oranges, zest and juice
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 1/2 cup milk
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2 eggs
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c). grease or line a muffin tin with paper liners.
2. in a bowl, combine the cranberries, orange zest, and orange juice. set aside for about 10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
3. in a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
4. make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and add the melted butter, milk, vanilla extract, and eggs. stir until just combined.
5. fold in the cranberry-orange mixture, being careful not to overmix. the batter will be thick and lumpy.
6. spoon the batter into the prepared muffin tin, filling each about 2/3 full.
7. bake for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
8. allow the muffins to cool in the tin for a few minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. serve and enjoy these delicious cranberry orange muffins!
ingredients_list: cranberry, fresh, frozen, orange, zest, flour, sugar, unsalted, butter, milk, baking, powder, vanilla, extract, salt, egg

title: Mexican Sopes
raw_text: 41. Mexican Sopes: 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat. Origin: Mexico.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups masa harina (corn flour)
- 1 1/4 cups warm water
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup refried beans
- 1/2 cup cooked shredded chicken or beef
- 1/2 cup crumbled queso fresco (fresh cheese)
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
- 1/4 cup diced tomatoes
- 1/4 cup diced onions
- 1 avocado, sliced
- 1 jalapeno, sliced (optional)
- vegetable oil for frying
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, mix the masa harina, warm water, and salt until a soft dough is formed. let it rest for 10 minutes.
2. take a small handful of the dough, about golf ball size, and shape it into a disk about 1/4 inch thick. repeat with the remaining dough.
3. heat vegetable oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. fry the dough disks for about 2-3 minutes on each side until golden brown. remove from the pan and drain on paper towels.
4. once the sopes have cooled slightly, press down the center of each one to create a small well.
5. heat a small amount of vegetable oil in a separate pan and sauté the diced onions until translucent. add the cooked shredded chicken or beef and heat through.
6. spread a spoonful of refried beans over each sope, leaving the well in the center. top with the sautéed meat, crumbled queso fresco, chopped cilantro, diced tomatoes, sliced avocado, and jalapeno (if desired).
7. serve the mexican sopes as an appetizer or main course. enjoy!
ingredients_list: masa, harina, corn, flour, water, salt, refried, bean, shredded, chicken, beef, queso, fresco, fresh, cheese, fresh, cilantro, tomato, onion, avocado, jalapeno, vegetable

title: Nutella Stuffed French Toast
raw_text: 44. Nutella Stuffed French Toast: 450 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat and nuts. Origin: France.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 slices of thick cut bread
- nutella
- 2 eggs
- 1/4 cup milk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- butter for cooking
preparation:
1. spread a generous amount of nutella on two slices of bread. 
2. place the remaining two slices on top, creating two nutella sandwiches. press firmly to seal the edges.
3. in a shallow dish, whisk together the eggs, milk, and vanilla extract until well combined.
4. melt a small amount of butter in a large skillet or griddle over medium heat.
5. dip each nutella sandwich into the egg mixture, ensuring both sides are coated.
6. place the coated sandwiches onto the heated skillet and cook until golden brown on each side, about 2-3 minutes per side.
7. remove from heat and let cool for a minute or two to allow the nutella to set slightly.
8. serve warm and enjoy! optionally, you can dust the french toast with powdered sugar or drizzle with maple syrup.
ingredients_list: bread, nutella, egg, milk, vanilla, extract, butter

title: Baked Egg in Avocado
raw_text: 48. Baked Egg in Avocado: 300 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains eggs. Origin: Various.
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 2 ripe avocados
- 4 medium eggs
- salt and pepper, to taste
- optional toppings: chopped fresh herbs (such as chives or parsley), shredded cheese, hot sauce
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 425°f (220°c).
2. cut the avocados in half lengthwise and remove the pit. scoop out a little bit of flesh from each avocado half to make room for the egg.
3. place the avocado halves in a baking dish or on a baking sheet, making sure they’re stable and won't tip over.
4. crack one egg into each avocado half, ensuring the yolk stays intact. if your avocado halves are small, you may need to remove a little bit more flesh to fit the whole egg.
5. season the eggs with salt and pepper to taste.
6. bake the avocados in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the egg whites are set and the yolks are still slightly runny.
7. remove the avocado halves from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
8. add your preferred toppings if desired, such as chopped fresh herbs, shredded cheese, or hot sauce.
9. serve the baked egg in avocado halves immediately, while they’re still warm and creamy. enjoy!
ingredients_list: avocado, egg, salt, pepper, taste, topping, fresh, herb, chive, parsley, shredded, cheese, hot, sauce

title: Greek Yogurt with Fig Compote
raw_text: 49. Greek Yogurt with Fig Compote: 350 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains dairy. Origin: Greece.
ingredients:
ingredients for greek yogurt with fig compote: 

- 1 cup greek yogurt 
- 1/4 cup honey 
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 
- 1 cup fresh figs, chopped 
- 1/4 cup water 
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice 
- 2 tablespoons sugar 
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon 
- 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
preparation:
1. in a small saucepan, combine the chopped figs, water, lemon juice, sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg. 
2. bring the mixture to a simmer over medium heat, stirring occasionally. 
3. reduce the heat to low and let the compote simmer for about 10 minutes, or until the figs are soft and the liquid has thickened slightly. 
4. remove the compote from heat and let it cool to room temperature. 
5. in a separate bowl, combine the greek yogurt, honey, and vanilla extract. stir well to combine. 
6. divide the yogurt mixture into serving bowls or glasses. 
7. top each serving with a spoonful of the fig compote. 
8. serve the greek yogurt with fig compote immediately or refrigerate for a few hours to allow the flavors to meld before serving. enjoy!
ingredients_list: greek, yogurt, honey, vanilla, extract, fresh, fig, water, lemon, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg

title: Vegetarian Breakfast Strata
raw_text: 50. Vegetarian Breakfast Strata: 400 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains wheat and dairy. Origin: USA.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 slices of bread, preferably stale
- 1 cup of shredded cheddar cheese
- 1 cup of diced vegetables (such as bell peppers, onions, spinach)
- 1 cup of diced mushrooms
- 6 large eggs
- 2 cups of milk
- 1 teaspoon of dijon mustard
- 1/2 teaspoon of salt
- 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon of dried thyme
- 1/4 teaspoon of dried oregano
preparation:
1. grease a 9x13 inch baking dish and preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. lay half of the bread slices in a single layer on the bottom of the baking dish.
3. sprinkle half of the shredded cheese evenly over the bread.
4. layer half of the diced vegetables and mushrooms over the cheese.
5. place the remaining bread slices on top of the vegetable layer.
6. sprinkle the remaining cheese over the bread.
7. layer the remaining vegetables and mushrooms on top.
8. in a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, dijon mustard, salt, black pepper, dried thyme, and dried oregano.
9. pour the egg mixture evenly over the layered ingredients in the baking dish, making sure to soak all the bread.
10. cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight, allowing the bread to absorb the liquid.
11. when ready to bake, remove the baking dish from the refrigerator and let it sit at room temperature while the oven preheats.
12. bake for 40-45 minutes, or until the strata has set and the top is golden brown.
13. allow the strata to cool for a few minutes before slicing.
14. serve warm and enjoy a delicious vegetarian breakfast strata!
ingredients_list: bread, preferably, shredded, cheddar, cheese, vegetable, bell, pepper, onion, spinach, mushroom, egg, milk, dijon, mustard, salt, black, pepper, dried, thyme, dried, oregano

title: Mushroom and Spinach Breakfast Quesadilla
raw_text: 51. Mushroom and Spinach Breakfast Quesadilla: 350 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains wheat and dairy. Origin: Mexico.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large flour tortillas
- 4 large eggs
- 1 cup baby spinach, chopped
- 1 cup sliced mushrooms
- 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- salt and pepper to taste
- olive oil for cooking
preparation:
1. in a medium-sized skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
2. add the sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook until they start to brown, about 5 minutes.
3. add the chopped spinach to the skillet and sauté until wilted, about 2 minutes.
4. season the mushrooms and spinach with salt and pepper to taste. remove them from the skillet and set aside.
5. in a separate bowl, beat the eggs and season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
6. wipe the skillet clean with a paper towel and add a little more olive oil.
7. pour the beaten eggs into the skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, until they are scrambled and cooked to your liking.
8. remove the scrambled eggs from the skillet and set aside.
9. place one tortilla in the skillet and sprinkle half of the shredded cheese on top.
10. spread half of the cooked mushrooms, spinach, and scrambled eggs evenly over the cheese.
11. sprinkle the remaining shredded cheese on top and cover with the second tortilla.
12. cook the quesadilla over medium heat until the bottom tortilla is golden brown, about 3-4 minutes.
13. carefully flip the quesadilla to cook the other side until golden brown and the cheese is melted.
14. remove from the skillet and let it cool for a minute.
15. cut the quesadilla into wedges and serve hot. enjoy your mushroom and spinach breakfast quesadilla!
ingredients_list: flour, tortilla, egg, baby, spinach, mushroom, shredded, cheddar, cheese, salt, pepper, taste, olive

title: Irish Soda Bread
raw_text: 52. Irish Soda Bread: 300 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat. Origin: Ireland.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 2 cups buttermilk
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c) and lightly grease a baking sheet.
2. in a large bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and salt.
3. slowly add the buttermilk to the dry ingredients. mix until a soft dough forms.
4. turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead it gently for about a minute.
5. shape the dough into a round loaf and place it on the prepared baking sheet.
6. use a sharp knife to make a deep cross in the top of the loaf, about 1 inch deep.
7. bake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped on the bottom.
8. remove from the oven and cool on a wire rack before serving.
ingredients_list: flour, baking, soda, salt, buttermilk

title: Banana Chia Pancakes
raw_text: 54. Banana Chia Pancakes: 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat. Origin: Various.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 ripe bananas
- 2 eggs
- 1/4 cup chia seeds
- 1/4 cup flour (all-purpose or gluten-free)
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon (optional)
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 cup milk (dairy or non-dairy)
- 1 tablespoon maple syrup (optional)
- cooking oil or butter for frying
preparation:
1. in a medium bowl, mash the bananas until smooth.
2. add the eggs to the mashed bananas and whisk well.
3. mix in the chia seeds and let the mixture sit for about 5 minutes to allow the chia seeds to absorb some moisture.
4. in a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, cinnamon (if using), and salt.
5. gradually add the flour mixture into the banana mixture, stirring until well combined.
6. stir in the milk and maple syrup (if using) until the batter is smooth.
7. heat a frying pan or skillet over medium heat and lightly grease with cooking oil or butter.
8. spoon about 1/4 cup of the pancake batter onto the pan for each pancake.
9. cook for about 2-3 minutes, until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, until golden brown.
10. repeat with the remaining batter, adding more oil or butter to the pan as needed.
11. serve the pancakes warm with your favorite toppings, such as sliced bananas, maple syrup, or a dollop of yogurt. enjoy!
ingredients_list: banana, egg, chia, seed, flour, gluten, baking, powder, cinnamon, salt, milk, dairy, dairy, maple, syrup, butter

title: Broccoli and Cheese Frittata
raw_text: 55. Broccoli and Cheese Frittata: 350 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains eggs and dairy. Origin: Various.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 6 large eggs
- 1 cup chopped broccoli
- 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 1/4 cup milk
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1/2 small onion, diced
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a medium-sized mixing bowl, beat the eggs and milk together. season with salt and pepper.
3. heat the olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
4. add the diced onion and sauté until translucent, about 2-3 minutes.
5. stir in the chopped broccoli and cook for another 2-3 minutes until slightly tender.
6. pour the beaten eggs over the sautéed vegetables in the skillet.
7. sprinkle shredded cheddar cheese evenly over the top.
8. cook on the stovetop for about 5 minutes until the edges start to set.
9. transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes or until the frittata is set in the center and the cheese is melted and slightly golden.
10. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing into wedges.
11. serve warm and enjoy!
ingredients_list: egg, broccoli, shredded, cheddar, cheese, milk, salt, pepper, taste, olive, onion

title: Chocolate Chip Muffins
raw_text: 58. Chocolate Chip Muffins: 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat. Origin: USA.
ingredients:
ingredients:
1 3/4 cup all-purpose flour
1/2 cup granulated sugar
1/2 cup packed brown sugar
1 teaspoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted
2 large eggs
1 cup milk
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 cup chocolate chips
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c). line a muffin tin with paper liners.
2. in a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, granulated sugar, brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
3. in a separate bowl, whisk together the melted butter, eggs, milk, and vanilla extract.
4. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. do not overmix.
5. fold in the chocolate chips.
6. scoop the batter evenly into the prepared muffin tin, filling each liner about 3/4 full.
7. bake in the preheated oven for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
8. remove from the oven and allow the muffins to cool in the tin for 5 minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. enjoy the delicious chocolate chip muffins!
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, brown, sugar, baking, powder, baking, soda, salt, unsalted, butter, egg, milk, vanilla, extract, chocolate, chip

title: Almond Croissant
raw_text: 63. Almond Croissant: 400 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains wheat and nuts. Origin: France.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large croissants
- 1/2 cup almond paste
- 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened
- 2 tablespoons powdered sugar
- 1/4 cup sliced almonds
- 1/4 cup powdered sugar, for dusting
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c). line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. slice each croissant in half horizontally, creating a top and bottom half.
3. in a small bowl, mix together the almond paste, softened butter, and powdered sugar until well combined.
4. spread the almond mixture evenly onto the bottom half of each croissant.
5. place the top half of the croissants back on, pressing gently to seal.
6. place the filled croissants onto the prepared baking sheet. sprinkle the sliced almonds over the top of each croissant.
7. bake in the preheated oven for about 15 minutes, or until the croissants are golden brown and the almond filling is slightly melted.
8. remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes. dust the croissants with powdered sugar before serving.
9. enjoy your delicious almond croissants!
ingredients_list: croissant, almond, paste, unsalted, butter, sugar, almond, sugar

title: Vegetarian Quiche Lorraine
raw_text: 64. Vegetarian Quiche Lorraine: 400 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains eggs and dairy. Origin: France.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pie crust
- 1 cup shredded vegetarian bacon (such as tempeh or seitan)
- 1 small onion, diced
- 1 cup shredded swiss cheese
- 4 large eggs
- 1 cup milk (dairy or plant-based)
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c). place the pie crust into a 9-inch pie dish and set it aside.
2. in a skillet, cook the vegetarian bacon according to the package instructions until crispy. remove from the skillet and set aside.
3. in the same skillet, sauté the diced onion until it becomes translucent. remove from heat and set aside.
4. sprinkle the shredded swiss cheese over the bottom of the pie crust. follow with the cooked vegetarian bacon and sautéed onion, evenly distributing them over the cheese.
5. in a mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, pepper, and nutmeg until well combined.
6. pour the egg mixture over the cheese, bacon, and onions in the pie crust, ensuring everything is evenly distributed.
7. carefully transfer the quiche to the preheated oven. bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the filling is set.
8. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

enjoy your vegetarian quiche lorraine!
ingredients_list: pie, crust, shredded, vegetarian, bacon, tempeh, seitan, onion, shredded, swiss, cheese, egg, milk, dairy, plant, salt, ground, black, pepper, ground, nutmeg

title: Lemon Poppy Seed Pancakes
raw_text: 65. Lemon Poppy Seed Pancakes: 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat. Origin: Various.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 1 tablespoon poppy seeds
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 1/4 cup fresh lemon juice
- zest of 1 lemon
- 1 large egg
- 2 tablespoons melted butter
- butter or cooking spray, for greasing the pan
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, poppy seeds, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
2. in a separate bowl, combine the buttermilk, lemon juice, lemon zest, egg, and melted butter. mix well.
3. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and gently fold until just combined. do not overmix; lumps are okay.
4. heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat and grease it with butter or cooking spray.
5. spoon about 1/4 cup of batter onto the hot skillet for each pancake. cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until golden brown.
6. remove the cooked pancakes from the skillet and keep warm. repeat with the remaining batter.
7. serve the lemon poppy seed pancakes warm with maple syrup, fresh berries, or any desired toppings.
8. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, poppy, seed, baking, powder, baking, soda, salt, buttermilk, fresh, lemon, zest, lemon, egg, butter, butter, spray, greasing

title: Mushroom Breakfast Burrito
raw_text: 69. Mushroom Breakfast Burrito: 400 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains wheat. Origin: Various.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large flour tortillas
- 8 ounces mushrooms, sliced
- 1 red bell pepper, chopped
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 4 eggs
- 1/4 cup milk
- 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- optional toppings: salsa, avocado, sour cream
preparation:
1. heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. add chopped onions and bell peppers to the skillet. cook until they start to soften, about 5 minutes.
3. add sliced mushrooms to the skillet and season with salt and pepper. cook for an additional 5 minutes, or until mushrooms are tender.
