4. in a separate bowl, whisk together eggs and milk. season with salt and pepper.
5. push the vegetables to one side of the skillet and pour the whisked eggs into the empty space. scramble the eggs, then mix them with the vegetables.
6. warm the flour tortillas in a microwave or on a skillet until pliable.
7. divide the mushroom and egg mixture evenly onto each tortilla. sprinkle shredded cheddar cheese on top.
8. roll the tortillas tightly, tucking in the sides as you go.
9. optional: warm the burritos in a skillet over medium heat for a few minutes to melt the cheese and crisp up the tortilla.
10. serve the mushroom breakfast burritos with optional toppings such as salsa, avocado, or sour cream. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, tortilla, ounce, mushroom, red, bell, pepper, onion, egg, milk, shredded, cheddar, cheese, olive, salt, pepper, taste, topping, salsa, avocado, sour, cream

title: Bread Upma
raw_text: 70. Bread Upma: 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat. Origin: India.
ingredients:
ingredients for bread upma:
- 4 slices of bread
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 1 tomato, finely chopped
- 1 green chili, finely chopped
- 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds
- 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds
- 1/4 teaspoon turmeric powder
- a pinch of asafoetida (hing)
- few curry leaves
- salt to taste
- 2 tablespoons oil
- fresh coriander leaves, chopped (for garnish)
- lemon wedges (optional, for serving)
preparation:
1. start by cutting the bread slices into small cubes. keep them aside.
2. heat oil in a pan over medium heat. add mustard seeds and cumin seeds, and let them splutter.
3. add asafoetida, curry leaves, and chopped green chili to the pan. stir for a few seconds.
4. now, add the finely chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent.
5. add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and mushy.
6. add turmeric powder and salt to the pan and mix well.
7. add the bread cubes to the pan and gently toss them with the onion-tomato mixture, making sure the bread gets coated evenly with the spices.
8. cook the bread on low heat for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally. this will help the bread cubes absorb the flavors and get slightly toasted.
9. turn off the heat, garnish with fresh coriander leaves, and serve hot.
10. you can also squeeze some lemon juice over the upma before serving, if desired. enjoy your bread upma as a delicious breakfast or snack!
ingredients_list: bread, onion, tomato, green, chili, mustard, seed, cumin, seed, turmeric, powder, pinch, asafoetida, hing, curry, leaf, salt, taste, fresh, coriander, leaf, garnish, lemon, wedge

title: Sourdough Biscuits and Mushroom Gravy
raw_text: 71. Sourdough Biscuits and Mushroom Gravy: 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat. Origin: USA.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 cup sourdough starter
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, cold and cubed
- 1/2 cup buttermilk
- 1 tablespoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon baking soda

for the mushroom gravy:
- 2 cups sliced mushrooms
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 cups milk
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).

2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, salt, and baking soda.

3. cut in the cold butter using a pastry cutter or your fingertips until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.

4. add the sourdough starter and buttermilk to the mixture. stir until a soft dough forms.

5. turn the dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead it gently a few times until it comes together.

6. roll out the dough to about 1/2-inch thickness. cut out biscuits using a biscuit cutter or a round cookie cutter. place the biscuits on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.

7. bake the biscuits in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes or until they are golden brown.

8. while the biscuits are baking, prepare the mushroom gravy. in a skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. add the sliced mushrooms and cook until they are tender.

9. sprinkle the flour over the mushrooms and stir well to coat. cook for a minute.

10. slowly pour in the milk, stirring constantly to prevent lumps. continue to cook until the gravy thickens. season with salt and pepper to taste.

11. once the biscuits are done, remove them from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.

12. serve the warm biscuits with mushroom gravy poured over the top. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, sourdough, starter, unsalted, butter, buttermilk, baking, powder, salt, baking, soda, mushroom, gravy, mushroom, unsalted, butter, flour, milk, salt, pepper, taste

title: Mozzarella and Tomato Bruschetta
raw_text: 76. Mozzarella and Tomato Bruschetta: 250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat and dairy. Origin: Italy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 slices of italian bread
- 2 ripe tomatoes, diced
- 1 ball of mozzarella cheese, sliced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 3 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil
- 1 tablespoon of balsamic vinegar
- fresh basil leaves, chopped
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. place the slices of italian bread on the baking sheet and drizzle with a little olive oil. toast the bread in the oven for about 5 minutes or until they turn golden brown and crispy. set aside.
3. in a bowl, combine the diced tomatoes, minced garlic, extra virgin olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper. mix well.
4. place a slice of mozzarella cheese on each toasted bread slice.
5. spoon the tomato mixture over the mozzarella slices, covering them evenly.
6. place the bruschettas back in the oven for another 5 minutes or until the mozzarella cheese has melted.
7. remove from the oven and sprinkle the chopped fresh basil leaves on top.
8. serve immediately and enjoy as an appetizer or light meal.
ingredients_list: italian, bread, tomato, ball, mozzarella, cheese, clove, garlic, minced, virgin, olive, balsamic, vinegar, fresh, basil, leaf, salt, pepper, taste

title: Veggie Breakfast Strudel
raw_text: 78. Veggie Breakfast Strudel: 350 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains wheat and dairy. Origin: Germany.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 zucchini, diced
- 1 cup frozen spinach, thawed and drained
- 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 sheet puff pastry, thawed
- 1 egg, beaten (for egg wash)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. add the diced onion and minced garlic, and sauté until the onion becomes translucent.
3. add the diced red bell pepper and zucchini to the skillet. cook until the vegetables become slightly tender, about 5 minutes.
4. stir in the thawed spinach and cook for an additional 2 minutes. remove from heat and allow the mixture to cool slightly.
5. add the shredded mozzarella cheese to the vegetable mixture, and season with salt and pepper to taste. stir until well combined.
6. roll out the puff pastry on a lightly floured surface. place the vegetable and cheese mixture lengthwise down the center of the pastry.
7. fold the sides of the pastry over the filling, and then fold the ends over to enclose the filling fully. press the edges together to seal.
8. transfer the strudel to the prepared baking sheet, seam side down. cut a few slits on the top to allow steam to escape.
9. brush the top of the strudel with the beaten egg wash.
10. bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the strudel becomes golden brown and crispy.
11. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing.
12. serve the veggie breakfast strudel warm and enjoy!
ingredients_list: olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, red, bell, pepper, zucchini, frozen, spinach, thawed, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, salt, pepper, taste, puff, pastry, thawed, egg, egg, wash

title: Banana Oat Pancakes
raw_text: 79. Banana Oat Pancakes: 300 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat and nuts. Origin: Various.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 ripe bananas
- 1 cup rolled oats
- 2 eggs
- 1/4 cup milk (optional)
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
preparation:
1. in a blender or food processor, add the bananas, rolled oats, eggs, milk (if using), vanilla extract, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt.
2. blend or process the mixture until smooth and well combined.
3. let the batter rest for about 10-15 minutes to allow the oats to absorb the liquid and thicken.
4. heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat and lightly grease it with cooking spray or butter.
5. once the skillet is hot, pour about 1/4 cup of the batter onto the skillet for each pancake.
6. cook the pancakes for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until golden brown.
7. repeat the process with the remaining batter, adding more cooking spray or butter as needed.
8. serve the banana oat pancakes warm with your favorite toppings such as fresh fruits, maple syrup, or yogurt. enjoy!
ingredients_list: banana, rolled, oat, egg, milk, vanilla, extract, baking, powder, cinnamon, salt

title: Spinach and Goat Cheese Omelette
raw_text: 80. Spinach and Goat Cheese Omelette: 350 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains eggs and dairy. Origin: Various.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 3 large eggs
- 1 cup fresh spinach, chopped
- 1/4 cup crumbled goat cheese
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 tablespoon butter
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, whisk the eggs until well beaten. set aside.
2. heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and add the butter. allow it to melt and coat the pan evenly.
3. add the chopped spinach to the skillet and sauté for 2-3 minutes until wilted.
4. pour the beaten eggs over the spinach, spreading them out evenly.
5. allow the eggs to set slightly, then gently push the cooked edges towards the center using a spatula, tilting the pan to let the uncooked eggs flow to the edges.
6. sprinkle the crumbled goat cheese evenly over the omelette.
7. season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. cook for an additional 1-2 minutes until the cheese starts to melt and the omelette is cooked through.
9. carefully fold the omelette in half using the spatula.
10. slide the omelette onto a plate and serve hot. enjoy!
ingredients_list: egg, fresh, spinach, goat, cheese, salt, pepper, taste, butter

title: Ricotta Pancakes
raw_text: 83. Ricotta Pancakes: 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat and dairy. Origin: Italy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup ricotta cheese
- 3/4 cup milk
- 2 large eggs
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- butter or cooking spray for greasing the pan
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
2. in a separate bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, milk, eggs, and vanilla extract. whisk until well combined.
3. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. do not overmix; small lumps are okay.
4. heat a non-stick frying pan or griddle over medium-high heat. add a small amount of butter or cooking spray to lightly grease the pan.
5. pour 1/4 cup of pancake batter onto the pan for each pancake. cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until golden brown.
6. transfer the cooked pancakes to a plate and cover with a kitchen towel to keep warm while cooking the remaining batter.
7. serve the ricotta pancakes warm with your favorite pancake toppings such as maple syrup, fresh berries, or a dusting of powdered sugar.
8. enjoy your delicious ricotta pancakes!
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, baking, powder, baking, soda, salt, ricotta, cheese, milk, egg, vanilla, extract, butter, spray, greasing

title: Veggie Breakfast Skillet
raw_text: 84. Veggie Breakfast Skillet: 400 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains eggs. Origin: Various.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, diced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 zucchini, diced
- 1 cup sliced mushrooms
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 4 large eggs
- 1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese (optional)
- fresh parsley, for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. add the diced onion, bell pepper, zucchini, mushrooms, and garlic to the skillet. cook until the vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally, for about 5-6 minutes.
3. sprinkle the dried thyme, paprika, salt, and black pepper over the vegetables. stir well to combine.
4. make four wells in the vegetable mixture and crack an egg into each well. cover the skillet and cook until the eggs are cooked to your liking, about 4-5 minutes for a soft yolk or longer for a fully cooked yolk.
5. if desired, sprinkle shredded cheddar cheese over the eggs during the last minute of cooking and cover the skillet again until the cheese melts.
6. remove from heat and garnish with fresh parsley, if desired.
7. serve the veggie breakfast skillet hot. enjoy!
ingredients_list: olive, onion, bell, pepper, zucchini, mushroom, clove, garlic, minced, dried, thyme, paprika, salt, black, pepper, egg, shredded, cheddar, cheese, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Nutella Banana Croissant
raw_text: 87. Nutella Banana Croissant: 400 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains wheat and nuts. Origin: France.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 croissants
- nutella
- 1 banana, sliced
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c).
  2. slice open the croissants horizontally to create a pocket.
  3. spread nutella generously inside each croissant.
  4. place sliced bananas on top of the nutella.
  5. close the croissants and press gently to seal.
  6. place the filled croissants on a baking sheet.
  7. bake in the preheated oven for about 10 minutes, or until the croissants are golden brown.
  8. remove from the oven and let cool slightly before serving. enjoy your nutella banana croissants!
ingredients_list: croissant, nutella, banana

title: Vegetarian Breakfast Casserole
raw_text: 88. Vegetarian Breakfast Casserole: 400 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains eggs and dairy. Origin: Various.
ingredients:
ingredients for vegetarian breakfast casserole:
- 6 large eggs
- 1 cup milk
- 1 teaspoon dijon mustard
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/2 teaspoon onion powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 slices whole wheat bread, cubed
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 1 cup diced bell peppers
- 1 cup diced onion
- 1 cup chopped spinach
- 1/2 cup sliced mushrooms
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c) and lightly grease a casserole dish.
2. in a large mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, dijon mustard, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper.
3. add the cubed bread, shredded cheddar cheese, diced bell peppers, diced onion, chopped spinach, and sliced mushrooms to the egg mixture. stir well to combine.
4. pour the mixture into the prepared casserole dish and spread it evenly.
5. bake in the preheated oven for 40-45 minutes, or until the casserole is set and the top is golden brown.
6. allow the casserole to cool for a few minutes before serving. enjoy your vegetarian breakfast casserole!
ingredients_list: egg, milk, dijon, mustard, garlic, powder, onion, powder, salt, pepper, taste, whole, wheat, bread, shredded, cheddar, cheese, bell, pepper, onion, spinach, mushroom

title: Tomato and Basil Bruschetta Scramble
raw_text: 89. Tomato and Basil Bruschetta Scramble: 350 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains eggs and wheat. Origin: Italy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 slices of crusty bread
- 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1/4 cup fresh basil leaves, chopped
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 4 eggs
- grated parmesan cheese, for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. place the slices of bread on a baking sheet and brush them with olive oil. toast in the oven for about 5 minutes, or until golden and crispy. set aside.
3. in a skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. add the minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute, until fragrant.
4. add the cherry tomatoes to the skillet and cook for about 3-4 minutes, until slightly softened. stir in the chopped basil leaves and season with salt and pepper to taste. cook for an additional minute, then remove the mixture from the skillet and set aside.
5. in the same skillet, heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat.
6. crack the eggs into the skillet, being careful not to break the yolks. season with salt and pepper, and cook to your desired doneness (around 2-3 minutes for a runny yolk).
7. to assemble the bruschetta scramble, place a slice of toasted bread on a plate. top with a spoonful of the tomato and basil mixture, then place a cooked egg on top. repeat with the remaining bread, tomato mixture, and eggs.
8. optional: garnish with grated parmesan cheese and additional chopped basil leaves before serving.

enjoy your tomato and basil bruschetta scramble!
ingredients_list: crusty, bread, virgin, olive, clove, garlic, minced, cherry, tomato, halved, fresh, basil, leaf, salt, pepper, taste, egg, parmesan, cheese, garnish

title: Saffron Yogurt with Fruit
raw_text: 92. Saffron Yogurt with Fruit: 300 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains dairy and nuts. Origin: Various.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup plain yogurt
- 1 teaspoon saffron threads
- assorted fruits (such as berries, sliced peaches, or diced melon)
- honey or agave syrup, for drizzling
- chopped pistachios or almonds, for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, soak the saffron threads in 1 tablespoon hot water for about 10 minutes, until the water turns yellow and fragrant.
2. in a separate bowl, whisk the saffron water into the plain yogurt until well combined.
3. spoon the saffron yogurt into serving bowls or glasses.
4. add a variety of fresh fruits on top of the yogurt.
5. drizzle honey or agave syrup over the fruits for added sweetness.
6. optionally, sprinkle some chopped pistachios or almonds on top for a crunchy texture and nutty flavor.
7. serve immediately and enjoy the saffron yogurt with fruit as a refreshing and nutritious dessert or snack.
ingredients_list: plain, yogurt, saffron, thread, assorted, fruit, berry, peach, melon, honey, agave, syrup, drizzling, pistachio, almond, garnish

title: Veggie Biscuits and Gravy
raw_text: 97. Veggie Biscuits and Gravy: 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat and dairy. Origin: USA.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- for biscuits:
2 cups all-purpose flour
1 tablespoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup unsalted butter, cold and cubed
3/4 cup milk
- for gravy:
2 tablespoons vegetable oil
1 small onion, diced
2 cloves garlic, minced
1/4 cup all-purpose flour
2 cups vegetable broth
1 cup milk
1 teaspoon soy sauce
1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
salt and pepper to taste
2 cups assorted vegetables (such as mushrooms, broccoli, and bell peppers), chopped
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 425°f (220°c).
2. in a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt for the biscuits.
3. add the cold, cubed butter to the bowl. using a pastry cutter or your fingertips, cut the butter into the flour mixture until it resembles coarse crumbs.
4. slowly pour in the milk while stirring with a fork until the dough comes together.
5. transfer the dough onto a lightly floured surface and gently knead a few times until it becomes smooth.
6. roll out the dough to about 1/2 inch thickness. use a biscuit cutter or a round glass to cut out biscuits and place them on a baking sheet.
7. bake the biscuits in the preheated oven for about 12-15 minutes or until they turn golden brown. set them aside to cool.
8. while the biscuits are baking, prepare the gravy. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
9. add the diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet and cook until the onions become translucent.
10. sprinkle the flour over the onion and garlic mixture and stir well to combine.
11. gradually pour in the vegetable broth and milk, stirring constantly to prevent lumps from forming.
12. add soy sauce, dried thyme, salt, and pepper to the skillet. stir until the gravy thickens and comes to a gentle boil.
13. reduce the heat to low, and add the chopped vegetables. simmer for about 8-10 minutes or until the vegetables are cooked through and the gravy has reached the desired consistency.
14. to serve, split the biscuits in half and pour a generous amount of the vegetable gravy over each biscuit.
15. enjoy your delicious veggie biscuits and gravy!
ingredients_list: biscuit, flour, baking, powder, salt, unsalted, butter, milk, gravy, vegetable, onion, clove, garlic, minced, flour, vegetable, broth, milk, soy, sauce, dried, thyme, salt, pepper, taste, assorted, vegetable, mushroom, broccoli, bell, pepper

title: Ragi (Finger Millet) Pancakes
raw_text: 98. Ragi (Finger Millet) Pancakes: 250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat. Origin: India.
ingredients:
ingredients for ragi pancakes:
- 1 cup ragi flour (finger millet flour)
- 1/4 cup rice flour
- 1/4 cup curd (yogurt)
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 1 green chili, finely chopped
- 1/4 teaspoon ginger paste
- salt to taste
- water as needed
- oil for cooking
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the ragi flour, rice flour, curd, chopped onion, green chili, ginger paste, and salt.
2. gradually add water while whisking the mixture until it forms a smooth batter. the consistency should be similar to that of regular pancake batter.
3. let the batter rest for 10-15 minutes to allow it to ferment slightly.
4. heat a non-stick pan or skillet over medium heat and drizzle a little oil on it.
5. pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it evenly to form a pancake.
6. cook the pancake on medium-low heat until the bottom is golden brown and crisp. flip it over and cook the other side as well.
7. remove the pancake from the pan and repeat the process with the remaining batter, adding oil as needed.
8. serve the ragi pancakes hot with chutney or sauce of your choice. enjoy!
ingredients_list: ragi, flour, finger, millet, flour, rice, flour, curd, yogurt, onion, green, chili, ginger, paste, salt, taste, water, needed

title: Banana Walnut Bread
raw_text: 99. Banana Walnut Bread: 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat and nuts. Origin: Various.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 3 ripe bananas
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup chopped walnuts
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c). grease and flour a 9x5-inch loaf pan.
2. in a mixing bowl, mash the ripe bananas with a fork until smooth.
3. in a separate large bowl, cream together the melted butter and sugar.
4. beat in the eggs, one at a time, and stir in the vanilla extract.
5. in another bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and salt.
6. gradually add the dry ingredients to the banana mixture, stirring until just combined.
7. fold in the chopped walnuts.
8. pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan.
9. bake for 60-65 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
10. allow the bread to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then remove it from the pan and transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
ingredients_list: banana, unsalted, butter, sugar, egg, vanilla, extract, flour, baking, soda, salt, walnut

title: Greek Feta and Tomato Toast
raw_text: 25. Greek Feta and Tomato Toast: 250kcals per portion; 2 portions; contains gluten, dairy; Origin: Greece
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 slices of bread
- 1 large tomato, sliced
- 1 cup crumbled feta cheese
- fresh basil leaves, for garnish
- olive oil, for drizzling
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. place the slices of bread on a baking sheet and drizzle them with olive oil.
3. toast the bread in the oven for about 5-7 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crisp.
4. remove the bread from the oven and let it cool slightly.
5. top each slice of bread with tomato slices, arranging them evenly.
6. sprinkle crumbled feta cheese over the tomatoes.
7. season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. return the baking sheet to the oven and broil for 2-3 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and slightly golden.
9. remove from the oven and garnish with fresh basil leaves.
10. serve the greek feta and tomato toast immediately as an appetizer or a light meal. enjoy!
ingredients_list: bread, tomato, feta, cheese, fresh, basil, leaf, garnish, olive, drizzling, salt, pepper, taste

title: Tofu Scramble Breakfast Burrito
raw_text: 26. Tofu Scramble Breakfast Burrito: 300kcals per portion; 1 portion; contains gluten, soy; Origin: United States
ingredients:
sure! here's the recipe for tofu scramble breakfast burrito:

ingredients:
- 1 block of firm tofu
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1/2 onion, diced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon turmeric
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- salt and pepper to taste
- tortillas
- salsa, guacamole, or any desired toppings
preparation:
1. drain the tofu and pat it dry with a paper towel. crumble it into small pieces, resembling scrambled eggs.
2. heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
3. add the diced onion, bell pepper, and minced garlic to the skillet. sauté for about 5 minutes until they become soft.
4. add the crumbled tofu to the skillet and mix well with the vegetables.
5. sprinkle turmeric, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper over the tofu scramble. stir to evenly distribute the spices.
6. cook the tofu scramble for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until it is heated through and slightly browned.
7. warm the tortillas in a separate skillet or microwave.
8. place a scoop of the tofu scramble on a tortilla and top with salsa, guacamole, or any desired toppings.
9. roll up the tortilla into a burrito and secure it with aluminum foil or parchment paper.
10. repeat the process with the remaining tortillas and tofu scramble.
11. serve the tofu scramble breakfast burrito warm and enjoy!

note: feel free to customize the recipe by adding other vegetables, such as spinach or mushrooms, or by adding your favorite seasonings to the tofu scramble.
ingredients_list: tofu, burrito, tofu, olive, onion, bell, pepper, clove, garlic, minced, turmeric, cumin, paprika, salt, pepper, taste, tortilla, salsa, guacamole, topping

title: Vegetarian Quiche
raw_text: 30. Vegetarian Quiche: 200kcals per portion; 3 portions; contains eggs, gluten; Origin: France
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pre-made pie crust
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, diced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 cup chopped spinach
- 1 cup sliced mushrooms
- 1 cup shredded cheese (such as cheddar or mozzarella)
- 4 large eggs
- 1 cup milk
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. place the pie crust in a 9-inch pie dish and set aside.
3. heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. add diced onion and bell pepper, sauté until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
4. add chopped spinach and sliced mushrooms to the skillet, cook for another 2-3 minutes until the spinach has wilted and mushrooms have released their moisture.
5. remove the skillet from heat and let the vegetable mixture cool slightly.
6. in a separate bowl, whisk together eggs and milk until well combined. season with salt and pepper.
7. spread the vegetable mixture evenly over the pie crust.
8. sprinkle shredded cheese over the vegetables.
9. pour the egg mixture over the vegetables and cheese, making sure it's evenly distributed.
10. place the quiche in the preheated oven and bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the center is set and the top is golden brown.
11. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving. enjoy!
ingredients_list: pie, crust, olive, onion, bell, pepper, spinach, mushroom, shredded, cheese, cheddar, mozzarella, egg, milk, salt, pepper, taste

title: Caprese Avocado Toast
raw_text: 33. Caprese Avocado Toast: 200kcals per portion; 3 portions; contains gluten, dairy; Origin: Italy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 ripe avocado
- 4 slices of bread (sourdough or ciabatta)
- 4 slices of mozzarella cheese
- 4 slices of tomato
- fresh basil leaves
- balsamic glaze
- olive oil
- salt and black pepper
preparation:
1. start by toasting the bread slices until golden brown and crispy.
2. cut the avocado in half, remove the pit, and scoop out the flesh into a bowl. mash the avocado with a fork until smooth.
3. spread a generous amount of mashed avocado onto each toasted bread slice.
4. sprinkle with salt and black pepper to taste.
5. layer a slice of mozzarella cheese on top of each avocado-covered bread slice.
6. add a slice of tomato on top of the mozzarella cheese.
7. drizzle a little olive oil over each tomato slice.
8. tear the fresh basil leaves into smaller pieces and sprinkle them on top of each toast.
9. drizzle a generous amount of balsamic glaze over each toast.
10. serve immediately and enjoy!
ingredients_list: avocado, bread, sourdough, ciabatta, mozzarella, cheese, tomato, fresh, basil, leaf, balsamic, glaze, olive, salt, black, pepper

title: Stuffed French Toast
raw_text: 37. Stuffed French Toast: 250kcals per portion; 2 portions; contains gluten; Origin: United States
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 slices of bread
- 4 ounces cream cheese, softened
- 2 tablespoons powdered sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 cup milk
- 2 tablespoons butter
- maple syrup, for serving (optional)
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, mix the cream cheese, powdered sugar, and vanilla extract until well combined.
2. spread the cream cheese mixture evenly on two slices of bread. top with the remaining slices to make sandwiches.
3. in a shallow dish, whisk together the eggs and milk until well combined.
4. heat the butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
5. dip each stuffed sandwich into the egg mixture, coating both sides.
6. place the sandwiches in the skillet and cook until golden brown on both sides, about 2-3 minutes per side.
7. remove from the skillet and let cool for a minute.
8. cut each sandwich diagonally and serve with maple syrup, if desired. enjoy!
ingredients_list: bread, ounce, cream, cheese, sugar, vanilla, extract, egg, milk, butter, maple, syrup

title: Cheesy Spinach Pita Pocket
raw_text: 40. Cheesy Spinach Pita Pocket: 250kcals per portion; 2 portions; contains gluten, dairy; Origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large pita bread
- 1 cup fresh spinach leaves
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 1/4 cup diced red onion
- 1/4 cup diced red bell pepper
- 1/4 cup diced tomatoes
- 1/4 cup sliced black olives
- 1/4 cup greek yogurt
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. in a skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
3. add in the diced red onion and red bell pepper. sauté for about 3-4 minutes until they become slightly soft.
4. add in the spinach leaves and sauté until wilted, about 2-3 minutes.
5. season the mixture with oregano, salt, and pepper. remove from heat and set aside.
6. cut each pita bread in half to form pockets.
7. open up each pita pocket and stuff with the shredded cheddar cheese, sautéed spinach mixture, diced tomatoes, and sliced black olives.
8. place the stuffed pita pockets on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for about 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is fully melted and the pita bread is slightly crispy.
9. remove from the oven and let it cool for a couple of minutes.
10. serve the cheesy spinach pita pockets with a dollop of greek yogurt on top. enjoy!
ingredients_list: pita, bread, fresh, spinach, leaf, shredded, cheddar, cheese, red, onion, red, bell, pepper, tomato, black, olive, greek, yogurt, olive, dried, oregano, salt, pepper, taste

title: Veggie Breakfast Burrito Bowl
raw_text: 43. Veggie Breakfast Burrito Bowl: 300kcals per portion; 1 portion; contains gluten, soy; Origin: United States
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup cooked quinoa
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 cup black beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 cup corn kernels
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 large eggs
- 1 avocado, sliced
- fresh cilantro, chopped (for garnish)
- salsa or hot sauce (optional)
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. add the diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet and sauté until the onion becomes translucent.
3. add the diced bell pepper and cook for another 2 minutes until it starts to soften.
4. stir in the cooked quinoa, black beans, corn kernels, cherry tomatoes, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. cook for an additional 3-5 minutes until all the ingredients are well combined and heated through.
5. in a separate non-stick skillet, fry the eggs to your desired level of doneness. season with salt and pepper.
6. to assemble the burrito bowl, divide the quinoa mixture into serving bowls. top with fried eggs, avocado slices, and sprinkle with fresh cilantro.
7. optional: drizzle salsa or hot sauce over the bowl for an extra kick of flavor.
8. serve the veggie breakfast burrito bowl immediately and enjoy!
ingredients_list: quinoa, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, bell, pepper, black, bean, corn, kernel, cherry, tomato, halved, cumin, paprika, salt, pepper, taste, egg, avocado, fresh, cilantro, garnish, salsa, hot, sauce

title: Middle Eastern Shakshuka
raw_text: 45. Middle Eastern Shakshuka: 250kcals per portion; 2 portions; contains eggs; Origin: Middle East
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon ground chili powder (optional for spicier version)
- 1 can (14 ounces) diced tomatoes
- 1 can (14 ounces) tomato sauce
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4-6 large eggs
- fresh cilantro, chopped (for garnish)
- crumbled feta cheese (for garnish)
preparation:
1. heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. add chopped onion and thinly sliced red bell pepper to the skillet, and sauté until the vegetables are softened, about 5-6 minutes.
3. add minced garlic, ground cumin, ground paprika, and ground chili powder (if using) to the skillet. stir well to combine and cook for another minute until the spices are fragrant.
4. pour in the diced tomatoes and tomato sauce, and season with salt and pepper to taste. stir everything together and let the mixture simmer for about 10-15 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
5. make indentations in the sauce with a spoon and crack one egg into each indentation. cover the skillet and cook until the eggs are done to your liking, about 5-8 minutes for a runny yolk and longer for a firmer yolk.
6. once the eggs are cooked to your desired doneness, remove the skillet from heat. sprinkle the shakshuka with chopped fresh cilantro and crumbled feta cheese.
7. serve the shakshuka with warm pita bread or crusty bread for dipping and enjoy!
ingredients_list: olive, onion, red, bell, pepper, thinly, clove, garlic, minced, ground, cumin, ground, paprika, ground, chili, powder, spicier, version, ounce, tomato, ounce, tomato, sauce, salt, pepper, taste, egg, fresh, cilantro, garnish, feta, cheese, garnish

title: Banana Nut Smoothie Bowl
raw_text: 46. Banana Nut Smoothie Bowl: 300kcals per portion; 1 portion; contains nuts; Origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 ripe bananas
- 1/4 cup almond milk
- 1/4 cup greek yogurt
- 1/4 cup crushed walnuts
- 1 tablespoon honey
- 1 tablespoon chia seeds
- 1 tablespoon shredded coconut
- sliced banana, crushed walnuts, and chia seeds for topping
preparation:
1. peel the ripe bananas and cut them into chunks.
2. in a blender, combine the banana chunks, almond milk, greek yogurt, crushed walnuts, honey, and chia seeds.
3. blend the mixture until smooth and creamy.
4. pour the smoothie into a bowl.
5. top the smoothie bowl with sliced banana, crushed walnuts, chia seeds, and shredded coconut.
6. enjoy the banana nut smoothie bowl immediately!
ingredients_list: banana, almond, milk, greek, yogurt, walnut, honey, chia, seed, shredded, coconut, banana, walnut, chia, seed, topping

title: Mexican Black Bean Breakfast Wrap
raw_text: 47. Mexican Black Bean Breakfast Wrap: 200kcals per portion; 4 portions; contains gluten, soy; Origin: Mexico
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 can of black beans, drained and rinsed
- 1 teaspoon olive oil
- 1/2 onion, diced
- 1/2 bell pepper, diced
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon chili powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 large flour tortillas
- 4 eggs
- 1 avocado, sliced
- 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- fresh cilantro, chopped (optional)
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. add the diced onion and bell pepper, and sauté until they become soft and lightly browned, around 5 minutes.
2. add the minced garlic to the skillet, and cook for another minute.
3. stir in the black beans, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. cook for about 2 minutes, until the beans are heated through.
4. in a separate skillet, cook the eggs to your liking (scrambled, fried, or poached).
5. warm the flour tortillas in a microwave or on a skillet for a few seconds, until they are pliable.
6. assemble the breakfast wraps by dividing the black bean mixture evenly onto each tortilla. top with cooked eggs, sliced avocado, shredded cheddar cheese, and fresh cilantro if desired.
7. fold in the sides of the tortilla and roll it up tightly to form a wrap.
8. serve immediately and enjoy your mexican black bean breakfast wrap!
ingredients_list: black, bean, olive, onion, bell, pepper, clove, garlic, minced, ground, cumin, chili, powder, salt, pepper, taste, flour, tortilla, egg, avocado, shredded, cheddar, cheese, fresh, cilantro

title: Veggie Breakfast Quesadilla
raw_text: 49. Veggie Breakfast Quesadilla: 300kcals per portion; 1 portion; contains gluten, dairy; Origin: Mexico
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large tortillas
- 1/2 cup diced bell peppers
- 1/2 cup diced red onions
- 1/2 cup sliced mushrooms
- 1/2 cup chopped spinach
- 1/2 cup shredded cheese (cheddar or mexican blend)
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
2. add bell peppers, red onions, and mushrooms to the skillet. sauté for about 5 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
3. add chopped spinach to the skillet and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until wilted.
4. season the vegetable mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
5. remove the vegetable mixture from the skillet and set aside.
6. in the same skillet, place one tortilla and evenly spread half of the shredded cheese on top.
7. arrange half of the cooked vegetable mixture on one half of the tortilla.
8. fold the other half of the tortilla over the vegetables to create a half-moon shape.
9. press down gently with a spatula to seal the quesadilla.
10. cook the quesadilla for about 2-3 minutes on each side until cheese is melted and tortilla is crispy.
11. remove the quesadilla from the skillet and repeat the process with the remaining tortilla, cheese, and vegetable mixture.
12. cut each quesadilla into wedges and serve hot as a delicious and healthy breakfast option. enjoy!
ingredients_list: tortilla, bell, pepper, red, onion, mushroom, spinach, shredded, cheese, cheddar, mexican, blend, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms
raw_text: 50. Spinach and Feta Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms: 200kcals per portion; 4 portions; contains dairy; Origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large portobello mushrooms
- 2 cups spinach, chopped
- 1 cup feta cheese, crumbled
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. remove the stems from the portobello mushrooms and scrape out the gills gently with a spoon.
3. in a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped spinach, feta cheese, minced garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper. mix well.
4. stuff each portobello mushroom cap with the spinach and feta mixture, packing it tightly.
5. place the stuffed mushrooms on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender and the cheese has melted.
6. once cooked, remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving. enjoy!
ingredients_list: portobello, mushroom, spinach, feta, cheese, clove, garlic, minced, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Blueberry Almond Baked Oatmeal
raw_text: 53. Blueberry Almond Baked Oatmeal: 200kcals per portion; 4 portions; contains gluten, nuts; Origin: United States
ingredients:
sure, here's a recipe for blueberry almond baked oatmeal:

ingredients:
- 2 cups rolled oats
- 1/2 cup sliced almonds
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 2 cups milk (dairy or non-dairy)
- 1/4 cup maple syrup or honey
- 1 large egg
- 2 tablespoons melted butter or oil
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 cup fresh blueberries
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c) and lightly grease a baking dish with butter or cooking spray.
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the rolled oats, sliced almonds, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt. stir well to combine.
3. in a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, maple syrup or honey, egg, melted butter or oil, and vanilla extract.
4. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until well combined.
5. gently fold in the fresh blueberries.
6. pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish and spread it out evenly.
7. bake in the preheated oven for about 30-35 minutes, or until the top is lightly golden brown and the center is set.
8. remove from the oven and allow it to cool for a few minutes before serving.
9. cut into squares and serve warm. you can drizzle extra maple syrup or honey on top if desired.
enjoy your blueberry almond baked oatmeal!
ingredients_list: blueberry, almond, baked, oatmeal, rolled, oat, almond, baking, powder, cinnamon, salt, milk, dairy, dairy, maple, syrup, honey, egg, butter, vanilla, extract, fresh, blueberry

title: Vegan Breakfast Sausage
raw_text: 54. Vegan Breakfast Sausage: 250kcals per portion; 2 portions; contains gluten, soy; Origin: United States
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup cooked quinoa
- 1/2 cup black beans, cooked and mashed
- 1/2 cup mushrooms, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup finely chopped onion
- 2 tablespoons nutritional yeast
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce or tamari
- 1 tablespoon ground flaxseed mixed with 2 tablespoons water
- 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/2 teaspoon onion powder
- 1/2 teaspoon dried sage
- 1/4 teaspoon dried thyme
- salt and pepper to taste
- 2 tablespoons oil for frying
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, mashed black beans, chopped mushrooms, and finely chopped onion.
2. in a small bowl, mix together nutritional yeast, soy sauce (or tamari), and the ground flaxseed mixture to form a paste.
3. add the paste, smoked paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, dried sage, dried thyme, salt, and pepper to the quinoa mixture. mix well until all ingredients are evenly combined.
4. shape the mixture into small patties or sausage shapes using your hands.
5. heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat. add the sausage patties and cook for about 4-5 minutes on each side, until golden brown and crispy.
6. remove the vegan breakfast sausages from the pan and let them cool slightly before serving.
7. enjoy your vegan breakfast sausages in sandwiches, wraps, or alongside your favorite breakfast dishes.
taste: The key taste profile in this recipe is umami.
ingredients_list: quinoa, black, bean, mushroom, onion, yeast, soy, sauce, tamari, ground, flaxseed, water, smoked, paprika, garlic, powder, onion, powder, dried, sage, dried, thyme, salt, pepper, taste

title: Whole Wheat Veggie Breakfast Wrap
raw_text: 57. Whole Wheat Veggie Breakfast Wrap: 250kcals per portion; 2 portions; contains gluten; Origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 whole wheat tortilla
- 2 eggs
- 1/4 cup chopped bell peppers (any color)
- 1/4 cup chopped onions
- 1/4 cup chopped tomatoes
- 1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- salt and pepper to taste
- olive oil for cooking
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, whisk the eggs with a pinch of salt and pepper.
2. heat a small pan over medium heat and add a drizzle of olive oil.
3. add the chopped bell peppers and onions to the pan, and sauté for about 2-3 minutes until they start to soften.
4. add the chopped tomatoes to the pan and sauté for an additional minute.
5. push the veggies to one side of the pan and pour the whisked eggs into the other side.
6. cook the eggs, scrambling them with a spatula, until they are fully cooked and no longer runny.
7. warm the whole wheat tortilla in a separate pan or on a stove burner for a few seconds on each side.
8. place the cooked eggs and veggies in the center of the tortilla.
9. sprinkle the shredded cheddar cheese on top.
10. fold in the sides of the tortilla and roll it up tightly.
11. cut the wrap in half and serve warm. enjoy your whole wheat veggie breakfast wrap!
ingredients_list: whole, wheat, tortilla, egg, bell, pepper, color, onion, tomato, shredded, cheddar, cheese, salt, pepper, taste, olive

title: Quinoa Breakfast Burrito
raw_text: 59. Quinoa Breakfast Burrito: 200kcals per portion; 4 portions; contains gluten; Origin: Mexico
ingredients:
sure! here's the recipe for quinoa breakfast burrito:

ingredients:
- 1 cup cooked quinoa
- 4 large eggs
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, diced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 4 large flour tortillas
- optional toppings: avocado slices, salsa, sour cream, chopped cilantro
preparation:
1. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
2. add the diced onion and bell pepper to the skillet and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. add the minced garlic and ground cumin to the skillet, stirring for an additional minute.
4. push the vegetables to one side of the skillet and crack the eggs into the empty space. scramble the eggs until cooked through.
5. add the cooked quinoa to the skillet and stir to combine everything. season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. sprinkle the shredded cheddar cheese over the mixture and stir until melted.
7. warm the flour tortillas in a separate skillet or microwave.
8. divide the quinoa mixture evenly between the tortillas and fold into burritos.
9. serve the breakfast burritos immediately with your choice of optional toppings, such as avocado slices, salsa, sour cream, and chopped cilantro.

enjoy your quinoa breakfast burrito!
ingredients_list: quinoa, burrito, quinoa, egg, olive, onion, bell, pepper, clove, garlic, minced, ground, cumin, salt, pepper, taste, shredded, cheddar, cheese, flour, tortilla, topping, avocado, salsa, sour, cream, cilantro

title: Raspberry Coconut Breakfast Bars
raw_text: 62. Raspberry Coconut Breakfast Bars: 200kcals per portion; 4 portions; contains gluten; Origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 ¼ cups rolled oats
- 1 cup shredded coconut
- ½ cup almond flour
- ¼ cup chia seeds
- ⅓ cup maple syrup
- ¼ cup coconut oil, melted
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- 1 cup frozen raspberries
- ½ cup chopped almonds (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c) and line a square baking dish with parchment paper.
2. in a large bowl, combine the rolled oats, shredded coconut, almond flour, and chia seeds.
3. in a separate bowl, whisk together the maple syrup, melted coconut oil, and vanilla extract.
4. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until well combined.
5. gently fold in the frozen raspberries and chopped almonds (if using).
6. transfer the mixture into the lined baking dish, spreading it out evenly and pressing it down firmly.
7. bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the top is set.
8. remove from the oven and let cool completely in the baking dish.
9. once cooled, cut into bars and serve. enjoy your raspberry coconut breakfast bars!
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, shredded, coconut, almond, flour, chia, seed, maple, syrup, coconut, vanilla, extract, frozen, raspberry, almond

title: Overnight Cherry Almond Oats
raw_text: 64. Overnight Cherry Almond Oats: 300kcals per portion; 1 portion; gluten-free, contains nuts; Origin: United States
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup rolled oats
- 1 cup almond milk
- 1/4 cup greek yogurt
- 1 tablespoon honey
- 1/4 teaspoon almond extract
- 1/2 cup fresh or frozen cherries, pitted and chopped
- 2 tablespoons sliced almonds
preparation:
1. in a medium-sized bowl, combine the rolled oats, almond milk, greek yogurt, honey, and almond extract. stir well to combine.
2. gently fold in the chopped cherries.
3. cover the bowl with plastic wrap or a lid and refrigerate overnight, or for at least 4 hours.
4. in the morning, give the oats a good stir.
5. serve the overnight oats in bowls, and top with sliced almonds.
6. enjoy your delicious overnight cherry almond oats!
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, almond, milk, greek, yogurt, honey, almond, extract, fresh, frozen, cherry, pitted, almond

title: Veggie Breakfast Couscous
raw_text: 68. Veggie Breakfast Couscous: 200kcals per portion; 4 portions; contains gluten; Origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup couscous
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, diced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 zucchini, diced
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon cumin
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh parsley, chopped for garnish
preparation:
1. in a medium saucepan, bring the vegetable broth to a boil. remove from heat and stir in the couscous. cover and let it sit for 5 minutes, or until all the liquid is absorbed. fluff with a fork and set aside.
2. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. add the diced onion and sauté for 2-3 minutes until softened.
3. add the red bell pepper, zucchini, and cherry tomatoes to the skillet. cook for about 5 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
4. stir in the minced garlic, smoked paprika, and cumin. cook for an additional minute, until the spices are fragrant.
5. add the cooked couscous to the skillet and mix well to combine all the ingredients. season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. remove from heat and garnish with chopped parsley.
7. serve the veggie breakfast couscous warm and enjoy!
ingredients_list: couscous, vegetable, broth, olive, onion, red, bell, pepper, zucchini, cherry, tomato, halved, clove, garlic, minced, smoked, paprika, cumin, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Roasted Vegetable Breakfast Tacos
raw_text: 71. Roasted Vegetable Breakfast Tacos: 200kcals per portion; 4 portions; contains gluten; Origin: Mexico
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 yellow bell pepper, sliced
- 1 small red onion, sliced
- 1 zucchini, sliced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon chili powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 small flour tortillas
- 4 large eggs
- salsa, for serving
- fresh cilantro, for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. in a large bowl, toss the sliced red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, red onion, and zucchini with olive oil, ground cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper until well coated.
3. spread the vegetables in a single layer on a baking sheet.
4. roast in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and slightly charred.
5. while the vegetables are roasting, heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
6. warm the flour tortillas in the skillet, flipping them occasionally until softened and heated through.
7. in a separate pan, cook the eggs to your desired doneness (e.g., fry, scramble, or poach).
8. once the vegetables are done, divide them evenly among the warmed tortillas.
9. top each tortilla with a cooked egg, salsa, and fresh cilantro.
10. fold the tortillas in half or roll them up to form tacos.
11. serve immediately and enjoy your roasted vegetable breakfast tacos!
ingredients_list: red, bell, pepper, yellow, bell, pepper, red, onion, zucchini, olive, ground, cumin, chili, powder, salt, pepper, taste, flour, tortilla, egg, salsa, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Vegan Breakfast Strata
raw_text: 72. Vegan Breakfast Strata: 250kcals per portion; 2 portions; contains gluten; Origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 loaf of day-old crusty bread, cut into 1-inch cubes
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 cup sliced mushrooms
- 2 cups baby spinach
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1 cup non-dairy cheese, shredded (such as vegan cheddar or mozzarella)
- 2 cups plant-based milk (such as almond or soy milk)
- 2 tablespoons nutritional yeast
- 1 tablespoon dijon mustard
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the diced onion and minced garlic and sauté until softened and fragrant, about 3-4 minutes.
3. add the bell pepper and mushrooms to the skillet and cook for an additional 5 minutes, until the vegetables have softened.
4. add the baby spinach and cherry tomatoes to the skillet, and cook until the spinach has wilted, about 2-3 minutes. remove from heat.
5. in a greased 9x13-inch baking dish, layer half of the bread cubes on the bottom. top with half of the vegetable mixture and half of the non-dairy cheese. repeat with another layer of bread cubes, vegetables, and cheese.
6. in a mixing bowl, whisk together the plant-based milk, nutritional yeast, dijon mustard, dried thyme, salt, and pepper.
7. pour the milk mixture over the layered bread and vegetables in the baking dish, ensuring all of the bread is soaked. press down gently with a fork to ensure the liquid is evenly distributed.
8. cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and let it sit for at least 30 minutes to allow the bread to absorb the liquid.
9. bake the strata in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, until golden brown and crisp on top.
10. remove from the oven and let it cool slightly before serving. enjoy your delicious vegan breakfast strata!
note: you can customize this recipe by adding other vegetables or spices of your choice.
ingredients_list: loaf, crusty, bread, cube, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, bell, pepper, mushroom, baby, spinach, cherry, tomato, halved, dairy, cheese, shredded, vegan, cheddar, mozzarella, plant, milk, almond, soy, milk, yeast, dijon, mustard, dried, thyme, salt, pepper, taste

title: Spinach Tomato Feta Frittata
raw_text: 74. Spinach Tomato Feta Frittata: 200kcals per portion; 4 portions; contains eggs, dairy; Origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 6 large eggs
- 1 cup baby spinach, chopped
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1/2 cup feta cheese, crumbled
- 1/4 cup milk
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, and pepper.
3. heat the olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium heat.
4. add the spinach to the skillet and sauté for 2 minutes until wilted.
5. add the halved cherry tomatoes and cook for an additional 1 minute.
6. pour the egg mixture into the skillet and stir gently to evenly distribute the ingredients.
7. sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese over the top of the frittata.
8. cook for 3-4 minutes on the stovetop until the edges start to set.
9. transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 12-15 minutes or until the eggs are fully set and the top is golden.
10. remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
11. serve the spinach tomato feta frittata warm and enjoy!
ingredients_list: egg, baby, spinach, cherry, tomato, halved, feta, cheese, milk, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Apple Cinnamon French Toast Casserole
raw_text: 76. Apple Cinnamon French Toast Casserole: 300kcals per portion; 1 portion; contains gluten; Origin: United States
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 6 cups bread cubes
- 2 apples, peeled, cored, and diced
- 4 eggs
- 1 cup milk
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 1/4 cup brown sugar
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (180°c).
2. in a greased baking dish, spread half of the bread cubes.
3. top the bread with the diced apples, and then layer the rest of the bread cubes on top.
4. in a mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, granulated sugar, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and salt until well combined.
5. pour the egg mixture evenly over the bread and apples in the baking dish, making sure to coat all the bread cubes.
6. in a small bowl, mix together the melted butter and brown sugar until it resembles a crumbly mixture.
7. sprinkle the butter and sugar mixture over the top of the casserole.
8. bake uncovered in the preheated oven for about 35-40 minutes, or until the casserole is golden brown and set in the center.
9. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
10. serve warm and enjoy!
ingredients_list: bread, cube, apple, cored, egg, milk, sugar, vanilla, extract, ground, cinnamon, salt, unsalted, butter, brown, sugar

title: Tomato Basil Avocado Toast
raw_text: 79. Tomato Basil Avocado Toast: 300kcals per portion; 1 portion; contains gluten; Origin: United States
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 ripe avocados
- 4 slices of bread (your choice of type)
- 2 medium-sized tomatoes, thinly sliced
- fresh basil leaves, chopped
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. start by toasting the bread slices until golden brown and crispy.
2. while the bread is toasting, cut the avocados in half and remove the pits. scoop out the flesh into a bowl and mash with a fork until creamy.
3. season the mashed avocado with salt and pepper to taste.
4. once the bread is toasted, spread a generous amount of the mashed avocado onto each slice.
5. layer the sliced tomatoes on top of the avocado, distributing evenly among the slices.
6. sprinkle the chopped basil leaves over the tomato slices.
7. add an additional pinch of salt and pepper if desired.
8. serve the tomato basil avocado toast immediately and enjoy!

title: Spinach and Mushroom Breakfast Tacos
raw_text: 80. Spinach and Mushroom Breakfast Tacos: 200kcals per portion; 4 portions; contains gluten; Origin: Mexico
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1/2 cup chopped onion
- 1/2 cup sliced mushrooms
- 2 cups fresh spinach leaves
- 4 large eggs, beaten
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 small flour tortillas
- salsa, for serving (optional)
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. add the chopped onion and sliced mushrooms to the skillet. cook until the mushrooms are browned and the onions are softened, about 5 minutes.
3. add the spinach leaves to the skillet and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes.
4. push the vegetables to one side of the skillet and add the beaten eggs to the other side. season with salt and pepper and scramble the eggs until cooked through.

title: Mini Vegetable Quiche
raw_text: 86. Mini Vegetable Quiche: 200kcals per portion; 4 portions; contains eggs, gluten; Origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 sheet of frozen puff pastry, thawed
- 1 cup of mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, mushrooms, spinach), chopped
- 1/2 cup of grated cheese (such as cheddar or swiss)
- 4 eggs
- 1/2 cup of milk
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c) and lightly grease a mini muffin tin.
2. roll out the puff pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface, then cut it into small circles or squares that will fit into the muffin tin.
3. press each pastry piece into the muffin tin, making sure to press it against the sides.
4. in a bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, and pepper.
5. divide the chopped vegetables equally among the prepared pastry cups.
6. sprinkle grated cheese over the vegetables.
7. pour the egg mixture over the vegetables and cheese, filling each cup about 3/4 of the way.
8. bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the quiches are set and golden brown on top.
9. remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before removing them from the muffin tin.
10. serve warm or at room temperature. enjoy!
ingredients_list: frozen, puff, pastry, thawed, vegetable, bell, pepper, mushroom, spinach, cheese, cheddar, swiss, egg, milk, salt, pepper, taste

title: Blueberry Oatmeal Breakfast Bars
raw_text: 87. Blueberry Oatmeal Breakfast Bars: 250kcals per portion; 2 portions; contains gluten; Origin: United States
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups rolled oats
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 cup blueberries (fresh or frozen)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c). grease a 9x9 inch baking dish.
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the rolled oats, flour, brown sugar, baking soda, and salt.
3. add the melted butter and vanilla extract to the dry mixture. stir until well combined.
4. gently fold in the blueberries, being careful not to crush them.
5. press the mixture evenly into the prepared baking dish.
6. bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the blueberries are soft and bubbly.
7. remove from the oven and let it cool completely in the baking dish before cutting into bars.
8. store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 5 days. enjoy as a delicious breakfast or snack!

title: Tomato Basil Tofu Scramble
raw_text: 92. Tomato Basil Tofu Scramble: 200kcals per portion; 4 portions; contains soy; Origin: United States
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 ounces of firm tofu
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 cup of cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1/4 cup of fresh basil leaves, chopped
- 1/2 teaspoon of salt
- 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon of paprika
- 1/4 teaspoon of turmeric
- 1/4 teaspoon of crushed red pepper flakes (optional)
preparation:
1. drain and press the tofu to remove excess water. crumble the tofu into small pieces and set aside.
2. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
3. add the diced onion to the skillet and sauté for about 5 minutes until it becomes translucent.
4. add the minced garlic and cook for an additional minute until fragrant.
5. add the crumbled tofu to the skillet and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. add the halved cherry tomatoes and cook for another 3 minutes until they start to soften.
7. sprinkle the salt, black pepper, paprika, turmeric, and crushed red pepper flakes (if using) over the tofu mixture. stir well to evenly distribute the spices.
8. cook for another 2 minutes until the tofu is heated through and the flavors are well incorporated.
9. remove the skillet from heat and stir in the chopped fresh basil leaves.
10. serve the tomato basil tofu scramble hot and enjoy as a delicious and protein-packed breakfast or brunch option.
ingredients_list: ounce, tofu, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, cherry, tomato, halved, fresh, basil, leaf, salt, black, pepper, paprika, turmeric, red, pepper, flake

title: Mushroom and Spinach Vegan Quiche
raw_text: 94. Mushroom and Spinach Vegan Quiche: 300kcals per portion; 1 portion; contains gluten; Origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pre-made vegan pie crust
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 8 ounces mushrooms, sliced
- 2 cups fresh spinach, chopped
- 1 cup plant-based milk (such as almond or soy milk)
- 1 tablespoon nutritional yeast
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. add the onion and garlic, and sauté until softened and fragrant, about 5 minutes.
3. add the sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook until they release their moisture and become tender, about 8-10 minutes.
4. stir in the chopped spinach and cook until wilted, about 3 minutes. remove from heat and set aside.
5. in a mixing bowl, whisk together the plant-based milk, nutritional yeast, turmeric, salt, and pepper.
6. roll out the pre-made vegan pie crust and place it gently into a pie dish. trim any excess crust hanging over the edges.
7. spoon the mushroom and spinach mixture into the pie crust and spread it evenly.
8. pour the plant-based milk mixture over the filling, making sure it's evenly distributed.
9. place the quiche in the preheated oven and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the crust is golden and the filling is set.
10. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
11. serve the mushroom and spinach vegan quiche warm or at room temperature. enjoy!
ingredients_list: vegan, pie, crust, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ounce, mushroom, fresh, spinach, plant, milk, almond, soy, milk, yeast, turmeric, salt, pepper, taste

title: Mediterranean Vegetable Omelette
raw_text: 95. Mediterranean Vegetable Omelette: 200kcals per portion; 4 portions; contains eggs; Origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1/4 cup chopped onion
- 1/4 cup chopped red bell pepper
- 1/4 cup sliced zucchini
- 1/4 cup sliced mushrooms
- 1/4 cup chopped tomatoes
- 1/4 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 4 large eggs
- 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
- fresh parsley, for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
2. add the chopped onion and red bell pepper to the skillet. cook until the onions are translucent and the peppers start to soften, about 3-4 minutes.
3. add the sliced zucchini and mushrooms to the skillet. cook for another 3-4 minutes, until the vegetables are tender.
4. stir in the chopped tomatoes, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. cook for an additional 2 minutes to allow the flavors to blend.
5. in a separate bowl, beat the eggs until well mixed. pour the beaten eggs into the skillet, evenly covering the vegetables.
6. sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese on top of the eggs and vegetables.
7. reduce the heat to low, cover the skillet, and cook for about 5-6 minutes, or until the eggs are set and the cheese has melted.
8. remove the lid and garnish with fresh parsley, if desired.
9. carefully slide the omelette onto a serving plate and cut into wedges.
10. serve hot and enjoy your mediterranean vegetable omelette!
ingredients_list: olive, onion, red, bell, pepper, zucchini, mushroom, tomato, dried, oregano, salt, pepper, taste, egg, feta, cheese, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Vegan Pancake Skewers
raw_text: 96. Vegan Pancake Skewers: 250kcals per portion; 2 portions; contains gluten; Origin: United States
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup almond milk (or any plant-based milk)
- 2 tablespoons coconut oil (melted)
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- fresh fruits (such as strawberries, bananas, blueberries)
- vegan chocolate spread or maple syrup (for dipping)
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
2. make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and pour in the almond milk, melted coconut oil, and vanilla extract.
3. stir the mixture until just combined. be careful not to overmix; a few lumps are fine.
4. preheat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat and lightly grease it with coconut oil or cooking spray.
5. spoon a dollop of the pancake batter onto the skillet and spread it slightly to form a small round pancake. repeat to make more pancakes, leaving some space between each.
6. cook the pancakes until small bubbles start to form on the surface, then flip them with a spatula and cook for another 1-2 minutes until golden brown.
7. remove the pancakes from the skillet and let them cool slightly.
8. cut the pancakes into small squares or use a cookie cutter to create different shapes.
9. assemble the pancake skewers by threading the pancake squares and fresh fruits onto wooden skewers, alternating between the two.
10. serve the pancake skewers with a side of vegan chocolate spread or maple syrup for dipping.
11. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, baking, powder, salt, almond, milk, plant, milk, coconut, vanilla, extract, fresh, fruit, strawberry, banana, blueberry, vegan, chocolate, spread, maple, syrup, dipping

title: Veggie Breakfast Wrap with Tofu Scramble
raw_text: 98. Veggie Breakfast Wrap with Tofu Scramble: 200kcals per portion; 4 portions; contains soy, gluten; Origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1/2 small onion, diced
- 1/2 red bell pepper, diced
- 1/2 green bell pepper, diced
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric
- 1/2 teaspoon cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1/2 cup crumbled tofu

- 1/2 avocado, sliced
- fresh spinach leaves
preparation:
1. heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
2. add diced onion, red bell pepper, and green bell pepper to the skillet and sauté for 5 minutes, or until softened.
3. stir in minced garlic, turmeric, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. cook for another 1 minute.
4. add crumbled tofu to the skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes until heated through and well combined with the spices.
5. warm the tortillas or wraps in a separate skillet or microwave.
6. divide the tofu scramble mixture between the tortillas or wraps, spreading it evenly.
7. top with sliced avocado and a handful of fresh spinach leaves.
8. roll up the tortillas or wraps tightly, tucking in the sides as you go.
9. slice each wrap in half and serve immediately.
10. enjoy your delicious veggie breakfast wrap with tofu scramble!

title: Blueberry Banana Breakfast Bars

ingredients:
ingredients:

title: Greek Yogurt Pancakes
raw_text:
58. Greek Yogurt Pancakes
Calories: 280 per portion
Portions: 4
Allergenic Warning: Contains gluten (flour), contains dairy
Origin: Greece
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup greek yogurt
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, whisk together the greek yogurt and eggs until well combined.

3. gradually add the dry ingredients to the yogurt mixture, stirring until just combined. do not overmix; it's okay if there are a few lumps.

5. pour about 1/4 cup of batter onto the skillet for each pancake. cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes, or until golden brown.
6. remove from heat and serve warm. optional toppings include fresh fruits, maple syrup, or honey. enjoy!

title: Grilled Cheese Sandwich
raw_text:
17. Grilled Cheese Sandwich: 400 calories per portion, 1 portion, origin: -
    - Warning: Contains dairy, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 slices of bread
- butter or margarine, softened
- 2 slices of cheese (cheddar, mozzarella, or your preference)
- optional: additional fillings such as sliced tomatoes, bacon, or ham
preparation:
1. preheat a skillet or griddle over medium heat.
2. spread butter or margarine evenly on one side of each bread slice.

4. place one slice of cheese on top of the bread.

title: Almond Biscotti
raw_text:
28. Almond Biscotti: 120 calories per portion, 1 portion, origin: Italy
    - Warning: Contains nuts, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 ½ teaspoons baking powder
- ½ teaspoon salt
- ¼ cup unsalted butter, softened
- ¾ cup granulated sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 teaspoon almond extract
- 1 cup whole almonds, toasted and coarsely chopped
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c). line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
3. in a separate large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
4. beat in the eggs, one at a time, followed by the vanilla extract and almond extract.
5. gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
6. fold in the chopped almonds.
7. divide the dough in half. on a lightly floured surface, shape each portion into a 12-inch long log.
8. place the logs onto the prepared baking sheet, spacing them a few inches apart.
9. bake for 25-30 minutes, or until golden brown and slightly firm to touch.
10. remove from the oven and let cool on the baking sheet for 10 minutes.
11. reduce the oven temperature to 325°f (160°c).
12. transfer the logs to a cutting board and slice diagonally into ½-inch thick pieces.
13. place the biscotti back on the baking sheet and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until they are crispy and dry.
14. remove from the oven and allow to cool completely before serving or storing in an airtight container.

enjoy your almond biscotti!
ingredients_list: flour, baking, powder, salt, unsalted, butter, sugar, egg, vanilla, extract, almond, extract, whole, almond, toasted, coarsely

title: Spinach Quiche
raw_text:
29. Spinach Quiche: 280 calories per portion, 1 portion, origin: France
    - Warning: Contains dairy, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 refrigerated pie crust
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 3 cups fresh spinach, chopped
- 4 eggs
- 1 cup milk
- 1 cup shredded swiss cheese
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. roll out the refrigerated pie crust and press it into a 9-inch pie dish. set aside.
3. heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. add the diced onion and minced garlic, and sauté until the onion becomes translucent.
4. add the chopped spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted, about 2-3 minutes. remove from heat and set aside.
5. in a medium mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs and milk until well combined.
6. stir in the shredded swiss cheese, salt, and black pepper until evenly distributed.
7. add the cooked spinach mixture to the egg and cheese mixture, and stir until everything is well incorporated.
8. pour the mixture into the prepared pie crust, spreading it out evenly.
9. place the quiche in the preheated oven and bake for 40-45 minutes, or until the center is set and the top is golden brown.
10. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving. enjoy warm or at room temperature.
ingredients_list: pie, crust, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, spinach, egg, milk, shredded, swiss, cheese, salt, black, pepper

title: Spinach and Feta Phyllo Triangles
raw_text:
81. Spinach and Feta Phyllo Triangles: 180 calories per portion, 1 portion, origin: Greece
    - Warning: Contains dairy, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups spinach, chopped
- 1 cup feta cheese, crumbled
- ¼ cup fresh dill, chopped
- 2 green onions, finely chopped
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 12 sheets phyllo dough
- ½ cup melted butter
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a large bowl, mix together the chopped spinach, crumbled feta cheese, chopped dill, and finely chopped green onions.
3. drizzle the olive oil over the mixture and season with salt and pepper. stir well to combine all the ingredients.
4. take one sheet of phyllo dough and brush it lightly with melted butter. layer another sheet of phyllo dough on top and brush with more butter. repeat this process until you have 6 layers of phyllo dough.
5. cut the layered phyllo dough into 6 equal strips vertically.
6. place a spoonful of the spinach and feta mixture at the bottom of each phyllo strip. fold the bottom right corner of the strip over the filling, creating a triangle shape. continue folding the strip up and over, maintaining the triangle shape, until the entire strip is folded.
7. repeat steps 5 and 6 with the remaining phyllo dough and spinach-feta mixture.
8. place the filled phyllo triangles on the prepared baking sheet. brush the tops with melted butter.
9. bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the triangles turn golden brown.
10. allow the spinach and feta phyllo triangles to cool slightly before serving. enjoy as an appetizer or snack!
ingredients_list: spinach, feta, cheese, fresh, dill, green, onion, olive, salt, pepper, taste, sheet, phyllo, dough, butter

title: Avocado Toast with Tomato and Basil
raw_text: 3. Avocado Toast with Tomato and Basil: 250 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, origin: N/A

ingredients:
- 1 ripe avocado
- 2 slices of bread (preferably whole wheat or sourdough)

preparation:
1. start by toasting the bread slices until golden and crispy.
2. while the bread is toasting, cut the avocado in half and remove the pit. scoop out the flesh and place it in a small bowl.
3. mash the avocado with a fork until it reaches your desired consistency. add salt and pepper to taste.
4. wash and slice the tomato into thin rounds.
5. once the bread slices are toasted, spread the mashed avocado evenly onto each slice.
6. layer the tomato slices on top of the avocado.

title: Chia Pudding with Almond Milk and Mango
raw_text: 5. Chia Pudding with Almond Milk and Mango: 300 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains nuts, origin: N/A
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1/4 cup chia seeds
- 1 cup almond milk
- 1 ripe mango, diced
- 1 tablespoon honey or maple syrup (optional, for sweetness)
- a pinch of cinnamon (optional, for flavor)
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine chia seeds and almond milk.
2. stir well to ensure the chia seeds are evenly distributed.
3. let the mixture sit for about 5 minutes, then stir again to prevent clumping.
4. cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
5. once the chia seeds have absorbed the almond milk and formed a pudding-like consistency, give it a good stir.
6. if desired, add honey or maple syrup for sweetness and a pinch of cinnamon for extra flavor. stir until well incorporated.
7. in serving glasses or bowls, layer the chia pudding and diced mango.
8. repeat the layering process until all the chia pudding and mango are used.
9. garnish with additional mango cubes, if desired.
10. serve chilled and enjoy!
ingredients_list: chia, seed, almond, milk, mango, honey, maple, syrup, sweetness, pinch, cinnamon, flavor

title: Cottage Cheese Pancakes with Blueberries
raw_text: 7. Cottage Cheese Pancakes with Blueberries: 250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: N/A

ingredients:

title: Overnight Oats with Apples and Cinnamon
raw_text: 8. Overnight Oats with Apples and Cinnamon: 300 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, origin: N/A
ingredients:
ingredients:

ingredients:

title: Vegetable Smoothie

ingredients:

- 1 small bunch of spinach
- 1 apple
- 1 lemon
