title: Quinoa Salad with Chickpeas and Veggies
raw_text: 17. Quinoa Salad with Chickpeas and Veggies: 300 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains N/A, origin: N/A
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup quinoa
- 2 cups water
- 1 can chickpeas, rinsed and drained
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 cucumber, diced
- 1/2 red onion, finely chopped
- 1/2 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped
- 1/4 cup fresh mint, chopped

for the dressing:
- 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. rinse the quinoa under cold water in a fine-mesh sieve. in a medium-sized pot, bring the water to a boil. add the quinoa and reduce the heat to low. cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the water is absorbed and the quinoa is tender. remove from heat and let it cool.

2. in a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, chickpeas, diced red bell pepper, cucumber, red onion, cherry tomatoes, parsley, and mint.

3. in a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, ground cumin, salt, and pepper.

4. pour the dressing over the salad and toss everything together until well coated.

5. serve chilled and enjoy! you can garnish with additional fresh herbs if desired.
cuisine: The cuisine type for this recipe is "Mediterranean."

sure! here's the recipe for a cucumber and hummus sandwich:

title: Vegan Chocolate Energy Balls
raw_text: 19. Vegan Chocolate Energy Balls: 150 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains nuts, origin: N/A
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup medjool dates, pitted
- 1 cup nuts (e.g. almonds, cashews, or walnuts)
- 2 tablespoons cocoa powder
- 2 tablespoons chia seeds
- 1 tablespoon maple syrup
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- pinch of salt
- shredded coconut (optional, for rolling)
preparation:
1. in a food processor, blend the medjool dates and nuts until a sticky mixture forms.
2. add the cocoa powder, chia seeds, maple syrup, vanilla extract, and salt to the food processor. blend until all ingredients are well combined and a dough-like consistency is achieved.
3. scoop out tablespoon-sized portions of the mixture and roll into balls between your hands.
4. if desired, roll the balls in shredded coconut for added texture and flavor.
5. place the energy balls in an airtight container and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to help them firm up.
6. enjoy as a healthy and delicious snack on-the-go!
ingredients_list: medjool, date, pitted, nut, almond, cashew, walnut, cocoa, powder, chia, seed, maple, syrup, vanilla, extract, pinch, salt, shredded, coconut, rolling

title: Spinach and Feta Puff Pastry Tart
raw_text: 21. Spinach and Feta Puff Pastry Tart: 300 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains dairy, origin: Greece
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 sheet of puff pastry
- 2 cups of fresh spinach, chopped
- 1 cup of crumbled feta cheese
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. thaw the puff pastry according to the package instructions, if frozen.
3. in a skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the minced garlic and sauté for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
4. add the chopped spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted, about 3-4 minutes. season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. remove the skillet from heat and let the spinach mixture cool slightly.
6. on a lightly floured surface, unfold the sheet of puff pastry and roll it out slightly to smooth any creases.
7. transfer the puff pastry to the prepared baking sheet.
8. evenly spread the spinach mixture over the puff pastry, leaving a small border around the edges.
9. sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese over the top of the spinach.
10. gently fold the edges of the puff pastry over the filling, creating a border.
11. bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the puff pastry is golden brown and puffed.
12. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
13. cut into slices and enjoy your delicious spinach and feta puff pastry tart!
ingredients_list: puff, pastry, fresh, spinach, feta, cheese, clove, garlic, minced, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Banana and Blueberry Protein Smoothie
raw_text: 24. Banana and Blueberry Protein Smoothie: 300 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains dairy, origin: N/A
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 ripe banana
- 1/2 cup blueberries
- 1 scoop vanilla protein powder
- 1 cup almond milk
- 1 tablespoon honey (optional)
- ice cubes (optional)
preparation:
1. peel the banana and break it into smaller pieces.
2. rinse the blueberries under cold water and remove any stems.
3. place the banana, blueberries, protein powder, almond milk, and honey (if desired) into a blender.
4. blend on high speed until smooth and creamy.
5. if desired, add a few ice cubes to make the smoothie colder and more refreshing.
6. blend again until the desired consistency is reached.
7. taste the smoothie and adjust sweetness or thickness by adding more honey or almond milk if needed.
8. pour the smoothie into a glass and serve immediately. enjoy!
ingredients_list: banana, blueberry, scoop, vanilla, protein, powder, almond, milk, honey, ice, cube

title: Vegetable Spring Rolls with Peanut Dipping Sauce
raw_text: 25. Vegetable Spring Rolls with Peanut Dipping Sauce: 350 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains nuts, origin: N/A
ingredients:
ingredients for vegetable spring rolls:
- 8 spring roll wrappers
- 1 cup shredded cabbage
- 1 cup shredded carrots
- 1 cup bean sprouts
- 1/2 cup sliced bell peppers
- 1/2 cup sliced cucumber
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh mint leaves
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil leaves
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon sesame oil
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- salt and pepper to taste
- oil for frying

ingredients for peanut dipping sauce:
- 1/2 cup peanut butter
- 2 tablespoons hoisin sauce
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon lime juice
- 1 tablespoon honey
- 1 teaspoon sesame oil
- 1/4 cup warm water (or more for desired consistency)
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, combine the shredded cabbage, carrots, bean sprouts, bell peppers, cucumber, cilantro, mint, basil, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, sugar, salt, and pepper. mix well to evenly coat the vegetables with the seasoning.
2. take one spring roll wrapper and place it on a clean, flat surface. place about 1/4 cup of the vegetable mixture diagonally in the center of the wrapper. fold the sides over the filling, then tightly roll the wrapper from the bottom to the top, sealing the edges with a bit of water. repeat with the remaining wrappers and filling.
3. in a deep saucepan or skillet, heat enough oil for frying over medium heat. carefully place the spring rolls in the hot oil, a few at a time, and cook until golden brown and crispy, about 3-4 minutes. remove the cooked spring rolls and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil. repeat until all spring rolls are cooked.
4. for the peanut dipping sauce, in a small bowl, whisk together the peanut butter, hoisin sauce, soy sauce, lime juice, honey, sesame oil, and warm water until smooth and well combined. add more warm water if needed to reach your desired dipping consistency.
5. serve the crispy vegetable spring rolls with the peanut dipping sauce on the side. enjoy!
ingredients_list: spring, wrapper, shredded, cabbage, shredded, carrot, bean, sprout, bell, pepper, cucumber, fresh, cilantro, fresh, mint, leaf, fresh, basil, leaf, soy, sauce, rice, vinegar, sesame, sugar, salt, pepper, taste, peanut, butter, hoisin, sauce, soy, sauce, lime, honey, sesame, water

title: Homemade Trail Mix
raw_text: 26. Homemade Trail Mix: 150 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains nuts, origin: N/A
ingredients:
sure! here's a recipe for homemade trail mix:

ingredients:
- 1 cup nuts (such as almonds, walnuts, or cashews)
- 1 cup dried fruits (such as raisins, cranberries, or apricots)
- 1 cup seeds (such as pumpkin seeds or sunflower seeds)
- 1 cup pretzels or whole grain cereal
- 1/2 cup dark chocolate chips or chunks
- 1/4 cup coconut flakes (optional)
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, mix together the nuts, dried fruits, seeds, pretzels (or whole grain cereal), chocolate chips, and coconut flakes (if using).
2. stir well to ensure all the ingredients are evenly distributed.
3. transfer the trail mix into an airtight container or individual snack bags.
4. enjoy as a snack or take it on your outdoor adventures!

optional: you can customize the trail mix by adding other ingredients such as banana chips, popcorn, or mini marshmallows. feel free to adjust the quantities of each ingredient to suit your taste preferences.
ingredients_list: nut, almond, walnut, cashew, dried, fruit, raisin, cranberry, apricot, seed, pumpkin, seed, sunflower, seed, pretzel, whole, grain, cereal, dark, chocolate, chip, coconut, flake

title: Vegetable Couscous Salad
raw_text: 28. Vegetable Couscous Salad: 250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Middle East
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup couscous
- 1 1/2 cups water
- 1 cucumber, diced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 yellow bell pepper, diced
- 1 small red onion, finely chopped
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped
- 1/4 cup fresh mint, chopped
- 1/4 cup olive oil
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- salt and black pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a medium saucepan, bring the water to a boil. remove from heat and stir in the couscous. cover the saucepan with a lid and let the couscous sit for about 5 minutes, or until all the water is absorbed. fluff the couscous with a fork and transfer it into a large mixing bowl.
2. add the diced cucumber, red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, red onion, cherry tomatoes, parsley, and mint to the bowl with couscous.
3. in a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil and lemon juice. season with salt and black pepper, to taste. pour the dressing over the couscous salad and toss to combine all the ingredients.
4. taste and adjust the seasoning if needed. serve the vegetable couscous salad chilled or at room temperature. enjoy!
ingredients_list: couscous, water, cucumber, red, bell, pepper, yellow, bell, pepper, red, onion, cherry, tomato, halved, fresh, parsley, fresh, mint, olive, lemon, salt, black, pepper, taste

title: Peanut Butter and Jelly Rice Cakes
raw_text: 29. Peanut Butter and Jelly Rice Cakes: 300 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains nuts, origin: N/A
ingredients:
ingredients:
- rice cakes
- peanut butter
- jelly (any flavor of your choice)
preparation:
1. take a rice cake and spread a generous amount of peanut butter on top.
2. next, spread a layer of jelly on top of the peanut butter.
3. place another rice cake on top to form a sandwich.
4. repeat these steps for as many rice cake sandwiches as desired.
5. enjoy your peanut butter and jelly rice cakes as a snack or light meal!
ingredients_list: rice, cake, peanut, butter, jelly, flavor

title: Baked Apple with Cinnamon
raw_text: 30. Baked Apple with Cinnamon: 150 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains N/A, origin: N/A
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 apples
- 4 tablespoons of brown sugar
- 2 teaspoons of ground cinnamon
- 4 tablespoons of melted butter
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. wash and core the apples, leaving the bottoms intact. remove a small portion from the top of each apple as well.
3. in a small bowl, mix together the brown sugar and cinnamon.
4. place the apples in a baking dish and fill the center of each apple with the brown sugar and cinnamon mixture. press the mixture down gently.
5. drizzle melted butter over the tops of the apples, allowing it to soak into the sugar mixture.
6. bake the apples in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until they are tender when pierced with a fork.
7. serve the baked apples warm. optionally, you can serve them with a scoop of vanilla ice cream or a dollop of whipped cream. enjoy!
ingredients_list: apple, brown, sugar, ground, cinnamon, butter

title: Spinach and Egg Muffins
raw_text: 32. Spinach and Egg Muffins: 250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains eggs, origin: N/A
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 6 large eggs
- 2 cups fresh spinach, chopped
- 1/4 cup red bell pepper, diced
- 1/4 cup onion, diced
- 1/4 cup cheddar cheese, grated
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
- cooking spray
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. in a large mixing bowl, whisk the eggs until well beaten.
3. add the chopped spinach, diced red bell pepper, diced onion, grated cheddar cheese, salt, black pepper, and garlic powder to the eggs. mix everything until well combined.
4. grease a muffin tin with cooking spray. 
5. pour the egg mixture evenly into the muffin cups, filling them about 2/3 of the way.
6. bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the muffins are set and slightly golden on top.
7. remove the muffin tin from the oven and let the muffins cool for a few minutes.
8. carefully remove the spinach and egg muffins from the tin with a spoon or knife.
9. serve hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: egg, fresh, spinach, red, bell, pepper, onion, cheddar, cheese, salt, black, pepper, garlic, powder, spray

title: Chocolate Chia Seed Pudding
raw_text: 33. Chocolate Chia Seed Pudding: 300 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains dairy, origin: N/A
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1/4 cup chia seeds
- 1 cup milk (dairy or plant-based)
- 2 tablespoons cocoa powder
- 2 tablespoons maple syrup or sweetener of choice
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- optional toppings: chocolate chips, chopped nuts, berries, coconut flakes
preparation:
1. in a medium-sized bowl, combine chia seeds, cocoa powder, and sweetener.
2. slowly pour in the milk and whisk well to ensure that there are no clumps.
3. add the vanilla extract and mix thoroughly.
4. cover the bowl and place it in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours, or overnight if possible.
5. once the chia seeds have absorbed the liquid and the pudding has thickened, give it a good stir.
6. serve the chocolate chia seed pudding in individual bowls or jars.
7. top with desired toppings, such as chocolate chips, chopped nuts, berries, or coconut flakes.
8. enjoy immediately or refrigerate for up to 3 days.
ingredients_list: chia, seed, milk, dairy, plant, cocoa, powder, maple, syrup, sweetener, vanilla, extract, topping, chocolate, chip, nut, berry, coconut, flake

title: Vegetable Quesadilla with Salsa
raw_text: 39. Vegetable Quesadilla with Salsa: 250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Mexico
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 tortillas
- 1 cup mixed vegetables (bell peppers, onions, mushrooms, zucchini, etc.), sliced
- 1 cup shredded cheese (cheddar, mozzarella, or a mix)
- 1/2 cup salsa
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. heat one tablespoon of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
2. add the mixed vegetables to the skillet and sauté for 5-7 minutes, or until they are tender.
3. remove the vegetables from the skillet and set aside.
4. place one tortilla in the skillet and sprinkle half of the shredded cheese evenly over it.
5. spoon half of the sautéed vegetables on top of the cheese.
6. spread a layer of salsa over the vegetables.
7. sprinkle a little more cheese on top.
8. place the second tortilla on top to create a quesadilla.
9. cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the bottom tortilla is golden brown.
10. carefully flip the quesadilla over and cook for another 2-3 minutes, or until the other side is golden brown and the cheese is melted.
11. repeat the process for the second quesadilla using the remaining ingredients.
12. once both quesadillas are cooked, remove them from the skillet and let them cool slightly.
13. cut each quesadilla into wedges and serve warm.
14. optionally, you can serve them with additional salsa or sour cream on the side. enjoy!
ingredients_list: tortilla, vegetable, bell, pepper, onion, mushroom, zucchini, shredded, cheese, cheddar, mozzarella, salsa, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Homemade Salsa and Tortilla Chips
raw_text: 40. Homemade Salsa and Tortilla Chips: 300 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, origin: Mexico
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 roma tomatoes
- 1/2 red onion
- 1 jalapeno pepper
- 1/4 cup fresh cilantro leaves
- 2 cloves garlic
- 1 lime
- salt, to taste
- tortilla chips, for serving
preparation:
1. preheat the broiler in your oven.
2. slice the tomatoes in half and place them on a baking sheet, cut side down.
3. peel and quarter the red onion. add it to the baking sheet.
4. cut the jalapeno in half lengthwise and remove the seeds. place it on the baking sheet.
5. place the baking sheet under the broiler and broil for about 10-15 minutes, or until the tomato skins are blackened and blistered.
6. while the tomatoes are broiling, roughly chop the cilantro leaves.
7. peel the garlic cloves and crush them.
8. remove the baking sheet from the oven and carefully transfer the hot ingredients to a blender or food processor.
9. add the cilantro, crushed garlic, juice of half a lime, and salt to taste.
10. blend the ingredients until you achieve your desired consistency. for a chunky salsa, pulse a few times. for a smoother salsa, blend until smooth.
11. taste the salsa and adjust the seasoning with more salt or lime juice if needed.
12. allow the salsa to cool in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
13. serve the homemade salsa with tortilla chips. enjoy!
ingredients_list: rom, tomato, red, onion, jalapeno, pepper, fresh, cilantro, leaf, clove, garlic, lime, salt, taste, tortilla, chip

title: Tofu Scramble with Veggies
raw_text: 42. Tofu Scramble with Veggies: 200 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains soy, origin: N/A
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 block of firm tofu
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 cup of diced tomatoes
- 1 cup of chopped spinach
- 2 tablespoons of nutritional yeast
- 1 teaspoon of turmeric
- 1/2 teaspoon of paprika
- salt and pepper to taste
- optional toppings: avocado, cilantro, hot sauce
preparation:
1. start by pressing the tofu to remove excess water. place the block of tofu on a cutting board and cover it with a paper towel or kitchen towel. place a heavy object (such as a pan or book) on top of the tofu and let it sit for 15-20 minutes to press out the water. this step helps the tofu absorb flavors better.

2. once the tofu has been pressed, crumble it into small pieces using your hands or a fork.

3. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. add the diced onion and bell pepper and sauté for about 5 minutes until they start to soften.

4. add the minced garlic and crumbled tofu to the skillet. stir everything together and let it cook for about 5-7 minutes, until the tofu starts to brown slightly.

5. add the diced tomatoes, chopped spinach, nutritional yeast, turmeric, paprika, salt, and pepper to the skillet. stir well to combine all the ingredients.

6. cook the tofu scramble for another 5-7 minutes, until the veggies are heated through and the flavors have melded together.

7. serve the tofu scramble hot, either on its own or with your choice of optional toppings such as avocado, cilantro, or hot sauce.

enjoy your tofu scramble with veggies!
ingredients_list: tofu, olive, bell, pepper, onion, clove, garlic, minced, tomato, spinach, yeast, turmeric, paprika, salt, pepper, taste, topping, avocado, cilantro, hot, sauce

title: Veggie Stuffed Mushrooms
raw_text: 45. Veggie Stuffed Mushrooms: 250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains N/A, origin: N/A
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 12 large mushrooms
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 small zucchini, finely chopped
- 1 small red bell pepper, finely chopped
- 1 small carrot, grated
- 1 cup fresh spinach, chopped
- 1 cup breadcrumbs
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. clean the mushrooms and remove the stems. set aside.
3. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. add the onions and garlic and sauté until softened.
4. add the zucchini, bell pepper, and carrot to the skillet. cook for about 5 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
5. stir in the chopped spinach and cook for another 2 minutes until wilted.
6. remove the skillet from heat and stir in the breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, and chopped parsley. season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. stuff each mushroom cap with the vegetable mixture and place them on a baking sheet.
8. bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the mushrooms are cooked through and the filling is golden brown.
9. serve hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: mushroom, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, zucchini, red, bell, pepper, carrot, fresh, spinach, breadcrumb, parmesan, cheese, fresh, parsley, salt, pepper, taste

title: Banana and Chocolate Chip Scones
raw_text: 46. Banana and Chocolate Chip Scones: 300 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, origin: N/A
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 2 cups all-purpose flour 
- 1/3 cup granulated sugar 
- 2 teaspoons baking powder 
- 1/2 teaspoon salt 
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, cold and cubed 
- 1 ripe banana, mashed 
- 1/2 cup chocolate chips 
- 1/3 cup milk 
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper. 
2. in a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. 
3. add the cold cubed butter to the flour mixture. using a pastry cutter or your fingers, cut the butter into the flour until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. 
4. in a separate bowl, combine the mashed banana, chocolate chips, milk, and vanilla extract. stir well to combine. 
5. pour the banana mixture into the flour mixture. stir until the dough comes together. 
6. turn the dough out onto a floured surface and gently knead it a few times to bring it together. 
7. shape the dough into a 1-inch thick circle and cut it into 8 equal wedges. 
8. place the scones onto the prepared baking sheet and bake for 15-18 minutes, or until they are golden brown. 
9. remove from the oven and allow the scones to cool on a wire rack before serving. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, baking, powder, salt, unsalted, butter, banana, chocolate, chip, milk, vanilla, extract

title: Spinach and Artichoke Dip with Whole Wheat Crackers
raw_text: 47. Spinach and Artichoke Dip with Whole Wheat Crackers: 350 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, origin: N/A
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained
- 1 can (14 oz) artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
- 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/2 cup mayonnaise
- 1/2 cup sour cream
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- whole wheat crackers for serving
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a large bowl, combine the drained spinach, chopped artichoke hearts, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese, mayonnaise, sour cream, minced garlic, salt, and black pepper. mix well until all ingredients are well combined.
3. transfer the mixture to an oven-safe baking dish and spread it evenly.
4. bake in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes, or until the dip is heated through and the cheese is melted and slightly golden on top.
5. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
6. serve the spinach and artichoke dip warm with whole wheat crackers on the side for dipping.

enjoy your spinach and artichoke dip with whole wheat crackers!
ingredients_list: frozen, spinach, thawed, artichoke, heart, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, parmesan, cheese, mayonnaise, sour, cream, clove, garlic, minced, salt, black, pepper, whole, wheat, cracker

title: Roasted Mediterranean Vegetables
raw_text: 48. Roasted Mediterranean Vegetables: 200 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains N/A, origin: Greece
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 eggplant, cubed
- 1 zucchini, sliced
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 yellow bell pepper, sliced
- 1 red onion, sliced
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- 1 teaspoon of dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon of dried basil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
2. in a large baking dish, combine the eggplant, zucchini, bell peppers, red onion, and minced garlic.
3. drizzle the olive oil over the vegetables and toss to coat them evenly.
4. sprinkle the dried oregano, dried basil, salt, and pepper over the vegetables and toss again to distribute the seasonings.
5. spread the vegetables out in an even layer in the baking dish.
6. place the baking dish in the preheated oven and roast for about 25-30 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and slightly caramelized.
7. stir the vegetables halfway through the cooking time to ensure they cook evenly.
8. remove the roasted mediterranean vegetables from the oven and serve hot as a side dish or as a topping for pasta, rice, or quinoa.
ingredients_list: eggplant, zucchini, red, bell, pepper, yellow, bell, pepper, red, onion, clove, garlic, minced, olive, dried, oregano, dried, basil, salt, pepper, taste

title: Ricotta and Spinach Stuffed Shells
raw_text: 49. Ricotta and Spinach Stuffed Shells: 250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Italy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 20 jumbo pasta shells
- 2 cups ricotta cheese
- 1 cup chopped spinach, cooked and drained
- 1 egg, lightly beaten
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/2 teaspoon dried basil
- 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 cups marinara sauce
- 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c). cook the jumbo pasta shells according to the package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.
2. in a large bowl, mix together the ricotta cheese, cooked spinach, beaten egg, grated parmesan cheese, garlic powder, dried basil, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper until well combined.
3. spoon about 1-2 tablespoons of the ricotta and spinach mixture into each cooked pasta shell and place them in a greased baking dish.
4. pour the marinara sauce over the stuffed shells, covering them evenly.
5. sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese on top.
6. cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes.
7. remove the foil and bake for an additional 10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
9. serve warm and enjoy!
ingredients_list: pasta, shell, ricotta, cheese, spinach, egg, lightly, parmesan, cheese, garlic, powder, dried, basil, dried, oregano, salt, black, pepper, marinara, sauce, shredded, mozzarella, cheese

title: Apple Cinnamon Energy Bars
raw_text: 50. Apple Cinnamon Energy Bars: 200 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: N/A
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups rolled oats
- 1 cup almonds, chopped
- 1 cup dried apples, chopped
- 1/2 cup honey
- 1/4 cup almond butter
- 1/4 cup maple syrup
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c) and line an 8x8-inch baking dish with parchment paper.
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the rolled oats, chopped almonds, and dried apples.
3. in a small saucepan, heat the honey, almond butter, maple syrup, cinnamon, vanilla extract, and salt over medium heat. stir until well combined and smooth.
4. pour the warm honey mixture over the dry ingredients and mix until everything is evenly coated.
5. transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish and press it down firmly to create an even layer.
6. bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the edges turn golden brown.
7. remove from the oven and let it cool completely in the baking dish before cutting into bars.
8. once cooled, cut into desired-sized bars and serve. you can store these bars in an airtight container for up to a week.

enjoy your homemade apple cinnamon energy bars!
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, almond, dried, apple, honey, almond, butter, maple, syrup, cinnamon, vanilla, extract, salt

title: Mango and Coconut Chia Pudding
raw_text: 51. Mango and Coconut Chia Pudding: 250 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains nuts, origin: N/A
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 ripe mango
- 1 can (13.5 fl oz) coconut milk
- 4 tablespoons chia seeds
- 1 tablespoon honey or maple syrup (optional)
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract (optional)
- fresh mango slices, for garnish (optional)
- toasted coconut flakes, for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. peel and dice the ripe mango, setting aside a few slices for garnish if desired.
2. in a blender, combine the diced mango and coconut milk. blend until smooth.
3. in a bowl, pour the mango and coconut milk mixture. add the chia seeds and stir well to combine.
4. if desired, add honey or maple syrup and vanilla extract to sweeten the pudding. stir again to combine.
5. cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 3-4 hours, or overnight, allowing the chia seeds to expand and thicken the pudding.
6. once the chia pudding has set, give it a good stir and divide it into serving glasses or bowls.
7. if desired, garnish the pudding with fresh mango slices and toasted coconut flakes.
8. serve chilled and enjoy your mango and coconut chia pudding!
ingredients_list: mango, coconut, milk, chia, seed, honey, maple, syrup, vanilla, extract, fresh, mango, garnish, toasted, coconut, flake, garnish

title: Blueberry and Oatmeal Muffins
raw_text: 62. Blueberry and Oatmeal Muffins: 250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: N/A
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
- 1 ½ cups rolled oats
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 1 tsp baking powder
- 1 tsp baking soda
- ½ tsp salt
- 1 cup buttermilk
- ½ cup unsalted butter, melted
- 2 large eggs
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- 1 ½ cups fresh blueberries
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c). line a muffin tin with paper liners or grease the cups.
2. in a large bowl, combine the flour, oats, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
3. in a separate bowl, whisk together the buttermilk, melted butter, eggs, and vanilla until well combined.
4. gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring until just combined. do not overmix.
5. gently fold in the blueberries.
6. scoop the batter into the prepared muffin tin, filling each cup about 2/3 full.
7. bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
8. allow the muffins to cool in the tin for 5 minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. enjoy your delicious homemade blueberry and oatmeal muffins!
ingredients_list: flour, rolled, oat, sugar, baking, powder, baking, soda, salt, buttermilk, unsalted, butter, egg, vanilla, extract, fresh, blueberry

title: Quinoa and Vegetable Stuffed Bell Peppers
raw_text: 67. Quinoa and Vegetable Stuffed Bell Peppers: 200 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains N/A, origin: N/A
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 bell peppers
- 1 cup quinoa
- 1 ¾ cups vegetable broth
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 zucchini, diced
- 1 yellow squash, diced
- 1 carrot, diced
- ½ cup corn kernels
- ½ cup black beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 cup shredded cheese (such as cheddar or mozzarella)
- fresh parsley, for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes. place them in a baking dish and set aside.
3. rinse the quinoa in a fine mesh sieve under cold water. in a saucepan, combine the quinoa and vegetable broth. bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for about 15 minutes, until the quinoa is cooked and the liquid is absorbed. remove from heat and set aside.
4. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the chopped onion and minced garlic, and sauté until the onion becomes translucent.
5. add the diced zucchini, yellow squash, and carrot to the skillet. cook for about 5 minutes, until the vegetables are slightly tender.
6. stir in the corn kernels, black beans, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. cook for another 5 minutes, until all the flavors are well combined.
7. remove the skillet from heat and add the cooked quinoa. mix everything together until well incorporated.
8. spoon the quinoa and vegetable mixture into each bell pepper until they are completely filled. place the tops back on the peppers.
9. cover the baking dish with foil and bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the peppers are tender.
10. remove the foil and sprinkle shredded cheese on top of each pepper. return to the oven and bake for another 5 minutes, or until the cheese has melted and turned golden.
11. remove from the oven and let the stuffed peppers cool slightly before serving. garnish with fresh parsley. enjoy!
ingredients_list: bell, pepper, quinoa, vegetable, broth, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, zucchini, yellow, carrot, corn, kernel, black, bean, cumin, paprika, salt, pepper, taste, shredded, cheese, cheddar, mozzarella, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Pumpkin and Cranberry Energy Balls
raw_text: 69. Pumpkin and Cranberry Energy Balls: 300 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains nuts, origin: N/A
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup pumpkin puree
- 1 cup rolled oats
- 1/2 cup dried cranberries
- 1/2 cup almond butter
- 1/4 cup honey
- 1/4 cup ground flaxseeds
- 1/4 cup unsweetened shredded coconut
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- pinch of salt
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the pumpkin puree, rolled oats, dried cranberries, almond butter, honey, ground flaxseeds, shredded coconut, cinnamon, vanilla extract, and salt.
2. mix well until all the ingredients are well combined.
3. place the mixture in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes to let it firm up.
4. once chilled, take small portions of the mixture and shape them into bite-sized balls using your hands.
5. repeat with the remaining mixture until you have used it all.
6. store the pumpkin and cranberry energy balls in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to one week.
7. enjoy as a quick and delicious energy-boosting snack!
cooking_style: no cooking style indicated, as this is a no-bake recipe.
ingredients_list: pumpkin, puree, rolled, oat, dried, cranberry, almond, butter, honey, ground, flaxseed, unsweetened, shredded, coconut, cinnamon, vanilla, extract, pinch, salt

title: Apple and Cinnamon Overnight Oats
raw_text: 75. Apple and Cinnamon Overnight Oats: 300 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, origin: N/A
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup rolled oats
- 1 cup unsweetened almond milk (or any other milk of your choice)
- 1 apple, diced
- 1 tablespoon maple syrup
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1 tablespoon chia seeds
- 1/4 cup chopped nuts (optional, for topping)
preparation:
1. in a mason jar or any other resealable container, combine the rolled oats, almond milk, diced apple, maple syrup, ground cinnamon, and chia seeds.
2. stir well to ensure all the ingredients are fully mixed together.
3. seal the jar/container and refrigerate it overnight or for at least 4-6 hours.
4. in the morning, give the oats a good stir to combine all the flavors.
5. if desired, top with chopped nuts for some extra crunch and protein.
6. enjoy your delicious and nutritious apple and cinnamon overnight oats!
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, unsweetened, almond, milk, milk, apple, maple, syrup, ground, cinnamon, chia, seed, nut, topping

title: Veggie Burrito with Black Beans and Rice
raw_text: 78. Veggie Burrito with Black Beans and Rice: 300 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains N/A, origin: Mexico
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup cooked black beans
- 1 cup cooked rice
- 1 onion, diced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 large tortillas
- optional toppings: shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, salsa, guacamole, sour cream, shredded cheese
preparation:
1. in a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
2. add diced onion and bell pepper to the skillet and sauté until they become translucent.
3. add minced garlic, cumin, chili powder, paprika, salt and pepper to the skillet and cook for another minute, stirring continuously.
4. stir in the cooked black beans and rice, mixing well to combine all the flavors. cook for an additional 3-4 minutes until everything is heated through.
5. warm the tortillas in a separate skillet or in the microwave.
6. place a generous portion of the bean and rice mixture onto each tortilla, slightly off-center.
7. fold the sides of the tortilla towards the center, then roll the tortilla tightly to create a burrito shape.
8. if desired, top each burrito with shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, salsa, guacamole, sour cream, and shredded cheese.
9. serve the veggie burritos immediately and enjoy!
ingredients_list: black, bean, rice, onion, bell, pepper, clove, garlic, minced, cumin, chili, powder, paprika, salt, pepper, taste, tortilla, topping, shredded, lettuce, tomato, salsa, guacamole, sour, cream, shredded, cheese

title: Vegetable Potstickers with Soy Dipping Sauce
raw_text: 81. Vegetable Potstickers with Soy Dipping Sauce: 300 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and soy, origin: China
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup shredded cabbage
- 1 cup shredded carrots
- 1 cup chopped mushrooms
- 1/2 cup chopped green onions
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon grated ginger
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon sesame oil
- 1 package round potsticker wrappers
- vegetable oil, for frying

for the soy dipping sauce:
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon honey
- 1 teaspoon sesame oil
- 1 teaspoon sriracha (optional)
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, combine the cabbage, carrots, mushrooms, green onions, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, and sesame oil. mix well to combine.
2. place a tablespoon of the vegetable filling onto a potsticker wrapper. moisten the edges of the wrapper with water and fold the wrapper in half to form a half-moon shape. pinch the edges tightly to seal the potsticker. repeat with the remaining filling and wrappers.
3. heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. place the potstickers in the skillet, seam-side up. cook until the bottoms are golden brown, about 2-3 minutes.
4. carefully pour 1/4 cup water into the skillet and immediately cover with a lid. steam the potstickers for 5-6 minutes, or until the wrappers are cooked through and the filling is tender.
5. while the potstickers are cooking, prepare the soy dipping sauce. in a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, sesame oil, and sriracha (if using).
6. remove the potstickers from the skillet and serve hot with the soy dipping sauce on the side. enjoy!
ingredients_list: shredded, cabbage, shredded, carrot, mushroom, green, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, soy, sauce, sesame, potsticker, wrapper, vegetable, soy, dipping, sauce, soy, sauce, rice, vinegar, honey, sesame, sriracha

title: Coconut Chia Pudding with Mixed Berries
raw_text: 87. Coconut Chia Pudding with Mixed Berries: 300 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains N/A, origin: N/A
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1/2 cup chia seeds
- 2 cups coconut milk
- 2 tablespoons honey or maple syrup
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 cup mixed berries (blueberries, strawberries, raspberries)
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the chia seeds, coconut milk, honey or maple syrup, and vanilla extract. 
2. stir well until all the ingredients are fully combined. 
3. let the mixture sit for about 5 minutes, to allow the chia seeds to start absorbing the liquid.
4. after 5 minutes, give the mixture another good stir to prevent clumping. 
5. cover the bowl and refrigerate overnight, or for at least 4-6 hours, to allow the chia seeds to fully absorb the liquid and achieve a pudding-like consistency.
6. when ready to serve, give the chia pudding another stir to ensure it is evenly mixed.
7. divide the chia pudding into serving glasses or bowls.
8. top each serving with a generous amount of mixed berries.
9. serve chilled and enjoy your coconut chia pudding with mixed berries!
ingredients_list: chia, seed, coconut, milk, honey, maple, syrup, vanilla, extract, berry, blueberry, strawberry, raspberry

title: Cheesy Broccoli Bites
raw_text: 89. Cheesy Broccoli Bites: 200 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: N/A
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups broccoli florets, finely chopped
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/4 cup bread crumbs
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/4 teaspoon onion powder
- salt and black pepper to taste
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c). line a baking sheet with parchment paper or lightly grease it with cooking spray.
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped broccoli, cheddar cheese, parmesan cheese, bread crumbs, beaten eggs, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and black pepper. mix well until all the ingredients are evenly combined.
3. take about a tablespoon of the broccoli mixture and roll it into a small bite-sized ball using your hands. place the ball onto the prepared baking sheet. repeat this process until all the mixture is used, leaving a small gap between each ball.
4. drizzle the olive oil over the broccoli bites to help them brown and crisp up in the oven.
5. bake the cheesy broccoli bites in the preheated oven for 18-20 minutes, or until they are golden brown and firm to the touch.
6. remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the bites cool slightly before serving. they can be served warm or at room temperature.
7. enjoy the cheesy broccoli bites as a delicious appetizer, snack, or even as a side dish to accompany your main meal.
ingredients_list: broccoli, floret, shredded, cheddar, cheese, parmesan, cheese, bread, crumb, egg, garlic, powder, onion, powder, salt, black, pepper, taste, olive

title: Mushroom and Swiss Cheese Quiche
raw_text: 92. Mushroom and Swiss Cheese Quiche: 350 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains dairy, origin: N/A
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pre-made pie crust
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 cup sliced mushrooms
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 4 large eggs
- 1 cup milk
- 1 cup shredded swiss cheese
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. place the pre-made pie crust into a 9-inch pie dish and set aside.
3. in a medium-sized skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
4. add the sliced mushrooms, diced onion, and minced garlic to the skillet. cook until the mushrooms are tender and the onions are translucent, about 5-7 minutes.
5. in a mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, and black pepper.
6. spread the cooked mushrooms and onion mixture evenly over the pie crust.
7. sprinkle the shredded swiss cheese over the mushroom mixture.
8. pour the egg and milk mixture over the filling, making sure it is evenly distributed.
9. place the quiche in the preheated oven and bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the center is set and the top is golden brown.
10. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving. enjoy your mushroom and swiss cheese quiche!
ingredients_list: pie, crust, olive, mushroom, onion, clove, garlic, minced, egg, milk, shredded, swiss, cheese, salt, black, pepper

title: Baked Cinnamon Apple Chips
raw_text: 94. Baked Cinnamon Apple Chips: 250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains N/A, origin: N/A
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large apples
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1 tablespoon granulated sugar
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 200°f (93°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. wash the apples and remove the core. optionally, you can leave the skin on for added texture and nutrition.
3. using a sharp knife or a mandoline slicer, slice the apples thinly, about 1/8 inch (3mm) thick.
4. in a small bowl, mix together the ground cinnamon and sugar.
5. arrange the apple slices on the prepared baking sheet in a single layer.
6. sprinkle the cinnamon-sugar mixture evenly over the apple slices.
7. place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for about 1 hour, or until the apple slices turn crispy and lightly golden brown. you may need to flip the slices halfway through the baking time for even crispness.
8. once baked, remove the apple chips from the oven and let them cool completely on the baking sheet. they will further harden as they cool.
9. store the baked cinnamon apple chips in an airtight container at room temperature for up to a week. enjoy as a healthy snack!
ingredients_list: apple, ground, cinnamon, sugar

title: Vegan Peanut Butter Cookies
raw_text: 97. Vegan Peanut Butter Cookies: 250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and nuts, origin: N/A
ingredients:
sure! here's a recipe for vegan peanut butter cookies:

ingredients:
- 1 cup peanut butter
- 1 cup sugar
- 1/4 cup unsweetened almond milk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a mixing bowl, cream together the peanut butter and sugar until well combined.
3. add the almond milk and vanilla extract to the bowl and mix until smooth.
4. in a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
5. gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until a thick dough forms.
6. roll tablespoon-sized portions of dough into balls and place them onto the prepared baking sheet.
7. use the back of a fork to create a crisscross pattern on top of each cookie, gently pressing them down.
8. bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are slightly golden.
9. remove from the oven and let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. once cooled, enjoy your delicious vegan peanut butter cookies!

note: feel free to add chocolate chips, chopped nuts, or any other desired mix-ins to the dough before baking for added flavor and texture.
ingredients_list: vegan, peanut, butter, cooky, peanut, butter, sugar, unsweetened, almond, milk, vanilla, extract, flour, baking, powder, salt

title: Veggie Oatmeal Muffins
raw_text:
100. Veggie Oatmeal Muffins: 250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: N/A

Please note that the calorie counts provided are estimates and may vary based on portion size and specific ingredients used. Also, be sure to check for any potential allergens in the ingredients and adjust accordingly based on personal dietary needs or restrictions. Enjoy your morning snacks!
ingredients:
ingredients:
1 cup rolled oats
1 cup almond milk (or any plant-based milk)
1 ripe banana, mashed
1/4 cup maple syrup
1/4 cup unsweetened applesauce
1 tsp vanilla extract
1 cup whole wheat flour
1 tsp baking powder
1/2 tsp baking soda
1/2 tsp cinnamon
1/4 tsp salt
1/2 cup grated zucchini
1/2 cup grated carrot
1/4 cup chopped walnuts (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c) and line a muffin tray with paper liners.
2. in a large bowl, combine the rolled oats and almond milk. let it sit for 10 minutes to allow the oats to soften.
3. add the mashed banana, maple syrup, applesauce, and vanilla extract to the oat mixture. stir until well combined.
4. in a separate bowl, whisk together the whole wheat flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
5. gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
6. gently fold in the grated zucchini, grated carrot, and chopped walnuts (if using).
7. divide the batter evenly among the prepared muffin cups, filling each about 2/3 full.
8. bake in the preheated oven for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
9. once done, remove the muffins from the oven and let them cool in the tray for 5 minutes. then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. enjoy the veggie oatmeal muffins as a healthy and delicious snack or breakfast option!

ingredients:

title: Mini Quiche
raw_text: 11. Mini Quiche: 200 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains eggs and dairy, origin: France.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 package of pre-made mini pie crusts
- 1/2 cup of chopped vegetables (e.g. bell peppers, mushrooms, onions)
- 1/2 cup of shredded cheese (e.g. cheddar, mozzarella)

1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. place the mini pie crusts in a muffin tin or on a baking sheet.
3. in a small pan, sauté the chopped vegetables until they are tender. set aside to cool.

title: Mexican Bean Dip
raw_text: 25. Mexican Bean Dip: 170 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains legumes, origin: Mexico.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 can (15 oz) of black beans, drained and rinsed
- 1 can (15 oz) of pinto beans, drained and rinsed
- 1 cup of salsa (use your favorite variety)
- 1 cup of shredded cheddar cheese

- 2 green onions, thinly sliced
- 1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and finely chopped (optional)

2. add the salsa, cheddar cheese, sour cream, cilantro, green onions, jalapeno pepper (if using), cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper to the bowl. mix everything together until well combined.
3. taste and adjust the seasonings if needed.
4. transfer the mixture to a serving dish and smooth the top with a spoon or spatula.
5. you can serve the mexican bean dip immediately, but for better flavor, refrigerate for at least 1 hour to allow the flavors to meld together.

title: Spinach Balls
raw_text: 33. Spinach Balls: 120 calories per portion, 5 portions, contains gluten, origin: United States.
ingredients:
here is the recipe for spinach balls:

ingredients:
- 2 cups frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained
- 1 cup breadcrumbs
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/4 cup melted butter
- 1/4 cup chopped onion
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 1/2 teaspoon salt

preparation:

3. shape the mixture into small balls, about 1-2 inches in diameter, and place them on a greased or parchment-lined baking sheet.

enjoy your delicious spinach balls!

title: Roasted Red Pepper Dip with Pita Chips
raw_text: 35. Roasted Red Pepper Dip with Pita Chips: 140 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten, origin: Middle East.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 red bell peppers
- 1 clove of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1/4 cup cream cheese
- 1/4 cup greek yogurt
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- pita chips, for serving
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
2. place the red bell peppers on a baking sheet and roast them in the oven for about 25-30 minutes, until the skins are charred and blistered.
3. remove the peppers from the oven and immediately transfer them to a bowl. cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let the peppers sit for about 10 minutes. this will make them easier to peel.
4. once the peppers are cool enough to handle, remove the charred skin, stems, and seeds. cut the peppers into smaller pieces.
5. in a blender or food processor, combine the roasted red peppers, minced garlic, olive oil, cream cheese, greek yogurt, lemon juice, salt, and black pepper. blend until smooth and creamy.
6. transfer the dip to a serving bowl and let it chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour to allow the flavors to meld.
7. serve the roasted red pepper dip with pita chips on the side. enjoy!
ingredients_list: red, bell, pepper, clove, garlic, minced, olive, cream, cheese, greek, yogurt, lemon, salt, black, pepper, pita, chip

title: Caramelized Onion Tart
raw_text: 37. Caramelized Onion Tart: 220 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: France.
ingredients:
ingredients:

- 1 sheet of puff pastry
- 3 large onions, thinly sliced
- 2 tablespoons of butter
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
- 2 teaspoons of sugar
- 2 tablespoons of balsamic vinegar
- 1 cup of shredded gruyere cheese
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh thyme leaves for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).

2. in a large skillet, melt the butter with the olive oil over medium heat.

3. add the sliced onions to the skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, until they become golden brown and caramelized. this process can take about 25-30 minutes.

4. sprinkle sugar over the onions and continue cooking for an additional 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.

5. pour in the balsamic vinegar and stir well to combine with the onions. cook for another 2-3 minutes until the vinegar is absorbed. remove from heat.

6. roll out the puff pastry on a lightly floured surface into a rectangular shape. transfer the puff pastry onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.

7. prick the pastry with a fork all over to prevent it from puffing up too much during baking.

8. spread the caramelized onions evenly over the puff pastry, leaving a small border around the edges.

9. sprinkle the shredded gruyere cheese over the onions, and season with salt and pepper.

10. bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly and melted.

11. remove the tart from the oven and let it cool slightly. sprinkle fresh thyme leaves over the top for garnish.

12. slice and serve the caramelized onion tart as an appetizer or a light meal. enjoy!
ingredients_list: puff, pastry, onion, thinly, butter, olive, sugar, balsamic, vinegar, shredded, gruyere, cheese, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, thyme, leaf, garnish

title: Black Bean and Corn Salsa
raw_text: 39. Black Bean and Corn Salsa: 150 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains legumes and corn, origin: Mexico.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
- 1 cup corn kernels (fresh or frozen)
- 1/2 red onion, finely chopped
- 1 small jalapeno pepper, seeded and finely chopped
- 1 bell pepper (any color), finely chopped
- 1/4 cup cilantro leaves, chopped
- 1 avocado, diced
- juice of 2 limes
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, combine the black beans, corn, red onion, jalapeno pepper, bell pepper, and cilantro.
2. gently fold in the diced avocado.
3. squeeze the lime juice over the mixture and season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. stir everything together until well combined.
5. cover the salsa and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to allow the flavors to meld.
6. serve chilled with tortilla chips or as a topping for tacos, salads, or grilled meats. enjoy!
ingredients_list: black, bean, corn, kernel, fresh, frozen, red, onion, jalapeno, pepper, seeded, bell, pepper, color, cilantro, leaf, avocado, lime, salt, pepper, taste

title: Sweet and Spicy Roasted Almonds
raw_text: 47. Sweet and Spicy Roasted Almonds: 180 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains nuts, origin: United States.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups whole almonds
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 tablespoon honey
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a medium bowl, combine the almonds, olive oil, honey, salt, cinnamon, and cayenne pepper. mix well until the almonds are evenly coated.
3. spread the almond mixture in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet.
4. roast the almonds in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until they are golden brown and fragrant. stir the almonds every 5 minutes to ensure even cooking and prevent burning.
5. remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the almonds cool completely before serving. they will become crunchier as they cool.
6. once cooled, transfer the almonds to an airtight container to store. enjoy as a tasty snack or use them to top salads, yogurt, or desserts.

title: Crispy Tofu Bites
raw_text: 51. Crispy Tofu Bites: 180 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains soy, origin: China.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 block of firm tofu
- 2 tablespoons cornstarch
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- vegetable oil for frying
preparation:
1. drain the tofu and press it between two plates or with a tofu press to remove excess moisture. slice the tofu into bite-sized cubes.
2. in a small bowl, mix together the cornstarch, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and black pepper.
3. coat the tofu cubes with the cornstarch mixture, shaking off any excess.
4. heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or deep fryer to about 350°f (175°c).
5. carefully place the coated tofu cubes into the hot oil, without overcrowding the pan.
6. fry the tofu until golden brown and crispy, turning occasionally to ensure even cooking. this should take about 4-5 minutes.
7. once crispy, remove the tofu bites from the oil and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain any excess oil.
8. serve the crispy tofu bites hot as a snack or with your favorite dipping sauce. enjoy!
cuisine: The cuisine type of the recipe "Crispy Tofu Bites" is Asian.
ingredients_list: tofu, cornstarch, garlic, powder, paprika, salt, black, pepper, vegetable

title: Peanut Butter Banana Roll
raw_text: 55. Peanut Butter Banana Roll-Ups: 250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and nuts, origin: United States.

ingredients:

title: Black Bean Dip with Tortilla Chips
raw_text: 56. Black Bean Dip with Tortilla Chips: 190 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains legumes, origin: Mexico.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
- 1 small onion, finely diced
- 1 small tomato, diced
- 1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons fresh cilantro, chopped
- 1 tablespoon lime juice
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- salt and pepper to taste
- tortilla chips for serving
preparation:
1. in a medium bowl, mash the black beans with a fork or potato masher until smooth.
2. add the diced onion, tomato, jalapeno pepper, garlic, cilantro, lime juice, cumin, salt, and pepper to the mashed black beans. mix well to combine all the ingredients.
3. taste and adjust seasonings if needed.
4. cover the dip and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to allow the flavors to meld together.
5. serve the black bean dip with tortilla chips. enjoy!

title: Avocado Cucumber Sushi Rolls
raw_text: 59. Avocado Cucumber Sushi Rolls: 180 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten and avocado, origin: Japan.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups sushi rice
- 3 tablespoons rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 4 sheets of nori (seaweed)
- 1 ripe avocado, thinly sliced
- 1 english cucumber, seeds removed and cut into thin strips
- soy sauce, for serving
- wasabi, for serving
- pickled ginger, for serving
preparation:
1. rinse the sushi rice under cold water until the water runs clear. cook according to package instructions.
2. in a small saucepan, combine rice vinegar, sugar, and salt. heat over low heat until the sugar and salt dissolve. set aside to cool.
3. once the cooked rice is slightly cooled, transfer it to a large bowl and pour the vinegar mixture over it. gently mix to combine, taking care not to mash the rice.
4. place a bamboo sushi mat on a clean surface. lay a sheet of nori on top of the mat.
5. wet your hands with water to prevent sticking. grab a handful of sushi rice and spread it evenly over the nori, leaving a small border at the top.
6. lay avocado slices and cucumber strips horizontally across the rice, about one inch from the bottom edge.
7. using the bamboo mat, carefully roll the sushi tightly. apply light pressure to seal the roll.
8. repeat the process with the remaining nori sheets and fillings.
9. use a sharp knife to slice each roll into bite-sized pieces. wipe the knife with a damp cloth between each cut to prevent sticking.
10. serve the avocado cucumber sushi rolls with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger on the side. enjoy!
ingredients_list: sushi, rice, rice, vinegar, sugar, salt, sheet, nori, seaweed, avocado, thinly, cucumber, seed, strip, soy, sauce, wasabi, pickled, ginger

title: Peanut Butter Energy Balls
raw_text: 61. Peanut Butter Energy Balls: 120 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains nuts, origin: United States.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup old-fashioned rolled oats
- 1/2 cup peanut butter
- 1/4 cup honey
- 1/4 cup ground flaxseed
- 1/4 cup mini chocolate chips
- 1/4 cup shredded coconut
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine rolled oats, peanut butter, honey, ground flaxseed, mini chocolate chips, shredded coconut, and vanilla extract.
2. stir the mixture well until all ingredients are evenly combined.
3. once the mixture is well mixed, place it in the refrigerator for approximately 30 minutes to help it firm up.
4. after chilling, remove the mixture from the refrigerator and roll it into bite-sized balls using your hands.
5. place the energy balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
6. refrigerate the energy balls for another 30 minutes to help them set.
7. once the energy balls are firm, transfer them to an airtight container for storage.
8. they can be kept in the refrigerator for up to one week. enjoy!
cooking_style: no cooking style is indicated in the recipe. it is a no-cook recipe.
ingredients_list: fashioned, rolled, oat, peanut, butter, honey, ground, flaxseed, chocolate, chip, shredded, coconut, vanilla, extract

title: Blueberry Oat Bars
raw_text: 72. Blueberry Oat Bars: 140 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten, origin: United States.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups oats
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 cup blueberry jam
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c) and grease a 9x9-inch baking dish.
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine oats, flour, brown sugar, baking powder, and salt.
3. add melted butter and vanilla extract to the dry mixture. stir until it forms a crumbly dough.
4. press two-thirds of the mixture into the bottom of the prepared baking dish, making it even and firm.
5. spread blueberry jam evenly over the oat crust.
6. sprinkle the remaining oat mixture on top of the jam, gently pressing it down.
7. bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until the top is golden brown.
8. remove from the oven and let it cool completely before cutting into bars.
9. serve and enjoy!
ingredients_list: oat, flour, brown, sugar, baking, powder, salt, unsalted, butter, vanilla, extract, blueberry, jam

title: Portobello Mushroom Pizza Bites
raw_text: 76. Portobello Mushroom Pizza Bites: 160 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: United States.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large portobello mushrooms
- 1 cup pizza sauce
- 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1/4 cup sliced black olives
- 1/4 cup diced green bell pepper
- 1/4 cup diced red onion
- 1/4 cup sliced cherry tomatoes
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh basil leaves for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. remove the stems and gills from the portobello mushrooms.
3. place the mushroom caps on a baking sheet, gill side up. season with salt and pepper.
4. spread a spoonful of pizza sauce onto each mushroom cap.
5. sprinkle an even layer of shredded mozzarella cheese on top of the sauce.
6. arrange the black olives, green bell pepper, red onion, and cherry tomatoes on each mushroom cap.
7. bake in the preheated oven for about 12-15 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes.
9. garnish with fresh basil leaves before serving.
10. serve as an appetizer or a delicious snack. enjoy!
ingredients_list: portobello, mushroom, pizza, sauce, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, black, olive, green, bell, pepper, red, onion, cherry, tomato, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, basil, leaf, garnish

title: Banana Oat Cookies
raw_text: 77. Banana Oat Cookies: 120 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten, origin: United States.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large ripe bananas
- 1 1/2 cups rolled oats
- 1/4 cup peanut butter
- 1/4 cup honey
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
- optional: 1/3 cup chocolate chips or nuts
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a medium-sized bowl, mash the bananas until smooth.
3. add the rolled oats, peanut butter, honey, vanilla extract, and cinnamon to the mashed bananas. mix well until all the ingredients are combined.
4. if desired, stir in the chocolate chips or nuts.
5. scoop about two tablespoons of the mixture onto the prepared baking sheet. flatten each cookie slightly with the back of a spoon or your fingers.
6. bake for 12-15 minutes or until the edges are golden brown.

title: Carrot Hummus with Pita Chips
raw_text: 84. Carrot Hummus with Pita Chips: 150 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten and sesame, origin: Middle East.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups cooked chickpeas
- 2 cups grated carrots
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/4 cup tahini
- 1/4 cup lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- salt and pepper to taste
- pita bread, sliced into chips
preparation:
1. in a food processor, combine the cooked chickpeas, grated carrots, minced garlic, tahini, lemon juice, olive oil, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper.
2. process the mixture until smooth and well combined.
3. adjust the seasonings to taste, adding more salt, pepper, or lemon juice if desired.
4. transfer the carrot hummus to a serving dish and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
5. meanwhile, preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
6. arrange the sliced pita chips in a single layer on a baking sheet.
7. bake the pita chips for about 10 minutes, or until they become crispy and golden brown.
8. remove the pita chips from the oven and let them cool slightly.
9. serve the chilled carrot hummus with the homemade pita chips on the side for dipping. enjoy!

title: Black Bean Nachos
raw_text: 92. Black Bean Nachos: 260 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and legumes, origin: Mexico.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 15 oz. can of black beans, drained and rinsed
- 1 cup shredded cheese (cheddar, monterey jack, or a combination)
- 1/2 cup diced tomatoes
- 1/4 cup diced red onion
- 1/4 cup sliced black olives
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
- 1/4 cup pickled jalapenos, sliced
- 1/4 teaspoon cumin

- salt and pepper to taste
- tortilla chips
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 425°f (220°c).
2. in a small bowl, mix the black beans, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. set aside.
3. arrange a layer of tortilla chips on a baking sheet.
4. sprinkle half of the shredded cheese evenly over the chips.
5. spoon half of the seasoned black beans over the cheese.
6. repeat the layers with the remaining chips, cheese, and beans.
7. top the nachos with diced tomatoes, red onion, black olives, cilantro, and pickled jalapenos.
8. bake in the preheated oven for about 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese has melted and the nachos are heated through.
9. remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes.
10. serve hot and enjoy!

title: Roasted Beet Hummus with Crackers
raw_text: 94. Roasted Beet Hummus with Crackers: 190 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten and sesame, origin: Various.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 medium-sized beets
- 1 can (15 ounces) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 3 tablespoons tahini
- 2 cloves of garlic
- 1 lemon, juiced
- 3 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper, to taste
- crackers, for serving
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. wrap the beets individually in foil and place them on a baking sheet. roast in the oven for about 45-60 minutes or until the beets are fork-tender.
3. remove the beets from the oven and let them cool. once they are cool enough to handle, peel the skin off and chop them into smaller chunks.
4. in a food processor or blender, add the roasted beets, chickpeas, tahini, garlic cloves, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
5. blend the mixture until smooth and creamy, scraping down the sides of the blender or food processor as needed.
6. taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary.
7. transfer the roasted beet hummus to a serving bowl and serve with crackers. enjoy!
ingredients_list: beet, ounce, chickpea, tahini, clove, garlic, lemon, olive, salt, pepper, taste, cracker

ingredients:

title: Tomato and Mozzarella Panini
raw_text: 25. Tomato and Mozzarella Panini - 400kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 slices of thick crusty bread

preparation:
1. preheat a panini press or sandwich press.
2. lay out the slices of bread and top each with tomato slices.
3. place the mozzarella cheese on top of the tomatoes.
4. sprinkle the chopped basil leaves evenly over the cheese.
5. drizzle olive oil over the ingredients and season with salt and pepper.

title: Ratatouille Quiche
raw_text: 26. Ratatouille Quiche - 350kcals per portion, 3 portions, contains dairy, Origin: France
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pre-made pie crust
- 1 small zucchini, sliced
- 1 small yellow squash, sliced
- 1 small eggplant, sliced
- 1 small red bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 small onion, thinly sliced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 4 large eggs
- 1 cup milk
- 1/2 cup shredded gruyere cheese
- 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. roll out the pre-made pie crust and place it in a tart or quiche dish. press the crust firmly into the dish and trim any excess dough.
3. in a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. add the minced garlic and sliced onion, and sauté until they become translucent and fragrant.
4. add the sliced zucchini, yellow squash, eggplant, and red bell pepper to the skillet. cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables soften slightly.
5. in a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, shredded gruyere cheese, dried thyme, salt, and pepper.
6. spread the sautéed vegetables evenly over the pie crust. pour the egg mixture over the vegetables, ensuring it is evenly distributed.
7. place the quiche in the preheated oven and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the center of the quiche is set.
8. remove the quiche from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
9. enjoy the delicious ratatouille quiche!
ingredients_list: pie, crust, zucchini, yellow, eggplant, red, bell, pepper, thinly, onion, thinly, clove, garlic, minced, olive, egg, milk, shredded, gruyere, cheese, dried, thyme, salt, pepper, taste

title: Caprese Panini
raw_text: 38. Caprese Panini - 400kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 slices of ciabatta bread
- 2 tablespoons of basil pesto
- 4 slices of mozzarella cheese
- 1 large tomato, sliced
- handful of fresh basil leaves
- salt and pepper to taste
- olive oil for grilling
preparation:
1. preheat a panini press or grill pan.
2. lay out the ciabatta slices on a clean surface.
3. spread 1 tablespoon of basil pesto on each slice of bread.
4. place 2 slices of mozzarella cheese on 2 slices of bread.
5. top the mozzarella with sliced tomatoes.
6. season the tomatoes with salt and pepper.
7. place a few fresh basil leaves on top of the tomatoes.
8. place the remaining slices of bread, pesto side down, on top of each sandwich.
9. lightly brush the outsides of each sandwich with olive oil.
10. place the sandwiches on the preheated panini press or grill pan.
11. press down gently and cook for about 3-4 minutes, or until the bread is crispy and the cheese has melted.
12. carefully remove the sandwiches from the press or pan and let them cool for a few minutes.
13. slice the caprese panini diagonally and serve warm.
ingredients_list: ciabatta, bread, basil, pesto, mozzarella, cheese, tomato, handful, fresh, basil, leaf, salt, pepper, taste, olive, grilling

title: Mediterranean Flatbread Pizza
raw_text: 88. Mediterranean Flatbread Pizza - 400kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Origin: Various
ingredients:
mediterranean flatbread pizza:

ingredients:
- 2 whole grain flatbreads
- 1/2 cup tomato sauce

title: Caprese Stuffed Acorn Squash
raw_text: 93. Caprese Stuffed Acorn Squash - 400kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 small acorn squash
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 ounces mozzarella cheese, cubed
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1/4 cup fresh basil leaves, chopped
- 1 tablespoon balsamic glaze
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. cut the acorn squash in half and scoop out the seeds. drizzle olive oil over the cut sides and season with salt and pepper.
3. place the squash halves, cut side down, on a baking sheet. roast in the preheated oven for about 30-40 minutes or until the squash is tender and can be pierced easily with a fork.
4. while the squash is roasting, prepare the caprese filling. in a bowl, combine the cubed mozzarella, cherry tomatoes, and chopped basil. season with a sprinkle of salt and pepper.
5. once the squash is cooked, remove it from the oven. flip the halves over on the baking sheet, so they are cut side up.
6. spoon the caprese filling into the hollowed-out portion of each squash half, dividing it evenly between them.
7. place the stuffed squash back into the oven for an additional 5-7 minutes, or until the cheese has melted and the tomatoes have softened slightly.
8. remove the squash from the oven and drizzle with balsamic glaze. serve hot and enjoy!

note: the nutritional information provided is an estimate and may vary depending on the specific ingredients and brand used.

title: Caprese Stuffed Portobello Burgers
raw_text:
100. Caprese Stuffed Portobello Burgers - 400kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy

Please note that the calorie counts provided are approximate and may vary depending on specific ingredients and preparation methods.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large portobello mushrooms

6. remove the buns from the oven and set them aside.

title: Spinach and ricotta stuffed shells
raw_text: 10. Spinach and ricotta stuffed shells: 400 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Italy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 box jumbo pasta shells
- 2 cups fresh spinach, chopped
- 1 cup ricotta cheese
- 1 cup mozzarella cheese, shredded
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1 egg, beaten
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 cups marinara sauce
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c). 
2. cook the jumbo pasta shells according to package instructions until they are al dente. drain and set aside.
3. in a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped spinach, ricotta cheese, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese, beaten egg, minced garlic, dried basil, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper. mix well until all ingredients are evenly incorporated.
4. pour about 1 cup of marinara sauce into the bottom of a baking dish.
5. spoon the spinach and ricotta mixture into each jumbo pasta shell, filling it generously. place the filled shells into the baking dish on top of the marinara sauce.
6. pour the remaining marinara sauce over the top of the stuffed shells.
7. cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes.
8. remove the foil and sprinkle additional shredded mozzarella cheese and grated parmesan cheese on top of the shells. return to the oven and bake for another 10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving. enjoy!
