title: Roasted beet and feta salad
raw_text: 19. Roasted beet and feta salad: 180 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 medium beets
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 4 cups mixed greens
- 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 1/4 cup chopped walnuts
- 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar
- 1 tablespoon honey
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. trim the tops and roots off the beets, then peel and cut them into 1-inch cubes.
3. place the beet cubes on a baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil. season with salt and pepper.
4. toss the beets to coat them evenly with the oil, salt, and pepper.
5. roast the beets in the preheated oven for about 30-35 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
6. while the beets are roasting, prepare the dressing by whisking together the balsamic vinegar and honey in a small bowl.
7. once the beets are done roasting, remove them from the oven and let them cool slightly.
8. in a large salad bowl, combine the mixed greens, roasted beets, crumbled feta cheese, and chopped walnuts.
9. drizzle the balsamic-honey dressing over the salad and toss gently to combine all the ingredients.
10. serve the roasted beet and feta salad immediately and enjoy!
ingredients_list: beet, olive, salt, pepper, taste, green, feta, cheese, walnut, balsamic, vinegar, honey

title: Spinach and mushroom omelet
raw_text: 22. Spinach and mushroom omelet: 150 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 3 large eggs
- 1 cup fresh spinach, washed and chopped
- ½ cup mushrooms, thinly sliced
- ¼ cup shredded cheese (such as cheddar or feta)
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a bowl, beat the eggs together until well mixed. season with salt and pepper.
2. heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat.
3. add the mushrooms and sauté for 3-4 minutes, until they start to soften.
4. add the chopped spinach to the skillet and continue cooking for another 2-3 minutes, until the spinach wilts.
5. remove the cooked mushrooms and spinach from the skillet and set aside.
6. pour the remaining tablespoon of olive oil into the skillet and swirl to coat.
7. pour the beaten eggs into the skillet and let them cook undisturbed for about 1 minute, until the bottom sets.
8. sprinkle the cooked mushrooms, spinach, and shredded cheese evenly over one side of the omelet.
9. using a spatula, carefully fold the other side of the omelet over the filling, creating a half-moon shape.
10. continue cooking for another minute until the cheese melts.
11. slide the omelet onto a plate and serve hot.
ingredients_list: egg, fresh, spinach, washed, mushroom, thinly, shredded, cheese, cheddar, feta, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Greek tzatziki dip
raw_text: 23. Greek tzatziki dip: 220 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, Greece.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup greek yogurt
- 1 cucumber, peeled and grated
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil
- 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice
- 1 tablespoon fresh dill, chopped
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a medium bowl, combine the greek yogurt, grated cucumber, minced garlic, extra virgin olive oil, and lemon juice. mix well.
2. add the chopped dill to the mixture and stir until combined.
3. season with salt and pepper to taste. adjust the seasoning as needed.
4. cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to allow the flavors to meld together.
5. before serving, give the tzatziki dip a good stir. you can garnish with some fresh dill if desired.
6. serve with pita bread, vegetables, or as a sauce for souvlaki or gyros.
7. enjoy!
ingredients_list: greek, yogurt, cucumber, clove, garlic, minced, virgin, olive, fresh, lemon, fresh, dill, salt, pepper, taste

title: Greek moussaka
raw_text: 33. Greek moussaka: 350 kcals per portion, 3 portions, contains dairy, Greece.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 eggplants
- 1 lb ground lamb
- 1 onion, chopped
- 3 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes
- 1 tsp ground cinnamon
- 1 tsp dried oregano
- ½ tsp dried thyme
- ½ cup red wine
- 3 tbsp tomato paste
- ¼ cup olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste

for the béchamel sauce:
- 4 cups whole milk
- 4 tbsp unsalted butter
- ½ cup all-purpose flour
- ½ cup grated parmesan cheese
- 2 eggs, beaten
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. slice the eggplants into ¼-inch thick rounds. place them on a baking sheet, brush with olive oil, and season with salt and pepper. bake for about 15 minutes until tender. set aside.
3. in a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil. add the ground lamb and cook until browned. remove the lamb from the skillet and set aside.
4. in the same skillet, add the remaining olive oil and sauté the chopped onions and minced garlic until softened.
5. return the browned lamb to the skillet. add the diced tomatoes, cinnamon, oregano, thyme, red wine, and tomato paste. season with salt and pepper. simmer for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. in a separate saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat for the béchamel sauce. add the flour and whisk continuously for about 2 minutes until the mixture turns golden.
7. gradually whisk in the milk, making sure there are no lumps. cook until the sauce thickens, stirring constantly. remove from heat and stir in the grated parmesan cheese. let the sauce cool slightly, then whisk in the beaten eggs. season with salt and pepper.
8. in a greased baking dish, layer half of the cooked eggplant slices on the bottom. top with the lamb mixture, spreading it evenly. add another layer of the remaining eggplant slices.
9. pour the béchamel sauce over the top, spreading it evenly to cover the eggplant.
10. bake in the preheated oven for about 30-35 minutes until the top is golden brown and bubbly.
11. allow the moussaka to cool for a few minutes before cutting into slices. serve warm and enjoy!
ingredients_list: eggplant, ground, lamb, onion, garlic, clove, minced, tomato, ground, cinnamon, dried, oregano, dried, thyme, red, wine, tomato, paste, olive, salt, pepper, taste, chamel, sauce, whole, milk, unsalted, butter, flour, parmesan, cheese, egg, salt, pepper, taste

title: Spinach and artichoke dip
raw_text: 48. Spinach and artichoke dip: 180 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup chopped spinach
- 1 cup chopped artichoke hearts
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/2 cup mayonnaise
- 1/2 cup sour cream
- 1/4 cup grated mozzarella cheese
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a mixing bowl, combine the chopped spinach, artichoke hearts, parmesan cheese, mayonnaise, sour cream, mozzarella cheese, minced garlic, salt, black pepper, and red pepper flakes (if using).
3. mix well until all the ingredients are well combined.
4. transfer the mixture into a baking dish and spread it out evenly.
5. bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until the top is golden and bubbly.
6. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
7. serve the spinach and artichoke dip with tortilla chips, bread slices, or vegetable sticks.
8. enjoy your delicious spinach and artichoke dip!
ingredients_list: spinach, artichoke, heart, parmesan, cheese, mayonnaise, sour, cream, mozzarella, cheese, clove, garlic, minced, salt, black, pepper, red, pepper, flake

title: Indian vegetable korma
raw_text: 49. Indian vegetable korma: 250 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, India.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon ginger, grated
- 2 teaspoons ground cumin
- 2 teaspoons ground coriander
- 1 teaspoon ground turmeric
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional, for heat)
- 2 cups mixed vegetables (such as potatoes, carrots, peas, cauliflower)
- 1 cup coconut milk
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- salt to taste
- fresh cilantro for garnish
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or pan over medium heat.
2. add the chopped onion and sauté until translucent.
3. add the minced garlic and grated ginger, and cook for another minute.
4. add the ground cumin, ground coriander, ground turmeric, ground cinnamon, and cayenne pepper (if using). stir well to coat the onions and spices.
5. add the mixed vegetables to the skillet and stir to combine with the spice mixture.
6. pour in the coconut milk and vegetable broth, and season with salt to taste. stir well, then bring the mixture to a simmer.
7. reduce the heat to low and cover the skillet. let the vegetable korma cook for about 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
8. once the vegetables are cooked, remove from heat. garnish with fresh cilantro.
9. serve the indian vegetable korma hot with rice or naan bread. enjoy!
ingredients_list: vegetable, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, ground, turmeric, ground, cinnamon, cayenne, pepper, vegetable, potato, carrot, pea, cauliflower, coconut, milk, vegetable, broth, salt, taste, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Vegetarian sushi rolls
raw_text: 53. Vegetarian sushi rolls: 250 kcals per portion, 3 portions, contains soy, Japan.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups sushi rice
- 4 sheets nori seaweed
- 1 cucumber, julienned
- 1 avocado, sliced
- 1 carrot, julienned
- 1/2 cup pickled ginger
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- wasabi and sesame seeds for garnish
preparation:
1. prepare sushi rice according to package instructions. let it cool slightly.
2. lay a sheet of nori seaweed on a sushi mat or a clean, damp dish towel.
3. wet your hands and spread about 1/2 cup of sushi rice evenly onto the nori, leaving a small border at the top.
4. place cucumber, avocado, and carrot strips along the lower third of the rice.
5. start rolling the sushi tightly, using the mat or towel to help shape it. moisten the top border of the nori to seal the roll.
6. repeat steps 2-5 with the remaining ingredients.
7. slice each roll into 6-8 pieces using a sharp knife.
8. serve sushi rolls with pickled ginger, soy sauce, wasabi, and sesame seeds on the side for dipping and garnishing.
9. enjoy your delicious vegetarian sushi rolls!
ingredients_list: sushi, rice, sheet, nori, seaweed, cucumber, avocado, carrot, pickled, ginger, soy, sauce, wasabi, sesame, seed, garnish

title: Spinach and cheese stuffed tomatoes
raw_text: 58. Spinach and cheese stuffed tomatoes: 150 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large tomatoes
- 1 cup of spinach, chopped
- 1 cup of feta cheese, crumbled
- 1/4 cup of grated parmesan cheese
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
- 1/2 teaspoon of dried oregano
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cut off the tops of the tomatoes and scoop out the seeds and pulp. set aside.
3. in a large bowl, combine the chopped spinach, feta cheese, parmesan cheese, minced garlic, olive oil, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. mix well.
4. stuff the tomato shells with the spinach and cheese mixture, making sure to pack it tightly.
5. place the stuffed tomatoes in a baking dish or on a baking sheet.
6. bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes or until the tomatoes are soft and the cheese is melted and lightly golden.
7. remove from the oven and let the stuffed tomatoes cool for a few minutes before serving.
8. serve the spinach and cheese stuffed tomatoes as a side dish or as a light vegetarian meal. enjoy!
ingredients_list: tomato, spinach, feta, cheese, parmesan, cheese, clove, garlic, minced, olive, dried, oregano, salt, pepper, taste

title: French onion soup
raw_text: 60. French onion soup: 200 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, France.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large onions, thinly sliced
- 4 tablespoons unsalted butter
- 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
- 4 cups beef broth
- 2 cups chicken broth
- 1 cup dry white wine
- 1 teaspoon worcestershire sauce
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- salt and black pepper to taste
- baguette slices
- 2 cups shredded gruyere cheese
preparation:
1. in a large soup pot, melt the butter over medium heat. add the sliced onions and cook, stirring occasionally, until soft and caramelized, about 30-40 minutes.
2. sprinkle the flour over the cooked onions, stirring well to coat evenly. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.
3. pour in the beef broth, chicken broth, and white wine. add worcestershire sauce, dried thyme, salt, and black pepper. stir well to combine.
4. bring the mixture to a simmer and let it cook for 20-30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together. adjust the seasoning if needed.
5. while the soup simmers, preheat the broiler. arrange baguette slices on a baking sheet and toast them under the broiler until golden brown.
6. ladle the soup into oven-safe bowls or crocks. top each bowl with a few toasted baguette slices and sprinkle with a generous amount of shredded gruyere cheese.
7. place the filled bowls on a baking sheet and broil until the cheese is melted, bubbly, and slightly browned, about 1-2 minutes.
8. carefully remove the soup bowls from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving. enjoy your french onion soup!
ingredients_list: onion, thinly, unsalted, butter, flour, beef, broth, chicken, broth, white, wine, worcestershire, sauce, dried, thyme, salt, black, pepper, taste, baguette, shredded, gruyere, cheese

title: Greek spinach and feta pie
raw_text: 66. Greek spinach and feta pie: 350 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Greece.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 package of frozen spinach, thawed and drained
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 4 eggs, beaten
- 1 cup feta cheese, crumbled
- ¼ cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1 teaspoon dried dill
- salt and pepper to taste
- 8 sheets of phyllo pastry
- ½ cup melted butter
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c). grease a 9-inch pie dish.
2. heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat. add diced onion and minced garlic, and sauté until the onion becomes translucent.
3. add the thawed and drained spinach to the pan, stirring well to combine with the onion and garlic. cook for about 5 minutes, or until the excess moisture has evaporated.
4. in a large bowl, combine the beaten eggs, feta cheese, parmesan cheese, dried dill, salt, and pepper. stir in the cooked spinach mixture until well mixed.
5. brush one sheet of phyllo pastry with melted butter and place it in the greased pie dish. repeat with 3 more sheets, layering them and rotating each sheet slightly to cover the entire dish.
6. pour the spinach and cheese mixture into the phyllo-lined dish, spreading it evenly.
7. layer the remaining 4 sheets of phyllo pastry on top of the mixture, again brushing each sheet with melted butter and rotating to cover the filling.
8. trim any excess phyllo pastry hanging over the edges of the dish, then fold and tuck the edges of the pastry to create a neat border.
9. brush the top of the pie with more melted butter.
10. bake in the preheated oven for about 30-35 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and crisp.
11. allow the pie to cool slightly before slicing and serving. enjoy!
ingredients_list: frozen, spinach, thawed, onion, clove, garlic, minced, olive, egg, feta, cheese, parmesan, cheese, dried, dill, salt, pepper, taste, sheet, phyllo, pastry, butter

title: Mushroom and spinach quesadillas
raw_text: 68. Mushroom and spinach quesadillas: 300 kcals per portion, 3 portions, contains dairy, Mexico.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 large flour tortillas
- 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese
- 1 cup sliced mushrooms
- 2 cups baby spinach leaves
- 1/2 cup diced onion
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
2. add onions and garlic to the skillet and sauté until onions are translucent.
3. add mushrooms to the skillet and cook until they start to brown.
4. add baby spinach leaves and cook until wilted.
5. season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. remove the skillet from heat and set aside.
7. place a tortilla on a flat surface and sprinkle with a handful of shredded cheese.
8. spoon some of the mushroom and spinach mixture on half of the tortilla.
9. fold the tortilla over to create a half-moon shape.
10. repeat steps 7-9 with the remaining tortillas and filling.
11. heat a large skillet or griddle over medium heat.
12. cook each quesadilla for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until the cheese is melted and the tortilla is crisp.
13. remove the quesadillas from the skillet and let them cool for a few minutes.
14. cut each quesadilla into wedges and serve hot.

enjoy your delicious mushroom and spinach quesadillas!
ingredients_list: flour, tortilla, shredded, cheddar, cheese, mushroom, baby, spinach, leaf, onion, clove, garlic, minced, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Spinach and ricotta stuffed tomatoes
raw_text: 73. Spinach and ricotta stuffed tomatoes: 150 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, Italy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large tomatoes
- 1 cup spinach, chopped
- ½ cup ricotta cheese
- ¼ cup grated parmesan cheese
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cut off the tops of the tomatoes and gently scoop out the seeds and pulp with a spoon. keep the tomato shells intact.
3. place the hollowed tomatoes on a baking dish.
4. in a separate bowl, mix together the chopped spinach, ricotta cheese, parmesan cheese, minced garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
5. spoon the spinach and ricotta mixture into each tomato, filling them up to the top.
6. transfer the baking dish to the preheated oven and bake for about 15-20 minutes, or until the tomatoes are soft and slightly wrinkled.
7. once cooked, remove from the oven and let the stuffed tomatoes cool for a few minutes.
8. serve warm as a side dish or a light main course. enjoy!
ingredients_list: tomato, spinach, ricotta, cheese, parmesan, cheese, clove, garlic, minced, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Greek vegetable and feta burgers
raw_text: 77. Greek vegetable and feta burgers: 350 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Greece.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 small red onion, finely chopped
- 1 small zucchini, grated
- 1 small carrot, grated
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 cup cooked quinoa
- 1 cup breadcrumbs
- 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
- 1 tablespoon dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
- salt and pepper to taste
- olive oil for cooking
- burger buns
- toppings of your choice (lettuce, tomato, cucumber, etc.)
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped red onion, grated zucchini, grated carrot, and minced garlic.
2. add the cooked quinoa, breadcrumbs, crumbled feta cheese, chopped fresh parsley, dried oregano, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper to the bowl. mix well until all the ingredients are evenly incorporated.
3. shape the mixture into burger patties of your desired size and thickness.
4. heat a drizzle of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
5. cook the burger patties in the skillet for about 4-5 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and heated through.
6. serve the greek vegetable and feta burgers on burger buns with your choice of toppings. enjoy!

title: Vegetarian sushi bowl
raw_text: 79. Vegetarian sushi bowl: 250 kcals per portion, 3 portions, contains soy, Japan.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup sushi rice
- 1 3/4 cups water
- 2 tablespoons rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 avocado, sliced
- 1 cucumber, sliced
- 1 carrot, julienned
- 1/4 cup pickled ginger
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- 1/4 cup sesame seeds
- 1 tablespoon sesame oil
- 1 tablespoon nori (seaweed), thinly sliced
- optional toppings: sliced scallions, sriracha sauce
preparation:
1. rinse the sushi rice under cold water until the water runs clear. drain well.
2. in a medium saucepan, combine the rinsed rice with 1 3/4 cups water. bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until rice is tender and water is absorbed.
3. in a small saucepan, heat the rice vinegar, sugar, and salt over low heat until sugar is dissolved. remove from heat.
4. transfer the cooked rice to a large bowl and pour the vinegar mixture over it. gently fold the rice with a wooden spoon to combine and let it cool.
5. in individual serving bowls, divide the sushi rice and top with avocado slices, cucumber slices, carrot juliennes, and pickled ginger.
6. drizzle soy sauce and sesame oil over the toppings.
7. sprinkle sesame seeds and nori slices on top.
8. if desired, add sliced scallions and a drizzle of sriracha sauce for more flavor and heat.
9. serve the vegetarian sushi bowls immediately and enjoy!
taste: The key taste profile in this recipe is umami.
ingredients_list: sushi, rice, water, rice, vinegar, sugar, salt, avocado, cucumber, carrot, pickled, ginger, soy, sauce, sesame, seed, sesame, nori, seaweed, thinly, topping, scallion, sriracha, sauce

title: Eggplant and zucchini lasagna
raw_text: 80. Eggplant and zucchini lasagna: 400 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Italy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large eggplants
- 2 large zucchinis
- 1 onion, diced
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 can (14 oz) crushed tomatoes
- 1/2 cup tomato paste
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1 cup grated parmesan cheese
- fresh basil leaves, for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. slice the eggplants and zucchinis lengthwise into thin strips. sprinkle them with salt and let sit for about 10 minutes to remove excess moisture. rinse and pat dry.
3. heat some olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. sauté the diced onion and minced garlic until they become translucent and fragrant.
4. add the crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, dried oregano, dried basil, salt, and black pepper to the skillet. stir well and let the sauce simmer for about 10 minutes to allow the flavors to blend.
5. in a separate skillet, lightly cook the eggplant and zucchini slices until they are slightly softened, about 2-3 minutes on each side.
6. spread a thin layer of the tomato sauce in the bottom of a baking dish. arrange a single layer of eggplant slices on top of the tomato sauce, followed by a layer of zucchini slices. spread some of the tomato sauce over the vegetables, then sprinkle with mozzarella and parmesan cheese. repeat the layers until all the vegetables are used, finishing with a layer of cheese on top.
7. cover the baking dish with foil and bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes. then, remove the foil and bake for an additional 15 minutes, or until the cheese is golden and bubbly.
8. let the lasagna cool for a few minutes. garnish with fresh basil leaves before serving.
9. slice and serve the eggplant and zucchini lasagna while still warm. enjoy!
ingredients_list: eggplant, zucchini, onion, clove, garlic, minced, tomato, tomato, paste, dried, oregano, dried, basil, salt, black, pepper, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, parmesan, cheese, fresh, basil, leaf, garnish

title: Greek lemon rice soup (Avgolemono)
raw_text: 82. Greek lemon rice soup (Avgolemono): 220 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains egg, Greece.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup long-grain white rice
- 4 cups chicken broth
- 3 eggs
- juice of 2 lemons
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh parsley for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. in a large pot, bring the chicken broth to a boil.
2. add the rice to the boiling broth and reduce the heat to low. simmer for about 15 minutes until the rice is cooked and tender.
3. in a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs and lemon juice until well combined.
4. slowly pour about 1 cup of the hot broth into the egg mixture, whisking constantly to prevent the eggs from curdling.
5. gradually pour the egg mixture back into the pot of rice and broth, stirring continuously.
6. cook the soup over low heat for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until it thickens slightly.
7. season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.
8. garnish with fresh parsley if desired.
9. serve the greek lemon rice soup hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: long, grain, white, rice, chicken, broth, egg, lemon, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Spinach and cheese stuffed portobello mushrooms
raw_text: 97. Spinach and cheese stuffed portobello mushrooms: 200 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, -
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large portobello mushrooms
- 2 cups fresh spinach leaves
- 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. clean the portobello mushrooms by gently wiping off any dirt with a damp cloth. remove the stems and scrape out the gills using a spoon.
3. in a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant.
4. add the fresh spinach leaves and cook until wilted, stirring occasionally. season with salt and pepper to taste. remove from heat.
5. place the portobello mushrooms on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, gill-side up.
6. spoon the sautéed spinach evenly into each mushroom cap.
7. top the stuffed mushrooms with the shredded mozzarella cheese and grated parmesan cheese.
8. bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes or until the cheese is melted and golden brown.
9. remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving.
10. serve the spinach and cheese stuffed portobello mushrooms as a delicious appetizer or main dish. enjoy!

title: Hummus and Veggie Sandwich
raw_text: 8. Hummus and Veggie Sandwich - 380kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 slices of whole wheat bread (gluten-containing)
- 1/4 cup of hummus
- 1/4 cup of sliced cucumbers
- 1/4 cup of sliced bell peppers
- 1/4 cup of shredded carrots
- 1/4 cup of mixed salad greens
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. toast the slices of whole wheat bread.
2. spread the hummus evenly on one side of each bread slice.
3. layer the cucumbers, bell peppers, shredded carrots, and mixed salad greens on top of the hummus on one bread slice.

title: Black Bean Soup
raw_text: 14. Black Bean Soup - 280kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains legumes
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cans (15 ounces each) black beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced
- 3 cups vegetable broth
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- salt and pepper, to taste
- optional toppings: diced avocado, chopped cilantro, sour cream
preparation:
1. in a large pot, heat a little oil over medium heat. add the onion, garlic, red bell pepper, and jalapeno pepper. cook until the vegetables are softened, stirring occasionally.
2. add the black beans, vegetable broth, cumin, paprika, chili powder, salt, and pepper to the pot. stir well to combine.
3. bring the soup to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 20 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
4. use an immersion blender or a regular blender to puree about half of the soup until smooth. this step will give the soup a thick and creamy texture while still leaving some whole beans for texture.
5. taste and adjust the seasoning if needed. if the soup is too thick, you can add more vegetable broth or water to thin it out.
6. serve the black bean soup hot, garnished with diced avocado, chopped cilantro, and a dollop of sour cream if desired.

enjoy your delicious and nutritious black bean soup!
ingredients_list: can, ounce, black, bean, onion, clove, garlic, minced, red, bell, pepper, jalapeno, pepper, seeded, minced, vegetable, broth, cumin, paprika, chili, powder, salt, pepper, taste, topping, avocado, cilantro, sour, cream

title: Beet Salad with Goat Cheese
raw_text: 20. Beet Salad with Goat Cheese - 240kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy (Mediterranean)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 medium-sized beets
- 2 cups mixed salad greens
- 2 oz goat cheese, crumbled
- 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
- 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. scrub the beets thoroughly under running water to remove any dirt. trim off the tops and tails, leaving about an inch of stem attached. wrap each beet individually in aluminum foil.
3. place the wrapped beets in a baking dish and roast them in the preheated oven for about 45-60 minutes or until easily pierced with a fork. cooking time may vary depending on the size of the beets.
4. remove the beets from the oven and let them cool. once cooled, peel off the skin. using a sharp knife or vegetable peeler, gently remove the skin from the beets. cut the beets into thin slices or cubed pieces.
5. divide the salad greens between two plates or bowls.
6. arrange the beet slices or cubes on top of the salad greens.
7. sprinkle the crumbled goat cheese over the beets.
8. in a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper until well combined.
9. drizzle the dressing over the salad.
10. serve immediately and enjoy your mediterranean-style beet salad with goat cheese!
ingredients_list: beet, salad, green, goat, cheese, virgin, olive, balsamic, vinegar, salt, pepper, taste

title: Greek Pita Pockets
raw_text: 24. Greek Pita Pockets - 400kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, dairy (Greece)
ingredients:
sure! here's a recipe for greek pita pockets:

ingredients:

title: Veggie Pad Thai
raw_text: 32. Veggie Pad Thai - 420kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, peanuts (Thailand)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 6 ounces rice noodles
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 small onion, thinly sliced
- 1 carrot, julienned
- 1 bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 cup bean sprouts
- 2 green onions, chopped
- 1/4 cup crushed peanuts
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce (gluten-free if needed)
- 1 tablespoon tamarind paste
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1 lime, juiced
- fresh cilantro, for garnish
preparation:
1. cook the rice noodles according to the instructions on the package. drain and set aside.
2. in a large skillet or wok, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. add the garlic and onion, and sauté until fragrant and lightly golden.
3. add the carrot, bell pepper, and bean sprouts to the skillet. stir-fry for about 3-4 minutes until the vegetables are slightly tender.
4. push the vegetables to one side of the skillet and crack the eggs onto the other side. scramble the eggs until cooked through.
5. add the cooked rice noodles to the skillet and mix everything together.
6. in a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, tamarind paste, sugar, and lime juice until well combined. pour the sauce over the noodle mixture and toss to coat.
7. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly, until everything is heated through.
8. remove from heat and garnish with chopped green onions, crushed peanuts, and fresh cilantro.
9. serve hot and enjoy your delicious veggie pad thai!
ingredients_list: ounce, rice, noodle, vegetable, clove, garlic, minced, onion, thinly, carrot, bell, pepper, thinly, bean, sprout, green, onion, peanut, soy, sauce, gluten, needed, tamarind, paste, sugar, lime, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Ratatouille Couscous
raw_text: 46. Ratatouille Couscous - 370kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 small eggplant
- 1 small zucchini
- 1 red bell pepper
- 1 yellow bell pepper
- 1 small onion
- 2 cloves of garlic
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- 1 teaspoon dried rosemary
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 cup couscous
- 1 1/4 cups vegetable broth
- fresh parsley for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. dice the eggplant, zucchini, red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, onion, and garlic into small pieces.
3. in a large baking dish, combine the diced vegetables with olive oil, dried thyme, dried rosemary, paprika, salt, and pepper. mix well to coat the vegetables.
4. roast the vegetable mixture in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes or until they are tender and lightly browned, stirring occasionally.
5. while the vegetables are roasting, prepare the couscous according to the package instructions, using vegetable broth instead of water.
6. once the vegetables are done, remove them from the oven and mix them with the cooked couscous.
7. divide the ratatouille couscous into two portions.
8. garnish each portion with fresh parsley.
9. serve hot and enjoy!

note: make sure to check the ingredient labels of the couscous to ensure it is gluten-free if you require a gluten-free option.

title: Greek Flatbread Pizza
raw_text: 62. Greek Flatbread Pizza - 390kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, dairy (Greece)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 flatbread
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1/4 cup tomato sauce
- 1/4 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 1/4 cup sliced black olives
- 1/4 cup sliced red onions
- 1/4 cup sliced tomatoes
- 1/4 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/4 teaspoon dried basil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. place the flatbread on a baking sheet or pizza stone.
3. drizzle the olive oil over the flatbread and spread it evenly with the back of a spoon.
4. spread the tomato sauce evenly over the flatbread, leaving a small border around the edges.
5. sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese evenly over the tomato sauce.
6. spread the crumbled feta cheese over the mozzarella.
7. scatter the black olives, red onions, and sliced tomatoes on top of the cheeses.
8. sprinkle the dried oregano, dried basil, salt, and pepper evenly over the toppings.
9. place the baking sheet or pizza stone in the preheated oven and bake for about 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly and the edges of the flatbread are golden brown.
10. remove from the oven and let it cool for a couple of minutes.
11. cut the greek flatbread pizza into slices and serve hot.

enjoy your delicious greek flatbread pizza from greece!

title: Lentil and Rice Burritos
raw_text: 63. Lentil and Rice Burritos - 370kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains legumes, gluten (Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup cooked lentils
- 1 cup cooked rice
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 1 teaspoon cumin powder
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- salt to taste
- 4 small tortillas
- 1/4 cup shredded cheese (optional)
- salsa, guacamole, or sour cream for serving (optional)
preparation:
1. in a large pan, heat some oil over medium heat. add the chopped onion and minced garlic, and sauté until they become translucent.
2. add the cooked lentils to the pan and stir well. cook for a few minutes until the lentils are heated through.
3. add the cooked rice, cumin powder, chili powder, and salt to the pan. mix everything together until well combined. cook for another couple of minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
4. warm the tortillas in a separate pan or microwave them for a few seconds until they become pliable.
5. divide the lentil and rice mixture evenly among the tortillas, placing it in the center of each tortilla.
6. if desired, sprinkle some shredded cheese over the lentil and rice mixture.
7. fold the tortillas by pulling in the sides and then rolling them up tightly.
8. if desired, lightly grill or heat the burritos in a pan for a few minutes to make them crispy.
9. serve the lentil and rice burritos hot with salsa, guacamole, or sour cream on the side, if desired. enjoy your gluten-containing mexican-inspired meal!
ingredients_list: lentil, rice, onion, garlic, clove, minced, cumin, powder, chili, powder, salt, taste, tortilla, shredded, cheese, salsa, guacamole, sour, cream

title: Veggie Shepard's Pie
raw_text: 66. Veggie Shepard's Pie - 420kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 medium potatoes, peeled and cubed
- 1 tablespoon butter (or vegan substitute)
- 1 small onion, diced
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, corn)
- 1/2 cup vegetable broth
- 1/2 cup canned red kidney beans, drained and rinsed
- 1/4 cup tomato sauce
- 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1/4 cup grated cheddar cheese (or vegan cheese)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. in a large pot, bring water to a boil and cook the potatoes until tender. drain and set aside.
3. in a separate skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. add the diced onion and minced garlic, and cook until softened and fragrant.
4. add the mixed vegetables to the skillet and sauté for a few minutes until they start to soften.
5. pour in the vegetable broth, kidney beans, tomato sauce, dried thyme, salt, and pepper. stir well and let simmer for about 5 minutes.
6. mash the cooked potatoes with a fork or potato masher until smooth. season with salt and pepper, if desired.
7. transfer the vegetable mixture to an oven-safe dish. spread the mashed potatoes evenly on top.
8. sprinkle the grated cheddar cheese over the potatoes.
9. bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and golden.
10. remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving. enjoy!

title: Quinoa Black Bean Chili
raw_text: 73. Quinoa Black Bean Chili - 350kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains legumes
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup quinoa
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1 can (14 oz) black beans, drained and rinsed
- 1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh cilantro for garnish
preparation:
1. rinse the quinoa under cold water and drain.
2. in a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the diced onion, minced garlic, and jalapeno pepper. sauté until the onion is translucent and fragrant.
3. add the cumin and chili powder to the pot and stir for about 1 minute to release the flavors.
4. add the quinoa, black beans, diced tomatoes, and vegetable broth to the pot. stir well to combine.
5. bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. cover the pot and let it simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until the quinoa is cooked and tender.
6. season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. serve the quinoa black bean chili hot, garnished with fresh cilantro. enjoy!

title: Quinoa Stuffed Bell Peppers with Black Beans
raw_text: 79. Quinoa Stuffed Bell Peppers with Black Beans - 380kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains legumes, gluten-free
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 bell peppers (any color)
- 1/2 cup quinoa
- 1 cup water
- 1/2 cup black beans (cooked or canned)
- 1/4 cup diced red onion
- 1/4 cup diced tomatoes

preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).

4. in a mixing bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, black beans, red onion, tomatoes, zucchini, yellow squash, corn, cilantro, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. mix well until all the ingredients are evenly combined.
5. stuff the bell peppers with the quinoa mixture, pressing it down gently to fill the cavity. if desired, sprinkle shredded cheese on top.
6. place the stuffed bell peppers in a baking dish and cover with foil.
7. bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes until the bell peppers are tender and the filling is heated through.
8. remove from the oven and let cool slightly before serving. enjoy!

title: Greek Style Orzo with Roasted Vegetables

ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup orzo pasta

- 1 yellow bell pepper, diced

5. while the vegetables are roasting, cook the orzo pasta according to package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.

7. in a large bowl, combine the roasted vegetables with the cooked orzo pasta.

title: Lentil and Spinach Quesadillas
raw_text: 81. Lentil and Spinach Quesadillas - 370kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, legumes (Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup cooked lentils
- 1 cup spinach, chopped
- 1/2 red onion, diced
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1/2 tsp cumin powder
- 1/2 tsp chili powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 small flour tortillas
- 1 cup shredded cheese (cheddar or mexican blend)
- olive oil for cooking
preparation:
1. in a pan, heat olive oil over medium heat. add the diced red onion and minced garlic. sauté until onion becomes translucent.
2. add the cooked lentils, chopped spinach, cumin powder, chili powder, salt, and pepper to the pan. stir well and cook for 2-3 minutes until spinach wilts.
3. remove the lentil and spinach mixture from the heat and set aside.
4. take a tortilla and spread a layer of the lentil and spinach mixture on one half of the tortilla.
5. sprinkle a portion of shredded cheese on top of the lentil and spinach mixture.
6. fold the tortilla in half, enclosing the filling.
7. repeat steps 4-6 with the remaining tortillas and filling.
8. heat a separate pan over medium heat and add a small amount of olive oil.
9. place a quesadilla in the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side until the tortilla becomes crispy and the cheese melts.
10. repeat step 9 for the remaining quesadillas.
11. once cooked, cut each quesadilla into quarters.
12. serve hot as a snack or meal, optionally with salsa, guacamole, or sour cream on the side. enjoy!

title: Eggplant and Zucchini Lasagna
raw_text: 83. Eggplant and Zucchini Lasagna - 400kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, dairy (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 medium eggplant
- 1 medium zucchini
- 1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes
- 1/2 cup tomato sauce
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon dried basil
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. slice the eggplant and zucchini lengthwise into thin strips, about 1/4 inch thick.
3. in a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. add the minced garlic and sauté for 1 minute until fragrant.
4. add the diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper to the skillet. stir well and simmer for 10 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
5. in another skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil and cook the eggplant and zucchini slices for 3-4 minutes on each side until they soften slightly. remove from heat.
6. in a small baking dish, spread a thin layer of the tomato sauce mixture.
7. arrange a layer of eggplant and zucchini slices on top of the sauce. sprinkle with a little parmesan and mozzarella cheese.
8. repeat the layers until all the ingredients are used, finishing with a layer of sauce and cheese on top.
9. cover the baking dish with foil and bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes.
10. remove the foil and bake for an additional 10 minutes until the cheese is golden and bubbly.
11. let the lasagna rest for a few minutes before serving. cut into portions and enjoy!
ingredients_list: eggplant, zucchini, tomato, tomato, sauce, parmesan, cheese, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, clove, garlic, minced, dried, oregano, dried, basil, salt, pepper, taste, olive

title: Quinoa Stuffed Mushrooms with Feta
raw_text: 85. Quinoa Stuffed Mushrooms with Feta - 350kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, gluten-free

ingredients:

title: Greek Pasta Primavera
raw_text: 86. Greek Pasta Primavera - 390kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, dairy (Greece)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 180g penne pasta (gluten-containing)
- 1 medium red onion, sliced
- 1 medium red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 medium yellow bell pepper, sliced

1. cook the penne pasta according to the package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.

title: Lentil and Rice Soup

raw_text: 98. Greek Style Spinach and Feta Stuffed Mushrooms - 400kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy

ingredients:

ingredients:
