title: Ratatouille Galette
raw_text:
100. Ratatouille Galette - 420kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten (France)

Please note that the calorie counts are approximate and can vary depending on portion size and specific ingredients used. Also, always consider individual allergies and dietary restrictions when preparing or consuming these recipes. Enjoy your vegetarian lunch options!
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 small eggplant
- 1 zucchini
- 1 yellow bell pepper
- 1 small red onion
- 2 cloves of garlic
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 sheet of puff pastry (gluten-containing)
- 1 egg yolk
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 200°c (400°f).
2. cut the eggplant, zucchini, yellow bell pepper, and red onion into thin slices.
3. mince the garlic cloves.
4. heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. add the minced garlic and sauté for about 1 minute.
5. add the sliced vegetables to the skillet, season with dried thyme, salt, and pepper. cook for about 5-7 minutes until the vegetables become slightly tender. remove from heat and set aside.
6. roll out the puff pastry into a round shape and place it on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
7. arrange the cooked vegetables on top of the puff pastry, leaving a small border around the edges.
8. fold the edges of the puff pastry over the vegetables, creating a galette.
9. brush the folded edges with the egg yolk for a golden finish.
10. drizzle the remaining tablespoon of olive oil over the vegetables.
11. bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the puff pastry turns golden brown.
12. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
13. slice the ratatouille galette into portions and enjoy while warm.

note: adjust seasoning and baking time according to personal preference and desired level of vegetable tenderness.
ingredients_list: eggplant, zucchini, yellow, bell, pepper, red, onion, clove, garlic, olive, dried, thyme, salt, pepper, taste, puff, pastry, gluten, containing, egg

title: Caprese Sandwich
raw_text: 3. Caprese Sandwich: 300kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 loaf of italian bread or baguette
- 2-3 large tomatoes, sliced
- 1 pound fresh mozzarella cheese, sliced
- 1 bunch fresh basil leaves
- 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
- balsamic glaze (optional)
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. cut the italian bread or baguette into slices, about 1/2 inch thick.
3. place the bread slices on a baking sheet and brush both sides with olive oil.
4. bake the bread slices in the preheated oven for about 10 minutes, or until they become slightly crispy.
5. while the bread is toasting, slice the tomatoes and mozzarella cheese. set them aside.
6. rinse the basil leaves and pat them dry.
7. take the toasted bread slices out of the oven and let them cool slightly.
8. to assemble the caprese sandwich, place a few slices of tomato on one piece of bread.
9. top the tomato slices with a few leaves of fresh basil.
10. next, place a slice (or more) of mozzarella cheese on top of the basil.
11. drizzle the sandwich with a little olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste.
12. if desired, drizzle the caprese sandwich with balsamic glaze for additional flavor.
13. place another piece of toasted bread on top to complete the sandwich.
14. repeat steps 8-13 to make more sandwiches if desired.
15. serve the caprese sandwiches immediately and enjoy! they can also be refrigerated for later consumption.
ingredients_list: loaf, italian, bread, baguette, tomato, fresh, mozzarella, cheese, bunch, fresh, basil, leaf, virgin, olive, balsamic, glaze, salt, pepper, taste

title: Spinach and Feta Tart
raw_text: 6. Spinach and Feta Tart: 450kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy and gluten (Greece)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 sheet of puff pastry
- 3 cups of fresh spinach, washed and chopped
- 1 cup of feta cheese, crumbled
- 1/2 cup of cherry tomatoes, halved
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. roll out the puff pastry on a floured surface and transfer it to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
3. in a skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the minced garlic and sauté for about 1 minute.
4. add the chopped spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted, about 2-3 minutes. season with salt and pepper.
5. spread the cooked spinach evenly over the puff pastry, leaving a small border around the edges.
6. sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese over the spinach.
7. place the halved cherry tomatoes on top of the feta cheese.
8. fold the edges of the puff pastry slightly towards the center, creating a border around the tart.
9. bake in the preheated oven for approximately 20-25 minutes, or until the puff pastry is golden brown.
10. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
11. slice and serve warm as an appetizer or alongside a fresh salad. enjoy!
ingredients_list: puff, pastry, fresh, spinach, washed, feta, cheese, cherry, tomato, halved, clove, garlic, minced, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Avocado and Tomato Sandwich
raw_text: 20. Avocado and Tomato Sandwich: 300kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten (Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 slices of bread
- 1 ripe avocado
- 1 medium tomato
- salt and pepper to taste
- optional: lettuce, sliced red onion, or any other desired toppings
preparation:
1. toast the slices of bread until golden brown.
2. slice the avocado in half and remove the pit. scoop out the flesh into a bowl and mash it with a fork until smooth.
3. slice the tomato into thin slices.
4. spread the mashed avocado onto one slice of toasted bread.
5. layer the tomato slices on top of the avocado.
6. sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste.
7. add any optional toppings, such as lettuce or sliced red onion.
8. place the second slice of toasted bread on top to complete the sandwich.
9. cut the sandwich in half diagonally and serve.
10. enjoy your avocado and tomato sandwich!
ingredients_list: bread, avocado, tomato, salt, pepper, taste, lettuce, red, onion, topping

title: Gourmet Grilled Cheese
raw_text: 24. Gourmet Grilled Cheese: 400kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy (United States)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 slices of your choice of bread (such as sourdough, multigrain, or french bread)
- 4 tablespoons of butter, softened
- 4 slices of cheddar cheese
- 4 slices of swiss cheese
- 4 slices of provolone cheese
- 1 medium tomato, sliced
- 1 medium onion, thinly sliced
- 2 tablespoons of mayonnaise
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat.
2. spread butter on one side of each bread slice.
3. place two slices of bread, buttered side down, on the skillet.
4. layer each bread slice with one slice of cheddar, swiss, and provolone cheese.
5. divide the sliced tomato and onion evenly between the sandwiches.
6. sprinkle salt and pepper over the vegetables to taste.
7. place the remaining cheese slices on top of the vegetables.
8. spread mayonnaise on the non-buttered side of the remaining bread slices and place them on top of the sandwiches, mayonnaise side up.
9. press the sandwiches down gently with a spatula and cook for about 3-4 minutes until the bread turns golden brown and the cheese starts to melt.
10. carefully flip the sandwiches over and cook for an additional 3-4 minutes until the bread is golden brown and the cheese is fully melted.
11. remove from the skillet and let the sandwiches cool for a minute or two before serving.
12. cut the sandwiches in half and serve warm. enjoy your gourmet grilled cheese!
ingredients_list: bread, sourdough, multigrain, french, bread, butter, cheddar, cheese, swiss, cheese, provolone, cheese, tomato, onion, thinly, mayonnaise, salt, pepper, taste

title: Mushroom and Pea Risotto
raw_text: 33. Mushroom and Pea Risotto: 500kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup arborio rice
- 4 cups vegetable broth
- 1 cup mushrooms, sliced
- 1 cup frozen peas
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 cup white wine
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable broth in a saucepan over low heat and keep it warm.
2. in a separate large pot, heat the olive oil and melt the butter over medium-low heat.
3. add the onions and garlic to the pot and sauté until onions become translucent and fragrant.
4. add the sliced mushrooms and cook until they release their moisture and become slightly browned.
5. add the arborio rice to the pot and stir it into the onion and mushroom mixture, coating each grain with the oil and butter.
6. increase the heat to medium and pour in the white wine. stir continuously until the wine is absorbed by the rice.
7. begin adding the vegetable broth to the pot, one ladleful at a time, stirring well after each addition. allow the rice to absorb the broth before adding more.
8. continue adding the broth and stirring until the rice is cooked al dente, tender but still slightly firm in the center. this process should take about 20 minutes.
9. add the frozen peas to the risotto and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, until the peas are heated through.
10. remove the pot from heat and stir in the grated parmesan cheese. season with salt and pepper to taste.
11. let the risotto rest for a few minutes before serving. garnish with fresh chopped parsley.
ingredients_list: arborio, rice, vegetable, broth, mushroom, frozen, pea, onion, clove, garlic, minced, white, wine, parmesan, cheese, butter, olive, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Falafel Salad Bowl
raw_text: 41. Falafel Salad Bowl: 300kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten (Middle East)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup dried chickpeas
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped
- 1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- salt, to taste
- pepper, to taste
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 4 cups mixed greens
- 1 cucumber, diced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 tomato, diced
- 1/2 red onion, thinly sliced
- 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
- juice of 1 lemon
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- tahini sauce, for serving
preparation:
1. place the dried chickpeas in a bowl and cover with water. let them soak overnight. drain and rinse before using.
2. in a food processor, combine the soaked chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, cilantro, cumin, coriander, baking soda, salt, and pepper. pulse until the mixture becomes a coarse paste.
3. transfer the mixture to a bowl and stir in the flour until well combined. let it rest in the fridge for 30 minutes.
4. heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. form the chickpea mixture into small patties and carefully place them in the hot oil. cook until golden brown on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side. remove from the skillet and drain on paper towels.
5. in a large bowl, combine the mixed greens, cucumber, bell pepper, tomato, red onion, and feta cheese.
6. in a separate small bowl, whisk together lemon juice and olive oil. pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
7. to serve, divide the salad mixture among bowls and top each bowl with 2-3 falafel patties. drizzle with tahini sauce and serve immediately. enjoy!
ingredients_list: dried, chickpea, onion, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, parsley, fresh, cilantro, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, baking, soda, salt, taste, pepper, taste, flour, green, cucumber, bell, pepper, tomato, red, onion, thinly, feta, cheese, lemon, olive, tahini, sauce

title: Caprese Flatbread
raw_text: 42. Caprese Flatbread: 400kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 flatbread
- 2 tomatoes
- 1 cup fresh mozzarella cheese
- 1/4 cup fresh basil leaves
- 2 tablespoons balsamic glaze
- salt and black pepper to taste
- olive oil for brushing
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. place the flatbread on a baking sheet and brush it with olive oil.
3. slice the tomatoes and mozzarella cheese into thin slices.
4. arrange the tomato and mozzarella slices evenly on top of the flatbread.
5. tear the basil leaves into small pieces and sprinkle them over the flatbread.
6. season with salt and black pepper according to your taste.
7. drizzle the balsamic glaze over the flatbread.
8. bake in the preheated oven for about 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese melts and the flatbread is crispy.
9. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
10. cut the caprese flatbread into desired serving pieces.
11. serve warm and enjoy!
ingredients_list: flatbread, tomato, fresh, mozzarella, cheese, fresh, basil, leaf, balsamic, glaze, salt, black, pepper, taste, olive, brushing

title: Veggie Soba Noodle Stir
raw_text: 51. Veggie Soba Noodle Stir-Fry: 500kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and soy (Japan)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 ounces soba noodles
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 onion, thinly sliced
- 2 bell peppers (any color), thinly sliced
- 2 carrots, julienned
- 2 cups broccoli florets
- 1 cup sliced mushrooms
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon ginger, minced
- ¼ cup soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons oyster sauce
- 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
- 1 teaspoon sesame oil
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- salt and pepper to taste
- sesame seeds for garnish
preparation:
1. cook soba noodles according to package instructions. drain and set aside.
2. heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
3. add sliced onion, bell peppers, carrots, and broccoli to the skillet. stir-fry for about 5 minutes until vegetables are slightly tender.
4. add sliced mushrooms, minced garlic, and minced ginger to the skillet. stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes until mushrooms are cooked.
5. in a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, oyster sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, and cornstarch.
6. pour the sauce mixture over the stir-fried vegetables in the skillet. stir to coat the vegetables evenly.
7. add the cooked soba noodles to the skillet and toss everything together until well combined and heated through.
8. season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. remove from heat and garnish with sesame seeds.
10. serve hot and enjoy your veggie soba noodle stir-fry!
ingredients_list: ounce, soba, noodle, vegetable, onion, thinly, bell, pepper, color, thinly, carrot, broccoli, floret, mushroom, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, minced, soy, sauce, oyster, sauce, rice, vinegar, sesame, cornstarch, salt, pepper, taste, sesame, seed, garnish

title: Middle Eastern Falafel Burger
raw_text: 57. Middle Eastern Falafel Burger: 500kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten (Middle East)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 can chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1 small red onion, chopped
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped
- 1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional)
- 1/2 cup breadcrumbs
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- vegetable oil, for frying
- 4 burger buns

for the yogurt sauce:
- 1/2 cup greek yogurt
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1 clove of garlic, minced
- salt, to taste

for serving (optional):
- lettuce
- sliced tomatoes
- sliced cucumbers
- pickled red onions
preparation:
1. in a food processor, add the chickpeas, red onion, garlic, parsley, cilantro, cumin, coriander, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper (if using). pulse until well combined but still slightly chunky.
2. transfer the mixture to a bowl and stir in the breadcrumbs and flour. mix until the mixture holds together when pressed.
3. using your hands, shape the mixture into 4 patties, about 1/2 inch thick.
4. heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. carefully place the falafel patties in the hot oil and cook for about 3-4 minutes per side, or until crispy and golden brown. remove from the skillet and place on a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.
5. in a small bowl, mix together the greek yogurt, lemon juice, minced garlic, and salt to make the yogurt sauce.
6. to assemble the burgers, spread a spoonful of the yogurt sauce on the bottom half of each burger bun. top with a falafel patty and add desired toppings such as lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, and pickled red onions. cover with the top half of the bun.
7. serve the middle eastern falafel burgers immediately and enjoy!
ingredients_list: chickpea, red, onion, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, parsley, fresh, cilantro, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, salt, black, pepper, cayenne, pepper, breadcrumb, flour, vegetable, burger, bun, yogurt, sauce, greek, yogurt, lemon, clove, garlic, minced, salt, taste, lettuce, tomato, cucumber, pickled, red, onion

title: Vegetable and Tofu Skewers
raw_text: 67. Vegetable and Tofu Skewers: 350kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains soy (Various)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups of mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, mushrooms, zucchini, red onions)
- 1 block of tofu, cut into cubes
- 2 tablespoons of soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- 1 tablespoon of honey or maple syrup
- 1 tablespoon of lemon juice
- 1 teaspoon of minced garlic
- salt and pepper, to taste
- wooden skewers, soaked in water for 30 minutes
preparation:
1. in a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, olive oil, honey or maple syrup, lemon juice, minced garlic, salt, and pepper to make the marinade.
2. thread the mixed vegetables and tofu cubes onto the soaked wooden skewers, alternating between vegetables and tofu.
3. place the skewers into a dish or tray and pour the marinade over them, making sure each skewer is evenly coated. let them marinate for at least 30 minutes.
4. preheat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.
5. once the grill is hot, place the skewers on the grill and cook for about 5-7 minutes per side, or until vegetables are slightly charred and tofu is heated through.
6. remove the skewers from the grill and serve hot. you can sprinkle some additional salt and pepper if desired.
7. enjoy your delicious vegetable and tofu skewers!
ingredients_list: vegetable, bell, pepper, mushroom, zucchini, red, onion, tofu, cube, soy, sauce, olive, honey, maple, syrup, lemon, minced, garlic, salt, pepper, taste, wooden, skewer, soaked, water, minute

title: Veggie Shepherd's Pie
raw_text: 73. Veggie Shepherd's Pie: 800kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy (United Kingdom)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 carrots, diced
- 2 stalks celery, diced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 zucchini, diced
- 1 cup corn kernels
- 1 cup green peas
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- 1 teaspoon dried rosemary
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- 2 tablespoons tomato paste
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 4 cups mashed potatoes
- chopped parsley for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
3. add the onion and garlic and sauté until translucent.
4. add the carrots, celery, bell pepper, zucchini, corn, and peas. cook for about 5 minutes, until the vegetables are slightly softened.
5. stir in the dried thyme, dried rosemary, paprika, salt, and pepper. cook for another minute, until fragrant.
6. in a small bowl, mix together the vegetable broth, tomato paste, and soy sauce. pour the mixture into the skillet, stirring to combine with the vegetables.
7. reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 10 minutes, until the sauce thickens slightly and the vegetables are cooked through.
8. transfer the vegetable mixture to a baking dish and spread the mashed potatoes evenly over the top.
9. bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, until the mashed potatoes are golden brown and the mixture is bubbling.
10. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
11. garnish with chopped parsley and enjoy! 

note: you can customize the mashed potatoes by adding dairy-free butter or vegan cheese to make it creamier.
ingredients_list: olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, carrot, stalk, celery, red, bell, pepper, zucchini, corn, kernel, green, pea, dried, thyme, dried, rosemary, paprika, salt, pepper, taste, vegetable, broth, tomato, paste, soy, sauce, potato, parsley, garnish

title: Veggie Pho
raw_text: 74. Veggie Pho: 600kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and soy (Vietnam)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 cups vegetable broth
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 onion, thinly sliced
- 1 thumb-sized piece of ginger, thinly sliced
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons hoisin sauce
- 2 tablespoons rice vinegar
- 8 ounces rice noodles
- 1 cup sliced mushrooms
- 1 bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 2 carrots, thinly sliced
- 1 cup bean sprouts
- 1 cup chopped bok choy
- fresh cilantro and lime wedges for garnish
preparation:
1. in a large pot, bring vegetable broth to a boil over medium-high heat.
2. add minced garlic, onion slices, and ginger slices to the boiling broth. let it simmer for about 10 minutes to infuse the flavors.
3. stir in soy sauce, hoisin sauce, and rice vinegar. simmer for another 5 minutes.
4. cook rice noodles according to package instructions. drain and set aside.
5. add mushrooms, bell pepper, and carrots to the pot. cook for 5-7 minutes until the veggies are tender.
6. stir in bean sprouts and bok choy. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the vegetables are just wilted.
7. divide the cooked rice noodles into serving bowls. ladle the hot vegetable broth and veggies over the noodles.
8. garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with lime wedges. enjoy your veggie pho!
ingredients_list: vegetable, broth, clove, garlic, minced, onion, thinly, thumb, ginger, thinly, soy, sauce, hoisin, sauce, rice, vinegar, ounce, rice, noodle, mushroom, bell, pepper, thinly, carrot, thinly, bean, sprout, bok, choy, fresh, cilantro, lime, wedge, garnish

title: Cauliflower Alfredo Pasta
raw_text: 77. Cauliflower Alfredo Pasta: 450kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy (Various)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 head of cauliflower
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- ½ cup milk (can use almond milk for a dairy-free option)
- ¼ cup nutritional yeast
- 1 teaspoon salt
- ½ teaspoon black pepper
- 1 lb pasta of your choice
- optional toppings: chopped parsley, grated parmesan cheese
preparation:
1. wash and chop the cauliflower into small florets.
2. in a large pot, bring water to a boil and cook the cauliflower florets for about 10 minutes or until fork-tender.
3. drain the cauliflower and set aside.
4. in a separate skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
5. add the minced garlic and sauté for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.
6. add the cooked cauliflower florets, vegetable broth, milk, nutritional yeast, salt, and black pepper to the skillet.
7. use an immersion blender or transfer the mixture to a blender or food processor to puree until smooth and creamy.
8. meanwhile, cook the pasta according to the package instructions until al dente.
9. drain the pasta, reserving about ½ cup of the pasta water.
10. return the pasta to the pot and add the cauliflower alfredo sauce, stirring to coat the pasta evenly.
11. if the sauce is too thick, gradually add the reserved pasta water to thin it out to the desired consistency.
12. serve the cauliflower alfredo pasta hot, garnished with chopped parsley and grated parmesan cheese, if desired.
ingredients_list: head, cauliflower, clove, garlic, minced, olive, vegetable, broth, milk, almond, milk, dairy, option, yeast, salt, black, pepper, pasta, topping, parsley, parmesan, cheese

title: Mushroom and Spinach Quesadilla
raw_text: 80. Mushroom and Spinach Quesadilla: 400kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy (Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large flour tortillas
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 small onion, thinly sliced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 8 ounces mushrooms, sliced
- 2 cups fresh spinach leaves
- 1 cup shredded cheese (such as monterey jack or cheddar)
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. add the onion and garlic to the skillet and sauté until the onion is softened and translucent, about 5 minutes.
3. add the mushrooms to the skillet and cook until they have released their moisture and are browned, about 8 minutes.
4. remove the mushrooms from the skillet and set aside.
5. in the same skillet, add the remaining tablespoon of olive oil and the spinach leaves.
6. cook the spinach until wilted, about 2-3 minutes.
7. remove the skillet from heat and season with salt and pepper.
8. heat a separate skillet or griddle over medium heat.
9. place one tortilla on the skillet and sprinkle half of the shredded cheese evenly over the tortilla.
10. spoon half of the mushroom and spinach mixture over the cheese.
11. top with another tortilla and press down lightly.
12. cook until the bottom tortilla is golden brown and the cheese has melted, about 2-3 minutes.
13. flip the quesadilla and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the other side is golden brown.
14. remove the quesadilla from the skillet and repeat the process with the remaining ingredients to make the second quesadilla.
15. cut each quesadilla into wedges and serve hot. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, tortilla, olive, onion, thinly, clove, garlic, minced, ounce, mushroom, fresh, spinach, leaf, shredded, cheese, monterey, jack, cheddar, salt, pepper, taste

title: Bean and Vegetable Burrito
raw_text: 86. Bean and Vegetable Burrito: 600kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten (Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup cooked black beans
- 1 bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 onion, thinly sliced
- 1 zucchini, thinly sliced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon chili powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 large tortillas
- salsa, guacamole, or sour cream for serving (optional)
preparation:
1. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
2. add the bell pepper, onion, and zucchini to the skillet. sauté for about 5 minutes until the vegetables have softened.
3. add the cooked black beans to the skillet and stir to combine.
4. sprinkle in the cumin, paprika, chili powder, salt, and pepper. stir well to coat the beans and vegetables in the spices. cook for another 2-3 minutes.
5. warm the tortillas in a separate skillet or microwave until pliable.
6. divide the bean and vegetable mixture evenly among the tortillas, placing it in the center of each.
7. roll up the tortillas tightly, folding in the sides as you go.
8. serve the burritos hot with salsa, guacamole, or sour cream if desired.
9. enjoy your delicious bean and vegetable burritos!
ingredients_list: black, bean, bell, pepper, thinly, onion, thinly, zucchini, thinly, olive, cumin, paprika, chili, powder, salt, pepper, taste, tortilla, salsa, guacamole, sour, cream

title: Feta and Spinach Stuffed Mushrooms
raw_text: 91. Feta and Spinach Stuffed Mushrooms: 450kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy (Greece)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 20 medium-sized mushrooms
- 1 cup frozen spinach, thawed and drained
- 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/4 cup bread crumbs
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c). line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. remove the stems from the mushrooms and set aside. arrange the mushroom caps on the prepared baking sheet.
3. in a mixing bowl, combine the spinach, feta cheese, minced garlic, bread crumbs, olive oil, salt, and pepper. mix well until all the ingredients are evenly incorporated.
4. fill each mushroom cap with the spinach and feta mixture, pressing it down slightly.
5. finely chop the mushroom stems that were set aside earlier, and sprinkle them over the stuffed mushrooms.
6. place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender and the filling is golden brown.
7. once cooked, remove from the oven and let the mushrooms cool for a few minutes before serving. enjoy!
ingredients_list: mushroom, frozen, spinach, thawed, feta, cheese, clove, garlic, minced, bread, crumb, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Caprese Grilled Cheese Sandwich
raw_text: 9. Caprese Grilled Cheese Sandwich - 420kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 slices of bread (your choice)
- 4-6 ounces of fresh mozzarella cheese, sliced
- 2 tomatoes, sliced
- fresh basil leaves
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat a pan or sandwich press over medium heat.
2. spread the olive oil on one side of each slice of bread.
3. place one slice of bread (olive oil side down) onto the pan.
4. layer the mozzarella cheese, tomato slices, and fresh basil leaves on top of the bread.
5. sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste.
6. top with another slice of bread (olive oil side up).
7. press the sandwich with a spatula to help it cook evenly.
8. cook for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until the cheese is melted and the bread is crispy and golden brown.
9. remove from the pan and slice the sandwich diagonally.
10. serve hot and enjoy your caprese grilled cheese sandwich!
ingredients_list: bread, ounce, fresh, mozzarella, cheese, tomato, fresh, basil, leaf, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Quinoa Salad with Avocado and Black Beans
raw_text: 17. Quinoa Salad with Avocado and Black Beans - 380kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains legumes
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup quinoa
- 2 cups water
- 1 can black beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 avocado, diced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 small red onion, finely chopped
- 1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced (optional)
- 1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
- juice of 1 lime
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a medium saucepan, combine quinoa and water. bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes or until all the water is absorbed. fluff with a fork and set aside to cool.
2. in a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, black beans, avocado, red bell pepper, red onion, jalapeno pepper (if using), and cilantro.
3. in a small bowl, whisk together lime juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper. pour over the quinoa mixture and toss well to combine.
4. serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve. enjoy!
ingredients_list: quinoa, water, black, bean, avocado, red, bell, pepper, red, onion, jalapeno, pepper, seeded, minced, fresh, cilantro, lime, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Mexican Rice and Bean Stuffed Peppers
raw_text: 19. Mexican Rice and Bean Stuffed Peppers - 350kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains legumes (Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large bell peppers (any color)
- 1 cup cooked brown rice
- 1 cup cooked black beans
- 1 cup cooked corn kernels
- 1/2 cup diced tomatoes
- 1/4 cup diced red onion
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1/2 cup shredded mexican blend cheese
- optional toppings: sour cream, salsa, guacamole
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. slice the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes. set aside.
3. in a mixing bowl, combine the cooked brown rice, black beans, corn kernels, diced tomatoes, diced red onion, chopped fresh cilantro, ground cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. mix well until all the ingredients are evenly distributed.
4. stuff each bell pepper with the rice and bean mixture, pressing it down lightly to fill the peppers completely.
5. place the stuffed peppers in a baking dish, standing upright. if the peppers don't stand on their own, you can cut a small slice off the bottom to create a flat surface.
6. sprinkle the shredded mexican blend cheese evenly over the tops of the stuffed peppers.
7. cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the peppers are tender and the cheese is melted.
8. remove the foil and bake for an additional 5 minutes to allow the cheese to brown slightly.
9. carefully remove the stuffed peppers from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.
10. serve the mexican rice and bean stuffed peppers with optional toppings such as sour cream, salsa, and guacamole. enjoy!
ingredients_list: bell, pepper, color, brown, rice, black, bean, corn, kernel, tomato, red, onion, fresh, cilantro, ground, cumin, chili, powder, garlic, powder, salt, pepper, taste, shredded, mexican, blend, cheese, topping, sour, cream, salsa, guacamole

title: Caprese Quinoa Casserole
raw_text: 25. Caprese Quinoa Casserole - 420kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup quinoa
- 2 cups water
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1 cup fresh mozzarella cheese, diced
- 1/4 cup fresh basil leaves, chopped
- 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. rinse the quinoa under cold water.
3. in a medium-sized saucepan, bring the water to a boil. add the quinoa, reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 15 minutes until the quinoa is cooked and the water is absorbed.
4. in a mixing bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, cherry tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, and basil leaves.
5. drizzle the balsamic vinegar and olive oil over the quinoa mixture. season with salt and pepper to taste. mix well to combine all the ingredients.
6. transfer the quinoa mixture to a casserole dish.
7. bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese has melted and the top is slightly golden.
8. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
9. divide the casserole into two portions and serve hot. enjoy!
ingredients_list: quinoa, water, cherry, tomato, halved, fresh, mozzarella, cheese, fresh, basil, leaf, balsamic, vinegar, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Quinoa and Black Bean Burger
raw_text: 31. Quinoa and Black Bean Burger - 340kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains legumes
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup cooked quinoa
- 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/4 cup breadcrumbs
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon chili powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, mash the black beans using a fork or potato masher until they are mostly mashed but still have some whole beans remaining.
2. add the cooked quinoa, chopped onion, minced garlic, breadcrumbs, cilantro, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper to the bowl with the mashed black beans.
3. mix all the ingredients together until well combined. if the mixture is too dry, you can add a little water or additional breadcrumbs to help bind it.
4. divide the mixture into four equal portions and shape each portion into a patty. you can use your hands to shape the patties or use a burger press.
5. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. place the burger patties in the skillet and cook for about 4-5 minutes on each side, or until they are browned and heated through.
6. once cooked, remove the patties from the skillet and serve on your preferred bun or lettuce wrap, along with your favorite toppings such as avocado, tomato, lettuce, and condiments.
7. enjoy your delicious and healthy quinoa and black bean burgers!
ingredients_list: quinoa, black, bean, onion, clove, garlic, minced, breadcrumb, fresh, cilantro, cumin, chili, powder, salt, pepper, taste, olive

title: Eggplant Lasagna
raw_text: 44. Eggplant Lasagna - 390kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large eggplants
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 onion, diced
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 pound ground beef
- 1 can (14 ounces) crushed tomatoes
- 1 can (6 ounces) tomato paste
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- ½ teaspoon salt
- ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper
- ½ cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1 ½ cups shredded mozzarella cheese
- fresh basil leaves for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c). grease a baking dish and set aside.
2. slice the eggplants lengthwise into thin slices, about ¼ inch thick. place them on a paper towel and sprinkle with salt. let them sit for about 15 minutes to release excess moisture. pat dry with another paper towel.
3. heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. add the diced onion and minced garlic, and sauté until the onion becomes translucent.
4. add the ground beef to the skillet and cook until browned. drain any excess fat.
5. stir in the crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, dried basil, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper. simmer the mixture over low heat for about 10 minutes.
6. in a separate skillet, heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil. cook the eggplant slices on both sides until lightly golden. remove from the heat and set aside.
7. spread a thin layer of the meat sauce onto the bottom of the greased baking dish. arrange a layer of eggplant slices on top of the sauce.
8. sprinkle half of the grated parmesan cheese and half of the shredded mozzarella cheese over the eggplant.
9. repeat the layers with the remaining sauce, eggplant slices, parmesan cheese, and mozzarella cheese.
10. cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes. then remove the foil and bake for an additional 10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
11. let the lasagna cool for a few minutes before serving. garnish with fresh basil leaves if desired.
12. serve into 4 portions, each containing approximately 390 calories. enjoy your eggplant lasagna!
ingredients_list: eggplant, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ground, beef, ounce, tomato, ounce, tomato, paste, dried, basil, dried, oregano, salt, ground, black, pepper, parmesan, cheese, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, fresh, basil, leaf, garnish

title: Spinach and Cheese Stuffed Shells
raw_text: 58. Spinach and Cheese Stuffed Shells - 380kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 20 jumbo pasta shells
- 2 cups fresh spinach, chopped
- 1 cup ricotta cheese
- 1 cup mozzarella cheese, shredded
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1 egg, beaten
- 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/4 teaspoon onion powder
- 1/4 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper to taste
- 2 cups marinara sauce
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c) and lightly grease a baking dish.
2. cook the pasta shells according to the package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.
3. in a large bowl, mix together the chopped spinach, ricotta cheese, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese, beaten egg, garlic powder, onion powder, dried oregano, salt, and pepper.
4. spread 1 cup of marinara sauce on the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
5. fill each cooked pasta shell with a spoonful of the spinach and cheese mixture, and arrange them in a single layer in the baking dish.
6. pour the remaining marinara sauce over the stuffed shells.
7. cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake for 25 minutes.
8. remove the foil and sprinkle the shells with additional shredded mozzarella and parmesan cheese.
9. bake for an additional 10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. serve the spinach and cheese stuffed shells hot, and enjoy!
ingredients_list: pasta, shell, fresh, spinach, ricotta, cheese, mozzarella, cheese, shredded, parmesan, cheese, egg, garlic, powder, onion, powder, dried, oregano, salt, pepper, taste, marinara, sauce

title: Eggplant Curry
raw_text: 61. Eggplant Curry - 320kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains spices (India)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large eggplants
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1 teaspoon ground turmeric
- 1/2 teaspoon chili powder (adjust to taste)
- 1 teaspoon garam masala
- 1 can (400g) diced tomatoes
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- salt, to taste
- fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish
preparation:
1. wash the eggplants and cut them into 1-inch cubes. set aside.
2. heat the vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat.
3. add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the pan and sauté until they turn translucent and slightly browned.
4. add the ground cumin, ground coriander, ground turmeric, and chili powder to the pan. stir well to combine the spices with the onions and garlic.
5. add the cubed eggplants to the pan and stir to coat them with the spice mixture.
6. pour in the diced tomatoes and vegetable broth. give it a good stir.
7. season with salt to taste. bring the mixture to a simmer.
8. cover the pan and let the curry cook for around 20-25 minutes, or until the eggplants are tender.
9. sprinkle the garam masala over the curry and give it a final stir.
10. serve the eggplant curry hot, garnished with fresh cilantro leaves.
11. enjoy this delicious and flavorful indian eggplant curry!

note: serve the curry with steamed rice or naan bread for a complete meal. adjust the spices according to your preference for heat.
ingredients_list: eggplant, vegetable, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, ground, turmeric, chili, powder, taste, garam, masala, tomato, vegetable, broth, salt, taste, fresh, cilantro, leaf, garnish

title: Greek Feta Spinach Pie
raw_text: 65. Greek Feta Spinach Pie - 240kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy (Greece)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 200g frozen spinach, thawed and drained
- 150g feta cheese, crumbled
- 2 eggs
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1/4 teaspoon dried dill
- 1/4 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 sheets of phyllo pastry
- 2 tablespoons butter, melted
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 180°c (350°f).
2. heat the olive oil in a pan over medium heat. add the chopped onion and minced garlic, and sauté until golden brown.
3. in a large mixing bowl, combine the spinach, feta cheese, eggs, sautéed onion and garlic, dried dill, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. mix well until everything is evenly combined.
4. grease a round baking dish with butter and place the first sheet of phyllo pastry over the bottom, letting the edges hang over the sides. brush the pastry with melted butter.
5. place the second sheet of phyllo pastry over the first one, again letting the edges hang over the sides. brush with melted butter.
6. repeat the process with the third and fourth sheets of phyllo pastry, brushing each with melted butter.
7. pour the spinach and feta mixture over the phyllo pastry layers evenly.
8. fold the overhanging edges of the phyllo pastry towards the center, covering the filling.
9. brush the top of the pie with the remaining melted butter.
10. bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the pie is golden brown and crispy.
11. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing.
12. serve the greek feta spinach pie warm and enjoy!
ingredients_list: frozen, spinach, thawed, feta, cheese, egg, onion, clove, garlic, minced, olive, dried, dill, dried, oregano, salt, pepper, taste, sheet, phyllo, pastry, butter

title: Spinach and Artichoke Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms
raw_text: 66. Spinach and Artichoke Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms - 340kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large portobello mushrooms
- 1 cup spinach, chopped
- 1/2 cup artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
- 1/4 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 2 tablespoons cream cheese
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. remove the stems from the portobello mushrooms and gently scoop out the gills with a spoon.
3. in a skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add minced garlic and cook until fragrant.
4. add the chopped spinach to the skillet and sauté until wilted.
5. add the chopped artichoke hearts to the skillet and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
6. remove the skillet from heat and stir in the mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese, and cream cheese until well combined.
7. season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
8. spoon the spinach and artichoke mixture evenly into the hollowed-out portobello mushrooms.
9. place the stuffed mushrooms on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
10. bake for about 15-20 minutes or until the mushrooms are tender and the cheese is melted and golden.
11. serve the spinach and artichoke stuffed portobello mushrooms hot and enjoy!

each of the 2 portions will have approximately 340 calories.
ingredients_list: portobello, mushroom, spinach, artichoke, heart, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, parmesan, cheese, cream, cheese, clove, garlic, minced, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Spinach and Ricotta Stuffed Shells with Marinara Sauce
raw_text: 69. Spinach and Ricotta Stuffed Shells with Marinara Sauce - 390kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 16 jumbo pasta shells
- 2 cups marinara sauce
- 2 cups fresh spinach, chopped
- 1 cup ricotta cheese
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/4 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1/2 teaspoon dried basil
- 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and black pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cook the jumbo pasta shells according to package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.
3. in a medium mixing bowl, combine the spinach, ricotta cheese, parmesan cheese, garlic, basil, oregano, salt, and black pepper. mix well.
4. spread a thin layer of marinara sauce on the bottom of a baking dish.
5. spoon the spinach and ricotta mixture into each cooked pasta shell, filling them generously. place the stuffed shells in the baking dish.
6. pour the remaining marinara sauce over the stuffed shells, covering them completely.
7. sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese on top of the marinara sauce.
8. cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake for 25 minutes.
9. remove the foil and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and golden.
10. take out of the oven and let it cool for a couple of minutes before serving.
11. serve hot and enjoy!

title: Greek Stuffed Peppers with Rice and Feta
raw_text: 74. Greek Stuffed Peppers with Rice and Feta - 350kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large bell peppers
- 1 cup cooked rice
- 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh mint
- 1/4 cup chopped red onion
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes. rinse them well.
3. in a large bowl, combine the cooked rice, feta cheese, parsley, mint, red onion, olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. mix well.
4. stuff the bell peppers with the rice mixture, pressing it down gently to fill them evenly.
5. place the stuffed peppers in a baking dish and cover with foil.
6. bake in the preheated oven for about 35-40 minutes, or until the peppers are tender and the filling is heated through.
7. remove the foil and bake for an additional 5 minutes to lightly brown the tops.
8. serve the greek stuffed peppers hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: bell, pepper, rice, feta, cheese, fresh, parsley, fresh, mint, red, onion, olive, lemon, salt, pepper, taste

title: Spinach and Goat Cheese Stuffed Mushrooms
raw_text: 75. Spinach and Goat Cheese Stuffed Mushrooms - 350kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 12 large button mushrooms
- 2 cups fresh spinach, chopped
- 4 oz goat cheese, crumbled
- 2 tablespoons grated parmesan cheese
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. remove the stems from the mushrooms and set aside. place the mushroom caps on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
3. in a skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the minced garlic and chopped mushroom stems and sauté for 2-3 minutes until softened.
4. add the chopped spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes. remove from heat and allow it to cool slightly.
5. in a mixing bowl, combine the sautéed spinach and mushroom stems with the crumbled goat cheese. season with salt and pepper to taste. stir well to combine.
6. spoon the spinach and goat cheese mixture into each mushroom cap, pressing down lightly.
7. sprinkle grated parmesan cheese over the stuffed mushrooms.
8. bake in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes or until the mushrooms are tender and the cheese is melted and golden brown.
9. allow them to cool for a few minutes before serving. enjoy!
ingredients_list: mushroom, fresh, spinach, goat, cheese, parmesan, cheese, clove, garlic, minced, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Caprese Couscous Salad
raw_text: 80. Caprese Couscous Salad - 340kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup couscous
- 1 cup water
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1 cup mozzarella balls or fresh mozzarella, diced
- 1/4 cup fresh basil leaves, chopped
- 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
- 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar
- salt to taste
- pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a medium-sized saucepan, bring water to a boil.
2. remove from heat and add couscous to the boiling water. stir well and cover the saucepan with a lid. let it sit for 5 minutes until the couscous absorbs all the water.
3. fluff the cooked couscous with a fork and let it cool to room temperature.
4. in a large bowl, combine the cooked couscous, halved cherry tomatoes, diced mozzarella, and chopped basil leaves.
5. in a separate small bowl, whisk together the olive oil and balsamic vinegar to make the dressing.
6. pour the dressing over the salad ingredients and toss gently to combine.
7. season with salt and pepper according to your taste.
8. once everything is mixed well, divide the salad into 4 portions.
9. serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to eat.

enjoy your delicious caprese couscous salad from italy!
ingredients_list: couscous, water, cherry, tomato, halved, mozzarella, ball, fresh, mozzarella, fresh, basil, leaf, virgin, olive, balsamic, vinegar, salt, taste, pepper, taste

title: Vegetable Curry with Chickpeas
raw_text: 81. Vegetable Curry with Chickpeas - 380kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains legumes
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ginger, grated
- 1 tablespoon curry powder
- 1/2 teaspoon cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 can (15 ounces) chickpeas, rinsed and drained
- 1 can (14 ounces) diced tomatoes
- 2 cups mixed vegetables (such as carrots, bell peppers, zucchini), chopped
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- 1/2 cup coconut milk
- fresh cilantro, chopped for garnish
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat.
2. add the chopped onion and sauté until it becomes translucent.
3. add the minced garlic and grated ginger, stirring for about a minute.
4. add the curry powder, cumin, turmeric, paprika, salt, and black pepper. stir well to coat the onions and spices evenly.
5. add the chickpeas, diced tomatoes (with their juices), and mixed vegetables to the pot. stir to combine.
6. pour in the vegetable broth and bring the mixture to a boil. reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 15-20 minutes, until the vegetables are tender.
7. pour in the coconut milk and stir to incorporate. simmer for an additional 5 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
8. remove from heat and serve the vegetable curry over cooked rice or with naan bread. garnish with fresh chopped cilantro. enjoy!

title: Spinach and Ricotta Stuffed Tomatoes
raw_text: 83. Spinach and Ricotta Stuffed Tomatoes - 290kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large tomatoes
- 1 cup of spinach leaves, chopped
- 1 cup of ricotta cheese
- 1/4 cup of grated parmesan cheese
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cut off the tops of the tomatoes and gently scoop out the seeds and pulp using a spoon. set aside.
3. in a mixing bowl, combine the chopped spinach, ricotta cheese, parmesan cheese, minced garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper. mix well until all ingredients are fully incorporated.
4. stuff each tomato with the spinach and ricotta mixture, making sure to fill them completely.
5. place the stuffed tomatoes in a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the tomatoes are tender and the filling is slightly browned on top.
6. remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.
7. serve the spinach and ricotta stuffed tomatoes as a side dish or as a light main course. enjoy!

title: Greek Briam with Feta Cheese
raw_text: 87. Greek Briam with Feta Cheese - 270kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large potatoes, sliced
- 2 large zucchinis, sliced
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 yellow bell pepper, sliced
- 1 large onion, sliced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 4 tomatoes, diced
- 1/4 cup olive oil
- 1 tsp dried oregano
- 1 tsp dried basil
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 oz feta cheese, crumbled
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a large baking dish, arrange the sliced potatoes, zucchinis, bell peppers, onion, and garlic.
3. pour the diced tomatoes on top of the vegetables.
4. drizzle the olive oil over the vegetables and sprinkle with dried oregano, dried basil, salt, and pepper.
5. toss gently to ensure all the vegetables are coated with the seasonings and olive oil.
6. cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes.
7. remove the foil and sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese evenly over the vegetables.
8. return the baking dish to the oven and bake uncovered for an additional 15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and slightly golden.
9. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
10. divide the greek briam into 4 portions and serve warm. enjoy!

title: Spinach and Feta Puff Pastry Bites
raw_text: 92. Spinach and Feta Puff Pastry Bites - 270kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 sheet of puff pastry, thawed
- 1 cup of fresh spinach, chopped
- 1/2 cup of feta cheese, crumbled
- 1 egg, beaten (for egg wash)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. roll out the puff pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface.
3. cut the puff pastry into 16 equal squares.
4. in a bowl, mix together the chopped spinach and crumbled feta cheese.
5. place about a teaspoon of the spinach and feta mixture in the center of each puff pastry square.
6. fold each square in half diagonally to create triangles and press the edges together to seal.
7. place the puff pastry bites on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
8. brush the tops of the bites with the beaten egg wash.
9. bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown and puffed up.
10. remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving.

enjoy your spinach and feta puff pastry bites!

title: Caprese Omelette
raw_text: 93. Caprese Omelette - 400kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large eggs
- 1/4 cup milk
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 medium tomato, sliced
- 4 ounces fresh mozzarella, sliced
- 1/4 cup fresh basil leaves
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. in a bowl, whisk together the eggs and milk. season with salt and pepper.
2. heat the olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
3. pour half of the egg mixture into the skillet and let it cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the edges start to set.
4. arrange half of the tomato slices, mozzarella slices, and basil leaves on one half of the omelette.
5. fold the other half of the omelette over the toppings using a spatula.
6. cook for another 2-3 minutes, or until the cheese melts and the omelette is cooked through.
7. transfer the omelette to a plate and repeat the process with the remaining ingredients to make the second portion.
8. serve the caprese omelette hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: egg, milk, olive, tomato, ounce, fresh, mozzarella, fresh, basil, leaf, salt, pepper, taste

title: Spinach and Artichoke Stuffed Shells Alfredo
raw_text: 96. Spinach and Artichoke Stuffed Shells Alfredo - 390kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 16 jumbo pasta shells
- 2 cups fresh spinach, chopped
- 1 cup artichoke hearts, chopped
- 1 cup ricotta cheese
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese

- 1 cup alfredo sauce

preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c) and lightly grease a baking dish.
2. cook the jumbo pasta shells according to the instructions on the package until they are al dente. drain and set aside.
3. in a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped spinach, artichoke hearts, ricotta cheese, grated parmesan cheese, shredded mozzarella cheese, garlic powder, dried basil, salt, and pepper. mix well until all the ingredients are evenly distributed.
4. fill each cooked pasta shell with the spinach and artichoke mixture, and place them in the greased baking dish.
5. pour the alfredo sauce over the stuffed shells, making sure to cover them completely.
6. sprinkle some additional grated parmesan cheese on top if desired.
7. cover the baking dish with foil and bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the filling is heated through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. remove the foil and broil for an additional 2-3 minutes to lightly brown the cheese on top.
9. let the stuffed shells cool for a few minutes before serving. enjoy!

title: Caprese Stuffed Garlic Bread
raw_text: 99. Caprese Stuffed Garlic Bread - 430kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 large loaf of italian bread
- 2 tablespoons of butter, melted
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 4 slices of fresh mozzarella cheese
- 2 tomatoes, sliced
- 1/2 cup of fresh basil leaves
- salt and pepper to taste
- balsamic glaze (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. slice the loaf of italian bread lengthwise, creating two long halves.
3. in a small bowl, combine the melted butter and minced garlic. mix well.
4. brush the garlic butter mixture evenly onto both sides of the bread halves.
5. place the bread halves on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for about 10 minutes until lightly toasted.
6. once toasted, remove the bread from the oven and start layering the ingredients. 
7. begin by placing the mozzarella cheese slices evenly on one side of the bread.
8. top the cheese with the sliced tomatoes, followed by the fresh basil leaves. season with salt and pepper.
9. place the other half of the bread on top to create a sandwich.
10. press the sandwich gently together and return it to the oven for another 5-10 minutes, or until the cheese has melted.
11. once the cheese has melted, remove the bread from the oven and let it cool slightly.
12. cut the caprese stuffed garlic bread into portions and serve warm.
13. optionally, drizzle some balsamic glaze over the top before serving for added flavor.
14. enjoy your caprese stuffed garlic bread!
ingredients_list: loaf, italian, bread, butter, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, mozzarella, cheese, tomato, fresh, basil, leaf, salt, pepper, taste, balsamic, glaze

title: Sweet Potato, Black Bean, and Spinach Quesadillas
raw_text: 17. Sweet Potato, Black Bean, and Spinach Quesadillas - 350 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and diced
- 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
- 2 cups fresh spinach leaves
- 4 large flour tortillas
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 1 jalapeño pepper, seeded and finely chopped (optional)
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- cooking spray
preparation:
1. in a large pot, bring water to a boil and add the diced sweet potatoes. cook until tender, about 10-15 minutes. drain and set aside.
2. in a skillet over medium heat, add the black beans, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. stir until well combined and heated through, about 5 minutes. remove from heat and set aside.
3. preheat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat.
4. lay out the tortillas on a clean surface. spread an even layer of the black bean mixture on one half of each tortilla.
5. divide the cooked sweet potatoes, spinach leaves, shredded cheddar cheese, and jalapeño pepper (if using) equally among the tortillas, placing them on top of the black bean mixture.
6. fold the tortillas in half, pressing down gently to seal the filling inside.
7. lightly spray the preheated skillet or griddle with cooking spray. place the quesadillas on the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until the tortillas are crispy and the cheese has melted.
8. remove from heat and allow to cool for a minute before cutting each quesadilla into quarters.
9. serve hot and enjoy your sweet potato, black bean, and spinach quesadillas!
ingredients_list: sweet, potato, black, bean, fresh, spinach, leaf, flour, tortilla, shredded, cheddar, cheese, jalape, pepper, seeded, chili, powder, cumin, garlic, powder, salt, pepper, taste, spray

title: Tofu and Broccoli Stir
raw_text: 25. Tofu and Broccoli Stir-Fry - 200 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains soy (China)
ingredients:
ingredients for tofu and broccoli stir-fry:
- 1 package of firm tofu, drained and cubed
- 2 cups broccoli florets
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 onion, sliced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon ginger, minced
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon hoisin sauce
- 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, hoisin sauce, rice vinegar, and cornstarch. set aside.
2. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
3. add the tofu cubes to the skillet and cook until lightly browned on all sides. remove the tofu from the skillet and set aside.
4. in the same skillet, add the garlic and ginger. sauté for about 1 minute until fragrant.
5. add the sliced onion, bell pepper, and broccoli florets to the skillet. stir-fry for about 3-4 minutes until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
6. return the tofu cubes to the skillet and pour the sauce mixture over the tofu and vegetables. stir well to coat everything evenly.
7. cook for another 2-3 minutes until the sauce thickens and coats the tofu and vegetables.
8. season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. serve the tofu and broccoli stir-fry hot and enjoy!

note: it is important to check the packaging of the tofu and other ingredients to ensure they are suitable for your dietary needs, especially if you have soy allergies or intolerances.
ingredients_list: tofu, broccoli, floret, red, bell, pepper, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, minced, soy, sauce, hoisin, sauce, rice, vinegar, cornstarch, vegetable, salt, pepper, taste

title: Greek Pita Sandwiches
raw_text: 26. Greek Pita Sandwiches - 300 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (Greece)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 greek pita breads
- 1 pound boneless chicken breasts, sliced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 cup greek yogurt
- 1/2 cucumber, peeled and diced
- 1/4 cup fresh dill, chopped
- juice of 1 lemon
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1/4 cup red onion, thinly sliced
- 1/4 cup kalamata olives, pitted and halved
- 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. season the sliced chicken breasts with dried oregano, thyme, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
3. heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. cook the seasoned chicken until no longer pink and golden brown, about 5-7 minutes. set aside.
4. in a small bowl, combine greek yogurt, diced cucumber, chopped dill, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. mix well and set aside.
5. place the greek pita breads on a baking sheet and warm them in the oven for 2-3 minutes.
6. once warmed, slice open the pita breads and spread the greek yogurt sauce inside.
7. divide the cooked chicken among the pita breads, and top with cherry tomatoes, red onion, kalamata olives, and crumbled feta cheese.
8. fold the pita breads in half to form sandwiches and serve immediately.
9. enjoy your delicious greek pita sandwiches!
ingredients_list: greek, pita, bread, boneless, chicken, breast, olive, dried, oregano, dried, thyme, garlic, powder, salt, pepper, taste, greek, yogurt, cucumber, fresh, dill, lemon, cherry, tomato, halved, red, onion, thinly, kalamata, olive, pitted, halved, feta, cheese

title: Butternut Squash and Sage Pasta
raw_text: 28. Butternut Squash and Sage Pasta - 450 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 butternut squash
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 4 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon fresh sage, finely chopped
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- 1 cup heavy cream
- salt and pepper to taste
- 12 oz gluten-containing pasta of your choice
- grated parmesan cheese for serving
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c). cut the butternut squash in half lengthwise and remove the seeds. place the halves on a baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil. season with salt and pepper. roast in the oven for about 45 minutes or until the squash is tender. allow it to cool slightly, then scoop out the flesh and set aside.
2. in a large saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the chopped onion and sauté until it becomes translucent, about 5 minutes. stir in the minced garlic and chopped sage, and cook for an additional 1 minute.
3. add the roasted butternut squash flesh to the saucepan, and stir to combine with the onion, garlic, and sage. pour in the vegetable broth and heavy cream. bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for about 10 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together. remove from heat and let cool slightly.
4. using a blender or immersion blender, purée the butternut squash mixture until smooth. season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. cook the gluten-containing pasta according to the package instructions until al dente. drain the pasta, reserving a small amount of cooking water.
6. in a large skillet, heat the butternut squash sauce over medium heat. add the cooked pasta and toss gently to coat. if the sauce seems too thick, add a splash of the reserved cooking water to loosen it up.
7. divide the butternut squash and sage pasta into 4 portions. serve hot, sprinkled with grated parmesan cheese. enjoy!
ingredients_list: butternut, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, sage, vegetable, broth, cream, salt, pepper, taste, gluten, containing, pasta, parmesan, cheese

title: Mexican Stuffed Sweet Potatoes
raw_text: 31. Mexican Stuffed Sweet Potatoes - 350 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains black beans (Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 medium sweet potatoes
- 1 cup cooked black beans
- 1 cup corn kernels
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 small red onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- fresh cilantro, for garnish
- sour cream, for serving (optional)
- lime wedges, for serving (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c). line a baking sheet with foil or parchment paper.
2. wash the sweet potatoes and pat them dry. pierce each potato several times with a fork. place them on the prepared baking sheet and bake for 45-60 minutes, or until tender.
3. while the sweet potatoes are baking, prepare the filling. in a large skillet, heat some oil over medium heat. add the diced onion, minced garlic, and diced bell pepper. sauté for about 5 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
4. to the skillet, add the cooked black beans and corn kernels. stir in the cumin, chili powder, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper. cook the mixture for a few more minutes, allowing the flavors to blend together.
5. once the sweet potatoes are cooked, remove them from the oven and let them cool slightly. slice each potato lengthwise and fluff the flesh with a fork, leaving a small border around the skin intact.
6. spoon the black bean and corn mixture evenly into each sweet potato, filling them generously. top each stuffed sweet potato with shredded cheddar cheese.
7. return the stuffed sweet potatoes to the oven and bake for another 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. remove from the oven and garnish with fresh cilantro. serve hot with optional toppings like sour cream and lime wedges. enjoy your delicious mexican stuffed sweet potatoes!
ingredients_list: sweet, potato, black, bean, corn, kernel, bell, pepper, red, onion, clove, garlic, minced, cumin, chili, powder, smoked, paprika, salt, pepper, taste, shredded, cheddar, cheese, fresh, cilantro, garnish, sour, cream, lime, wedge

title: Indian Vegetable Samosas
raw_text: 37. Indian Vegetable Samosas - 200 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (India)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- for the dough:
2 cups all-purpose flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 cup vegetable oil
1/2 cup lukewarm water

- for the filling:
1 cup boiled and mashed potatoes
1/2 cup green peas, boiled
1/4 cup chopped carrots, boiled
1/4 cup finely chopped onions
2 green chilies, finely chopped
1/2 teaspoon grated ginger
1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds
1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
1/2 teaspoon red chili powder
1/2 teaspoon garam masala
1 tablespoon oil
salt to taste

- for frying:
oil for deep frying
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour and salt. add the vegetable oil and mix well. gradually add water and knead into a smooth and firm dough. cover the dough and let it rest for 20 minutes.

2. heat oil in a pan over medium heat. add the cumin seeds and let them splutter. then, add the chopped onions, grated ginger, and green chilies. sauté until the onions become translucent.

3. add the boiled and mashed potatoes, boiled green peas, and chopped carrots to the pan. mix well. sprinkle turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. cook for a few minutes until the filling is well combined and heated through. remove from heat and let it cool.

4. divide the dough into small lemon-sized balls. roll out each ball into a thin oval shape.

5. cut the rolled dough in half. take one half and shape it into a cone by joining the straight edges. seal the edges by applying a little water.

6. fill the cone with the prepared vegetable filling. leave some space at the top to seal the samosa.

7. apply water around the top edges and seal the samosa by pressing the edges together. repeat for the remaining dough and filling.

8. heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat. once the oil is hot, carefully add the prepared samosas and fry until golden brown and crispy. drain excess oil on a paper towel.

9. serve the hot samosas with your favorite chutney or sauce. enjoy your indian vegetable samosas!
ingredients_list: dough, flour, salt, vegetable, lukewarm, water, filling, boiled, potato, green, pea, boiled, carrot, boiled, onion, green, chilies, ginger, cumin, seed, turmeric, powder, red, chili, powder, garam, masala, salt, taste

title: Spaghetti with Marinara Sauce
raw_text: 39. Spaghetti with Marinara Sauce - 350 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 400g spaghetti (gluten)
- 400g canned tomatoes
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt, to taste
- black pepper, to taste
- grated parmesan cheese, for garnish (optional)
- fresh basil leaves, for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions. drain and set aside.
2. in a large saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
3. add the chopped onion and minced garlic. sauté until the onion becomes translucent and the garlic becomes fragrant.
4. add the canned tomatoes, sugar, dried basil, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper. stir well to combine.
5. reduce the heat to low and simmer the sauce for about 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. taste the sauce and adjust the seasoning if needed.
7. serve the cooked spaghetti topped with marinara sauce.
8. garnish with grated parmesan cheese and fresh basil leaves if desired.
9. enjoy your spaghetti with marinara sauce!
ingredients_list: spaghetti, gluten, canned, tomato, onion, garlic, clove, minced, olive, sugar, dried, basil, dried, oregano, salt, taste, black, pepper, taste, parmesan, cheese, garnish, fresh, basil, leaf, garnish

title: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Pita Pockets
raw_text: 42. Spinach and Feta Stuffed Pita Pockets - 350 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy (Greece)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 whole wheat pita pockets
- 2 cups fresh spinach leaves, chopped
- 1 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 1 small red onion, diced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (180°c).
2. in a large bowl, combine the chopped spinach, crumbled feta cheese, diced red onion, olive oil, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. mix well to ensure even distribution of ingredients.
3. carefully cut a small opening on one side of each pita pocket to create a pouch for stuffing.
4. stuff each pita pocket with an equal amount of the spinach and feta mixture.
5. place the stuffed pita pockets on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, or until the pita pockets are heated through and slightly crispy.
6. remove from the oven and allow the stuffed pita pockets to cool slightly before serving.
7. serve warm and enjoy!

note: this recipe yields 4 portions, with each portion containing approximately 350 calories.

title: Mexican Corn Salad
raw_text: 43. Mexican Corn Salad - 250 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains cilantro (Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups of frozen corn kernels
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and finely chopped
- 1/4 cup of red onion, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup of fresh cilantro, finely chopped
- juice of 1 lime
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. heat a skillet over medium heat and add the frozen corn kernels. cook until slightly charred, about 5-7 minutes. remove from heat and let it cool down.
2. in a mixing bowl, combine the cooked corn, diced red bell pepper, chopped jalapeno pepper, finely chopped red onion, and fresh cilantro.
3. drizzle the lime juice and olive oil over the mixture. season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. toss everything together until well combined.
5. serve the mexican corn salad immediately or refrigerate for a couple of hours to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. enjoy!

title: Mexican Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms
raw_text: 51. Mexican Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms - 200 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large portobello mushrooms
- 1 tbsp olive oil
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and chopped
- 1 cup cooked quinoa
- 1 cup canned black beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 cup corn kernels (fresh or frozen)
- 1 tsp chili powder
- 1/2 tsp cumin
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 cup shredded monterey jack cheese
- fresh cilantro, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. remove the stems from the portobello mushrooms and gently scrape out the gills using a spoon. place the mushrooms on a baking sheet.
3. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the diced onion, minced garlic, red bell pepper, and jalapeno pepper. cook for about 5 minutes until the vegetables are softened.
4. add the cooked quinoa, black beans, and corn to the skillet. stir in the chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the flavors are well combined.
5. spoon the filling mixture into each portobello mushroom cap, pressing it down firmly. top each mushroom with shredded monterey jack cheese.
6. place the stuffed mushrooms in the preheated oven and bake for about 15-20 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly and the mushrooms are cooked through.
7. remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes. garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.
8. serve the mexican stuffed portobello mushrooms as a main dish or as a side with a green salad or rice.

enjoy your mexican stuffed portobello mushrooms!
taste: The key taste profile in this recipe is umami.
ingredients_list: portobello, mushroom, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, red, bell, pepper, jalapeno, pepper, seeded, quinoa, canned, black, bean, corn, kernel, fresh, frozen, chili, powder, cumin, salt, pepper, taste, shredded, monterey, jack, cheese, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Vegetarian Burrito Bowl
raw_text: 55. Vegetarian Burrito Bowl - 400 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup brown rice
- 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 small red onion, diced
- 1 cup frozen corn, thawed
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1 avocado, sliced
- 1 lime, juiced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon cumin
- salt and pepper to taste
- optional toppings: shredded lettuce, chopped cilantro, salsa, greek yogurt
preparation:
1. cook the brown rice according to package instructions.
2. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the diced bell pepper and red onion, and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. add the black beans, corn, chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper to the skillet. stir well and cook for another 3-4 minutes until heated through.
4. in a separate bowl, combine the avocado slices with lime juice and a pinch of salt.
5. to assemble the burrito bowls, divide the cooked rice evenly among four bowls. top each bowl with the black bean and vegetable mixture, cherry tomatoes, and avocado slices.
6. add any optional toppings such as shredded lettuce, chopped cilantro, salsa, or greek yogurt.
7. serve immediately and enjoy your vegetarian burrito bowl with a taste of mexico!
