title: Spinach and Ricotta Stuffed Manicotti
raw_text: 56. Spinach and Ricotta Stuffed Manicotti - 450 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 8 manicotti shells 
- 2 cups of fresh spinach, chopped 
- 1 cup of ricotta cheese 
- 1/2 cup of grated parmesan cheese 
- 1 teaspoon of dried oregano 
- 1/2 teaspoon of garlic powder 
- 1/4 teaspoon of salt 
- 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper 
- 2 cups of marinara sauce 
- 1 cup of shredded mozzarella cheese
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c). 
2. cook the manicotti shells according to the package instructions, until al dente. drain and set aside. 
3. in a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped spinach, ricotta cheese, parmesan cheese, dried oregano, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper. mix well until all the ingredients are evenly incorporated. 
4. spoon the spinach and ricotta mixture into a piping bag or a plastic bag with the corner snipped off. 
5. take a manicotti shell and pipe the spinach and ricotta mixture into the shell, filling it completely. repeat with the remaining shells. 
6. spread a thin layer of marinara sauce on the bottom of a baking dish. arrange the stuffed manicotti shells in the dish. 
7. pour the remaining marinara sauce over the shells, making sure they are evenly coated. 
8. sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese over the top. 
9. cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake for 20 minutes. 
10. remove the foil and continue baking for an additional 10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly. 
11. let the stuffed manicotti cool for a few minutes before serving. 
12. enjoy your spinach and ricotta stuffed manicotti!
ingredients_list: manicotti, shell, fresh, spinach, ricotta, cheese, parmesan, cheese, dried, oregano, garlic, powder, salt, black, pepper, marinara, sauce, shredded, mozzarella, cheese

title: Mexican Rice Casserole
raw_text: 58. Mexican Rice Casserole - 350 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup long grain white rice
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 medium onion, diced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced
- 1 tablespoon chili powder
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional, for spiciness)
- 1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes, drained
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- 1 cup frozen corn kernels
- 1 cup black beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 cup shredded mexican blend cheese
- salt and pepper to taste
- chopped fresh cilantro for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cook the rice according to package instructions. set aside.
3. in a large oven-safe skillet or casserole dish, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
4. add the diced onion, bell pepper, garlic, and jalapeno pepper. sauté for about 5 minutes until the vegetables are soft.
5. stir in the chili powder, cumin, smoked paprika, and cayenne pepper (if using). cook for an additional 1 minute to toast the spices.
6. add the diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, frozen corn, and black beans to the skillet. stir well to combine.
7. bring the mixture to a simmer and let it cook for about 5 minutes.
8. stir in the cooked rice and season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. sprinkle the shredded mexican blend cheese evenly over the top of the mixture.
10. transfer the skillet or casserole dish to the preheated oven.
11. bake for 20-25 minutes until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
12. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
13. garnish with chopped fresh cilantro (optional) before serving.
14. serve hot and enjoy your mexican rice casserole!
ingredients_list: long, grain, white, rice, vegetable, onion, bell, pepper, clove, garlic, minced, jalapeno, pepper, seeded, minced, chili, powder, cumin, smoked, paprika, cayenne, pepper, spiciness, tomato, vegetable, broth, frozen, corn, kernel, black, bean, shredded, mexican, blend, cheese, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Fettuccine Alfredo
raw_text: 59. Fettuccine Alfredo - 500 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 400g fettuccine pasta (gluten)
- 4 cups heavy cream (dairy)
- 2 cups grated parmesan cheese (dairy)
- 4 tablespoons unsalted butter (dairy)
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. cook the fettuccine pasta according to the package instructions, until al dente. drain and set aside.
2. in a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
3. add the minced garlic and sauté for about 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
4. slowly pour in the heavy cream, stirring constantly to combine with the butter and garlic.
5. bring the cream mixture to a gentle simmer and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. gradually add the grated parmesan cheese to the cream mixture, stirring continuously until the cheese has melted completely and the sauce has thickened.
7. season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. add the cooked fettuccine pasta to the skillet and toss in the creamy sauce until well coated.
9. continue to cook for another 2-3 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
10. remove from heat and serve hot. enjoy your homemade fettuccine alfredo!
ingredients_list: fettuccine, pasta, gluten, cream, dairy, parmesan, cheese, dairy, unsalted, butter, dairy, clove, garlic, minced, salt, pepper, taste

title: Ratatouille Quinoa Bowl
raw_text: 64. Ratatouille Quinoa Bowl - 350 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains garlic (France)
ingredients:
here's the recipe for ratatouille quinoa bowl:

ingredients:
- 1 cup quinoa
- 2 cups water
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 eggplant, diced
- 1 zucchini, diced
- 1 yellow bell pepper, diced
- 1 red onion, diced
- 1 can crushed tomatoes (14 oz)
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. rinse the quinoa under cold water and drain.
2. in a medium saucepan, bring 2 cups of water to a boil. add the rinsed quinoa and reduce the heat to low. cover the saucepan and let it simmer for about 15-20 minutes or until the quinoa is cooked and the water is absorbed. fluff the quinoa with a fork and set aside.
3. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the minced garlic and sauté for about 1 minute until fragrant.
4. add the diced eggplant, zucchini, yellow bell pepper, and red onion to the skillet. cook for about 5-7 minutes or until the vegetables are slightly tender.
5. stir in the crushed tomatoes, dried basil, dried thyme, salt, and pepper. reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 10-15 minutes to allow the flavors to combine.
6. to serve, divide the cooked quinoa among four bowls. top each bowl with a generous portion of the ratatouille mixture.
7. garnish with fresh herbs or grated parmesan, if desired.
8. enjoy your delicious ratatouille quinoa bowl!

note: the nutritional information provided (350 calories/portion) is an estimate and may vary depending on the specific ingredients and quantities used.
ingredients_list: ratatouille, quinoa, quinoa, water, olive, clove, garlic, minced, eggplant, zucchini, yellow, bell, pepper, red, onion, tomato, dried, basil, dried, thyme, salt, pepper, taste

title: Roasted Vegetable and Goat Cheese Tart
raw_text: 66. Roasted Vegetable and Goat Cheese Tart - 450 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy (Various)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 sheet of store-bought puff pastry, thawed
- 1 medium-sized zucchini, sliced
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 yellow bell pepper, sliced
- 1 red onion, sliced
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 ounces of goat cheese, crumbled
- 2 tablespoons of fresh basil, chopped
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c). line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. place the sliced zucchini, red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, and red onion on the prepared baking sheet. drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. toss to coat the vegetables evenly.
3. roast the vegetables in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes or until they become tender and slightly charred. remove from the oven and let them cool slightly.
4. meanwhile, roll out the puff pastry sheet on a clean, lightly floured surface to fit a tart pan or a baking dish. press the rolled-out pastry into the pan or dish, making sure it covers the bottom and sides evenly. trim any excess pastry.
5. spread the roasted vegetables evenly over the puff pastry.
6. sprinkle crumbled goat cheese and chopped basil over the vegetables.
7. bake the tart in the oven for approximately 20-25 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown and the cheese has melted.
8. remove from the oven and allow it to cool for a few minutes before slicing into portions. serve warm.

enjoy your roasted vegetable and goat cheese tart!
ingredients_list: puff, pastry, thawed, zucchini, red, bell, pepper, yellow, bell, pepper, red, onion, olive, salt, pepper, taste, ounce, goat, cheese, fresh, basil

title: Aloo Gobi
raw_text: 67. Aloo Gobi - 300 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains turmeric (India)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 tbsp vegetable oil
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tsp ginger, grated
- 1 tsp turmeric powder
- 1 tsp cumin powder
- 1 tsp coriander powder
- 1/2 tsp red chili powder (adjust to taste)
- 1 large potato, diced into small cubes
- 1 small cauliflower, cut into florets
- salt to taste
- fresh cilantro/coriander leaves for garnish
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or pan over medium heat.
2. add the chopped onion and sauté until it becomes translucent.
3. add the minced garlic and grated ginger. cook for another minute until fragrant.
4. reduce the heat to low and add the turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and red chili powder. stir well to combine the spices with the onion mixture.
5. add the diced potatoes and cauliflower florets to the pan. stir everything together so that the spices coat the vegetables evenly.
6. cover the pan and let the vegetables cook for about 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally. if the pan becomes dry while cooking, you can sprinkle a little water to prevent burning.
7. once the potatoes and cauliflower are tender, remove the lid and increase the heat to medium-high. stir-fry for another 5 minutes or until the vegetables are lightly browned.
8. season the aloo gobi with salt to taste and remove from heat.
9. garnish with fresh cilantro/coriander leaves and serve hot.
10. enjoy your homemade aloo gobi!
ingredients_list: vegetable, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, turmeric, powder, cumin, powder, coriander, powder, red, chili, powder, taste, potato, cube, cauliflower, floret, salt, taste, fresh, cilantro, coriander, leaf, garnish

title: Mexican Street Corn Pasta Salad
raw_text: 72. Mexican Street Corn Pasta Salad - 350 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 ounces gluten-free pasta
- 2 ears of corn, husked
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1/4 cup mayonnaise
- 1/4 cup sour cream
- 1 tablespoon lime juice
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional for heat)
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
- 1/4 cup crumbled queso fresco (mexican cheese)
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. cook the gluten-free pasta according to package instructions. drain and set aside to cool.
2. heat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. brush the corn with olive oil and grill until charred in spots, turning occasionally, about 5-6 minutes. remove from the grill and let it cool slightly. then, cut the corn kernels off the cob and set aside.
3. in a small bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, sour cream, lime juice, chili powder, smoked paprika, and cayenne pepper (optional) until well combined. season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. in a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked pasta, grilled corn kernels, and chopped cilantro. pour the dressing over the pasta mixture and toss to coat evenly.
5. sprinkle crumbled queso fresco over the top of the salad.
6. serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve. enjoy!
ingredients_list: ounce, gluten, pasta, ear, corn, husked, olive, mayonnaise, sour, cream, lime, chili, powder, smoked, paprika, cayenne, pepper, fresh, cilantro, queso, fresco, mexican, cheese, salt, pepper, taste

title: Vegetable Bolognese
raw_text: 74. Vegetable Bolognese - 350 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 medium onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 carrot, finely chopped
- 1 celery stalk, finely chopped
- 1 red bell pepper, finely chopped
- 1 zucchini, finely chopped
- 1 cup of mushrooms, diced
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- 1 can (14 oz) of diced tomatoes
- 1 can (6 oz) of tomato paste
- 1 teaspoon of dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon of dried basil
- 1/2 teaspoon of dried thyme
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 servings of cooked spaghetti or pasta of your choice
- grated parmesan cheese (optional for serving)
preparation:
1. in a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
2. add the onions and garlic, and sauté until the onions become translucent.
3. add the carrots, celery, red bell pepper, zucchini, and mushrooms to the pot. cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables start to soften.
4. add the diced tomatoes, tomato paste, dried oregano, dried basil, dried thyme, salt, and pepper to the pot. stir well to combine all the ingredients.
5. reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 20-30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. while the sauce is simmering, cook the spaghetti or pasta according to the package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.
7. once the sauce is done simmering, adjust the seasoning if needed.
8. serve the vegetable bolognese sauce over the cooked spaghetti or pasta. sprinkle with grated parmesan cheese if desired.
9. enjoy your vegetable bolognese!

note: the calorie count may vary based on the specific brands and amounts of ingredients used.

title: Baked Falafel Bowl
raw_text: 75. Baked Falafel Bowl - 450 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (Middle East)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cans of chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1/4 cup packed fresh parsley leaves
- 1/4 cup packed fresh cilantro leaves
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- cooking spray

for the falafel bowl:
- 2 cups cooked quinoa
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1 cup diced cucumber
- 1/2 cup sliced red onion
- 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 1/4 cup plain greek yogurt
- juice of 1 lemon
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh parsley, for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c). 
2. in a food processor, combine the chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, cilantro, olive oil, flour, cumin, coriander, salt, and baking powder. pulse until well combined but still slightly chunky.
3. form the mixture into 16 equal-sized patties, about 2 inches in diameter. place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
4. spray the falafel patties with cooking spray to lightly coat them. this will help them get crispy while baking.
5. bake the falafel patties in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy on the outside.
6. while the falafel is baking, prepare the falafel bowl. in a bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, feta cheese, greek yogurt, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. stir well to combine.
7. once the falafel is ready, remove them from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
8. to serve, divide the falafel bowl mixture among four bowls. top each bowl with four falafel patties.
9. garnish with fresh parsley and serve immediately. enjoy your delicious baked falafel bowl!
ingredients_list: can, chickpea, onion, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, parsley, leaf, fresh, cilantro, leaf, olive, flour, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, salt, baking, powder, spray, falafel, quinoa, cherry, tomato, halved, cucumber, red, onion, feta, cheese, plain, greek, yogurt, lemon, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Thai Green Curry with Vegetables
raw_text: 76. Thai Green Curry with Vegetables - 400 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains garlic (Thailand)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons thai green curry paste
- 1 onion, sliced
- 1 bell pepper, sliced
- 1 zucchini, sliced
- 1 cup broccoli florets
- 1 cup snap peas
- 1 cup mushrooms, sliced
- 1 can coconut milk
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon fish sauce (optional)
- 1 tablespoon brown sugar
- fresh basil leaves, for garnish
- cooked jasmine rice, for serving
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large pan or wok over medium heat.
2. add the minced garlic and sauté for a minute until fragrant.
3. stir in the thai green curry paste and cook for another minute.
4. add the sliced onion, bell pepper, zucchini, broccoli, snap peas, and mushrooms to the pan and stir-fry for about 5 minutes until they start to soften.
5. pour in the coconut milk and vegetable broth. stir in the soy sauce, fish sauce (if using), and brown sugar. bring the mixture to a simmer and let it cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. taste and adjust the seasoning if needed.
7. serve the thai green curry over cooked jasmine rice and garnish with fresh basil leaves.
8. enjoy your delicious thai green curry with vegetables!
meal_type: the meal type of this recipe is vegetarian.

title: Mediterranean Roasted Vegetable Quiche
raw_text: 81. Mediterranean Roasted Vegetable Quiche - 450 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy (Various)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pre-made pie crust (store-bought or homemade)
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 yellow bell pepper, sliced
- 1 small eggplant, diced
- 1 zucchini, sliced
- 1 red onion, thinly sliced
- 4 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- salt and black pepper to taste
- 4 large eggs
- 1 cup milk (dairy or non-dairy)
- 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese (or any cheese of your choice)
- fresh basil leaves for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c). place the pie crust in a pie dish and set aside.
2. in a large baking sheet, combine the sliced bell peppers, diced eggplant, zucchini, red onion, and minced garlic.
3. drizzle olive oil over the vegetables and sprinkle with dried oregano, dried basil, salt, and black pepper. toss to coat the vegetables evenly.
4. roast the vegetables in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes or until they are tender and slightly browned. remove from the oven and let them cool slightly.
5. reduce the oven temperature to 350°f (180°c).
6. in a mixing bowl, whisk together eggs and milk until well combined. season with salt and black pepper.
7. place the roasted vegetables on top of the prepared pie crust. sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese over the vegetables.
8. pour the egg mixture over the vegetables, making sure it is evenly distributed.
9. bake the quiche in the preheated oven for about 30-35 minutes or until the center is set and the top is golden brown.
10. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing. garnish with fresh basil leaves.
11. serve the mediterranean roasted vegetable quiche warm or at room temperature for a delicious lunch or dinner option. enjoy!
ingredients_list: pie, crust, red, bell, pepper, yellow, bell, pepper, eggplant, zucchini, red, onion, thinly, clove, garlic, minced, olive, dried, oregano, dried, basil, salt, black, pepper, taste, egg, milk, dairy, dairy, feta, cheese, cheese, fresh, basil, leaf, garnish

title: Vegetable Jalfrezi
raw_text: 84. Vegetable Jalfrezi - 400 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains garlic (India)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 medium onion, sliced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 green bell pepper, sliced
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 yellow bell pepper, sliced
- 1 medium carrot, thinly sliced
- 1 cup frozen peas
- 1 cup diced tomatoes
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon chili powder (adjust to desired spiciness)
- salt to taste
- fresh cilantro, chopped for garnish
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large pan or wok over medium heat.
2. add the sliced onion and minced garlic to the pan. sauté for about 2-3 minutes until the onion becomes translucent.
3. add the sliced bell peppers and carrot to the pan. stir-fry for another 4-5 minutes until the vegetables start to soften.
4. add the frozen peas and diced tomatoes to the pan. cook for another 2-3 minutes until the tomatoes release their juices.
5. in a small bowl, mix together the ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder, paprika, chili powder, and salt. add this spice mixture to the pan and stir well to coat all the vegetables.
6. reduce the heat to low and let the jalfrezi simmer for about 5 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
7. taste and adjust the seasoning if needed.
8. garnish with fresh chopped cilantro.
9. serve the vegetable jalfrezi hot with rice or naan bread. enjoy!
ingredients_list: vegetable, onion, clove, garlic, minced, green, bell, pepper, red, bell, pepper, yellow, bell, pepper, carrot, thinly, frozen, pea, tomato, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, turmeric, powder, paprika, chili, powder, spiciness, salt, taste, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Phyllo Triangles
raw_text: 86. Spinach and Feta Stuffed Phyllo Triangles - 300 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy (Greece)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 sheets of phyllo dough
- 2 cups of fresh spinach, washed and chopped
- 1 cup of crumbled feta cheese
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1/4 cup of melted butter
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
3. add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the skillet, sauté until they become translucent and fragrant.
4. add the chopped spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted. season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. remove the skillet from heat and let the spinach mixture cool for a few minutes.
6. in a bowl, combine the spinach mixture with the crumbled feta cheese. mix well.
7. lay a sheet of phyllo dough on a clean surface and brush it lightly with melted butter.
8. place another sheet of phyllo dough on top of the first one and brush it with melted butter as well.
9. cut the phyllo dough into 4 equal squares.
10. spoon a small amount of the spinach and feta mixture onto one corner of each square.
11. fold the phyllo dough over the filling to form a triangle and continue folding until you reach the end of the sheet.
12. place the stuffed phyllo triangles on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
13. repeat steps 7-12 until all the phyllo dough and filling are used.
14. brush the tops of the stuffed triangles with melted butter.
15. bake in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the phyllo dough turns golden brown and crispy.
16. remove from the oven and let them cool slightly before serving.
17. serve warm as an appetizer or snack. enjoy!
ingredients_list: sheet, phyllo, dough, fresh, spinach, washed, feta, cheese, onion, clove, garlic, minced, olive, salt, pepper, taste, butter

title: Caprese Quinoa Bowl
raw_text: 88. Caprese Quinoa Bowl - 400 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains dairy (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup quinoa
- 2 cups water
- 2 cups cherry tomatoes, halved
- 8 ounces fresh mozzarella, diced
- 1/4 cup fresh basil leaves, chopped
- 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar
- 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. rinse the quinoa under cold water to remove any bitterness.
2. in a medium saucepan, bring the water to a boil. add the quinoa and reduce heat to low. cover and simmer for about 15-20 minutes or until all the water is absorbed. remove from heat and let it cool slightly.
3. in a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, cherry tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and chopped basil leaves.
4. in a small bowl, whisk together the balsamic vinegar, extra virgin olive oil, salt, and pepper.
5. pour the dressing over the quinoa mixture and toss gently to combine all the ingredients.
6. divide the caprese quinoa mixture into separate bowls, and serve immediately.

enjoy the delicious and nutritious caprese quinoa bowl!
ingredients_list: quinoa, water, cherry, tomato, halved, ounce, fresh, mozzarella, fresh, basil, leaf, balsamic, vinegar, virgin, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Vegetable Stroganoff
raw_text: 89. Vegetable Stroganoff - 450 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy (Russia)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 green bell pepper, sliced
- 8 ounces mushrooms, sliced
- 1 zucchini, sliced
- 1 can (14 ounces) diced tomatoes
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- 1 tablespoon tomato paste
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/2 cup sour cream (dairy)
- 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour (gluten)
- 12 ounces egg noodles (gluten)
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. add the chopped onion and minced garlic, and sauté for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.

2. add the sliced bell peppers, mushrooms, and zucchini to the skillet. cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are slightly softened.

3. in a small bowl, combine the sour cream and flour until well combined. set aside.

4. add the diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, tomato paste, paprika, dried thyme, salt, and black pepper to the skillet. stir well to combine. bring the mixture to a simmer and let it cook for about 10 minutes, until the vegetables are tender.

5. meanwhile, cook the egg noodles according to the package instructions. drain and set aside.

6. slowly add the sour cream-flour mixture to the skillet, stirring constantly. cook for an additional 3-4 minutes until the sauce thickens.

7. serve the vegetable stroganoff over the cooked egg noodles. garnish with fresh herbs, if desired.

enjoy your delicious vegetable stroganoff!

title: Greek Tabbouleh Salad
raw_text: 90. Greek Tabbouleh Salad - 250 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (Greece)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup bulgur wheat
- 2 cups water
- 1 medium cucumber, diced
- 4 roma tomatoes, diced
- 1/2 red onion, finely chopped
- 1/2 cup fresh parsley, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup fresh mint leaves, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
preparation:
1. in a medium-sized saucepan, bring the water to a boil. add the bulgur wheat and reduce heat to low. simmer for about 10-15 minutes or until the wheat is tender. remove from heat and let it cool.

2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the cooled bulgur wheat, diced cucumber, diced tomatoes, chopped red onion, parsley, and mint leaves.

3. in a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and black pepper. pour the dressing over the salad mixture and toss gently to combine.

4. sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese on top of the salad.

5. let the greek tabbouleh salad sit at room temperature for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.

6. serve the salad chilled or at room temperature and enjoy!

title: Spinach and Ricotta Stuffed Shells with Alfredo Sauce
raw_text: 91. Spinach and Ricotta Stuffed Shells with Alfredo Sauce - 500 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 16 jumbo pasta shells
- 2 cups fresh baby spinach, chopped
- 1 cup ricotta cheese
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 cups store-bought alfredo sauce
- 1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c).
2. cook the jumbo pasta shells according to the package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.
3. in a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped spinach, ricotta cheese, parmesan cheese, dried oregano, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper. mix well until all ingredients are thoroughly combined.
4. stuff each cooked pasta shell with a generous amount of the spinach and ricotta mixture. place the stuffed shells in a greased baking dish.
5. pour the alfredo sauce evenly over the stuffed shells, covering them completely.
6. sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese on top.
7. cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.
8. remove the foil and continue baking for an additional 5-10 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. once cooked, remove from the oven and let the stuffed shells cool for a few minutes before serving.
10. serve the spinach and ricotta stuffed shells with alfredo sauce hot and enjoy!

note: please be sure to check the labels of the store-bought alfredo sauce for gluten and dairy content or consider making your own homemade sauce.
ingredients_list: pasta, shell, fresh, baby, spinach, ricotta, cheese, parmesan, cheese, dried, oregano, garlic, powder, salt, black, pepper, alfredo, sauce, shredded, mozzarella, cheese

title: Vegetable Biryani Casserole
raw_text: 94. Vegetable Biryani Casserole - 450 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains nuts (India)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup basmati rice
- 2 cups water
- 1 tbsp ghee or vegetable oil
- 1 onion, thinly sliced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1-inch piece ginger, grated
- 1 small carrot, diced
- 1 small bell pepper, diced
- 1 cup cauliflower florets
- 1 cup green peas
- 1 tsp turmeric powder
- 1 tsp cumin powder
- 1 tsp coriander powder
- 1/2 tsp chili powder
- 1/4 cup cashews, chopped
- 1/4 cup raisins
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- salt to taste
- fresh cilantro for garnish
preparation:
1. rinse the basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear, then drain.
2. in a medium-sized pot, bring the water to a boil, then add the rinsed rice. cook until the rice is about 70% cooked, around 7-8 minutes. drain and set aside.
3. in a large casserole dish or oven-safe skillet, heat the ghee or oil over medium heat.
4. add the sliced onion and sauté until golden brown.
5. stir in the minced garlic and grated ginger, cooking for another minute.
6. add the diced carrot, bell pepper, cauliflower, and green peas to the casserole, stirring well to combine.
7. add the turmeric, cumin, coriander, and chili powder. mix everything together until the vegetables are coated with the spices.
8. stir in the cashews and raisins, reserving some for garnish.
9. add the partially cooked rice to the casserole dish, spreading it evenly over the vegetables.
10. pour the vegetable broth over the rice and vegetables, and season with salt to taste.
11. cover the casserole dish with a lid or aluminum foil, and place it in a preheated oven at 350°f (180°c) for 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is fully cooked and the flavors have melded together.
12. once the biryani is done, remove it from the oven and let it sit for a few minutes before fluffing it with a fork.
13. serve the vegetable biryani casserole garnished with the remaining cashews, raisins, and fresh cilantro. enjoy!
ingredients_list: basmati, rice, water, ghee, vegetable, onion, thinly, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, carrot, bell, pepper, cauliflower, floret, green, pea, turmeric, powder, cumin, powder, coriander, powder, chili, powder, cashew, raisin, vegetable, broth, salt, taste, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Spinach and Artichoke Dip Stuffed Bread
raw_text: 95. Spinach and Artichoke Dip Stuffed Bread - 350 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy (United States)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 loaf of italian bread
- 1 cup fresh spinach, chopped
- 1 cup canned artichoke hearts, chopped
- 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/2 cup mayonnaise
- 1/4 cup sour cream
- 1/4 cup cream cheese
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 teaspoon dried basil
- 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. slice the top off the loaf of italian bread and set it aside. hollow out the inside of the bread, leaving about a 1-inch thick shell.
3. in a bowl, combine the chopped spinach, artichoke hearts, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese, mayonnaise, sour cream, cream cheese, minced garlic, dried basil, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. mix until well combined.
4. spoon the spinach and artichoke mixture into the hollowed-out bread loaf, pressing it down gently.
5. place the reserved bread top back on the loaf.
6. wrap the entire bread loaf in aluminum foil, leaving the top slightly exposed.
7. bake the stuffed bread in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before unwrapping.
9. slice and serve warm. enjoy!
ingredients_list: loaf, italian, bread, fresh, spinach, canned, artichoke, heart, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, parmesan, cheese, mayonnaise, sour, cream, cream, cheese, clove, garlic, minced, dried, basil, dried, oregano, salt, pepper, taste

title: Mexican Zucchini Boats
raw_text: 96. Mexican Zucchini Boats - 250 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains cheese (Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 medium zucchinis 
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1/2 onion, diced 
- 2 cloves garlic, minced 
- 1/2 bell pepper, diced 
- 1 jalapeno pepper, minced 
- 1 teaspoon cumin 
- 1 teaspoon chili powder 
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika 
- 1/2 teaspoon salt 
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper 
- 1 cup cooked quinoa 
- 1 cup black beans, rinsed and drained 
- 1 cup corn kernels 
- 1 cup salsa 
- 1 cup shredded mexican cheese blend 
- fresh cilantro, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c). 
2. cut the zucchinis in half lengthwise and scoop out the insides, leaving about a 1/4 inch thick shell. place the hollowed zucchini boats on a baking sheet. 
3. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the onions and garlic, and cook until they soften, about 3 minutes. 
4. add the bell pepper, jalapeno pepper, cumin, chili powder, paprika, salt, and black pepper to the skillet. stir well and cook for another 2 minutes. 
5. add the cooked quinoa, black beans, corn, and salsa to the skillet. mix everything together and cook for an additional 3 minutes. 
6. spoon the filling mixture evenly into the hollowed zucchini boats. 
7. sprinkle the shredded mexican cheese on top of each zucchini boat. 
8. bake the zucchini boats in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the zucchini is tender and the cheese is melted and bubbly. 
9. remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes. 
10. garnish with fresh chopped cilantro before serving. enjoy your mexican zucchini boats!
ingredients_list: zucchini, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, bell, pepper, jalapeno, pepper, minced, cumin, chili, powder, paprika, salt, black, pepper, quinoa, black, bean, corn, kernel, salsa, shredded, mexican, cheese, blend, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Greek Chickpea Patties
raw_text: 97. Greek Chickpea Patties - 300 calories/portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (Greece)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cans of chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1/2 cup breadcrumbs (gluten-containing)
- 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 tablespoons olive oil, for cooking
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, mash the chickpeas with a fork or a potato masher until they're mostly broken down.
2. add the chopped onion, minced garlic, breadcrumbs, parsley, dried oregano, ground cumin, salt, and black pepper to the bowl. mix well to combine all the ingredients.
3. divide the mixture into 4 equal portions and shape them into patties using your hands.
4. heat the olive oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat.
5. place the chickpea patties in the pan and cook for about 4-5 minutes on each side, or until they become golden brown and crispy.
6. once cooked, transfer the patties to a plate lined with paper towels to drain any excess oil.
7. serve the greek chickpea patties hot with a side salad or in a pita bread as a sandwich.

enjoy your greek chickpea patties!
ingredients_list: can, chickpea, onion, clove, garlic, minced, breadcrumb, gluten, containing, fresh, parsley, dried, oregano, ground, cumin, salt, black, pepper, olive

title: Chickpea and vegetable stir
raw_text: 7. Chickpea and vegetable stir-fry - 300 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains soy (Middle East)
ingredients:
here's a recipe for chickpea and vegetable stir-fry:

ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 onion, thinly sliced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 zucchini, thinly sliced
- 1 cup sliced mushrooms
- 1 can chickpeas, rinsed and drained
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh cilantro, for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. add the sliced onion and minced garlic to the skillet and sauté for 2-3 minutes, until fragrant.
3. add the red bell pepper, zucchini, and mushrooms to the skillet. stir-fry for 5 minutes or until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
4. in a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, ground cumin, ground coriander, paprika, salt, and pepper.
5. pour the soy sauce mixture over the vegetables in the skillet. stir to coat the vegetables evenly.
6. add the rinsed and drained chickpeas to the skillet and stir-fry for an additional 2-3 minutes, until heated through.
7. taste and adjust the seasoning if needed.
8. serve the chickpea and vegetable stir-fry hot, garnished with fresh cilantro (if desired).

each portion of this chickpea and vegetable stir-fry contains approximately 300 calories. it's a flavorful middle eastern-inspired dish that is both nutritious and delicious!
cuisine: The cuisine type of this recipe is: Stir-Fry
ingredients_list: chickpea, vegetable, olive, onion, thinly, clove, garlic, minced, red, bell, pepper, thinly, zucchini, thinly, mushroom, chickpea, soy, sauce, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, paprika, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Sweet potato and black bean tacos
raw_text: 8. Sweet potato and black bean tacos - 350 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 small sweet potatoes
- 1 can of black beans, drained and rinsed
- 1 red onion, diced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- salt and pepper to taste
- 8 small gluten-free tortillas
- optional toppings: avocado, salsa, shredded lettuce, lime wedges
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c). line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. wash and peel the sweet potatoes, then cut them into small cubes.
3. in a large bowl, toss the sweet potato cubes with olive oil, cumin, chili powder, paprika, salt, and pepper until well coated.
4. spread the seasoned sweet potatoes in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. bake for about 20-25 minutes or until the sweet potatoes are tender and slightly crispy.
5. meanwhile, heat a tablespoon of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. add the diced red onion and minced garlic and sauté until the onions become translucent.
6. add the drained and rinsed black beans to the skillet with the onion and garlic mixture. stir well and cook for a few minutes until heated through. season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. warm the gluten-free tortillas according to the instructions on the package.
8. assemble the tacos by placing a spoonful of the sweet potato cubes and black bean mixture onto each tortilla. add optional toppings such as avocado slices, salsa, shredded lettuce, or a squeeze of lime juice.
9. serve the sweet potato and black bean tacos immediately and enjoy!

note: make sure to check the labels of the tortillas and other ingredients to ensure they are gluten-free. adjust the seasoning or add your favorite spices to suit your taste preferences.
ingredients_list: sweet, potato, black, bean, red, onion, clove, garlic, minced, olive, ground, cumin, chili, powder, paprika, salt, pepper, taste, gluten, tortilla, topping, avocado, salsa, shredded, lettuce, lime, wedge

title: Spinach and mushroom quesadillas
raw_text: 12. Spinach and mushroom quesadillas - 350 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy and gluten (Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 whole wheat tortillas
- 2 cups spinach, chopped
- 1 cup mushrooms, sliced
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. add the diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet and sauté until the onion becomes translucent.
3. add the sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook until they are soft and slightly browned.
4. add the chopped spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted. season with salt and pepper to taste. remove from heat and set aside.
5. place a tortilla on a clean surface and sprinkle some shredded mozzarella cheese evenly over the tortilla.
6. spoon a generous amount of the spinach and mushroom mixture onto one half of the tortilla.
7. fold the other half of the tortilla over the filling to create a half-moon shape.
8. repeat steps 5-7 for the remaining tortillas.
9. heat a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat and brush with some olive oil.
10. place the quesadillas in the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until the tortilla becomes crisp and the cheese is melted.
11. remove the quesadillas from the skillet and let them cool for a minute or two before cutting them into wedges.
12. serve hot and enjoy your spinach and mushroom quesadillas!
ingredients_list: whole, wheat, tortilla, spinach, mushroom, onion, clove, garlic, minced, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Panzanella salad
raw_text: 13. Panzanella salad - 250 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 cups of stale bread, cubed
- 2 cups of tomatoes, diced
- 1 cup of cucumber, diced
- 1/2 cup of red onion, thinly sliced
- 1/4 cup of fresh basil leaves, torn
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1/4 cup of extra virgin olive oil
- 2 tablespoons of red wine vinegar
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. spread the bread cubes on a baking sheet and toast them in the oven for about 10-15 minutes, until they become crispy. set aside to cool.
3. in a large mixing bowl, combine the tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, basil leaves, and garlic.
4. in a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, salt, and pepper. drizzle this dressing over the vegetable mixture and toss gently to coat.
5. add the toasted bread cubes to the bowl with the vegetables and toss again, ensuring the bread soaks up some of the dressing.
6. allow the salad to sit for about 15 minutes to let the flavors meld together.
7. serve the panzanella salad in individual portions, making sure each portion contains about 250 calories.
8. enjoy your homemade italian panzanella salad!

note: as this recipe contains gluten, it may not be suitable for individuals with gluten intolerance or celiac disease.
ingredients_list: bread, tomato, cucumber, red, onion, thinly, fresh, basil, leaf, torn, clove, garlic, minced, virgin, olive, red, wine, vinegar, salt, pepper, taste

title: Falafel with tahini sauce
raw_text: 15. Falafel with tahini sauce - 200 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (Middle East)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup dried chickpeas
- 1 small onion, roughly chopped
- 4 cloves of garlic
- 1/2 cup fresh parsley, roughly chopped
- 1/2 cup fresh cilantro, roughly chopped
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour (gluten-containing)
- salt to taste
- vegetable oil for frying

for the tahini sauce:
- 1/4 cup tahini paste
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons water
- 1 clove of garlic, minced
- salt to taste
preparation:
1. rinse the dried chickpeas and place them in a bowl. cover with water and let them soak overnight.
2. drain the chickpeas and transfer them to a food processor.
3. add the onion, garlic, parsley, cilantro, cumin, coriander, baking soda, flour, and salt to the food processor.
4. process the mixture until everything is well combined and forms a coarse paste. do not over process; the mixture should still have some texture.
5. transfer the mixture to a bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to firm up.
6. while the mixture is chilling, prepare the tahini sauce. in a small bowl, whisk together the tahini paste, lemon juice, water, minced garlic, and salt. adjust the consistency by adding more water if needed. set aside.
7. after the chilling time, shape the chickpea mixture into small patties or balls, about 1 1/2 inches in diameter.
8. in a large frying pan, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. add the falafel patties or balls and fry until golden brown and crispy on all sides. work in batches if necessary.
9. once cooked, transfer the falafel onto a plate lined with paper towels to absorb excess oil.
10. serve the falafel hot with the tahini sauce on the side. enjoy your middle eastern falafel with tahini sauce!
ingredients_list: dried, chickpea, onion, clove, garlic, fresh, parsley, fresh, cilantro, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, baking, soda, flour, gluten, containing, salt, taste, vegetable, tahini, sauce, tahini, paste, lemon, water, clove, garlic, minced, salt, taste

title: Veggie stir
raw_text: 18. Veggie stir-fried noodles - 300 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (China)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 oz (225g) dried egg noodles (gluten-containing)
- 2 tbsp vegetable oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 red onion, thinly sliced
- 1 medium carrot, julienned
- 1 small bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 cup broccoli florets
- 1 cup snap peas, trimmed
- 1 cup cabbage, shredded
- 2 tbsp soy sauce (gluten-containing)
- 1 tbsp oyster sauce (gluten-containing)
- 1/2 tsp sesame oil
- 1/4 tsp black pepper
- optional toppings: sliced green onions, sesame seeds
preparation:
1. cook the egg noodles according to the package instructions. drain and set aside.
2. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
3. add the minced garlic and sliced red onion to the skillet and sauté for 2-3 minutes until fragrant and slightly softened.
4. add the julienned carrot, sliced bell pepper, broccoli florets, snap peas, and shredded cabbage to the skillet. stir-fry for 5-6 minutes until the vegetables are slightly tender.
5. in a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, and black pepper.
6. add the cooked noodles to the skillet and pour the sauce mixture over them. stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes until the noodles are well coated and heated through.
7. remove from heat and transfer the stir-fried noodles to serving plates.
8. garnish with sliced green onions and sesame seeds if desired.
9. serve hot and enjoy your veggie stir-fried noodles!
ingredients_list: dried, egg, noodle, gluten, containing, vegetable, clove, garlic, minced, red, onion, thinly, carrot, bell, pepper, thinly, broccoli, floret, pea, cabbage, shredded, soy, sauce, gluten, containing, oyster, sauce, gluten, containing, sesame, black, pepper, topping, green, onion, sesame, seed

title: Butternut squash and lentil curry
raw_text: 24. Butternut squash and lentil curry - 350 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains nuts (India)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
- 1 cup red lentils
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1-inch piece of ginger, grated
- 1 tablespoon curry powder
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional, adjust to taste)
- 1 can (400ml) coconut milk
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1/4 cup chopped cashews (or any other nuts of your choice)
- fresh cilantro, chopped
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. add onions, garlic, and ginger. sauté until the onions are translucent and fragrant.
2. add the curry powder, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and cayenne pepper, if using. stir well to coat the onions and spices.
3. add the cubed butternut squash and red lentils to the pot. stir to combine everything.
4. pour in the coconut milk and vegetable broth to the pot. stir well and bring the mixture to a boil.
5. reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let the curry simmer for about 20-25 minutes or until the lentils and butternut squash are tender.
6. while the curry is simmering, toast the chopped cashews in a dry skillet over medium heat until lightly golden. set aside.
7. once the curry is cooked, season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. serve the butternut squash and lentil curry in bowls. sprinkle with toasted cashews and fresh cilantro.
9. enjoy your delicious butternut squash and lentil curry!
ingredients_list: butternut, seeded, red, lentil, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, curry, powder, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, turmeric, cayenne, pepper, taste, coconut, milk, vegetable, broth, olive, cashew, nut, fresh, cilantro, salt, pepper, taste

title: Veggie fajitas
raw_text: 25. Veggie fajitas - 250 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 bell pepper, sliced
- 1 onion, sliced
- 1 zucchini, sliced
- 1 cup sliced mushrooms
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- 8 small flour tortillas (gluten-containing)
- optional toppings: salsa, guacamole, sour cream
preparation:
1. heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. add bell pepper, onion, zucchini, and mushrooms to the skillet. cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are slightly softened.
3. sprinkle chili powder, ground cumin, garlic powder, salt, and pepper over the vegetables. stir well to evenly coat the veggies with the spices. cook for another 3-4 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
4. warm the flour tortillas in a separate skillet or the microwave according to the package instructions.
5. divide the vegetable mixture evenly among the tortillas, spooning it down the center of each tortilla.
6. if desired, top with salsa, guacamole, and/or sour cream.
7. roll up the tortillas, tucking in the sides as you go.
8. serve the veggie fajitas warm and enjoy your delicious mexican-style dish!

note: the calorie count of this recipe is approximate and may vary depending on the specific ingredients used.

title: Caprese tortellini skillet
raw_text: 28. Caprese tortellini skillet - 400 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 ounces of tortellini (gluten-containing)
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 pint of cherry tomatoes, halved
- 8 ounces of fresh mozzarella, diced (dairy-containing)
- 1/4 cup of fresh basil leaves, torn
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. cook the tortellini according to the package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.
2. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the minced garlic and sauté for about 1 minute until fragrant.
3. add the cherry tomatoes to the skillet and cook for about 3-4 minutes, until slightly softened.
4. add the cooked tortellini to the skillet and toss gently to combine with the tomatoes. cook for an additional 2 minutes to heat through.
5. stir in the diced mozzarella and torn basil leaves. season with salt and pepper to taste. cook for another minute to melt the cheese slightly.
6. remove from heat and divide the caprese tortellini skillet into four portions.
7. serve hot and enjoy your delicious caprese tortellini skillet!
ingredients_list: ounce, tortellini, gluten, containing, olive, clove, garlic, minced, pint, cherry, tomato, halved, ounce, fresh, mozzarella, dairy, containing, fresh, basil, leaf, torn, salt, pepper, taste

title: Feta and spinach stuffed tomatoes
raw_text: 29. Feta and spinach stuffed tomatoes - 150 calories per portion, 6 portions, contains dairy (Greece)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 6 tomatoes
- 200g feta cheese
- 200g spinach leaves
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 180°c (350°f).
2. cut the top of each tomato and scoop out the insides with a small spoon to create a hollow cavity. keep the scooped-out tomato flesh for later use.
3. place the hollowed tomatoes on a baking dish.
4. in a pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
5. add the minced garlic and cook for about a minute until it becomes fragrant.
6. add the spinach leaves to the pan and sauté until wilted, around 3-4 minutes.
7. crumble the feta cheese into small pieces and add it to the spinach mixture. stir well until the cheese is evenly distributed.
8. season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
9. fill each tomato cavity with the feta and spinach mixture, pressing down gently to compact it.
10. place the filled tomatoes back onto the baking dish.
11. chop the scooped-out tomato flesh and divide it among the filled tomatoes, sprinkling it on top.
12. bake the stuffed tomatoes in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the tomatoes are softened and the cheese is slightly browned.
13. remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.
14. enjoy your delicious feta and spinach stuffed tomatoes from greece!
ingredients_list: tomato, feta, cheese, spinach, leaf, olive, clove, garlic, minced, salt, pepper, taste

title: Tofu and vegetable kabobs
raw_text: 31. Tofu and vegetable kabobs - 250 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains soy
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 1 package of firm tofu, cut into cubes
- 1 red bell pepper, cut into chunks
- 1 yellow bell pepper, cut into chunks
- 1 zucchini, sliced
- 1 red onion, cut into wedges
- 8 cherry tomatoes
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. in a bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
3. add the tofu cubes to the marinade and let them marinate for 10-15 minutes.
4. thread the marinated tofu, bell peppers, zucchini, red onion, and cherry tomatoes onto skewers.
5. brush the vegetable kabobs with any remaining marinade.
6. place the kabobs on the grill and cook for about 8-10 minutes, or until the tofu is lightly browned and the vegetables are tender, turning occasionally.
7. once cooked, remove the kabobs from the grill and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.
8. serve the tofu and vegetable kabobs hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: tofu, cube, red, bell, pepper, yellow, bell, pepper, zucchini, red, onion, wedge, cherry, tomato, soy, sauce, olive, lemon, salt, pepper, taste

title: Curried vegetable couscous
raw_text: 33. Curried vegetable couscous - 350 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 carrots, diced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 zucchini, diced
- 1 cup cauliflower florets
- 1 cup broccoli florets
- 2 teaspoons curry powder
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- 1 cup couscous
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat.
2. add the diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet and sauté until they become fragrant and slightly softened.
3. add the diced carrots, red bell pepper, zucchini, cauliflower, and broccoli to the skillet and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. stir in the curry powder, turmeric, and ground cumin, making sure the vegetables are evenly coated with the spices.
5. pour in the vegetable broth and bring the mixture to a boil. reduce the heat and let it simmer for about 10 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
6. while the vegetables are simmering, prepare the couscous according to the package instructions.
7. once the couscous is cooked, fluff it with a fork and add it to the vegetable mixture in the skillet. stir well to combine all the ingredients.
8. season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. divide the curried vegetable couscous into four portions and serve hot.

each portion of this curried vegetable couscous recipe contains approximately 350 calories.

title: Mushroom and spinach lasagna
raw_text: 34. Mushroom and spinach lasagna - 400 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 9 lasagna noodles
- 2 cups sliced mushrooms
- 2 cups spinach, chopped
- 1 cup ricotta cheese
- 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon dried basil
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 cups marinara sauce
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cook the lasagna noodles according to the instructions on the package. drain and set aside.
3. in a large skillet, sauté the mushrooms over medium heat until they release their liquid and start to brown. add the minced garlic and cook for an additional minute.
4. add the chopped spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted. remove from heat and set aside.
5. in a separate bowl, mix together the ricotta cheese, oregano, basil, salt, and black pepper.
6. spread a thin layer of marinara sauce on the bottom of a 9x9-inch baking dish.
7. place 3 lasagna noodles over the sauce, covering the bottom of the dish.
8. spread half of the ricotta cheese mixture over the noodles.
9. top with half of the mushroom and spinach mixture.
10. sprinkle half of the mozzarella and parmesan cheese over the vegetables.
11. repeat the layering process with 3 more lasagna noodles, remaining ricotta cheese mixture, remaining mushroom and spinach mixture, and remaining cheeses.
12. finish with a final layer of 3 lasagna noodles, remaining marinara sauce, and a sprinkle of mozzarella and parmesan cheese.
13. cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for 25 minutes.
14. remove the foil and bake for an additional 10 minutes, or until the cheese is bubbly and golden.
15. let the lasagna cool for a few minutes before serving. enjoy your delicious mushroom and spinach lasagna!
ingredients_list: lasagna, noodle, mushroom, spinach, ricotta, cheese, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, parmesan, cheese, clove, garlic, minced, dried, oregano, dried, basil, salt, black, pepper, marinara, sauce

title: Vegetarian bibimbap
raw_text: 35. Vegetarian bibimbap - 350 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and soy (Korea)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 cups cooked short-grain rice
- 1 cup sliced carrots
- 1 cup shredded zucchini
- 1 cup sliced mushrooms
- 1 cup bean sprouts
- 1 cup spinach
- 1 cup sliced cucumber
- 4 fried eggs
- 4 tablespoons soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons sesame oil
- 2 tablespoons gochujang (korean red chili paste)
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- salt, to taste
- optional toppings: toasted sesame seeds, sliced green onions
preparation:
1. cook the short-grain rice according to package instructions or using a rice cooker.
2. in a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. add carrots and sauté for 2 minutes.
3. add zucchini and mushrooms to the skillet and sauté for an additional 2 minutes until slightly tender.
4. in a separate skillet, cook bean sprouts in salted boiling water for 1-2 minutes. drain and set aside.
5. using the same boiling water, blanch the spinach for about 30 seconds. drain and rinse with cold water. squeeze out excess water and set aside.
6. place cucumber slices in a bowl and sprinkle with salt. let sit for 10 minutes, then squeeze out excess moisture.
7. in a small bowl, mix together soy sauce, sesame oil, and gochujang to make the sauce.
8. divide the cooked rice among 4 bowls. arrange the sautéed vegetables, bean sprouts, spinach, and cucumber on top of the rice.
9. heat a small amount of vegetable oil in a skillet and fry the eggs to desired doneness.
10. place a fried egg on top of each bowl of bibimbap.
11. drizzle the sauce over the bibimbap and sprinkle with optional toppings such as toasted sesame seeds and sliced green onions.
12. to eat, mix all the ingredients together in the bowl, ensuring the sauce is evenly distributed.
13. serve hot and enjoy your vegetarian bibimbap!
ingredients_list: short, grain, rice, carrot, shredded, zucchini, mushroom, bean, sprout, spinach, cucumber, egg, soy, sauce, sesame, gochujang, korean, red, chili, paste, vegetable, salt, taste, topping, toasted, sesame, seed, green, onion

title: Chana masala
raw_text: 38. Chana masala - 300 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains nuts (India)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups cooked chickpeas
- 1 large onion, finely chopped
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1-inch piece of ginger, grated
- 2 tomatoes, pureed
- 1/2 cup tomato paste
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (adjust to taste)
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1/2 cup water
- salt to taste
- 1/4 cup chopped cilantro (coriander leaves)
- optional: 1/4 cup chopped cashews or almonds for garnish
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat.
2. add the chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.
3. add the minced garlic and grated ginger. cook for another minute.
4. add the pureed tomatoes and tomato paste to the pan. stir well.
5. add the ground cumin, ground coriander, paprika, turmeric, and cayenne pepper. mix everything together.
6. cook the mixture for about 5 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
7. add the cooked chickpeas and water to the pan. stir well.
8. reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and let it simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the sauce thickens.
9. taste the chana masala and add salt as desired.
10. once the dish is cooked, turn off the heat and garnish with chopped cilantro.
11. optional: sprinkle chopped cashews or almonds on top for added crunch and flavor.
12. serve hot with rice, naan bread, or roti.

enjoy your homemade chana masala from india!
ingredients_list: chickpea, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, tomato, pureed, tomato, paste, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, paprika, turmeric, cayenne, pepper, taste, vegetable, water, salt, taste, cilantro, coriander, leaf, cashew, almond, garnish

title: Veggie enchiladas
raw_text: 39. Veggie enchiladas - 350 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 small corn tortillas
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 zucchini, diced
- 1 cup canned black beans, drained and rinsed
- 1 cup corn kernels
- 1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon cumin
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 cup shredded mexican cheese blend
- fresh cilantro, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. add the onion and garlic, sauté until softened and fragrant.
3. add bell pepper and zucchini to the skillet, cook for about 5 minutes or until vegetables are slightly tender.
4. stir in black beans, corn, diced tomatoes, chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper. cook for another 5 minutes to blend the flavors.
5. warm the corn tortillas individually in a dry skillet for a few seconds on each side until they are pliable.
6. spoon a generous amount of the vegetable mixture onto each tortilla, roll it up tightly, and place seam side down in a greased baking dish.
7. repeat the process until all the tortillas are filled.
8. sprinkle the shredded cheese evenly over the filled tortillas.
9. bake in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
11. garnish with fresh chopped cilantro before serving.
12. enjoy your delicious veggie enchiladas!
ingredients_list: corn, tortilla, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, bell, pepper, zucchini, canned, black, bean, corn, kernel, tomato, chili, powder, cumin, salt, pepper, taste, shredded, mexican, cheese, blend, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Quinoa and black bean burgers
raw_text: 40. Quinoa and black bean burgers - 400 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup cooked quinoa
- 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
- 1/2 cup bread crumbs (gluten-containing)
- 1/4 cup chopped red onion
- 1/4 cup chopped bell pepper
- 1/4 cup chopped cilantro
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1 tsp ground cumin
- 1/2 tsp paprika
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1/4 tsp black pepper
- 2 tbsp olive oil
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, mash the black beans with a fork until most of them are mashed but some remain whole.
2. add the cooked quinoa, bread crumbs, red onion, bell pepper, cilantro, garlic, cumin, paprika, salt, and black pepper to the bowl with the mashed black beans. mix well to combine all the ingredients.
3. divide the mixture into four equal portions and shape each portion into a patty.
4. heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. place the quinoa and black bean patties into the skillet and cook for about 5-7 minutes on each side, or until they are crispy and heated through.
5. serve the quinoa and black bean burgers on buns with your desired toppings and condiments. enjoy!
ingredients_list: quinoa, black, bean, bread, crumb, gluten, containing, red, onion, bell, pepper, cilantro, clove, garlic, minced, ground, cumin, paprika, salt, black, pepper, olive

title: Falafel salad with tahini dressing
raw_text: 41. Falafel salad with tahini dressing - 250 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (Middle East)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup of canned chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1/4 cup of finely chopped onion
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 2 tablespoons of chopped fresh parsley
- 2 tablespoons of chopped fresh cilantro
- 1 teaspoon of ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon of ground coriander
- 1/4 teaspoon of baking soda
- salt and black pepper to taste
- 2 tablespoons of all-purpose flour (gluten-containing)
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil

for the salad:
- 4 cups of mixed salad greens
- 1 cup of cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1 cucumber, diced
- 1/4 cup of sliced red onion
- 1/4 cup of chopped fresh parsley
- 1/4 cup of chopped fresh mint

for the tahini dressing:
- 1/4 cup of tahini
- 2 tablespoons of lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons of water
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- salt to taste
preparation:
1. in a food processor, combine the chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, cilantro, cumin, coriander, baking soda, salt, and pepper. pulse until well combined but still slightly chunky.
2. transfer the mixture to a bowl and stir in the flour. shape the mixture into small patties, about 1 inch in diameter.
3. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. add the falafel patties and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and crispy. remove from the skillet and set aside.
4. in a large bowl, combine the salad greens, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, parsley, and mint.
5. in a separate small bowl, whisk together the tahini, lemon juice, water, garlic, and salt until smooth and well combined.
6. divide the salad mixture into 4 portions and top each with a few falafel patties. drizzle with the tahini dressing.
7. serve the falafel salad immediately and enjoy!

note: the calorie count provided is an estimate and may vary depending on specific ingredients and portion sizes used.
ingredients_list: canned, chickpea, onion, garlic, clove, minced, fresh, parsley, fresh, cilantro, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, baking, soda, salt, black, pepper, taste, flour, gluten, containing, olive, salad, salad, green, cherry, tomato, halved, cucumber, red, onion, fresh, parsley, fresh, mint, tahini, tahini, lemon, water, garlic, clove, minced, salt, taste

title: Vegetable curry with basmati rice
raw_text: 42. Vegetable curry with basmati rice - 350 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains nuts (India)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon curry powder
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional, for heat)
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 medium carrot, diced
- 1 cup cauliflower florets
- 1 cup broccoli florets
- 1 cup green beans, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces
- 1 cup canned chickpeas, rinsed and drained
- 1 can (400ml) coconut milk
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- 1/4 cup cashews, chopped (or any preferred nuts)
- salt, to taste
- fresh cilantro, for garnish
preparation:
1. in a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. add the chopped onion and minced garlic, and cook until the onions are translucent, stirring occasionally.
2. add the curry powder, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and cayenne pepper (if using) to the pot. stir well to coat the onions and garlic with the spices, and cook for another minute to release the flavors.
3. add the diced red bell pepper, carrot, cauliflower, broccoli, green beans, and chickpeas to the pot. stir to combine with the spices.
4. pour in the coconut milk and vegetable broth. bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low. cover the pot and let the curry cook for about 15-20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
5. while the curry is simmering, prepare the basmati rice according to package instructions.
6. once the curry is cooked, season with salt to taste. if desired, add more spices to adjust the flavor.
7. serve the vegetable curry over a portion of cooked basmati rice. garnish with chopped cashews and fresh cilantro.
8. enjoy your delicious vegetable curry with basmati rice from india!
ingredients_list: vegetable, onion, clove, garlic, minced, curry, powder, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, turmeric, powder, cayenne, pepper, red, bell, pepper, carrot, cauliflower, floret, broccoli, floret, green, bean, piece, canned, chickpea, coconut, milk, vegetable, broth, cashew, nut, salt, taste, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Coconut curry noodles
raw_text: 45. Coconut curry noodles - 400 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 oz rice noodles
- 1 tbsp vegetable oil
- 1 onion, thinly sliced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tbsp curry powder
- 1 cup coconut milk
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 carrot, julienned
- 1 cup snap peas
- 1 cup sliced mushrooms
- 1 cup tofu or protein of choice, cubed
- 2 tbsp soy sauce
- 1 tbsp lime juice
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh cilantro for garnish
preparation:
1. cook the rice noodles according to package instructions. drain and set aside.
2. in a large pan or wok, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. add the sliced onion and minced garlic. sauté until the onion becomes translucent.
3. stir in the curry powder and cook for another minute to release the flavors.
4. pour in the coconut milk and vegetable broth. bring to a simmer.
5. add the red bell pepper, carrot, snap peas, mushrooms, and tofu (or protein of choice) to the pan. cook until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
6. stir in the soy sauce and lime juice. season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. add the cooked rice noodles to the pan and toss to coat them in the curry sauce. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes to heat the noodles through.
8. divide the coconut curry noodles into four portions. garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.
9. enjoy your delicious gluten-containing coconut curry noodles!
