title: Mushroom and goat cheese flatbread
raw_text: 46. Mushroom and goat cheese flatbread - 350 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 store-bought flatbread, gluten-free if desired
- 8 ounces mushrooms, sliced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 4 ounces goat cheese, crumbled
- 1/4 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. add the sliced mushrooms and sauté until they release their moisture and start to brown, about 5-6 minutes. season with salt and pepper to taste.
3. place the flatbread on a baking sheet. brush the remaining tablespoon of olive oil over the flatbread.
4. sprinkle the sautéed mushrooms evenly over the flatbread. scatter the crumbled goat cheese and shredded mozzarella cheese on top.
5. place the baking sheet with the assembled flatbread in the preheated oven. bake for about 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese has melted and the edges of the flatbread are crispy.
6. remove from the oven and garnish with chopped fresh parsley.
7. allow the flatbread to cool slightly. cut it into 4 portions and serve while still warm. enjoy your mushroom and goat cheese flatbread!
ingredients_list: flatbread, gluten, ounce, mushroom, olive, ounce, goat, cheese, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, fresh, parsley, salt, pepper, taste

title: Tomato and mozzarella tart
raw_text: 47. Tomato and mozzarella tart - 200 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 sheet of puff pastry dough (gluten-containing)
- 2 large tomatoes
- 1 cup of shredded mozzarella cheese (dairy)
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
- 1 tablespoon of balsamic vinegar
- fresh basil leaves
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 200°c (400°f) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. roll out the puff pastry dough on the prepared baking sheet and prick it all over with a fork.
3. slice the tomatoes into thin rounds and place them on a paper towel to remove excess moisture.
4. arrange the tomato slices evenly on top of the puff pastry dough.
5. sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese over the tomatoes.
6. drizzle the olive oil and balsamic vinegar evenly over the tart.
7. season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. remove from the oven and let it cool slightly.
10. garnish with fresh basil leaves before serving.
11. cut the tart into four portions and serve warm.

enjoy your delicious tomato and mozzarella tart, a classic italian dish!
ingredients_list: puff, pastry, dough, gluten, containing, tomato, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, dairy, olive, balsamic, vinegar, fresh, basil, leaf, salt, pepper, taste

title: Sweet potato gnocchi with sage butter
raw_text: 49. Sweet potato gnocchi with sage butter - 400 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large sweet potatoes
- 1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1 egg, beaten
- 2 tbsp unsalted butter
- 10-12 fresh sage leaves
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c). pierce the sweet potatoes with a fork and place them on a baking sheet. bake for about 1 hour or until tender.
2. once the sweet potatoes are cooked and cooled, peel off the skin and mash the flesh in a large bowl until smooth.
3. add the flour, parmesan cheese, beaten egg, salt, and pepper to the sweet potato puree. mix well until a sticky dough forms.
4. on a lightly floured surface, divide the dough into 4 equal parts. roll each part into a long rope, about 1 inch thick.
5. cut the ropes into bite-sized pieces, about 1 inch in length. dust the gnocchi with a little flour to prevent sticking.
6. bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. cook the gnocchi in batches, dropping them into the boiling water. cook for about 2-3 minutes or until the gnocchi floats to the surface. remove using a slotted spoon and set aside.
7. in a separate pan, melt the unsalted butter over medium heat. add the sage leaves and cook until crispy, about 2 minutes. remove the sage leaves and set them aside.
8. add the cooked gnocchi to the pan with the melted butter and sage. toss gently to coat the gnocchi evenly. cook for an additional minute to allow the flavors to meld.
9. divide the sweet potato gnocchi among four serving plates, garnish with the crispy sage leaves, and drizzle any remaining sage butter over the top.
10. serve hot and enjoy your sweet potato gnocchi with sage butter!
ingredients_list: sweet, potato, flour, parmesan, cheese, egg, unsalted, butter, fresh, sage, leaf, salt, pepper, taste

title: Vegetable korma with basmati rice
raw_text: 65. Vegetable korma with basmati rice - 350 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains nuts (India)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon grated ginger
- 1 green chili, finely chopped
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
- 1/2 teaspoon garam masala
- 1/2 teaspoon chili powder (optional, for extra heat)
- 1 carrot, peeled and diced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 cup cauliflower florets
- 1 cup green beans, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces
- 1 cup frozen peas
- 1 cup diced potatoes
- 1/2 cup diced tomatoes
- 1 cup coconut milk
- 1/2 cup vegetable broth
- salt to taste
- 1/4 cup chopped cashews or almonds
- fresh cilantro leaves for garnish

for basmati rice:
- 1 cup basmati rice
- 2 cups water
- salt to taste
preparation:
1. in a large pan, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. add the chopped onion and sauté until translucent.
2. add the minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chili to the pan. cook for another minute until fragrant.
3. add the ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder, garam masala, and chili powder (if using) to the pan. stir well to combine the spices with the onion mixture.
4. add the diced carrot, bell pepper, cauliflower florets, green beans, peas, potatoes, and diced tomatoes to the pan. cook for 4-5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. pour in the coconut milk and vegetable broth. bring the mixture to a simmer. cover the pan and cook for 15-20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
6. while the korma is simmering, prepare the basmati rice. in a separate saucepan, rinse the rice under cold water until the water runs clear. drain the rice.
7. in the same saucepan, add the drained rice, 2 cups of water, and salt to taste. bring the water to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. cover the saucepan and simmer for 12-15 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and fluffy.
8. once the korma is ready, season with salt to taste and stir in the chopped cashews or almonds.
9. serve the vegetable korma with basmati rice. garnish with fresh cilantro leaves. enjoy!

note: make sure to check for any nut allergies if serving to others.
ingredients_list: vegetable, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, green, chili, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, turmeric, powder, garam, masala, chili, powder, carrot, bell, pepper, cauliflower, floret, green, bean, piece, frozen, pea, potato, tomato, coconut, milk, vegetable, broth, salt, taste, cashew, almond, fresh, cilantro, leaf, garnish, basmati, rice, basmati, rice, water, salt, taste

title: Stuffed grape leaves (Dolmas)
raw_text: 66. Stuffed grape leaves (Dolmas) - 200 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains nuts (Middle East)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup of grape leaves, preserved in brine
- 1/2 cup of uncooked rice
- 1/4 cup of finely chopped onions
- 1/4 cup of finely chopped parsley
- 2 tablespoons of finely chopped mint
- 2 tablespoons of pine nuts
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- 1 lemon, juiced
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. rinse the grape leaves under cold water to remove excess brine. place them in a bowl and cover with boiling water. let them soak for 10-15 minutes to soften. drain and set aside.
2. in a separate bowl, combine the rice, onions, parsley, mint, pine nuts, olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. mix well to incorporate all the ingredients.
3. take one grape leaf and place it flat on a clean surface, shiny side down. add about a tablespoon of the rice mixture in the center of the leaf.
4. fold the sides of the leaf towards the center, then roll it up tightly. repeat this process with the remaining grape leaves and rice mixture.
5. place the stuffed grape leaves in a saucepan, seam side down, making sure to pack them tightly together. if necessary, stack them in multiple layers.
6. add enough water to the saucepan just to cover the grape leaves. place a plate or a heat-safe lid directly on top of the dolmas to keep them from floating. this will help ensure they stay intact while cooking.
7. bring the water to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. cover the saucepan and simmer for about 30-40 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the grape leaves are tender.
8. once cooked, remove the dolmas from the heat and let them cool slightly before serving.
9. serve the stuffed grape leaves warm or at room temperature as an appetizer or part of a larger middle eastern meal. enjoy!
ingredients_list: grape, leaf, brine, rice, onion, parsley, mint, pine, nut, olive, lemon, salt, pepper, taste

title: Mushroom and truffle risotto
raw_text: 67. Mushroom and truffle risotto - 400 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 tablespoon unsalted butter
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 200g arborio rice
- 100ml dry white wine
- 600ml vegetable or chicken broth
- 150g mixed fresh mushrooms (such as cremini, shiitake, or oyster), sliced
- 1 tablespoon truffle oil
- 30g grated parmesan cheese
- salt and pepper, to taste
- fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil and butter in a large saucepan over medium heat.
2. add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the pan and sauté until softened, about 3 minutes.
3. stir in the arborio rice and cook for another 2 minutes, stirring constantly until the rice is coated and slightly translucent.
4. pour in the white wine and cook, stirring frequently, until the liquid has been absorbed.
5. begin adding the vegetable or chicken broth, about 100ml at a time, stirring continuously and allowing each addition to be absorbed before adding more. continue this process until the rice is creamy and tender, which should take about 20-25 minutes.
6. while the risotto is cooking, heat a separate skillet over medium heat and lightly sauté the sliced mushrooms until they become tender and slightly browned.
7. once the risotto has reached the desired consistency, stir in the sautéed mushrooms, truffle oil, and grated parmesan cheese. mix well to combine.
8. season with salt and pepper to taste. keep in mind that parmesan is naturally salty, so taste before adding more salt.
9. serve the mushroom and truffle risotto hot, garnished with freshly chopped parsley. enjoy!
ingredients_list: olive, unsalted, butter, onion, garlic, clove, minced, arborio, rice, white, wine, vegetable, chicken, broth, fresh, mushroom, cremini, shiitake, oyster, truffle, parmesan, cheese, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Vegetable and tofu stir
raw_text: 69. Vegetable and tofu stir-fry - 300 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains soy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 cups of mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, and snap peas)
- 1 block of tofu, drained and cubed
- 2 tablespoons of soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon of sesame oil
- 1 tablespoon of minced garlic
- 1 tablespoon of minced ginger
- 1 tablespoon of cornstarch
- 1/4 cup of vegetable broth
- salt and pepper to taste
- optional toppings: sesame seeds, green onions
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, sesame oil, minced garlic, minced ginger, cornstarch, and vegetable broth. set aside.

2. heat a large skillet or wok over medium heat. add a little oil if necessary.

3. add the tofu cubes to the skillet and cook until they are golden brown on all sides. remove tofu from skillet and set aside.

4. in the same skillet, add the mixed vegetables. stir-fry for about 5 minutes or until they are crisp-tender.

5. return the tofu to the skillet with the vegetables.

6. pour the soy sauce mixture over the tofu and vegetables. stir everything together until the sauce thickens and coats the ingredients evenly.

7. season with salt and pepper to taste. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.

8. remove from heat and let it cool slightly before serving.

9. garnish with sesame seeds and green onions if desired.

10. serve the vegetable and tofu stir-fry hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: vegetable, bell, pepper, broccoli, carrot, pea, tofu, soy, sauce, sesame, minced, garlic, minced, ginger, cornstarch, vegetable, broth, salt, pepper, taste, topping, sesame, seed, green, onion

title: Spinach and feta stuffed phyllo rolls
raw_text: 70. Spinach and feta stuffed phyllo rolls - 250 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy (Greece)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 sheets of phyllo pastry
- 2 cups fresh spinach, chopped
- 1 cup feta cheese, crumbled
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- butter or cooking spray for brushing
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (180°c).
2. in a skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the onion and garlic, and sauté until fragrant and translucent.
3. add the chopped spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted, about 2-3 minutes. season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. remove the skillet from the heat and let the spinach mixture cool slightly.
5. in a bowl, combine the cooked spinach mixture and crumbled feta cheese. mix well to combine.
6. lay one sheet of phyllo pastry on a clean surface. brush it lightly with melted butter or spray with cooking spray. repeat this step with three more sheets, layering them on top of each other.
7. spoon a portion of the spinach and feta mixture onto the lower third of the layered phyllo sheets, leaving a small border around the edges.
8. starting from the bottom, tightly roll the phyllo pastry over the filling, tucking in the sides as you go, to form a stuffed roll. repeat this step with the remaining phyllo and filling.
9. place the stuffed phyllo rolls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. brush the tops with melted butter or spray with cooking spray.
10. bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the phyllo pastry is golden brown and crispy.
11. once cooked, remove from the oven and let the rolls cool for a few minutes before serving. cut each roll into smaller portions according to your preferences.
12. serve warm as a delicious appetizer or as a side dish. enjoy!
   
note: this recipe contains gluten and dairy, so be mindful of dietary restrictions before consuming.
ingredients_list: sheet, phyllo, pastry, fresh, spinach, feta, cheese, onion, clove, garlic, minced, olive, salt, pepper, taste, butter, spray, brushing

title: Butternut squash ravioli with brown butter sauce
raw_text: 71. Butternut squash ravioli with brown butter sauce - 400 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
- 20 store-bought square ravioli
- 8 tablespoons unsalted butter
- fresh sage leaves, for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. place the cubed butternut squash on a baking sheet. drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. toss to coat the squash evenly.
3. roast the butternut squash in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes or until tender. remove from the oven and let it cool slightly.
4. transfer the roasted squash to a food processor or blender. add grated parmesan cheese and nutmeg. blend until smooth, adding a little water if needed to achieve a creamy consistency. season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. cook the ravioli according to package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.
6. in a large skillet, melt the unsalted butter over medium heat. let it cook until it starts to brown and smell nutty, about 3-5 minutes. be careful not to burn the butter. remove from heat.
7. plate the cooked ravioli and top with the butternut squash sauce. drizzle the brown butter sauce over the ravioli. garnish with fresh sage leaves.
8. serve immediately and enjoy your butternut squash ravioli with brown butter sauce.

note: please ensure to check the nutrition and allergen information on store-bought ravioli to confirm that it contains gluten and dairy. adjust the calorie count accordingly.
ingredients_list: butternut, seeded, olive, salt, pepper, taste, parmesan, cheese, nutmeg, square, ravioli, unsalted, butter, fresh, sage, leaf, garnish

title: French toast with maple syrup
raw_text: 9. French toast with maple syrup - 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Various
ingredients:
: france.

ingredients:
- 4 slices of thick bread (such as brioche or challah)
- 2 large eggs
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- pinch of salt
- 2 tablespoons unsalted butter
- maple syrup, for serving
preparation:
1. in a shallow bowl or dish, whisk together the eggs, milk, vanilla extract, ground cinnamon, and salt.
2. heat a large skillet or griddle over medium heat and melt 1 tablespoon of butter.
3. dip each slice of bread into the egg mixture, allowing it to soak for a few seconds on each side.
4. place the soaked bread onto the preheated skillet and cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until golden brown.
5. remove the cooked french toast from the skillet and repeat with the remaining slices, adding more butter if needed.
6. serve the french toast warm with maple syrup drizzled over the top. enjoy!
ingredients_list: france, bread, brioche, challah, egg, milk, vanilla, extract, ground, cinnamon, pinch, salt, unsalted, butter, maple, syrup

title: Huevos rancheros
raw_text: 13. Huevos rancheros - 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Mexico
ingredients:
huevos rancheros - 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: mexico

ingredients:
- 4 corn tortillas
- 4 large eggs
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1/2 cup canned black beans, drained and rinsed
- 1/2 cup diced tomatoes
- 1/4 cup diced onions
- 1/4 cup diced bell peppers
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro
- 2 tablespoons salsa (optional)
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit (175 degrees celsius).
2. in a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
3. add the diced onions and bell peppers to the skillet and sauté until they soften, about 4-5 minutes.
4. add the diced tomatoes and black beans to the skillet. cook for another 3-4 minutes, until heated through.
5. stir in the chopped cilantro and season with salt and pepper to taste. remove the skillet from heat and set aside.
6. heat the corn tortillas in a separate dry skillet or directly over a gas flame for a few seconds on each side until warmed and slightly charred.
7. place the warmed tortillas on a baking sheet and top each tortilla with 1/4 of the black bean mixture.
8. carefully crack an egg onto each tortilla, being careful to keep the yolk intact.
9. bake in the preheated oven for about 10-12 minutes, or until the eggs are cooked to your desired level of doneness.
10. remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving.
11. optional: top each portion with a tablespoon of salsa before serving.
12. serve the huevos rancheros immediately and enjoy!

note: this recipe contains gluten as it uses corn tortillas, which may have some traces of gluten from cross-contamination during processing. if you follow a strict gluten-free diet, ensure you use certified gluten-free corn tortillas or substitute with gluten-free tortillas of your choice.
ingredients_list: huevos, rancheros, calorie, portion, gluten, origin, mexico, corn, tortilla, egg, vegetable, canned, black, bean, tomato, onion, bell, pepper, fresh, cilantro, salsa, salt, pepper, taste

title: Overnight oats
raw_text: 15. Overnight oats - 250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: United States
ingredients:
overnight oats:
ingredients:
- 1 cup rolled oats
- 1 cup milk (any kind: dairy, almond, soy, etc.)
- 1 tablespoon chia seeds
- 1 tablespoon honey or maple syrup
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/4 cup fresh berries (optional topping)
- 1 tablespoon sliced almonds (optional topping)
preparation:
1. in a jar or container with a lid, combine the oats, milk, chia seeds, honey or maple syrup, and vanilla extract. mix well.
2. seal the jar/container and refrigerate overnight, or for at least 4-6 hours, allowing the oats to soak and thicken.
3. in the morning, give the oats a good stir. if desired, you can add a little more milk to adjust the consistency.
4. serve the overnight oats in bowls and top with fresh berries and sliced almonds, or any other toppings of your choice.
5. enjoy your nutritious and delicious overnight oats!

origin: overnight oats is a widely popular breakfast recipe that originated from switzerland and has gained popularity worldwide.
ingredients_list: oat, rolled, oat, milk, dairy, almond, soy, chia, seed, honey, maple, syrup, vanilla, extract, fresh, berry, topping, almond, topping

title: Turkish breakfast (tomato, cucumber, olives, cheese, bread)
raw_text: 16. Turkish breakfast (tomato, cucumber, olives, cheese, bread) - 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Turkey
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large tomatoes
- 1 cucumber
- 1 cup of mixed olives (green and black)
- 200g of turkish white cheese (feta or similar)
- 4 slices of turkish bread (or any other bread of your preference)
preparation:
1. wash the tomatoes and cucumber. slice the tomatoes into thin slices.

title: Breakfast quesadilla
raw_text: 21. Breakfast quesadilla - 400 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Mexico
ingredients:
: mexico.

ingredients:
- 2 large tortillas (gluten-containing)
- 2 large eggs
- 1/4 cup diced bell peppers
- 1/4 cup diced onions
- 1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese (dairy-containing)
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro
- salt and pepper to taste
- cooking spray or vegetable oil
preparation:
1. in a bowl, whisk the eggs and season with salt and pepper.
2. heat a small non-stick skillet over medium heat and spray with cooking spray or add a drizzle of vegetable oil.
3. add the diced bell peppers and onions to the skillet and sauté until they soften, about 3-4 minutes. remove from the skillet and set aside.
4. wipe the skillet clean and place it back over medium heat.
5. spray the skillet again with cooking spray or add a bit more vegetable oil.
6. place one tortilla in the skillet and let it warm up for a minute.
7. pour half of the whisked eggs onto the tortilla and spread it out evenly.
8. sprinkle half of the sautéed bell peppers and onions, along with half of the shredded cheddar cheese, evenly over the eggs.
9. carefully place the second tortilla on top and press it down gently.
10. cook for 2-3 minutes until the bottom tortilla is golden brown.
11. using a spatula, carefully flip the quesadilla over and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the other side is golden brown and the cheese has melted.
12. remove the quesadilla from the skillet and let it cool for a minute or two before cutting it into quarters.
13. sprinkle chopped fresh cilantro on top.
14. serve hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: mexico, tortilla, gluten, containing, egg, bell, pepper, onion, shredded, cheddar, cheese, dairy, containing, fresh, cilantro, salt, pepper, taste, spray, vegetable

6. gently fold and stir the eggs to form large, fluffy curds. continue cooking until the eggs are just set.
7. spread butter on the toasted english muffins, then top with a portion of cooked sausages and scrambled eggs.
8. place the topped muffins on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for about 5-7 minutes, until heated through.
9. remove from the oven and let cool slightly before serving. enjoy!

title: Aloo paratha (Indian stuffed potato bread)
raw_text: 38. Aloo paratha (Indian stuffed potato bread) - 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: India
ingredients:
here is the recipe for aloo paratha:

ingredients:
- 1 cup whole wheat flour
- 1 cup boiled and mashed potatoes
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 1 green chili, finely chopped (optional)
- 1 tablespoon fresh coriander leaves, chopped
- 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder
- 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder
- 1/4 teaspoon turmeric powder
- salt to taste
- ghee or oil for cooking
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat flour with a pinch of salt. gradually add water and knead to form a soft dough. cover and let it rest for 15-20 minutes.
2. in another bowl, mix the mashed potatoes, finely chopped onion, green chili (if using), coriander leaves, cumin powder, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt. mix well to form a smooth filling.
3. divide the dough into equal-sized balls. take one dough ball and roll it out into a small circle. place a spoonful of the potato filling in the center of the circle.
4. bring the edges of the dough together and seal it properly, ensuring the filling doesn't come out. flatten the stuffed dough ball gently with your hands.
5. dust some flour on the stuffed dough ball and roll it out into a flat paratha, approximately 6-7 inches in diameter. be careful not to put too much pressure while rolling, as it may cause the filling to come out.
6. heat a tawa or a griddle on medium heat. place the rolled paratha on the hot tawa and cook it on both sides, applying ghee or oil, until golden brown spots appear.
7. repeat the process with the remaining dough balls and filling.
8. serve the aloo parathas hot with yogurt, pickle, or any side dish of your choice.

origin: aloo paratha is a popular indian dish that originated in the indian subcontinent. it is commonly eaten for breakfast or as a main course and is enjoyed by people of all ages.
ingredients_list: aloo, paratha, whole, wheat, flour, boiled, potato, onion, green, chili, fresh, coriander, leaf, cumin, powder, red, chili, powder, turmeric, powder, salt, taste, ghee

title: Indian dosa with coconut chutney
raw_text: 49. Indian dosa with coconut chutney - 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: India
ingredients:
: south indian

dosa ingredients:
- 1 cup dosa rice
- ¼ cup urad dal (split black lentils)
- ¼ teaspoon fenugreek seeds
- salt to taste
- water for soaking and grinding
- oil for cooking

coconut chutney ingredients:
- ½ cup grated coconut
- 2 tablespoons roasted chana dal (split chickpeas)
- 2 green chilies, chopped
- 2 tablespoons roasted peanuts
- 1 tablespoon tamarind pulp
- salt to taste
- water for grinding
preparation:
1. dosa:
- wash the dosa rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds separately.
- soak the rice, dal, and fenugreek seeds in enough water for approximately 4-6 hours.
- drain the water and grind the rice, dal, and fenugreek seeds together to form a smooth batter, adding water as required.
- add salt to the batter and mix well.
- cover the batter and let it ferment overnight or for at least 6-8 hours.
- heat a non-stick or cast-iron skillet over medium heat.
- grease it lightly with oil.
- pour a ladleful of batter onto the center of the skillet and spread it outward in a circular motion to form a thin dosa.
- drizzle oil around the edges and cook until the dosa turns golden brown and crispy.
- flip the dosa and cook the other side for a minute or so.
- remove the dosa from the skillet and repeat the process with the remaining batter to make more dosas.

2. coconut chutney:
- in a blender or food processor, add grated coconut, roasted chana dal, green chilies, roasted peanuts, tamarind pulp, and salt.
- grind everything together by adding water gradually until you achieve a smooth chutney consistency.
- transfer the chutney to a serving bowl.

serve the dosa hot with coconut chutney.
ingredients_list: south, indian, dosa, dosa, rice, urad, dal, black, lentil, fenugreek, seed, salt, taste, water, soaking, grinding, coconut, chutney, coconut, roasted, chana, dal, chickpea, green, chilies, roasted, peanut, tamarind, pulp, salt, taste, water, grinding

title: Shakriya (Lebanese rice pudding)
raw_text: 50. Shakriya (Lebanese rice pudding) - 300 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: Lebanon
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1/4 cup short-grain rice
- 2 cups whole milk
- 1/4 cup white sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon rose water
- ground cinnamon, for garnish
preparation:
1. in a medium-sized saucepan, rinse the rice under cold water until the water runs clear. drain any excess water.
2. add the milk and rice to the saucepan and bring to a gentle boil over medium heat.
3. reduce the heat to low and simmer the rice and milk mixture, stirring frequently to prevent sticking, for about 30-40 minutes or until the rice is soft and the mixture has thickened.
4. stir in the sugar and rose water, and continue to cook for an additional 5 minutes until the sugar has dissolved.
5. remove the saucepan from heat and let the mixture cool slightly.
6. divide the pudding into two serving bowls and chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour to allow it to set.
7. before serving, sprinkle ground cinnamon over the top as a garnish.
8. enjoy your homemade shakriya!
ingredients_list: short, grain, rice, whole, milk, white, sugar, rose, water, ground, cinnamon, garnish

title: Moroccan msemen (thin layered pastry) with honey
raw_text: 51. Moroccan msemen (thin layered pastry) with honey - 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Morocco
ingredients:
: morocco

ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup fine semolina
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon yeast
- 1/4 cup warm water
- 1/4 cup vegetable oil
- 2 tablespoons melted butter
- honey, to taste
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, semolina, and salt.
2. dissolve the yeast in warm water and let it sit for 5 minutes, until it becomes frothy.
3. make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and pour in the yeast mixture, vegetable oil, and melted butter.
4. mix the ingredients with your hands until they come together to form a soft and slightly sticky dough. knead the dough for about 5 minutes until it becomes smooth and elastic.
5. divide the dough into two equal portions and shape each into a ball. cover the dough balls with a damp cloth and let them rest for 15-20 minutes.
6. take one dough ball and roll it out into a thin rectangle, about 1/8 inch thick. brush the surface with melted butter.
7. fold the sides of the rectangle towards the center, overlapping them slightly, to form a smaller rectangle. brush the surface with melted butter again.
8. fold the upper and lower ends of the rectangle towards the center, overlapping them slightly, to form a square. brush the surface with melted butter once more.
9. repeat steps 6-8 with the second dough ball.
10. heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat. carefully transfer one folded dough square to the pan and cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side until golden brown and crispy. repeat with the second square.
11. remove the cooked msemen from the pan and let them cool slightly. cut each square into smaller triangles or squares.
12. drizzle the warm msemen with honey according to your taste preferences.
13. serve the moroccan msemen with honey while still warm. enjoy!

note: the provided calorie count is an estimate and may vary depending on the specific brands and amounts of ingredients used.
ingredients_list: morocco, flour, semolina, salt, yeast, water, vegetable, butter, honey, taste

title: German-style potato pancakes with applesauce
raw_text: 54. German-style potato pancakes with applesauce - 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Germany

germany. 

ingredients:
- 2 large potatoes
- 1 small onion
- 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- applesauce for serving
preparation:
1. peel the potatoes and grate them using a box grater. place the grated potatoes in a clean kitchen towel and squeeze out any excess moisture.
2. finely chop the onion and add it to the grated potatoes.
3. in a large bowl, combine the grated potatoes, chopped onion, flour, salt, black pepper, and garlic powder. mix well until all the ingredients are evenly distributed.
4. heat the vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat.
5. take a spoonful of the potato mixture and flatten it into a pancake shape using your hands. place it in the heated skillet.
6. repeat step 5 with the remaining potato mixture, making sure not to overcrowd the skillet.
7. cook the potato pancakes for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and crispy.
8. remove the cooked potato pancakes from the skillet and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to absorb any excess oil.
9. serve the german-style potato pancakes warm with a side of applesauce. enjoy!

ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup rolled oats
- 1 medium apple, peeled and diced
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1 tablespoon honey or maple syrup
- 1/2 cup almond milk (or any milk of your choice)
- 1/4 cup raisins
- 1/4 cup chopped nuts (optional)
- cooking spray or butter, for greasing the baking dish
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c). grease a small baking dish with cooking spray or butter.
2. in a medium bowl, combine the rolled oats, diced apple, cinnamon, nutmeg, honey or maple syrup, almond milk, raisins, and chopped nuts (if using). mix well to combine all the ingredients.
3. pour the mixture into the greased baking dish and smooth the top using a spoon.
4. bake the oatmeal for about 25-30 minutes, or until the top is golden and the edges are slightly crispy.
5. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes. serve warm and enjoy!

origin: this recipe originated from north america and is a popular breakfast option.
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, apple, cinnamon, nutmeg, honey, maple, syrup, almond, milk, milk, raisin, nut, spray, butter, greasing, baking

title: Mexican sweet corn pancakes
raw_text: 58. Mexican sweet corn pancakes - 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Mexico
ingredients:
mexican sweet corn pancakes:

ingredients:
- 1 cup canned sweet corn kernels, drained
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/4 cup milk
- 1 egg
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 jalapeno pepper, finely chopped (optional)
- 2 green onions, finely chopped
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro
- cooking spray or additional vegetable oil, for frying
preparation:
1. in a blender or food processor, pulse the sweet corn kernels a few times until they break down but still have some texture.
2. in a mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, black pepper, and ground cumin.
3. in a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, egg, and vegetable oil. 
4. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
5. fold in the chopped jalapeno pepper (if using), green onions, and cilantro. 
6. heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat and lightly coat with cooking spray or a small amount of vegetable oil.
7. scoop about 1/4 cup of the batter onto the skillet for each pancake. cook for 2-3 minutes, or until bubbles form on the surface and the edges start to set.
8. flip the pancake and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through.
9. repeat with the remaining batter.
10. serve the mexican sweet corn pancakes hot, with your choice of toppings such as sour cream, salsa, avocado, or additional chopped cilantro. enjoy!
ingredients_list: mexican, sweet, corn, pancake, canned, sweet, corn, kernel, flour, baking, powder, salt, ground, black, pepper, ground, cumin, milk, egg, vegetable, jalapeno, pepper, green, onion, fresh, cilantro, spray, vegetable

title: Italian breakfast panini with prosciutto and mozzarella
raw_text: 59. Italian breakfast panini with prosciutto and mozzarella - 400 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Italy
ingredients:
italy

ingredients:
- 1 small ciabatta roll
- 2 slices of prosciutto
- 1 ounce of fresh mozzarella
- 1 small tomato, sliced
- fresh basil leaves
- olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat a panini press or grill pan.
2. slice the ciabatta roll in half horizontally, creating a top and bottom.
3. drizzle a little olive oil over the bottom half of the roll and layer with prosciutto slices.
4. slice the mozzarella and place it on top of the prosciutto.
5. layer the tomato slices over the mozzarella and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
6. tear a few basil leaves and scatter them on top of the tomato.
7. place the top half of the ciabatta roll on top and lightly press it down.
8. brush the outer sides of the panini with olive oil.
9. place the panini in the preheated panini press or grill pan and cook until the bread is toasted and the cheese is melted, about 4-5 minutes.
10. remove the panini from the press or pan and let it cool slightly before slicing in half.
11. serve warm and enjoy your delicious italian breakfast panini with prosciutto and mozzarella!

title: Indian poha cutlet
raw_text: 60. Indian poha cutlet - 300 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: India
ingredients:
indian poha cutlet - 300 calories per portion; 2 portions; contains gluten; origin: india

ingredients:
- 1 cup poha (flattened rice)
- 1 potato, boiled and mashed
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 green chilies, finely chopped
- 1/4 teaspoon turmeric powder
- 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon garam masala
- salt to taste
- 2 tablespoons corn flour
- oil for shallow frying
preparation:
1. rinse the poha under running water and soak it for about 5 minutes. drain the water and keep it aside.
2. in a mixing bowl, add the soaked poha, mashed potato, chopped onion, green chilies, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. mix well to combine all the ingredients.
3. divide the mixture into equal portions and shape them into small cutlets.
4. in a plate, take corn flour and coat each cutlet with a thin layer of it.
5. heat oil in a shallow frying pan over medium heat.
6. gently place the coated cutlets in the hot oil and fry them until golden brown on both sides.
7. once done, remove the cutlets from the pan and drain excess oil on a kitchen towel.
8. serve the hot poha cutlets with mint chutney or tomato ketchup.

enjoy your delicious indian poha cutlet!

title: Syrian ka'ak (sesame bread rings)
raw_text: 67. Syrian ka'ak (sesame bread rings) - 250 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, origin: Syria
ingredients:
syrian ka'ak (sesame bread rings)

ingredients:
- 1 cup warm water
- 2 teaspoons active dry yeast
- 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1/4 cup olive oil
- 1/4 cup sesame seeds
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, dissolve the yeast in warm water and let it sit for about 5 minutes until it becomes frothy.
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, salt, and sugar.
3. make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and pour in the activated yeast mixture.
4. gradually add the olive oil while kneading the dough until it becomes smooth and elastic, about 8-10 minutes.
5. cover the dough with a clean kitchen towel and let it rest in a warm place for around 1 hour, or until it doubles in size.
6. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
7. punch down the dough to release any air bubbles and divide it into 6 equal portions.
8. roll each portion of dough into a rope shape, about 10 inches long.
9. twist each rope into a circle shape, crossing the ends over each other to form a ring.
10. place the sesame seeds in a shallow bowl and dip each ring into the sesame seeds, making sure to coat both sides.
11. arrange the sesame-coated rings on the prepared baking sheet.
12. bake for about 15-20 minutes or until the bread rings turn golden brown.
13. remove from the oven and let them cool on a wire rack.
14. serve the syrian ka'ak as a delicious snack or as an accompaniment to soups and stews.

note: this recipe makes 6 portions. each portion of syrian ka'ak is approximately 250 calories. it is important to note that this recipe contains gluten. the origin of syrian ka'ak is syria. enjoy!
ingredients_list: syrian, sesame, bread, ring, water, yeast, flour, salt, sugar, olive, sesame, seed

title: South Indian idli with sambar
raw_text: 68. South Indian idli with sambar - 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: India
ingredients:
south indian idli with sambar:
ingredients:
- 1 cup of idli rice
- 1/4 cup of urad dal (split black gram lentils)
- 1/4 teaspoon of fenugreek seeds
- salt to taste
- water as needed
- oil for greasing
- 1 tablespoon of ghee (clarified butter)

for sambar:
- 1/2 cup of toor dal (split pigeon peas)
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 1 small tomato, chopped
- 1 small carrot, diced
- 1 small potato, diced
- 1/4 cup of drumsticks, cut into pieces (optional)
- 1/2 cup of tamarind pulp
- 2 tablespoons of sambar powder
- 1/2 teaspoon of turmeric powder
- 1 teaspoon of mustard seeds
- 1 teaspoon of cumin seeds
- a pinch of asafoetida (hing)
- a few curry leaves
- 2 tablespoons of oil
- salt to taste
- water as needed
preparation:
1. idli:
- rinse the idli rice and urad dal separately, then soak them in water overnight. 
- grind the soaked urad dal and fenugreek seeds in a blender until smooth. 
- grind the soaked rice into a slightly coarse batter separately. 
- mix both batters together, add salt, and let it ferment overnight or for at least 8 hours. 
- grease the idli molds with oil and pour the batter into each mold. 
- steam the idlis in a steamer for about 10-12 minutes or until they become soft and fluffy. 
- remove the idlis from the molds and keep them aside. 

2. sambar:
- cook the toor dal in a pressure cooker with 2 cups of water until soft. 
- heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and asafoetida. 
- once the seeds start to splutter, add chopped onions and curry leaves. sauté until onions turn golden brown. 
- add tomatoes and cook until they become soft and mushy. 
- add the chopped carrot, potato, and drumsticks (if using) into the pan. mix well. 
- dissolve sambar powder and turmeric powder in a little water and add it to the pan. 
- add tamarind pulp, salt, and enough water to cover the vegetables. 
- pressure cook the sambar for 2-3 whistles or until the vegetables are cooked. 
- serve the idlis with the sambar and enjoy your south indian treat!

note: the calorie count and gluten content may vary depending on the brand and specific ingredients used.
ingredients_list: south, indian, idli, sambar, idli, rice, urad, dal, black, gram, lentil, fenugreek, seed, salt, taste, water, needed, greasing, ghee, clarified, butter, sambar, toor, dal, pigeon, pea, onion, tomato, carrot, potato, drumstick, piece, tamarind, pulp, sambar, powder, turmeric, powder, mustard, seed, cumin, seed, pinch, asafoetida, hing, curry, leaf, salt, taste, water, needed

title: Russian syrniki (cottage cheese pancakes)
raw_text: 69. Russian syrniki (cottage cheese pancakes) - 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Russia
ingredients:
russian syrniki (cottage cheese pancakes):

ingredients:
- 250g cottage cheese
- 2 tbsp sugar
- 2 tbsp flour (gluten-containing)
- 1/2 tsp vanilla extract
- pinch of salt
- 1 egg
- 2 tbsp vegetable oil
- optional toppings: sour cream, jam, honey
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine cottage cheese, sugar, flour, vanilla extract, salt, and egg.
2. mix well until all ingredients are well combined and a thick batter is formed.
3. heat vegetable oil in a large non-stick pan over medium heat.
4. take a spoonful of the cottage cheese batter and shape it into a small pancake with your hands.
5. place the pancake in the heated pan and repeat with the rest of the batter, leaving some space between each pancake.
6. cook the pancakes for about 2-3 minutes on each side or until golden brown.
7. remove the cooked pancakes from the pan and place them on a paper towel to absorb any excess oil.
8. serve the syrniki warm with your choice of toppings such as sour cream, jam, or honey.
9. enjoy your delicious russian syrniki!
ingredients_list: russian, syrniki, cottage, cheese, pancake, cottage, cheese, sugar, flour, gluten, containing, vanilla, extract, pinch, salt, egg, vegetable, topping, sour, cream, jam, honey

title: Venezuelan arepas with cheese and avocado
raw_text: 70. Venezuelan arepas with cheese and avocado - 400 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Venezuela
ingredients:
venezuelan arepas with cheese and avocado:

ingredients:
- 1 cup pre-cooked cornmeal (masarepa)
- 1 cup warm water
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1 tbsp vegetable oil
- 1/2 cup grated cheese (such as queso fresco or mozzarella)
- 1 ripe avocado, sliced
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the pre-cooked cornmeal, warm water, salt, and vegetable oil. mix well until a soft dough forms. let the dough rest for 5 minutes.
2. divide the dough into 4 equal portions and shape each portion into a smooth ball.
3. flatten each dough ball with your hands to form a disk shape, about 1/2 inch thick.
4. heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat. place the arepas on the skillet and cook for about 5 minutes on each side, or until they develop a golden crust.
5. once cooked, carefully cut a slit horizontally into each arepa, creating a pocket for the filling.
6. stuff each arepa with grated cheese and avocado slices. season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. serve warm and enjoy the delicious venezuelan arepas with cheese and avocado.
ingredients_list: venezuelan, arepas, cheese, avocado, cornmeal, masarepa, water, salt, vegetable, cheese, queso, fresco, mozzarella, avocado, salt, pepper, taste

title: British eggy soldiers
raw_text: 71. British eggy soldiers - 250 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, origin: United Kingdom
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 2 slices of bread (gluten-containing)
- 2 large eggs
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. start by bringing a small pot of water to a boil. 
2. carefully place the eggs into the pot and let them boil for about 4-5 minutes for a slightly runny yolk, or 6-7 minutes for a firmer yolk. 
3. while the eggs are boiling, toast the bread slices until they are golden brown and crispy. 
4. remove the eggs from the pot and place them in an eggcup or small bowl. use a knife to gently tap the top of each egg and remove the shell. 
5. cut the toasted bread into thin strips, about 1 inch wide, to use as "soldiers" for dipping. 
6. arrange the bread soldiers on a plate and place the peeled eggs alongside them. 
7. sprinkle some salt and pepper over the eggs, if desired. 
8. serve immediately and enjoy a delicious and protein-filled british eggy soldiers breakfast!
ingredients_list: bread, gluten, containing, egg, salt, pepper, taste

title: Irish soda bread with butter and jam
raw_text: 72. Irish soda bread with butter and jam - 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Ireland
ingredients:
: ireland.

ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened
- butter and jam, for serving
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c). 
2. in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt.
3. add the softened butter to the dry ingredients, and using your fingers or a pastry cutter, rub the butter into the flour mixture until it resembles coarse crumbs.
4. make a well in the center of the mixture and pour in the buttermilk. 
5. stir with a wooden spoon or your hands until the dough comes together.
6. turn the dough onto a lightly floured surface, and gently knead it a few times until it forms a smooth ball.
7. shape the dough into a round loaf and place it on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
8. use a sharp knife to score a deep cross on top of the loaf.
9. bake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped on the bottom.
10. remove from the oven and let it cool on a wire rack.
11. once the bread has cooled, slice it into portions and serve with butter and jam.

enjoy your homemade irish soda bread with butter and jam!
ingredients_list: ireland, flour, baking, soda, salt, buttermilk, unsalted, butter, butter, jam

title: Middle Eastern labneh with za'atar and bread
raw_text: 74. Middle Eastern labneh with za'atar and bread - 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Middle East
ingredients:
middle eastern labneh with za'atar and bread

ingredients:
- 1 cup greek yogurt
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 teaspoons za'atar spice
- 4 slices of bread (gluten-containing)
- fresh herbs (optional), for garnish
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine the greek yogurt, salt, and lemon juice. stir well to mix the ingredients thoroughly.

2. line a sieve or colander with a cheesecloth or kitchen towel, then place it over a bowl. pour the yogurt mixture into the cheesecloth-lined sieve, and let it strain for at least 6 hours or overnight in the refrigerator.

3. once the yogurt has strained and thickened to a creamy consistency, transfer it to a serving dish.

4. drizzle the labneh with olive oil, and sprinkle with za'atar spice. you can adjust the amount of za'atar to your liking.

5. toast the slices of bread until golden and crispy. cut them into smaller pieces for serving.

6. serve the labneh with the toasted bread alongside. optionally, garnish with fresh herbs for added flavor and presentation.

note: labneh can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.
ingredients_list: middle, eastern, labneh, atar, bread, greek, yogurt, salt, lemon, olive, atar, spice, bread, gluten, containing, fresh, herb, garnish

title: Turkish acma (soft bread rings) with feta cheese
raw_text: 75. Turkish acma (soft bread rings) with feta cheese - 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Turkey
ingredients:
: turkey

ingredients:
- 1 and 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup warm milk
- 2 teaspoons active dry yeast
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 1 tablespoon sesame seeds (optional)
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, dissolve the yeast in warm milk and let it sit for about 5 minutes or until it becomes frothy.

2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the flour and salt. make a well in the center and pour in the yeast mixture and olive oil. mix until a soft and sticky dough forms.

3. transfer the dough onto a floured surface and knead for about 5-7 minutes or until the dough becomes smooth and elastic.

4. place the dough in a greased bowl, cover it with a clean kitchen towel, and let it rise in a warm place for about 1 hour or until it doubles in size.

5. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

6. punch down the risen dough to release the air. divide it into two equal portions.

7. take one portion of the dough and divide it into 6 small balls. roll each ball into a thin rope, about 8-10 inches long.

8. bring the ends of each rope together and twist them a few times to form a ring. place the rings on the prepared baking sheet.

9. repeat the same process with the remaining dough portion.

10. fill the center of each ring with some crumbled feta cheese.

11. optional: sprinkle sesame seeds on top of the rings.

12. bake in the preheated oven for approximately 15-20 minutes or until the bread rings turn golden brown.

13. remove from the oven and let the acma cool for a few minutes before serving.

14. enjoy your turkish acma bread rings with feta cheese!
ingredients_list: turkey, flour, milk, yeast, salt, olive, feta, cheese, sesame, seed

title: Malaysian nasi lemak (coconut rice with condiments)
raw_text: 76. Malaysian nasi lemak (coconut rice with condiments) - 500 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Malaysia
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup jasmine rice
- 1 cup coconut milk
- 1 cup water
- 1 pandan leaf (optional)
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2 cups sliced cucumber
- 2 cups sliced tomatoes
- 4 hard-boiled eggs
- 1 cup roasted peanuts
- 2 tablespoons fried anchovies (ikan bilis)
- 1/2 cup sambal sauce
preparation:
1. rinse the jasmine rice a few times until the water runs clear. drain well.
2. in a medium pot, combine the rice, coconut milk, water, pandan leaf (if using), and salt. bring to a boil over medium heat.
3. once it boils, reduce the heat to low and cover the pot. cook for about 15-20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and most of the liquid is absorbed.
4. remove the pot from the heat and let the rice sit covered for another 5 minutes to allow it to steam.
5. fluff the rice with a fork to separate the grains and remove the pandan leaf (if used).
6. divide the rice into two portions, approximately 1 cup each.
7. serve each portion of coconut rice with cucumber slices, tomato slices, a hard-boiled egg, roasted peanuts, fried anchovies, and sambal sauce.
8. enjoy your delicious malaysian nasi lemak!

note: make sure to adjust the portion sizes and additional condiments as per your dietary requirements and preferences.
ingredients_list: jasmine, rice, coconut, milk, water, pandan, leaf, salt, cucumber, tomato, boiled, egg, roasted, peanut, anchovy, ikan, bilis, sambal, sauce

title: Swedish pancakes with lingonberry jam
raw_text: 77. Swedish pancakes with lingonberry jam - 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Sweden
ingredients:
swedish pancakes with lingonberry jam:

ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 2 cups milk
- 3 large eggs
- 1 tablespoon melted butter
- lingonberry jam (for serving)
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, and salt.
2. in a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, eggs, and melted butter.
3. gradually pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients while whisking, until well combined and smooth.
4. heat a non-stick skillet or pancake griddle over medium heat.
5. pour a ladleful of the pancake batter onto the skillet and swirl it around to form a thin pancake.
6. cook for about 2-3 minutes, or until the edges start to turn golden and the top looks set.
7. flip the pancake carefully using a spatula and cook for another 1-2 minutes on the other side.
8. transfer the cooked pancake to a plate and keep warm.
9. repeat the process with the remaining batter until all the pancakes are cooked.
10. serve the swedish pancakes warm with a generous dollop of lingonberry jam on top.
11. enjoy this delicious swedish treat!

title: Filipino champorado (chocolate rice porridge)
raw_text: 78. Filipino champorado (chocolate rice porridge) - 300 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Philippines
ingredients:
filipino champorado (chocolate rice porridge):

ingredients:
- 1/2 cup glutinous rice
- 2 cups water
- 2 tablespoons cocoa powder
- 4 tablespoons sugar
- 1/4 cup evaporated milk
- pinch of salt
- toppings (optional): condensed milk, dried fish, tuyo, or salted dried fish
preparation:
1. rinse the glutinous rice under running water until the water runs clear.
2. in a medium-sized pot, combine the rinsed rice and water. bring it to a boil over medium heat.
3. once boiling, reduce the heat to low and cover the pot. let the rice cook for about 15 minutes or until the rice is tender, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking.
4. in a small bowl, whisk together the cocoa powder, sugar, and a pinch of salt with a little water to create a smooth chocolate mixture.
5. add the chocolate mixture to the pot of cooked rice. stir well to combine.
6. continue to cook the champorado over low heat for another 10 minutes, or until it reaches your desired consistency. add more water if needed.
7. remove from heat and stir in the evaporated milk. taste and adjust sweetness according to your preference by adding more sugar if desired.
8. serve the champorado hot in bowls. optional: drizzle condensed milk on top and serve with dried fish, tuyo, or salted dried fish on the side.
9. enjoy your delicious filipino champorado!
ingredients_list: filipino, champorado, chocolate, rice, porridge, glutinous, rice, water, cocoa, powder, sugar, evaporated, milk, pinch, salt, topping, condensed, milk, dried, fish, tuyo, salted, dried, fish

title: Lebanese fatteh (pita chips soaked in yogurt and topped with nuts)
raw_text: 79. Lebanese fatteh (pita chips soaked in yogurt and topped with nuts) - 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Lebanon
ingredients:
lebanese fatteh recipe:

ingredients:
- 2 medium-sized pita bread
- 1 cup plain yogurt
- 1 cup vegetable or chicken broth
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 tablespoon butter
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup chopped pistachios (or any nuts of your choice)
- fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. cut the pita bread into small bite-sized pieces or triangles.
3. arrange the pita pieces on a baking sheet and bake for about 10-15 minutes until they are crispy and golden brown. set aside.
4. in a small saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. add the minced garlic and sauté until fragrant, for about 1-2 minutes.
5. add the vegetable or chicken broth, cumin, and salt to the saucepan. stir well and bring to a simmer.
6. once simmering, turn off the heat and let the broth mixture cool down for a few minutes.
7. in a serving dish or individual bowls, layer half of the baked pita chips.
8. pour half of the cooled-off broth mixture over the pita chips, allowing them to soak for a couple of minutes.
9. spread half of the plain yogurt over the soaked pita chips.
10. repeat steps 7-9 for the second portion.
11. sprinkle the chopped nuts over the yogurt layers.
12. lastly, garnish with fresh parsley.
13. serve immediately and enjoy your lebanese fatteh!
ingredients_list: lebanese, fatteh, pita, bread, plain, yogurt, vegetable, chicken, broth, garlic, clove, minced, butter, ground, cumin, salt, pistachio, nut, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Singaporean kaya toast
raw_text: 82. Singaporean kaya toast - 300 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Singapore
ingredients:
singaporean kaya toast:

ingredients:
- 4 slices of white bread
- 4 tablespoons kaya (coconut jam)
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 2 soft-boiled eggs
- soy sauce (optional)
- 1 cup strong black tea or coffee (optional)
preparation:
1. toast the slices of white bread until they are golden brown and crispy.
2. spread one tablespoon of butter evenly on each slice of toasted bread.
3. spread two tablespoons of kaya on two slices of the buttered bread.
4. place the remaining two slices of buttered bread on top to form two sandwiches.
5. cut each sandwich into two triangular halves.
6. serve the kaya toast with a side of soft-boiled eggs.
7. to soft-boil eggs, bring a small pot of water to a boil. carefully add two eggs and let them cook for 6 minutes. remove the eggs from the boiling water and place them in an egg cup or small bowl. crack the top of the egg with a spoon and drizzle soy sauce over it for added flavor.
8. serve the kaya toast and soft-boiled eggs with a cup of strong black tea or coffee, if desired.
9. enjoy your delicious singaporean kaya toast!
ingredients_list: singaporean, kaya, toast, white, bread, kaya, coconut, jam, butter, boiled, egg, soy, sauce, strong, black, tea, coffee

title: Israeli shakshuka with feta cheese
raw_text: 83. Israeli shakshuka with feta cheese - 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: Israel
ingredients:
israeli shakshuka with feta cheese:

ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, diced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional, for heat)
- 1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 4 large eggs
- 2 ounces feta cheese, crumbled
- fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium heat.
2. add the diced onion and bell pepper to the skillet and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. stir in the minced garlic, cumin, paprika, and cayenne pepper (if using) and cook for an additional minute.
4. pour in the diced tomatoes with their juices and season with salt and pepper. bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for about 10-15 minutes, until slightly thickened.
5. make four small wells in the tomato mixture and crack an egg into each well. season the eggs with salt and pepper.
6. cover the skillet and let the eggs poach in the tomato mixture for about 5-7 minutes, until the whites are set but the yolks are still runny.
7. sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese over the top of the shakshuka and garnish with fresh parsley.
8. serve the shakshuka hot with crusty bread or pita on the side. enjoy!

origin: shakshuka is a popular dish in israeli and middle eastern cuisine. it is believed to have originated in north africa and has since been adapted and loved by many cultures around the world.

title: Brazilian tapioca pancake filled with cheese
raw_text: 84. Brazilian tapioca pancake filled with cheese - 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Brazil
ingredients:
brazilian tapioca pancake filled with cheese:

ingredients:
- 1 cup tapioca flour
- pinch of salt
- 1 cup water
- 1 cup shredded cheese (such as mozzarella or cheddar)
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine tapioca flour and salt.
2. gradually add water to the dry mixture while stirring constantly. mix until the batter becomes homogeneous and forms a soft dough-like consistency.
3. heat a non-stick skillet or a tapioca pancake pan over medium heat.
4. scoop half of the tapioca batter onto the hot skillet, spreading it evenly to form a thin layer.
5. allow the pancake to cook for about 1-2 minutes, or until the edges start to lift and become golden brown.
6. sprinkle half of the shredded cheese over one half of the pancake.
7. fold the other half of the pancake over the cheese, creating a half-moon shape.
8. press down gently with a spatula to seal and allow the cheese to melt.
9. cook for another minute or until the cheese has completely melted and the pancake turns slightly crispy.
10. carefully transfer the tapioca pancake to a plate and repeat the process for the second portion.
11. serve the brazilian tapioca pancake filled with cheese immediately, while still warm and crispy.

enjoy your delicious brazilian tapioca pancake filled with cheese!
ingredients_list: brazilian, tapioca, pancake, filled, cheese, tapioca, flour, pinch, salt, water, shredded, cheese, mozzarella, cheddar

title: Sri Lankan hoppers with coconut sambol
raw_text: 85. Sri Lankan hoppers with coconut sambol - 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Sri Lanka
ingredients:
: sri lanka

ingredients:
- 1 cup rice flour
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour (gluten-containing)
- 1/2 teaspoon active dry yeast
- 1/2 teaspoon sugar
- 1/2 cup coconut milk
- 1/2 cup water
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- oil for frying

for coconut sambol:
- 1 cup grated coconut
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 1 green chili, finely chopped
- 2 tablespoons lime juice
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, combine the active dry yeast, sugar, and 2 tablespoons of warm water. let it sit for about 5 minutes until it becomes frothy.

2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the rice flour, all-purpose flour, coconut milk, water, salt, and yeast mixture. mix well to form a smooth batter. cover the bowl and let it rest in a warm place for 2 hours to allow the batter to ferment.

3. after 2 hours, heat a hopper pan or a small non-stick frying pan over medium heat. brush some oil on the pan to grease it lightly.

4. pour a ladleful of the batter into the center of the pan, rotating the pan in a circular motion to spread the batter evenly and create a thin, lace-like pancake. cover the pan with a lid and cook for about 2-3 minutes until the edges start to crisp up and the center is cooked through.

5. carefully lift the hopper from the pan using a spatula. repeat the process with the remaining batter to make additional hoppers.

6. for the coconut sambol, in a separate bowl, mix the grated coconut, chopped onion, green chili, lime juice, and salt. mix well until the ingredients are evenly combined.

7. serve the hoppers warm with coconut sambol on the side. enjoy!

note: the nutrition information provided is an estimate and may vary depending on the specific ingredients used.
ingredients_list: sri, lanka, rice, flour, flour, gluten, containing, yeast, sugar, coconut, milk, water, salt, coconut, sambol, coconut, onion, green, chili, lime, salt

title: Rwandan akabenz (fried plantains) with yogurt
raw_text: 87. Rwandan akabenz (fried plantains) with yogurt - 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: Rwanda
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 ripe plantains
- vegetable oil for frying
- salt to taste
- 1 cup plain yogurt
preparation:
1. peel the plantains and cut them into thick slices.
2. heat vegetable oil in a frying pan over medium heat.
3. fry the plantain slices in the hot oil until they turn golden brown and crispy on both sides. make sure to fry them in batches to avoid overcrowding the pan.
4. once fried, remove the plantain slices from the pan and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.
5. sprinkle the fried plantains with salt to taste.
6. serve the akabenz (fried plantains) hot with a side of plain yogurt for dipping or topping.
7. enjoy your rwandan akabenz with yogurt!
ingredients_list: plantain, vegetable, salt, taste, plain, yogurt

title: Jamaican ackee and saltfish with Johnny cakes
raw_text: 88. Jamaican ackee and saltfish with Johnny cakes - 450 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Jamaica
ingredients:
jamaican ackee and saltfish:

ingredients:
- 1 can of ackee
- 8 oz salted codfish
- 1 small onion, diced
- 1 medium tomato, diced
- 1 small bell pepper, diced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 teaspoon thyme leaves
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
- scotch bonnet pepper (optional for heat)
- salt to taste


1. start by soaking the salted codfish in water overnight to remove excess salt. rinse and shred the codfish into small pieces.
2. in a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. add the diced onions, bell pepper, tomato, and minced garlic. sauté until the vegetables are softened and fragrant.
3. add the shredded codfish to the skillet and stir until well combined with the vegetables. cook for about 5 minutes.
4. drain and rinse the canned ackee, then gently add it to the skillet. be careful not to break up the ackee too much during cooking. stir gently to combine with the other ingredients.
5. season with thyme, black pepper, and salt to taste. if desired, add a scotch bonnet pepper for extra heat.
6. cover the skillet and simmer for about 10-15 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together. stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
7. taste and adjust seasonings if needed. serve hot with johnny cakes.

johnny cakes:

ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, cold and cut into small pieces
- 1/3 cup milk
preparation:
1. start by soaking the salted codfish in water overnight to remove excess salt. rinse and shred the codfish into small pieces.
2. in a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. add the diced onions, bell pepper, tomato, and minced garlic. sauté until the vegetables are softened and fragrant.
3. add the shredded codfish to the skillet and stir until well combined with the vegetables. cook for about 5 minutes.
4. drain and rinse the canned ackee, then gently add it to the skillet. be careful not to break up the ackee too much during cooking. stir gently to combine with the other ingredients.
5. season with thyme, black pepper, and salt to taste. if desired, add a scotch bonnet pepper for extra heat.
6. cover the skillet and simmer for about 10-15 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together. stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
7. taste and adjust seasonings if needed. serve hot with johnny cakes.

johnny cakes:

ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, cold and cut into small pieces
- 1/3 cup milk

preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. stir well to combine.
2. add the cold butter pieces to the dry ingredients. using your fingertips or a pastry cutter, work the butter into the flour mixture until it resembles coarse crumbs.
3. slowly add the milk, stirring until a soft dough forms. do not overmix.
4. turn the dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead it gently for a minute or two. be careful not to overwork the dough.
5. roll out the dough to about 1/2 inch thickness. use a round cookie cutter or a glass to cut out small circles.
6. heat a skillet or griddle over medium heat and lightly grease it with oil or butter.
7. place the johnny cakes onto the heated skillet and cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side until golden brown.
8. remove from the skillet and serve hot alongside the jamaican ackee and saltfish.

enjoy your delicious jamaican ackee and saltfish with johnny cakes!

title: Finnish Karelian pasties with egg butter
raw_text: 89. Finnish Karelian pasties with egg butter - 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Finland
ingredients:
finnish karelian pasties with egg butter:

ingredients:
- 1 cup rye flour
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2/3 cup warm water
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, softened
- 2 hard-boiled eggs, finely chopped
- salt, to taste
- freshly ground black pepper, to taste
- chopped fresh parsley, for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the rye flour, all-purpose flour, and salt.

2. gradually add warm water and mix well until a dough forms. knead the dough on a floured surface for about 5 minutes until smooth and elastic.

3. divide the dough into 4 equal portions and shape each portion into a ball. cover them with a clean kitchen towel and let them rest for 30 minutes.

4. in a separate bowl, mix together the softened butter, chopped hard-boiled eggs, salt, and freshly ground black pepper. this will be your egg butter filling.

5. preheat the oven to 475°f (245°c).

6. take one portion of the dough and roll it out into a thin circle on a lightly floured surface. the thinner the dough, the better. cut the circle into an oval shape.

7. place a generous spoonful of the egg butter filling onto the center of the oval dough. fold the sides of the dough over the filling, leaving the center exposed.

8. transfer the pasty onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. repeat the process with the remaining dough and egg butter filling.

9. bake the karelian pasties in the preheated oven for about 10-12 minutes, or until they turn golden brown.

10. once done, remove the pasties from the oven and let them cool slightly. sprinkle with chopped fresh parsley, if desired.

11. serve warm or at room temperature. enjoy your finnish karelian pasties with egg butter!

note: this recipe makes 2 portions, and each portion contains approximately 350 calories.
ingredients_list: finnish, karelian, pasty, egg, butter, rye, flour, flour, salt, water, vegetable, unsalted, butter, boiled, egg, salt, taste, freshly, ground, black, pepper, taste, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Afghan bolani (stuffed flatbread) with yogurt sauce
raw_text: 91. Afghan bolani (stuffed flatbread) with yogurt sauce - 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Afghanistan
ingredients:
afghan bolani (stuffed flatbread) with yogurt sauce:
ingredients:
- for the bolani:
1 cup all-purpose flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 cup water
2 tablespoons vegetable oil
1/2 cup mashed potatoes
1/4 cup finely chopped green onions
1/4 cup chopped cilantro
1/2 teaspoon ground cumin
1/4 teaspoon ground coriander
salt and pepper to taste
vegetable oil for frying

- for the yogurt sauce:
1/2 cup plain yogurt
1 clove garlic, minced
1/2 tablespoon lemon juice
salt to taste
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour and salt for the bolani. gradually add water and mix until the dough comes together. knead the dough on a lightly floured surface for about 5 minutes until smooth. cover and let it rest for 30 minutes.

2. in a separate bowl, combine the mashed potatoes, green onions, cilantro, ground cumin, ground coriander, salt, and pepper. mix well to combine all the ingredients evenly.

3. divide the dough into two equal portions. roll out each portion into a thin circle on a floured surface. place half of the potato mixture on one half of the dough circle, leaving a small border around the edges.

4. fold the other half of the dough over the filling and press the edges to seal. repeat the same process with the remaining dough and filling.

5. heat vegetable oil in a frying pan over medium heat. carefully place the bolani in the pan and cook for about 4-5 minutes on each side until golden brown and crispy. transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain any excess oil.

6. in a small bowl, whisk together the plain yogurt, minced garlic, lemon juice, and salt to make the yogurt sauce.

7. serve the hot bolani with the yogurt sauce on the side. enjoy!

note: this recipe serves 2 portions, and each portion contains approximately 350 calories. it is important to note that this recipe contains gluten and dairy. afghan bolani is a traditional dish from afghanistan.
ingredients_list: afghan, bolani, stuffed, flatbread, yogurt, sauce, bolani, flour, salt, water, vegetable, potato, green, onion, cilantro, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, salt, pepper, taste, vegetable, yogurt, sauce, plain, yogurt, clove, garlic, minced, lemon, salt, taste

title: Vietnamese banh mi sandwich with eggs
raw_text: 92. Vietnamese banh mi sandwich with eggs - 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Vietnam
ingredients:
vietnamese banh mi sandwich with eggs - 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: vietnam

ingredients:
- 2 large baguettes (or 4 small baguettes)
- 4 large eggs
- 1 cup shredded carrots
- 1 cup sliced cucumber
- 1 cup sliced jalapenos
- 1/2 cup fresh cilantro leaves
- 1/4 cup thinly sliced red onion
- 1/4 cup mayonnaise
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons rice vinegar
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. cut the baguettes in half lengthwise, then place them on a baking sheet. toast them in the oven for about 5 minutes until they are slightly crispy on the outside.
3. in a small bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, and minced garlic until well combined. set aside as the sauce for the banh mi.
4. heat the vegetable oil in a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. crack the eggs into the skillet and cook them to your desired doneness (e.g., sunny side up or over easy). remove from heat and set aside.
5. to assemble the banh mi, spread a generous amount of the sauce on the inside of each baguette. place a cooked egg on one side of the bread and layer on the shredded carrots, sliced cucumber, sliced jalapenos, cilantro leaves, and red onion.
6. close the sandwich by pressing the other half of the baguette on top.
7. repeat for the second portion.
8. serve the banh mi sandwiches immediately and enjoy!

note: you can add additional ingredients such as grilled pork, chicken, or tofu for added protein and flavor.
ingredients_list: vietnamese, banh, sandwich, egg, calorie, portion, gluten, origin, vietnam, baguette, baguette, egg, shredded, carrot, cucumber, jalapeno, fresh, cilantro, leaf, thinly, red, onion, mayonnaise, soy, sauce, rice, vinegar, sugar, clove, garlic, minced, vegetable

title: Egyptian feteer meshaltet (layered pastry) with honey
raw_text: 94. Egyptian feteer meshaltet (layered pastry) with honey - 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Egypt
ingredients:
egyptian feteer meshaltet (layered pastry) with honey:

ingredients:
- 250g all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon instant yeast
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 150ml water
- 3 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted
- honey, for drizzling
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, combine the flour, instant yeast, and salt.
2. gradually add water while kneading until a soft dough forms. you may need more or less water depending on the humidity of your kitchen.
3. knead the dough on a lightly floured surface for about 5-7 minutes until it becomes smooth and elastic.
4. divide the dough into 2 equal portions and shape them into balls. cover with a clean kitchen towel and let them rest for 15 minutes.
5. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
6. roll out one portion of the dough on a floured surface into a thin circle or rectangle, about 1/8 inch thick.
7. brush the surface with melted butter, making sure to cover it evenly.
8. fold the dough in half, and then fold it in half again to create a quarter circle or rectangle.
9. roll out the folded dough once again into a thin circle or rectangle.
10. brush the surface with more melted butter and fold it in half and then quarter once more.
11. repeat the rolling, brushing with butter, and folding process for a third time.
12. place the layered dough onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
13. repeat steps 6-12 with the second portion of the dough.
14. bake the feteers in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes or until they turn golden brown and crispy.
15. remove the feteers from the oven and drizzle them generously with honey.
16. allow the feteers to cool slightly before serving.
17. cut each feteer into portions and enjoy!

note: this recipe yields 2 portions, each containing approximately 400 calories per serving.
ingredients_list: egyptian, feteer, meshaltet, layered, pastry, honey, flour, yeast, salt, water, unsalted, butter, honey, drizzling

title: Haitian pain patate (sweet potato bread)
raw_text: 95. Haitian pain patate (sweet potato bread) - 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Haiti
ingredients:
haitian pain patate (sweet potato bread):

ingredients:
- 1 large sweet potato (about 1 lb)
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup brown sugar
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
