- 1/4 cup vegetable oil
- 1/4 cup milk
- 1/4 cup raisins (optional)
- 1/4 cup chopped walnuts (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c) and grease a loaf pan or line it with parchment paper.
2. peel the sweet potato and cut it into chunks. place the sweet potato chunks in a pot with enough water to cover them. boil the sweet potatoes until they are tender.
3. drain the boiled sweet potatoes and mash them using a fork or potato masher until smooth. let the mashed sweet potatoes cool slightly.
4. in a large bowl, combine the flour, brown sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
5. add the mashed sweet potatoes, vegetable oil, and milk to the bowl. stir until all the ingredients are well combined.
6. if desired, fold in the raisins and chopped walnuts into the batter.
7. pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
8. bake in the preheated oven for about 50-60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
9. remove the bread from the oven and let it cool in the pan for 10 minutes. then, transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely before slicing and serving.
10. enjoy the haitian pain patate as a delicious snack or breakfast option!

note: the provided recipe is for 2 portions, and the estimated calorie count is approximately 350 calories per portion.
ingredients_list: haitian, pain, patate, sweet, potato, bread, sweet, potato, flour, brown, sugar, baking, powder, ground, cinnamon, ground, nutmeg, salt, vegetable, milk, raisin, walnut

title: Iraqi masgouf (grilled fish) with flatbread
raw_text: 96. Iraqi masgouf (grilled fish) with flatbread - 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Iraq
ingredients:
: iraqi

ingredients:
- 2 whole fish, such as carp or catfish (about 1 pound each)
- 1 lemon, sliced
- salt, to taste
- 1 tablespoon ground cumin
- 1 tablespoon paprika
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- flatbread, for serving
preparation:
1. clean and gut the fish, removing the scales and innards. make a few diagonal cuts on each side of the fish to help it cook evenly.
2. preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
3. place the sliced lemon inside the cavity of each fish, and sprinkle salt on both sides.
4. in a small bowl, combine the cumin, paprika, minced garlic, and olive oil. mix well to form a paste.
5. rub the spice paste all over the fish, making sure to get it into the cuts.
6. place the fish on the preheated grill and cook for about 5-7 minutes per side, or until the fish is fully cooked and slightly charred.
7. while the fish is grilling, warm the flatbread on the grill for a few seconds on each side.
8. once the fish is cooked, remove it from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes.
9. serve the grilled fish with warm flatbread on the side.

enjoy your delicious iraqi masgouf!
ingredients_list: iraqi, whole, fish, carp, catfish, lemon, salt, taste, ground, cumin, paprika, clove, garlic, minced, olive, flatbread

title: Bangladeshi panta bhat (fermented rice) with fried hilsa fish
raw_text: 97. Bangladeshi panta bhat (fermented rice) with fried hilsa fish - 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Bangladesh
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup of leftover cooked rice (preferably parboiled)
- 2 cups of water
- 1 teaspoon of salt
- 2 hilsa fish fillets, cleaned and cut into pieces
- 2 tablespoons of mustard oil
- ½ teaspoon of turmeric powder
- ½ teaspoon of chili powder
- salt to taste
- oil for frying
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, add the leftover cooked rice and water. mix well and let it soak for about 6-8 hours or overnight to ferment.

2. after the rice has fermented, drain the excess water and mash the rice with a fork or your hands until it becomes a coarse paste. add salt and mix well. this is the panta bhat base.

3. in a separate bowl, marinate the hilsa fish fillets with turmeric powder, chili powder, and salt. make sure the fish pieces are evenly coated with the spices.

4. heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat. fry the marinated hilsa fish until they turn golden brown and crispy. remove from the pan and set aside.

5. in the same pan, add mustard oil and heat it up. add the panta bhat base to the pan and cook it for a few minutes until it becomes soft and heated through.

6. divide the panta bhat into two portions and serve each portion with a fried hilsa fish fillet on top.

enjoy your bangladeshi panta bhat with fried hilsa fish, a traditional and delicious dish from bangladesh!
ingredients_list: leftover, rice, preferably, parboiled, water, salt, hilsa, fish, fillet, piece, mustard, turmeric, powder, chili, powder, salt, taste

title: Maltese pastizzi (ricotta
raw_text: 98. Maltese pastizzi (ricotta-filled pastries) - 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Malta
ingredients:
maltese pastizzi (ricotta-filled pastries)

ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, cold and cubed
- 1/2 cup cold water
- 1 cup ricotta cheese
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 egg, beaten (for egg wash)
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour and salt together. add the cold cubed butter and use your fingers or a pastry cutter to mix until the mixture forms coarse crumbs.
2. gradually add the cold water, a little at a time, and mix until the dough comes together. knead the dough for a few minutes until it becomes smooth and elastic.
3. divide the dough into two equal portions and shape each portion into a round disc. wrap them in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
4. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
5. in a mixing bowl, combine the ricotta cheese with salt and pepper to taste. mix well until all the ingredients are evenly incorporated.
6. on a lightly floured surface, roll out one disc of dough to around 1/8 inch (3mm) thickness. use a round cutter or a glass to cut out circles with a diameter of about 4 inches (10cm).
7. spoon a tablespoon of the ricotta filling onto one half of each circle. fold the other half of the circle over the filling and press the edges together to seal. you can use a fork to crimp the edges if desired.
8. place the filled pastries onto the prepared baking sheet. repeat the process with the remaining dough and filling.
9. brush the pastizzi with the beaten egg wash to give them a golden color when baked.
10. bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes or until the pastizzi are golden brown and crispy.
11. remove from the oven and let them cool slightly before serving. enjoy the maltese pastizzi warm as a delicious snack or appetizer.

note: it is important to note that this recipe contains gluten and dairy. if you have any dietary restrictions or allergies, please adapt the recipe accordingly.
ingredients_list: maltese, pastizzi, ricotta, filled, pastry, flour, salt, unsalted, butter, water, ricotta, cheese, salt, pepper, taste, egg, egg, wash

title: Algerian msemen (pan fried dough) with honey
raw_text:
100. Algerian msemen (pan fried dough) with honey - 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Algeria

Please note that these calorie counts are approximate and may vary based on specific ingredients and portion sizes.
ingredients:
algerian msemen with honey recipe:

ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 1 teaspoon yeast
- 1 cup warm water
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 2 tablespoons melted butter
- honey, for serving
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine flour, salt, sugar, and yeast. mix well.
2. gradually add warm water to the dry ingredients, stirring with a spoon or your hands, until a sticky dough forms.
3. knead the dough on a lightly floured surface for about 5 minutes or until it becomes smooth and elastic.
4. divide the dough into 2 equal portions and shape them into balls.
5. in a small bowl, mix together vegetable oil and melted butter.
6. place each dough ball on a clean, oiled surface and flatten it with your hands to form a thin rectangle.
7. brush the dough with the oil and butter mixture, ensuring it is evenly coated.
8. starting from one side, fold the dough into thirds like a letter, then fold the ends towards the center to form a smaller rectangle.
9. repeat the folding process with the second dough ball.
10. cover the dough rectangles with a clean cloth and let them rest for about 30 minutes.
11. heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat.
12. roll out each dough rectangle into a thin square or circle, approximately 1/8 inch in thickness.
13. place the msemen in the heated skillet and cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side until golden brown and crispy.
14. remove the msemen from the skillet and let them cool for a few minutes.
15. cut each msemen into smaller squares or triangles.
16. drizzle honey over the msemen pieces, and serve warm.

enjoy your delicious algerian msemen with honey!
ingredients_list: algerian, msemen, honey, flour, salt, sugar, yeast, water, vegetable, butter, honey

title: Omelette with Spinach and Feta
raw_text: 4. Omelette with Spinach and Feta: 300kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains dairy, originated in France.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 3 large eggs
- 1 cup fresh spinach, chopped
- 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
preparation:
1. in a medium-sized bowl, beat the eggs until well combined.
2. stir in the chopped spinach and crumbled feta cheese.
3. season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
4. heat the olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
5. pour the egg mixture into the skillet and spread it evenly.
6. cook the omelette for about 3-4 minutes, or until the bottom is golden brown.
7. gently flip the omelette using a spatula and cook for an additional 2 minutes on the other side, until cooked through.
8. remove the omelette from the skillet and cut into wedges.
9. serve hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: egg, fresh, spinach, feta, cheese, salt, pepper, taste, olive

title: Scrambled Eggs with Smoked Salmon
raw_text: 6. Scrambled Eggs with Smoked Salmon: 350kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains dairy and fish, originated in the United States.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large eggs
- 100g smoked salmon
- salt, to taste
- black pepper, to taste
- 2 tablespoons butter
- fresh dill, for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. crack the eggs into a bowl and beat them until well combined. season with salt and black pepper.
2. slice the smoked salmon into thin strips or small pieces.
3. heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and add the butter. allow it to melt and evenly coat the surface of the skillet.
4. pour the beaten eggs into the skillet and stir gently with a spatula or wooden spoon.
5. as the eggs start to set, add the smoked salmon to the skillet. continue to stir, folding the salmon into the eggs.
6. cook the eggs to your desired consistency, taking care not to overcook or dry them out.
7. remove the skillet from heat and transfer the scrambled eggs with smoked salmon to serving plates.
8. garnish with fresh dill, if desired.
9. serve hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: egg, smoked, salmon, salt, taste, black, pepper, taste, butter, fresh, dill, garnish

title: Breakfast Burrito
raw_text: 9. Breakfast Burrito: 500kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, originated in Mexico.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large tortillas
- 6 eggs, beaten
- 1/2 cup diced onions
- 1/2 cup diced bell peppers
- 1/2 cup diced tomatoes
- 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 1/4 cup chopped cilantro
- salt and pepper, to taste
- cooking oil
preparation:
1. heat a small amount of oil in a skillet over medium heat.
2. add the onions and bell peppers to the skillet and sauté until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
3. add the diced tomatoes to the skillet and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
4. pour the beaten eggs into the skillet and scramble them with the vegetables. season with salt and pepper.
5. once the eggs are cooked through, remove the skillet from heat.
6. warm tortillas in a microwave or on a skillet until pliable.
7. divide the egg mixture evenly among the tortillas, placing it in the center of each one.
8. sprinkle shredded cheddar cheese and chopped cilantro over the egg mixture.
9. fold the sides of the tortillas over the filling, then roll them up tightly into burritos.
10. optionally, you can heat the burritos in a skillet or microwave for a few seconds to melt the cheese.
11. serve hot and enjoy your breakfast burritos!
ingredients_list: tortilla, egg, onion, bell, pepper, tomato, shredded, cheddar, cheese, cilantro, salt, pepper, taste

title: Smashed Avocado and Egg Toast
raw_text: 12. Smashed Avocado and Egg Toast: 400kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, originated in Australia.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 ripe avocado
- 2 slices of bread
- 2 eggs
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. begin by toasting the bread slices until golden brown on both sides.
2. while the bread is toasting, cut the avocado in half and remove the pit. scoop out the flesh into a small bowl.
3. use a fork to smash the avocado, leaving some small chunks for texture.
4. add salt and pepper to taste, and mix well.
5. in a separate pan, fry the eggs to your desired level of doneness (such as sunny side up or over easy).
6. once the bread slices are toasted, spread a generous amount of the smashed avocado mixture onto each slice.
7. carefully place a fried egg on top of each slice of avocado-covered toast.
8. sprinkle with additional salt and pepper if desired.
9. serve the smashed avocado and egg toast immediately and enjoy!
ingredients_list: avocado, bread, egg, salt, pepper, taste

title: Homemade Granola with Yogurt
raw_text: 14. Homemade Granola with Yogurt: 350kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains nuts and dairy, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:

- 2 cups rolled oats
- 1/2 cup sliced almonds
- 1/2 cup dried cranberries
- 1/4 cup honey
- 1/4 cup maple syrup
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- pinch of salt
- yogurt, for serving
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 325°f (160°c). line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the oats, almonds, cranberries, honey, maple syrup, vegetable oil, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and salt. mix well until all the ingredients are evenly coated.

3. spread the mixture onto the prepared baking sheet in an even layer.

4. bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the granola turns golden brown, stirring halfway through to ensure even browning.

5. remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the granola cool completely. it will harden as it cools.

6. once the granola is cooled, break it into small clusters and store in an airtight container.

7. serve the homemade granola with your favorite yogurt, and enjoy!

note: you can also add additional toppings such as fresh fruits, nuts, or a drizzle of honey if desired.
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, almond, dried, cranberry, honey, maple, syrup, vegetable, vanilla, extract, ground, cinnamon, pinch, salt, yogurt

title: Banana and Almond Butter Toast
raw_text: 16. Banana and Almond Butter Toast: 250kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and nuts, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 ripe banana
- 2 slices of bread (white, whole wheat, or your preference)
- 2 tablespoons almond butter
preparation:
1. start by toasting the bread slices until they are golden brown and crispy.
2. while the bread is toasting, peel the ripe banana and slice it into thin rounds.
3. once the toast is ready, spread 1 tablespoon of almond butter on each slice.
4. arrange the banana slices on top of the almond butter, evenly distributing them.
5. serve immediately and enjoy your delicious banana and almond butter toast.
ingredients_list: banana, bread, white, whole, wheat, preference, almond, butter

title: Sausage and Egg Breakfast Sandwich
raw_text: 18. Sausage and Egg Breakfast Sandwich: 450kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 english muffins
- 4 sausage patties
- 4 eggs
- 2 slices of cheese
- salt and pepper to taste
- butter for toasting the muffins
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. heat a skillet over medium heat and cook the sausage patties until browned and cooked through.
3. in a separate non-stick skillet, melt a little butter over medium heat.
4. crack the eggs into the skillet and season with salt and pepper. cook until the whites are set but the yolks are still slightly runny.
5. while the eggs are cooking, split the english muffins and toast them until golden brown.
6. once the muffins are toasted, place a slice of cheese on the bottom half of each muffin. this will help it melt slightly from the residual heat.
7. assemble the sandwich by placing one sausage patty on top of the cheese, followed by a cooked egg. top with the other half of the english muffin.
8. repeat the process with the remaining ingredients to make the second sandwich.
9. place the assembled breakfast sandwiches on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for about 5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted.
10. remove from the oven and let cool slightly before serving.
11. enjoy your delicious sausage and egg breakfast sandwich!
ingredients_list: muffin, sausage, patty, egg, cheese, salt, pepper, taste, butter, toasting, muffin

title: Breakfast Quesadilla
raw_text: 22. Breakfast Quesadilla: 400kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, originated in Mexico.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large flour tortillas
- 4 large eggs
- 1/4 cup milk
- 1/2 cup shredded cheese (cheddar, mozzarella, or your choice)
- 1/2 cup chopped vegetables (bell peppers, onions, tomatoes, etc.)
- salt and pepper to taste
- cooking spray or butter for greasing
preparation:
1. in a bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, and pepper until well combined.
2. heat a lightly greased non-stick skillet over medium heat.
3. pour the egg mixture into the skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, until the eggs are scrambled and cooked through. remove from heat.
4. lay the tortillas flat on a clean surface. divide the scrambled eggs, shredded cheese, and chopped vegetables evenly between the tortillas, placing the fillings on one half of each tortilla.
5. fold the empty half of each tortilla over the filling, creating a half-moon shape.
6. wipe clean the skillet and return it to medium heat.
7. carefully transfer the quesadillas to the skillet and cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until the tortillas are toasted and the cheese is melted.
8. remove from heat and let cool for a minute. cut into wedges and serve hot.
9. optional: serve with salsa, sour cream, or guacamole as desired.

enjoy your delicious breakfast quesadilla!
ingredients_list: flour, tortilla, egg, milk, shredded, cheese, cheddar, mozzarella, vegetable, bell, pepper, onion, tomato, salt, pepper, taste, spray, butter, greasing

title: English Breakfast
raw_text: 24. English Breakfast: 600kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, originated in the United Kingdom.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 eggs
- 2 slices of bacon
- 2 sausages
- 1 tomato
- 1 cup of mushrooms
- 2 slices of bread
- butter
- salt
- pepper
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 200°c (400°f).
2. place the bacon and sausages on a baking tray and cook in the oven for 15-20 minutes, or until crispy and cooked through.
3. while the bacon and sausages are cooking, heat a knob of butter in a frying pan over medium heat.
4. add the mushrooms to the pan and cook for about 5 minutes, until they are browned and soft.
5. cut the tomato in half and add it to the pan with the mushrooms, cut-side down. cook for 2-3 minutes, until the tomato is slightly charred.
6. remove the bacon and sausages from the oven and set aside. keep them warm.
7. in the same frying pan, fry the eggs in a little butter until the whites are set but the yolks are still runny. season with salt and pepper.
8. while the eggs are cooking, toast the bread slices and spread with butter.
9. arrange the cooked bacon, sausages, mushrooms, fried eggs, and tomato on a plate.
10. serve the english breakfast with the toast on the side.

enjoy your classic english breakfast!
ingredients_list: egg, bacon, sausage, tomato, mushroom, bread, butter, salt, pepper

title: Bacon and Egg Muffins
raw_text: 26. Bacon and Egg Muffins: 450kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, originated in the United States.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 6 slices of bacon
- 6 large eggs
- 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c). lightly grease a muffin tin.
2. cook the bacon slices in a skillet over medium heat until crispy. remove the bacon from the skillet and drain on paper towels. chop the bacon into small pieces.
3. in a mixing bowl, beat the eggs. stir in the shredded cheese and season with salt and pepper.
4. divide the chopped bacon evenly among the muffin tin cups.
5. pour the egg mixture over the bacon in each muffin cup, filling them about 3/4 full.
6. bake in the preheated oven for about 15-18 minutes, or until the eggs are set.
7. remove the muffins from the oven and let them cool slightly before removing them from the muffin tin.
8. serve the bacon and egg muffins warm. enjoy!
ingredients_list: bacon, egg, shredded, cheddar, cheese, salt, pepper, taste

title: Breakfast Bruschetta
raw_text: 29. Breakfast Bruschetta: 350kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, originated in Italy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 slices of bread (such as french bread or baguette)
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 4 large eggs
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 avocado, sliced
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1/4 cup fresh basil leaves, chopped
- balsamic glaze, for drizzling
- optional toppings: crumbled feta cheese, sliced radishes
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. in a small bowl, mix the minced garlic with olive oil. set aside.
3. brush each slice of bread with the garlic-infused olive oil mixture on one side.
4. place the bread slices on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for about 5-7 minutes, or until the edges become golden and crispy. keep an eye on them to avoid burning.
5. while the bread is toasting, crack the eggs into a non-stick skillet over medium heat. cook until the whites are set but the yolks are still slightly runny, or until desired doneness. season with salt and pepper.
6. once the bread slices are toasted, remove them from the oven and let them cool slightly. 
7. top each slice with avocado slices, cherry tomato halves, and a cooked egg.
8. sprinkle chopped basil leaves over the top and drizzle with balsamic glaze.
9. optional: sprinkle crumbled feta cheese and sliced radishes on top for added flavor and texture.
10. serve immediately and enjoy your breakfast bruschetta!
ingredients_list: bread, french, bread, baguette, clove, garlic, minced, egg, olive, salt, pepper, taste, avocado, cherry, tomato, halved, fresh, basil, leaf, balsamic, glaze, drizzling, topping, feta, cheese, radish

title: Bagel with Cream Cheese and Smoked Salmon
raw_text: 31. Bagel with Cream Cheese and Smoked Salmon: 400kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, originated in the United States.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 bagel
- 2 tablespoons cream cheese
- 2 oz smoked salmon
- 1 tablespoon chopped fresh dill
- 1 tablespoon capers
- sliced red onion (optional)
preparation:
1. slice the bagel in half horizontally.
2. spread 1 tablespoon of cream cheese on each half of the bagel.
3. arrange the smoked salmon evenly on top of the cream cheese.
4. sprinkle chopped fresh dill and capers over the smoked salmon.
5. optionally, add some sliced red onion for extra flavor.
6. put the two halves of the bagel together.
7. serve and enjoy!
ingredients_list: bagel, cream, cheese, smoked, salmon, fresh, dill, caper, red, onion

title: Aloo Paratha
raw_text: 32. Aloo Paratha: 300kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, originated in India.
ingredients:
ingredients for aloo paratha:
- 2 cups whole wheat flour
- 2 medium-sized boiled potatoes
- 1 teaspoon cumin powder
- 1 teaspoon coriander powder
- 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
- 1/2 teaspoon garam masala (optional)
- salt to taste
- ghee or oil for cooking
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, add the whole wheat flour and a pinch of salt. gradually add water and knead it into a soft dough. set it aside for 10-15 minutes.
2. in a separate bowl, mash the boiled potatoes until smooth.
3. add cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala (if using), and salt to the mashed potatoes. mix well to combine all the ingredients.
4. divide the dough and potato mixture into equal-sized portions.
5. take one portion of dough and roll it into a small circle. place one portion of the potato mixture in the center of the dough.
6. bring the edges of the dough together and seal it tightly, ensuring that the potato mixture is fully enclosed.
7. gently flatten the stuffed dough using your hands and roll it out into a circular-shaped paratha. dust flour as needed while rolling to prevent sticking.
8. heat a tawa or griddle on medium heat. place the rolled paratha on the hot tawa.
9. cook the paratha on both sides, applying ghee or oil as needed until it turns golden brown and crispy.
10. repeat the above steps with the remaining dough and potato mixture to make more parathas.
11. serve the hot and delicious aloo parathas with yogurt, pickle, or any chutney of your choice. enjoy!
ingredients_list: whole, wheat, flour, boiled, potato, cumin, powder, coriander, powder, red, chili, powder, turmeric, powder, garam, masala, salt, taste, ghee

title: Breakfast Sushi
raw_text: 33. Breakfast Sushi: 350kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, originated in Japan.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large eggs
- 2 tablespoons milk
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 slices of whole wheat bread
- 4 tablespoons cream cheese
- 4 slices of smoked salmon
- 1 avocado, sliced
- 1 small cucumber, julienned
- soy sauce for serving
preparation:
1. in a bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, and pepper.
2. heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and pour in the egg mixture.
3. cook the eggs, gently stirring, until set but still slightly soft.
4. remove from heat and let the eggs cool slightly.
5. trim the crusts off the bread slices and flatten them with a rolling pin.
6. spread 1 tablespoon of cream cheese onto each bread slice.
7. place a slice of smoked salmon on top of the cream cheese.
8. arrange some scrambled eggs, avocado slices, and cucumber strips on the salmon.
9. starting from one end, roll the bread tightly into a sushi-style roll.
10. repeat with the remaining ingredients.
11. using a sharp knife, cut each roll into bite-sized pieces.
12. serve with soy sauce for dipping.
13. enjoy your delicious breakfast sushi!
ingredients_list: egg, milk, salt, pepper, taste, whole, wheat, bread, cream, cheese, smoked, salmon, avocado, cucumber, soy, sauce

title: Shakshuka with Feta Cheese
raw_text: 34. Shakshuka with Feta Cheese: 400kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains dairy, originated in Tunisia.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 medium onion, thinly sliced
- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon chili powder (optional)
- 1 can (400 g) crushed tomatoes
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4-6 large eggs
- 100 g feta cheese, crumbled
- fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat.
2. add the sliced onions and bell peppers to the pan and sauté for about 5 minutes until they begin to soften.
3. stir in the minced garlic, cumin, paprika, and chili powder (optional). cook for an additional minute until fragrant.
4. pour in the crushed tomatoes and season with salt and pepper. stir everything together and let the mixture simmer for about 10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
5. create small wells in the tomato mixture with the back of a spoon and crack the eggs directly into each well. cover the pan and let the eggs cook until the whites are set but the yolks are still runny (about 5-7 minutes).
6. sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese over the shakshuka, cover the pan again, and cook for an additional 2 minutes until the cheese begins to melt.
7. remove from heat and garnish with fresh parsley.
8. serve hot directly from the skillet, with crusty bread or pita on the side for dipping. enjoy!
ingredients_list: olive, onion, thinly, red, bell, pepper, thinly, clove, garlic, minced, cumin, paprika, chili, powder, tomato, salt, pepper, taste, egg, feta, cheese, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Cheesy Egg and Bacon Casserole
raw_text: 35. Cheesy Egg and Bacon Casserole: 500kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains dairy, originated in the United States.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 6 eggs
- 1 cup of whole milk
- 6 slices of bacon, cooked and crumbled
- 1 cup of shredded cheddar cheese
- 1/2 cup of shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1/4 cup of grated parmesan cheese
- 1/4 teaspoon of salt
- 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper
- 1 tablespoon of chopped fresh parsley
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c) and grease a casserole dish with cooking spray.
2. in a large mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs and milk until well combined.
3. stir in the cooked bacon, cheddar cheese, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese, salt, and black pepper.
4. pour the mixture into the prepared casserole dish and spread it out evenly.
5. bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the center is set.
6. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. garnish with chopped fresh parsley before serving.
8. slice and serve warm. enjoy your cheesy egg and bacon casserole!
ingredients_list: egg, whole, milk, bacon, shredded, cheddar, cheese, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, parmesan, cheese, salt, black, pepper, fresh, parsley

title: Egg and Cheese Breakfast Taco
raw_text: 38. Egg and Cheese Breakfast Taco: 250kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, originated in Mexico.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large eggs
- 2 small flour tortillas
- 1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- salt and pepper, to taste
- optional toppings: salsa, sour cream, avocado, cilantro
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, beat the eggs with salt and pepper. set aside.
2. heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and place a tortilla on it.
3. cook the tortilla for about 10 seconds, then flip it over.
4. pour half of the beaten eggs onto one side of the tortilla in a circular motion, creating a half-moon shape.
5. sprinkle half of the shredded cheese on top of the eggs.
6. allow the eggs to cook until they start setting around the edges, then carefully fold the other half of the tortilla over the filling to create a taco shape.
7. press the taco gently with a spatula to seal it, and cook for another minute or until the cheese melts.
8. remove the breakfast taco from the pan and set aside. repeat the process with the remaining tortilla, eggs, and cheese.
9. serve the egg and cheese breakfast tacos hot with desired toppings like salsa, sour cream, avocado, or cilantro.
10. enjoy your delicious egg and cheese breakfast taco!
ingredients_list: egg, flour, tortilla, shredded, cheddar, cheese, salt, pepper, taste, topping, salsa, sour, cream, avocado, cilantro

title: Dutch Baby Pancake
raw_text: 41. Dutch Baby Pancake: 450kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, originated in Germany.
ingredients:
sure! here's the recipe for dutch baby pancake:

ingredients:
- 3 large eggs
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup milk
- 2 tablespoons granulated sugar
- 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 2 tablespoons unsalted butter
- powdered sugar (for serving)
- fresh fruit, syrup, or jam (for serving)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 425°f (220°c). place a 10-inch cast-iron skillet or oven-safe frying pan in the oven to heat up.

2. in a blender or a mixing bowl, combine the eggs, flour, milk, granulated sugar, vanilla extract, and salt. blend or whisk until smooth and well combined.

3. carefully remove the hot skillet from the oven and add the butter to it. swirl the skillet around to melt the butter and coat the bottom and sides.

4. pour the pancake batter into the hot skillet. immediately return the skillet to the oven and bake for 18-20 minutes, or until the pancake is puffed up and golden brown.

5. once the dutch baby pancake is done, remove it from the oven and let it cool slightly. it will deflate as it cools.

6. dust the pancake with powdered sugar and serve it warm. you can also top it with fresh fruit, syrup, or jam of your choice.

enjoy your delicious dutch baby pancake!
ingredients_list: dutch, baby, pancake, egg, flour, milk, sugar, vanilla, extract, salt, unsalted, butter, sugar, fresh, fruit, syrup, jam

title: Smoked Salmon Bagel Sandwich
raw_text: 43. Smoked Salmon Bagel Sandwich: 550kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, originated in the United States.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 bagel (any flavor)
- 4 ounces smoked salmon
- 2 tablespoons cream cheese
- 1 tablespoon capers
- 1 tablespoon red onion, thinly sliced
- fresh dill, for garnish
- lemon wedges, for serving
preparation:
1. slice the bagel in half horizontally.
2. toast the bagel halves until crispy and golden brown.
3. spread the cream cheese evenly on both toasted bagel halves.
4. arrange the smoked salmon on one half of the bagel.
5. top the salmon with capers and red onion slices.
6. garnish with fresh dill.
7. place the other bagel half on top to make a sandwich.
8. serve with lemon wedges on the side.
9. enjoy your delicious smoked salmon bagel sandwich!
ingredients_list: bagel, flavor, ounce, smoked, salmon, cream, cheese, caper, red, onion, thinly, fresh, dill, garnish, lemon, wedge

title: Breakfast Tacos with Avocado Salsa
raw_text: 45. Breakfast Tacos with Avocado Salsa: 400kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, originated in Mexico.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 small flour tortillas
- 6 large eggs
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 avocado, diced
- 1/4 cup red onion, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 2 tablespoons fresh cilantro, chopped
- 1 tablespoon lime juice
- salt and pepper to taste
- hot sauce (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. wrap the tortillas in aluminum foil and warm them in the oven for about 10 minutes.
3. in a bowl, whisk the eggs, salt, and pepper together.
4. heat the olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat.
5. pour the egg mixture into the skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, until the eggs are scrambled and fully cooked. remove from heat.
6. in another bowl, combine the diced avocado, red onion, cherry tomatoes, cilantro, lime juice, salt, and pepper. mix well to make the avocado salsa.
7. to assemble the breakfast tacos, place a scoop of scrambled eggs onto each warmed tortilla. top with a spoonful of avocado salsa.
8. serve the breakfast tacos with hot sauce on the side, if desired.
9. enjoy your delicious breakfast tacos with avocado salsa!
ingredients_list: flour, tortilla, egg, olive, salt, black, pepper, avocado, red, onion, cherry, tomato, halved, fresh, cilantro, lime, salt, pepper, taste, hot, sauce

title: Breakfast Sausage and Egg Casserole
raw_text: 51. Breakfast Sausage and Egg Casserole: 500kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains dairy, originated in the United States.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound breakfast sausage
- 6 large eggs
- 1 1/2 cups milk
- 1 teaspoon ground mustard
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
- 4 cups cubed bread
- 1 1/2 cups shredded cheddar cheese
- 1/2 cup chopped green onions
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c) and grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
2. in a skillet, cook the breakfast sausage over medium heat until browned and cooked through. drain any excess grease.
3. in a large mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, ground mustard, salt, and black pepper.
4. spread the cubed bread evenly in the prepared baking dish. 
5. sprinkle the cooked sausage over the bread cubes.
6. pour the egg mixture over the bread and sausage, making sure to evenly coat everything.
7. sprinkle the shredded cheese and chopped green onions over the top.
8. cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for 30 minutes.
9. after 30 minutes, remove the foil and bake for an additional 15-20 minutes, or until the casserole is set and the cheese is melted and beginning to brown.
10. allow the casserole to cool for a few minutes before serving.
11. serve warm and enjoy your delicious breakfast sausage and egg casserole!
ingredients_list: sausage, egg, milk, ground, mustard, salt, black, pepper, bread, shredded, cheddar, cheese, green, onion

title: Japanese Souffle Pancakes
raw_text: 52. Japanese Souffle Pancakes: 400kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, originated in Japan.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 3 eggs, separated
- 1/4 cup granulated sugar
- 1/4 cup whole milk
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- pinch of salt
- cooking spray or butter, for greasing the pan
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and sugar until pale and creamy.
2. add the milk and vanilla extract to the egg yolk mixture and whisk until well combined.
3. sift the flour, baking powder, and salt into the egg yolk mixture and whisk until just combined. do not overmix.
4. in a separate bowl, whisk the egg whites until stiff peaks form.
5. gently fold the egg whites into the batter until just incorporated. be careful not to overmix, as this will deflate the batter.
6. heat a non-stick pan or griddle over low heat and lightly grease with cooking spray or butter.
7. using a ladle or large spoon, pour about 1/4 cup of batter onto the pan for each pancake. cook for about 3 minutes, or until bubbles form on the surface.
8. carefully flip the pancakes and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through.
9. remove the pancakes from the pan and serve immediately. repeat with the remaining batter.
10. serve the japanese souffle pancakes with your favorite toppings such as fresh fruits, whipped cream, maple syrup, or powdered sugar. enjoy!
ingredients_list: egg, separated, sugar, whole, milk, vanilla, extract, flour, baking, powder, pinch, salt, spray, butter, greasing

title: Spinach and Feta Breakfast Wrap
raw_text: 54. Spinach and Feta Breakfast Wrap: 450kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large eggs
- 1 cup fresh spinach, chopped
- 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 4 flour tortillas
- salt and pepper to taste
- olive oil for cooking
preparation:
1. in a bowl, whisk the eggs until well beaten. season with salt and pepper.
2. heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and add a drizzle of olive oil.
3. add the chopped spinach to the skillet and sauté for 2-3 minutes until wilted.
4. pour the beaten eggs into the skillet with the spinach. cook, stirring occasionally until the eggs are scrambled and cooked through.
5. sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese over the scrambled eggs and stir until the cheese is slightly melted and incorporated.
6. warm the flour tortillas in a microwave or on a dry skillet over low heat for about 30 seconds on each side.
7. divide the scrambled eggs and feta mixture among the tortillas, placing it in the center of each tortilla.
8. fold the sides of the tortilla over the filling and roll it up tightly to form a wrap.
9. serve immediately and enjoy your spinach and feta breakfast wrap.
ingredients_list: egg, fresh, spinach, feta, cheese, flour, tortilla, salt, pepper, taste, olive

title: Homemade Cinnamon Rolls
raw_text: 55. Homemade Cinnamon Rolls: 600kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 3/4 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup granulated sugar
- 2 1/4 teaspoons (1 packet) active dry yeast
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter, softened
- 1 large egg

for the filling:
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 3/4 cup brown sugar
- 2 tablespoons ground cinnamon

for the cream cheese frosting:
- 4 ounces cream cheese, softened
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter, softened
- 1 cup powdered sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, yeast, and salt.
2. in a small saucepan, heat the milk and butter together over low heat until the butter has melted. remove from heat and let it cool down to lukewarm temperature.
3. pour the lukewarm milk mixture into the dry ingredients. add the egg. stir well until a soft dough forms.
4. transfer the dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead for about 5 minutes until it becomes smooth and elastic.
5. place the dough in a greased bowl, cover it with a clean kitchen towel, and let it rise in a warm place for about 1 hour or until doubled in size.
6. while the dough is rising, prepare the filling by combining melted butter, brown sugar, and cinnamon in a small bowl. mix well.
7. after the dough has risen, punch it down and roll it out on a floured surface into a rectangle shape, approximately 12x16 inches.
8. spread the prepared filling evenly over the dough, leaving a small border around the edges.
9. starting from the long side, tightly roll up the dough into a log shape.
10. cut the rolled dough into 12 equal-sized pieces using a sharp knife or dental floss.
11. place the cinnamon rolls in a greased baking dish, cover with a kitchen towel, and let them rise for another 30 minutes.
12. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c).
13. bake the cinnamon rolls in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until they turn golden brown.
14. while the cinnamon rolls are baking, prepare the cream cheese frosting by beating the cream cheese and butter together until creamy. add powdered sugar and vanilla extract, and continue beating until smooth.
15. once the cinnamon rolls are done baking, remove them from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
16. spread the cream cheese frosting over the warm cinnamon rolls.
17. serve the homemade cinnamon rolls while they are still warm and enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, packet, yeast, salt, milk, unsalted, butter, egg, filling, unsalted, butter, brown, sugar, ground, cinnamon, cream, cheese, ounce, cream, cheese, unsalted, butter, sugar, vanilla, extract

title: Breakfast Pizza
raw_text: 57. Breakfast Pizza: 550kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, originated in Italy.
ingredients:
ingredients for breakfast pizza:
- 1 pizza dough
- 4 slices of bacon, cooked and crumbled
- 1/2 cup of shredded mozzarella cheese
- 4 large eggs
- 1/4 cup of milk
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1/4 cup of chopped green onions
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to the temperature specified on your pizza dough package.
2. roll out the pizza dough on a lightly floured surface to your desired thickness.
3. transfer the rolled-out dough onto a baking sheet or pizza stone.
4. sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese evenly over the dough, leaving a small border around the edges.
5. distribute the crumbled bacon on top of the cheese.
6. in a mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, and pepper until well combined.
7. pour the egg mixture over the cheese and bacon, making sure to evenly distribute it.
8. sprinkle the chopped green onions on top of the egg mixture.
9. carefully transfer the baking sheet or pizza stone into the preheated oven.
10. bake for about 12-15 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the eggs are set.
11. remove from the oven and let the breakfast pizza cool for a few minutes.
12. slice and serve warm.
enjoy your delicious breakfast pizza!
ingredients_list: pizza, dough, bacon, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, egg, milk, salt, pepper, taste, green, onion

title: Waffle Breakfast Sandwich
raw_text: 59. Waffle Breakfast Sandwich: 450kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large waffles
- 4 slices of bacon
- 2 large eggs
- 2 slices of cheese
- salt and black pepper to taste
- butter or cooking spray for greasing
preparation:
1. preheat your waffle iron according to its instructions.
2. cook bacon until crisp in a skillet over medium heat. once done, remove the bacon and set it aside on paper towels to drain excess grease.
3. in the same skillet, fry eggs over medium heat until the whites are set but the yolk is still slightly runny. season with salt and black pepper to taste.
4. while the eggs are frying, lightly grease the preheated waffle iron with butter or cooking spray.
5. place one waffle into the waffle iron and cook until golden brown and crisp.
6. remove the waffle from the iron and repeat with the second waffle.
7. place a slice of cheese onto one of the cooked waffles, followed by the cooked bacon and fried egg. top with the second waffle to complete the sandwich.
8. press the sandwich together gently and cook in the waffle iron for another 1-2 minutes, or until the cheese is melted.
9. carefully remove the sandwich from the waffle iron and let it cool slightly before serving.
10. cut the waffle breakfast sandwich in half diagonally and enjoy!
ingredients_list: waffle, bacon, egg, cheese, salt, black, pepper, taste, butter, spray, greasing

title: Mediterranean Breakfast Wraps
raw_text: 62. Mediterranean Breakfast Wraps: 400kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, originated in Mediterranean countries.
ingredients:
sure! here's a recipe for mediterranean breakfast wraps:

ingredients:
- 4 large flour tortillas
- 4 eggs
- 1/4 cup milk
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/2 cup diced tomatoes
- 1/2 cup diced cucumbers
- 1/4 cup sliced black olives
- 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh mint
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
preparation:
1. in a bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, salt, and black pepper.
2. heat a non-stick skillet over medium-low heat and spray with cooking spray.
3. pour the egg mixture into the skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, until the eggs are scrambled and cooked through.
4. in a separate bowl, combine diced tomatoes, cucumbers, black olives, feta cheese, fresh parsley, fresh mint, lemon juice, and olive oil. mix well.
5. warm the flour tortillas in a microwave or stovetop until pliable.
6. divide the scrambled eggs onto the tortillas and top with the mediterranean vegetable mixture.
7. roll up the tortillas tightly, tucking in the sides as you go.
8. if desired, you can grill the wraps on a panini press or stovetop grill for a few minutes until warmed through and slightly crispy.
9. slice the wraps diagonally and serve.

enjoy your mediterranean breakfast wraps!
ingredients_list: mediterranean, wrap, flour, tortilla, egg, milk, salt, black, pepper, tomato, cucumber, black, olive, feta, cheese, fresh, parsley, fresh, mint, lemon, olive

title: Belgian Liege Waffles
raw_text: 63. Belgian Liege Waffles: 550kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, originated in Belgium.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast
- 1/4 cup lukewarm water
- 3 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 3 large eggs
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 1/4 cups unsalted butter, softened
- 1 1/2 cups pearl sugar
preparation:
1. dissolve the yeast in the lukewarm water and let it sit for about 5 minutes until it becomes frothy.
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the flour and salt. make a well in the center and pour in the yeast mixture, eggs, and vanilla extract.
3. mix all the ingredients together until a dough forms.
4. gradually add the softened butter to the dough, mixing well after each addition. knead the dough for about 5-10 minutes until it becomes smooth and elastic.
5. cover the dough with plastic wrap or a damp towel and let it rise in a warm place for about 1-2 hours until it doubles in size.
6. after the dough has risen, gently fold in the pearl sugar until it is evenly distributed throughout the dough.
7. preheat a waffle iron and lightly grease it with cooking spray or butter.
8. take a small handful of the dough and shape it into a ball. place the dough ball onto the preheated waffle iron and cook according to the manufacturer's instructions until golden brown and crispy.
9. repeat step 8 for the remaining dough, making sure to grease the waffle iron before each batch.
10. serve the belgian liege waffles warm with your preferred toppings such as powdered sugar, whipped cream, fresh fruits, or syrup. enjoy!
ingredients_list: yeast, lukewarm, water, flour, salt, egg, vanilla, extract, unsalted, butter, pearl, sugar

title: Cheddar and Herb Quiche
raw_text: 65. Cheddar and Herb Quiche: 500kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, originated in France.
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. press the pie crust into a 9-inch pie dish and crimp the edges.
3. in a medium bowl, mix together the shredded cheddar cheese, chopped parsley, and chopped chives.
4. spread the cheese and herb mixture evenly over the pie crust.
5. in a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, and black pepper.
6. pour the egg mixture over the cheese and herb mixture in the pie crust.
7. bake in the preheated oven for about 35-40 minutes, or until the quiche is set and lightly golden on top.
8. remove from the oven and allow it to cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
9. enjoy the cheddar and herb quiche warm or at room temperature.
ingredients_list: pie, crust, shredded, cheddar, cheese, fresh, parsley, fresh, chive, egg, milk, salt, black, pepper

title: Turkish Borek
raw_text: 68. Turkish Borek: 400kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, originated in Turkey.
ingredients:
ingredients for turkish borek:
- 1 package of phyllo pastry sheets
- 500g of ground beef or lamb
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- 1 teaspoon of paprika
- 1 teaspoon of cumin
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 cup of plain yogurt
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 cup of milk
- 1/4 cup of melted butter
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 180°c (350°f) and grease a baking dish with some butter or oil.
2. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the chopped onion and minced garlic and cook until softened.
3. add the ground beef or lamb to the skillet and cook until browned, breaking up any clumps with a wooden spoon.
4. stir in the paprika, cumin, salt, and pepper. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes to incorporate the spices into the meat mixture.
5. in a separate bowl, mix together the yogurt, eggs, and milk until well combined. set aside.
6. unroll the phyllo pastry sheets and cover them with a slightly damp towel to prevent them from drying out.
7. place one sheet of phyllo pastry in the greased baking dish and brush it with melted butter. repeat this step with 4-5 more sheets.
8. spread half of the meat mixture evenly over the phyllo pastry.
9. place another sheet of phyllo pastry on top of the meat and brush it with melted butter. repeat this step with 4-5 more sheets.
10. spread the remaining meat mixture over the phyllo pastry.
11. layer the remaining phyllo pastry sheets, brushing each one with melted butter, until all the sheets are used.
12. pour the yogurt mixture over the top of the layered phyllo pastry.
13. bake in the preheated oven for about 45 minutes or until the top is golden brown and crispy.
14. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
15. turkish borek can be enjoyed as a main dish or as a snack. serve it warm with a side salad or yogurt sauce, if desired. enjoy!
ingredients_list: phyllo, pastry, sheet, ground, beef, lamb, onion, clove, garlic, minced, olive, paprika, cumin, salt, pepper, taste, plain, yogurt, egg, milk, butter

title: Breakfast Nachos
raw_text: 69. Breakfast Nachos: 550kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, originated in the United States.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 bag of tortilla chips
- 1 cup of shredded cheese (cheddar or monterrey jack)
- 4 strips of bacon, cooked and crumbled
- 4 large eggs, scrambled
- 1 tomato, diced
- 1/4 cup of sliced green onions
- 1/4 cup of sliced black olives
- 1/4 cup of pickled jalapenos
- sour cream, for serving
- salsa, for serving
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. spread the tortilla chips evenly on a baking sheet.
3. sprinkle the shredded cheese over the chips.
4. place the baking sheet in the oven for about 5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
5. while the cheese is melting, cook the bacon until crispy and crumble it into small pieces.
6. in a separate pan, scramble the eggs until fully cooked.
7. remove the baking sheet from the oven and evenly distribute the scrambled eggs, bacon, diced tomatoes, sliced green onions, black olives, and pickled jalapenos over the chips and melted cheese.
8. return the baking sheet to the oven for another 5 minutes, or until all the toppings are heated through.
9. remove from the oven and let it cool slightly.
10. serve with a dollop of sour cream and salsa on the side.
11. enjoy your delicious breakfast nachos!
ingredients_list: tortilla, chip, shredded, cheese, cheddar, monterrey, jack, strip, bacon, egg, tomato, green, onion, black, olive, pickled, jalapeno, sour, cream, salsa

title: English Muffin Breakfast Pizza
raw_text: 71. English Muffin Breakfast Pizza: 400kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, originated in the United States.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 english muffins
- 4 slices of bacon
- 4 large eggs
- 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 1/4 cup diced tomatoes
- 2 tablespoons sliced green onions
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. split the english muffins in half and place them on a baking sheet.
3. in a skillet over medium heat, cook the bacon until crispy. remove from the skillet and drain on paper towels. crumble the bacon into small pieces.
4. use the same skillet to cook the eggs. crack the eggs into the skillet and cook until the whites are set but the yolks are still slightly runny. season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. place the cooked eggs on top of the english muffin halves.
6. sprinkle the shredded cheddar cheese evenly over each muffin half.
7. top with diced tomatoes and sliced green onions.
8. bake in the preheated oven for about 10 minutes, or until the cheese has melted and the muffins are slightly toasted.
9. remove from the oven and sprinkle the crumbled bacon on top.
10. serve hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: muffin, bacon, egg, shredded, cheddar, cheese, tomato, green, onion, salt, pepper, taste

title: Veggie Breakfast Burritos
raw_text: 72. Veggie Breakfast Burritos: 450kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, originated in Mexico.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large tortillas
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, diced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 2 cups baby spinach
- 1 cup diced tomatoes
- 1 cup cooked black beans
- 1 cup shredded cheese (cheddar or mozzarella)
- salt and pepper, to taste
- salsa, for serving
preparation:
1. heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. add the diced onion and bell pepper. cook until onion becomes translucent, about 5 minutes.
2. add baby spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes.
3. stir in the diced tomatoes and cooked black beans. season with salt and pepper to taste. cook for another 2 minutes.
4. warm tortillas in a dry skillet or microwave to make them pliable.
5. place some of the vegetable mixture onto each warm tortilla. sprinkle shredded cheese on top.
6. roll up the tortilla, folding in the sides as you go, to form a burrito.
7. optional: heat the burritos in a skillet over medium heat for a few minutes to melt the cheese and make the tortillas crispy.
8. serve the veggie breakfast burritos with salsa. enjoy!
ingredients_list: tortilla, olive, onion, bell, pepper, baby, spinach, tomato, black, bean, shredded, cheese, cheddar, mozzarella, salt, pepper, taste, salsa

title: Turkish Poached Eggs with Yogurt
raw_text: 73. Turkish Poached Eggs with Yogurt: 400kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains dairy, originated in Turkey.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large eggs
- 1 cup plain greek yogurt
- 2 tablespoons unsalted butter
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 1 teaspoon red pepper flakes
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper, to taste
- fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. fill a wide saucepan or skillet with water and bring it to a gentle simmer over medium heat.
2. in a separate small saucepan, melt the butter over low heat. add the minced garlic, red pepper flakes, and dried oregano, and sauté for about 1-2 minutes until fragrant. set aside.
3. in a separate bowl, whisk the greek yogurt until smooth. season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. crack each egg into a small ramekin or cup, one at a time.
5. carefully slide each egg into the simmering water, one by one, making sure they are not overcrowded in the pan. poach the eggs for about 3-4 minutes until the whites are set, but the yolks are still runny. use a slotted spoon to carefully remove the poached eggs from the water and drain any excess water.
6. to serve, spread a generous dollop of the seasoned yogurt onto a plate. place the poached eggs on top of the yogurt.
7. drizzle the garlic butter sauce over the eggs and yogurt.
8. garnish with fresh parsley.
9. serve immediately and enjoy your turkish poached eggs with yogurt!
ingredients_list: egg, plain, greek, yogurt, unsalted, butter, garlic, clove, minced, red, pepper, flake, dried, oregano, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Breakfast Stuffed Peppers
raw_text: 76. Breakfast Stuffed Peppers: 400kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large bell peppers
- 8 large eggs
- 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 1/2 cup diced ham
- 1/2 cup diced tomatoes
- 1/4 cup diced green onions
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes. set aside.
3. in a large bowl, whisk the eggs together. add the shredded cheddar cheese, diced ham, diced tomatoes, and diced green onions. season with salt and pepper, and mix well.
4. place the bell peppers upright in a baking dish.
5. carefully pour the egg mixture into each pepper, filling them about 3/4 of the way.
6. bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes or until the eggs are set and the peppers have softened.
7. remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
8. serve hot and enjoy your delicious breakfast stuffed peppers!
ingredients_list: bell, pepper, egg, shredded, cheddar, cheese, ham, tomato, green, onion, salt, pepper, taste

title: Turkish Gozleme
raw_text: 78. Turkish Gozleme: 500kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, originated in Turkey.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 cup plain yogurt
- 1/2 cup warm water
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 cup cooked spinach, squeezed and finely chopped
- 1 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 1/2 cup chopped fresh parsley
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
- salt to taste
- olive oil, for cooking
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, salt, and baking powder. mix well.
2. in a separate bowl, whisk together the yogurt, warm water, and olive oil.
3. slowly pour the wet mixture into the dry ingredients while stirring.
4. knead the dough in the bowl until it comes together and forms a smooth ball.
5. cover the dough with a towel and let it rest for 30 minutes.
6. in another mixing bowl, combine the cooked spinach, crumbled feta cheese, chopped parsley, black pepper, and salt. mix well.
7. divide the dough into 4 equal parts and roll each part into a thin round or oval shape.
8. spread a quarter of the spinach and cheese filling on one half of each rolled-out dough.
9. fold the dough over the filling to create a half-moon shape and press the edges to seal it.
10. heat a bit of olive oil in a large skillet or griddle over medium heat.
11. cook each gozleme for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and crispy.
12. remove from heat and transfer to a cutting board. allow it to cool for a few minutes before cutting into triangles or rectangles.
13. serve the turkish gozleme warm and enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, salt, baking, powder, plain, yogurt, water, olive, spinach, squeezed, feta, cheese, fresh, parsley, black, pepper, salt, taste, olive

title: Breakfast Tostadas
raw_text: 79. Breakfast Tostadas: 450kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, originated in Mexico.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large tostada shells
- 4 eggs
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 cup refried beans
- 1 ripe avocado, sliced
- 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- salsa, to serve
- fresh cilantro, for garnish
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. fry the eggs in the skillet, seasoning with salt and pepper to taste. cook until the egg whites are set, but the yolks are still slightly runny.
3. warm the tostada shells in a toaster oven or under the broiler until crisp.
4. spread a layer of refried beans onto each tostada shell.
5. top each tostada with a fried egg, sliced avocado, shredded cheddar cheese, and a dollop of salsa.
6. garnish with fresh cilantro leaves.
7. serve immediately and enjoy your delicious breakfast tostadas!
ingredients_list: tostada, shell, egg, vegetable, salt, pepper, taste, refried, bean, avocado, shredded, cheddar, cheese, salsa, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Shakshuka with Merguez Sausage
raw_text: 81. Shakshuka with Merguez Sausage: 400kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, originated in Tunisia.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 4 merguez sausages, sliced
- 1 onion, thinly sliced
- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 can (14 ounces) diced tomatoes
- 1 tablespoon tomato paste
- 4-6 large eggs
- fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. add the sliced merguez sausages to the skillet and brown them on all sides for about 5 minutes. remove from skillet and set aside.
3. in the same skillet, add the sliced onion and red bell pepper. sauté them for about 5 minutes until they start to soften.
4. add minced garlic, ground cumin, smoked paprika, ground coriander, salt, and black pepper to the skillet. stir well to coat the vegetables with the spices.
5. pour in the diced tomatoes and tomato paste, stirring to combine everything. let the mixture simmer for about 10 minutes until it thickens slightly.
6. make small wells in the tomato mixture and crack an egg into each well. cover the skillet and cook on medium-low heat for about 5-7 minutes, or until the eggs are cooked to your desired level of runniness.
7. once the eggs are cooked, remove the skillet from the heat. sprinkle fresh parsley over the top.
8. serve the shakshuka with merguez sausage hot, with crusty bread or pita on the side for dipping.
ingredients_list: olive, merguez, sausage, onion, thinly, red, bell, pepper, thinly, clove, garlic, minced, ground, cumin, smoked, paprika, ground, coriander, salt, black, pepper, ounce, tomato, tomato, paste, egg, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Quinoa Breakfast Cookies
raw_text: 83. Quinoa Breakfast Cookies: 300kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
sure! here's a recipe for quinoa breakfast cookies:

ingredients:
- 1 cup cooked quinoa
- 1 ripe banana, mashed
- 1/4 cup honey or maple syrup
- 1/4 cup nut butter (such as almond butter or peanut butter)
- 1/2 cup rolled oats
- 1/4 cup unsweetened shredded coconut
- 1/4 cup dried cranberries or raisins
- 1/4 cup chopped nuts (such as almonds or walnuts)
- 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
- pinch of salt
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, mashed banana, honey or maple syrup, and nut butter. stir until well combined.
3. add the rolled oats, shredded coconut, dried cranberries or raisins, chopped nuts, cinnamon, and salt to the bowl. mix everything together until evenly combined.
4. using a tablespoon or cookie scoop, drop spoonfuls of the cookie dough onto the prepared baking sheet, spacing them about 2 inches apart.
5. use the back of a spoon or your fingers to flatten each cookie slightly.
6. bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
7. remove from the oven and let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
8. enjoy your homemade quinoa breakfast cookies as a nutritious and delicious morning treat!

note: feel free to customize these cookies by adding other ingredients like chocolate chips, dried fruits, or seeds. you can also adjust the sweetness by adding more or less honey/maple syrup to taste.
cuisine:
The cuisine type of the recipe is: 

Breakfast.
ingredients_list: quinoa, cooky, quinoa, banana, honey, maple, syrup, nut, butter, almond, butter, peanut, butter, rolled, oat, unsweetened, shredded, coconut, dried, cranberry, raisin, nut, almond, walnut, cinnamon, pinch, salt

title: Sausage and Cheese Quiche
raw_text: 84. Sausage and Cheese Quiche: 550kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, originated in France.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pre-made pie crust
- 1/2 lb sausage, cooked and crumbled
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 4 large eggs
- 1 cup milk
- 1/4 tsp salt
- 1/4 tsp black pepper
- 1/4 tsp garlic powder
- 1/4 tsp dried thyme
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. unroll the pre-made pie crust and press it into a 9-inch pie dish.
3. in a skillet over medium heat, cook the sausage until browned and crumbly. drain excess grease.
4. spread the cooked sausage evenly over the bottom of the pie crust.
5. sprinkle shredded cheddar cheese over the sausage layer.
6. in a mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, black pepper, garlic powder, and dried thyme.
7. pour the egg mixture over the sausage and cheese in the pie crust.
8. gently tap the pie dish on the counter a few times to remove any air bubbles.
9. place the quiche in the preheated oven and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the center is set.
10. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
11. serve warm and enjoy!
ingredients_list: pie, crust, sausage, shredded, cheddar, cheese, egg, milk, salt, black, pepper, garlic, powder, dried, thyme

title: Veggie Breakfast Bagel Sandwich
raw_text: 85. Veggie Breakfast Bagel Sandwich: 400kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 bagel (any flavor)
- 2 eggs
- 1/4 cup diced bell peppers (any color)
- 1/4 cup diced red onion
- 1/4 cup sliced mushrooms
- 1/4 cup fresh spinach leaves
- 2 slices of cheddar cheese
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat a skillet over medium heat and lightly toast the bagel slices.
2. in a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and season with salt and pepper.
3. in the same skillet, add the diced bell peppers, red onion, and mushrooms. sauté until they are lightly cooked and tender.
4. pour the whisked eggs into the skillet with the sautéed vegetables. allow the eggs to cook undisturbed for a minute or two, then gently scramble them until fully cooked.
5. place the spinach leaves on one side of the toasted bagel. top with a slice of cheddar cheese followed by the scrambled eggs and sautéed vegetables.
6. place the second slice of cheddar cheese on the other side of the bagel.
7. close the sandwich and enjoy your veggie breakfast bagel sandwich!
ingredients_list: bagel, flavor, egg, bell, pepper, color, red, onion, mushroom, fresh, spinach, leaf, cheddar, cheese, salt, pepper, taste

title: Aloo Tikki
raw_text: 86. Aloo Tikki: 300kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, originated in India.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 medium-sized potatoes
- 1/2 cup boiled green peas
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 green chilies, finely chopped
- 2 tablespoons chopped coriander leaves
- 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder
- 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon garam masala powder
- salt to taste
- oil for frying
preparation:
1. boil the potatoes until they are completely cooked. peel the skin and mash them in a mixing bowl.
2. add boiled green peas, chopped onions, green chilies, coriander leaves, cumin powder, red chili powder, garam masala powder, and salt to the mashed potatoes. mix well.
3. divide the mixture into small portions and shape them into round patties or tikkis.
4. heat oil in a frying pan. place the tikkis gently in the hot oil and fry until they turn golden brown and crispy on both sides.
5. once cooked, remove the tikkis from the pan and drain the excess oil on a paper towel.
6. serve the aloo tikki hot with mint chutney, tamarind chutney, or ketchup. enjoy!
ingredients_list: potato, boiled, green, pea, onion, green, chilies, coriander, leaf, cumin, powder, red, chili, powder, garam, masala, powder, salt, taste

title: Breakfast Tacos with Chorizo
raw_text: 89. Breakfast Tacos with Chorizo: 400kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, originated in Mexico.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 6 flour tortillas
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1/2 onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 pound chorizo sausage, casings removed
- 4 large eggs
- 1/4 cup chopped cilantro
- salt and pepper to taste
- optional toppings: shredded cheese, avocado, salsa
preparation:
1. heat a large skillet over medium heat and warm the tortillas until slightly browned on both sides. remove from heat and set aside.
2. in the same skillet, heat the olive oil and sauté the diced onion until translucent. add the minced garlic and cook for another minute.
3. crumble the chorizo sausage into the skillet and cook until browned and cooked through. use a spatula to break up the sausage into smaller pieces.
4. while the chorizo is cooking, beat the eggs in a separate bowl and season with salt and pepper.
5. push the chorizo to one side of the skillet and pour the beaten eggs into the cleared space. scramble the eggs until cooked to your desired level of doneness.
6. mix the scrambled eggs with the cooked chorizo and stir in the chopped cilantro. remove from heat.
7. spoon the chorizo and egg mixture onto the warmed tortillas. add any desired toppings such as shredded cheese, avocado, or salsa.
8. fold the tortillas over the filling to create tacos and serve immediately. enjoy your breakfast tacos with chorizo!
ingredients_list: flour, tortilla, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, chorizo, sausage, casing, egg, cilantro, salt, pepper, taste, topping, shredded, cheese, avocado, salsa

title: Egg Salad Sandwich
raw_text: 90. Egg Salad Sandwich: 300kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, originated worldwide.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 hard-boiled eggs
- 1/4 cup mayonnaise
- 1 tablespoon dijon mustard
- 2 tablespoons finely chopped green onions
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 8 slices of bread
- lettuce leaves (optional)
preparation:
1. peel the hard-boiled eggs and chop them into small pieces.
2. in a mixing bowl, combine the chopped eggs, mayonnaise, dijon mustard, green onions, salt, and black pepper. mix well until all ingredients are evenly combined.
3. take a slice of bread and spread the egg salad mixture evenly on top.
4. if desired, place a few lettuce leaves on top of the egg salad mixture.
5. top with another slice of bread to form a sandwich.
6. repeat steps 3-5 to make more egg salad sandwiches.
7. cut each sandwich in half diagonally and serve. enjoy!
cooking_style: this recipe is for a sauteed egg salad sandwich.
ingredients_list: boiled, egg, mayonnaise, dijon, mustard, green, onion, salt, black, pepper, bread, lettuce, leaf

title: Shakshuka with Halloumi Cheese
raw_text: 91. Shakshuka with Halloumi Cheese: 400kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains dairy, originated in Tunisia.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 yellow bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper (optional, for heat)
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 can (400 grams) crushed tomatoes
- 4-6 eggs
- 200 grams halloumi cheese, sliced
- fresh parsley, for garnish
preparation:
1. heat olive oil in a large, deep skillet over medium heat.
2. add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the skillet and sauté until softened and lightly browned.
3. add the sliced red and yellow bell peppers to the skillet and cook for a few minutes until they start to soften.
4. stir in the ground cumin, ground paprika, cayenne pepper (if using), salt, and pepper. cook for another minute to allow the flavors to meld.
5. pour the crushed tomatoes into the skillet and stir well to combine with the other ingredients. simmer for about 10-15 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly.
6. create small wells in the sauce and carefully crack the eggs into each well. reduce the heat to low, cover the skillet, and cook the eggs until they reach your desired doneness.
7. while the eggs are cooking, heat a separate non-stick skillet over medium heat and add the halloumi cheese slices. cook for a few minutes on each side until golden brown.
8. once the eggs are cooked, remove the skillet from heat. arrange the halloumi cheese slices on top of the shakshuka.
9. garnish with fresh parsley and serve the shakshuka with halloumi cheese hot, straight from the skillet. enjoy!
ingredients_list: olive, onion, garlic, clove, minced, red, bell, pepper, thinly, yellow, bell, pepper, thinly, ground, cumin, ground, paprika, ground, cayenne, pepper, salt, pepper, taste, gram, tomato, egg, gram, halloumi, cheese, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Breakfast Paella
raw_text: 93. Breakfast Paella: 550kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains seafood, originated in Spain.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup of rice
- 1 onion, diced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 4 slices of bacon, chopped
- 1 cup of diced tomatoes
- 1 cup of chicken broth
- 1/2 teaspoon of paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon of turmeric
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 eggs
- fresh parsley for garnish
preparation:
1. in a large skillet or paella pan, cook the chopped bacon over medium heat until crispy. remove the bacon and set aside.
2. in the same skillet with the bacon fat, add the diced onion, bell pepper, and minced garlic. sauté until the vegetables are soft and fragrant.
3. add the rice to the skillet and stir, coating it with the bacon fat and vegetables. toast the rice for a minute or two.
4. add the diced tomatoes, chicken broth, paprika, turmeric, salt, and pepper to the skillet. stir everything together.
5. bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the skillet. let the rice cook for about 20 minutes, or until it is cooked through and the liquid has been absorbed.
6. while the rice is cooking, preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c).
7. once the rice is cooked, remove the skillet from the heat. use the back of a spoon to create small wells in the rice.
8. gently crack the eggs into the wells, one by one.
9. transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for about 10 minutes, or until the eggs are cooked to your liking.
10. remove the breakfast paella from the oven and garnish with the crispy bacon and fresh parsley.
11. serve hot and enjoy your delicious breakfast paella!
ingredients_list: rice, onion, bell, pepper, clove, garlic, minced, bacon, tomato, chicken, broth, paprika, turmeric, salt, pepper, taste, egg, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Pancake Breakfast Sandwich
raw_text: 95. Pancake Breakfast Sandwich: 500kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, originated in the United States.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 pancake mix packets
- 1 cup milk
- 2 eggs
- 4 slices of bacon
- 4 slices of cheddar cheese
- 4 large eggs
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the pancake mix, milk, and eggs. stir until smooth.
2. heat a large non-stick frying pan over medium heat. cook the bacon slices until crispy. remove from pan and set aside.
3. pour the pancake batter onto the same frying pan, using about 1/4 cup of batter per pancake. cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook the other side until golden brown. repeat with the remaining batter.
4. in a separate frying pan, fry the large eggs to your desired level of doneness. season with salt and pepper.
5. to assemble the breakfast sandwiches, place a pancake on a plate, then add a slice of cheddar cheese, a fried egg, two slices of bacon, and another pancake on top. repeat with the remaining ingredients to make additional sandwiches.
6. serve warm and enjoy your delicious pancake breakfast sandwich.
ingredients_list: pancake, packet, milk, egg, bacon, cheddar, cheese, egg, salt, pepper, taste

title: French Crepes
raw_text: 97. French Crepes: 450kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy, originated in France.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 tablespoons granulated sugar
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 1/2 cups milk
- 3 large eggs
- 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, and salt.
2. in a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, eggs, melted butter, and vanilla extract.
3. slowly pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, whisking continuously until a smooth batter forms.
4. let the batter rest for about 15 minutes to allow it to thicken slightly.
5. heat a non-stick skillet or crepe pan over medium heat.
6. grease the pan with a small amount of butter or cooking spray.
7. pour approximately 1/4 cup of batter onto the pan and swirl it around to create a thin, even layer.
8. cook the crepe for about 1-2 minutes, or until the edges start to brown and lift easily.
9. carefully flip the crepe using a spatula and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes on the other side.
10. remove the cooked crepe from the pan and repeat the process with the remaining batter.
11. serve warm with your choice of toppings, such as fresh fruit, nutella, whipped cream, or syrup. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, salt, milk, egg, unsalted, butter, vanilla, extract

title: Apple slices with almond butter
raw_text: 10. Apple slices with almond butter: 150 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains almonds, origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 apples
- 4 tablespoons almond butter
preparation:
1. wash the apples and slice them into thin rounds, removing the core and seeds.
2. spread almond butter evenly onto half of the apple slices.
3. place the remaining apple slices on top to create sandwich-like apple slices.
4. serve and enjoy!
ingredients_list: apple, almond, butter
