title: Greek yogurt with honey
raw_text: 13. Greek yogurt with honey: 120 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains dairy, origin: Greece
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup greek yogurt
- 2 tablespoons honey
preparation:
1. in a bowl, add the greek yogurt.
2. drizzle the honey over the greek yogurt.
3. using a spoon, gently swirl the honey into the yogurt until well combined.
4. serve the greek yogurt with honey immediately, or refrigerate for later use.
5. enjoy!

title: Egg muffins with spinach and feta
raw_text: 18. Egg muffins with spinach and feta: 180 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 6 large eggs
- 1 cup spinach, chopped
- 1/2 cup feta cheese, crumbled
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c) and lightly grease a muffin tin with cooking spray or butter.
2. in a mixing bowl, whisk the eggs until well beaten and season with salt and pepper.
3. stir in the chopped spinach and crumbled feta cheese, combining well with the eggs.
4. pour the egg mixture into the prepared muffin tin, filling each cavity about 3/4 full.
5. bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the egg muffins are set and golden on top.
6. remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before carefully removing the egg muffins from the tin.
7. serve warm and enjoy! these muffins can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 3 days and reheated when ready to eat.
ingredients_list: egg, spinach, feta, cheese, salt, pepper, taste

title: Almond milk chia pudding
raw_text: 20. Almond milk chia pudding: 200 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains almonds, origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup almond milk
- 1/4 cup chia seeds
- 1 tbsp maple syrup or sweetener of choice
- 1/2 tsp vanilla extract
- optional toppings: fresh fruits, nuts, coconut flakes, or granola
preparation:
1. in a medium-sized bowl, combine almond milk, chia seeds, maple syrup, and vanilla extract.
2. stir well to ensure all ingredients are evenly mixed and there are no clumps.
3. let the mixture sit for 5 minutes, then stir again to prevent the chia seeds from clumping together.
4. cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight to allow the chia seeds to absorb the liquid and create a pudding-like consistency.
5. once the chia pudding has reached the desired consistency, give it a final stir.
6. serve the almond milk chia pudding in individual bowls or jars.
7. if desired, top with fresh fruits, nuts, coconut flakes, or granola for added flavor and texture.
8. enjoy chilled!
ingredients_list: almond, milk, chia, seed, maple, syrup, sweetener, vanilla, extract, topping, fresh, fruit, nut, coconut, flake, granola

title: Broccoli and cheese mini quiches
raw_text: 21. Broccoli and cheese mini quiches: 150 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains cheese, origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup of chopped broccoli
- 1/2 cup of shredded cheddar cheese
- 1/4 cup of diced onion
- 4 large eggs
- 1/2 cup of milk
- 1/4 teaspoon of salt
- 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon of garlic powder
- 1/4 teaspoon of dried oregano
- store-bought or homemade pie crust
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a medium-sized mixing bowl, combine the chopped broccoli, shredded cheddar cheese, and diced onion.
3. in a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, black pepper, garlic powder, and dried oregano.
4. add the egg mixture to the broccoli mixture and stir until well combined.
5. roll out your store-bought or homemade pie crust and cut it into circles to fit into a muffin tin or small ramekins.
6. place a circle of pie crust into each muffin cup or ramekin, pressing it down gently.
7. spoon the broccoli and cheese mixture into each crust-lined cup, filling them about 3/4 full.
8. bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the quiches have puffed up and turned golden brown.
9. remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.
10. serve the broccoli and cheese mini quiches warm and enjoy!

note: you can also customize this recipe by adding cooked bacon, mushrooms, or any other vegetables or herbs you like.
ingredients_list: broccoli, shredded, cheddar, cheese, onion, egg, milk, salt, black, pepper, garlic, powder, dried, oregano, pie, crust

title: Bell pepper and cream cheese roll
raw_text: 25. Bell pepper and cream cheese roll-ups: 120 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 3 large bell peppers (any color)
- 8 oz cream cheese, softened
- 1 tsp garlic powder
- 1 tsp onion powder
- 1 tsp dried parsley
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. cut the bell peppers in half lengthwise and remove the seeds and white membrane.
2. in a medium bowl, combine the cream cheese, garlic powder, onion powder, dried parsley, salt, and pepper. mix well until all the ingredients are evenly incorporated.
3. spoon the cream cheese mixture into each bell pepper half, spreading it evenly throughout.
4. roll up the bell pepper halves tightly, starting from one end and pressing gently to seal.
5. place the roll-ups on a serving dish and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to allow them to firm up.
6. once chilled and firm, cut the roll-ups into bite-sized pieces and serve as an appetizer or snack.
7. enjoy!
ingredients_list: bell, pepper, color, cream, cheese, garlic, powder, onion, powder, dried, parsley, salt, pepper, taste

title: Smoked salmon on whole wheat crackers
raw_text: 29. Smoked salmon on whole wheat crackers: 180 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains fish and gluten, origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- smoked salmon slices
- whole wheat crackers
- cream cheese or sour cream
- fresh dill (optional)
- lemon wedges (optional)
- black pepper (optional)
preparation:
1. lay out the whole wheat crackers on a serving platter.
2. spread a thin layer of cream cheese or sour cream on each cracker.
3. take a slice of smoked salmon and place it on top of the cream cheese or sour cream on each cracker.
4. if desired, sprinkle some fresh dill over the smoked salmon.
5. squeeze a bit of lemon juice from the wedges onto the smoked salmon.
6. add a pinch of black pepper for extra flavor, if desired.

title: Chocolate protein smoothie
raw_text: 33. Chocolate protein smoothie: 300 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains dairy, origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup unsweetened almond milk
- 1 scoop chocolate protein powder
- 1 ripe banana
- 1 tablespoon almond butter
- 1 tablespoon cacao powder
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 cup ice cubes
preparation:
1. in a blender, add almond milk, chocolate protein powder, ripe banana, almond butter, cacao powder, vanilla extract, and ice cubes.
2. blend on high speed until all the ingredients are well combined and smooth.
3. if the smoothie is too thick, add a little more almond milk. if it's too thin, add more ice cubes.
4. pour into a glass and enjoy immediately.

title: Sweet potato toast with almond butter
raw_text: 34. Sweet potato toast with almond butter: 250 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains almonds, origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 sweet potato
- almond butter
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. wash the sweet potato thoroughly and pat dry.
3. slice the sweet potato lengthwise into thin slices, about 1/4 inch thick.
4. place the sweet potato slices on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
5. bake the sweet potato slices in the preheated oven for approximately 15-20 minutes, or until they are tender but not overly soft.
6. remove the sweet potato slices from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
7. spread a generous amount of almond butter on each sweet potato slice.
8. serve and enjoy your sweet potato toast with almond butter!
ingredients_list: sweet, potato, almond, butter

title: Carrot and raisin muffins
raw_text: 38. Carrot and raisin muffins: 180 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 2 large eggs
- 1/2 cup vegetable oil
- 1/2 cup buttermilk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 1/2 cups grated carrots
- 1/2 cup raisins
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c). grease or line a muffin pan with paper liners.
2. in a mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
3. in a separate bowl, beat the eggs lightly. add the oil, buttermilk, and vanilla extract. mix well.
4. pour the wet mixture into the dry mixture and stir until just combined. be careful not to overmix.
5. fold in the grated carrots and raisins.
6. divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups, filling each about 2/3 full.
7. bake for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
8. allow the muffins to cool in the pan for a few minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. serve and enjoy your delicious carrot and raisin muffins!
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, baking, powder, baking, soda, ground, cinnamon, salt, egg, vegetable, buttermilk, vanilla, extract, carrot, raisin

title: Granola bars
raw_text: 42. Granola bars: 180 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and nuts, origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups old-fashioned rolled oats
- 1 cup nuts (e.g. almonds, pecans, walnuts), chopped
- 1/2 cup seeds (e.g. sunflower, pumpkin)
- 1/2 cup dried fruit (e.g. raisins, cranberries, apricots), chopped
- 1/2 cup honey or maple syrup
- 1/4 cup nut butter (e.g. almond butter, peanut butter)
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c). line a baking dish with parchment paper and set it aside.
2. in a large bowl, combine the rolled oats, chopped nuts, seeds, and dried fruit.
3. in a small saucepan, heat the honey or maple syrup, nut butter, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and salt over low heat. stir until well combined and smooth.
4. pour the wet mixture over the dry ingredients and stir until everything is evenly coated.
5. transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish and press it down firmly with the back of a spoon or spatula.
6. bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the edges turn golden brown.
7. remove from the oven and let it cool completely in the baking dish before cutting into bars.
8. store the granola bars in an airtight container at room temperature or in the refrigerator for longer shelf life.

enjoy your delicious homemade granola bars!
ingredients_list: fashioned, rolled, oat, nut, almond, pecan, walnut, seed, sunflower, pumpkin, dried, fruit, raisin, cranberry, apricot, honey, maple, syrup, nut, butter, almond, butter, peanut, butter, vanilla, extract, cinnamon, salt

title: Spinach and cheese turnovers
raw_text: 44. Spinach and cheese turnovers: 220 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy and gluten, origin: Various
ingredients:
sure! here's the recipe for spinach and cheese turnovers:

ingredients:
- 2 cups fresh spinach, chopped
- 1 cup feta cheese, crumbled
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh dill
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
- 1/4 cup chopped green onions
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 package of puff pastry sheets
- 1 egg, beaten (for egg wash)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped spinach, feta cheese, parmesan cheese, dill, parsley, green onions, minced garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper. mix until well combined.
3. roll out the puff pastry sheets on a lightly floured surface and cut them into squares of your desired size.
4. place a spoonful of the spinach and cheese mixture onto each square of puff pastry.
5. fold the pastry over the filling to create a triangle shape and gently press the edges to seal. use a fork to crimp the edges for an extra seal.
6. transfer the turnovers onto the prepared baking sheet and brush them with the beaten egg wash.
7. bake in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the turnovers are puffed up and golden brown.
8. remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

enjoy your delicious spinach and cheese turnovers!
ingredients_list: spinach, cheese, turnover, fresh, spinach, feta, cheese, parmesan, cheese, fresh, dill, fresh, parsley, green, onion, clove, garlic, minced, olive, salt, pepper, taste, puff, pastry, sheet, egg, egg, wash

title: Yogurt parfait with granola
raw_text: 49. Yogurt parfait with granola: 250 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains dairy and gluten, origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup of yogurt (any flavor)
- 1/2 cup of granola
- 1/4 cup of fresh berries (such as strawberries or blueberries)

preparation:

4. repeat the layers with the remaining yogurt, granola, and berries.

title: Oatmeal cookies
raw_text: 50. Oatmeal cookies: 180 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup unsalted butter, softened
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 and 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 3 cups old-fashioned oats
- 1 cup raisins (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a large mixing bowl, cream together the softened butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar until fluffy and well combined.
3. add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. stir in the vanilla extract.
4. in a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and salt. gradually add this dry mixture to the creamed butter and sugar, mixing until just combined.
5. stir in the oats (and raisins, if desired) until evenly distributed in the dough.
6. drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto the prepared baking sheet, spacing them about 2 inches apart.
7. bake in the preheated oven for 10 to 12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
8. allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. enjoy your homemade oatmeal cookies!
ingredients_list: unsalted, butter, brown, sugar, sugar, egg, vanilla, extract, flour, baking, soda, salt, fashioned, oat, raisin

title: Almond milk smoothie
raw_text: 53. Almond milk smoothie: 200 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains almonds, origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup almond milk
- 1 ripe banana
- 1/2 cup frozen berries (blueberries, strawberries, or mixed berries)
- 1 tablespoon almond butter
- 1 tablespoon honey or maple syrup (optional, for sweetness)
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- ice cubes (as desired)
preparation:
1. in a blender, combine almond milk, banana, frozen berries, almond butter, honey or maple syrup (if using), and vanilla extract.
2. blend the ingredients until smooth and creamy. if desired, add a few ice cubes and blend again to make the smoothie colder and thicker.
3. taste the smoothie and adjust the sweetness or thickness by adding more honey/maple syrup or ice cubes as needed.
4. pour the almond milk smoothie into glasses and enjoy immediately. you can also garnish with a sprinkle of sliced almonds or a berry on top if desired.
ingredients_list: almond, milk, banana, frozen, berry, blueberry, strawberry, berry, almond, butter, honey, maple, syrup, sweetness, vanilla, extract, ice, cube

title: Greek yogurt pancakes with maple syrup
raw_text: 55. Greek yogurt pancakes with maple syrup: 250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: Greece
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 tablespoons granulated sugar
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup greek yogurt
- 1/2 cup milk
- 2 large eggs
- 2 tablespoons melted butter
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
2. in a separate bowl, mix together the greek yogurt, milk, eggs, melted butter, and vanilla extract until well-combined.
3. gradually pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, stirring until just combined. do not overmix; there may be a few lumps in the batter.
4. heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat and lightly grease with cooking spray or butter.
5. pour about 1/4 cup of batter onto the skillet for each pancake. cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until golden brown.
6. repeat with the remaining batter, adding more cooking spray or butter as needed.
7. serve the pancakes warm with maple syrup drizzled over the top. enjoy!

title: Egg muffins with turkey and cheese
raw_text: 59. Egg muffins with turkey and cheese: 160 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 6 large eggs
- 1/2 cup cooked turkey, diced
- 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 1/4 cup milk
- salt and pepper, to taste
- optional toppings: chopped green onions or diced tomatoes
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c). grease or line a muffin tin with paper liners.
2. in a large bowl, whisk together the eggs and milk until well combined. season with salt and pepper.
3. stir in the diced turkey and shredded cheese into the egg mixture.
4. pour the mixture evenly into the muffin tin, filling each cup about 3/4 full.
5. optional: sprinkle some chopped green onions or diced tomatoes on top of each muffin.
6. bake in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the muffins are puffed up and set in the center.
7. remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes. enjoy warm or let cool completely before storing in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

serve these delicious egg muffins as a tasty breakfast or snack option. they can be reheated in the microwave for a quick and satisfying meal!
ingredients_list: egg, turkey, shredded, cheddar, cheese, milk, salt, pepper, taste, topping, green, onion, tomato

title: Mixed nuts and dried fruit
raw_text: 61. Mixed nuts and dried fruit: 200 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains nuts, origin: Various
ingredients:
sure! here's a recipe for mixed nuts and dried fruit:

ingredients:
- 1 cup almonds
- 1 cup cashews
- 1 cup walnuts
- 1 cup dried cranberries
- 1 cup dried apricots
- 1 cup raisins
- 1 tablespoon honey
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- pinch of salt
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the almonds, cashews, and walnuts.
3. drizzle the honey over the nuts and mix well until they are evenly coated.
4. sprinkle the ground cinnamon and pinch of salt over the nuts and toss to combine.
5. spread the coated nuts in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet.
6. place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for 10-15 minutes, or until the nuts are golden brown and fragrant.
7. remove the baking sheet from the oven and allow the nuts to cool completely.
8. once cooled, add the dried cranberries, dried apricots, and raisins to the bowl with the nuts.
9. toss well to combine all the ingredients.
10. transfer the mixed nuts and dried fruit to an airtight container or jar for storage.
11. enjoy as a snack, or use as a topping for salads, yogurt, or desserts.

note: feel free to adjust the quantities of nuts and dried fruits to your preference. you can also add other dried fruits like cherries or blueberries for added variety.
cuisine: The cuisine type of this recipe is "Mixed".

ingredients:

title: Oatmeal raisin cookies
raw_text: 66. Oatmeal raisin cookies: 180 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup of rolled oats
- 1 cup of all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon of baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon of ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon of salt
- 1/2 cup of unsalted butter, softened
- 1/2 cup of brown sugar
- 1/4 cup of granulated sugar
- 1 large egg
- 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract
- 1/2 cup of raisins
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a medium-sized bowl, combine the rolled oats, flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt. set aside.
3. in a separate large bowl, cream together the softened butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
4. beat in the egg and vanilla extract until well combined.
5. gradually add the dry ingredient mixture to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.
6. stir in the raisins.
7. drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto the prepared baking sheet, spacing them about 2 inches apart.
8. bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes or until the edges are golden brown.
9. remove from the oven and let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. enjoy your homemade oatmeal raisin cookies!

title: Shrimp and avocado salad

ingredients:

- 2 tablespoons olive oil

1. in a large bowl, combine the cooked shrimp, diced avocados, red onion, cilantro, and jalapeno.

title: Spinach and ricotta puff pastry swirls
raw_text: 68. Spinach and ricotta puff pastry swirls: 150 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy and gluten, origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 sheet of puff pastry
- 1 cup of fresh spinach, chopped
- 1 cup of ricotta cheese
- 1/4 cup of grated parmesan cheese
- 1 clove of garlic, minced
- 1/2 teaspoon of dried basil
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 egg, beaten (for egg wash)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. thaw the puff pastry according to the package instructions.
3. in a mixing bowl, combine the chopped spinach, ricotta cheese, parmesan cheese, minced garlic, dried basil, salt, and pepper. mix well until all the ingredients are evenly incorporated.
4. on a lightly floured surface, roll out the puff pastry into a large rectangle.
5. spread the spinach and ricotta mixture evenly over the puff pastry, leaving a small border around the edges.
6. starting from one of the shorter ends, carefully roll the puff pastry into a log, ensuring that the filling is secured inside.
7. once rolled, use a sharp knife to slice the log into individual swirls, about 1-inch thick.
8. place the swirls on the prepared baking sheet, spacing them apart to allow for expansion.
9. brush the tops of the swirls with beaten egg to create a golden and shiny crust.
10. bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the pastry is puffed and golden brown.
11. remove from the oven and let the swirls cool slightly before serving.
12. enjoy your delicious spinach and ricotta puff pastry swirls!
ingredients_list: puff, pastry, fresh, spinach, ricotta, cheese, parmesan, cheese, clove, garlic, minced, dried, basil, salt, pepper, taste, egg, egg, wash

title: Sundried tomato and feta muffins
raw_text: 74. Sundried tomato and feta muffins: 220 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy and gluten, origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 tablespoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup sundried tomatoes, drained and chopped
- 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh basil
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
- 1 cup milk
- 1/4 cup olive oil
- 2 large eggs
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c) and line a muffin tin with paper liners.
2. in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
3. stir in the sundried tomatoes, feta cheese, basil, and parsley until well combined.
4. in a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, olive oil, and eggs.
5. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. do not overmix.
6. spoon the batter into the prepared muffin tin, filling each about 2/3 full.
7. bake in the preheated oven for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
8. allow the muffins to cool in the tin for a few minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, baking, powder, salt, sundried, tomato, feta, cheese, fresh, basil, fresh, parsley, milk, olive, egg

title: Almond milk yogurt with granola and berries
raw_text: 78. Almond milk yogurt with granola and berries: 280 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains almonds and gluten, origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups almond milk
- 2 tablespoons almond milk yogurt starter culture
- 1 cup granola
- 1 cup mixed berries (such as blueberries, strawberries, raspberries)
preparation:
1. in a saucepan, heat almond milk over low heat until it reaches a temperature of 110°f (43°c). use a kitchen thermometer to ensure the correct temperature.

2. remove the almond milk from heat and transfer it to a clean glass jar.

3. stir in the almond milk yogurt starter culture until well combined. make sure the culture is evenly distributed throughout the mixture.

4. cover the jar with a clean cloth or paper towel and secure it with a rubber band or string. allow the mixture to ferment at room temperature for 8-12 hours, or until it reaches your desired level of tartness.

5. after the fermentation process, transfer the jar to the refrigerator and let it chill for at least 4 hours or overnight.

6. once chilled, divide the almond milk yogurt into serving bowls or glasses.

7. top each serving with a generous amount of granola and mixed berries.

8. serve immediately and enjoy your homemade almond milk yogurt with granola and berries!
ingredients_list: almond, milk, almond, milk, yogurt, starter, granola, berry, blueberry, strawberry, raspberry

title: Savory muffins with ham and cheese

ingredients:

title: Chocolate banana protein pancakes
raw_text: 80. Chocolate banana protein pancakes: 250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy and gluten, origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 ripe banana
- 1 scoop of chocolate protein powder
- 2 eggs
- ¼ cup of oats
- 1 tsp of baking powder
- 1 tsp of cocoa powder
- ½ tsp of vanilla extract
- cooking spray or coconut oil for greasing
preparation:
1. in a blender, combine the ripe banana, protein powder, eggs, oats, baking powder, cocoa powder, and vanilla extract.
2. blend the ingredients until you have a smooth batter.
3. heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat and lightly grease it with cooking spray or coconut oil.
4. pour about ¼ cup of the batter onto the skillet for each pancake.
5. cook the pancakes for 2-3 minutes, or until bubbles start to form on the surface.
6. flip the pancakes and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, until they are cooked through.
7. repeat steps 4-6 with the remaining batter.
8. serve the pancakes warm and enjoy with your favorite toppings such as sliced bananas, melted chocolate, or maple syrup.

title: Raspberry almond chia pudding
raw_text: 82. Raspberry almond chia pudding: 220 calories per portion, 1 portion, contains almonds, origin: Various

ingredients:
- 1 cup fresh or frozen raspberries
- 2 cups almond milk
- 1/4 cup chia seeds
- 2 tablespoons honey or maple syrup
- 1/4 teaspoon almond extract
- optional toppings: sliced almonds, additional raspberries
preparation:
1. in a blender or food processor, blend the raspberries until smooth and creamy.
2. in a large bowl, whisk together the almond milk, chia seeds, honey or maple syrup, and almond extract.
3. add the raspberry puree to the mixture and stir well until everything is combined.
4. cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight, allowing the chia seeds to absorb the liquid and thicken the pudding.
5. stir the pudding well before serving and divide it into serving bowls or jars.
6. top with sliced almonds and additional raspberries if desired.

ingredients:

title: Date and Nut Balls
raw_text: 1. Date and Nut Balls: 60 kcal per portion, 8 portions, contains nuts, origin: Middle East.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup pitted dates
- 1 cup nuts (such as almonds, walnuts, or cashews)
- 1 tablespoon honey or maple syrup
- 1 tablespoon coconut oil
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- shredded coconut or cocoa powder for coating (optional)
preparation:
1. in a food processor, add the dates and nuts. pulse until they are finely chopped and well combined.

title: Lebanese Za'atar Bread
raw_text: 9. Lebanese Za'atar Bread: 80 kcal per portion, 6 portions, contains gluten, origin: Lebanon.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon active dry yeast
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 tablespoons za'atar spice blend
- 1 tablespoon sesame seeds
- 1 tablespoon dried thyme
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, dissolve the yeast and sugar in 1/4 cup warm water. let it sit for 5 minutes until foamy.
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the flour and salt. make a well in the center and pour in the yeast mixture and olive oil.
3. gradually mix in 3/4 cup warm water until a dough forms.
4. transfer the dough onto a floured surface and knead for about 5-7 minutes until smooth and elastic.
5. place the dough in a greased bowl, cover with a clean kitchen towel, and let it rise in a warm place for 1 hour or until it doubles in size.
6. preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
7. punch down the risen dough and divide it into 4 equal portions. roll each portion into a 1/4 inch thick circle or oval shape.
8. transfer the rolled dough onto the prepared baking sheet.
9. in a small bowl, mix together the za'atar spice blend, sesame seeds, and dried thyme.
10. sprinkle the za'atar mixture evenly over the bread dough, pressing it gently into the dough.
11. bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes or until the bread is golden brown and crisp.
12. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes. serve warm as a side with hummus, labneh, or your choice of dips.
ingredients_list: flour, yeast, sugar, salt, olive, atar, spice, blend, sesame, seed, dried, thyme

title: Pineapple and Cucumber Salad
raw_text: 12. Pineapple and Cucumber Salad: 80 kcal per portion, 6 portions, contains citrus, origin: Unknown.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 small pineapple
- 1 cucumber
- 1 red bell pepper
- 1 small red onion
- 1/4 cup fresh cilantro leaves
- 1 tablespoon lime juice

preparation:
1. peel and core the pineapple, then cut it into bite-sized chunks. place them in a large bowl.
2. peel the cucumber and cut it into thin slices. add to the bowl with the pineapple.
3. deseed the red bell pepper and dice it into small pieces. thinly slice the red onion. add both to the bowl.
4. roughly chop the cilantro leaves and add them to the bowl as well.
5. in a separate small bowl, whisk together the lime juice and honey until well combined.
6. pour the lime-honey mixture over the salad ingredients in the large bowl.
7. season with salt and pepper according to your taste.
8. toss all the ingredients together until well coated with the dressing.
9. let the salad sit in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
10. serve chilled and enjoy!
ingredients_list: pineapple, cucumber, red, bell, pepper, red, onion, fresh, cilantro, leaf, lime, honey, salt, pepper, taste

title: Frozen Berry Yogurt Bites
raw_text: 14. Frozen Berry Yogurt Bites: 60 kcal per portion, 8 portions, contains dairy, origin: Unknown.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups plain greek yogurt
- 1 cup mixed berries (such as blueberries, raspberries, and strawberries)
- 2 tablespoons honey or maple syrup (optional)
preparation:
1. in a medium-sized bowl, combine the greek yogurt and honey/maple syrup (if using). mix well until smooth and creamy.
2. gently fold in the mixed berries, ensuring they are evenly distributed throughout the yogurt mixture.
3. line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
4. using a spoon or cookie scoop, scoop small dollops of the yogurt and berry mixture onto the lined baking sheet, spacing them apart.
5. once all the mixture has been scooped onto the baking sheet, use the back of the spoon or a spatula to flatten and shape the dollops into bite-sized circles.
6. place the baking sheet in the freezer and let the yogurt bites freeze for at least 2-3 hours, or until completely frozen.
7. once frozen, remove the yogurt bites from the baking sheet and transfer them to an airtight container or freezer bag for storage.
8. keep the frozen berry yogurt bites in the freezer until ready to serve. enjoy as a refreshing and healthy snack!
