title: Spiced Roasted Almonds
raw_text: 17. Spiced Roasted Almonds: 120 kcal per portion, 6 portions, contains nuts, origin: Unknown.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups almonds
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional)
- 1 tablespoon honey (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. in a mixing bowl, combine the almonds, olive oil, cumin, paprika, cinnamon, salt, and cayenne pepper (if using). toss well to coat the almonds evenly with the spices.
3. spread the spiced almonds in a single layer on a baking sheet.
4. place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and roast the almonds for 10-15 minutes, or until golden brown and fragrant. give them a quick stir halfway through the cooking time to ensure even browning.
5. remove the almonds from the oven and let them cool completely. they will become crunchier as they cool.
6. if desired, drizzle the roasted almonds with honey and toss gently to coat. this will add a touch of sweetness to the spiced nuts.
7. let the almonds rest for a few more minutes until the honey sets, then transfer to an airtight container for storage.
8. enjoy as a snack or use as a topping for salads, yogurt, or desserts.
ingredients_list: almond, olive, ground, cumin, paprika, ground, cinnamon, salt, cayenne, pepper, honey

title: Mini Chicken Kebabs
raw_text: 19. Mini Chicken Kebabs: 150 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains poultry, origin: Middle East.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breast
- 1/4 cup greek yogurt
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- skewers, soaked in water
preparation:
1. cut the chicken breast into small, bite-sized cubes.
2. in a mixing bowl, combine the greek yogurt, olive oil, minced garlic, paprika, cumin, salt, and black pepper. stir well to combine.
3. add the chicken cubes into the marinade and toss until they are thoroughly coated. allow the chicken to marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes, or up to overnight.
4. preheat the grill to medium heat.
5. remove the chicken cubes from the marinade and thread them onto the soaked skewer sticks.
6. place the skewers on the preheated grill and cook for about 8-10 minutes, turning occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through and slightly charred.
7. once cooked, remove the skewers from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes before serving.
8. serve the mini chicken kebabs as an appetizer or main dish with your favorite sauce or dip. enjoy!
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, greek, yogurt, olive, clove, garlic, minced, paprika, cumin, salt, black, pepper, skewer, soaked, water

title: Apple Cinnamon Oatmeal Bars
raw_text: 20. Apple Cinnamon Oatmeal Bars: 100 kcal per portion, 6 portions, contains gluten, origin: USA.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups rolled oats
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup packed brown sugar
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 1/4 cup honey
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 2 cups peeled and diced apples
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c). grease a 9x9-inch baking dish.
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the rolled oats, flour, brown sugar, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt.
3. add in the melted butter, honey, and vanilla extract. mix until well combined and crumbly.
4. reserve about 1/2 cup of the oat mixture for later use.
5. press the remaining oat mixture into the bottom of the prepared baking dish, forming an even layer.
6. spread the diced apples on top of the oat mixture in a single layer.
7. sprinkle the reserved oat mixture evenly over the top of the apples.
8. bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the apples are tender.
9. remove from the oven and let cool completely before cutting into bars.
10. serve and enjoy!
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, flour, brown, sugar, ground, cinnamon, baking, soda, salt, unsalted, butter, honey, vanilla, extract, apple

title: Olive and Sundried Tomato Bruschetta
raw_text: 22. Olive and Sundried Tomato Bruschetta: 90 kcal per portion, 8 portions, contains gluten, origin: Italy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 loaf of ciabatta bread
- 1/2 cup of pitted green olives, diced
- 1/4 cup of sundried tomatoes, chopped
- 2 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh basil leaves for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. slice the ciabatta bread into 1-inch thick slices.
3. place the bread slices on a baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil.
4. bake in the preheated oven for about 8-10 minutes, or until the bread is toasted and crispy.
5. in a mixing bowl, combine the diced olives, chopped sundried tomatoes, minced garlic, and extra virgin olive oil. mix well.
6. season the olive and sundried tomato mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
7. once the bread slices are toasted, remove them from the oven and allow them to cool for a few minutes.
8. spoon the olive and sundried tomato mixture onto each toasted bread slice, spreading it evenly.
9. garnish each bruschetta with fresh basil leaves.
10. serve immediately and enjoy!
ingredients_list: loaf, ciabatta, bread, pitted, green, olive, sundried, tomato, virgin, olive, clove, garlic, minced, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, basil, leaf, garnish

title: Baked Falafel Balls
raw_text: 27. Baked Falafel Balls: 90 kcal per portion, 8 portions, contains gluten, origin: Middle East.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup dried chickpeas
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 3 garlic cloves, minced
- 1/2 cup fresh parsley, chopped
- 1/2 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional)
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
preparation:
1. soak the dried chickpeas in water overnight. drain and rinse thoroughly.
2. in a food processor, combine the soaked chickpeas, chopped onion, minced garlic, parsley, cilantro, cumin, coriander, cayenne pepper (optional), salt, and black pepper. pulse until the mixture is well combined and begins to form a coarse paste.
3. transfer the mixture to a bowl. cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to allow the mixture to firm up.
4. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c). grease a baking sheet with olive oil.
5. take small portions of the chickpea mixture and shape them into small balls, about 1-2 inches in diameter. place the falafel balls onto the greased baking sheet.
6. drizzle olive oil over the falafel balls to promote browning and prevent sticking.
7. bake the falafel balls in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until they are golden brown and firm on the outside.
8. serve the baked falafel balls as desired. they can be enjoyed plain, in pita pockets, with salad, or with a dipping sauce such as hummus or tzatziki. enjoy!
ingredients_list: dried, chickpea, onion, garlic, clove, minced, fresh, parsley, fresh, cilantro, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, cayenne, pepper, salt, black, pepper, olive

title: Quinoa Salad with Vinaigrette
raw_text: 32. Quinoa Salad with Vinaigrette: 140 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains citrus, origin: South America.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup quinoa
- 2 cups water
- 1/4 cup olive oil
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 1/2 teaspoon dijon mustard
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 cucumber, diced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh mint
- 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 1/4 cup toasted pine nuts
preparation:
1. rinse the quinoa thoroughly under cold water.
2. in a medium-sized saucepan, bring the water to a boil. add the quinoa and reduce heat to low. cover and simmer for about 15-20 minutes or until the quinoa is tender and the water is absorbed.
3. meanwhile, in a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, red wine vinegar, minced garlic, dijon mustard, salt, and pepper to make the vinaigrette.
4. once the quinoa is cooked, fluff it with a fork and transfer it to a large mixing bowl.
5. add the diced cucumber, red bell pepper, chopped parsley, chopped mint, crumbled feta cheese, and toasted pine nuts to the bowl with the quinoa.
6. pour the vinaigrette over the ingredients in the bowl and toss everything together until well combined.
7. taste and adjust the seasoning if needed.
8. serve the quinoa salad at room temperature or chilled. enjoy!
ingredients_list: quinoa, water, olive, lemon, red, wine, vinegar, garlic, clove, minced, dijon, mustard, salt, pepper, taste, cucumber, red, bell, pepper, fresh, parsley, fresh, mint, feta, cheese, toasted, pine, nut

title: Spanakopita (Spinach Pie)
raw_text: 34. Spanakopita (Spinach Pie): 180 kcal per portion, 5 portions, contains dairy, origin: Greece.
ingredients:
ingredients for spanakopita (spinach pie):
- 1 package of phyllo pastry sheets
- 2 pounds of fresh spinach, washed and chopped
- 1 large onion, finely chopped
- 4 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1/2 cup of fresh dill, chopped
- 1/2 cup of fresh parsley, chopped
- 1 cup of feta cheese, crumbled
- 1/4 cup of olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- butter for brushing the phyllo pastry sheets
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. add onions and garlic, and cook until onions become translucent.
3. add the chopped spinach to the pan and cook until wilted, about 3-5 minutes. remove from heat and allow the mixture to cool.
4. once cooled, squeeze out any excess moisture from the spinach mixture using a clean kitchen towel.
5. in a mixing bowl, combine the spinach mixture, dill, parsley, and crumbled feta cheese. season with salt and pepper according to taste. stir well to combine all the ingredients.
6. unroll the phyllo pastry sheets and cover them with a damp kitchen towel to prevent them from drying out.
7. take one sheet of phyllo pastry and brush it lightly with melted butter. place another sheet on top and repeat the process until you have about 8-10 sheets stacked together.
8. spoon a generous amount of the spinach mixture onto the phyllo pastry stack, spreading it evenly along the sheet.
9. fold the phyllo pastry over the filling, sealing the edges. repeat this step to create a triangle shape (or any desired shape) until all the ingredients are used.
10. place the prepared spanakopitas on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
11. brush the tops of the spanakopitas with melted butter.
12. bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until the pastry turns golden brown and crispy.
13. remove from the oven and allow it to cool for a few minutes before serving.

enjoy your homemade spanakopita (spinach pie)!
ingredients_list: phyllo, pastry, sheet, pound, fresh, spinach, washed, onion, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, dill, fresh, parsley, feta, cheese, olive, salt, pepper, taste, butter, brushing, phyllo, pastry, sheet

title: Tomato and Avocado Salsa
raw_text: 35. Tomato and Avocado Salsa: 70 kcal per portion, 6 portions, contains citrus, origin: Mexico.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 ripe tomatoes, diced
- 1 avocado, diced
- 1/4 cup red onion, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
- 1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and finely chopped
- 1 lime, juiced
- salt to taste
preparation:
1. in a medium-sized bowl, combine the diced tomatoes, avocado, red onion, cilantro, and jalapeno pepper.
2. squeeze the lime juice over the mixture and gently toss to combine.
3. season with salt to taste.
4. let the salsa sit for at least 10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
5. serve with tortilla chips or as a topping for tacos, salads, or grilled meats.
6. enjoy!
ingredients_list: tomato, avocado, red, onion, fresh, cilantro, jalapeno, pepper, seeded, lime, salt, taste

title: Indian Samosas
raw_text: 37. Indian Samosas: 200 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten, origin: India.
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 teaspoon salt
- water, as needed
- 2 medium potatoes, boiled and mashed
- 1 cup green peas, boiled
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 1 green chili, finely chopped
- 1 teaspoon ginger, grated
- 1 teaspoon cumin seeds
- 1 teaspoon coriander powder
- 1 teaspoon garam masala
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
- salt, to taste
- vegetable oil, for frying
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, vegetable oil, and salt. mix well. gradually add water and knead to form a firm dough. set aside for 30 minutes.
2. heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a pan. add cumin seeds and let them splutter. 
3. add chopped onion, green chili, and grated ginger to the pan. sauté until the onions turn translucent.
4. add boiled mashed potatoes, green peas, coriander powder, garam masala, turmeric powder, and salt. mix well. cook for 2-3 minutes, then remove from heat and let the filling cool down.
5. divide the dough into small lemon-sized balls. roll each ball into a thin circle.
6. cut the rolled dough into two halves. take one half and form a cone by sealing the straight side with water.
7. fill the cone with the prepared filling, then seal the top by sticking the edges together using water.
8. continue making cones and filling them with the mixture until all the dough and filling are used.
9. heat vegetable oil in a deep frying pan. once heated, carefully place the samosas into the oil and fry until golden brown and crispy.
10. remove the samosas from the oil and drain excess oil on paper towels.
11. serve hot with chutney or ketchup.

enjoy your delicious indian samosas!
ingredients_list: flour, vegetable, salt, water, needed, potato, boiled, green, pea, boiled, onion, green, chili, ginger, cumin, seed, coriander, powder, garam, masala, turmeric, powder, salt, taste, vegetable

title: Spring Rolls
raw_text: 39. Spring Rolls: 150 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten, origin: China.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- rice paper wrappers
- rice vermicelli noodles
- shredded lettuce
- thinly sliced cucumber
- julienne carrots
- fresh mint leaves
- fresh cilantro leaves
- cooked shrimp or grilled chicken (optional)
- soy sauce, for dipping
preparation:
1. cook the rice vermicelli noodles according to package instructions. drain and set aside.
2. prepare a shallow bowl of warm water. dip a rice paper wrapper into the water for a few seconds until it softens. place it on a clean surface.
3. on the bottom third of the rice paper, layer a few lettuce leaves, followed by a small handful of cooked rice vermicelli noodles.
4. add a few strips of sliced cucumber, julienne carrots, and some fresh herbs (mint and cilantro leaves).
5. if desired, add a few pieces of cooked shrimp or grilled chicken on top.
6. fold the bottom of the rice paper over the filling, then fold in the sides, and roll up tightly.
7. repeat with the remaining rice paper wrappers and filling ingredients.
8. serve the spring rolls with soy sauce for dipping. enjoy!
ingredients_list: rice, wrapper, rice, vermicelli, noodle, shredded, lettuce, thinly, cucumber, julienne, carrot, fresh, mint, leaf, fresh, cilantro, leaf, shrimp, chicken, soy, sauce, dipping

title: Persian Cucumber Yogurt Dip
raw_text: 42. Persian Cucumber Yogurt Dip: 90 kcal per portion, 8 portions, contains dairy, origin: Iran.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 persian cucumbers
- 1 cup plain greek yogurt
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon fresh mint, chopped (optional)
- 1 tablespoon fresh dill, chopped (optional)
- 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. wash and finely chop the persian cucumbers. you can peel them if desired, but it's not necessary.
2. in a medium-sized bowl, combine the chopped cucumbers, greek yogurt, minced garlic, fresh mint (if using), and fresh dill (if using).
3. squeeze the fresh lemon juice into the bowl and mix everything together until well combined.
4. season the dip with salt and pepper, according to your taste preferences. adjust the seasoning as needed.
5. cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. before serving, give the dip a quick stir. you can garnish it with a sprig of fresh mint or dill, if desired.
7. serve the persian cucumber yogurt dip chilled with pita bread, crackers, or fresh vegetables for dipping. enjoy!
ingredients_list: persian, cucumber, plain, greek, yogurt, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, mint, fresh, dill, fresh, lemon, salt, pepper, taste

title: Baked Cheese Crisps
raw_text: 43. Baked Cheese Crisps: 120 kcal per portion, 6 portions, contains dairy, origin: Unknown.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup shredded cheese (cheddar, mozzarella, or your choice)
- optional: seasonings (garlic powder, paprika, italian seasoning)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. scoop 1-2 tablespoon-sized portions of shredded cheese onto the prepared baking sheet. leave enough space between each portion for the cheese to melt and spread.
3. flatten each portion of cheese with the back of a spoon or your fingers. make sure it forms a thin, even layer.
4. optional: sprinkle your choice of seasonings over the cheese crisps for added flavor.
5. bake the cheese crisps in the preheated oven for 5-7 minutes, or until they turn golden brown and the edges start to crisp up.
6. remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the crisps cool for a few minutes until they become firm.
7. carefully transfer the cheese crisps to a wire rack or plate to cool completely and become fully crispy.
8. repeat the process with the remaining shredded cheese, if you have more.
9. serve the baked cheese crisps as a snack or as a topping for salads, soups, or any other dish you like. enjoy!
ingredients_list: shredded, cheese, cheddar, mozzarella, seasoning, garlic, powder, paprika, italian, seasoning

title: Chicken Satay Skewers
raw_text: 45. Chicken Satay Skewers: 200 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains peanuts, origin: Southeast Asia.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound chicken breast, cut into thin strips
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons fish sauce
- 2 tablespoons brown sugar
- 2 tablespoons peanut butter
- 2 tablespoons lime juice
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional)
- bamboo skewers, soaked in water
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine soy sauce, fish sauce, brown sugar, peanut butter, lime juice, minced garlic, ground coriander, turmeric powder, ground cumin, and cayenne pepper (if using). mix well until smooth.
2. add the chicken strips to the marinade and let them marinate for at least 1 hour, or overnight in the refrigerator.
3. preheat grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.
4. thread marinated chicken strips onto the soaked bamboo skewers, making sure to evenly distribute the strips.
5. grill the skewers for about 3-4 minutes per side or until the chicken is cooked through and slightly charred.
6. serve chicken satay skewers with peanut sauce and enjoy!
ingredients_list: chicken, breast, strip, soy, sauce, fish, sauce, brown, sugar, peanut, butter, lime, clove, garlic, minced, ground, coriander, turmeric, powder, ground, cumin, cayenne, pepper, bamboo, skewer, soaked, water

title: Lebanese Spinach Pies (Fatayer)
raw_text: 48. Lebanese Spinach Pies (Fatayer): 100 kcal per portion, 6 portions, contains gluten, origin: Lebanon.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups of all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon of instant yeast
- 1 teaspoon of sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon of salt
- 3/4 cup of warm water
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil

for the spinach filling:
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 10 ounces of frozen spinach, thawed and drained
- 1/2 cup of crumbled feta cheese
- 1/4 cup of chopped fresh parsley
- 1/4 teaspoon of salt
- 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon of ground sumac (optional)
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, yeast, sugar, and salt. mix well.
2. gradually add the warm water and olive oil to the flour mixture. stir until a dough starts to form.
3. knead the dough on a lightly floured surface for about 5 minutes, until it becomes smooth and elastic.
4. place the dough in a greased bowl, cover with a clean cloth, and let it rise in a warm place for about 1 hour, or until doubled in size.
5. while the dough is rising, prepare the spinach filling by heating olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
6. add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the skillet and sauté until the onion becomes translucent.
7. add the drained spinach to the skillet and cook for a few minutes until any excess moisture evaporates.
8. remove the skillet from the heat and let the spinach cool slightly.
9. in a bowl, combine the sautéed spinach, crumbled feta cheese, chopped parsley, salt, black pepper, and ground sumac (optional). mix well.
10. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
11. punch down the risen dough and divide it into small pieces. roll each piece into a small circle, about 4-5 inches in diameter.
12. place a spoonful of the spinach filling in the center of each dough circle.
13. fold the dough over the filling to form a triangle shape. pinch the edges firmly to seal the pies.
14. place the spinach pies on the prepared baking sheet and brush the tops lightly with olive oil.
15. bake in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the pies turn golden brown.
16. remove from the oven and let them cool slightly before serving. enjoy your lebanese spinach pies!
ingredients_list: flour, yeast, sugar, salt, water, olive, spinach, filling, olive, onion, garlic, clove, minced, ounce, frozen, spinach, thawed, feta, cheese, fresh, parsley, salt, black, pepper, ground, sumac

title: Baked Chicken Tenders
raw_text: 51. Baked Chicken Tenders: 200 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains poultry, origin: Unknown.
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 1 pound chicken tenders 
- 1 cup breadcrumbs 
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese 
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder 
- 1 teaspoon paprika 
- 1/2 teaspoon salt 
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper 
- 2 eggs, beaten 
- cooking spray
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c) and line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. 
2. in a shallow dish, combine the breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and black pepper. 
3. dip each chicken tender into the beaten eggs, then roll them in the breadcrumb mixture, pressing to adhere. 
4. place the coated chicken tenders on the prepared baking sheet. 
5. lightly spray the tenders with cooking spray to help them brown. 
6. bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the coating is golden brown. 
7. serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce. enjoy!
ingredients_list: chicken, tender, breadcrumb, parmesan, cheese, garlic, powder, paprika, salt, black, pepper, egg, spray

title: Spiced Roasted Chickpeas
raw_text: 55. Spiced Roasted Chickpeas: 90 kcal per portion, 8 portions, contains legumes, origin: Unknown.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 can (15 ounces) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c). line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a medium bowl, toss the chickpeas with olive oil until they are well coated.
3. in a separate small bowl, combine cumin, coriander, paprika, cayenne pepper, and salt.
4. sprinkle the spice mixture over the chickpeas and toss until fully coated.
5. transfer the seasoned chickpeas to the prepared baking sheet and spread them out evenly.
6. roast in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy. toss the chickpeas halfway through the cooking time to ensure even roasting.
7. once done, remove from the oven and let them cool slightly before serving. enjoy as a healthy snack or add them to salads, bowls, or wraps for an extra crunch.
cuisine: Spiced Roasted Chickpeas are of the cuisine type: Mediterranean
ingredients_list: ounce, chickpea, olive, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, paprika, cayenne, pepper, salt

title: Turkish Pide Bread
raw_text: 56. Turkish Pide Bread: 180 kcal per portion, 5 portions, contains gluten, origin: Turkey.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 cups all-purpose flour
- 2 teaspoons instant yeast
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 1/2 cups warm water
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 tablespoon yogurt
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, yeast, sugar, and salt. mix well.
2. make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and pour in the warm water, olive oil, and yogurt. mix with a wooden spoon until the dough forms.
3. transfer the dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead for about 10 minutes until it becomes smooth and elastic.
4. shape the dough into a ball and place it in a greased bowl. cover with a clean towel and let it rise in a warm place for about 1 hour or until doubled in size.
5. preheat the oven to 450°f (230°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
6. punch down the dough and divide it into 4 equal portions. shape each portion into an oval shape, about 1/2 inch thick.
7. transfer the shaped dough onto the prepared baking sheet and let them rest for 15 minutes.
8. using your fingers or the handle of a wooden spoon, create indentations on the surface of the dough to make a decorative pattern.
9. bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes or until the bread turns golden brown.
10. remove from the oven and let the bread cool on a wire rack. serve warm or at room temperature.

enjoy your homemade turkish pide bread!
ingredients_list: flour, yeast, sugar, salt, water, olive, yogurt

title: Moroccan Couscous Salad
raw_text: 57. Moroccan Couscous Salad: 160 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten, origin: Morocco.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup couscous
- 1 cup boiling water
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- salt, to taste
- pepper, to taste
- 1 small red onion, thinly sliced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 yellow bell pepper, diced
- 1 cucumber, diced
- 1 15-ounce can chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1/2 cup dried apricots, chopped
- 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped
- 1/4 cup fresh mint, chopped
- juice of 1 lemon
- 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine couscous, boiling water, and olive oil. cover and let it sit for about 5 minutes or until all the liquid is absorbed.
2. fluff the couscous with a fork to separate the grains.
3. in a small bowl, mix together ground cumin, ground coriander, ground cinnamon, salt, and pepper.
4. add the spice mixture to the couscous and toss to combine.
5. in a large serving bowl, combine red onion, red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, cucumber, chickpeas, dried apricots, parsley, and mint.
6. add the seasoned couscous to the vegetable mixture and toss everything together.
7. in a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice and extra-virgin olive oil.
8. drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to coat all the ingredients evenly.
9. allow the salad to sit for about 30 minutes to let the flavors meld together.
10. serve the moroccan couscous salad chilled or at room temperature. enjoy!
ingredients_list: couscous, boiling, water, olive, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, ground, cinnamon, salt, taste, pepper, taste, red, onion, thinly, red, bell, pepper, yellow, bell, pepper, cucumber, chickpea, dried, apricot, fresh, parsley, fresh, mint, lemon, virgin, olive

title: Mini Salmon Cakes
raw_text: 59. Mini Salmon Cakes: 200 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains seafood, origin: Unknown.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound cooked salmon, flaked
- 1/4 cup diced red onion
- 1/4 cup diced red bell pepper
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill
- 1/4 cup mayonnaise
- 1 tablespoon dijon mustard
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1/2 cup breadcrumbs
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the flaked salmon, red onion, red bell pepper, dill, mayonnaise, mustard, and lemon juice. mix well.
2. add the breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, salt, and black pepper to the salmon mixture. stir until everything is thoroughly combined.
3. shape the mixture into small patties, about 2 inches in diameter.
4. place the flour in a shallow dish. lightly coat each salmon cake with flour, shaking off any excess.
5. heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. add the salmon cakes to the skillet and cook until golden brown on each side, about 3-4 minutes per side.
6. remove the salmon cakes from the skillet and drain on a paper towel-lined plate. serve hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: salmon, flaked, red, onion, red, bell, pepper, fresh, dill, mayonnaise, dijon, mustard, lemon, breadcrumb, parmesan, cheese, salt, black, pepper, flour, olive

title: Caramel Popcorn
raw_text: 60. Caramel Popcorn: 120 kcal per portion, 6 portions, contains dairy, origin: Unknown.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup popcorn kernels
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter
- 1/4 cup light corn syrup
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 250°f (120°c). line a baking sheet with parchment paper or lightly grease it.
2. pop the popcorn kernels according to your preferred method. remove any unpopped kernels and transfer the popcorn to a large mixing bowl.
3. in a medium saucepan, combine the sugar, butter, corn syrup, and salt over medium heat. stir constantly until the mixture is melted and smooth.
4. increase the heat to medium-high and bring the mixture to a boil. allow it to boil for 4 minutes without stirring.
5. remove the saucepan from the heat and quickly stir in the baking soda and vanilla extract. the mixture will foam up, so be careful.
6. pour the caramel mixture over the popcorn in the mixing bowl. use a rubber spatula or wooden spoon to gently toss and coat the popcorn evenly.
7. transfer the coated popcorn to the prepared baking sheet, spreading it out in an even layer.
8. bake the caramel popcorn in the preheated oven for 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes to ensure even coating and prevent burning.
9. after 1 hour, remove the caramel popcorn from the oven and let it cool completely on the baking sheet. it will crisp up as it cools.
10. once cooled, break apart any large clumps of caramel popcorn and transfer it to an airtight container for storage. enjoy!
ingredients_list: popcorn, kernel, sugar, unsalted, butter, light, corn, syrup, salt, baking, soda, vanilla, extract

title: Spinach and Cheese Muffins
raw_text: 62. Spinach and Cheese Muffins: 180 kcal per portion, 5 portions, contains dairy, origin: Unknown.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 cups fresh spinach, chopped
- 1 cup shredded cheese (such as cheddar or gruyere)
- 1/4 cup finely diced onion
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 2 large eggs
- 1 tablespoon dijon mustard
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c) and line a muffin tin with paper liners or grease it.
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and black pepper.
3. add the chopped spinach, shredded cheese, diced onion, and minced garlic to the flour mixture. mix well to evenly distribute the ingredients.
4. in a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, melted butter, eggs, and dijon mustard until well combined.
5. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredient mixture. stir until just combined, being careful not to overmix. the batter will be thick and slightly lumpy.
6. spoon the batter into the prepared muffin tin, filling each cup about 2/3 full.
7. bake in the preheated oven for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
8. remove the muffins from the oven and allow them to cool in the tin for a few minutes. then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. serve the spinach and cheese muffins warm or at room temperature. they can be enjoyed as a snack, breakfast, or alongside a bowl of soup or salad.

enjoy your delicious homemade spinach and cheese muffins!
ingredients_list: flour, baking, powder, baking, soda, salt, black, pepper, fresh, spinach, shredded, cheese, cheddar, gruyere, onion, clove, garlic, minced, milk, unsalted, butter, egg, dijon, mustard

title: Roasted Garlic Edamame
raw_text: 64. Roasted Garlic Edamame: 90 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains soy, origin: Japan.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound of frozen edamame
- 1 head of garlic
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- salt, to taste
- crushed red pepper flakes (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. thaw the frozen edamame by placing it in a colander and rinsing it under warm water.
3. peel the outer skin off the head of garlic, leaving the individual cloves intact.
4. cut off the top of the garlic head to expose the cloves.
5. place the head of garlic on a piece of aluminum foil and drizzle it with 1 tablespoon of olive oil. wrap the foil tightly around the garlic.
6. place the garlic packet on a baking sheet and bake it in the preheated oven for about 30 minutes, or until the garlic cloves are soft and golden.
7. remove the garlic from the oven and let it cool.
8. squeeze the roasted garlic cloves out of their skins into a small bowl.
9. in a large skillet, heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat.
10. add the thawed edamame to the skillet and stir-fry for about 5-7 minutes, or until heated through.
11. add the roasted garlic to the skillet and toss the edamame to coat it evenly.
12. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, until the flavors are combined.
13. season with salt to taste, and if desired, sprinkle some crushed red pepper flakes for a spicy kick.
14. remove from heat and transfer the roasted garlic edamame to a serving bowl.
15. serve hot and enjoy as a side dish or a healthy snack.
ingredients_list: frozen, edamame, head, garlic, olive, salt, taste, red, pepper, flake

title: Beef Empanadas
raw_text: 67. Beef Empanadas: 200 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten, origin: Spain.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 lb ground beef
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 package refrigerated pie crusts (2 crusts)
- 1/2 cup pitted green olives, sliced
- 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 1 egg, beaten (for egg wash)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until browned. drain any excess fat.
3. add the chopped onion, minced garlic, cumin, paprika, dried oregano, salt, and pepper to the skillet with the cooked beef. stir well to combine. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the onions are soft.
4. roll out the refrigerated pie crusts on a lightly floured surface. use a round cookie cutter or a glass to cut out circles with a diameter of about 4-5 inches.
5. place a spoonful of the beef mixture onto one half of each pie crust circle, leaving about a 1/2 inch border around the edges.
6. top the beef mixture with some sliced green olives and shredded cheddar cheese.
7. fold the other half of each pie crust circle over the filling to form a half-moon shape. press the edges together firmly to seal.
8. use a fork to crimp the edges of the empanadas for a decorative touch and to ensure they are securely sealed.
9. place the prepared empanadas on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
10. brush the tops of the empanadas with the beaten egg to give them a nice golden color after baking.
11. bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the empanadas are golden brown and crispy.
12. remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving. enjoy these delicious beef empanadas as a snack or party appetizer!
ingredients_list: ground, beef, onion, clove, garlic, minced, cumin, paprika, dried, oregano, salt, pepper, taste, pie, crust, crust, pitted, green, olive, shredded, cheddar, cheese, egg, egg, wash

title: Tabbouleh Salad
raw_text: 71. Tabbouleh Salad: 130 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten, origin: Lebanon.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup bulgur wheat
- 2 cups boiling water
- 2 cups chopped fresh parsley
- 1/2 cup chopped fresh mint leaves
- 3 tomatoes, diced
- 1 cucumber, diced
- 1/2 red onion, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup fresh lemon juice
- 1/4 cup olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, pour the boiling water over the bulgur wheat. let it sit for about 20 minutes or until the water is fully absorbed. fluff the bulgur with a fork.
2. add the chopped parsley, mint, tomatoes, cucumber, and red onion to the bowl with the bulgur.
3. in a separate small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper. pour the dressing over the salad and toss well to combine.
4. taste and adjust seasoning as needed. you can add more lemon juice, olive oil, salt, or pepper according to your preference.
5. let the tabbouleh salad sit at room temperature for about 30 minutes before serving to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. serve chilled or at room temperature. enjoy!
ingredients_list: bulgur, wheat, boiling, water, fresh, parsley, fresh, mint, leaf, tomato, cucumber, red, onion, fresh, lemon, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Moroccan Spiced Roasted Nuts
raw_text: 73. Moroccan Spiced Roasted Nuts: 110 kcal per portion, 6 portions, contains nuts, origin: Morocco.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups mixed nuts (almonds, cashews, pistachios)
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon ground paprika
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 tablespoon honey
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c). line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a large bowl, combine the mixed nuts with olive oil. toss until all the nuts are well coated.
3. in a separate small bowl, mix together cumin, coriander, cinnamon, paprika, cayenne pepper, and salt.
4. sprinkle the spice mixture over the nuts, and toss well to ensure all the nuts are evenly coated.
5. spread the spiced nuts in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet.
6. roast the nuts in the preheated oven for about 12-15 minutes, or until they are fragrant and slightly golden brown. make sure to stir the nuts halfway through baking to prevent burning.
7. remove the nuts from the oven and drizzle honey over them. toss well to coat all the nuts with honey.
8. allow the nuts to cool completely on the baking sheet before storing in an airtight container. enjoy as a snack or as a topping for salads or desserts!
ingredients_list: nut, almond, cashew, pistachio, olive, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, ground, cinnamon, ground, paprika, cayenne, pepper, salt, honey

title: Mini Berry Tarts
raw_text: 79. Mini Berry Tarts: 170 kcal per portion, 5 portions, contains gluten, origin: Unknown.
ingredients:
ingredients for mini berry tarts:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup powdered sugar
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, cold and cut into small cubes
- 1 cup mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries, etc.)
- 1/4 cup granulated sugar
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- optional: whipped cream or powdered sugar for garnish
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour and powdered sugar.
2. add the cold, cubed butter to the flour mixture.
3. using a pastry cutter or your fingers, cut the butter into the flour until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
4. form the dough into a ball and wrap it in plastic wrap. chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
5. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
6. on a lightly floured surface, roll out the chilled dough to about 1/4-inch thickness.
7. using a round cookie cutter or the bottom of a small glass, cut out circles that will fit into your mini tart pans.
8. press the dough circles into the mini tart pans, trimming any excess dough.
9. in a separate bowl, combine the mixed berries, granulated sugar, cornstarch, and lemon juice. gently toss to coat the berries.
10. fill each tart shell with the berry mixture.
11. place the filled tart pans on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the berries are bubbling.
12. remove from the oven and allow the tarts to cool before serving.
13. optional: serve with a dollop of whipped cream or a dusting of powdered sugar on top.
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, unsalted, butter, cube, berry, strawberry, blueberry, raspberry, sugar, cornstarch, lemon, cream, sugar, garnish

title: Stuffed Dates with Cream Cheese
raw_text: 80. Stuffed Dates with Cream Cheese: 140 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, origin: Unknown.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 12 medjool dates
- 4 ounces cream cheese
- 1/4 cup chopped nuts (such as almonds or walnuts)
- 1 tablespoon honey
preparation:
1. starting with each date, make a lengthwise cut about halfway through the date, without fully splitting it open.
2. remove the pit from each date and set aside.
3. in a small bowl, combine the cream cheese and chopped nuts until well mixed.
4. take about a teaspoonful of the cream cheese mixture and stuff it into the cavity of each date, pressing gently to close the opening.
5. arrange the stuffed dates on a serving plate.
6. drizzle honey over the top of the stuffed dates, using more or less depending on your preference for sweetness.
7. serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.
ingredients_list: medjool, date, ounce, cream, cheese, nut, almond, walnut, honey

title: Greek Pita Bread Pizza
raw_text: 81. Greek Pita Bread Pizza: 160 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten, origin: Greece.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 greek pita breads
- 1 cup tomato sauce
- 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- ½ cup sliced black olives
- ¼ cup crumbled feta cheese
- ¼ cup diced red onion
- ¼ cup diced green bell pepper
- ¼ cup chopped fresh tomatoes
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. lay the four pita breads onto a baking sheet.
3. spread an even layer of tomato sauce on each pita bread.
4. sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese over the tomato sauce.
5. add black olives, feta cheese, red onion, green bell pepper, and chopped tomatoes evenly over the cheese.
6. sprinkle dried oregano on top of the toppings.
7. drizzle olive oil over the pizzas and season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for about 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and slightly golden.
9. remove from the oven and let the pizzas cool for a few minutes before slicing.
10. serve the greek pita bread pizzas warm and enjoy!
ingredients_list: greek, pita, bread, tomato, sauce, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, black, olive, feta, cheese, red, onion, green, bell, pepper, fresh, tomato, dried, oregano, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Baked Zucchini Fritters
raw_text: 82. Baked Zucchini Fritters: 120 kcal per portion, 6 portions, contains gluten, origin: Unknown.
ingredients:
sure! here is a recipe for baked zucchini fritters:

ingredients:
- 2 medium zucchini, grated
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/2 cup breadcrumbs
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 eggs, beaten
- olive oil, for brushing
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c). line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set aside.
2. grate the zucchini into a colander and sprinkle with salt. let sit for about 10 minutes to allow the zucchini to release excess moisture. then squeeze out any remaining liquid from the grated zucchini.
3. in a large mixing bowl, combine the grated zucchini, parmesan cheese, breadcrumbs, minced garlic, chopped parsley, black pepper, and beaten eggs. mix well until all the ingredients are evenly combined.
4. take spoonfuls of the zucchini mixture and shape into patties or fritters. place them on the prepared baking sheet.
5. brush the tops of the fritters with olive oil.
6. bake in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes, or until the fritters are golden brown and crispy on the outside.
7. remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving.
8. serve the baked zucchini fritters as a side dish or appetizer with your favorite dipping sauce, such as sour cream, tzatziki, or marinara sauce.

enjoy your baked zucchini fritters!
ingredients_list: baked, zucchini, fritter, zucchini, salt, parmesan, cheese, breadcrumb, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, parsley, black, pepper, egg, olive, brushing

title: Orange and Feta Salad
raw_text: 83. Orange and Feta Salad: 90 kcal per portion, 6 portions, contains dairy, origin: Greece.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 cups of mixed salad greens
- 2 oranges, peeled and segmented
- 1 cup of crumbled feta cheese
- 1/4 cup of sliced red onions
- 1/4 cup of chopped fresh mint leaves
- 2 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil
- 1 tablespoon of freshly squeezed orange juice
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a large salad bowl, combine the mixed salad greens, orange segments, crumbled feta cheese, sliced red onions, and chopped fresh mint leaves.
2. in a small bowl, whisk together the extra virgin olive oil, freshly squeezed orange juice, salt, and pepper until well combined.
3. drizzle the dressing over the salad ingredients.
4. toss the salad gently to ensure all the ingredients are well coated with the dressing.
5. serve immediately and enjoy!
ingredients_list: salad, green, orange, feta, cheese, red, onion, fresh, mint, leaf, virgin, olive, freshly, squeezed, orange, salt, pepper, taste

title: Spicy Roasted Chickpea Salad
raw_text: 84. Spicy Roasted Chickpea Salad: 110 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains legumes, origin: Unknown.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 can of chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 cups mixed salad greens
- 1 cucumber, sliced
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1/4 red onion, thinly sliced
- 1/4 cup feta cheese, crumbled
- fresh parsley for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. in a mixing bowl, combine the drained and rinsed chickpeas, olive oil, smoked paprika, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. toss until the chickpeas are coated evenly.
3. spread the seasoned chickpeas on a baking sheet in a single layer.
4. roast in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the chickpeas are crispy and golden brown.
5. while the chickpeas are roasting, prepare the salad ingredients. in a large salad bowl, add the mixed salad greens, sliced cucumber, red bell pepper, and red onion.
6. once the chickpeas are done, remove them from the oven and let them cool slightly.
7. add the roasted chickpeas to the salad bowl and gently toss everything together.
8. sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese over the salad.
9. garnish with fresh parsley.
10. serve the spicy roasted chickpea salad immediately and enjoy!
cuisine: Spicy Roasted Chickpea Salad is a Mediterranean cuisine.
ingredients_list: chickpea, olive, smoked, paprika, cayenne, pepper, salt, pepper, taste, salad, green, cucumber, red, bell, pepper, red, onion, thinly, feta, cheese, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Lebanese Spinach Fatayer
raw_text: 85. Lebanese Spinach Fatayer: 140 kcal per portion, 5 portions, contains gluten, origin: Lebanon.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups fresh spinach, chopped
- 1 cup feta cheese, crumbled
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1 teaspoon ground sumac
- 1 teaspoon dried mint
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/4 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- store-bought pizza dough or puff pastry, thawed (enough for 12 small pastries)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. add the chopped onion and sauté until translucent.
3. add the chopped spinach to the skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes, until wilted.
4. remove the skillet from heat and transfer the cooked spinach and onion mixture to a mixing bowl.
5. to the bowl, add feta cheese, lemon juice, sumac, dried mint, salt, black pepper, cumin, coriander, and cinnamon. mix all the ingredients together until well combined.
6. roll out the store-bought pizza dough or puff pastry on a floured surface to a thickness of about 1/8 inch (3 mm).
7. using a round cookie cutter or a glass, cut circles of about 4-5 inches (10-12 cm) in diameter from the dough or pastry.
8. spoon a tablespoon of the spinach and feta mixture onto the center of each dough/ pastry circle.
9. fold the edges of the dough or pastry over the filling, creating a triangular shape or any desired shape for the fatayer. pinch the edges to seal.
10. place the fatayer on a parchment-lined baking sheet, leaving a little space between them.
11. bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the fatayer turns golden brown.
12. remove from the oven and let the fatayer cool for a few minutes before serving. enjoy as an appetizer or a snack!

note: you can make these vegetarian fatayer by omitting the feta cheese or substituting it with vegan cheese.
ingredients_list: fresh, spinach, feta, cheese, onion, olive, lemon, ground, sumac, dried, mint, salt, ground, black, pepper, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, ground, cinnamon, pizza, dough, puff, pastry, thawed, enough, pastry

title: Grilled Eggplant Roll
raw_text: 88. Grilled Eggplant Roll-Ups: 150 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, origin: Unknown.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large eggplants
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 cup ricotta cheese
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 cup marinara sauce
- fresh basil leaves, for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
2. slice the eggplants lengthwise into thin strips, about 1/4 inch thick.
3. brush both sides of the eggplant slices with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
4. grill the eggplant slices for 2-3 minutes per side, until they are tender and have grill marks. remove from the grill and set aside.
5. in a small bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, parmesan cheese, chopped basil, and minced garlic. mix well.
6. lay out the grilled eggplant slices on a clean surface. spread a spoonful of the ricotta mixture onto each slice.
7. starting from one end, roll up the eggplant slice tightly and secure with a toothpick.
8. repeat the process with the remaining eggplant slices and ricotta mixture.
9. pour the marinara sauce into a baking dish and spread it evenly across the bottom.
10. place the rolled eggplant slices seam side down in the baking dish.
11. cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake in a preheated oven at 375°f (190°c) for 20-25 minutes, until the sauce is bubbly and the eggplant is heated through.
12. remove from the oven and let cool slightly before serving.
13. garnish with fresh basil leaves and serve as an appetizer or main dish.
ingredients_list: eggplant, olive, salt, pepper, taste, ricotta, cheese, parmesan, cheese, fresh, basil, clove, garlic, minced, marinara, sauce, fresh, basil, leaf, garnish

title: Cheesy Cauliflower Popcorn
raw_text: 89. Cheesy Cauliflower Popcorn: 110 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, origin: Unknown.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 medium cauliflower head
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c). 
2. cut the cauliflower into small florets, about the size of popcorn bites.
3. in a large bowl, combine the cauliflower florets, olive oil, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and black pepper. toss until the cauliflower is evenly coated.
4. spread the cauliflower florets in a single layer on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
5. bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the cauliflower is crispy and golden brown.
6. remove the cauliflower from the oven and sprinkle the grated parmesan cheese over the top. toss gently to coat the cauliflower evenly.
7. return the baking sheet to the oven for an additional 5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. remove from the oven and let cool slightly before serving. enjoy the cheesy cauliflower popcorn as a healthy snack or appetizer!
ingredients_list: cauliflower, head, olive, garlic, powder, paprika, salt, black, pepper, parmesan, cheese

title: Mini Chicken Lettuce Wraps
raw_text: 90. Mini Chicken Lettuce Wraps: 120 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains poultry, origin: Unknown.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 lb ground chicken
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 small onion, diced
- 1/4 cup hoisin sauce
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
- 1 teaspoon sesame oil
- 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes (optional)
- 8-10 lettuce leaves (butter lettuce or iceberg lettuce works well)
- 2 green onions, chopped
- 1/4 cup chopped peanuts (optional)
- fresh cilantro, for garnish
preparation:
1. heat a large skillet over medium heat and add ground chicken. cook until browned and cooked through, breaking it up into small pieces with a wooden spoon.
2. add minced garlic and diced onion to the skillet. cook for 2-3 minutes until the onion is translucent.
3. in a small bowl, whisk together hoisin sauce, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, and red pepper flakes (if using). pour the sauce into the skillet with the chicken and stir to coat evenly.
4. reduce heat to low and simmer for 5-7 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
5. meanwhile, wash and separate the lettuce leaves. pat them dry with paper towels.
6. to serve, spoon a portion of the chicken mixture onto each lettuce leaf. top with chopped green onions, chopped peanuts (if desired), and fresh cilantro.
7. fold or roll the lettuce leaves to enclose the filling and enjoy!
ingredients_list: ground, chicken, clove, garlic, minced, onion, hoisin, sauce, soy, sauce, rice, vinegar, sesame, red, pepper, flake, lettuce, leaf, butter, lettuce, iceberg, lettuce, work, green, onion, peanut, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Mediterranean Salsa with Pita Chips
raw_text: 91. Mediterranean Salsa with Pita Chips: 150 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten, origin: Mediterranean.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 tomatoes, diced
- 1 cucumber, diced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1/4 red onion, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup kalamata olives, pitted and chopped
- 2 tablespoons fresh parsley, chopped
- 2 tablespoons fresh mint, chopped
- 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- salt, to taste
- pita chips, for serving
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, combine the diced tomatoes, cucumber, red bell pepper, red onion, kalamata olives, parsley, and mint.
2. drizzle the extra virgin olive oil and lemon juice over the mixture.
3. season with salt, to taste.
4. toss all the ingredients together until well combined.
5. cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
6. serve the mediterranean salsa chilled with pita chips on the side for dipping.
enjoy!
ingredients_list: tomato, cucumber, red, bell, pepper, red, onion, kalamata, olive, pitted, fresh, parsley, fresh, mint, virgin, olive, lemon, salt, taste, pita, chip

title: Pear and Almond Tartlets
raw_text: 92. Pear and Almond Tartlets: 170 kcal per portion, 5 portions, contains nuts, origin: Unknown.
ingredients:
ingredients for pear and almond tartlets:

- 1 sheet of puff pastry, thawed
- 2 ripe pears, peeled, cored, and thinly sliced
- 3/4 cup almond meal
- 1/3 cup granulated sugar
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter, softened
- 1 egg
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/4 teaspoon almond extract
- 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- powdered sugar, for dusting
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. on a lightly floured surface, roll out the puff pastry sheet to a 1/8-inch thickness. using a round cutter or glass, cut out 4-6 circles slightly larger than your tartlet molds.

3. gently press the pastry circles into the tartlet molds, ensuring they cover the bottom and sides evenly. trim any excess pastry hanging over the edges.

4. in a medium bowl, combine the almond meal, granulated sugar, softened butter, egg, vanilla extract, almond extract, and ground cinnamon. mix well until smooth and creamy.

5. spread a generous spoonful of the almond mixture into each tartlet shell, smoothing it out with the back of a spoon.

6. arrange the thinly sliced pears on top of the almond mixture, slightly overlapping the slices. press the pears gently into the filling.

7. place the tartlets on the prepared baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the pastry is golden brown and the pears are tender.

8. remove the tartlets from the oven and allow them to cool for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack.

9. once completely cooled, dust the pear and almond tartlets with powdered sugar for an elegant finishing touch.

these pear and almond tartlets are best served warm or at room temperature. enjoy!
ingredients_list: puff, pastry, thawed, pear, cored, thinly, almond, sugar, unsalted, butter, egg, vanilla, extract, almond, extract, ground, cinnamon, sugar

title: Moroccan Carrot Dip with Pita Bread
raw_text: 93. Moroccan Carrot Dip with Pita Bread: 130 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten, origin: Morocco.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large carrots, peeled and chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon ground ginger
- 1/4 teaspoon ground paprika
- 1/4 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- juice of 1 lemon
- 2 tablespoons tahini
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro (optional)
- pita bread, for serving
preparation:
1. bring a pot of water to a boil. add the chopped carrots and cook until they are tender, about 10-12 minutes. drain the carrots and set aside to cool.
2. in a pan over medium heat, add the olive oil and minced garlic. sauté for 1-2 minutes until the garlic is fragrant.
3. in a food processor, add the cooked carrots, sautéed garlic, ground cumin, ground cinnamon, ground ginger, ground paprika, ground coriander, ground turmeric, salt, black pepper, lemon juice, and tahini. blend until smooth and creamy.
4. transfer the dip to a serving bowl and garnish with chopped cilantro, if desired. serve with warm pita bread on the side.
5. enjoy your moroccan carrot dip with pita bread!
ingredients_list: carrot, clove, garlic, minced, olive, ground, cumin, ground, cinnamon, ground, ginger, ground, paprika, ground, coriander, ground, turmeric, salt, black, pepper, lemon, tahini, fresh, cilantro, pita, bread

title: Turkish Stuffed Bell Peppers
raw_text: 94. Turkish Stuffed Bell Peppers: 140 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten, origin: Turkey.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large bell peppers (any color)
- 1 cup long-grain rice
- 1/2 lb ground beef or lamb
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tomatoes, diced
- 2 tablespoons tomato paste
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 2 cups chicken or vegetable broth
- fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c). 
2. cut off the tops of the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes. set aside.
3. in a large mixing bowl, combine the rice, ground beef or lamb, chopped onion, minced garlic, diced tomatoes, tomato paste, paprika, cumin, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. mix well to combine.
4. stuff the bell peppers with the rice and meat mixture, pressing it down gently to fill the peppers completely.
5. place the stuffed bell peppers in a baking dish and pour the chicken or vegetable broth into the dish.
6. cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for about 45-50 minutes, or until the bell peppers are tender and the filling is cooked through.
7. once cooked, remove the foil and garnish the stuffed bell peppers with freshly chopped parsley.
8. serve hot and enjoy your turkish stuffed bell peppers!
ingredients_list: bell, pepper, color, long, grain, rice, ground, beef, lamb, onion, clove, garlic, minced, tomato, tomato, paste, paprika, cumin, dried, oregano, salt, pepper, taste, chicken, vegetable, broth, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Chicken Shawarma Skewers
raw_text: 95. Chicken Shawarma Skewers: 200 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains poultry, origin: Middle East.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 ½ pounds of boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch pieces
- ½ cup plain yogurt
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon ground cumin
- 1 tablespoon ground coriander
- 1 teaspoon ground paprika
- 1 teaspoon ground turmeric
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- salt and pepper, to taste
- ½ cup finely chopped fresh parsley
- lemon wedges, for serving
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine yogurt, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, cumin, coriander, paprika, turmeric, cinnamon, salt, and pepper. mix well to create the marinade.
2. add the chicken pieces to the marinade and toss until well-coated. cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight to allow the flavors to develop.
3. preheat your grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. if using wooden skewers, soak them in water for 30 minutes prior to grilling.
4. thread the marinated chicken pieces onto skewers, evenly distributing the pieces.
5. place the skewers on the preheated grill and cook for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until the chicken is fully cooked and slightly charred. make sure to turn the skewers occasionally for even cooking.
6. once cooked through, remove the skewers from the grill and sprinkle with fresh parsley. serve hot with lemon wedges on the side for added zest.
7. enjoy your delicious chicken shawarma skewers!
ingredients_list: pound, boneless, skinless, chicken, thigh, piece, plain, yogurt, olive, lemon, clove, garlic, minced, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, ground, paprika, ground, turmeric, ground, cinnamon, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, parsley, lemon, wedge

title: Greek Spinach and Feta Bruschetta
raw_text: 96. Greek Spinach and Feta Bruschetta: 120 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, origin: Greece.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 french baguette
- 2 cups fresh spinach, chopped
- 1/2 cup feta cheese, crumbled
- 1/4 cup red onion, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup kalamata olives, pitted and chopped
- 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. slice the baguette into 1-inch thick slices.
3. arrange the slices on a baking sheet and brush both sides with olive oil. bake for about 8-10 minutes, or until lightly toasted and crispy.
4. in a mixing bowl, combine the chopped spinach, feta cheese, red onion, kalamata olives, garlic, lemon juice, and olive oil. stir until well combined.
5. season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
6. once the bread slices are ready, remove them from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
7. spoon the spinach and feta mixture onto each baguette slice, spreading it evenly.
8. return the bruschetta to the oven and bake for an additional 5 minutes, or until the feta cheese is slightly melted.
9. remove from the oven and allow to cool slightly before serving.
10. serve the greek spinach and feta bruschetta as a delicious appetizer or snack. enjoy!
ingredients_list: french, baguette, fresh, spinach, feta, cheese, red, onion, kalamata, olive, pitted, virgin, olive, lemon, clove, garlic, minced, salt, pepper, taste

title: Beetroot and Feta Salad
raw_text: 97. Beetroot and Feta Salad: 90 kcal per portion, 6 portions, contains dairy, origin: Unknown.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 medium-sized beetroots, cooked and cooled
- 100 grams feta cheese, crumbled
- 1/4 cup toasted walnuts, roughly chopped
- 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
- 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar
- 1 tablespoon honey
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh mint leaves, for garnish
preparation:
1. peel the cooked beetroots and slice them into thin rounds or cubes.
2. in a large bowl, combine the beetroot slices, crumbled feta cheese, and toasted walnuts.
3. in a separate small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, honey, salt, and pepper.
4. pour the dressing over the beetroot mixture and toss gently to coat all the ingredients.
5. allow the salad to marinate for at least 10 minutes to let the flavors meld together.
6. serve the salad on a platter or individual plates, garnished with fresh mint leaves.
7. enjoy the beetroot and feta salad as a refreshing and nutritious appetizer or side dish.
ingredients_list: beetroot, cooled, gram, feta, cheese, toasted, walnut, virgin, olive, balsamic, vinegar, honey, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, mint, leaf, garnish

title: Lebanese Falafel with Tahini Sauce
raw_text: 98. Lebanese Falafel with Tahini Sauce: 180 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains sesame, origin: Lebanon.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups dried chickpeas
- 1 small onion, roughly chopped
- 4 cloves of garlic
- 1 cup fresh parsley, chopped
- 1 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper
- salt and pepper to taste
- vegetable oil for frying
- pita bread, for serving

for the tahini sauce:
- 1/2 cup tahini paste
- 1/4 cup fresh lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons water
- 1 clove of garlic, finely minced
- salt to taste
preparation:
1. place the dried chickpeas in a bowl and cover them with cold water. let them soak overnight. drain and rinse the chickpeas before using.
2. in a food processor, add the soaked chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, cilantro, cumin, coriander, baking powder, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. process until the mixture forms a coarse, crumbly texture that sticks together when pressed.
3. transfer the falafel mixture to a bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to firm up.
4. heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer or heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat.
5. scoop about 2 tablespoons of the falafel mixture and shape it into a small patty or ball using your hands. repeat with the remaining mixture.
6. carefully lower the falafel balls into the hot oil and fry for about 3-4 minutes or until golden brown and crispy. avoid overcrowding the pot, fry in batches if needed.
7. once cooked, remove the falafel from the oil and drain on a paper towel-lined plate to remove excess oil.
8. to make the tahini sauce, in a small bowl, whisk together the tahini paste, lemon juice, water, minced garlic, and salt until smooth and creamy. adjust the consistency by adding more water if necessary.
9. serve the falafel hot with pita bread and the tahini sauce on the side. enjoy!
ingredients_list: dried, chickpea, onion, clove, garlic, fresh, parsley, fresh, cilantro, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, baking, powder, cayenne, pepper, salt, pepper, taste, vegetable, pita, bread, tahini, sauce, tahini, paste, fresh, lemon, water, clove, garlic, minced, salt, taste

title: Tabbouleh
raw_text: 9. Tabbouleh: 180 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup bulgur wheat
- 2 cups boiling water
- 1 cup finely chopped fresh parsley
- 1/2 cup finely chopped fresh mint leaves
- 1/4 cup finely chopped green onion
- 2 medium tomatoes, finely chopped
- 1 cucumber, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil
- 1/4 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice

preparation:
1. place the bulgur wheat in a large bowl and pour the boiling water over it. let it sit for about 30 minutes or until the wheat is tender and has absorbed all the water.
2. fluff the cooked bulgur wheat with a fork and set it aside to cool.
3. in a separate bowl, mix together the parsley, mint, green onion, tomatoes, and cucumber.
4. add the cooled bulgur wheat to the bowl of vegetables and mix well.
5. in a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
6. pour the dressing over the tabbouleh mixture and toss everything together until well combined.
7. taste and adjust the seasoning if needed.
8. cover the tabbouleh and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving to allow the flavors to meld together.
9. serve chilled and enjoy!
ingredients_list: bulgur, wheat, boiling, water, fresh, parsley, fresh, mint, leaf, green, onion, tomato, cucumber, virgin, olive, freshly, squeezed, lemon, salt, pepper, taste

title: Sliced Apples with Peanut Butter

ingredients:

preparation:

title: Chicken Skewers with Peanut Sauce
raw_text: 18. Chicken Skewers with Peanut Sauce: 250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains peanuts.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon honey
- 1 tablespoon lime juice
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 teaspoon minced garlic
- 1 teaspoon minced ginger
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander
- salt and pepper, to taste
- wooden or metal skewers

for peanut sauce:
- 1/4 cup peanut butter
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon honey
- 1 tablespoon lime juice
- 1/2 teaspoon minced garlic
- 1/2 teaspoon minced ginger
- 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes (optional)
- 2-4 tablespoons water, as needed
preparation:
1. cut the chicken breasts into 1-inch cubes and set aside.
2. in a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, honey, lime juice, vegetable oil, minced garlic, minced ginger, ground cumin, ground coriander, salt, and pepper.
3. add the chicken cubes to the marinade and toss until well coated. let marinate for at least 30 minutes, or refrigerate overnight for best results.
4. while chicken is marinating, soak wooden skewers in water for about 20 minutes to prevent them from charring.
5. preheat grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.
6. thread chicken cubes onto skewers, leaving a small space in between each piece.
7. grill the chicken skewers for about 6-8 minutes per side or until cooked through, with an internal temperature of 165°f (74°c).
8. while the chicken is grilling, prepare the peanut sauce by whisking together peanut butter, soy sauce, honey, lime juice, minced garlic, minced ginger, red pepper flakes (if desired), and enough water to reach desired consistency. add more water if needed.
9. once the chicken skewers are cooked, serve them hot with the peanut sauce on the side for dipping. enjoy!

title: Mini Pizza Bagels
raw_text: 27. Mini Pizza Bagels: 180 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy.

ingredients:

title: Nachos with Salsa and Guacamole
raw_text: 34. Nachos with Salsa and Guacamole: 230 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains corn.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 bag of tortilla chips
- 1 cup of shredded cheddar cheese
- 1 cup of salsa
- 1 ripe avocado
- 1/4 cup of diced onion
- 1/4 cup of diced tomato
- 1/4 cup of chopped cilantro
- juice of 1 lime
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. spread the tortilla chips on a baking sheet in a single layer.
3. sprinkle the shredded cheddar cheese evenly over the tortilla chips.
4. bake in the preheated oven for 5-7 minutes, or until the cheese has melted.
5. meanwhile, prepare the guacamole by scooping out the flesh of the avocado into a bowl.
6. mash the avocado with a fork until it reaches your desired consistency.
7. add the diced onion, diced tomato, chopped cilantro, lime juice, salt, and pepper to the mashed avocado and mix well.
8. remove the nachos from the oven and transfer them to a serving platter.
9. serve the nachos with salsa on the side and a generous dollop of guacamole.
10. enjoy your homemade nachos with salsa and guacamole!

title: Rice Paper Rolls with Shrimp
raw_text: 35. Rice Paper Rolls with Shrimp: 120 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains shellfish.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 12 large shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 12 rice paper wrappers
- 1 cup cooked rice noodles
- 1 cup shredded lettuce
- 1 carrot, julienned
- 1 cucumber, julienned
- 1/4 cup fresh mint leaves
- 1/4 cup fresh cilantro leaves
- 1/4 cup fresh basil leaves
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons lime juice
- 1 tablespoon fish sauce
- 1 tablespoon honey
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- water for soaking rice paper wrappers
preparation:
1. boil the shrimp in a pot of salted water until they turn pink and cooked through. drain and set aside to cool.
2. meanwhile, prepare the dipping sauce by combining soy sauce, lime juice, fish sauce, honey, and minced garlic in a small bowl. stir well to combine. set aside.
3. fill a large shallow dish or a wide bowl with warm water. dip one rice paper wrapper into the water and let it soak for about 10-15 seconds, or until soft and pliable.
4. place the soaked wrapper on a clean surface. arrange a few shrimp halves in the center of the wrapper.
5. add a small amount of rice noodles, lettuce, carrots, cucumber, mint leaves, cilantro leaves, and basil leaves on top of the shrimp.
6. fold the bottom half of the wrapper over the filling, then fold in the sides, and roll tightly to enclose the filling. repeat with the remaining ingredients.
7. serve the rice paper rolls with the prepared dipping sauce on the side.
8. enjoy your delicious rice paper rolls with shrimp!
