title: Sweet Potato and Black Bean Wraps
raw_text: 36. Sweet Potato and Black Bean Wraps: 250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large sweet potatoes
- 1 can black beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1/2 red onion, thinly sliced
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika
- juice of 1 lime
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 4 large whole wheat tortillas
- optional toppings: avocado, diced tomatoes, grated cheese, salsa
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c). wash the sweet potatoes, prick them with a fork, and place them on a baking sheet. bake for about 45 minutes or until tender when pierced with a knife. remove from the oven and let cool slightly.
2. while the sweet potatoes are cooking, prepare the black bean mixture. in a mixing bowl, combine the rinsed black beans, sliced red bell pepper, sliced red onion, chopped cilantro, ground cumin, smoked paprika, lime juice, salt, and pepper. mix well to combine and set aside.
3. once the sweet potatoes are cool enough to handle, peel off the skin and place the flesh in a bowl. mash the sweet potatoes with a fork or potato masher until smooth.
4. warm the whole wheat tortillas in a dry skillet or microwave for a few seconds to make them more pliable.
5. spread an even amount of mashed sweet potato onto each tortilla, leaving a border around the edges. top with the black bean mixture, spreading it evenly over the sweet potato.
6. roll each tortilla tightly, tucking in the sides as you go. slice the wraps in half diagonally and serve.
7. if desired, top the wraps with diced avocado, diced tomatoes, grated cheese, and salsa. enjoy your sweet potato and black bean wraps!
ingredients_list: sweet, potato, black, bean, red, bell, pepper, thinly, red, onion, thinly, fresh, cilantro, ground, cumin, smoked, paprika, lime, salt, pepper, taste, whole, wheat, tortilla, topping, avocado, tomato, cheese, salsa

title: Mini Chicken and Vegetable Pies
raw_text: 37. Mini Chicken and Vegetable Pies: 200 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breast, diced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 carrot, diced
- 1 celery stalk, diced
- 1 cup frozen peas
- 1 cup chicken broth
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup milk
- 2 sheets refrigerated pie crusts
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the diced chicken and cook until browned on all sides. remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
3. in the same skillet, add the onion, garlic, carrot, and celery. cook until the vegetables are softened, about 5 minutes.
4. stir in the frozen peas, chicken broth, dried thyme, salt, and black pepper. bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes.
5. in a small bowl, whisk together the flour and milk until smooth. add the flour mixture to the skillet and cook, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens.
6. return the cooked chicken to the skillet and stir to combine with the vegetable mixture. remove from heat.
7. roll out the pie crusts on a floured surface. using a round cookie cutter or a glass, cut out circles that are slightly larger than the wells of a muffin tin.
8. place the pie crust circles into the wells of the muffin tin, pressing them gently to form a crust. spoon the chicken and vegetable mixture into each crust.
9. cut out smaller circles from the remaining pie crusts and place them on top of each mini pie to form a lid. press the edges of the top and bottom crusts together to seal.
10. use a fork to poke a few holes in the top crusts to allow steam to escape.
11. bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the crusts are golden brown.
12. remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before removing the mini chicken and vegetable pies from the muffin tin.
13. serve warm and enjoy!
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, carrot, celery, stalk, frozen, pea, chicken, broth, dried, thyme, salt, black, pepper, flour, milk, sheet, pie, crust

title: Avocado and Tomato Bruschetta
raw_text: 38. Avocado and Tomato Bruschetta: 160 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 ripe avocado
- 1 large tomato
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 1 tablespoon fresh basil, chopped
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon balsamic vinegar
- salt and pepper to taste
- baguette, sliced
preparation:
1. start by preheating your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. slice the baguette into ½ inch thick slices.
3. place the slices on a baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil. toast the slices in the preheated oven for about 6-8 minutes until they turn golden brown and crispy.
4. meanwhile, dice the avocado and tomato into small pieces.
5. in a bowl, combine the diced avocado, tomato, minced garlic, chopped basil, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper. mix well to combine all the flavors.
6. remove the toasts from the oven and let them cool slightly.
7. once cooled, spread the avocado and tomato mixture evenly on top of each toast.
8. serve the avocado and tomato bruschetta immediately and enjoy!
ingredients_list: avocado, tomato, garlic, clove, minced, fresh, basil, olive, balsamic, vinegar, salt, pepper, taste, baguette

title: Baba Ganoush with Pita Bread
raw_text: 41. Baba Ganoush with Pita Bread: 190 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and sesame. (Origin: Middle East)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large eggplants
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 3 tablespoons of tahini
- 3 tablespoons of lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil
- 1/2 teaspoon of salt
- freshly ground black pepper, to taste
- chopped fresh parsley, for garnish

for the pita bread:
- 4 pita breads
- olive oil, for brushing
preparation:
1. preheat your grill or oven to medium-high heat. pierce the eggplants all over with a fork and place them on the grill or on a baking sheet if using the oven. cook for about 20-25 minutes, turning occasionally, until the skin is charred and the flesh is soft. remove from heat and let them cool slightly.

2. once the eggplants are cool enough to handle, cut them in half lengthwise. use a spoon to scrape out the flesh into a colander, discarding the charred skin. let the flesh drain for about 10 minutes to remove any excess liquid.

3. in a bowl, combine the eggplant flesh, minced garlic, tahini, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and black pepper. use a fork or a blender to mash or blend the mixture until smooth and well combined. adjust the seasonings to taste.

4. transfer the baba ganoush to a serving bowl and garnish with chopped fresh parsley. drizzle with some extra olive oil, if desired.

5. to make the pita bread, preheat your grill or a grill pan over medium-high heat. brush both sides of each pita bread with olive oil. grill for about 2-3 minutes on each side until slightly charred and heated through.

6. cut the grilled pita bread into triangles and serve alongside the baba ganoush as a dipping bread.

enjoy your homemade baba ganoush with freshly grilled pita bread!
ingredients_list: eggplant, clove, garlic, minced, tahini, lemon, virgin, olive, salt, freshly, ground, black, pepper, taste, fresh, parsley, garnish, pita, bread, pita, bread, olive, brushing

title: Quinoa Salad with Chickpeas
raw_text: 43. Quinoa Salad with Chickpeas: 180 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup quinoa
- 1 can chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 cucumber, diced
- 1/2 red onion, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup kalamata olives, pitted and chopped
- 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped
- 1/4 cup fresh mint, chopped
- juice of 1 lemon
- 3 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. rinse quinoa in a fine mesh strainer under cold water. in a medium saucepan, bring 2 cups of water to a boil. add the rinsed quinoa and reduce heat to low. cover and simmer for about 15 minutes, or until all the water is absorbed. remove from heat and let it sit covered for 5 minutes. fluff with a fork and set aside to cool.
2. in a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, chickpeas, diced red bell pepper, diced cucumber, finely chopped red onion, chopped kalamata olives, fresh parsley, and fresh mint.
3. in a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, minced garlic, salt, and pepper. pour the dressing over the salad and toss until well combined.
4. taste and adjust seasonings if needed. you can add more lemon juice, olive oil, salt, or pepper according to your preference.
5. cover the bowl with plastic wrap or transfer to an airtight container. refrigerate for at least 1 hour to let the flavors meld and the salad chill.
6. serve chilled and enjoy as a side dish or a light meal.
ingredients_list: quinoa, chickpea, red, bell, pepper, cucumber, red, onion, kalamata, olive, pitted, fresh, parsley, fresh, mint, lemon, olive, clove, garlic, minced, salt, pepper, taste

title: Zucchini and Goat Cheese Tartlets
raw_text: 44. Zucchini and Goat Cheese Tartlets: 150 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- for the tart crust:
- 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, cold and cut into small cubes
- 1 egg yolk
- 2 tablespoons ice water

- for the filling:
- 2 medium zucchini, thinly sliced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 ounces goat cheese
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh basil
- 1 tablespoon chopped fresh thyme
- 1 egg
- 1/4 cup heavy cream
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).

2. in a large bowl, combine the flour and salt for the tart crust. add the cold butter cubes and use your fingertips or a pastry cutter to cut the butter into the flour until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.

3. in a small bowl, whisk together the egg yolk and ice water. pour this mixture into the flour and butter mixture. stir until the dough comes together. if needed, add more ice water, a teaspoon at a time, until the dough can be formed into a ball.

4. flatten the dough into a disk and wrap it in plastic wrap. refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.

5. on a lightly floured surface, roll out the chilled dough to about 1/8 inch thickness. cut out rounds or squares to fit into your tartlet pans. press the dough into the pans and trim any excess.

6. in a skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the sliced zucchini and cook until slightly softened, about 5 minutes. season with salt and pepper to taste.

7. in a medium bowl, mix together the goat cheese, parmesan cheese, chopped basil, chopped thyme, egg, and heavy cream. stir until well combined.

8. divide the goat cheese mixture evenly among the tartlet pans, spreading it out to cover the bottom.

9. arrange the cooked zucchini slices on top of the goat cheese mixture.

10. place the tartlet pans on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the crust is golden and the filling is set.

11. remove from the oven and let cool slightly before serving. these tartlets can be served warm or at room temperature. enjoy!
cuisine: The cuisine type of the recipe is: French.
ingredients_list: tart, crust, flour, salt, unsalted, butter, cube, egg, ice, water, filling, zucchini, thinly, olive, salt, pepper, taste, ounce, goat, cheese, parmesan, cheese, fresh, basil, fresh, thyme, egg, cream

title: Pork Satay with Peanut Sauce
raw_text: 45. Pork Satay with Peanut Sauce: 250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains peanuts.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound pork tenderloin, cut into thin strips
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon fish sauce
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ginger, grated
- 1 teaspoon turmeric powder
- 1 teaspoon cumin powder
- 1 teaspoon coriander powder
- 1 tablespoon brown sugar
- bamboo skewers, soaked in water

for peanut sauce:
- 1/2 cup peanut butter
- 1/4 cup coconut milk
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon lime juice
- 1 tablespoon brown sugar
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ginger, grated
- water, as needed for desired consistency
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine soy sauce, fish sauce, minced garlic, grated ginger, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and brown sugar. mix well to form a marinade.
2. add the pork strips to the marinade, ensuring all pieces are coated. allow the meat to marinate for at least 30 minutes, or refrigerate overnight for enhanced flavor.
3. meanwhile, prepare the peanut sauce. in a small saucepan over low heat, combine peanut butter, coconut milk, soy sauce, lime juice, brown sugar, minced garlic, and grated ginger. stir well until all ingredients are fully incorporated.
4. if the sauce appears thick, add water gradually to reach your desired consistency. continue heating the sauce until warm. set aside.
5. preheat grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.
6. thread the marinated pork strips onto soaked bamboo skewers, shaking off excess marinade.
7. cook the pork skewers on the preheated grill, turning occasionally, until cooked through and slightly charred, about 6-8 minutes.
8. serve the pork satay skewers hot, alongside the warm peanut sauce for dipping.
9. enjoy!
ingredients_list: pork, tenderloin, strip, soy, sauce, fish, sauce, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, turmeric, powder, cumin, powder, coriander, powder, brown, sugar, bamboo, skewer, soaked, water, peanut, sauce, peanut, butter, coconut, milk, soy, sauce, lime, brown, sugar, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, water, needed

title: Caramelized Onion and Gruyere Tart
raw_text: 46. Caramelized Onion and Gruyere Tart: 200 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 sheet frozen puff pastry, thawed
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 3 large onions, thinly sliced
- 1 tablespoon brown sugar
- 1 teaspoon balsamic vinegar
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 cup grated gruyere cheese
- fresh thyme leaves, for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. roll out the thawed puff pastry onto a lightly floured surface and transfer it to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
3. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the sliced onions and cook, stirring occasionally, until they start to soften and become translucent, about 10 minutes.
4. sprinkle the brown sugar over the onions and continue cooking for another 5 minutes, or until the onions have caramelized and turned golden brown.
5. stir in the balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper, and cook for an additional 2 minutes. remove the skillet from the heat and set aside.
6. spread the caramelized onions evenly over the puff pastry, leaving a small border around the edges.
7. sprinkle the grated gruyere cheese over the onions.
8. bake the tart in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the pastry is golden and the cheese has melted and slightly browned.
9. remove the tart from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes. garnish with fresh thyme leaves before serving.
10. slice and enjoy this delicious caramelized onion and gruyere tart as an appetizer or a light meal.
ingredients_list: frozen, puff, pastry, thawed, olive, onion, thinly, brown, sugar, balsamic, vinegar, salt, pepper, taste, gruyere, cheese, fresh, thyme, leaf, garnish

title: Baked Mini Samosas
raw_text: 50. Baked Mini Samosas: 200 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon fennel seeds
- 1/4 teaspoon cumin seeds
- 1/4 teaspoon coriander powder
- 1/4 teaspoon turmeric powder
- 1/4 teaspoon red chili powder
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 1 small potato, boiled and mashed
- 1/4 cup frozen peas
- 2 tablespoons chopped cilantro
- salt to taste
- vegetable oil for brushing
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, vegetable oil, and salt. add water gradually and knead into a smooth dough. set aside for 15 minutes.
2. heat oil in a pan and add fennel seeds and cumin seeds. saute for a minute until fragrant.
3. add onions and cook until they turn translucent.
4. add coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. stir well.
5. add mashed potato, frozen peas, and chopped cilantro. mix thoroughly and cook for 2-3 minutes. remove from heat and let the filling cool down.
6. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
7. divide the dough into equal portions and roll each portion into a small circle.
8. cut each circle in half to make semi-circles.
9. take one semi-circle, apply water on the straight edge, and fold it into a cone shape, overlapping the straight edges. press to seal.
10. fill the cone with the prepared potato and pea filling. apply water on the open edges and press to seal, ensuring the samosa is tightly sealed.
11. repeat the same process for the remaining dough and filling.
12. place the mini samosas on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
13. brush each samosa with vegetable oil for a crispy texture.
14. bake for 20-25 minutes until golden brown and crispy.
15. serve hot with chutney or sauce of your choice. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, vegetable, salt, fennel, seed, cumin, seed, coriander, powder, turmeric, powder, red, chili, powder, onion, potato, boiled, frozen, pea, cilantro, salt, taste, vegetable, brushing

title: Ricotta Stuffed Mushrooms
raw_text: 55. Ricotta Stuffed Mushrooms: 150 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 16 large white mushrooms
- 1/2 cup ricotta cheese
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh basil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c). line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. clean the mushrooms by gently wiping off any dirt with a damp cloth. remove the stems and set aside.
3. in a mixing bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, parmesan cheese, minced garlic, parsley, basil, salt, and pepper. mix well.
4. stuff each mushroom cap with the ricotta mixture, filling them generously. place the stuffed mushrooms on the prepared baking sheet.
5. bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the mushrooms are cooked through and the cheese is golden brown on top.
6. remove from the oven and let cool slightly before serving. enjoy warm as an appetizer or side dish.
ingredients_list: white, mushroom, ricotta, cheese, parmesan, cheese, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, parsley, fresh, basil, salt, pepper, taste

title: Spinach and Feta Triangles
raw_text: 58. Spinach and Feta Triangles: 160 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy. (Origin: Greece)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups frozen spinach, thawed and drained
- 1 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh dill
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 10 (9x14 inch) sheets phyllo dough
- 1/2 cup melted butter
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c). line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a mixing bowl, combine the spinach, feta cheese, dill, garlic, salt, and black pepper. mix well until evenly combined.
3. lay one sheet of phyllo dough on a clean surface and brush it lightly with melted butter. place a second sheet of phyllo dough on top and brush with butter again. repeat this process with two more sheets of phyllo dough.
4. cut the layered phyllo dough into 3 equal strips widthwise. place a spoonful of the spinach and feta mixture at the bottom of each strip.
5. fold the bottom right corner of the strip diagonally over the filling to form a triangle. continue folding the triangle up the strip, maintaining the triangle shape, until you reach the end of the strip. repeat this process with the remaining phyllo dough and filling.
6. place the filled triangles on the prepared baking sheet and brush the tops with melted butter.
7. bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the triangles are golden brown and crispy.
8. remove from the oven and let cool slightly before serving. enjoy your spinach and feta triangles!
ingredients_list: frozen, spinach, thawed, feta, cheese, fresh, dill, clove, garlic, minced, salt, black, pepper, sheet, phyllo, dough, butter

title: Roasted Beetroot and Goat Cheese Crostini
raw_text: 62. Roasted Beetroot and Goat Cheese Crostini: 170 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 medium-sized beetroots
- 1 baguette
- 150g goat cheese
- 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh thyme leaves for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 200°c (400°f).
2. start by preparing the beetroots. wash and scrub them thoroughly to remove any dirt. trim off the beet tops, leaving about an inch of the stems intact.
3. wrap each beetroot individually in aluminum foil and place them on a baking tray. roast in the oven for about 45-60 minutes, or until they are tender when pierced with a fork.
4. while the beetroots are roasting, slice the baguette into thin slices, about 1.5 cm (1/2 inch) thick. arrange the slices on a baking sheet and lightly brush one side with olive oil.
5. toast the baguette slices in the oven for about 8-10 minutes, or until they turn golden and crispy.
6. once the beetroots are cooked, remove them from the oven and let them cool slightly. then, carefully peel off the skin using a knife or your fingers. cut the beetroots into thin slices.
7. in a small bowl, whisk together the balsamic vinegar and olive oil. season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. to assemble the crostini, spread a generous amount of goat cheese on each toasted baguette slice. top with a slice or two of roasted beetroot.
9. drizzle the balsamic vinegar and olive oil dressing over the crostini. garnish with fresh thyme leaves.
10. serve the roasted beetroot and goat cheese crostini immediately and enjoy!

note: you can also add some arugula or baby spinach leaves on top for extra freshness.
ingredients_list: beetroot, baguette, goat, cheese, balsamic, vinegar, olive, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, thyme, leaf, garnish

title: Black Olive Tapenade with Crackers
raw_text: 63. Black Olive Tapenade with Crackers: 160 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten.
ingredients:
here's the recipe for black olive tapenade with crackers:

ingredients:
- 1 cup pitted black olives
- 1/4 cup sun-dried tomatoes, drained
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons capers
- 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
- 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- salt and pepper to taste
- crackers for serving
preparation:
1. in a food processor, combine black olives, sun-dried tomatoes, minced garlic, capers, olive oil, lemon juice, dried thyme, salt, and pepper.
2. process the mixture until it reaches your desired consistency. it can be chunky or smoother, depending on your preference.
3. taste and adjust the seasoning if needed, adding more salt, pepper, or lemon juice as desired.
4. transfer the tapenade to a serving bowl and chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
5. serve the black olive tapenade with your choice of crackers. enjoy!

note: you can store any leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week.

title: Avocado and Bacon Deviled Eggs
raw_text: 68. Avocado and Bacon Deviled Eggs: 220 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains eggs.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 6 hard-boiled eggs
- 1 ripe avocado
- 4 slices of bacon, cooked and crumbled
- 2 tablespoons mayonnaise
- 1 tablespoon dijon mustard
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- salt and pepper to taste
- optional: chopped fresh chives for garnish
preparation:
1. start by cutting the hard-boiled eggs in half lengthwise. carefully remove the yolks and place them in a separate bowl.
2. in the bowl with the egg yolks, add the avocado. mash the egg yolks and avocado together until well combined.
3. next, add the crumbled bacon, mayonnaise, dijon mustard, and lemon juice to the bowl. mix everything together until smooth and creamy.
4. season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste. adjust the flavors according to your preference.
5. using a spoon or a piping bag, fill each egg white half with the avocado and bacon filling.
6. if desired, garnish the deviled eggs with chopped fresh chives for added flavor and presentation.
7. serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve. enjoy your delicious avocado and bacon deviled eggs!

title: Coconut Almond Energy Balls
raw_text: 71. Coconut Almond Energy Balls: 180 calories per portion, 8 portions, contains nuts.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup shredded coconut
- 1 cup almond flour
- 1/2 cup almond butter
- 1/4 cup honey
- 1/4 cup chopped almonds
- 1 tablespoon coconut oil
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- pinch of salt
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine shredded coconut, almond flour, chopped almonds, and salt.
2. in a small saucepan, melt the coconut oil over low heat.
3. add almond butter, honey, and vanilla extract to the melted coconut oil. stir until well combined.
4. pour the wet mixture into the dry mixture and mix until all ingredients are evenly incorporated.
5. use your hands to shape the mixture into small balls, about 1 inch in diameter.
6. place the energy balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
7. refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the balls to firm up.
8. once chilled, transfer the energy balls to an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for up to one week.
9. enjoy as a healthy snack or on-the-go energy boost!
ingredients_list: shredded, coconut, almond, flour, almond, butter, honey, almond, coconut, vanilla, extract, pinch, salt

title: Caramelized Onion Tartlets
raw_text: 74. Caramelized Onion Tartlets: 160 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large onions, thinly sliced
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 sheet puff pastry, thawed
- 1/2 cup grated gruyère cheese
- fresh thyme leaves, for garnish
preparation:
1. in a large skillet, heat the butter and olive oil over medium-high heat.
2. add the sliced onions and cook, stirring occasionally, until they begin to soften and caramelize, about 15-20 minutes.
3. sprinkle sugar, salt, and black pepper over the onions and continue cooking for another 5 minutes until the onions are deeply caramelized.
4. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
5. roll out the puff pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface and cut it into small squares or circles, depending on the shape of your tartlet molds.
6. place the puff pastry squares/circles into the tartlet molds and gently press to fit.
7. prick the bottom of each tartlet with a fork to prevent puffing during baking.
8. fill each tartlet with a spoonful of the caramelized onions, leaving a border around the edges.
9. sprinkle grated gruyère cheese over the onions.
10. place the tartlets on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the pastry is puffed and golden.
11. remove the tartlets from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before removing them from the molds.
12. garnish with fresh thyme leaves and serve warm or at room temperature. enjoy!
ingredients_list: onion, thinly, butter, olive, sugar, salt, black, pepper, puff, pastry, thawed, gruy, cheese, fresh, thyme, leaf, garnish

title: Sweet Potato and Chickpea Patties
raw_text: 76. Sweet Potato and Chickpea Patties: 150 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
- 1 can chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1 small onion, finely diced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/4 cup bread crumbs
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
- optional toppings: greek yogurt, avocado slices, or tahini sauce
preparation:
1. in a large saucepan, place the cubed sweet potatoes and cover with water. bring to a boil and cook until the sweet potatoes are fork-tender, about 10-15 minutes. drain and set aside.
2. in a skillet over medium heat, heat the olive oil. add the diced onion and minced garlic, sautéing until they are softened and fragrant.
3. in a food processor, combine the cooked sweet potatoes, sautéed onions and garlic, drained chickpeas, cumin, paprika, salt, and black pepper. process until well combined but still slightly chunky.
4. transfer the mixture to a bowl and add the bread crumbs, flour, and chopped parsley. stir until evenly combined.
5. shape the mixture into patties, approximately 1/2-inch thick and 3 inches in diameter.
6. heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. add a drizzle of olive oil and carefully place the patties in the skillet. cook for about 4-5 minutes on each side, or until they are golden brown and crispy.
7. serve the sweet potato and chickpea patties with desired toppings such as greek yogurt, avocado slices, or tahini sauce.
8. enjoy your sweet potato and chickpea patties while still warm!
ingredients_list: sweet, potato, chickpea, onion, clove, garlic, minced, olive, cumin, paprika, salt, black, pepper, bread, crumb, flour, fresh, parsley, topping, greek, yogurt, avocado, tahini, sauce

title: Coconut Shrimp with Sweet Chili Sauce
raw_text: 83. Coconut Shrimp with Sweet Chili Sauce: 220 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains shellfish.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 1 cup shredded coconut
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
- vegetable oil, for frying

for the sweet chili sauce:
- 1/2 cup sweet chili sauce
- 2 tablespoons rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon honey
- 1 tablespoon lime juice
preparation:
1. in a shallow dish, combine shredded coconut and flour.
2. in another dish, beat the eggs and season with salt and black pepper.
3. dip each shrimp into the egg mixture, then coat it with the coconut and flour mixture, pressing gently to adhere.
4. in a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
5. fry the coated shrimp in batches until they turn golden brown, about 3-4 minutes per side. make sure not to overcrowd the skillet.
6. remove the cooked shrimp and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.
7. in a small bowl, whisk together sweet chili sauce, rice vinegar, soy sauce, honey, and lime juice to make the dipping sauce.
8. serve the coconut shrimp with the sweet chili sauce on the side for dipping.
9. enjoy your delicious coconut shrimp with sweet chili sauce!

title: Chocolate Peanut Butter Protein Balls

ingredients:
- 1 cup rolled oats
- 1/2 cup natural peanut butter
- 1/4 cup honey

preparation:

title: Greek Spinach and Feta Pinwheels
raw_text: 87. Greek Spinach and Feta Pinwheels: 190 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 package frozen spinach, thawed and drained

- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/4 cup chopped red onion
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon chopped fresh dill

title: Goat Cheese and Honey Crostini
raw_text: 88. Goat Cheese and Honey Crostini: 160 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- baguette, sliced
- 4 oz goat cheese
- honey
- fresh thyme leaves
- pinch of salt
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. place the baguette slices on a baking sheet and toast them in the oven until golden and crispy, approximately 8-10 minutes.
3. remove the toasted baguette slices from the oven and let them cool slightly.
4. spread a dollop of goat cheese on each slice of baguette.

title: Crispy Baked Potato Skins
raw_text: 89. Crispy Baked Potato Skins: 140 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy.
ingredients:
sure! here's the recipe for crispy baked potato skins:

ingredients:
- 4 large russet potatoes
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 4 strips cooked bacon, crumbled
- 2 green onions, chopped
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. wash the potatoes thoroughly and pat them dry.
3. pierce each potato several times with a fork.
4. place the potatoes directly on the oven rack and bake for about 50-60 minutes, or until they are tender when pierced with a knife.
5. remove the potatoes from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
6. slice each potato in half lengthwise and carefully scoop out most of the flesh, leaving about 1/4 inch of potato attached to the skin.
7. brush both sides of the potato skins with olive oil and place them on a baking sheet, skin side down.
8. in a small bowl, mix together the salt, garlic powder, paprika, and black pepper.
9. sprinkle the mixture evenly over the potato skins.
10. bake the potato skins for about 10 minutes, or until they start to become crispy and golden.
11. remove the baking sheet from the oven and sprinkle the shredded cheddar cheese, crumbled bacon, and chopped green onions over the potato skins.
12. return the baking sheet to the oven and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
13. remove from the oven and let them cool slightly before serving.
14. serve the crispy baked potato skins as an appetizer or side dish. enjoy!
ingredients_list: crispy, baked, potato, skin, russet, potato, olive, salt, garlic, powder, paprika, black, pepper, shredded, cheddar, cheese, strip, bacon, green, onion

title: Stuffed Mushrooms with Cream Cheese
raw_text: 92. Stuffed Mushrooms with Cream Cheese: 150 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 12 large mushrooms
- 8 ounces cream cheese, softened
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 tablespoons bread crumbs
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c). 
2. remove the stems from the mushrooms and set aside. 
3. in a mixing bowl, combine cream cheese, parmesan cheese, minced garlic, chopped parsley, salt, and black pepper. 
4. mix until well combined and smooth. 
5. stuff each mushroom cap with the cream cheese mixture, filling them generously. 
6. place the stuffed mushrooms on a baking sheet or in a baking dish. 
7. finely chop the mushroom stems and sprinkle them over the stuffed mushrooms. 
8. sprinkle bread crumbs on top of each stuffed mushroom. 
9. bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender and the tops are golden brown. 
10. remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving. enjoy!
ingredients_list: mushroom, ounce, cream, cheese, parmesan, cheese, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, parsley, salt, black, pepper, bread, crumb

title: Baked Jalapeno Poppers
raw_text: 93. Baked Jalapeno Poppers: 180 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 12 jalapeno peppers
- 8 ounces cream cheese, softened
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/2 teaspoon onion powder
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 12 slices bacon
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. slice each jalapeno in half lengthwise and remove the seeds and membranes. set aside.
3. in a mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese, shredded cheddar cheese, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, salt, and black pepper. stir until well combined.
4. spoon the cream cheese mixture into each jalapeno half, filling them to the top.
5. cut each bacon slice in half and wrap one piece around each stuffed jalapeno, securing with a toothpick if needed.
6. place the bacon-wrapped jalapenos on the prepared baking sheet and bake for about 20 minutes, or until the bacon is crispy and the jalapenos are tender.
7. serve the baked jalapeno poppers warm as an appetizer or snack. enjoy!
ingredients_list: jalapeno, pepper, ounce, cream, cheese, shredded, cheddar, cheese, garlic, powder, onion, powder, paprika, salt, black, pepper, bacon

title: Asparagus and Goat Cheese Tartlets
raw_text: 95. Asparagus and Goat Cheese Tartlets: 160 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 sheet of puff pastry
- 1 bunch of asparagus
- 4 oz goat cheese, crumbled
- 1 tbsp olive oil
- 1 clove of garlic, minced
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh thyme leaves for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. roll out the puff pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface and cut it into 4 equal squares. place the squares on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
3. trim the tough ends of the asparagus and blanch them in boiling water for 2 minutes. drain and set aside.
4. in a small pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat and add the minced garlic. sauté for a minute until fragrant.
5. brush each puff pastry square with the garlic-infused olive oil.
6. arrange a few asparagus spears diagonally on each pastry square and sprinkle with crumbled goat cheese. season with salt and pepper.
7. bake in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes or until the puff pastry is golden brown.
8. remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes. garnish with fresh thyme leaves before serving.
9. enjoy these delicious asparagus and goat cheese tartlets as an appetizer or light lunch.
ingredients_list: puff, pastry, bunch, asparagus, goat, cheese, olive, clove, garlic, minced, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, thyme, leaf, garnish

title: Baked Mini Samosas with Mint Chutney
raw_text: 96. Baked Mini Samosas with Mint Chutney: 220 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 4 tablespoons ghee or vegetable oil
- 1/2 cup water
- 1 cup boiled potatoes, mashed
- 1/2 cup frozen peas, thawed
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ginger, grated
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric
- 1/2 teaspoon chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon garam masala
- salt to taste
- vegetable oil for brushing

mint chutney:
- 1 cup fresh mint leaves
- 1/2 cup fresh coriander leaves
- 2 green chilies
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1 tablespoon water
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon sugar
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, mix flour and salt. add ghee or oil and rub into the flour until it resembles breadcrumbs.
2. gradually add water and knead to form a smooth dough. cover and let it rest for 15-20 minutes.
3. in a separate bowl, combine mashed potatoes, peas, onion, garlic, ginger, turmeric, chili powder, garam masala, and salt. mix well.
4. divide the dough into small portions and roll out each portion into a thin circle.
5. cut each circle in half to form semicircles.
6. fold each semicircle into a cone shape, sealing the edges with water.
7. fill each cone with the potato mixture and seal the top.
8. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
9. place the samosas on a baking sheet and brush with vegetable oil.
10. bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.
11. meanwhile, prepare the mint chutney by blending mint leaves, coriander leaves, green chilies, lemon juice, water, salt, and sugar in a food processor until smooth.
12. serve the baked mini samosas hot with mint chutney on the side. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, salt, ghee, vegetable, water, boiled, potato, frozen, pea, thawed, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, turmeric, chili, powder, garam, masala, salt, taste, vegetable, brushing, mint, chutney, fresh, mint, leaf, fresh, coriander, leaf, green, chilies, lemon, water, salt, sugar

title: Cilantro Lime Shrimp Skewers
raw_text: 97. Cilantro Lime Shrimp Skewers: 200 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains shellfish.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 3 tablespoons fresh lime juice
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine olive oil, lime juice, garlic, cilantro, salt, and black pepper.
2. add the shrimp to the bowl and toss until well coated with the marinade.
3. cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to marinate.
4. preheat grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
5. thread the marinated shrimp onto skewers.
6. grill the shrimp skewers for about 2-3 minutes per side, or until shrimp are opaque and cooked through.
7. remove from the grill and serve hot. enjoy!
ingredients_list: shrimp, deveined, olive, fresh, lime, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, cilantro, salt, black, pepper

title: Chocolate Dipped Pretzels
raw_text: 99. Chocolate Dipped Pretzels: 160 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 package of pretzels
- 1 cup of chocolate chips (milk, dark, or white chocolate)
- optional toppings: sprinkles, chopped nuts, crushed candy canes
preparation:
1. line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a microwave-safe bowl, melt the chocolate chips in 30-second intervals, stirring in between to avoid burning. alternatively, you can melt the chocolate using a double boiler on the stove.
3. once the chocolate is completely melted and smooth, dip each pretzel into the chocolate, using a fork or dipping tool to fully coat the pretzel.
4. allow any excess chocolate to drip off and place the chocolate-dipped pretzel on the prepared baking sheet.
5. if desired, sprinkle toppings on the dipped pretzels while the chocolate is still wet.
6. repeat the process until all pretzels are dipped and decorated.
7. place the baking sheet in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes, or until the chocolate is firm.
8. once the chocolate has hardened, remove the pretzels from the refrigerator and store them in an airtight container at room temperature.

enjoy your homemade chocolate-dipped pretzels!
cooking_style: the cooking style of this recipe is "baked".
ingredients_list: pretzel, chocolate, chip, milk, dark, white, chocolate, topping, sprinkle, nut, candy, cane

title: Teriyaki Chicken with Rice
raw_text: 13. Teriyaki Chicken with Rice: 500kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains soy (Japan)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 chicken breasts
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- 1/4 cup mirin
- 2 tablespoons brown sugar
- 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
- 1 teaspoon grated fresh ginger
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 2 cups cooked rice
- 2 green onions, thinly sliced
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, mirin, brown sugar, rice vinegar, ginger, and garlic until well combined.
2. place the chicken breasts in a shallow dish and pour half of the teriyaki sauce over them, reserving the other half for later.
3. marinate the chicken in the sauce for at least 30 minutes, or overnight if possible.
4. preheat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.
5. remove the chicken from the marinade and discard any excess sauce.
6. grill the chicken for about 6-8 minutes per side, or until cooked through and no longer pink in the center.
7. remove the chicken from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into thin strips.
8. serve the teriyaki chicken over cooked rice, drizzle with the remaining teriyaki sauce, and garnish with sliced green onions.
9. enjoy your teriyaki chicken with rice!
ingredients_list: chicken, breast, soy, sauce, mirin, brown, sugar, rice, vinegar, fresh, ginger, clove, garlic, minced, rice, green, onion, thinly

title: Greek Salad with Chicken
raw_text: 14. Greek Salad with Chicken: 300kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy (Greece)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- salt and pepper
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 4 cups mixed salad greens
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1 cucumber, sliced
- 1/2 red onion, thinly sliced
- 1/2 cup kalamata olives, pitted and halved
- 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar
- 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.
2. season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper on both sides.
3. drizzle 1 tablespoon of olive oil over the chicken breasts.
4. grill the chicken for about 6-8 minutes per side or until cooked through. set it aside to cool.
5. once cooled, slice the chicken into thin strips or bite-sized pieces.
6. in a large salad bowl, combine the salad greens, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, kalamata olives, and crumbled feta cheese.
7. in a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, red wine vinegar, extra-virgin olive oil, dried oregano, salt, and pepper to make the dressing.
8. pour the dressing over the salad and toss well to combine.
9. add the sliced grilled chicken to the salad and toss gently.
10. serve immediately and enjoy your greek salad with chicken!
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, salt, pepper, olive, salad, green, cherry, tomato, halved, cucumber, red, onion, thinly, kalamata, olive, pitted, halved, feta, cheese, fresh, lemon, red, wine, vinegar, virgin, olive, dried, oregano, salt, pepper, taste

title: Chicken Shawarma
raw_text: 17. Chicken Shawarma: 450kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains garlic, dairy (Middle East)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 lbs boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 1/4 cup olive oil
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1/4 cup plain yogurt
- 1/4 cup mayonnaise
- 2 tablespoons tahini
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
- 4 pita breads
- sliced tomatoes, cucumbers, and onions for serving
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine olive oil, minced garlic, lemon juice, cumin, paprika, coriander, turmeric, cinnamon, salt, and pepper. mix well.
2. pound the chicken breasts with a meat mallet until they are of even thickness.
3. place the chicken in a ziplock bag and pour the marinade over it. seal the bag and massage the marinade into the chicken. let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or overnight.
4. preheat the grill or skillet over medium-high heat.
5. remove the chicken from the marinade and discard any excess marinade.
6. grill or pan-fry the chicken for about 6-8 minutes on each side, or until cooked through and nicely browned. remove from heat and let it rest for a few minutes.
7. in a small bowl, whisk together the plain yogurt, mayonnaise, tahini, chopped parsley, salt, and pepper to make the sauce.
8. slice the cooked chicken into thin strips.
9. warm the pita breads on the grill or stovetop.
10. to assemble, spread the sauce on the inside of each pita bread. fill with sliced chicken, sliced tomatoes, cucumbers, and onions.
11. fold the pita breads and serve immediately. enjoy your chicken shawarma!
taste: The key taste profile in this recipe is: savory (umami)
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, olive, clove, garlic, minced, lemon, ground, cumin, ground, paprika, ground, coriander, ground, turmeric, ground, cinnamon, salt, pepper, taste, plain, yogurt, mayonnaise, tahini, fresh, parsley, pita, bread, tomato, cucumber, onion

title: Stuffed Bell Peppers with Ground Beef and Rice
raw_text: 24. Stuffed Bell Peppers with Ground Beef and Rice: 450kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy (International)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 bell peppers (any color)
- 1 lb ground beef
- 1 cup cooked rice
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 can diced tomatoes
- 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1 tsp dried oregano
- 1 tsp dried basil
- salt and pepper to taste
- olive oil for cooking
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. slice off the tops of the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes. set aside.
3. in a large skillet, heat some olive oil over medium heat. add the diced onions and minced garlic and sauté until fragrant.
4. add the ground beef to the skillet and cook until browned. break up the meat with a spatula as it cooks.
5. once the ground beef is cooked, drain any excess fat from the skillet.
6. stir in the cooked rice, diced tomatoes, dried oregano, dried basil, salt, and pepper. mix well to combine all the ingredients.
7. fill each bell pepper with the ground beef and rice mixture, packing them tightly.
8. place the stuffed bell peppers in a baking dish and drizzle them with some olive oil.
9. bake in the preheated oven for about 25 minutes or until the bell peppers are tender.
10. sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese on top of each stuffed bell pepper and return to the oven for another 5 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
11. remove from the oven and let the stuffed bell peppers cool slightly before serving.
12. serve the stuffed bell peppers warm and enjoy!
ingredients_list: bell, pepper, color, ground, beef, rice, onion, clove, garlic, minced, tomato, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, dried, oregano, dried, basil, salt, pepper, taste, olive

title: Fattoush Salad with Grilled Chicken
raw_text: 25. Fattoush Salad with Grilled Chicken: 350kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, gluten-free (Middle East)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 4 tablespoons olive oil, divided
- 2 teaspoons ground cumin
- 2 teaspoons ground paprika
- salt and black pepper to taste
- 4 pita breads
- 2 cups romaine lettuce, chopped
- 1 cup cucumber, diced
- 1 cup tomato, diced
- 1 small red onion, thinly sliced
- 1 cup fresh parsley, chopped
- 1/2 cup fresh mint leaves, chopped
- juice of 1 lemon
- 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- salt and black pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.
2. in a small bowl, mix together 2 tablespoons olive oil, ground cumin, ground paprika, salt, and black pepper. rub the chicken breasts with the mixture, coating them evenly.
3. grill the chicken for about 6-8 minutes per side, or until cooked through. once cooked, let it rest for a few minutes before slicing into strips.
4. while the chicken is grilling, brush the pita breads with 1 tablespoon olive oil and grill for about 1 minute on each side, until lightly toasted and crispy. cut the pitas into bite-sized pieces.
5. in a large salad bowl, combine the romaine lettuce, cucumber, tomato, red onion, parsley, and mint.
6. in a small bowl, whisk together the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil, lemon juice, red wine vinegar, minced garlic, salt, and black pepper. drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
7. add the grilled chicken and pita pieces to the salad and toss gently.
8. serve the fattoush salad immediately and enjoy!
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, olive, ground, cumin, ground, paprika, salt, black, pepper, taste, pita, bread, romaine, lettuce, cucumber, tomato, red, onion, thinly, fresh, parsley, fresh, mint, leaf, lemon, red, wine, vinegar, clove, garlic, minced, salt, black, pepper, taste

title: Shrimp Pad Thai
raw_text: 28. Shrimp Pad Thai: 500kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains seafood, peanuts (Thailand)
ingredients:
ingredients for shrimp pad thai:
- 8 oz rice noodles
- 1 lb shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 1 cup bean sprouts
- 1 cup shredded carrots
- 1/2 cup chopped green onions
- 1/2 cup chopped cilantro
- 1/4 cup chopped peanuts
- 3 tbsp soy sauce
- 2 tbsp fish sauce
- 2 tbsp tamarind paste
- 1 tbsp brown sugar
- 1 tbsp vegetable oil
- lime wedges for serving
preparation:
1. cook the rice noodles according to package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.
2. in a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, fish sauce, tamarind paste, and brown sugar. set aside.
3. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. add the minced garlic and sauté for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
4. add the shrimp to the skillet and cook until pink and cooked through, about 2-3 minutes. remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
5. push the shrimp to the side of the skillet and add the beaten eggs. scramble the eggs until cooked, then mix them with the shrimp.
6. add the cooked rice noodles to the skillet, followed by the sauce mixture. toss everything together until well combined.
7. stir in the bean sprouts, shredded carrots, and chopped green onions. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until heated through.
8. remove the skillet from heat and garnish with chopped cilantro and peanuts.
9. serve the shrimp pad thai with lime wedges on the side. enjoy!
ingredients_list: rice, noodle, shrimp, deveined, clove, garlic, minced, egg, bean, sprout, shredded, carrot, green, onion, cilantro, peanut, soy, sauce, fish, sauce, tamarind, paste, brown, sugar, vegetable, lime, wedge

title: Beef Kebabs
raw_text: 33. Beef Kebabs: 500kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains garlic (International)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound beef, cut into cubes
- 1 red bell pepper, cut into chunks
- 1 green bell pepper, cut into chunks
- 1 red onion, cut into chunks
- 8 wooden skewers, soaked in water

marinade:
- 1/4 cup olive oil
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons worcestershire sauce
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine olive oil, soy sauce, worcestershire sauce, minced garlic, paprika, cumin, salt, and pepper. mix well to make the marinade.
2. place the beef cubes in a shallow dish and pour the marinade over them. ensure all beef pieces are coated with marinade. cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or overnight if possible.
3. preheat grill to medium-high heat.
4. thread the marinated beef onto the soaked skewers, alternating with chunks of red bell pepper, green bell pepper, and red onion.
5. place the kebabs on the preheated grill and cook for about 8-10 minutes, turning occasionally, until the beef is cooked to your desired doneness and the vegetables are tender.
6. remove from heat and let the kebabs rest for a few minutes before serving.
7. serve the beef kebabs hot with rice, salad, or your preferred side dish. enjoy!
ingredients_list: beef, cube, red, bell, pepper, green, bell, pepper, red, onion, wooden, skewer, soaked, water, olive, soy, sauce, worcestershire, sauce, clove, garlic, minced, paprika, cumin, salt, pepper, taste

title: Tabouli Salad with Grilled Chicken
raw_text: 39. Tabouli Salad with Grilled Chicken: 400kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, dairy (Middle East)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup bulgur wheat
- 2 cups boiling water
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 cup chopped fresh parsley
- 1/2 cup chopped fresh mint leaves
- 1 cucumber, diced
- 4 tomatoes, diced
- 1 small red onion, finely chopped
- 2 grilled chicken breasts, sliced
preparation:
1. place the bulgur wheat in a bowl and pour boiling water over it. cover and let it sit for about 20 minutes or until the water is absorbed and the bulgur is tender.
2. in a separate small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and black pepper.
3. fluff the bulgur with a fork and pour the dressing over it. mix well to combine.
4. add the chopped parsley, mint, cucumber, tomatoes, and red onion to the bulgur mixture. toss gently to incorporate all the ingredients evenly.
5. allow the tabouli salad to sit at room temperature for about 30 minutes to let the flavors meld together.
6. meanwhile, grill the chicken breasts until fully cooked. allow them to cool slightly, then slice into thin pieces.
7. serve the tabouli salad on plates or bowls, topping each serving with slices of grilled chicken.
8. enjoy your tabouli salad with grilled chicken!
ingredients_list: bulgur, wheat, boiling, water, olive, fresh, lemon, salt, black, pepper, fresh, parsley, fresh, mint, leaf, cucumber, tomato, red, onion, chicken, breast

title: Chicken Parmesan with Spaghetti
raw_text: 42. Chicken Parmesan with Spaghetti: 500kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, dairy (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 1 cup bread crumbs
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/2 teaspoon dried basil
- 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1 egg, beaten
- 1 cup marinara sauce
- 1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 8 ounces spaghetti noodles
- olive oil for frying
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh basil leaves for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a shallow bowl, mix together the bread crumbs, grated parmesan cheese, dried basil, dried oregano, and garlic powder. season with salt and pepper.
3. dip each chicken breast in the beaten egg, then coat with the bread crumb mixture, pressing it lightly to adhere.
4. in a large skillet, heat enough olive oil to cover the bottom over medium-high heat. add the breaded chicken breasts and cook for about 3-4 minutes per side, or until golden brown and cooked through.
5. remove the chicken from the skillet and drain on paper towels to remove excess oil.
6. in a separate large pot, cook the spaghetti noodles according to the package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.
7. in a baking dish, spread a thin layer of marinara sauce on the bottom. place the cooked chicken breasts on top of the sauce.
8. spoon the remaining marinara sauce over the chicken, then sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese on top.
9. bake in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. while the chicken is baking, divide the cooked spaghetti noodles onto serving plates.
11. once the chicken is done, place a chicken breast on top of each serving of spaghetti.
12. garnish with fresh basil leaves, if desired, and serve warm.

enjoy your delicious chicken parmesan with spaghetti!
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, bread, crumb, parmesan, cheese, dried, basil, dried, oregano, garlic, powder, egg, marinara, sauce, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, ounce, spaghetti, noodle, olive, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, basil, leaf, garnish

title: Chicken and Broccoli Stir Fry
raw_text: 53. Chicken and Broccoli Stir Fry: 350kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains soy (International)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, sliced into thin strips
- 1 head of broccoli, cut into florets
- 1 bell pepper, sliced
- 1 carrot, sliced
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon ginger, grated
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon oyster sauce
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 1/4 cup chicken broth
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, oyster sauce, cornstarch, and chicken broth. set aside.
2. heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
3. add chicken strips and cook until browned and cooked through. remove from skillet and set aside.
4. in the same skillet, add garlic and ginger. cook for about 1 minute until fragrant.
5. add broccoli florets, bell pepper, and carrot slices to the skillet. stir-fry for about 5 minutes until vegetables are crisp-tender.
6. return the cooked chicken to the skillet and pour the sauce mixture over the ingredients. stir well to coat everything evenly.
7. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the sauce thickens and coats the chicken and vegetables.
8. season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. serve hot with steamed rice or noodles.
10. enjoy your chicken and broccoli stir fry!
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, strip, head, broccoli, floret, bell, pepper, carrot, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, soy, sauce, oyster, sauce, cornstarch, chicken, broth, vegetable, salt, pepper, taste

title: Thai Red Curry with Chicken
raw_text: 55. Thai Red Curry with Chicken: 500kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains peanuts (Thailand)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 chicken breasts, sliced
- 2 tablespoons red curry paste
- 1 can (400ml) coconut milk
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 green bell pepper, diced
- 1 onion, sliced
- 1 tablespoon fish sauce
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon brown sugar
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- fresh cilantro, chopped (for garnish)
- steamed rice (optional, for serving)
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
2. add the red curry paste and stir fry for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
3. add the chicken to the pan and cook until browned on all sides.
4. add the diced bell peppers and sliced onion to the pan and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, until slightly softened.
5. pour in the coconut milk, fish sauce, soy sauce, and brown sugar. stir well to combine.
6. reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15-20 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
7. taste the curry and adjust the seasoning, if needed, by adding more fish sauce, soy sauce, or sugar.
8. remove from heat and garnish with fresh cilantro.
9. serve the thai red curry with chicken over steamed rice, if desired. enjoy!
ingredients_list: chicken, breast, red, curry, paste, coconut, milk, red, bell, pepper, green, bell, pepper, onion, fish, sauce, soy, sauce, brown, sugar, vegetable, fresh, cilantro, garnish, rice

title: Baked Chicken Parmesan
raw_text: 61. Baked Chicken Parmesan: 500kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, dairy (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 1 cup bread crumbs
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/2 teaspoon dried basil
- 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes (optional)
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 1 cup marinara sauce
- 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- fresh basil leaves for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c). lightly grease a baking dish.
2. in a shallow bowl or plate, mix together the bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, dried basil, dried oregano, garlic powder, salt, black pepper, and red pepper flakes (if using).
3. place the flour in a separate shallow bowl or plate. beat the eggs in another bowl.
4. dip each chicken breast in the flour, coating both sides, then dip into the beaten eggs and coat with the bread crumb mixture, pressing gently to adhere the crumbs.
5. place the breaded chicken breasts in the greased baking dish and bake for about 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the coating is golden brown.
6. remove the baking dish from the oven and spoon marinara sauce over each chicken breast. top with shredded mozzarella cheese.
7. return the dish to the oven and bake for another 5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. remove from the oven and let rest for a few minutes. garnish with fresh basil leaves if desired.
9. serve the baked chicken parmesan with your favorite pasta or a side salad. enjoy!
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, bread, crumb, parmesan, cheese, dried, basil, dried, oregano, garlic, powder, salt, black, pepper, red, pepper, flake, flour, egg, marinara, sauce, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, fresh, basil, leaf, garnish

title: Chicken and Rice Pilaf
raw_text: 64. Chicken and Rice Pilaf: 450kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy (International)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
- 1 cup long-grain rice
- 2 cups chicken broth
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- salt and pepper, to taste
- chopped fresh parsley, for garnish
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. add the chopped onion and minced garlic. sauté until the onion becomes translucent and fragrant.
3. add the chicken pieces to the skillet and cook until they are browned on all sides.
4. stir in the long-grain rice, ensuring it is evenly coated with the oil and chicken juices.
5. pour in the chicken broth and sprinkle in the dried thyme. season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. cover the skillet with a lid and simmer for about 20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.
7. remove the skillet from the heat and let it sit, covered, for about 5 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
8. fluff the pilaf with a fork, then garnish with chopped fresh parsley before serving.
ingredients_list: olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, piece, long, grain, rice, chicken, broth, dried, thyme, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Chicken and Mushroom Stir Fry
raw_text: 71. Chicken and Mushroom Stir Fry: 450kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains soy (International)
ingredients:
ingredients:

- 2 chicken breasts, thinly sliced
- 8 ounces mushrooms, sliced
- 1 bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 onion, thinly sliced
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 3 tablespoons soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons oyster sauce
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 1 teaspoon sesame oil
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- salt and pepper, to taste
- cooked rice, for serving
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, oyster sauce, cornstarch, and sesame oil. set aside.
2. heat vegetable oil in a frying pan or wok over medium-high heat.
3. add chicken slices and stir-fry until cooked through and lightly browned. remove from pan and set aside.
4. in the same pan, add a bit more vegetable oil if needed. add garlic and sauté for 1 minute.
5. add mushrooms, bell pepper, and onion, and stir-fry for 5-6 minutes until vegetables are tender.
6. return cooked chicken to the pan and pour the sauce mixture over the ingredients.
7. stir-fry for an additional 2-3 minutes until the sauce thickens and coats the chicken and vegetables.
8. season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. serve the chicken and mushroom stir fry over cooked rice.
10. enjoy!

title: Chicken Noodle Stir Fry
raw_text: 73. Chicken Noodle Stir Fry: 350kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten (International)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 chicken breasts, sliced into thin strips
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 3 garlic cloves, minced
- 1-inch piece of fresh ginger, grated
- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 yellow bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 carrot, julienned
- 1 cup broccoli florets
- 2 cups cooked egg noodles
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon oyster sauce
- 1 tablespoon hoisin sauce
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 2 green onions, thinly sliced
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
2. add the chicken strips and cook until browned and cooked through. remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
3. in the same skillet, add the minced garlic and grated ginger. cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
4. add the sliced bell peppers, julienned carrot, and broccoli florets to the skillet. stir-fry for about 3-4 minutes, or until the vegetables are slightly tender.
5. return the cooked chicken to the skillet and mix well with the vegetables.
6. add the cooked egg noodles to the skillet and toss to combine with the chicken and vegetables.
7. in a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, oyster sauce, and hoisin sauce. pour the sauce over the chicken and noodle mixture.
8. season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. continue to stir-fry for about 2-3 minutes, until everything is heated through and well-coated with the sauce.
10. remove from heat and garnish with sliced green onions.
11. serve the chicken noodle stir fry hot and enjoy!

title: Grilled Tandoori Chicken
raw_text: 76. Grilled Tandoori Chicken: 500kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy (India)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 1 cup plain yogurt
- 3 tablespoons tandoori masala
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 2 teaspoons grated ginger
- 2 teaspoons minced garlic
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional)
- fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, whisk together the yogurt, tandoori masala, lemon juice, vegetable oil, ginger, garlic, salt, and cayenne pepper (if using).
2. add the chicken breasts to the bowl and coat them well with the marinade. cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or overnight for best results.
3. preheat your grill to medium-high heat.
4. remove the chicken from the marinade, allowing any excess to drip off. reserve the marinade for basting.
5. place the chicken on the grill and cook for 6-8 minutes per side, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°f (74°c) and the chicken is no longer pink.
6. while grilling, baste the chicken with the reserved marinade occasionally to keep it moist and flavorful.
7. once cooked, remove the chicken from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes.
8. garnish with fresh cilantro leaves and serve hot. enjoy your grilled tandoori chicken!
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, plain, yogurt, tandoori, masala, lemon, vegetable, ginger, minced, garlic, salt, cayenne, pepper, fresh, cilantro, leaf, garnish

title: Chicken and Vegetable Rice Bowl
raw_text: 78. Chicken and Vegetable Rice Bowl: 450kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains soy (International)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup of cooked white rice
- 1 chicken breast, cooked and thinly sliced
- 1 cup of mixed vegetables (carrots, bell peppers, broccoli, snap peas, etc.)
- 2 tablespoons of soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon of sesame oil
- 1 clove of garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon of grated ginger
- salt and pepper, to taste
- sesame seeds (optional, for garnish)
- green onions, sliced (optional, for garnish)
preparation:
1. in a large skillet or wok, heat the sesame oil over medium heat.
2. add the minced garlic and grated ginger to the skillet and cook for about 1 minute, until fragrant.
3. add the mixed vegetables to the skillet and sauté for about 5-7 minutes, until they are tender-crisp.
4. meanwhile, in a separate bowl, mix together the soy sauce, salt, and pepper.
5. push the vegetables to one side of the skillet and add the sliced chicken breast to the other side. cook for about 3-4 minutes, until the chicken is heated through.
6. pour the soy sauce mixture over the chicken and vegetables. stir everything together to coat evenly.
7. add the cooked white rice to the skillet and stir until everything is well combined and heated through.
8. taste and adjust the seasoning if needed.
9. remove from heat and transfer the chicken and vegetable rice mixture to serving bowls.
10. garnish with sesame seeds and sliced green onions, if desired.
11. serve hot and enjoy your chicken and vegetable rice bowl!
ingredients_list: white, rice, chicken, breast, thinly, vegetable, carrot, bell, pepper, broccoli, pea, soy, sauce, sesame, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, salt, pepper, taste, sesame, seed, garnish, green, onion, garnish

title: Pad Thai with Shrimp
raw_text: 82. Pad Thai with Shrimp: 450kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains seafood, peanuts (Thailand)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 oz rice noodles
- 1 lb medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 3 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 2 carrots, julienned
- 2 green onions, sliced
- 1/2 cup bean sprouts
- 1/4 cup chopped peanuts
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 1/4 cup fish sauce
- 3 tablespoons soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons lime juice
- 1 tablespoon brown sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes
- fresh cilantro, for garnish
- lime wedges, for serving
preparation:
1. cook the rice noodles according to package instructions. drain and set aside.
2. in a small bowl, whisk together the fish sauce, soy sauce, lime juice, brown sugar, and crushed red pepper flakes. set aside.
3. heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. add the shrimp and cook until pink and opaque, about 2-3 minutes per side. remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
4. in the same skillet, add another tablespoon of vegetable oil. add the garlic and sauté for about 1 minute until fragrant. add the bell pepper, carrots, and green onions. cook for another 2-3 minutes until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
5. push the vegetables to one side of the skillet and add the beaten eggs to the other side. scramble the eggs until cooked through, then mix them with the vegetables.
6. add the cooked rice noodles, shrimp, bean sprouts, and chopped peanuts to the skillet. pour the sauce over the top and toss everything together until well-coated and heated through.
7. remove from heat and garnish with fresh cilantro.
8. serve the pad thai with shrimp hot, with lime wedges on the side for squeezing over the top. enjoy!
ingredients_list: rice, noodle, shrimp, deveined, vegetable, clove, garlic, minced, red, bell, pepper, thinly, carrot, green, onion, bean, sprout, peanut, egg, fish, sauce, soy, sauce, lime, brown, sugar, red, pepper, flake, fresh, cilantro, garnish, lime, wedge

title: Chicken Pesto Pasta
raw_text: 86. Chicken Pesto Pasta: 500kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, dairy (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 ounces of linguine pasta
- 2 chicken breasts, boneless and skinless
- salt and pepper to taste
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1/4 cup of chicken broth
- 1/4 cup of pesto sauce
- 1/4 cup of heavy cream
- 1/4 cup of grated parmesan cheese
- fresh basil leaves for garnish
preparation:
1. cook the linguine pasta according to the package instructions. drain and set aside.
2. season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper on both sides.
3. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. add the chicken breasts and cook until they are golden brown and cooked through, about 6-8 minutes per side. remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
4. in the same skillet, add the minced garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
5. add the chicken broth to the skillet and stir, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan. bring to a simmer.
6. stir in the pesto sauce and heavy cream, allowing it to simmer for 2-3 minutes to combine the flavors.
7. slice the cooked chicken breasts into thin strips and add them back to the skillet, along with any juices that may have accumulated. stir to coat the chicken with the pesto sauce.
8. add the cooked linguine pasta to the skillet and toss until it is well coated with the sauce.
9. sprinkle the grated parmesan cheese over the pasta and toss again.
10. garnish with fresh basil leaves before serving. enjoy your delicious chicken pesto pasta!
ingredients_list: ounce, linguine, pasta, chicken, breast, boneless, skinless, salt, pepper, taste, olive, clove, garlic, minced, chicken, broth, pesto, sauce, cream, parmesan, cheese, fresh, basil, leaf, garnish

title: Mexican Stuffed Peppers
raw_text: 87. Mexican Stuffed Peppers: 450kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, dairy (Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large bell peppers (any color)
- 1 pound ground beef or turkey
- 1 cup cooked rice
- 1 cup black beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 cup corn kernels (fresh or frozen)
- 1 cup diced tomatoes
- 1/2 cup diced onion
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon chili powder
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- fresh cilantro, for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c). cut off the tops of the bell peppers and remove the seeds and veins. rinse the peppers under cold water and set aside.
2. in a large skillet, cook the ground beef or turkey over medium-high heat, breaking it up into small pieces. add the diced onion and minced garlic, cooking until the meat is browned and the onion is translucent.
3. stir in the cooked rice, black beans, corn kernels, diced tomatoes, chili powder, ground cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. cook for another 3-4 minutes until all the flavors combine.
4. arrange the peppers in a baking dish, standing upright. fill each bell pepper with the meat and rice mixture, packing it in tightly. top each pepper with shredded cheddar cheese.
5. cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the peppers are tender and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
6. remove from the oven and let the stuffed peppers cool for a few minutes. garnish with fresh cilantro before serving. enjoy your delicious mexican stuffed peppers!
ingredients_list: bell, pepper, color, ground, beef, turkey, rice, black, bean, corn, kernel, fresh, frozen, tomato, onion, clove, garlic, minced, chili, powder, ground, cumin, paprika, salt, pepper, taste, shredded, cheddar, cheese, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Chicken and Asparagus Stir Fry
raw_text: 89. Chicken and Asparagus Stir Fry: 450kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains soy (International)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 chicken breasts, sliced into thin strips
- 1 bunch of asparagus, trimmed and cut into 2-inch pieces
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 small onion, sliced
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon oyster sauce
- 1 tablespoon hoisin sauce
- 1 teaspoon sesame oil
- 1 teaspoon cornstarch
- salt and pepper to taste
- cooking oil for stir frying
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, mix together soy sauce, oyster sauce, hoisin sauce, sesame oil, and cornstarch. set aside.

2. heat cooking oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.

3. add the chicken strips to the skillet and cook until they are no longer pink, about 5-6 minutes. remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.

4. in the same skillet, add a bit more oil if needed, and then add the minced garlic, red bell pepper, and onion. stir fry for about 3-4 minutes until the vegetables are slightly softened.

5. add the asparagus to the skillet and cook for an additional 3-4 minutes or until the asparagus is tender-crisp.

6. return the cooked chicken back to the skillet with the vegetables.

7. pour the sauce mixture over the chicken and vegetables. stir everything together until well coated in the sauce.

8. cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, until the sauce has thickened and everything is heated through.

9. season with salt and pepper to taste.

10. serve the chicken and asparagus stir fry over steamed rice or noodles. enjoy!
