title: Tom Yum Soup with Shrimp
raw_text: 91. Tom Yum Soup with Shrimp: 300kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains seafood (Thailand)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 lb shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 4 cups chicken broth
- 2 stalks lemongrass, smashed and roughly chopped
- 4 kaffir lime leaves
- 1 thumb-sized piece of galangal, thinly sliced
- 2 red bird's eye chili peppers, thinly sliced
- 1 cup mushrooms, sliced
- 1 onion, thinly sliced
- 3 tablespoons fish sauce
- 2 tablespoons lime juice
- 1 tablespoon palm sugar
- fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish
preparation:
1. in a saucepan, bring the chicken broth to a boil.
2. add the lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, galangal, and chili peppers to the broth. let it simmer for about 5 minutes to infuse the flavors.
3. add the mushrooms and onion to the broth and continue to simmer for another 5 minutes.
4. stir in the shrimp and cook until they turn pink and opaque, which typically takes around 2-3 minutes.
5. add the fish sauce, lime juice, and palm sugar. stir well to combine and let it simmer for an additional 2 minutes.
6. remove from heat and discard the lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and galangal.
7. serve hot in bowls, garnished with fresh cilantro leaves. enjoy!

title: Tomato and Mozzarella Stuffed Chicken Breast
raw_text: 98. Tomato and Mozzarella Stuffed Chicken Breast: 500kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy (Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 2 medium-sized tomatoes, sliced
- 4 slices of fresh mozzarella cheese
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon dried basil
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. use a sharp knife to carefully butterfly each chicken breast, creating a pocket in the center of each piece.
3. season both sides of the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
4. stuff each chicken breast with tomato slices and mozzarella cheese, dividing them evenly between the two.
5. use toothpicks to secure the openings of the chicken breasts, holding the stuffing in place.
6. in a small bowl, combine the olive oil, minced garlic, dried basil, and dried oregano.
7. brush both sides of the stuffed chicken breasts with the olive oil mixture.
8. heat a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat. once hot, add the stuffed chicken breasts to the skillet.
9. cook the chicken for about 3-4 minutes on each side, until golden brown.
10. transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for about 18-20 minutes, or until the chicken is fully cooked.
11. remove the toothpicks from the chicken breasts before serving.
12. serve the tomato and mozzarella stuffed chicken breasts hot, and enjoy!
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, tomato, fresh, mozzarella, cheese, salt, pepper, taste, olive, clove, garlic, minced, dried, basil, dried, oregano

title: Beef and Broccoli Stir
raw_text: 3. Beef and Broccoli Stir-Fry: 300 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains soy (origin: China)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 lb beef, thinly sliced
- 2 cups broccoli florets
- 1/2 cup soy sauce
- 1/4 cup oyster sauce
- 2 tablespoons cornstarch
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ginger, minced
- 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes (optional)
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, oyster sauce, cornstarch, and a pinch of salt and pepper. set aside.
2. heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
3. add minced garlic, ginger, and red pepper flakes (if using), and sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
4. add beef slices and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until browned. remove beef from skillet and set aside.
5. in the same skillet, add broccoli florets and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until slightly tender.
6. return beef to the skillet and pour the soy sauce mixture over the beef and broccoli.
7. stir-fry for an additional 2-3 minutes until the sauce has thickened and coats the beef and broccoli.
8. remove from heat and serve hot with steamed rice or noodles.

enjoy your beef and broccoli stir-fry!

title: Baked Salmon with Lemon
raw_text: 11. Baked Salmon with Lemon: 300 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains fish (origin: Norway)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound salmon fillet
- 1 lemon, sliced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon dried dill
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. place the salmon fillet on a baking sheet lined with aluminum foil.
3. drizzle the olive oil over the salmon.
4. sprinkle the dried dill, salt, and pepper evenly over the salmon.
5. place the lemon slices on top of the salmon.
6. bake the salmon in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes.
7. check for doneness by inserting a fork into the thickest part of the salmon. it should easily flake.
8. remove the salmon from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.
9. serve the baked salmon with lemon slices on top. enjoy!

title: Moroccan Couscous with Chicken
raw_text: 17. Moroccan Couscous with Chicken: 400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten (origin: Morocco)
ingredients:
ingredients for moroccan couscous with chicken:
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
- 1 large onion, diced
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 teaspoons ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1 teaspoon ground paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric
- 1/4 teaspoon ground ginger
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional, for extra heat)
- salt and black pepper, to taste
- 2 cups chicken broth
- 1 cup diced tomatoes (fresh or canned)
- 1 cup canned chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1 cup diced carrots
- 1 cup diced zucchini
- 1 cup frozen green peas
- 1 cup dried couscous
- fresh parsley or cilantro, for garnish
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a large pot or dutch oven over medium heat. add the chicken pieces and cook until browned on all sides. remove the chicken from the pot and set aside.
2. in the same pot, add the diced onion and minced garlic. sauté until the onion is translucent and fragrant.
3. add the ground cumin, coriander, paprika, cinnamon, turmeric, ginger, cayenne pepper (if using), salt, and black pepper to the pot. stir well to coat the onions and garlic with the spices.
4. pour in the chicken broth, diced tomatoes, chickpeas, carrots, and zucchini. bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to simmer.
5. return the chicken to the pot and stir everything together. cover the pot and let it simmer for about 15 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
6. while the chicken and vegetables are simmering, prepare the couscous according to the package instructions. usually, you'll need to bring water to a boil, stir in the couscous, cover the pot, and let it sit for about 5 minutes until the couscous absorbs the water. fluff with a fork.
7. add the frozen green peas to the pot with the chicken and vegetables, and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, until the peas are heated through.
8. serve the moroccan couscous by placing a scoop of couscous on each plate, and topping it with the chicken and vegetable mixture. garnish with fresh parsley or cilantro before serving.

enjoy your moroccan couscous with chicken!

title: Beef and Black Bean Burrito
raw_text: 19. Beef and Black Bean Burrito: 450 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten (origin: Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound ground beef
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 large flour tortillas
- shredded cheese (optional)
- sour cream (optional)
- salsa (optional)
- guacamole (optional)
preparation:
1. in a large skillet, brown the ground beef over medium heat until cooked through. drain any excess fat.
2. add the diced onion, minced garlic, and bell pepper to the skillet. cook for another 5 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
3. stir in the black beans, cumin, chili powder, paprika, salt, and pepper. cook for an additional 3-4 minutes to blend the flavors together.
4. warm the flour tortillas in the microwave or oven until pliable.
5. spoon the beef and black bean mixture onto the center of each tortilla. add shredded cheese, sour cream, salsa, or guacamole on top if desired.
6. fold the sides of the tortilla over the filling, then roll it up tightly into a burrito shape.
7. serve the beef and black bean burritos warm and enjoy!

title: Lebanese Chicken Rice
raw_text: 20. Lebanese Chicken Rice: 300 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains nuts (origin: Lebanon)
ingredients:
ingredients:

- 1 onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced

4. add the basmati rice to the skillet and stir to combine with the chicken and spices.

6. remove the skillet from heat and let it sit, covered, for an additional 5 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.

title: Thai Tom Yum Soup
raw_text: 31. Thai Tom Yum Soup: 150 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains shrimp (origin: Thailand)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 cups vegetable or chicken broth
- 2 stalks lemongrass, trimmed and smashed
- 3-4 slices galangal or ginger
- 3-4 kaffir lime leaves, torn
- 1-2 thai chilies, sliced
- 8-10 medium-sized shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 8-10 button mushrooms, quartered
- 1 tomato, cut into wedges
- 2 tablespoons fish sauce
- 1 tablespoon lime juice
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish
- sliced scallions, for garnish
- thai chili flakes, for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. in a large pot, bring the vegetable or chicken broth to a boil.
2. add the lemongrass, galangal or ginger, kaffir lime leaves, and thai chilies to the pot. let it simmer for 5-7 minutes to infuse the flavors.
3. stir in the shrimp, mushrooms, and tomato wedges. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes or until the shrimp is cooked through.
4. add the fish sauce, lime juice, and sugar to the soup. taste and adjust the seasoning according to your preference.
5. remove the lemongrass, galangal or ginger, and kaffir lime leaves from the soup.
6. serve the tom yum soup hot, garnished with fresh cilantro leaves, sliced scallions, and thai chili flakes if desired. enjoy!
ingredients_list: vegetable, chicken, broth, stalk, lemongrass, smashed, galangal, ginger, kaffir, lime, leaf, torn, thai, chilies, shrimp, deveined, mushroom, quartered, tomato, wedge, fish, sauce, lime, sugar, fresh, cilantro, leaf, garnish, scallion, garnish, thai, chili, flake, garnish

title: Indian Chicken Tikka Masala
raw_text: 36. Indian Chicken Tikka Masala: 450 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy (origin: India)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 500 grams chicken breast, cut into bite-sized pieces
- 1 cup plain yogurt
- 3 tablespoons tikka masala paste
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 large onion, finely chopped
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1-inch piece of ginger, grated
- 2 tablespoons tomato paste
- 1 cup tomato puree
- 1 cup heavy cream
- 1 teaspoon garam masala
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1 teaspoon turmeric powder
- salt to taste
- fresh cilantro, chopped for garnish
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, combine the chicken, yogurt, and tikka masala paste. mix well, ensuring the chicken is coated in the mixture. let it marinate for at least 1 hour, or overnight in the refrigerator for optimal flavor.

2. heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or saucepan over medium heat. add the chopped onion and sauté until it becomes golden brown.

3. add the minced garlic and grated ginger to the pan. cook for another minute until fragrant.

4. stir in the tomato paste, tomato puree, and the spices (garam masala, ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder, and salt). mix well to combine all the flavors.

5. add the marinated chicken along with the yogurt mixture to the pan. cook over medium-high heat for about 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through.

6. reduce the heat to low and pour in the heavy cream. stir well to combine and simmer for another 2-3 minutes to heat through.

7. once cooked, remove from heat and garnish with freshly chopped cilantro.

8. serve the chicken tikka masala with steamed basmati rice or naan bread. enjoy!
taste:
The key taste profile in this recipe is:
- Spicy (due to tikka masala paste and spices)
ingredients_list: gram, chicken, breast, piece, plain, yogurt, tikka, masala, paste, vegetable, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, tomato, paste, tomato, puree, cream, garam, masala, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, turmeric, powder, salt, taste, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Turkish Lamb Kofta
raw_text: 41. Turkish Lamb Kofta: 300 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains nuts (origin: Turkey)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 500g ground lamb
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- salt and black pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, combine the ground lamb, chopped onion, minced garlic, chopped parsley, ground cumin, ground coriander, paprika, dried oregano, ground cinnamon, salt, and black pepper.
2. mix well until all the ingredients are evenly distributed.
3. shape the mixture into small elongated meatballs, about 2 inches long and 1 inch thick.
4. thread the meatballs onto skewers.
5. preheat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.
6. grill the lamb koftas for about 12-15 minutes, turning occasionally, until they are evenly browned and cooked through.
7. serve the turkish lamb kofta with flatbread, yogurt sauce, and your choice of side dishes. enjoy!
ingredients_list: ground, lamb, onion, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, parsley, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, paprika, dried, oregano, ground, cinnamon, salt, black, pepper, taste

title: Indian Palak Paneer
raw_text: 44. Indian Palak Paneer: 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy (origin: India)
ingredients:
ingredients for indian palak paneer: 
- 2 cups spinach leaves
- 200 grams paneer (indian cottage cheese), cubed
- 2 tablespoons oil
- 1 teaspoon cumin seeds
- 1 medium onion, finely chopped
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 1-inch ginger, grated
- 2 green chilies, chopped
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
- 1 teaspoon cumin powder
- 1 teaspoon coriander powder
- 1/2 teaspoon garam masala
- salt to taste
- 1/4 cup water
- 1/4 cup heavy cream (optional)
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
preparation:
1. blanch the spinach leaves in boiling water for about 2 minutes. drain and rinse them with cold water. blend them into a smooth puree and set aside.
2. heat oil in a pan over medium heat. add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
3. add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.
4. add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. sauté for a minute.
5. add turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. mix well and cook for another minute.
6. add the spinach puree to the pan and stir everything together. add water and let it simmer for 4-5 minutes.
7. add cubed paneer to the spinach mixture and gently mix it in. cook for 2-3 minutes to heat the paneer.
8. if desired, add heavy cream to the pan and mix well. cook for an additional minute.
9. lastly, add lemon juice and give it a final stir.
10. serve hot with rice, naan, or roti. enjoy your delicious palak paneer!
ingredients_list: spinach, leaf, gram, paneer, indian, cottage, cheese, cumin, seed, onion, garlic, clove, minced, ginger, green, chilies, turmeric, powder, cumin, powder, coriander, powder, garam, masala, salt, taste, water, cream, lemon

title: Thai Red Curry with Shrimp
raw_text: 46. Thai Red Curry with Shrimp: 400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains shrimp (origin: Thailand)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 2 tablespoons thai red curry paste
- 1 can (13.5 ounces) coconut milk
- 1 tablespoon fish sauce
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon brown sugar
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 green bell pepper, sliced
- 1 onion, sliced
- 1 cup broccoli florets
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- fresh cilantro for garnish
- cooked rice, for serving
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
2. add the thai red curry paste and cook for about 1 minute, stirring constantly.
3. add the shrimp to the skillet and cook until they turn pink and are cooked through, about 3-4 minutes. remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
4. in the same skillet, add the bell peppers, onion, and broccoli florets. cook for about 3-4 minutes, until they start to soften.
5. pour in the coconut milk, fish sauce, soy sauce, and brown sugar. stir well to combine and bring to a simmer.
6. reduce the heat to low and let the curry simmer for about 5 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
7. return the cooked shrimp to the skillet and cook for an additional 2 minutes to heat through.
8. serve the thai red curry with shrimp over cooked rice.
9. garnish with fresh cilantro and enjoy!
ingredients_list: shrimp, deveined, thai, red, curry, paste, ounce, coconut, milk, fish, sauce, soy, sauce, brown, sugar, red, bell, pepper, green, bell, pepper, onion, broccoli, floret, vegetable, fresh, cilantro, garnish, rice

title: Italian Caprese Panini
raw_text: 48. Italian Caprese Panini: 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten (origin: Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 large tomato, thinly sliced
- 8 oz mozzarella cheese, sliced
- 1/2 cup fresh basil leaves
- 4 tablespoons balsamic glaze
- 8 slices of bread (such as ciabatta or focaccia)
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat a panini press or a grill pan over medium heat.
2. assemble the sandwiches by placing a few basil leaves on the bottom slice of each bread.
3. top with tomato slices and a few slices of mozzarella cheese.
4. drizzle each sandwich with 1 tablespoon of balsamic glaze and season with salt and pepper.
5. place the top slices of bread over the filling to make a sandwich.
6. brush the outsides of the sandwiches with olive oil.
7. place the sandwiches onto the preheated panini press or grill pan.
8. cook for about 3-4 minutes, until the bread is crispy and the cheese has melted.
9. remove the sandwiches from the grill and let them cool for a minute before serving.
10. cut the sandwiches in half diagonally and serve warm. enjoy the delicious italian caprese panini!
ingredients_list: tomato, thinly, mozzarella, cheese, fresh, basil, leaf, balsamic, glaze, bread, ciabatta, focaccia, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Korean Japchae
raw_text: 49. Korean Japchae: 300 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains soy (origin: Korea)
ingredients:
ingredients for korean japchae:
- 8 ounces of sweet potato glass noodles (dangmyeon)
- 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil
- 1 onion, thinly sliced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 carrot, julienned
- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 4 ounces of spinach
- 4 ounces of mushrooms (shiitake or button), sliced
- 1 tablespoon of sesame oil
- 2 tablespoons of soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon of sugar
- salt, to taste
- ground black pepper, to taste
- roasted sesame seeds, for garnish
preparation:
1. cook the glass noodles according to the package instructions. drain and set aside.
2. heat the vegetable oil in a large pan or wok over medium heat.
3. add the onion and garlic, and sauté for 2-3 minutes until the onion becomes translucent.
4. add the carrot and bell pepper, and continue to stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes until the vegetables begin to soften.
5. in a separate pot, blanch the spinach in boiling salted water for about 1 minute. drain and rinse under cold water to stop the cooking process. squeeze out any excess water and set aside.
6. add the mushrooms to the pan and stir-fry for about 3-4 minutes until they are cooked through.
7. add the cooked glass noodles to the pan, along with the sesame oil, soy sauce, sugar, salt, and black pepper. stir well to coat all the ingredients evenly.
8. finally, add the blanched spinach to the pan and gently mix everything together.
9. cook for an additional 1-2 minutes until the noodles are heated through.
10. remove from heat and transfer to a serving dish.
11. garnish with roasted sesame seeds.
12. serve hot or cold as a side dish or main course. enjoy your delicious korean japchae!
ingredients_list: ounce, sweet, potato, noodle, dangmyeon, vegetable, onion, thinly, clove, garlic, minced, carrot, red, bell, pepper, thinly, ounce, spinach, ounce, mushroom, shiitake, sesame, soy, sauce, sugar, salt, taste, ground, black, pepper, taste, roasted, sesame, seed, garnish

title: Japanese Chicken Teriyaki
raw_text: 56. Japanese Chicken Teriyaki: 400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten (origin: Japan)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 1/2 cup soy sauce
- 1/4 cup mirin (japanese sweet rice wine)
- 1/4 cup sake (japanese rice wine)
- 2 tablespoons brown sugar
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- sesame seeds, for garnish
- green onions, sliced for garnish
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine the soy sauce, mirin, sake, brown sugar, minced garlic, and grated ginger. stir well until the sugar dissolves to make the teriyaki sauce.
2. place the chicken breasts in a shallow dish and pour half of the teriyaki sauce over them. reserve the remaining sauce for later.
3. marinate the chicken in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes, flipping the chicken halfway through.
4. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or grill pan over medium-high heat.
5. remove the chicken from the marinade, leaving any excess sauce behind. cook the chicken in the hot skillet for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
6. while the chicken is cooking, pour the reserved teriyaki sauce into a small saucepan. bring it to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for about 5 minutes, or until it thickens slightly.
7. once the chicken is cooked, remove it from the skillet and let it rest for a few minutes. slice it into thin pieces.
8. serve the sliced chicken drizzled with the thickened teriyaki sauce. garnish with sesame seeds and sliced green onions.
9. enjoy the japanese chicken teriyaki with steamed rice or vegetables.
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, soy, sauce, mirin, japanese, sweet, rice, wine, sake, japanese, rice, wine, brown, sugar, garlic, clove, minced, fresh, ginger, vegetable, sesame, seed, garnish, green, onion, garnish

title: Lebanese Chicken Shawarma Salad
raw_text: 60. Lebanese Chicken Shawarma Salad: 400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains nuts (origin: Lebanon)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 4 tablespoons olive oil
- 4 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 4 cups mixed salad greens
- 1 cucumber, sliced
- 1 tomato, diced
- 1/4 cup chopped red onion
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
- tahini sauce, for serving
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, ground cumin, ground coriander, paprika, ground turmeric, salt, and pepper. mix well to create the marinade.
2. place chicken breasts in a resealable plastic bag and pour the marinade over them. seal the bag and massage the marinade into the chicken, ensuring it is evenly coated. allow the chicken to marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour, or overnight for best flavor.
3. preheat grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. cook the marinated chicken breasts for about 6-8 minutes per side, or until cooked through and no longer pink in the center. remove from heat and let rest for a few minutes.
4. slice the cooked chicken thinly and set aside.
5. in a large salad bowl, combine mixed salad greens, sliced cucumber, diced tomato, chopped red onion, and chopped fresh parsley.
6. arrange the sliced chicken on top of the salad.
7. serve the lebanese chicken shawarma salad with tahini sauce on the side.
8. enjoy!
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, olive, freshly, squeezed, lemon, clove, garlic, minced, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, paprika, ground, turmeric, salt, pepper, taste, salad, green, cucumber, tomato, red, onion, fresh, parsley, tahini, sauce

title: Korean Bulgogi Beef
raw_text: 64. Korean Bulgogi Beef: 450 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains soy (origin: Korea)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound beef sirloin, thinly sliced
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons brown sugar
- 2 tablespoons sesame oil
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 small onion, thinly sliced
- 1 tablespoon rice wine or mirin
- 1 tablespoon sesame seeds, for garnish
- 2 green onions, sliced diagonally
- optional: 1 carrot, julienned
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame oil, minced garlic, and rice wine/mirin. mix well.
2. add the beef slices into the marinade, making sure each slice is coated evenly. let it marinate for at least 30 minutes, or preferably overnight in the refrigerator.
3. heat a large pan or skillet over medium-high heat. add the marinated beef, onions, and carrots (if using) to the pan. cook until the beef is browned and cooked through, and the onions are translucent and slightly caramelized.
4. garnish with sesame seeds and sliced green onions before serving.
5. serve the bulgogi beef over steamed rice, with some lettuce or cabbage leaves on the side for wrapping if desired.
6. enjoy your delicious korean bulgogi beef!
ingredients_list: beef, sirloin, thinly, soy, sauce, brown, sugar, sesame, clove, garlic, minced, onion, thinly, rice, wine, mirin, sesame, seed, garnish, green, onion, carrot

title: Mexican Chicken Fajitas
raw_text: 66. Mexican Chicken Fajitas: 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten (origin: Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 1 bell pepper (any color), sliced
- 1 onion, sliced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 tablespoon chili powder
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- juice of 1 lime
- flour tortillas
- optional toppings: sliced avocado, shredded cheese, sour cream, salsa
preparation:
1. slice the chicken breasts into thin strips.
2. in a large bowl, combine chicken strips, sliced bell pepper, sliced onion, minced garlic, olive oil, chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, black pepper, and lime juice. mix well to evenly coat the chicken and vegetables.
3. heat a large skillet or grill pan over medium-high heat. add the marinated chicken and vegetables to the pan and cook for 8-10 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender-crisp. stir occasionally to prevent sticking and ensure even cooking.
4. while the chicken is cooking, warm the flour tortillas according to package instructions.
5. once the chicken and vegetables are cooked, remove from heat.
6. to serve, spoon the chicken and vegetable mixture onto warm flour tortillas. top with optional toppings such as sliced avocado, shredded cheese, sour cream, and salsa.
7. roll up the tortillas tightly, folding in the sides, to create the fajitas.
8. serve hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, bell, pepper, color, onion, clove, garlic, minced, olive, chili, powder, cumin, paprika, salt, black, pepper, lime, flour, tortilla, topping, avocado, shredded, cheese, sour, cream, salsa

title: Vietnamese Summer Rolls
raw_text: 67. Vietnamese Summer Rolls: 250 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains shrimp (origin: Vietnam)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8-10 rice paper wrappers
- 1 cup cooked vermicelli rice noodles
- 1 carrot, julienned
- 1 cucumber, julienned
- 1 bell pepper, julienned
- 1/2 cup fresh cilantro leaves
- 1/2 cup fresh mint leaves
- 1/2 cup fresh basil leaves
- 8-10 cooked shrimp, peeled and deveined (optional)
- hoisin sauce, for dipping
preparation:
1. fill a large bowl with warm water. dip 1 rice paper wrapper into the water for about 10 seconds until it becomes soft and pliable.
2. place the damp rice paper wrapper onto a clean surface. leave about 2-3 inches of space at the bottom of the wrapper.
3. lay a few pieces of each vegetable (carrot, cucumber, bell pepper), a small handful of vermicelli noodles, and a few leaves of cilantro, mint, and basil onto the lower half of the rice paper wrapper.
4. if using shrimp, place one shrimp on top of the herbs and vegetables.
5. fold the bottom of the rice paper wrapper over the filling, then fold in the sides and continue rolling tightly until completely sealed.
6. repeat steps 1-5 with the remaining ingredients.
7. serve the summer rolls with hoisin sauce as a dipping sauce.
8. enjoy!
ingredients_list: rice, wrapper, vermicelli, rice, noodle, carrot, cucumber, bell, pepper, fresh, cilantro, leaf, fresh, mint, leaf, fresh, basil, leaf, shrimp, deveined, hoisin, sauce, dipping

title: Thai Massaman Curry
raw_text: 70. Thai Massaman Curry: 400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains peanuts (origin: Thailand)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1.5 lbs (680g) beef, cut into cubes
- 2 tbsp vegetable oil
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tbsp massaman curry paste
- 1 can (400ml) coconut milk
- 1 cup beef broth
- 2 potatoes, peeled and cut into chunks
- 1 carrot, peeled and sliced
- 1 tbsp fish sauce
- 1 tbsp tamarind paste
- 1 tbsp brown sugar
- 1/2 cup roasted peanuts
- fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish
preparation:
1. in a large pot or dutch oven, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. add onions and garlic, and cook until onions are softened, about 5 minutes.
2. add massaman curry paste to the pot and stir-fry for about a minute until fragrant.
3. add beef to the pot and cook until browned on all sides.
4. pour in the coconut milk and beef broth. stir to combine.
5. add potatoes, carrots, fish sauce, tamarind paste, and brown sugar to the pot. stir well.
6. bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low. cover and simmer for about 1.5 to 2 hours, or until the beef is tender.
7. stir in the roasted peanuts and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
8. serve the massaman curry over steamed rice, garnished with fresh cilantro leaves. enjoy!
ingredients_list: beef, cube, vegetable, onion, clove, garlic, minced, massaman, curry, paste, coconut, milk, beef, broth, potato, carrot, fish, sauce, tamarind, paste, brown, sugar, roasted, peanut, fresh, cilantro, leaf, garnish

title: Italian Chicken Parmesan
raw_text: 72. Italian Chicken Parmesan: 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten (origin: Italy)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 1 cup bread crumbs
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 1/4 cup olive oil
- 1 jar (24 oz) marinara sauce
- 4 slices mozzarella cheese
- fresh basil leaves for garnish
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. pound the chicken breasts between two sheets of plastic wrap until about 1/2 inch thick.
3. in a shallow dish, mix together the bread crumbs and grated parmesan cheese.
4. place the flour in another shallow dish and season with salt and pepper.
5. dip each chicken breast into the flour, then into the beaten eggs, and finally into the bread crumb mixture, pressing gently to adhere.
6. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. cook the chicken breasts for about 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown.
7. pour half of the marinara sauce into a baking dish. place the cooked chicken breasts on top of the sauce.
8. spoon the remaining marinara sauce over the chicken breasts.
9. top each chicken breast with a slice of mozzarella cheese.
10. bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
11. serve the chicken parmesan over cooked spaghetti or any pasta of your choice.
12. garnish with fresh basil leaves and serve hot. enjoy!
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, bread, crumb, parmesan, cheese, flour, egg, olive, marinara, sauce, mozzarella, cheese, fresh, basil, leaf, garnish, salt, pepper, taste

title: Korean Kimchi Fried Rice
raw_text: 73. Korean Kimchi Fried Rice: 400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains soy (origin: Korea)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups cooked white rice
- 1 cup kimchi, chopped
- 1/2 cup kimchi juice
- 1/4 cup gochujang (korean chili paste)
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon sesame oil
- 1/2 cup diced carrots
- 1/2 cup frozen peas
- 1/2 cup diced onions
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 green onions, chopped
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 2 eggs, beaten
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
2. add the onions, carrots, peas, and garlic to the skillet and stir-fry for about 3-4 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
3. push the vegetables to one side of the skillet and pour the beaten eggs onto the other side. scramble the eggs until fully cooked.
4. mix the cooked eggs with the vegetables in the skillet.
5. add the chopped kimchi and continue to stir-fry for another 2 minutes.
6. in a small bowl, combine the kimchi juice, gochujang, soy sauce, and sesame oil. stir well to combine.
7. pour the sauce mixture over the kimchi and vegetable mixture in the skillet and mix until everything is coated evenly.
8. add the cooked white rice to the skillet and stir-fry for about 5 minutes, or until the rice is heated through and well-combined with the other ingredients.
9. season with salt and pepper to taste.
10. remove from heat and garnish with chopped green onions.
11. serve hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: white, rice, kimchi, kimchi, gochujang, korean, chili, paste, soy, sauce, sesame, carrot, frozen, pea, onion, clove, garlic, minced, green, onion, vegetable, egg, salt, pepper, taste

title: Vietnamese Caramelized Pork
raw_text: 75. Vietnamese Caramelized Pork: 400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains fish (origin: Vietnam)
ingredients:
ingredients for vietnamese caramelized pork:
- 500 grams of pork belly, sliced
- 3 tablespoons of fish sauce
- 3 tablespoons of dark soy sauce
- 3 tablespoons of sugar
- 1 tablespoon of minced garlic
- 1 tablespoon of minced shallots
- 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil
- freshly ground black pepper
- optional garnish: sliced spring onions and sesame seeds
preparation:
1. in a bowl, mix together the fish sauce, dark soy sauce, sugar, minced garlic, minced shallots, and a pinch of black pepper.
2. add the pork slices to the bowl and marinate for at least 30 minutes, or overnight for better flavor absorption.
3. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
4. add the marinated pork slices (including the marinade) to the hot skillet.
5. cook the pork for about 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until it caramelizes and turns golden brown.
6. reduce the heat to low and continue cooking for an additional 5-10 minutes to let the flavors intensify.
7. remove the caramelized pork from heat and let it rest for a few minutes.
8. serve hot with steamed rice or as a topping for noodles.
9. garnish with sliced spring onions and sesame seeds, if desired.
10. enjoy your delicious vietnamese caramelized pork!
ingredients_list: gram, pork, belly, fish, sauce, dark, soy, sauce, sugar, minced, garlic, minced, shallot, vegetable, freshly, ground, black, pepper, garnish, spring, onion, sesame, seed

title: Japanese Gyoza
raw_text: 80. Japanese Gyoza: 300 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (origin: Japan)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 package of gyoza wrappers
- 1/2 pound ground pork
- 1/2 cup finely shredded cabbage
- 2 green onions, finely chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon freshly grated ginger
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon sesame oil
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- vegetable oil, for frying
- water, for steaming
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine ground pork, shredded cabbage, green onions, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, sesame oil, salt, and black pepper. mix well until all the ingredients are evenly incorporated.
2. place a small spoonful of the pork filling onto the center of a gyoza wrapper. dip your finger in water and moisten the edge of the wrapper. fold the wrapper in half and seal it by pinching the edges together. pleat the edges of the wrapper by folding one section and then overlapping with the next section. repeat this process until all the filling and wrappers are used.
3. heat a tablespoon of vegetable oil in a frying pan over medium heat. place the gyoza in the pan, pleated side up, and cook until the bottoms are golden brown, about 2-3 minutes.
4. once the bottoms are browned, carefully pour about 1/4 cup of water into the pan and immediately cover with a lid. steam the gyoza for about 5 minutes, or until the water has evaporated.
5. remove the lid and continue cooking for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until the gyoza are crispy on the bottom.
6. serve the gyoza hot with your favorite dipping sauce such as soy sauce mixed with rice vinegar or chili oil. enjoy!
ingredients_list: gyoza, wrapper, ground, pork, shredded, cabbage, green, onion, clove, garlic, minced, freshly, ginger, soy, sauce, sesame, salt, black, pepper, vegetable, water, steaming

title: Turkish Chicken Pilaf
raw_text: 81. Turkish Chicken Pilaf: 400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains nuts (origin: Turkey)
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 2 cups long-grain white rice
- 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cubed
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
- 4 cups chicken broth
- 1 cup frozen peas
- fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. rinse the rice under cold water until the water runs clear. then, soak the rice in cold water for about 20 minutes, and drain.
2. in a large skillet or dutch oven, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. add the chicken cubes and cook until browned on all sides. remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
3. in the same skillet, add the chopped onion and minced garlic. sauté until the onions are soft and translucent.
4. add the soaked and drained rice to the skillet with the onions and garlic. stir well to combine.
5. sprinkle the cumin, oregano, paprika, salt, and black pepper over the rice mixture. stir to evenly distribute the spices.
6. return the cooked chicken cubes to the skillet and stir to mix with the rice.
7. pour the chicken broth into the skillet and bring to a boil. reduce the heat to low, cover the skillet, and let it simmer for about 15-20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.
8. once the rice is cooked, add the frozen peas to the skillet. stir gently to combine and cover the skillet again. let it sit for 5 minutes to allow the peas to thaw and heat through.
9. fluff the pilaf with a fork and sprinkle with the chopped fresh parsley for garnish.
10. serve the turkish chicken pilaf hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: long, grain, white, rice, boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, onion, clove, garlic, minced, vegetable, ground, cumin, dried, oregano, paprika, salt, black, pepper, chicken, broth, frozen, pea, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Mexican Chicken Quesadilla
raw_text: 82. Mexican Chicken Quesadilla: 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten (origin: Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 onion, diced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 green bell pepper, diced
- 1 jalapeno pepper, minced (optional)
- 4 large tortillas (flour or corn)
- 1 cup shredded mexican cheese blend
- salsa, guacamole, and sour cream for serving
preparation:
1. season the chicken breasts with chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper on both sides.
2. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. cook the chicken breasts until fully cooked and no longer pink in the center, about 6-8 minutes per side. remove from the skillet and set aside to cool slightly.
3. in the same skillet, add the diced onion, red bell pepper, green bell pepper, and jalapeno pepper (if using). cook until the vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes.
4. slice the cooked chicken breasts into thin strips.
5. lay a tortilla flat and sprinkle a quarter of the shredded cheese on one side. top with a quarter of the cooked vegetables and a quarter of the sliced chicken. fold the tortilla in half to enclose the filling.
6. place the quesadilla in the skillet over medium heat. cook until the tortilla is crispy and golden brown on one side, then flip and cook the other side until crispy and the cheese has melted.
7. repeat steps 5-6 with the remaining tortillas and filling ingredients.
8. slice the cooked quesadillas into wedges and serve with salsa, guacamole, and sour cream on the side. enjoy!
taste: The key taste profile in this recipe is spicy (from the chili powder, cumin, and jalapeno pepper).
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, chili, powder, cumin, paprika, salt, pepper, taste, olive, onion, red, bell, pepper, green, bell, pepper, jalapeno, pepper, minced, tortilla, flour, corn, shredded, mexican, cheese, blend, salsa, guacamole, sour, cream

title: Lebanese Kibbeh
raw_text: 84. Lebanese Kibbeh: 450 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten (origin: Lebanon)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 lb ground beef or lamb
- 1 cup fine bulgur wheat
- 1 medium onion, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon ground allspice
- 1/2 teaspoon salt

for the filling:
- 1/2 lb ground beef or lamb
- 1 medium onion, finely chopped
- 2 tablespoons pine nuts (optional)
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon ground allspice
- salt and black pepper to taste

for frying:
- vegetable oil
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, soak the bulgur wheat in water for about 10 minutes. drain well and squeeze out any excess water.
2. add the ground beef or lamb, chopped onion, parsley, cumin, cinnamon, allspice, and salt to the bowl with the bulgur wheat. mix well with your hands until all the ingredients are evenly combined and a smooth, firm dough is formed.
3. to make the filling, heat a small amount of vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. add the chopped onion and cook until translucent. add the ground beef or lamb and cook until browned, breaking it up with a wooden spoon. stir in the pine nuts (if using), cinnamon, allspice, salt, and black pepper. cook for another few minutes until the flavors are well blended. remove from heat and let it cool.
4. take a small portion of the kibbeh dough, about the size of a golf ball, and shape it into a hollow cup with your hands. fill the cup with a spoonful of the meat filling and seal it by pinching the edges together. shape into an oval or torpedo shape, similar to a small football. repeat with the remaining dough and filling.
5. heat vegetable oil in a deep frying pan or pot to medium-high heat. fry the kibbeh in batches until they turn golden brown and crispy on all sides. remove with a slotted spoon and transfer to a plate lined with paper towels to drain excess oil.
6. serve the lebanese kibbeh hot as an appetizer or main dish, with a side of yogurt sauce, hummus, or tahini sauce.

note: you can also bake the kibbeh instead of frying. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c) and arrange the kibbeh on a greased baking sheet. bake for about 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.
ingredients_list: ground, beef, lamb, bulgur, wheat, onion, fresh, parsley, ground, cumin, ground, cinnamon, ground, allspice, salt, filling, ground, beef, lamb, onion, pine, nut, ground, cinnamon, ground, allspice, salt, black, pepper, taste, vegetable

title: Thai Pineapple Curry with Shrimp
raw_text: 85. Thai Pineapple Curry with Shrimp: 400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains shrimp (origin: Thailand)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 medium onion, thinly sliced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons thai red curry paste
- 1 cup coconut milk
- 1 cup chicken or vegetable broth
- 1 tablespoon fish sauce
- 1 tablespoon brown sugar
- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 cup pineapple chunks
- 1 pound shrimp, peeled and deveined
- fresh cilantro, for garnish
- cooked rice, for serving
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
2. add the sliced onion and minced garlic, and sauté for 2-3 minutes until slightly softened.
3. add the thai red curry paste and stir-fry for another minute to release the flavors.
4. pour in the coconut milk, chicken or vegetable broth, fish sauce, and brown sugar. stir until well combined and bring to a simmer.
5. add the sliced red bell pepper and pineapple chunks to the curry mixture. simmer for 5 minutes until the vegetables start to soften.
6. gently stir in the shrimp and cook for an additional 3-4 minutes until they turn pink and opaque.
7. remove from heat and garnish with fresh cilantro.
8. serve the thai pineapple curry with shrimp over cooked rice. enjoy!
ingredients_list: vegetable, onion, thinly, clove, garlic, minced, thai, red, curry, paste, coconut, milk, chicken, vegetable, broth, fish, sauce, brown, sugar, red, bell, pepper, thinly, pineapple, shrimp, deveined, fresh, cilantro, garnish, rice

title: Korean Jjajangmyeon
raw_text: 88. Korean Jjajangmyeon: 350 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten (origin: Korea)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 200g pork belly, thinly sliced
- 200g onions, finely chopped
- 100g zucchini, diced
- 100g cabbage, thinly sliced
- 100g carrots, diced
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 4 cups water
- 1 cup black bean paste (chunjang)
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 2 tablespoons oyster sauce
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch, dissolved in 2 tablespoons water
- salt and black pepper, to taste
- 4 servings of noodles, cooked according to package instructions
preparation:
1. heat vegetable oil in a large pan or wok over medium heat.
2. add the sliced pork belly and stir-fry until cooked and slightly crispy. remove from the pan and set aside.
3. in the same pan, add the chopped onions and minced garlic. stir-fry until the onions become translucent.
4. add the diced carrots, zucchini, and cabbage. stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until the vegetables start to soften.
5. pour in the water and bring it to a boil. reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for 10 minutes.
6. in a separate bowl, mix the black bean paste, sugar, oyster sauce, and soy sauce together.
7. add the black bean paste mixture to the pan and stir well to combine with the vegetables.
8. simmer the sauce for another 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
9. taste and adjust the seasoning with salt and black pepper if needed.
10. gradually pour in the dissolved cornstarch while stirring continuously until the sauce thickens to your desired consistency.
11. add the cooked pork belly back to the pan and stir well to coat with the sauce.
12. serve the jjajang sauce over the cooked noodles.
13. garnish with any desired toppings like sliced cucumbers, green onions, or sesame seeds.
14. mix everything together before eating and enjoy your homemade korean jjajangmyeon!
taste: The key taste profile for this recipe is both salty and umami.
ingredients_list: pork, belly, thinly, onion, zucchini, cabbage, thinly, carrot, clove, garlic, minced, water, black, bean, paste, chunjang, vegetable, sugar, oyster, sauce, soy, sauce, cornstarch, dissolved, water, salt, black, pepper, taste, serving, noodle, instruction

title: Mexican Steak Fajitas
raw_text: 90. Mexican Steak Fajitas: 400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten (origin: Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound flank steak
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 tablespoon lime juice
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 green bell pepper, sliced
- 1 onion, sliced
- flour tortillas
- optional toppings: sour cream, guacamole, salsa, shredded cheese, chopped cilantro
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, combine the olive oil, lime juice, minced garlic, chili powder, smoked paprika, cumin, oregano, salt, and black pepper.
2. place the flank steak in a resealable plastic bag and pour the marinade over it. close the bag and massage the steak to evenly coat it with the marinade. let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour, or preferably overnight.
3. preheat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. remove the steak from the marinade and discard any excess marinade.
4. grill the steak for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until it reaches your desired level of doneness. remove the steak from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes. slice the steak against the grain into thin strips.
5. in a separate skillet, heat a tablespoon of oil over medium heat. add the sliced bell peppers and onions, and sauté until they become tender and slightly charred, about 7-8 minutes.
6. warm the flour tortillas in a dry skillet or microwave.
7. to serve, fill each tortilla with slices of grilled steak, sautéed peppers and onions, and any optional toppings you desire, such as sour cream, guacamole, salsa, shredded cheese, and chopped cilantro.
8. roll up the tortillas, tucking in the sides, and enjoy your delicious mexican steak fajitas.
ingredients_list: flank, steak, olive, lime, clove, garlic, minced, chili, powder, smoked, paprika, cumin, oregano, salt, black, pepper, red, bell, pepper, green, bell, pepper, onion, flour, tortilla, topping, sour, cream, guacamole, salsa, shredded, cheese, cilantro

title: Thai Basil Chicken Stir
raw_text: 93. Thai Basil Chicken Stir-Fry: 400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains soy (origin: Thailand)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, thinly sliced
- 4 garlic cloves, minced
- 2 thai chili peppers, thinly sliced (optional for spiciness)
- 1 onion, sliced
- 1 bell pepper, sliced
- 1 cup basil leaves
- 2 tablespoons oyster sauce
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon fish sauce
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- jasmine rice, cooked for serving
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
2. add the minced garlic and thai chili peppers (if using) and stir-fry for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
3. add the sliced chicken breasts and stir-fry for about 4-5 minutes until cooked through and browned.
4. add the sliced onions and bell peppers to the skillet and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes until they begin to soften.
5. in a small bowl, mix together the oyster sauce, soy sauce, fish sauce, and sugar until well combined.
6. pour the sauce mixture into the skillet and stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes until everything is well coated.
7. finally, add the basil leaves to the skillet and stir-fry for another 1 minute until they wilt.
8. remove from heat and serve the thai basil chicken stir-fry over cooked jasmine rice. enjoy!
ingredients_list: vegetable, boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, thinly, garlic, clove, minced, thai, chili, pepper, thinly, spiciness, onion, bell, pepper, basil, leaf, oyster, sauce, soy, sauce, fish, sauce, sugar, jasmine, rice

title: Mexican Chicken Pozole
raw_text: 97. Mexican Chicken Pozole: 400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten (origin: Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 pounds chicken thighs, bone-in
- 4 cups chicken broth
- 2 cups water
- 1 onion, chopped
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 cans (15 ounces each) white hominy, drained and rinsed
- 1 can (14.5 ounces) diced tomatoes, undrained
- 2 tablespoons chili powder
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- salt and pepper, to taste
- toppings: chopped fresh cilantro, diced avocado, sliced radishes, lime wedges, shredded cabbage, and tortilla chips
preparation:
1. in a large pot, combine the chicken thighs, chicken broth, water, chopped onion, and minced garlic. bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
2. reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for about 1 hour or until the chicken is cooked through and tender.
3. remove the chicken thighs from the pot and let them cool slightly. once cooled, shred the chicken meat using two forks.
4. return the shredded chicken to the pot and add the drained hominy, diced tomatoes (with their juices), chili powder, dried oregano, and ground cumin. season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. stir well to combine all the ingredients. simmer the pozole for an additional 15-20 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
6. serve the mexican chicken pozole hot, garnished with your choice of chopped fresh cilantro, diced avocado, sliced radishes, lime wedges, shredded cabbage, and tortilla chips. enjoy!
ingredients_list: pound, chicken, thigh, bone, chicken, broth, water, onion, clove, garlic, minced, can, ounce, white, hominy, ounce, tomato, chili, powder, dried, oregano, ground, cumin, salt, pepper, taste, topping, fresh, cilantro, avocado, radish, lime, wedge, shredded, cabbage, tortilla, chip

title: Grilled Salmon with Mango Salsa
raw_text: 2. Grilled Salmon with Mango Salsa: 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains fish and citrus, origin: Caribbean
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 salmon fillets
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 ripe mango, peeled and diced
- 1/2 red bell pepper, diced
- 1/4 red onion, finely diced
- 1 jalapeno, seeded and minced
- 2 tablespoons fresh cilantro, chopped
- juice of 1 lime
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
2. season the salmon fillets with salt and pepper.
3. drizzle olive oil over the salmon fillets and rub it in to coat.
4. in a medium bowl, combine the diced mango, red bell pepper, red onion, jalapeno, cilantro, lime juice, salt, and pepper. mix well to combine.
5. place the seasoned salmon fillets on the preheated grill. cook for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
6. remove the grilled salmon from the heat and serve hot with the mango salsa on top.
7. garnish with additional cilantro, if desired. enjoy!
ingredients_list: salmon, fillet, salt, pepper, taste, olive, mango, red, bell, pepper, red, onion, jalapeno, seeded, minced, fresh, cilantro, lime, salt, pepper, taste

title: Beef Stir Fry with Vegetables
raw_text: 6. Beef Stir Fry with Vegetables: 500 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains soy, origin: China
ingredients:
ingredients:

- 1 lb beef (sliced into thin strips)
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 2 garlic cloves (minced)
- 1 onion (sliced)
- 1 bell pepper (sliced)
- 1 cup broccoli florets
- 1 carrot (julienned)
- 1 cup snow peas
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon oyster sauce
- 1 teaspoon cornstarch
- salt and pepper to taste
- cooked rice (for serving)
preparation:
1. in a large skillet or wok, heat the vegetable oil over high heat.
2. add the beef strips and cook for 2-3 minutes or until browned. remove from skillet and set aside.
3. in the same skillet, add the minced garlic and sliced onion. stir fry for 2 minutes.
4. add the bell pepper, broccoli, carrot, and snow peas to the skillet. cook for 3-4 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
5. in a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce, oyster sauce, and cornstarch. pour the sauce over the vegetables and stir well to coat.
6. return the cooked beef to the skillet and stir fry for an additional 2 minutes, or until everything is heated through.
7. season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. serve the beef stir fry with vegetables over cooked rice.

enjoy your delicious beef stir fry with vegetables!
ingredients_list: beef, strip, vegetable, garlic, clove, minced, onion, bell, pepper, broccoli, floret, carrot, pea, soy, sauce, oyster, sauce, cornstarch, salt, pepper, taste, rice

title: Veggie Burger with Avocado Mayo
raw_text: 12. Veggie Burger with Avocado Mayo: 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and soy, origin: United States
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup cooked quinoa
- 1 can black beans, rinsed and drained
- 1/2 cup breadcrumbs
- 1/4 cup chopped red onion
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 teaspoon cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon chili powder
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 4 burger buns
- lettuce leaves
- tomato slices
- red onion slices

for the avocado mayo:
- 1 ripe avocado
- 2 tablespoons mayonnaise
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, mash the black beans with a fork until mostly smooth.
2. add the cooked quinoa, breadcrumbs, chopped red onion, minced garlic, cumin, paprika, salt, black pepper, and chili powder to the bowl with the black beans. mix well to combine.
3. divide the mixture into 4 equal portions and shape each portion into a patty.
4. heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. cook the patties for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until golden brown and crispy.
5. while the patties are cooking, prepare the avocado mayo by mashing the avocado in a bowl until smooth. stir in the mayonnaise, lemon juice, salt, and black pepper. mix until well combined.
6. toast the burger buns if desired. spread a generous amount of avocado mayo on the bottom half of each bun.
7. place a veggie burger patty on top of the avocado mayo, followed by lettuce leaves, tomato slices, and red onion slices.
8. top each burger with the remaining bun half and serve immediately. enjoy your veggie burger with avocado mayo!
ingredients_list: quinoa, black, bean, breadcrumb, red, onion, clove, garlic, minced, cumin, paprika, salt, black, pepper, chili, powder, olive, burger, bun, lettuce, leaf, tomato, red, onion, avocado, mayo, avocado, mayonnaise, lemon, salt, black, pepper

title: Teriyaki Beef Stir Fry
raw_text: 17. Teriyaki Beef Stir Fry: 400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains soy, origin: Japan
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 lb beef, thinly sliced
- 1/2 cup soy sauce
- 1/4 cup brown sugar
- 2 tablespoons honey
- 2 tablespoons rice vinegar
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon ginger, grated
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 onion, thinly sliced
- 1 cup broccoli florets
- 1 carrot, julienned
- rice or noodles, for serving
preparation:
1. in a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, brown sugar, honey, rice vinegar, minced garlic, grated ginger, and cornstarch until well combined. set aside.
2. heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
3. add the sliced beef to the hot skillet and cook until browned, about 2-3 minutes. remove the beef from the skillet and set aside.
4. in the same skillet, add bell pepper, onion, broccoli, and carrot. stir fry for about 3-4 minutes, or until vegetables are crisp-tender.
5. return the beef to the skillet with the vegetables.
6. pour the teriyaki sauce over the beef and vegetables, stirring well to coat.
7. continue cooking for another 2-3 minutes, until the sauce thickens and coats the stir fry.
8. remove from heat and serve hot over rice or noodles. enjoy!
ingredients_list: beef, thinly, soy, sauce, brown, sugar, honey, rice, vinegar, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, cornstarch, vegetable, bell, pepper, thinly, onion, thinly, broccoli, floret, carrot, rice, noodle

title: Indonesian Chicken Satay
raw_text: 20. Indonesian Chicken Satay: 600 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains peanuts, origin: Indonesia
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons lime juice
- 2 tablespoons honey
- 1 tablespoon minced garlic
- 1 tablespoon minced ginger
- 1 tablespoon ground coriander
- 1 tablespoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon turmeric
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- salt, to taste
- wooden skewers, soaked in water
preparation:
1. cut the chicken breasts into long, thin strips and set aside.
2. in a bowl, combine vegetable oil, soy sauce, lime juice, honey, minced garlic, minced ginger, ground coriander, ground cumin, turmeric, chili powder, and salt to make the marinade.
3. add the chicken strips to the marinade, ensuring they are evenly coated. allow the chicken to marinate for at least 2 hours, but preferably overnight.
4. preheat the grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.
5. thread the marinated chicken strips onto the soaked wooden skewers, making sure to leave enough space for holding the skewers.
6. grill the chicken skewers for about 6-8 minutes per side, or until cooked through and slightly charred.
7. serve the indonesian chicken satay hot with peanut sauce or any desired dipping sauce. enjoy!
ingredients_list: pound, boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, vegetable, soy, sauce, lime, honey, minced, garlic, minced, ginger, ground, coriander, ground, cumin, turmeric, chili, powder, salt, taste, wooden, skewer, soaked, water

title: Stuffed Bell Peppers with Ground Turkey
raw_text: 21. Stuffed Bell Peppers with Ground Turkey: 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: United States
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 bell peppers (any color)
- 1 pound ground turkey
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 cup cooked rice
- 1 cup shredded cheese (cheddar or mozzarella)
- 1 cup tomato sauce
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes.
3. place the bell peppers in a baking dish and set aside.
4. in a skillet, cook the ground turkey over medium heat until browned. remove from heat and set aside.
5. in the same skillet, sauté the diced onion and minced garlic until the onion is translucent.
6. add the cooked ground turkey back to the skillet and mix well.
7. stir in the cooked rice, shredded cheese, tomato sauce, dried basil, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. mix until well combined.
8. spoon the turkey and rice mixture into each bell pepper until they are full.
9. place the bell peppers in the preheated oven and bake for approximately 25-30 minutes or until the peppers are tender and the filling is heated through.
10. remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving.
11. optional: garnish with additional shredded cheese or chopped parsley before serving.
12. enjoy your stuffed bell peppers with ground turkey!
ingredients_list: bell, pepper, color, ground, turkey, onion, clove, garlic, minced, rice, shredded, cheese, cheddar, mozzarella, tomato, sauce, dried, basil, dried, oregano, salt, pepper, taste

title: Tofu Stir Fry with Black Bean Sauce
raw_text: 24. Tofu Stir Fry with Black Bean Sauce: 300 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains soy, origin: China
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 block of firm tofu, drained and cut into cubes
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 onion, sliced
- 1 bell pepper, sliced
- 1 zucchini, sliced
- 1 carrot, julienned
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons black bean sauce
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 1/2 cup vegetable broth
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons water
- salt and pepper to taste
- optional: chopped green onions for garnish
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
2. add the tofu cubes to the skillet and cook for about 5 minutes, until golden brown on all sides. remove the tofu from the skillet and set aside.
3. in the same skillet, add the sliced onion, bell pepper, zucchini, and carrot. cook for 2-3 minutes until the vegetables are slightly softened.
4. add the minced garlic to the skillet and cook for an additional 1 minute.
5. in a small bowl, whisk together the black bean sauce, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, and vegetable broth. pour the sauce into the skillet with the vegetables.
6. return the tofu to the skillet and stir to coat everything in the sauce. cook for 2-3 minutes until the sauce has thickened slightly.
7. add the cornstarch-water mixture to the skillet and stir well. this will help thicken the sauce further.
8. season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. remove from heat and garnish with chopped green onions if desired.
10. serve the tofu stir fry with black bean sauce over steamed rice or noodles. enjoy!
ingredients_list: tofu, cube, vegetable, onion, bell, pepper, zucchini, carrot, clove, garlic, minced, black, bean, sauce, soy, sauce, rice, vinegar, sugar, vegetable, broth, cornstarch, water, salt, pepper, taste, green, onion, garnish

title: Spanish Tortilla (Potato Omelette)
raw_text: 25. Spanish Tortilla (Potato Omelette): 400 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains eggs, origin: Spain
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 medium potatoes
- 1 onion
- 6 large eggs
- salt, to taste
- olive oil, for frying
preparation:
1. peel the potatoes and cut them into thin slices.
2. dice the onion into small pieces.
3. in a large frying pan, heat enough olive oil to cover the bottom of the pan.
4. add the potatoes and onion to the pan and fry over medium heat until the potatoes are cooked and slightly golden. stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
5. in a separate bowl, beat the eggs and season with salt.
6. once the potatoes and onion are cooked, remove them from the pan using a slotted spoon to drain excess oil.
7. add the potatoes and onion to the bowl with the beaten eggs. mix gently to combine.
8. in the same frying pan, remove most of the oil, leaving only a small amount.
9. pour the potato and egg mixture into the pan, spreading it evenly.
10. cook over low heat for about 5-7 minutes or until the bottom is set and golden.
11. flip the tortilla by placing a plate over the pan and flipping it carefully. then slide the uncooked side of the tortilla back into the pan.
12. cook for another 5-7 minutes until the other side is set and golden.
13. remove the tortilla from the heat and let it rest for a few minutes before cutting into slices.
14. serve warm or at room temperature and enjoy your spanish tortilla!
ingredients_list: potato, onion, egg, salt, taste, olive

title: Thai Green Curry with Chicken
raw_text: 26. Thai Green Curry with Chicken: 450 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat, origin: Thailand
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
- 1 green bell pepper, sliced
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 onion, sliced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon ginger, grated
- 1 can (14 ounces) coconut milk
- 2 tablespoons green curry paste
- 1 tablespoon fish sauce
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1 tablespoon lime juice
- 1 cup fresh basil leaves
- salt, to taste
- cooked jasmine rice, for serving
preparation:
1. heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
2. add the chicken and cook until browned on all sides. remove from skillet and set aside.
3. in the same skillet, add the bell peppers, onion, garlic, and ginger. cook until the vegetables are slightly softened.
4. in a small bowl, mix together the coconut milk, green curry paste, fish sauce, sugar, and lime juice. pour the mixture into the skillet with the vegetables.
5. bring the mixture to a simmer and add the cooked chicken. stir to combine.
6. let the curry simmer for about 10 minutes to allow the flavors to come together.
7. stir in the basil leaves and season with salt to taste.
8. serve the thai green curry with chicken over cooked jasmine rice. enjoy!
ingredients_list: vegetable, boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, piece, green, bell, pepper, red, bell, pepper, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, ounce, coconut, milk, green, curry, paste, fish, sauce, sugar, lime, fresh, basil, leaf, salt, taste, jasmine, rice

title: Hawaiian Grilled Shrimp Skewers
raw_text: 35. Hawaiian Grilled Shrimp Skewers: 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains shellfish, origin: United States
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- 1/4 cup pineapple juice
- 2 tablespoons brown sugar
- 2 tablespoons ketchup
- 2 tablespoons rice vinegar
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon grated ginger
- pineapple chunks, for skewers
- bell peppers, cut into chunks, for skewers
- red onion, cut into chunks, for skewers
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. in a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, pineapple juice, brown sugar, ketchup, rice vinegar, vegetable oil, garlic, and ginger to make the marinade.
2. place shrimp in a plastic bag, pour marinade over shrimp, and seal the bag. let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
3. preheat grill to medium-high heat.
4. thread shrimp onto skewers, alternating with pineapple chunks, bell peppers, and red onion.
5. season skewers with salt and pepper.
6. grease the grill grates and place the skewers on the preheated grill.
7. cook for about 2-3 minutes per side, or until the shrimp are opaque and cooked through.
8. remove skewers from the grill and serve hot.
9. optional: serve with rice and garnish with chopped cilantro or green onions.

enjoy your hawaiian grilled shrimp skewers!
ingredients_list: shrimp, deveined, soy, sauce, pineapple, brown, sugar, ketchup, rice, vinegar, vegetable, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, pineapple, skewer, bell, pepper, skewer, red, onion, skewer, salt, pepper, taste

title: Teriyaki Salmon
raw_text: 39. Teriyaki Salmon: 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains fish and soy, origin: Japan
ingredients:
ingredients for teriyaki salmon:
- 4 salmon fillets
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- 1/4 cup mirin (japanese sweet rice wine)
- 2 tablespoons brown sugar
- 1 tablespoon honey
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon grated ginger
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- sesame seeds (optional)
- green onions, chopped (optional)
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, mix together soy sauce, mirin, brown sugar, honey, garlic, and ginger to make the teriyaki sauce.
2. place the salmon fillets in a shallow dish and pour half of the teriyaki sauce over them. allow the salmon to marinate for at least 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
3. heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
4. remove the salmon fillets from the marinade, reserving the marinade. add the salmon to the skillet and cook for about 4-5 minutes on each side, or until cooked to your desired level of doneness.
5. in a small saucepan, bring the reserved marinade to a boil. reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
6. once the salmon is cooked, remove it from the skillet and brush with the thickened teriyaki sauce.
7. serve the teriyaki salmon hot, garnished with sesame seeds and chopped green onions if desired.
8. enjoy your delicious teriyaki salmon!
ingredients_list: salmon, fillet, soy, sauce, mirin, japanese, sweet, rice, wine, brown, sugar, honey, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, vegetable, sesame, seed, green, onion

title: Caprese Stuffed Chicken Breast
raw_text: 40. Caprese Stuffed Chicken Breast: 500 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: Italy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 4 slices of fresh mozzarella cheese
- 1 large tomato, sliced
- 10-12 fresh basil leaves
- salt and black pepper, to taste
- olive oil, for cooking
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. slice the chicken breasts in half horizontally, through the middle, to create a pocket for the stuffing.
3. season the chicken breasts with salt and black pepper on both sides.
4. stuff each chicken breast with 2 slices of mozzarella cheese, tomato slices, and a few basil leaves.
5. secure the stuffed chicken breasts with toothpicks to hold the fillings in place.
6. heat a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat and add olive oil.
7. place the stuffed chicken breasts in the skillet, and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side until browned.
8. transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for about 20 minutes or until the chicken is fully cooked and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.
10. remove the toothpicks, slice the chicken breasts, and serve hot.
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, fresh, mozzarella, cheese, tomato, fresh, basil, leaf, salt, black, pepper, taste, olive

title: Beef and Broccoli Stir Fry
raw_text: 43. Beef and Broccoli Stir Fry: 400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains soy, origin: China
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 lb beef sirloin, thinly sliced
- 2 cups broccoli florets
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons oyster sauce
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ginger, grated
- 1/2 teaspoon sesame oil
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, oyster sauce, cornstarch, and sesame oil. set aside.
2. heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
3. add minced garlic and grated ginger to the skillet, and sauté for about 1 minute until fragrant.
4. add beef slices to the skillet and cook until browned, stirring occasionally.
5. once the beef is cooked, remove it from the skillet and set aside.
6. in the same skillet, add the broccoli florets and cook for 3-4 minutes until tender-crisp.
7. return the cooked beef to the skillet with the broccoli.
8. pour the sauce mixture over the beef and broccoli, stirring continuously until the sauce thickens and coats the ingredients.
9. season with salt and pepper to taste.
10. cook for an additional minute to ensure everything is heated through.
11. remove from heat and serve the beef and broccoli stir fry over steamed rice or noodles.
enjoy your delicious stir fry!
ingredients_list: beef, sirloin, thinly, broccoli, floret, soy, sauce, oyster, sauce, cornstarch, vegetable, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, sesame, salt, pepper, taste

title: Lemon Garlic Shrimp Pasta
raw_text: 50. Lemon Garlic Shrimp Pasta: 450 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains shellfish and wheat, origin: Italy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 ounces of spaghetti
- 1 pound of large shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 4 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- 1 lemon, juiced and zested
- 1/4 cup of chicken broth
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh parsley, chopped for garnish
preparation:
1. cook the spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.
2. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute until fragrant.
3. add the shrimp to the skillet and season with salt and pepper. cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side until the shrimp turns pink and opaque.
4. remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
5. in the same skillet, add the chicken broth and lemon juice. bring to a simmer.
6. add the cooked spaghetti to the skillet and toss to coat it with the lemon broth.
7. return the shrimp to the skillet and toss everything together for about 1-2 minutes until heated through.
8. remove from heat and garnish with lemon zest and fresh parsley.
9. serve hot and enjoy your lemon garlic shrimp pasta!
ingredients_list: ounce, spaghetti, shrimp, deveined, clove, garlic, minced, olive, lemon, zested, chicken, broth, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Fish Tacos with Lime Crema
raw_text: 54. Fish Tacos with Lime Crema: 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains fish and dairy, origin: Mexico
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound white fish fillets (such as cod or tilapia)
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup cornmeal
- vegetable oil, for frying
- 8 small corn tortillas
- shredded lettuce, for serving
- chopped fresh cilantro, for garnish
- lime wedges, for serving

for the lime crema:
- 1/2 cup sour cream
- 2 tablespoons mayonnaise
- zest and juice of 1 lime
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c). wrap the tortillas in aluminum foil and place them in the oven to warm while preparing the rest of the recipe.

2. in a small bowl, combine the cumin, paprika, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. pat dry the fish fillets and season them with the spice mixture on both sides.

3. in a shallow dish or bowl, mix together the all-purpose flour and cornmeal. dredge each seasoned fish fillet in the flour-cornmeal mixture, pressing gently to adhere.

4. heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. fry the fish fillets until golden and crispy, about 3-4 minutes per side. remove from the skillet and set aside on a plate lined with paper towels to absorb any excess oil. once cooled slightly, break the fish into smaller pieces.

5. to prepare the lime crema, whisk together the sour cream, mayonnaise, lime zest, lime juice, salt, and pepper in a bowl until well combined.

6. place the warm tortillas on a serving platter. layer each tortilla with shredded lettuce, a few pieces of fried fish, and a dollop of lime crema.

7. garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve immediately with lime wedges on the side.

enjoy your delicious fish tacos with lime crema!
ingredients_list: white, fish, fillet, cod, tilapia, ground, cumin, paprika, garlic, powder, cayenne, pepper, salt, pepper, taste, flour, cornmeal, vegetable, corn, tortilla, shredded, lettuce, fresh, cilantro, garnish, lime, wedge, lime, crema, sour, cream, mayonnaise, zest, lime, salt, pepper, taste

title: Teriyaki Tofu Stir Fry
raw_text: 56. Teriyaki Tofu Stir Fry: 300 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains soy, origin: Japan
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 block of firm tofu, drained and cut into cubes
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons honey or maple syrup
- 2 tablespoons rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon sesame oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon ginger, grated
- 1 bell pepper, sliced
- 1 carrot, sliced
- 1 small onion, sliced
- 1 cup broccoli florets
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 2 tablespoons water
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- sesame seeds, for garnish
- cooked rice, for serving
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, honey or maple syrup, rice vinegar, sesame oil, minced garlic, and grated ginger to make the teriyaki sauce. set aside.
2. in a large skillet or wok, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. add tofu cubes and cook until golden brown on all sides. remove tofu from the skillet and set aside.
3. in the same skillet, add the sliced bell pepper, carrot, onion, and broccoli florets. stir-fry for about 5 minutes until the vegetables are slightly tender.
4. return the tofu to the skillet with the vegetables and pour the teriyaki sauce over them. stir well to coat everything in the sauce.
5. in a small bowl, mix cornstarch and water together to create a slurry. pour the slurry into the skillet and stir continuously until the sauce thickens.
6. remove from heat and garnish with sesame seeds.
7. serve the teriyaki tofu stir-fry over cooked rice. enjoy!
