ingredients_list: tofu, cube, soy, sauce, honey, maple, syrup, rice, vinegar, sesame, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, bell, pepper, carrot, onion, broccoli, floret, cornstarch, water, vegetable, sesame, seed, garnish, rice

title: Cuban Mojo Roast Pork
raw_text: 57. Cuban Mojo Roast Pork: 500 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains pork, origin: Cuba
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 lbs pork shoulder
- 8 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 cup orange juice
- 1/2 cup lime juice
- 1/4 cup olive oil
- 2 teaspoons dried oregano
- 2 teaspoons ground cumin
- 2 teaspoons salt
- 1 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, combine the minced garlic, orange juice, lime juice, olive oil, oregano, cumin, salt, pepper, and thyme.
2. place the pork shoulder in a large resealable plastic bag and pour the marinade over it. make sure the pork is evenly coated. close the bag and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours, or overnight if possible.
3. preheat the oven to 325°f (160°c). 
4. remove the pork shoulder from the marinade, reserving the marinade to use later. 
5. place the pork shoulder on a roasting pan or a baking dish with a rack and roast for approximately 3 to 4 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°f (74°c). 
6. every 30 minutes, baste the pork with the reserved marinade to keep it moist and flavorful. 
7. once cooked, remove the pork from the oven and let it rest for 10 minutes before slicing. 
8. serve the cuban mojo roast pork with the pan juices and any remaining marinade as a dipping sauce. enjoy!
ingredients_list: pork, shoulder, garlic, clove, minced, orange, lime, olive, dried, oregano, ground, cumin, salt, black, pepper, dried, thyme

title: Italian Stuffed Zucchini
raw_text: 61. Italian Stuffed Zucchini: 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: Italy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 medium zucchini
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 pound ground italian sausage
- 1 cup diced onion
- 1 cup diced bell pepper
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 cup marinara sauce
- 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. slice the zucchini lengthwise and scoop out the insides to create boats. set aside.
3. heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
4. add the italian sausage, onion, bell pepper, garlic, oregano, basil, salt, and black pepper to the skillet. cook until the sausage is browned and the vegetables are softened.
5. drain any excess fat from the skillet.
6. stir in the marinara sauce and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
7. place the zucchini boats in a baking dish and fill with the sausage mixture.
8. top each boat with shredded mozzarella and grated parmesan cheese.
9. cover the baking dish with foil and bake for 20 minutes.
10. remove the foil and bake for an additional 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
11. serve hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: zucchini, olive, ground, italian, sausage, onion, bell, pepper, clove, garlic, minced, dried, oregano, dried, basil, salt, black, pepper, marinara, sauce, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, parmesan, cheese

title: Bulgur Salad
raw_text: 66. Bulgur Salad: 250 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten, origin: Mediterranean
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup bulgur
- 2 cups water
- 1 cucumber, peeled and chopped
- 1 tomato, chopped
- 1 red bell pepper, chopped
- 1/2 red onion, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped
- 1/4 cup fresh mint leaves, chopped
- juice of 1 lemon
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and black pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a medium pot, bring the water to a boil. add the bulgur and reduce heat to low. cover and simmer for 10-12 minutes, or until the bulgur is tender and has absorbed all the water. remove from heat and let it cool.
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked bulgur, cucumber, tomato, red bell pepper, red onion, parsley, and mint leaves.
3. in a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and black pepper.
4. pour the dressing over the bulgur salad and toss well to combine.
5. taste and adjust the seasoning if needed.
6. cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to allow the flavors to meld.
7. serve chilled and enjoy!
ingredients_list: bulgur, water, cucumber, tomato, red, bell, pepper, red, onion, fresh, parsley, fresh, mint, leaf, lemon, olive, salt, black, pepper, taste

title: Mediterranean Lentil Salad
raw_text: 70. Mediterranean Lentil Salad: 300 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains legumes, origin: Mediterranean
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup dried green lentils
- 2 cups water
- 1 cucumber, diced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 small red onion, thinly sliced
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1/2 cup kalamata olives, pitted and halved
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh mint
- 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. rinse the lentils under cold water.
2. in a medium saucepan, bring water to a boil and add the lentils.
3. reduce heat to low and simmer for about 20-25 minutes or until the lentils are tender.
4. drain any excess water and let the lentils cool.
5. in a large mixing bowl, combine the cooled lentils, cucumber, red bell pepper, red onion, cherry tomatoes, kalamata olives, parsley, mint, and feta cheese.
6. in a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and pepper.
7. pour the dressing over the lentil mixture and toss until everything is well coated.
8. allow the salad to sit for at least 15 minutes before serving to let the flavors meld together.
9. serve chilled or at room temperature. enjoy!
ingredients_list: dried, green, lentil, water, cucumber, red, bell, pepper, red, onion, thinly, cherry, tomato, halved, kalamata, olive, pitted, halved, fresh, parsley, fresh, mint, feta, cheese, virgin, olive, lemon, clove, garlic, minced, salt, pepper, taste

title: Beef and Snow Pea Stir Fry
raw_text: 72. Beef and Snow Pea Stir Fry: 400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains soy, origin: China
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 lb beef (sliced into thin strips)
- 2 cups snow peas (ends trimmed)
- 1 red bell pepper (sliced)
- 1 small onion (sliced)
- 2 cloves garlic (minced)
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons oyster sauce
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 1 tablespoon sesame oil
- 1 teaspoon ginger (minced)
- 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes (optional)
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, oyster sauce, cornstarch, sesame oil, ginger, and red pepper flakes (if using). set aside.
2. heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
3. add beef to the skillet and season with salt and pepper. cook until browned and cooked through, about 4-5 minutes. remove beef from the skillet and set aside.
4. in the same skillet, add onion and garlic. cook for 2-3 minutes until onion becomes translucent.
5. add snow peas and bell pepper to the skillet. stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until vegetables become crisp-tender.
6. return the cooked beef to the skillet. pour the sauce mixture over the beef and vegetables.
7. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens and coats the beef and vegetables.
8. serve the beef and snow pea stir fry over steamed rice or noodles. enjoy!
ingredients_list: beef, strip, pea, end, red, bell, pepper, onion, clove, garlic, minced, soy, sauce, oyster, sauce, cornstarch, sesame, ginger, minced, red, pepper, flake, vegetable, salt, pepper, taste

title: Tofu Pad Kra Pao
raw_text: 76. Tofu Pad Kra Pao: 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains soy, origin: Thailand
ingredients:
ingredients for tofu pad kra pao:
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 12 ounces firm tofu, cubed
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 fresh thai chilies, finely chopped (adjust quantity to taste)
- 1 cup basil leaves, loosely packed
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon oyster sauce
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 1 teaspoon fish sauce
- 1/4 cup water
preparation:
1. heat vegetable oil in a large pan or wok over medium heat.
2. add minced garlic and chopped thai chilies to the pan and cook for about 1 minute until fragrant.
3. increase the heat to medium-high and add the cubed tofu to the pan. stir-fry for about 5-6 minutes until the tofu is slightly golden and crispy.
4. in a small bowl, mix together soy sauce, oyster sauce, sugar, fish sauce, and water. stir well until the sugar dissolves.
5. pour the sauce mixture into the pan with tofu and stir to coat the tofu evenly.
6. lower the heat to medium-low and let the tofu simmer in the sauce for about 2-3 minutes, allowing it to absorb the flavors.
7. add the basil leaves to the pan and gently stir to combine. cook for an additional 1-2 minutes until the basil leaves wilt.
8. remove from heat and serve the tofu pad kra pao hot with steamed rice or noodles.

enjoy your tofu pad kra pao!
ingredients_list: vegetable, ounce, tofu, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, thai, chilies, taste, basil, leaf, soy, sauce, oyster, sauce, sugar, fish, sauce, water

title: Chicken Shawarma Pita
raw_text: 78. Chicken Shawarma Pita: 600 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains wheat, origin: Middle East
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground paprika
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 pita pockets
- toppings of your choice:
  - sliced tomatoes
  - sliced cucumbers
  - chopped lettuce
  - thinly sliced red onion
  - tzatziki sauce or garlic sauce
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, cumin, paprika, coriander, turmeric, cinnamon, salt, and pepper. mix well to make the marinade.
2. slice the chicken breasts into thin strips and add them to the marinade. stir well to coat the chicken evenly. let it marinate for at least 30 minutes or refrigerate overnight for best results.
3. heat a pan over medium-high heat and add a little olive oil. once the pan is hot, add the marinated chicken strips and cook for about 5-7 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and slightly browned.
4. while the chicken is cooking, warm the pita pockets in a toaster oven or on a stovetop pan until they are soft and pliable.
5. once the chicken is cooked, assemble the shawarma pitas. open each pita pocket and spread a tablespoon of tzatziki sauce or garlic sauce inside.
6. add a handful of sliced tomatoes, cucumbers, lettuce, and red onion to each pita.
7. finally, add a generous portion of the cooked chicken shawarma to each pita.
8. fold the pita pockets in half and serve immediately. enjoy your delicious chicken shawarma pita!
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, olive, lemon, clove, garlic, minced, ground, cumin, ground, paprika, ground, coriander, ground, turmeric, ground, cinnamon, salt, pepper, taste, pita, pocket, topping, tomato, cucumber, lettuce, thinly, red, onion, tzatziki, sauce, garlic, sauce

title: Sweet and Sour Shrimp
raw_text: 80. Sweet and Sour Shrimp: 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains shellfish, origin: China
ingredients:
sure! here's the recipe for sweet and sour shrimp:

ingredients:
- 1 pound shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 1/2 cup pineapple chunks
- 1/2 cup bell peppers, cut into chunks
- 1/2 cup onion, cut into chunks
- 1/4 cup ketchup
- 1/4 cup rice vinegar
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons brown sugar
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 1 teaspoon grated ginger
- 1 teaspoon minced garlic
- vegetable oil, for cooking
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, whisk together ketchup, rice vinegar, soy sauce, brown sugar, cornstarch, grated ginger, and minced garlic. set aside.
2. in a large skillet or wok, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
3. add shrimp to the hot pan. season with salt and pepper, and cook until they turn pink and are cooked through, about 2-3 minutes. remove the shrimp from the pan and set aside.
4. in the same pan, add more oil if needed, then add bell peppers and onion. stir-fry for about 2-3 minutes until they start to soften.
5. add pineapple chunks and cook for another minute.
6. pour the sweet and sour sauce mixture over the vegetables in the pan.
7. bring the sauce to a simmer, stirring constantly until it thickens and coats the vegetables.
8. return the cooked shrimp to the pan and toss to coat them with the sauce.
9. cook for an additional minute or until everything is heated through.
10. serve the sweet and sour shrimp over steamed rice or noodles. enjoy!

note: you can adjust the sweetness and tanginess to your preference by adding more or less sugar and vinegar.
ingredients_list: sweet, sour, shrimp, shrimp, deveined, pineapple, bell, pepper, onion, ketchup, rice, vinegar, soy, sauce, brown, sugar, cornstarch, ginger, minced, garlic, vegetable, salt, pepper, taste

title: Spanish Empanadas
raw_text: 87. Spanish Empanadas: 450 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains wheat, origin: Spain
ingredients:
ingredients for spanish empanadas:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, cold and cubed
- 1/4 cup ice water
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 red bell pepper, finely chopped
- 1/2 green bell pepper, finely chopped
- 1/2 cup cooked ham, finely chopped
- 1/2 cup cooked chicken, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup pitted green olives, chopped
- 1/4 cup raisins
- 2 teaspoons paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper to taste
- 2 hard-boiled eggs, chopped
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour and salt. add the cold, cubed butter and use a pastry blender or your fingers to cut the butter into the flour until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
2. add the ice water, one tablespoon at a time, and mix until the dough comes together. shape the dough into a disc, wrap it in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
3. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the onion and garlic, and sauté until softened.
4. add the red and green bell peppers, cooked ham, cooked chicken, green olives, raisins, paprika, dried oregano, salt, and pepper to the skillet. cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the mixture is well combined and heated through. remove from heat and let it cool.
5. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c). line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
6. on a lightly floured surface, roll out the chilled dough to about 1/8 inch thickness. use a round cutter or a glass to cut out circles from the dough, about 4-5 inches in diameter.
7. place a spoonful of the cooled filling onto each dough circle, leaving a small border. top with a few pieces of chopped hard-boiled egg.
8. fold the dough over the filling to create a semi-circle shape. use a fork to crimp the edges to seal the empanadas.
9. place the empanadas on the prepared baking sheet and brush the tops with beaten egg for a shiny finish (optional).
10. bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the empanadas are golden brown.
11. remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving. enjoy your homemade spanish empanadas!
ingredients_list: flour, salt, unsalted, butter, ice, water, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, red, bell, pepper, green, bell, pepper, ham, chicken, pitted, green, olive, raisin, paprika, dried, oregano, salt, pepper, taste, boiled, egg

title: Lebanese Tabbouleh
raw_text: 91. Lebanese Tabbouleh: 250 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains wheat, origin: Lebanon
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup bulgur wheat
- 1 ½ cups water
- 2 cups parsley, finely chopped
- ½ cup mint leaves, finely chopped
- 4 tomatoes, diced
- 2 cucumbers, diced
- 1 red onion, finely chopped
- 3 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 lemon, juiced
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. place the bulgur wheat in a bowl and pour the water over it. let it soak for about 30 minutes or until the water is completely absorbed.
2. fluff the bulgur wheat with a fork and set aside.
3. in a large mixing bowl, combine the parsley, mint leaves, tomatoes, cucumbers, and red onion.
4. add the soaked bulgur wheat to the bowl and mix well.
5. drizzle the olive oil and lemon juice over the mixture and season with salt and pepper.
6. toss everything together until all the ingredients are evenly coated.
7. let the tabbouleh sit for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
8. serve chilled and enjoy!
ingredients_list: bulgur, wheat, water, parsley, mint, leaf, tomato, cucumber, red, onion, olive, lemon, salt, pepper, taste

title: Grilled Steak with Chimichurri Sauce
raw_text: 9. Grilled Steak with Chimichurri Sauce: 600 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains garlic, origin: Argentina
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 1/2 pounds of steak (such as ribeye or sirloin)
- 1/4 cup of olive oil 
- 2 tablespoons of red wine vinegar 
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced 
- 1/4 cup of fresh parsley, finely chopped 
- 2 tablespoons of fresh oregano, finely chopped 
- 2 tablespoons of fresh cilantro, finely chopped 
- 1 teaspoon of red pepper flakes 
- salt and pepper to taste 

for the chimichurri sauce:
- 1/2 cup of olive oil 
- 1/4 cup of red wine vinegar 
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced 
- 1/4 cup of fresh parsley, finely chopped 
- 2 tablespoons of fresh oregano, finely chopped 
- 2 tablespoons of fresh cilantro, finely chopped 
- 1 teaspoon of red pepper flakes 
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, combine olive oil, red wine vinegar, minced garlic, parsley, oregano, cilantro, red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper. stir well to combine. this will be used as the marinade for the steak.
2. place the steak in a shallow dish and pour the marinade over it, making sure to coat both sides. cover the dish and let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour, or overnight for best results.
3. preheat the grill to medium-high heat. remove the steak from the marinade and discard any excess marinade.
4. grill the steak for about 4-5 minutes per side for medium-rare, or adjust the cooking time to your desired doneness. cooking time may vary depending on the thickness of the steak. 
5. while the steak is grilling, prepare the chimichurri sauce. in a separate bowl, combine olive oil, red wine vinegar, minced garlic, parsley, oregano, cilantro, red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper. stir well to combine and let it sit for a few minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
6. once the steak is cooked to your liking, remove it from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes. this allows the juices to redistribute and makes for a more flavorful steak.
7. slice the steak against the grain into thin strips. serve with a generous drizzle of chimichurri sauce on top. enjoy your grilled steak with chimichurri sauce!
ingredients_list: pound, steak, ribeye, sirloin, olive, red, wine, vinegar, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, parsley, fresh, oregano, fresh, cilantro, red, pepper, flake, salt, pepper, taste, chimichurri, sauce, olive, red, wine, vinegar, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, parsley, fresh, oregano, fresh, cilantro, red, pepper, flake, salt, pepper, taste

title: Beef Tacos with Salsa
raw_text: 13. Beef Tacos with Salsa: 450 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten, origin: Mexico
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound ground beef
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon oregano
- salt and pepper to taste
- 8 small flour or corn tortillas
- 1 cup salsa
- optional toppings: shredded cheese, diced tomatoes, lettuce, sour cream, guacamole
preparation:
1. in a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until browned. drain any excess fat.
2. add the diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet, and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the onion is translucent.
3. stir in the chili powder, cumin, oregano, salt, and pepper. cook for another 2 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
4. warm the tortillas in a skillet or microwave until soft and pliable.
5. spoon the beef mixture onto each tortilla, and top with salsa and any desired toppings.
6. fold the tortillas in half, and serve hot.

enjoy your delicious beef tacos with salsa!
ingredients_list: ground, beef, onion, clove, garlic, minced, chili, powder, cumin, oregano, salt, pepper, taste, flour, corn, tortilla, salsa, topping, shredded, cheese, tomato, lettuce, sour, cream, guacamole

title: Shrimp and Broccoli Stir
raw_text: 15. Shrimp and Broccoli Stir-Fry: 300 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains seafood, origin: Asian
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 1 pound shrimp, peeled and deveined 
- 2 cups broccoli florets 
- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced 
- 1 small onion, thinly sliced 
- 3 cloves garlic, minced 
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce 
- 1 tablespoon oyster sauce 
- 1 teaspoon cornstarch 
- 1/2 teaspoon sesame oil 
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil 
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, oyster sauce, cornstarch, and sesame oil. set aside. 
2. heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. 
3. add minced garlic and sauté for about 1 minute until fragrant. 
4. add shrimp and stir-fry for about 2-3 minutes until they turn pink and cooked through. 
5. remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside. 
6. in the same skillet, add sliced onions and bell peppers. stir-fry for about 2 minutes until slightly softened. 
7. add broccoli florets to the skillet and continue to stir-fry for another 3-4 minutes until the broccoli is bright green and tender-crisp. 
8. return the cooked shrimp to the skillet and pour in the sauce mixture. 
9. stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes until the sauce thickens and coats the shrimp and vegetables evenly. 
10. season with salt and pepper to taste. 
11. serve hot over steamed rice or noodles. enjoy!
ingredients_list: shrimp, deveined, broccoli, floret, red, bell, pepper, thinly, onion, thinly, clove, garlic, minced, soy, sauce, oyster, sauce, cornstarch, sesame, vegetable, salt, pepper, taste

title: Baked Lemon Herb Chicken
raw_text: 16. Baked Lemon Herb Chicken: 350 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, origin: Unknown
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 2 lemons
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 teaspoons dried thyme
- 1 teaspoon dried rosemary
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. place the chicken breasts in a baking dish.
3. squeeze the juice of one lemon over the chicken.
4. in a small bowl, combine the olive oil, minced garlic, dried thyme, dried rosemary, salt, and pepper.
5. drizzle the olive oil mixture over the chicken breasts, coating them evenly.
6. slice the second lemon into thin rounds and place them on top of the chicken breasts.
7. cover the baking dish with foil and bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
8. remove the foil for the last 5 minutes of baking to allow the chicken to brown slightly.
9. serve the baked lemon herb chicken with the pan juices poured over the top. enjoy!
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, lemon, olive, clove, garlic, minced, dried, thyme, dried, rosemary, salt, pepper, taste

title: Spaghetti Carbonara
raw_text: 17. Spaghetti Carbonara: 550 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains pork, origin: Italy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 ounces spaghetti
- 4 slices bacon, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 large eggs
- 1/2 cup parmesan cheese, grated
- salt and black pepper, to taste
- fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. cook spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.
2. in a large skillet, cook bacon over medium heat until crispy. remove bacon from skillet and set aside, leaving the bacon drippings in the skillet.
3. in the same skillet, sauté minced garlic in the bacon drippings until fragrant.
4. in a small bowl, whisk together eggs and parmesan cheese until well combined.
5. slowly pour the egg mixture into the skillet with the garlic, stirring constantly to prevent the eggs from scrambling.
6. add cooked spaghetti and crispy bacon to the skillet, tossing everything together until the pasta is well coated in the creamy egg sauce.
7. season with salt and black pepper to taste. continue to toss until the spaghetti is evenly coated and heated through.
8. remove from heat and garnish with fresh parsley. serve immediately. enjoy!
ingredients_list: ounce, spaghetti, bacon, clove, garlic, minced, egg, parmesan, cheese, salt, black, pepper, taste, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Spicy Thai Green Curry
raw_text: 26. Spicy Thai Green Curry: 500 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains shrimp, origin: Thailand
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 2 tablespoons thai green curry paste
- 1 can (14 ounces) coconut milk
- 1 cup chicken or vegetable broth
- 1 pound chicken (breast or thigh), sliced thinly
- 1 cup bell peppers, sliced
- 1 cup bamboo shoots
- 1 cup green beans, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces
- 1 tablespoon fish sauce
- 1 tablespoon brown sugar
- 1/2 cup thai basil leaves
- lime wedges, for serving
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
2. add the green curry paste and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
3. pour in the coconut milk and broth, stirring well to combine.
4. add the sliced chicken and cook for 5-7 minutes until cooked through.
5. stir in the bell peppers, bamboo shoots, and green beans. cook for another 3-4 minutes until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
6. add the fish sauce and brown sugar, stirring to combine. cook for an additional 2 minutes.
7. remove from heat and stir in the thai basil leaves.
8. serve hot with steamed rice or noodles, and lime wedges on the side. enjoy your spicy thai green curry!
ingredients_list: vegetable, thai, green, curry, paste, ounce, coconut, milk, chicken, vegetable, broth, chicken, breast, thigh, thinly, bell, pepper, bamboo, shoot, green, bean, piece, fish, sauce, brown, sugar, thai, basil, leaf, lime, wedge

title: Cheese and Spinach Ravioli
raw_text: 30. Cheese and Spinach Ravioli: 500 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, vegetarian, origin: Italy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 2 eggs
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup warm water
- 2 cups fresh spinach, washed and chopped
- 1 cup ricotta cheese
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1/4 cup butter
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the flour and salt. make a well in the center and crack the eggs into it. beat the eggs with a fork and gradually incorporate the flour until a dough forms.
2. knead the dough on a lightly floured surface for about 5 minutes until smooth and elastic. wrap the dough in plastic wrap and let it rest for 30 minutes.
3. in another bowl, combine the chopped spinach, ricotta cheese, parmesan cheese, black pepper, nutmeg, salt, and pepper. mix well until all the ingredients are evenly incorporated.
4. on a floured surface, roll out the dough into a thin sheet. cut the sheet into small squares, about 2 inches in size.
5. place a spoonful of the spinach and cheese mixture in the center of each square. fold the dough over the filling to form a triangle and press the edges together to seal the ravioli.
6. bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. carefully drop the ravioli into the boiling water and cook for about 3-4 minutes, or until they float to the surface.
7. while the ravioli are cooking, melt the butter in a small saucepan over low heat. add the chopped basil and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
8. use a slotted spoon to remove the cooked ravioli from the water and transfer them to a serving dish. drizzle the melted butter and basil sauce over the ravioli.
9. serve the cheese and spinach ravioli hot, optionally sprinkled with grated parmesan cheese. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, egg, salt, water, fresh, spinach, washed, ricotta, cheese, parmesan, cheese, black, pepper, nutmeg, butter, fresh, basil, salt, pepper, taste

title: Honey Mustard Glazed Salmon
raw_text: 34. Honey Mustard Glazed Salmon: 450 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains mustard, origin: Unknown
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 salmon fillets
- 1/4 cup dijon mustard
- 1/4 cup honey
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- salt and pepper, to taste
- chopped fresh parsley, for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c) and line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
2. in a small bowl, whisk together the dijon mustard, honey, soy sauce, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and pepper.
3. arrange the salmon fillets on the prepared baking sheet and brush the tops with the honey mustard glaze.
4. bake the salmon in the preheated oven for about 12-15 minutes, depending on the thickness of the fillets, or until cooked through and flaky.
5. remove the salmon from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.
6. serve the honey mustard glazed salmon with a sprinkle of chopped fresh parsley on top.
7. enjoy!
ingredients_list: salmon, fillet, dijon, mustard, honey, soy, sauce, lemon, clove, garlic, minced, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Roast Beef with Mashed Potatoes
raw_text: 39. Roast Beef with Mashed Potatoes: 600 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: Unknown
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 pounds of beef roast
- 4 cups of peeled and diced potatoes
- 1 cup of beef broth
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon of dried thyme
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. season the beef roast with salt, pepper, and dried thyme.
3. heat olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat.
4. add the beef roast to the skillet and sear it on all sides until browned, about 3-4 minutes per side.
5. remove the skillet from the heat and transfer it to the preheated oven.
6. roast the beef in the oven for about 25-30 minutes or until it reaches your desired level of doneness.
7. meanwhile, in a separate pot, boil the diced potatoes in salted water until tender, then drain.
8. in the same pot, add the minced garlic and mash the potatoes until smooth.
9. slowly pour in the beef broth while stirring until the desired consistency of mashed potatoes is reached.
10. season the mashed potatoes with salt and pepper to taste.
11. once the beef roast is done, remove it from the oven and let it rest for about 10 minutes before slicing.
12. serve the sliced roast beef with a side of mashed potatoes.

enjoy your roast beef with mashed potatoes!
cuisine:
Roast Beef with Mashed Potatoes:         
Cuisine type: Traditional
ingredients_list: pound, beef, roast, potato, beef, broth, olive, clove, garlic, minced, dried, thyme, salt, pepper, taste

title: Sweet and Sour Chicken with Rice
raw_text: 44. Sweet and Sour Chicken with Rice: 600 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains soy, origin: China
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
- 1/4 cup cornstarch
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1/4 tsp black pepper
- 2 tbsp vegetable oil
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 cup pineapple chunks, drained
- 1/2 cup ketchup
- 1/4 cup rice vinegar
- 2 tbsp soy sauce
- 2 tbsp brown sugar
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1 tbsp cornstarch, dissolved in 2 tbsp water
- cooked rice, for serving
preparation:
1. in a shallow dish, combine cornstarch, flour, salt, and black pepper. dredge the chicken pieces in the mixture, coating them evenly.
2. heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. add the chicken and cook until golden brown, about 5-7 minutes. remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
3. in the same skillet, add the bell pepper and cook for 2-3 minutes until slightly softened.
4. in a small bowl, whisk together ketchup, rice vinegar, soy sauce, brown sugar, and minced garlic. pour the sauce over the bell pepper in the skillet.
5. add the pineapple chunks to the skillet and bring the sauce to a simmer. cook for 2-3 minutes.
6. stir in the cornstarch-water mixture into the sauce and cook until the sauce has thickened, about 1-2 minutes.
7. return the cooked chicken to the skillet and toss to coat it in the sweet and sour sauce.
8. serve the sweet and sour chicken over cooked rice. enjoy!
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, piece, cornstarch, flour, salt, black, pepper, vegetable, bell, pepper, pineapple, ketchup, rice, vinegar, soy, sauce, brown, sugar, clove, garlic, minced, cornstarch, dissolved, water, rice

title: Lemon Herb Roasted Chicken
raw_text: 46. Lemon Herb Roasted Chicken: 500 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, origin: Unknown
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 whole chicken
- 3 lemons
- 4 cloves of garlic
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- 1 tablespoon of dried thyme
- 1 tablespoon of dried rosemary
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
2. rinse the chicken inside and out with cold water, then pat it dry with paper towels.
3. cut two lemons in half and squeeze the juice over the chicken, both inside and out. set the squeezed lemon halves aside.
4. crush the garlic cloves and rub them all over the chicken, inside and out.
5. in a small bowl, mix together the olive oil, dried thyme, dried rosemary, salt, and pepper. rub this herb mixture all over the chicken.
6. place the squeezed lemon halves inside the chicken cavity.
7. place the chicken on a rack in a roasting pan, breast side up.
8. cut the remaining lemon into slices and arrange them around the chicken in the roasting pan.
9. roast the chicken in the preheated oven for about 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°f (74°c).
10. remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for at least 10 minutes before carving.
11. serve the lemon herb roasted chicken with the roasted lemon slices as garnish. enjoy!
ingredients_list: whole, chicken, lemon, clove, garlic, olive, dried, thyme, dried, rosemary, salt, pepper, taste

title: Shrimp Fried Rice
raw_text: 47. Shrimp Fried Rice: 450 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains seafood, origin: China
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound of shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 3 cups of cooked rice
- 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 small onion, diced
- 1 cup of mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, corn)
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 3 tablespoons of soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon of oyster sauce
- salt and pepper to taste
- optional: sliced green onions for garnish
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat.
2. add the minced garlic and diced onion to the pan, and sauté until they become soft and fragrant.
3. add the shrimp to the pan and cook until they turn pink and are cooked through. remove the shrimp from the pan and set aside.
4. push the garlic, onion, and shrimp to one side of the pan and add the beaten eggs to the other side. scramble the eggs until fully cooked.
5. combine the cooked eggs, shrimp, garlic, and onion in the pan. add the cooked rice and mixed vegetables. mix well to combine.
6. add the soy sauce and oyster sauce to the pan, and stir until everything is evenly coated.
7. season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. continue to cook for a few more minutes, until everything is heated through.
9. optional: garnish with sliced green onions before serving.
10. serve hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: shrimp, deveined, rice, vegetable, clove, garlic, minced, onion, vegetable, carrot, pea, corn, egg, soy, sauce, oyster, sauce, salt, pepper, taste, green, onion, garnish

title: Stir-Fried Noodles with Vegetables
raw_text: 48. Stir-Fried Noodles with Vegetables: 400 kcals per portion, 4 portions, vegetarian, contains soy, origin: Asia
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 ounces of noodles (such as linguine or udon)
- 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil
- 1 onion, thinly sliced
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 carrot, julienned
- 1 cup of broccoli florets
- 1 cup of snap peas
- 2 tablespoons of soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon of oyster sauce
- 1 tablespoon of sesame oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- optional: sliced green onions and sesame seeds for garnish
preparation:
1. cook noodles according to package instructions. drain and set aside.
2. heat vegetable oil in a large pan or wok over medium heat.
3. add sliced onion and minced garlic to the pan and sauté for 2-3 minutes, until fragrant.
4. increase the heat to high and add the bell pepper, carrot, broccoli, and snap peas to the pan. stir-fry for about 5 minutes, until the vegetables are crisp-tender.
5. in a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, salt, and pepper.
6. push the vegetables to one side of the pan and add the cooked noodles to the other side.
7. pour the sauce over the noodles and vegetables, then gently toss everything together until well coated.
8. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together and the noodles to heat through.
9. remove from heat and serve hot. garnish with sliced green onions and sesame seeds if desired. enjoy!
ingredients_list: ounce, noodle, linguine, udon, vegetable, onion, thinly, garlic, clove, minced, bell, pepper, thinly, carrot, broccoli, floret, pea, soy, sauce, oyster, sauce, sesame, salt, pepper, taste, green, onion, sesame, seed, garnish

title: Chicken Satay Skewers with Peanut Sauce
raw_text: 53. Chicken Satay Skewers with Peanut Sauce: 400 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains nuts, origin: Southeast Asia
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 lb chicken breast, sliced into strips
- 3 tablespoons soy sauce
- 3 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 2 tablespoons honey
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- salt to taste
- wooden skewers, soaked in water

for peanut sauce:
- 1/2 cup peanut butter
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons honey
- 2 tablespoons lime juice
- 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon sesame oil
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1/2 teaspoon chili flakes (optional)
- water (as needed for desired consistency)
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine soy sauce, vegetable oil, honey, minced garlic, ground coriander, ground cumin, turmeric, paprika, and salt. mix well to make the marinade.
2. add the chicken strips to the marinade, ensuring they are fully coated. cover the bowl and let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour or overnight for maximum flavor.
3. preheat the grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.
4. thread the marinated chicken strips onto the soaked wooden skewers.
5. place the skewers on the preheated grill and cook for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until the chicken is cooked through and has grill marks. make sure to turn them occasionally for even cooking.
6. meanwhile, prepare the peanut sauce by combining peanut butter, soy sauce, honey, lime juice, rice vinegar, sesame oil, minced garlic, and chili flakes (if using) in a bowl. stir well to combine. add water gradually, if needed, to achieve your desired sauce consistency.
7. once the chicken skewers are cooked, remove them from the grill and serve hot with the prepared peanut sauce on the side for dipping.
8. enjoy your chicken satay skewers with peanut sauce!
cuisine: The recipe is of the Thai cuisine type.
ingredients_list: chicken, breast, strip, soy, sauce, vegetable, honey, clove, garlic, minced, ground, coriander, ground, cumin, turmeric, paprika, salt, taste, wooden, skewer, soaked, water, peanut, sauce, peanut, butter, soy, sauce, honey, lime, rice, vinegar, sesame, clove, garlic, minced, chili, flake, water, needed

title: Baked Ziti with Cheese
raw_text: 59. Baked Ziti with Cheese: 550 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, origin: Italy
ingredients:
ingredients: 

- 1 pound ziti pasta
- 2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 2 cups marinara sauce
- 1 cup ricotta cheese
- 1/4 cup fresh basil, chopped
- 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c) and lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
2. cook the ziti pasta according to package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.
3. in a large bowl, combine the shredded mozzarella cheese, grated parmesan cheese, ricotta cheese, chopped basil, chopped parsley, minced garlic, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. mix well.
4. add the cooked ziti pasta to the cheese mixture and toss until all the pasta is well coated.
5. spread half of the marinara sauce evenly on the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
6. pour the ziti pasta and cheese mixture over the marinara sauce and spread it evenly.
7. pour the remaining marinara sauce on top of the ziti.
8. cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake for 20 minutes.
9. remove the foil and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
11. garnish with additional fresh basil and parsley, if desired.
12. serve hot and enjoy your delicious baked ziti with cheese!
ingredients_list: ziti, pasta, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, parmesan, cheese, marinara, sauce, ricotta, cheese, fresh, basil, fresh, parsley, clove, garlic, minced, dried, oregano, salt, pepper, taste

title: Stuffed Zucchini with Ground Beef
raw_text: 66. Stuffed Zucchini with Ground Beef: 600 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: Unknown
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 medium zucchini
- 1 pound ground beef
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 cup cooked rice
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- salt and pepper to taste
- olive oil
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cut the zucchini in half lengthwise and scoop out the seeds and some of the flesh to form a hollow cavity in the center of each zucchini half. set aside.
3. heat a tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
4. add the ground beef, onion, garlic, and bell pepper to the skillet. cook until the beef is browned and the vegetables are softened.
5. drain any excess fat from the skillet and add the cooked rice, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper. stir well to combine.
6. fill each zucchini half with the ground beef mixture, pressing it down gently.
7. place the stuffed zucchini halves in a greased baking dish.
8. sprinkle the shredded cheddar cheese on top of the stuffed zucchini.
9. cover the baking dish with foil and bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes.
10. remove the foil and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the zucchini is tender and the cheese is melted and golden.
11. serve the stuffed zucchini with ground beef hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: zucchini, ground, beef, onion, clove, garlic, minced, bell, pepper, rice, shredded, cheddar, cheese, dried, oregano, dried, basil, salt, pepper, taste, olive

title: Vegetable Chow Mein
raw_text: 67. Vegetable Chow Mein: 400 kcals per portion, 4 portions, vegetarian, contains soy, origin: China
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 oz chow mein noodles
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 onion, thinly sliced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 carrot, julienned
- 1 bell pepper, sliced
- 1 cup cabbage, thinly sliced
- 1 cup bean sprouts
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon oyster sauce
- 1 tablespoon hoisin sauce
- 1 teaspoon sesame oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. cook the chow mein noodles according to package instructions. drain and set aside.
2. heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
3. add onion and garlic to the skillet and sauté until fragrant and slightly softened.
4. add carrot, bell pepper, cabbage, and bean sprouts to the skillet. stir-fry for about 3 minutes, or until vegetables are tender-crisp.
5. in a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, oyster sauce, hoisin sauce, and sesame oil. pour the sauce mixture over the vegetables in the skillet.
6. add the cooked chow mein noodles to the skillet and toss to combine with the sauce and vegetables. stir-fry for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until everything is heated through.
7. season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. remove from heat and serve hot. enjoy your delicious vegetable chow mein!
ingredients_list: chow, mein, noodle, vegetable, onion, thinly, clove, garlic, minced, carrot, bell, pepper, cabbage, thinly, bean, sprout, soy, sauce, oyster, sauce, hoisin, sauce, sesame, salt, pepper, taste

title: Lamb Pilaf
raw_text: 68. Lamb Pilaf: 700 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains nuts, origin: Middle East
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound lamb, cut into chunks
- 1 cup basmati rice
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 carrots, diced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 tablespoon curry powder
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 2 cups chicken broth
- salt to taste
- fresh cilantro, chopped (optional)
preparation:
1. heat a large pot over medium-high heat and add the lamb chunks. cook until browned on all sides. remove the lamb from the pot and set aside.
2. in the same pot, add the chopped onion and garlic. sauté until the onion becomes translucent.
3. add the diced carrots and bell pepper to the pot. cook for a few minutes until the vegetables start to soften.
4. stir in the curry powder, cumin, and coriander. cook for another minute to toast the spices and enhance their flavor.
5. return the lamb to the pot and add the basmati rice. stir well to combine all the ingredients.
6. pour in the chicken broth and add salt to taste. bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. cover the pot and let it simmer for about 20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.
7. remove the pot from heat and let it sit for a few minutes before fluffing the pilaf with a fork.
8. serve the lamb pilaf hot, garnished with fresh cilantro if desired. enjoy!
ingredients_list: lamb, basmati, rice, onion, clove, garlic, minced, carrot, bell, pepper, curry, powder, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, chicken, broth, salt, taste, fresh, cilantro

title: Vegetarian Quesadillas
raw_text: 69. Vegetarian Quesadillas: 350 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: Mexico
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large tortillas
- 1 cup shredded cheese (e.g. cheddar or monterey jack)
- 1/2 cup black beans, rinsed and drained
- 1/2 cup corn kernels (fresh or frozen)
- 1/4 cup chopped onions
- 1/4 cup chopped bell peppers (any color)
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon cumin
- salt and pepper to taste
- cooking oil
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the black beans, corn kernels, onions, bell peppers, cilantro, chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper. mix well.
2. heat a small amount of cooking oil in a medium-sized skillet over medium heat.
3. place one tortilla in the skillet and spread half of the shredded cheese evenly over the tortilla.
4. spoon half of the vegetable mixture onto one side of the tortilla, leaving some space around the edges.
5. fold the tortilla in half, pressing down gently with a spatula. cook for about 2-3 minutes until the bottom is golden brown.
6. carefully flip the quesadilla to cook the other side for an additional 2-3 minutes until golden brown and the cheese is melted.
7. remove the cooked quesadilla from the skillet and repeat the process with the remaining tortilla and ingredients.
8. once both quesadillas are cooked, let them cool for a minute, then cut them into wedges.
9. serve the vegetarian quesadillas with salsa, guacamole, or sour cream on the side if desired. enjoy!
ingredients_list: tortilla, shredded, cheese, cheddar, monterey, jack, black, bean, corn, kernel, fresh, frozen, onion, bell, pepper, color, fresh, cilantro, chili, powder, cumin, salt, pepper, taste

title: Chicken Korma with Basmati Rice
raw_text: 72. Chicken Korma with Basmati Rice: 600 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, origin: India
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 500g chicken, cut into pieces
- 1 cup plain yogurt
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 2 onions, finely chopped
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons ginger paste
- 2 teaspoons ground cumin
- 2 teaspoons ground coriander
- 1 teaspoon turmeric powder
- 1 teaspoon chili powder (optional)
- 1 teaspoon garam masala
- 1 cup coconut milk
- salt to taste
- fresh cilantro for garnish

for basmati rice:
- 1 cup basmati rice
- 2 cups water
- salt to taste
preparation:
1. marinate the chicken pieces in yogurt, salt, and turmeric powder for at least 30 minutes.
2. in a large pan, heat oil over medium heat and sauté the chopped onions until golden brown.
3. add minced garlic and ginger paste to the pan and cook for a minute.
4. add ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder, chili powder (if using), and garam masala to the pan. mix well and cook for another minute to release the flavors.
5. add the marinated chicken pieces to the pan and cook until they are no longer pink. stir occasionally to ensure even cooking.
6. pour in coconut milk and simmer for 15-20 minutes until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce thickens. adjust salt to taste.
7. while the chicken is cooking, prepare the basmati rice. rinse the rice thoroughly under cold water until the water runs clear.
8. in a separate pot, bring 2 cups of water to a boil and add salt. add the rinsed basmati rice to the boiling water and let it cook on medium heat for about 10-12 minutes or until the rice is tender. drain any excess water.
9. serve the chicken korma over a bed of basmati rice and garnish with fresh cilantro. enjoy!
ingredients_list: chicken, piece, plain, yogurt, vegetable, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, paste, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, turmeric, powder, chili, powder, garam, masala, coconut, milk, salt, taste, fresh, cilantro, garnish, basmati, rice, basmati, rice, water, salt, taste

title: Lemon Herb Roasted Turkey Breast
raw_text: 75. Lemon Herb Roasted Turkey Breast: 500 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, origin: Unknown
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 bone-in turkey breast (about 6-8 pounds)
- 1/4 cup olive oil
- 3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
- zest of 1 lemon
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 teaspoons dried thyme
- 2 teaspoons dried rosemary
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 325°f (165°c).
2. in a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, lemon zest, minced garlic, dried thyme, dried rosemary, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper.
3. place the turkey breast on a roasting rack in a roasting pan.
4. brush the entire turkey breast with the lemon herb mixture, making sure to cover both sides.
5. roast the turkey breast in the preheated oven for about 2 to 2 1/2 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°f (74°c) when checked with a meat thermometer.
6. baste the turkey breast with the pan juices every 30 minutes while it cooks.
7. once cooked, remove the turkey breast from the oven and let it rest for about 10 minutes before carving.
8. carve and serve hot. enjoy!
ingredients_list: bone, turkey, breast, pound, olive, fresh, lemon, zest, lemon, clove, garlic, minced, dried, thyme, dried, rosemary, dried, oregano, salt, black, pepper

title: Grilled Vegetable Skewers with Tzatziki Sauce
raw_text: 80. Grilled Vegetable Skewers with Tzatziki Sauce: 300 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: Mediterranean
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 zucchini, cut into chunks
- 1 red bell pepper, cut into chunks
- 1 yellow bell pepper, cut into chunks
- 1 red onion, cut into chunks
- 8 cherry tomatoes
- 1/4 cup olive oil
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper to taste
- wooden skewers, soaked in water for 30 minutes

for the tzatziki sauce:
- 1 cup greek yogurt
- 1/2 cucumber, grated and squeezed to remove excess moisture
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1 tablespoon fresh dill, chopped
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the olive oil, minced garlic, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. mix well to create a marinade.
2. add the cut vegetables to the marinade and toss until they are evenly coated.
3. preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
4. thread the marinated vegetables onto soaked wooden skewers, alternating the different vegetables.
5. place the skewers on the preheated grill and cook for about 10-12 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and slightly charred, turning occasionally.
6. while the skewers are grilling, prepare the tzatziki sauce by combining the greek yogurt, grated cucumber, minced garlic, lemon juice, chopped dill, salt, and pepper in a bowl. mix well.
7. once the skewers are done, remove them from the grill and serve hot with the tzatziki sauce on the side for dipping. enjoy!
ingredients_list: zucchini, red, bell, pepper, yellow, bell, pepper, red, onion, cherry, tomato, olive, clove, garlic, minced, dried, oregano, salt, pepper, taste, wooden, skewer, soaked, water, minute, tzatziki, sauce, greek, yogurt, cucumber, squeezed, moisture, clove, garlic, minced, lemon, fresh, dill, salt, pepper, taste

title: Grilled Tofu with Teriyaki Sauce
raw_text: 88. Grilled Tofu with Teriyaki Sauce: 300 kcals per portion, 4 portions, vegetarian, contains soy, origin: Unknown
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 block of tofu
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons brown sugar
- 2 tablespoons rice vinegar
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ginger, grated
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 2 tablespoons water
- cooking oil
preparation:
1. press the tofu to remove excess water. place the tofu block between two paper towels and place a heavy object on top. let it sit for about 15 minutes.
2. in a bowl, combine soy sauce, brown sugar, rice vinegar, minced garlic, and grated ginger. mix well until the sugar has dissolved.
3. after the tofu has been pressed, slice it into thick slices or squares.
4. place the tofu slices in a shallow dish and pour the teriyaki sauce over them. allow them to marinate for at least 30 minutes, turning occasionally to coat evenly.
5. in a small bowl, whisk cornstarch and water until smooth to make a slurry.
6. preheat the grill to medium-high heat. lightly brush the grill grates with cooking oil to prevent sticking.
7. remove the tofu from the marinade and discard the marinade.
8. place the tofu on the grill and cook for about 5-7 minutes on each side, or until grill marks form and the tofu is heated through.
9. while grilling, brush the tofu slices with the cornstarch slurry to create a nice glaze.
10. once the tofu is cooked, remove from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.
11. serve the grilled tofu with teriyaki sauce as a dipping sauce or drizzle the sauce over the tofu slices. enjoy!
ingredients_list: tofu, soy, sauce, brown, sugar, rice, vinegar, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, cornstarch, water

title: Lamb Biryani
raw_text: 89. Lamb Biryani: 800 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains nuts, origin: India
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound lamb, cut into pieces
- 2 cups basmati rice
- 2 onions, thinly sliced
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 1-inch ginger, grated
- 2 tomatoes, chopped
- 2 green chilies, slit
- 1/2 cup plain yogurt
- 2 teaspoons biryani masala
- 1 teaspoon turmeric powder
- 1 teaspoon red chili powder
- 1 teaspoon cumin powder
- 1 teaspoon fennel seeds
- 1 cinnamon stick
- 4 cloves
- 4 cardamom pods
- 1 bay leaf
- 4 cups water
- salt to taste
- fresh cilantro, chopped (for garnish)
- lemon wedges (for serving)
preparation:
1. rinse the basmati rice under cold water until water runs clear. soak the rice in water for 30 minutes, then drain and set aside.
2. in a large pan, heat some oil over medium heat. add the sliced onions and fry until golden brown. remove half of the fried onions and set aside for garnishing.
3. to the remaining onions in the pan, add the minced garlic and grated ginger. stir and cook for a minute until fragrant.
4. add the lamb pieces to the pan and cook until browned on all sides.
5. stir in the chopped tomatoes, green chilies, biryani masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, fennel seeds, cinnamon stick, cloves, cardamom pods, and bay leaf. cook for a few minutes until the tomatoes are soft and well combined with the spices.
6. add the yogurt to the pan and mix everything together. cook for a couple of minutes to allow the flavors to blend.
7. pour in 4 cups of water and season with salt. bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 20 minutes until the lamb is tender and the flavors are well infused.
8. while the lamb is cooking, bring a large pot of water to boil. add the soaked and drained basmati rice along with some salt. cook the rice until it is 70% cooked (parboiled). drain the rice and set aside.
9. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c).
10. in a separate oven-safe dish, layer half of the parboiled rice. then, spoon half of the cooked lamb curry over the rice. repeat the layers with the remaining rice and lamb curry.
11. cover the dish with aluminum foil and place it in the preheated oven. bake for 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld and the rice to finish cooking.
12. once done, remove the biryani from the oven. garnish with the reserved fried onions and chopped cilantro.
13. serve the lamb biryani hot with lemon wedges on the side. enjoy!
ingredients_list: lamb, piece, basmati, rice, onion, thinly, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, tomato, green, chilies, slit, plain, yogurt, biryani, masala, turmeric, powder, red, chili, powder, cumin, powder, fennel, seed, cinnamon, clove, cardamom, pod, leaf, water, salt, taste, fresh, cilantro, garnish, lemon, wedge

title: Vegetable Gnocchi Bake
raw_text: 92. Vegetable Gnocchi Bake: 450 kcals per portion, 2 portions, vegetarian, contains dairy, origin: Italy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 package of gnocchi
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 zucchini, diced
- 1 cup of cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1 cup of spinach
- 1 cup of marinara sauce
- 1/2 cup of shredded mozzarella cheese
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh basil leaves for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cook the gnocchi according to package instructions, then set aside.
3. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
4. add the diced onion and garlic, sauté until they become translucent and fragrant.
5. add the diced bell pepper and zucchini, cooking until they are tender.
6. stir in the cherry tomatoes and spinach, cooking until the spinach has wilted.
7. add the cooked gnocchi to the skillet and mix well.
8. pour in the marinara sauce, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. stir everything together until well combined, then transfer the mixture to a baking dish.
10. sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese on top of the mixture evenly.
11. place the baking dish in the preheated oven and bake for about 20 minutes, or until the cheese has melted and turned golden brown.
12. once done, remove from the oven and let it cool slightly.
13. garnish with fresh basil leaves before serving.

enjoy your vegetable gnocchi bake!
ingredients_list: gnocchi, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, bell, pepper, zucchini, cherry, tomato, halved, spinach, marinara, sauce, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, basil, leaf, garnish

title: Pesto Shrimp Pasta
raw_text: 95. Pesto Shrimp Pasta: 550 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains seafood, contains nuts, origin: Italy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 ounces of pasta
- 1 pound of shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 2 tablespoons of pesto sauce
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh basil leaves for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. cook the pasta according to package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.
2. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the minced garlic and sauté for a minute until fragrant.
3. add the shrimp to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side until they turn pink and opaque. season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. reduce the heat to low and add the cooked pasta to the skillet. mix well to coat the pasta with the garlicky shrimp flavor.
5. stir in the pesto sauce and continue cooking for another minute to heat through.
6. remove from heat and garnish with fresh basil leaves if desired.
7. serve hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: ounce, pasta, shrimp, deveined, pesto, sauce, clove, garlic, minced, olive, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, basil, leaf, garnish

title: Vegetable Egg Fried Rice
raw_text: 97. Vegetable Egg Fried Rice: 400 kcals per portion, 2 portions, vegetarian, contains egg, origin: China
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups cooked rice
- 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, corn, bell peppers, etc.)
- 3 eggs
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/2 teaspoon ginger powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- green onions for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
2. add the mixed vegetables to the skillet and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until they are slightly cooked but still crisp.
3. push the vegetables to one side of the skillet and crack the eggs onto the other side.
4. scramble the eggs using a spatula until they are fully cooked and then mix them with the vegetables.
5. add the cooked rice to the skillet and stir-fry everything together for 2-3 minutes until well combined.
6. sprinkle the soy sauce, garlic powder, ginger powder, salt, and pepper over the rice mixture, and stir to evenly distribute the seasonings.
7. continue stir-frying for another 2-3 minutes until the rice is heated through and slightly crispy.
8. remove the skillet from heat and garnish with chopped green onions if desired.
9. serve the vegetable egg fried rice hot as a main dish or as a side dish with your favorite protein.

enjoy your vegetable egg fried rice!
ingredients_list: rice, vegetable, carrot, pea, corn, bell, pepper, egg, soy, sauce, vegetable, garlic, powder, ginger, powder, salt, pepper, taste, green, onion, garnish

title: Moroccan Lamb Meatballs with Couscous
raw_text: 98. Moroccan Lamb Meatballs with Couscous: 700 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains nuts, origin: Morocco
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 500 grams ground lamb
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons fresh parsley, chopped
- 2 tablespoons fresh mint, chopped
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 cup couscous
- 1 1/4 cups chicken or vegetable broth
- juice of 1 lemon
- 1/4 cup raisins
- 1/4 cup slivered almonds, toasted
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, combine the ground lamb, chopped onion, minced garlic, parsley, mint, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper. mix well using your hands until all the ingredients are evenly incorporated.
2. shape the mixture into small meatballs, about 1 inch in diameter.
3. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. add the meatballs to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes. remove the meatballs from the skillet and set aside.
4. in the same skillet, add the couscous and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until lightly toasted.
5. pour in the broth and lemon juice, then bring to a boil. reduce the heat to low and cover the skillet. simmer for 8-10 minutes, or until the couscous is tender and has absorbed the liquid.
6. remove the skillet from heat and stir in the raisins. cover and let it sit for 5 minutes to allow the raisins to plump up.
7. meanwhile, warm a small skillet over medium heat. add the slivered almonds and toast them for a few minutes until golden brown. keep an eye on them as they can burn quickly.
8. fluff the couscous with a fork and serve it alongside the lamb meatballs. garnish with the toasted almonds. enjoy!
ingredients_list: gram, ground, lamb, onion, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, parsley, fresh, mint, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, ground, cinnamon, cayenne, pepper, salt, pepper, taste, olive, couscous, chicken, vegetable, broth, lemon, raisin, slivered, almond, toasted

title: Chicken Curry with Basmati Rice
raw_text:
100. Chicken Curry with Basmati Rice: 600 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, origin: India

Please note that the above calorie counts are approximate and can vary depending on the specific ingredients used and serving sizes.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 lbs chicken, cut into pieces
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 inch ginger, grated
- 2 tomatoes, chopped
- 2 tbsp curry powder
- 1 tsp turmeric powder
- 1 tsp cumin powder
- 1 tsp coriander powder
- 1 tsp chili powder (optional, adjust to taste)
- 1 cup coconut milk
- salt to taste
- fresh cilantro leaves, chopped (for garnish)
- 2 cups basmati rice
- 4 cups water (for rice)
preparation:
1. rinse the basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear. drain well.
2. in a medium-sized pot, add the rinsed basmati rice and 4 cups of water. bring to a boil.
3. once boiling, reduce heat to low, cover, and let simmer for about 15-20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and fluffy. remove from heat and keep covered.
4. in a large saucepan or skillet, heat some oil over medium heat. add the chopped onions and cook until they turn translucent.
5. add minced garlic and grated ginger to the saucepan. saute for another minute until fragrant.
6. add the chicken pieces to the pan and cook until they are browned on all sides.
7. stir in the curry powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and chili powder (if using). cook for a minute to toast the spices.
8. add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften and release their juices.
9. pour in the coconut milk and season with salt. stir well to combine all the ingredients.
10. reduce the heat to low, cover the saucepan, and let simmer for about 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and tender.
11. once the chicken curry is ready, serve it hot with the cooked basmati rice.
12. garnish with fresh cilantro leaves.

enjoy your delicious chicken curry with basmati rice!
taste: The key taste profile in this recipe is savory (umami).
ingredients_list: chicken, piece, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, tomato, curry, powder, turmeric, powder, cumin, powder, coriander, powder, chili, powder, taste, coconut, milk, salt, taste, fresh, cilantro, leaf, garnish, basmati, rice, water, rice

title: Chicken curry (500 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, origin
raw_text: 1. Chicken curry (500 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, origin: India)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 500g chicken breast, cut into bite-sized pieces
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 thumb-sized piece of ginger, grated
- 2 tablespoons curry powder
- 1 teaspoon turmeric powder
- 1 teaspoon cumin powder
- 400ml coconut milk
- 200ml chicken broth
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh cilantro, chopped (for garnish)
- steamed rice or naan bread (for serving)
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large pan or skillet over medium heat.
2. add the chopped onion and cook until translucent.
3. stir in the minced garlic and grated ginger, cooking for another minute until fragrant.
4. add the curry powder, turmeric powder, and cumin powder to the pan, stirring well to coat the onions, garlic, and ginger with the spices.
5. push the onion mixture to one side of the pan and add the chicken pieces to the other side. cook until the chicken is browned on all sides.
6. pour in the coconut milk and chicken broth, stirring to combine everything together.
7. season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. reduce the heat to low and let the curry simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and tender.
9. serve the chicken curry hot, garnished with fresh cilantro. accompany with steamed rice or naan bread. enjoy your homemade chicken curry!

title: Eggplant Parmesan with spaghetti (600 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin
raw_text: 12. Eggplant Parmesan with spaghetti (600 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Italy)
ingredients:
italian):

ingredients:
- 1 large eggplant
- 1 cup bread crumbs (gluten-containing)
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese (dairy)
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup marinara sauce
- 1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese (dairy)
- 2 cups cooked spaghetti
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. slice the eggplant into 1/2-inch thick rounds.
3. in a shallow bowl, combine the bread crumbs, grated parmesan cheese, dried oregano, and salt.
4. in another shallow bowl, beat the eggs.
5. dip the eggplant slices into the beaten eggs, allowing any excess to drip off, then coat them in the breadcrumb mixture.
6. place the coated eggplant slices onto a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy.
7. while the eggplant is baking, cook the spaghetti according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
8. in a medium-sized saucepan, heat the marinara sauce over medium heat until warmed through.
9. remove the eggplant from the oven and spread half of the marinara sauce over the slices. sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese on top.
10. return the baking sheet to the oven and bake for an additional 10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
11. in a serving dish, divide the cooked spaghetti into two portions.
12. place half of the eggplant slices on top of each portion of spaghetti.
13. serve hot and enjoy your homemade eggplant parmesan with spaghetti!
ingredients_list: italian, eggplant, bread, crumb, gluten, containing, parmesan, cheese, dairy, dried, oregano, salt, egg, marinara, sauce, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, dairy, spaghetti

title: Chicken enchiladas with rice and beans (700 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin
raw_text: 16. Chicken enchiladas with rice and beans (700 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Mexico)
ingredients:
: mexican).

ingredients:
- 2 chicken breasts, cooked and shredded
- 1 cup cooked white rice
- 1 cup cooked black beans
- 1 can (10 oz) red enchilada sauce
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 4 flour tortillas
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
- 1/4 cup diced red onion
- 1/4 cup sliced black olives
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a large bowl, combine the shredded chicken, cooked rice, and cooked black beans. mix well.
3. pour half of the enchilada sauce into a shallow baking dish.
4. place a tortilla on a clean surface, and spoon 1/4 of the chicken and rice mixture onto the center of the tortilla. roll it up tightly and place it seam-side down in the baking dish. repeat with the remaining tortillas and chicken mixture.
5. pour the remaining enchilada sauce over the rolled tortillas, making sure they are completely covered.
6. sprinkle the shredded cheddar cheese evenly over the top of the enchiladas.
7. cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake for 20 minutes.
8. remove the foil and continue baking for an additional 10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. remove the enchiladas from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
10. garnish with chopped fresh cilantro, diced red onion, and sliced black olives.
11. season with salt and pepper to taste.
12. serve the chicken enchiladas with rice and beans hot and enjoy!

note: if you prefer your enchiladas to be spicier, you can add some diced jalapenos or red pepper flakes to the filling mixture.
ingredients_list: mexican, chicken, breast, shredded, white, rice, black, bean, red, enchilada, sauce, shredded, cheddar, cheese, flour, tortilla, fresh, cilantro, red, onion, black, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Red lentil dal with naan bread (500 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten, origin
raw_text: 17. Red lentil dal with naan bread (500 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten, origin: India)
ingredients:
ingredients for red lentil dal:
- 1 cup red lentils
- 2 cups water
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 onion, diced
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric
- 1/2 teaspoon chili powder
- 1 can (14 ounces) diced tomatoes
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- salt and pepper, to taste
- fresh cilantro, for garnish

ingredients for naan bread:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon sugar
- 1/2 cup plain yogurt
- 1/4 cup warm water
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- butter, for brushing
preparation:
1. in a large saucepan, combine the red lentils and water. bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for about 15-20 minutes or until the lentils are tender. drain any excess water and set aside.
2. in another saucepan, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. add diced onion and minced garlic, and sauté until they become translucent.
3. add ground cumin, ground coriander, ground turmeric, and chili powder to the pan. stir well to coat the onions and garlic with the spices.
4. pour in the diced tomatoes and vegetable broth, then add the cooked red lentils. stir everything together and let it simmer for about 10-15 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together. season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. while the dal is simmering, prepare the naan bread. in a large mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, salt, baking powder, and sugar.
6. in a separate small bowl, whisk together plain yogurt, warm water, and vegetable oil. add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until a dough forms.
7. transfer the dough onto a floured surface and knead for about 5-7 minutes, until it becomes smooth and elastic.
8. divide the dough into 6 equal portions and shape each portion into a ball. using a rolling pin, flatten each ball into a circular shape, about 1/4-inch thick.
9. heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat. cook each naan bread for about 2-3 minutes on each side, until it puffs up and gets golden brown spots.
10. once the dal and naan bread are ready, garnish the dal with fresh cilantro and serve it alongside the warm naan bread. enjoy!

note: this recipe contains gluten from the naan bread.
taste:
salty (in the red lentil dal)
salty (in the naan bread)
ingredients_list: red, lentil, water, vegetable, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, ground, turmeric, chili, powder, ounce, tomato, vegetable, broth, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, cilantro, garnish, flour, salt, baking, powder, sugar, plain, yogurt, water, vegetable, butter, brushing

title: Grilled shrimp skewers with vegetable couscous (400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains shellfish, origin
raw_text: 18. Grilled shrimp skewers with vegetable couscous (400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains shellfish, origin: Various)
ingredients:
al origin: mediterranean)

ingredients:
- 10-12 large shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
- salt and black pepper to taste
- 1/2 cup couscous
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- 1/4 cup diced red bell pepper
- 1/4 cup diced yellow bell pepper
- 1/4 cup diced zucchini
- 1/4 cup diced eggplant
- 1/4 cup diced red onion
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
preparation:
1. soak wooden skewers in water for about 10 minutes to prevent them from burning on the grill.
2. in a bowl, mix together olive oil, lemon juice, smoked paprika, salt, and black pepper. add the shrimp and toss to coat evenly. let marinate for 10-15 minutes.
3. meanwhile, prepare the couscous. in a small saucepan, bring the vegetable broth to a boil. stir in the couscous, cover the pan, remove from heat, and let stand for 5 minutes. fluff with a fork.
4. preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
5. thread the marinated shrimp onto the soaked skewers, alternating with the diced vegetables.
6. grill the skewers for about 3-4 minutes per side, or until the shrimp are cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
7. to serve, divide the couscous between two plates and top with the grilled shrimp skewers. sprinkle with chopped fresh parsley for garnish.
8. enjoy your grilled shrimp skewers with vegetable couscous!
ingredients_list: origin, mediterranean, shrimp, deveined, olive, lemon, smoked, paprika, salt, black, pepper, taste, couscous, vegetable, broth, red, bell, pepper, yellow, bell, pepper, zucchini, eggplant, red, onion, fresh, parsley

title: Greek salad with grilled chicken and pita bread (400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin
raw_text: 20. Greek salad with grilled chicken and pita bread (400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Greece)
ingredients:
: greek cuisine) :

ingredients:
- 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 4 cups romaine lettuce, chopped
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1 cucumber, peeled and diced
- 1/2 red onion, thinly sliced
- 1/2 cup kalamata olives, pitted and halved
- 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 2 whole wheat pita breads
- for the dressing:
  - 2 tablespoons olive oil
  - 1 tablespoon lemon juice
  - 1 teaspoon dried oregano
  - salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.
2. in a small bowl, combine dried oregano, dried basil, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper. rub the spice mixture evenly onto both sides of the chicken breasts.
3. drizzle the chicken breasts with 1 tablespoon of olive oil and place them on the grill. cook for about 6-8 minutes per side or until the internal temperature reaches 165°f (75°c). once cooked, remove from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes before slicing.
4. while the chicken is cooking, prepare the salad. in a large mixing bowl, combine romaine lettuce, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, kalamata olives, and crumbled feta cheese.
5. in a separate small bowl, whisk together 2 tablespoons of olive oil, lemon juice, dried oregano, salt, and pepper to make the dressing.
6. pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat all the ingredients evenly.
7. warm the pita breads on the grill for about 1 minute per side or until lightly toasted.
8. slice the grilled chicken into thin strips.
9. divide the salad into two portions and top each portion with sliced grilled chicken.
10. serve the greek salad with grilled chicken alongside the warm pita breads.
11. enjoy your delicious greek salad with grilled chicken and pita bread!
