title: Mediterranean grilled vegetables with feta cheese and orzo (400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin
raw_text: 23. Mediterranean grilled vegetables with feta cheese and orzo (400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Various)
ingredients:
mediterranean grilled vegetables with feta cheese and orzo:

ingredients:
- 1 zucchini
- 1 yellow squash
- 1 red bell pepper
- 1 yellow bell pepper
- 1 red onion
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 cup uncooked orzo pasta
- 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese

preparation:
1. preheat your grill to medium heat.

2. slice the zucchini, yellow squash, red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, and red onion into thin, even slices.

3. in a large bowl, toss the sliced vegetables with olive oil, salt, and pepper, ensuring they are well coated.

4. place the vegetables onto the preheated grill and cook for about 4-5 minutes per side or until they are nicely charred and cooked through. remove from the grill and set aside.

5. while the vegetables are grilling, cook the orzo pasta according to the package instructions. drain and set aside.

6. in a large serving bowl, combine the grilled vegetables and cooked orzo. toss gently to mix.

7. sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese over the vegetables and orzo mixture.

8. if desired, garnish with freshly chopped parsley for added flavor and color.

9. serve the mediterranean grilled vegetables warm as a main dish or a side dish. enjoy!

title: Beef and broccoli stir
raw_text: 28. Beef and broccoli stir-fry with steamed rice (600 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: China)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 12 ounces flank steak, sliced into thin strips
- 1/4 cup low-sodium soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons cornstarch
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 4 cups broccoli florets
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon grated ginger
- 1/4 cup oyster sauce
- 1/4 cup beef broth
- 2 cups cooked steamed rice
preparation:
1. in a bowl, mix the sliced flank steak with soy sauce and cornstarch. allow it to marinate for 15 minutes.
2. heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
3. add the marinated steak to the skillet and stir-fry until browned. remove the steak from the skillet and set it aside.
4. in the same skillet, add another tablespoon of vegetable oil and stir-fry the broccoli florets until they are bright green and crisp-tender. remove the broccoli from the skillet and set it aside.
5. in the same skillet, add minced garlic and grated ginger. stir-fry until fragrant, about 1 minute.
6. return the cooked steak and broccoli to the skillet. add oyster sauce and beef broth. stir-fry for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and everything is well combined.
7. serve the beef and broccoli stir-fry over steamed rice. enjoy!
ingredients_list: ounce, flank, steak, strip, sodium, soy, sauce, cornstarch, vegetable, broccoli, floret, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, oyster, sauce, beef, broth, rice

title: Grilled teriyaki tofu with stir
raw_text: 30. Grilled teriyaki tofu with stir-fried vegetables and noodles (400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten and soy, origin: Japan)
ingredients:
asian)
ingredients:
- 1 package of firm tofu
- 1 cup of teriyaki sauce
- 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 onion, sliced
- 1 bell pepper, sliced
- 1 zucchini, sliced
- 1 cup of broccoli florets
- 2 cups of cooked noodles (such as soba or udon)
- salt and pepper to taste
- chopped green onions for garnish
preparation:
1. cut the tofu into rectangular slices and pat them dry with a paper towel to remove excess moisture.
2. marinate the tofu in teriyaki sauce for at least 30 minutes, turning the slices occasionally to ensure even flavor absorption.
3. preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
4. while the grill is preheating, heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
5. add the minced garlic and sauté for a minute until fragrant.
6. add the sliced onion, bell pepper, zucchini, and broccoli florets to the skillet.
7. stir-fry the vegetables for about 5-7 minutes until tender-crisp.
8. remove the vegetables from the skillet and set aside.
9. in the same skillet, add another tablespoon of vegetable oil and place the marinated tofu slices on it. discard the remaining teriyaki sauce used for marinating.
10. cook the tofu on the grill for 3-4 minutes per side, or until grill marks form and the tofu is heated through.
11. remove the tofu from the grill and slice it into smaller pieces if desired.
12. add the cooked noodles to the skillet with the remaining oil and quickly stir-fry them for 2 minutes to heat through.
13. return the stir-fried vegetables to the skillet with the noodles, and toss everything together.
14. season with salt and pepper to taste.
15. divide the stir-fried vegetables and noodles mixture into three portions.
16. place the grilled teriyaki tofu on top of each portion.
17. garnish with chopped green onions.
18. serve hot and enjoy your delicious grilled teriyaki tofu with stir-fried vegetables and noodles!
ingredients_list: asian, tofu, teriyaki, sauce, vegetable, clove, garlic, minced, onion, bell, pepper, zucchini, broccoli, floret, noodle, soba, udon, salt, pepper, taste, green, onion, garnish

title: Spinach and feta stuffed chicken breast with quinoa (500 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin
raw_text: 34. Spinach and feta stuffed chicken breast with quinoa (500 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: Various)
ingredients:
greek)

ingredients:
- 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 2 cups baby spinach, chopped
- 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 1/2 cup cooked quinoa
- 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
- salt and pepper, to taste
- olive oil, for cooking
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a bowl, combine the chopped spinach, crumbled feta cheese, cooked quinoa, dried oregano, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. mix well.
3. using a sharp knife, create a pocket in each chicken breast by slicing horizontally through the thickest part, without cutting all the way through. open up the pocket.
4. stuff the spinach and feta mixture into each chicken breast pocket, dividing it evenly between the two.
5. secure the opening of each chicken breast with toothpicks to hold in the stuffing.
6. heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium heat. once hot, add the stuffed chicken breasts and cook for about 3-4 minutes on each side, until lightly browned.
7. transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 15-18 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and reaches an internal temperature of 165°f (74°c).
8. remove toothpicks before serving. serve the spinach and feta stuffed chicken breast with a side of cooked quinoa and additional vegetables, if desired.

enjoy your delicious spinach and feta stuffed chicken breast with quinoa!
ingredients_list: greek, boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, baby, spinach, feta, cheese, quinoa, dried, oregano, garlic, powder, salt, pepper, taste, olive

title: Lentil meatballs with marinara sauce and spaghetti (600 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin
raw_text: 35. Lentil meatballs with marinara sauce and spaghetti (600 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Various)
ingredients:
: italian)

ingredients:
- 1 cup of dried lentils
- 1/2 cup of breadcrumbs (gluten-containing)
- 1/4 cup of grated parmesan cheese
- 1/4 cup of chopped parsley
- 1/4 cup of chopped onion
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon of dried basil
- 1/2 teaspoon of dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon of salt
- 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon of red pepper flakes (optional)
- 1 egg, lightly beaten
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
- 1 jar of marinara sauce
- 6 oz of spaghetti
preparation:
1. cook the lentils according to package instructions until tender. drain and let cool.
2. in a large bowl, combine the cooked lentils, breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, parsley, onion, garlic, dried basil, dried oregano, salt, black pepper, and red pepper flakes (if using). mix well.
3. add the lightly beaten egg to the lentil mixture and mix until thoroughly incorporated.
4. shape the lentil mixture into meatball-sized balls and set aside.
5. heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. add the lentil meatballs and cook until browned on all sides, about 8-10 minutes.
6. pour the jar of marinara sauce into the skillet with the lentil meatballs. reduce the heat to medium-low and let simmer for about 10 minutes, or until the meatballs are cooked through.
7. while the sauce simmers, cook the spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente. drain.
8. serve the lentil meatballs and marinara sauce over a bed of cooked spaghetti, and garnish with additional parmesan cheese and parsley if desired.

enjoy your lentil meatballs with marinara sauce and spaghetti!
ingredients_list: italian, dried, lentil, breadcrumb, gluten, containing, parmesan, cheese, parsley, onion, clove, garlic, minced, dried, basil, dried, oregano, salt, black, pepper, red, pepper, flake, egg, lightly, olive, marinara, sauce, spaghetti

title: Teriyaki salmon with broccoli and jasmine rice (600 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains fish, origin
raw_text: 38. Teriyaki salmon with broccoli and jasmine rice (600 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains fish, origin: Japan)
ingredients:
japan):

ingredients:
- 2 salmon fillets
- 4 tablespoons of teriyaki sauce
- 2 cups of broccoli florets
- 1 cup of jasmine rice
- 2 cups of water
- salt, to taste
- sesame seeds, for garnish (optional)
- green onions, chopped, for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. place the salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
3. brush each salmon fillet with 2 tablespoons of teriyaki sauce, ensuring the sauce is evenly spread.
4. bake the salmon in the preheated oven for about 12-15 minutes, or until it is cooked to your desired level of doneness.
5. while the salmon is baking, prepare the broccoli by steaming or blanching it until crisp-tender. drain and set aside.
6. in a separate saucepan, rinse the jasmine rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
7. add the rinsed rice to the saucepan with 2 cups of water and a pinch of salt.
8. bring the rice to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and let it simmer for about 15 minutes, or until all the water is absorbed and the rice is fluffy.
9. remove the salmon from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.
10. divide the jasmine rice, broccoli, and teriyaki salmon fillets equally between two plates.
11. optionally, sprinkle sesame seeds and green onions on top for garnish.
12. serve immediately and enjoy your homemade teriyaki salmon with broccoli and jasmine rice!
ingredients_list: japan, salmon, fillet, teriyaki, sauce, broccoli, floret, jasmine, rice, water, salt, taste, sesame, seed, garnish, green, onion, garnish

title: Mushroom and spinach pasta with garlic bread (450 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin
raw_text: 39. Mushroom and spinach pasta with garlic bread (450 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Various)
ingredients:
:  italy).

ingredients:
- 200g pasta (gluten-containing)
- 150g fresh mushrooms, sliced
- 100g fresh spinach
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes
- salt and black pepper to taste
- 4 slices bread (preferably italian or french)
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
preparation:
1. cook the pasta according to package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.
2. in a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. add minced garlic and sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
3. add sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook for about 5 minutes until they start to brown.
4. add fresh spinach to the skillet and cook for another 2-3 minutes until wilted.
5. season the mushroom and spinach mixture with dried oregano, red pepper flakes, salt, and black pepper. stir well to combine.
6. add the cooked pasta to the skillet and toss everything together until well coated. cook for an additional 1-2 minutes to heat up the pasta.
7. meanwhile, preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c). in a small bowl, mix butter with garlic powder until well combined.
8. spread the garlic butter mixture evenly on both sides of the bread slices. place them on a baking sheet and bake for about 10 minutes until golden and crispy.
9. serve the mushroom and spinach pasta with the garlic bread on the side. enjoy!

note: please make sure to double-check the nutritional information and adjust the portion size if required to fit your dietary needs.

title: Vegetable lasagna with garlic bread (600 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin
raw_text: 45. Vegetable lasagna with garlic bread (600 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Italy)
ingredients:
: italian):

for the vegetable lasagna:
- 6 lasagna noodles
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1/2 onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 zucchini, sliced
- 1 yellow squash, sliced
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 cup sliced mushrooms
- 1 can diced tomatoes (14 oz)
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1 cup ricotta cheese
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese

for the garlic bread:
- 2 slices of italian bread
- 2 tablespoons butter, softened
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cook the lasagna noodles according to the package instructions. drain and set aside.
3. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the diced onion and minced garlic, sauté until they become translucent.
4. add the sliced zucchini, yellow squash, red bell pepper, and mushrooms to the skillet. cook for about 5 minutes until the vegetables are slightly tender.
5. stir in the diced tomatoes, dried basil, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper. let it simmer for 10 minutes.
6. in a mixing bowl, combine the ricotta cheese and shredded mozzarella cheese.
7. assemble the lasagna: in a baking dish, layer 2 lasagna noodles on the bottom. spread half of the vegetable mixture over the noodles. add another layer of 2 lasagna noodles and spread half of the cheese mixture on top. repeat the layers with the remaining ingredients.
8. sprinkle the grated parmesan cheese over the top layer.
9. bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes until the cheese is golden and bubbly.
10. while the lasagna is baking, prepare the garlic bread. in a small bowl, mix together the softened butter, minced garlic, chopped parsley, and salt. spread the garlic butter mixture evenly on the slices of italian bread.
11. toast the garlic bread slices in a toaster or under the broiler until they are golden and crispy.
12. serve the vegetable lasagna with a portion of garlic bread on the side.

enjoy your delicious vegetable lasagna with garlic bread!

title: Thai coconut curry with chicken and rice (700 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains fish, origin
raw_text: 46. Thai coconut curry with chicken and rice (700 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains fish, origin: Thailand)
ingredients:
here's a recipe for thai coconut curry with chicken and rice:

ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 cup sliced mushrooms
- 1 tablespoon thai red curry paste
- 1 can (14 ounces) coconut milk
- 1 cup chicken broth
- 1 tablespoon fish sauce
- 1 tablespoon brown sugar
- 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
- 1 cup cooked jasmine rice
- fresh cilantro, for garnish
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
2. add the diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet, and sauté until the onion becomes translucent.
3. add the sliced red bell pepper and mushrooms to the skillet, and cook for another 2-3 minutes until they start to soften.
4. push the vegetables to one side of the skillet and add the thai red curry paste. cook the paste for a minute to release its flavors.
5. pour in the coconut milk and chicken broth, and stir until well combined with the curry paste.
6. add the fish sauce and brown sugar to the skillet, and stir to dissolve the sugar.
7. add the chicken pieces to the skillet, and simmer over low heat for about 10-15 minutes until the chicken is cooked through.
8. while the curry is cooking, prepare the jasmine rice according to package instructions.
9. serve the thai coconut curry over a bed of cooked jasmine rice, and garnish with fresh cilantro.

enjoy your delicious thai coconut curry with chicken and rice!

title: Vegetarian stuffed zucchini boats with quinoa and cheese (400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains dairy, origin
raw_text: 47. Vegetarian stuffed zucchini boats with quinoa and cheese (400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains dairy, origin: Various)
ingredients:
here is the recipe for vegetarian stuffed zucchini boats with quinoa and cheese:

ingredients:
- 3 medium zucchini
- 1 cup cooked quinoa
- 1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil
- 1/4 cup chopped sun-dried tomatoes
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. cut the zucchini in half lengthwise and scoop out the seeds to form boat-shaped shells. reserve the scooped-out zucchini for later use.
3. in a mixing bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, shredded mozzarella cheese, grated parmesan cheese, chopped basil, chopped sun-dried tomatoes, minced garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper. mix well.
4. fill each zucchini boat with the quinoa mixture, pressing it firmly.
5. place the filled zucchini boats in a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the zucchini is tender and the cheese is melted and lightly browned on top.
6. serve the vegetarian stuffed zucchini boats hot and enjoy!

note: you can also add any other preferred veggies or spices to the filling mixture to personalize the recipe.

title: Sweet and sour shrimp with steamed rice (600 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains shellfish, origin
raw_text: 49. Sweet and sour shrimp with steamed rice (600 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains shellfish, origin: Various)
ingredients:
china):

ingredients:
- 1 pound of shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 1/4 cup of cornstarch
- 1/4 cup of water
- 1/4 cup of ketchup
- 1/4 cup of rice vinegar
- 2 tablespoons of soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons of sugar
- 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil
- 1 bell pepper, cut into chunks
- 1 onion, cut into chunks
- 1 clove of garlic, minced
- steamed rice, for serving
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the cornstarch and water to make a slurry. set it aside.
2. in a separate bowl, mix together the ketchup, rice vinegar, soy sauce, and sugar. set aside.
3. heat the vegetable oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat.
4. add the shrimp to the hot pan and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, until they are pink and cooked through. remove the shrimp from the pan and set them aside.
5. in the same pan, add the bell pepper, onion, and minced garlic. stir-fry for about 2-3 minutes until they are slightly tender.
6. push the vegetables to the side of the pan and pour the sauce mixture into the center. stir the sauce until it thickens.
7. once the sauce is thick, add the cooked shrimp back to the pan and stir to coat them in the sauce.
8. serve the sweet and sour shrimp over steamed rice. enjoy!

note: make sure to follow the appropriate food safety guidelines when handling shellfish.
ingredients_list: china, shrimp, deveined, cornstarch, water, ketchup, rice, vinegar, soy, sauce, sugar, vegetable, bell, pepper, onion, clove, garlic, minced, rice

title: Grilled vegetable and halloumi skewers with quinoa (400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains dairy, origin
raw_text: 55. Grilled vegetable and halloumi skewers with quinoa (400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains dairy, origin: Various)
ingredients:
here is the recipe for grilled vegetable and halloumi skewers with quinoa:

ingredients:
- 1 red bell pepper
- 1 zucchini
- 1 yellow squash
- 1 red onion
- 200g halloumi cheese
- 1 cup quinoa
- 2 cups vegetable broth
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar
- salt and black pepper to taste
- fresh herbs (such as basil or parsley) for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. soak wooden skewers in water for about 20 minutes to prevent them from burning during grilling.

2. preheat the grill to medium-high heat.

3. cut the red bell pepper, zucchini, yellow squash, and red onion into chunks.

4. cut the halloumi cheese into cubes.

5. thread the vegetables and halloumi onto the skewers, alternating between each ingredient.

6. in a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, and black pepper.

7. brush the skewers with the marinade mixture, ensuring all sides are coated.

8. in a saucepan, bring the vegetable broth to a boil. add the quinoa and reduce the heat to a simmer. cook the quinoa according to package instructions until it is tender and has absorbed the liquid.

9. while the quinoa is cooking, place the skewers on the preheated grill. cook for about 5-7 minutes per side, or until the vegetables are slightly charred and the halloumi cheese has softened.

10. once the quinoa is cooked, fluff it with a fork and divide it among three plates.

11. remove the grilled skewers from the grill and carefully slide the vegetables and halloumi off the skewers onto the plates with quinoa.

12. garnish with fresh herbs if desired.

enjoy your grilled vegetable and halloumi skewers with quinoa!

title: Caprese stuffed portobello mushrooms with garlic bread (500 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin
raw_text: 57. Caprese stuffed portobello mushrooms with garlic bread (500 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Italy)
ingredients:
: italian cuisine)

ingredients:
- 2 large portobello mushrooms
- 4 slices of mozzarella cheese
- 2 tomatoes, sliced
- fresh basil leaves
- olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste

for garlic bread:
- 2 slices of bread (gluten-free or regular)
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- butter or dairy-free margarine
- parsley, chopped
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).

2. clean the portobello mushrooms by removing the stems and scraping out the gills with a spoon. place them on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.

3. drizzle olive oil over the mushrooms and season with salt and pepper.

4. layer each mushroom with 2 slices of mozzarella cheese, tomato slices, and fresh basil leaves.

5. bake in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes until the cheese is melted and mushrooms are cooked.

6. while the mushrooms are baking, prepare the garlic bread. spread butter or dairy-free margarine onto one side of each slice of bread.

7. mix minced garlic and parsley in a small bowl, then sprinkle the mixture over the buttered side of the bread.

8. toast the garlic bread in a toaster oven or under the broiler until golden brown.

9. remove the stuffed mushrooms from the oven and serve them alongside the garlic bread.

enjoy the caprese stuffed portobello mushrooms with garlic bread!

title: Thai peanut chicken with broccoli and rice (800 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains peanuts, origin
raw_text: 58. Thai peanut chicken with broccoli and rice (800 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains peanuts, origin: Thailand)
ingredients:
: thailand)

ingredients:
- 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 2 cups broccoli florets
- 1 cup jasmine rice
- 1/4 cup unsalted peanuts, crushed
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon fresh ginger, minced
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons peanut butter
- 1 tablespoon honey
- 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
- 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes (optional)
- salt, to taste
- fresh cilantro, for garnish
preparation:
1. cook jasmine rice according to package instructions and set aside.
2. season chicken breasts with salt on both sides.
3. in a large pan or skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat.
4. add minced garlic and ginger to the skillet and sauté for about 1 minute until fragrant.
5. push the garlic and ginger to one side of the skillet and add the chicken breasts. cook for about 5-7 minutes on each side until fully cooked through. remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside to rest.
6. in the same skillet, add broccoli florets and sauté for about 3-4 minutes until tender. remove from heat.
7. in a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, peanut butter, honey, rice vinegar, and red pepper flakes (if using) until smooth.
8. slice the rested chicken breasts into strips.
9. return the skillet with the broccoli to low heat and pour the peanut sauce over it. stir until well combined and heated through.
10. divide the cooked rice between two plates.
11. top each plate with broccoli and chicken slices. sprinkle crushed peanuts over the top.
12. garnish with fresh cilantro.
13. serve hot and enjoy your delicious thai peanut chicken with broccoli and rice!

title: Eggplant rollatini with spaghetti marinara (600 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin
raw_text: 62. Eggplant rollatini with spaghetti marinara (600 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Italy)
ingredients:
: italian)

ingredients:
- 1 large eggplant
- 1 cup ricotta cheese
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 1/2 cups marinara sauce
- 4 ounces cooked spaghetti
- 1/4 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. slice the eggplant into 1/4-inch thick slices lengthwise.
3. place the eggplant slices on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake for about 10 minutes until softened.
4. in a bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, parmesan cheese, basil, salt, and black pepper. mix well.
5. spread a spoonful of marinara sauce on the bottom of a baking dish.
6. lay an eggplant slice on a flat surface and spoon a generous amount of the ricotta mixture onto one end. roll the eggplant slice tightly and place it seam side down in the baking dish. repeat with the remaining eggplant slices.
7. pour the marinara sauce over the rolled eggplants, making sure they are well coated.
8. cover the baking dish with foil and bake for about 20 minutes.
9. remove the foil and sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese on top of the eggplant rolls. return to the oven and bake for an additional 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. while the eggplant rollatini is baking, cook the spaghetti according to package instructions.
11. serve the eggplant rollatini with a portion of spaghetti marinara and enjoy!
cuisine: The cuisine type of this recipe is Italian.
ingredients_list: italian, eggplant, ricotta, cheese, parmesan, cheese, fresh, basil, salt, black, pepper, marinara, sauce, ounce, spaghetti, shredded, mozzarella, cheese

title: Thai red curry with chicken and jasmine rice (700 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains fish, origin
raw_text: 63. Thai red curry with chicken and jasmine rice (700 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains fish, origin: Thailand)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup jasmine rice
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 small onion, thinly sliced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 small zucchini, sliced
- 1 cup coconut milk
- 2 tablespoons thai red curry paste
- 1 tablespoon fish sauce
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 1 cup chicken breast, thinly sliced
- 1/2 cup fresh basil leaves
- lime wedges, for serving
preparation:
1. cook the jasmine rice according to package instructions.
2. heat the vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat. add the onion and garlic, stirring frequently until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
3. add the bell pepper and zucchini to the pan and cook for another 2-3 minutes until slightly softened.
4. in a small bowl, whisk together the coconut milk, thai red curry paste, fish sauce, and sugar until well combined.
5. pour the curry mixture into the pan with the vegetables and bring to a simmer.
6. add the sliced chicken to the pan and cook for 5-7 minutes until cooked through.
7. stir in the fresh basil leaves and cook for an additional minute until wilted.
8. serve the thai red curry over jasmine rice. garnish with lime wedges on the side. enjoy!

title: Beef and vegetable stir
raw_text: 68. Beef and vegetable stir-fry with noodles (600 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: China)
ingredients:
: chinese)

ingredients:
- 200g beef steak, thinly sliced
- 150g egg noodles
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 zucchini, sliced
- 1 carrot, sliced
- 1 small onion, sliced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon oyster sauce
- 1 tablespoon hoisin sauce
- 1/2 teaspoon sesame oil
- 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- spring onions, sliced (for garnish)
preparation:
1. cook the egg noodles according to the package instructions. drain and set aside.
2. in a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce, oyster sauce, hoisin sauce, sesame oil, and black pepper.
3. heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
4. add the beef slices and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until browned. remove from the wok and set aside.
5. in the same wok, heat the remaining tablespoon of vegetable oil.
6. add the garlic and onion, stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until fragrant and slightly softened.
7. add the red bell pepper, zucchini, and carrot, and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until the vegetables are crisp-tender.
8. return the beef to the wok and pour the sauce mixture over the stir-fry. stir well to coat everything evenly.
9. add the cooked egg noodles to the wok and toss to combine with the beef and vegetables.
10. cook for an additional 1-2 minutes until everything is heated through.
11. remove from heat and garnish with sliced spring onions.
12. divide the stir-fry into two portions and serve immediately. enjoy your beef and vegetable stir-fry with noodles!

title: Chicken piccata with lemon butter sauce and angel hair pasta (700 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin
raw_text: 70. Chicken piccata with lemon butter sauce and angel hair pasta (700 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Italy)
ingredients:
: italian)

ingredients:
- 2 chicken breasts
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- salt and pepper to taste
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 tablespoons unsalted butter
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 cup chicken broth
- 1/4 cup fresh lemon juice
- 1/4 cup capers, drained
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
- 6 ounces angel hair pasta
- grated parmesan cheese (optional)
preparation:
1. begin by preparing the chicken. place each chicken breast between two sheets of plastic wrap and pound with a meat tenderizer until thin. season both sides with salt and pepper.
2. in a shallow dish, combine the flour, salt, and pepper. dredge the chicken breasts in the flour mixture, shaking off any excess.
3. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. add the chicken breasts and cook for about 3-4 minutes on each side until golden brown and cooked through. remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
4. in the same skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. add the minced garlic and sauté for about 1 minute until fragrant.
5. pour in the chicken broth and lemon juice, scraping the bottom of the skillet to incorporate any browned bits. bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 2-3 minutes to reduce slightly.
6. stir in the capers and chopped parsley, then return the chicken to the skillet. coat the chicken with the sauce and cook for an additional 2 minutes to heat through.
7. while the sauce is simmering, cook the angel hair pasta according to the package instructions until al dente. drain the pasta and set aside.
8. divide the cooked pasta onto two serving plates. place a chicken breast on top of each portion and spoon the lemon butter sauce over the chicken and pasta.
9. optional: sprinkle grated parmesan cheese over the dish for added flavor (optional).
10. serve immediately and enjoy your delicious chicken piccata with lemon butter sauce and angel hair pasta!

raw_text: 74. Greek stuffed peppers with couscous and feta cheese (500 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Greece)

: greek

5. stuff each bell pepper half with the couscous mixture.

title: Honey lime grilled shrimp with quinoa and roasted vegetables (500 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains shellfish, origin
raw_text: 76. Honey lime grilled shrimp with quinoa and roasted vegetables (500 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains shellfish, origin: Various)
ingredients:
honey lime grilled shrimp with quinoa and roasted vegetables:

ingredients:
- 12 large shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 2 tablespoons honey
- juice of 2 limes
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 cup cooked quinoa
- 1 cup mixed roasted vegetables (such as bell peppers, zucchini, and carrots)
- fresh cilantro for garnish
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine the honey, lime juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper. whisk until well combined.
2. add the shrimp to the bowl and marinate for at least 15 minutes, or up to 1 hour in the refrigerator.
3. preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
4. thread the marinated shrimp onto skewers, if desired. this makes grilling easier and prevents the shrimp from falling through the grates.
5. grill the shrimp for about 2-3 minutes per side, or until they are pink and opaque.
6. while the shrimp are grilling, warm the cooked quinoa and roasted vegetables in a separate pan.
7. once the shrimp are cooked, remove from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes.
8. to serve, divide the cooked quinoa and roasted vegetables between two plates. top with the grilled shrimp.
9. garnish with fresh cilantro and a squeeze of lime juice if desired.
10. enjoy your honey lime grilled shrimp with quinoa and roasted vegetables!

title: Vegetarian pad Thai with tofu and vegetables (400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains soy, origin
raw_text: 77. Vegetarian pad Thai with tofu and vegetables (400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains soy, origin: Thailand)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 200g rice noodles
- 200g firm tofu, cubed
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 small onion, thinly sliced
- 1 medium carrot, julienned
- 1 bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 100g beansprouts

- 2 tablespoons lime juice
- 1 tablespoon brown sugar

3. in the same skillet, add the minced garlic and sliced onion. stir-fry for about 2 minutes until fragrant and slightly softened.

6. add the cooked rice noodles and tofu cubes to the skillet. gently toss everything together until everything is well combined and heated through.

china)

title: Falafel wrap with tahini sauce and tabbouleh (500 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin
raw_text: 79. Falafel wrap with tahini sauce and tabbouleh (500 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Middle East)
ingredients:
lebanon):

ingredients:
- for the falafel:
  - 1 cup dried chickpeas
  - 1 small onion, roughly chopped
  - 3 cloves garlic, minced
  - 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped
  - 1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
  - 1 teaspoon ground cumin
  - 1 teaspoon ground coriander
  - 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
  - salt and pepper, to taste
  - vegetable oil, for frying

- for the tahini sauce:
  - 1/4 cup tahini
  - 2 tablespoons lemon juice
  - 2 tablespoons water
  - 1 clove garlic, minced
  - salt, to taste

- for the tabbouleh:
  - 1/2 cup bulgur wheat
  - 1 cup boiling water
  - 1 cup fresh parsley, finely chopped
  - 1/4 cup fresh mint leaves, finely chopped
  - 1 small cucumber, diced
  - 2 medium tomatoes, diced
  - 1/4 cup red onion, finely chopped
  - 1/4 cup lemon juice
  - 2 tablespoons olive oil
  - salt and pepper, to taste

- for the wrap:
  - 2 large whole wheat tortillas
  - fresh lettuce leaves
  - sliced tomatoes
  - sliced cucumbers
  - sliced red onion
preparation:
1. falafel:
   - soak the chickpeas in cold water overnight. drain and rinse well.
   - in a food processor, combine the soaked chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, cilantro, cumin, coriander, baking soda, salt, and pepper. blend until you have a coarse mixture.
   - transfer the falafel mixture to a bowl and refrigerate for 1-2 hours.
   - shape the chilled falafel mixture into small, round patties.
   - heat vegetable oil in a frying pan over medium heat. fry the falafel patties until they are golden brown and crispy on all sides. drain on paper towels.

2. tahini sauce:
   - in a small bowl, whisk together tahini, lemon juice, water, minced garlic, and salt until smooth and creamy. adjust the consistency by adding more water if needed.

3. tabbouleh:
   - place the bulgur wheat in a bowl and pour boiling water over it. cover and let it sit for about 10 minutes or until the bulgur is tender.
   - fluff the bulgur with a fork and let it cool.
   - in a large bowl, combine the cooled bulgur, parsley, mint leaves, cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper. toss everything together until well combined.

4. wrap assembly:
   - warm the tortillas slightly to make them more pliable.
   - spread a generous amount of tahini sauce over the tortillas.
   - arrange lettuce leaves, falafel patties, tabbouleh, sliced tomatoes, sliced cucumbers, and sliced red onion down the center of each tortilla.
   - fold the sides of the tortilla inward and tightly roll it up to form a wrap.
   - cut the wraps in half and serve immediately.

enjoy the delicious and healthy falafel wrap with tahini sauce and tabbouleh!
taste:
Falafel: Salty
Tahini sauce: Sour
Tabbouleh: Sour
Wrap: Salty
ingredients_list: lebanon, falafel, dried, chickpea, onion, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, parsley, fresh, cilantro, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, baking, soda, salt, pepper, taste, vegetable, tahini, sauce, tahini, lemon, water, clove, garlic, minced, salt, taste, tabbouleh, bulgur, wheat, boiling, water, fresh, parsley, fresh, mint, leaf, cucumber, tomato, red, onion, lemon, olive, salt, pepper, taste, wrap, whole, wheat, tortilla, fresh, lettuce, leaf, tomato, cucumber, red, onion

title: Grilled vegetable pizza with whole wheat crust (500 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin
raw_text: 87. Grilled vegetable pizza with whole wheat crust (500 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Various)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 whole wheat pizza crust
- 1 cup marinara sauce

- 1 zucchini, sliced

title: Beef and mushroom risotto (700 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin
raw_text: 88. Beef and mushroom risotto (700 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, origin: Italy)
ingredients:
italian):

ingredients:
- 200g beef, thinly sliced
- 200g mushrooms, sliced
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 200g arborio rice
- 500ml beef or vegetable broth
- 100ml white wine
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- parmesan cheese, grated (optional)
- fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
2. add the sliced beef and cook until browned. remove from the pan and set aside.
3. in the same pan, add the chopped onion and minced garlic. sauté until the onion becomes translucent.
4. add the sliced mushrooms to the pan and cook until they have released their moisture and are lightly browned.
5. add the arborio rice to the pan and stir to coat it with the oil. cook for a few minutes until the rice starts to become opaque.
6. pour in the white wine and stir until it is absorbed by the rice.
7. begin adding the beef or vegetable broth to the pan, one ladleful at a time, stirring constantly. allow each ladleful to be absorbed before adding the next. continue this process until the rice is creamy and al dente.
8. return the beef to the pan and stir it into the risotto.
9. season with salt and pepper to taste.
10. remove the pan from heat and let it rest for a few minutes.
11. serve the beef and mushroom risotto hot, garnished with grated parmesan cheese (if desired) and chopped fresh parsley.

title: General Tso's tofu with steamed rice (400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten and soy, origin
raw_text: 92. General Tso's tofu with steamed rice (400 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten and soy, origin: China)
ingredients:
: chinese) :

ingredients:
- 1 block of firm tofu, drained and pressed
- 1/4 cup cornstarch
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon ginger, minced
- 1/2 cup vegetable broth
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons rice vinegar
- 2 tablespoons hoisin sauce
- 2 tablespoons brown sugar
- 1 tablespoon chili paste or sauce
- 1 tablespoon sesame oil
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons water
- steamed rice, for serving
- green onions, sliced for garnish
preparation:
1. cut the tofu into bite-sized cubes and toss them in 1/4 cup of cornstarch until coated.
2. heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
3. add the tofu cubes to the skillet and cook until crispy and golden brown on all sides. remove and set aside.
4. in the same skillet, add the minced garlic and ginger. sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
5. in a bowl, whisk together the vegetable broth, soy sauce, rice vinegar, hoisin sauce, brown sugar, and chili paste.
6. pour the sauce mixture into the skillet with the garlic and ginger. stir well and bring to a simmer.
7. add the crispy tofu back to the skillet and toss to coat with the sauce.
8. in a small bowl, mix together 1 tablespoon of cornstarch with 2 tablespoons of water to make a slurry.
9. pour the slurry into the skillet and stir until the sauce thickens.
10. drizzle sesame oil over the tofu and stir gently to combine.
11. serve the general tso's tofu over steamed rice and garnish with sliced green onions. enjoy!
ingredients_list: chinese, tofu, cornstarch, vegetable, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, minced, vegetable, broth, soy, sauce, rice, vinegar, hoisin, sauce, brown, sugar, chili, paste, sauce, sesame, cornstarch, water, rice, green, onion, garnish

title: Grilled lamb kebabs with mint yogurt sauce and couscous (800 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin
raw_text: 93. Grilled lamb kebabs with mint yogurt sauce and couscous (800 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: Middle East)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 400g lamb, cut into cubes
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 cup greek yogurt
- 2 tablespoons fresh mint, chopped
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1 cup couscous
- 1 ½ cups water
- salt to taste
- fresh mint leaves for garnish
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine the olive oil, ground cumin, ground coriander, paprika, salt, and pepper. add the lamb cubes and toss to coat well. let it marinate for at least 30 minutes.
2. preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
3. thread the marinated lamb cubes onto skewers and place them on the grill. cook for about 8-10 minutes, turning occasionally, until cooked to your desired doneness.
4. in the meantime, prepare the mint yogurt sauce. in a small bowl, mix together the greek yogurt, chopped mint, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. stir well until combined. set aside.
5. in a medium saucepan, bring the water to a boil. add salt to taste. stir in the couscous, cover the pan, and remove it from the heat. let it sit for about 5 minutes until the couscous absorbs the water. fluff it with a fork to separate the grains.
6. serve the grilled lamb kebabs with a side of couscous and a dollop of mint yogurt sauce. garnish with fresh mint leaves. enjoy your delicious grilled lamb kebabs with mint yogurt sauce and couscous!
ingredients_list: lamb, cube, olive, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, paprika, salt, pepper, taste, greek, yogurt, fresh, mint, lemon, couscous, water, salt, taste, fresh, mint, leaf, garnish

title: Eggplant and zucchini lasagna with garlic bread (600 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin
raw_text: 94. Eggplant and zucchini lasagna with garlic bread (600 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Italy)
ingredients:
: italian)

ingredients:
- 1 eggplant
- 1 zucchini
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 2 cups marinara sauce
- 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 slices of bread
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons butter, softened
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. slice the eggplant and zucchini into thin rounds.
3. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. add the eggplant and zucchini slices and cook until they are slightly softened, about 5-7 minutes. season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. in a separate bowl, mix together the minced garlic and softened butter. spread the garlic butter evenly onto the slices of bread.
5. place the garlic bread slices on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for about 10 minutes, or until the bread is crispy and golden. set aside.
6. in a small baking dish, spread a thin layer of marinara sauce on the bottom.
7. arrange a layer of eggplant and zucchini slices on top of the marinara sauce.
8. sprinkle a portion of the shredded mozzarella and grated parmesan cheese over the vegetables.
9. repeat steps 6-8 to create a second layer.
10. finish with a final layer of marinara sauce and cheeses.
11. cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes.
12. remove the foil and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
13. while the lasagna is baking, you can enjoy the garlic bread as a side dish or appetizer.
14. once the lasagna is done, let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
15. divide into 2 portions and serve each portion with a slice of garlic bread.
16. enjoy your delicious eggplant and zucchini lasagna with garlic bread!
cuisine: The cuisine type of the recipe is: Italian
ingredients_list: italian, eggplant, zucchini, olive, marinara, sauce, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, parmesan, cheese, salt, pepper, taste, bread, clove, garlic, minced, butter

title: Balsamic glazed salmon with roasted vegetables and quinoa (500 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains fish, origin
raw_text: 97. Balsamic glazed salmon with roasted vegetables and quinoa (500 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains fish, origin: Various)
ingredients:
balsamic glazed salmon with roasted vegetables and quinoa

ingredients:
- 2 salmon fillets (about 4-6 ounces each)
- 1 cup of quinoa
- 2 cups of mixed vegetables (such as broccoli, bell peppers, and carrots)
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
- 2 tablespoons of balsamic vinegar
- 1 teaspoon of honey
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh herbs (optional, for garnish)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).

2. cook quinoa according to package instructions. once cooked, set aside.

3. in a small bowl, mix together olive oil, balsamic vinegar, honey, salt, and pepper.

4. place the salmon fillets in a shallow dish and pour half of the balsamic mixture over them, coating them evenly. let them marinate for about 10 minutes.

5. meanwhile, prepare the vegetables by cutting them into bite-sized pieces. toss them with the remaining balsamic mixture.

6. place the marinated salmon fillets on one side of a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and arrange the vegetables on the other side.

7. roast the salmon and vegetables in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.

8. once cooked, remove the salmon and vegetables from the oven.

9. divide the cooked quinoa onto two plates. top each plate with a salmon fillet and some roasted vegetables.

10. garnish with fresh herbs (if desired) and serve hot.

enjoy your delicious and healthy balsamic glazed salmon with roasted vegetables and quinoa!
cuisine: The cuisine type of this recipe is "fusion."
ingredients_list: balsamic, glazed, salmon, roasted, vegetable, quinoa, salmon, fillet, ounce, quinoa, vegetable, broccoli, bell, pepper, carrot, olive, balsamic, vinegar, honey, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, herb, garnish

title: Scrambled eggs with spinach and feta (160 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Greek origin)
raw_text: 1. Scrambled eggs with spinach and feta (160 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Greek origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large eggs 
- 1 cup fresh spinach, chopped 
- 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese 
- 1 tablespoon olive oil 
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a medium-sized mixing bowl, crack the eggs and whisk them until well-beaten. set aside.
2. heat the olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
3. add the chopped spinach to the skillet and sauté for about 2 minutes, until wilted.
4. pour the beaten eggs into the skillet with the spinach.
5. using a spatula, gently scramble the eggs and spinach together, until the eggs are fully cooked but still slightly soft.
6. sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese over the scrambled eggs and continue to cook for another minute or until the cheese slightly melts.
7. season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. divide the scrambled eggs into two portions and serve hot.

each portion of scrambled eggs with spinach and feta contains approximately 160 calories. enjoy this delicious greek-inspired dish!
ingredients_list: egg, fresh, spinach, feta, cheese, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Avocado toast with smoked salmon (280 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains fish, American origin)
raw_text: 3. Avocado toast with smoked salmon (280 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains fish, American origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 slices of whole grain bread
- 1 ripe avocado
- 100g smoked salmon
- salt and pepper to taste
- optional toppings: lemon juice, red pepper flakes, fresh herbs
preparation:
1. toast the slices of bread until golden brown.
2. while the bread is toasting, slice the avocado in half and remove the pit.
3. scoop out the flesh of the avocado into a small bowl and mash it with a fork until smooth.
4. season the mashed avocado with salt and pepper, adjusting the taste to your preference.
5. spread the mashed avocado evenly onto the toasted bread slices.
6. top each slice with smoked salmon, ensuring it covers the entire surface.
7. optional: squeeze a little lemon juice over the salmon and sprinkle some red pepper flakes or fresh herbs for added flavor.
8. serve immediately and enjoy your delicious avocado toast with smoked salmon!
cooking_style: the cooking style for this recipe would be "toasted".
ingredients_list: whole, grain, bread, avocado, smoked, salmon, salt, pepper, taste, topping, lemon, red, pepper, flake, fresh, herb

title: Greek yogurt with honey and walnuts (200 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy and nuts, Greek origin)
raw_text: 4. Greek yogurt with honey and walnuts (200 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy and nuts, Greek origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup greek yogurt
- 2 tablespoons honey
- 2 tablespoons crushed walnuts
preparation:
1. take two serving bowls and divide the greek yogurt equally into each bowl.
2. drizzle 1 tablespoon of honey over each portion of greek yogurt.
3. sprinkle 1 tablespoon of crushed walnuts on top of each portion.
4. serve immediately and enjoy your greek yogurt with honey and walnuts!

title: Shakshuka with crusty bread (400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains eggs, Israeli origin)
raw_text: 6. Shakshuka with crusty bread (400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains eggs, Israeli origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 yellow bell pepper, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon chili flakes (optional, adjust to taste)
- 1 can (400g) crushed tomatoes
- salt and black pepper to taste
- 4 large eggs
- fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)
- crusty bread, sliced (for serving)
preparation:
1. in a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
2. add the chopped onion and sauté until translucent, about 5 minutes.
3. add the diced bell peppers and cook for another 5 minutes, until they start to soften.
4. stir in the minced garlic, cumin, paprika, and chili flakes (if using). cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
5. pour in the crushed tomatoes and season with salt and black pepper. simmer for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until slightly thickened.
6. make four small wells in the tomato mixture and crack an egg into each well.
7. cover the skillet and cook over low heat for about 5-8 minutes, or until the eggs are cooked to your liking.
8. remove from heat and garnish with fresh parsley.
9. serve the shakshuka with slices of crusty bread for dipping and enjoy!
ingredients_list: olive, onion, red, bell, pepper, yellow, bell, pepper, clove, garlic, minced, cumin, paprika, chili, flake, taste, tomato, salt, black, pepper, taste, egg, fresh, parsley, garnish, crusty, bread

title: Cheese and vegetable frittata (260 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Italian origin)
raw_text: 13. Cheese and vegetable frittata (260 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Italian origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large eggs
- 1/4 cup low-fat milk
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/8 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/4 cup diced bell peppers (any color)
- 1/4 cup diced zucchini
- 1/4 cup diced tomatoes
- 1/4 cup diced red onion
- 1 tablespoon chopped fresh basil
- 1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a medium-sized bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, and black pepper.
3. stir in the shredded mozzarella and grated parmesan cheese, reserving a small amount of parmesan for topping.
4. in a separate skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
5. add the diced bell peppers, zucchini, tomatoes, and red onion to the skillet. sauté for about 5 minutes until they are slightly softened.
6. pour the egg and cheese mixture over the sautéed vegetables in the skillet.
7. sprinkle the chopped basil and parsley evenly over the top.
8. cook on medium-low heat for 3-4 minutes until the edges start to set.
9. sprinkle the reserved parmesan cheese on top.
10. transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 12-15 minutes until the frittata is set and slightly golden on top.
11. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
12. cut into wedges and serve warm. enjoy your cheesy and vegetable frittata!
ingredients_list: egg, fat, milk, salt, black, pepper, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, parmesan, cheese, bell, pepper, color, zucchini, tomato, red, onion, fresh, basil, fresh, parsley, olive

title: Baked avocado eggs with bacon (380 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains eggs, American origin)
raw_text: 19. Baked avocado eggs with bacon (380 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains eggs, American origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 avocados
- 4 eggs
- 4 strips of bacon
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh parsley (optional, for garnish)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cut the avocados in half and remove the pits.
3. scoop out a small portion of the avocado flesh from each half to make room for the eggs. save the scooped-out flesh for another recipe or discard.
4. place the avocado halves in a baking dish or on a baking sheet lined with aluminum foil.
5. crack one egg into each avocado half. depending on the size of your avocados, you may need to remove some of the egg white to fit it into the avocado cavity.
6. season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. wrap one strip of bacon around each avocado half, securing it with toothpicks if necessary.
8. place the baking dish or sheet in the preheated oven and bake for about 20-25 minutes, or until the eggs are cooked to your desired level of doneness and the bacon is crispy.
9. remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes.
10. carefully remove the toothpicks (if used) and garnish with fresh parsley, if desired.
11. serve warm and enjoy your delicious baked avocado eggs with bacon!
ingredients_list: avocado, egg, strip, bacon, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Blueberry almond smoothie (300 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts, American origin)
raw_text: 24. Blueberry almond smoothie (300 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts, American origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup fresh or frozen blueberries
- 1 ripe banana
- 1/4 cup almond butter
- 1 cup almond milk
- 1 tablespoon honey
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 cup ice cubes
preparation:
1. in a blender, combine the blueberries, banana, almond butter, almond milk, honey, vanilla extract, and ice cubes.
2. blend on high speed until smooth and creamy, approximately 1-2 minutes.
3. taste and adjust sweetness if needed by adding more honey.
4. pour into two glasses and serve immediately.
5. you can garnish with a few extra blueberries or sliced almonds if desired.
6. enjoy your refreshing blueberry almond smoothie!
ingredients_list: fresh, frozen, blueberry, banana, almond, butter, almond, milk, honey, vanilla, extract, ice, cube

title: Mushroom and goat cheese frittata (320 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, French origin)
raw_text: 25. Mushroom and goat cheese frittata (320 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, French origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large eggs
- 1/2 cup sliced mushrooms
- 1 ounce goat cheese, crumbled
- 1 tablespoon chopped fresh herbs (such as parsley or thyme)
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (180°c).
2. in a bowl, whisk the eggs until well beaten. set aside.
3. heat the olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium heat.
4. add the sliced mushrooms to the skillet and sauté until they are tender and slightly browned, about 5 minutes.
5. pour the beaten eggs into the skillet, ensuring that they cover the mushrooms evenly.
6. sprinkle the crumbled goat cheese and chopped herbs over the eggs. season with salt and pepper.
7. cook the frittata on the stovetop for about 5 minutes, until the edges start to set.
8. transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for about 10-12 minutes, or until the frittata is set in the center and slightly golden on top.
9. remove the skillet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing.
10. serve the frittata warm, either on its own or with a side salad. enjoy your delicious mushroom and goat cheese frittata!
ingredients_list: egg, mushroom, goat, cheese, fresh, herb, parsley, thyme, salt, pepper, taste, olive

title: Spinach and feta breakfast muffins (200 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Greek origin)
raw_text: 26. Spinach and feta breakfast muffins (200 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Greek origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup spinach, chopped
- 1/2 cup feta cheese, crumbled
- 1/4 cup whole wheat flour
- 4 large eggs
- 1/4 cup milk
- 1/4 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c) and grease a muffin tin with cooking spray.
2. in a mixing bowl, combine the chopped spinach and crumbled feta cheese.
3. in a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, whole wheat flour, baking powder, salt, and black pepper.
4. pour the egg mixture over the spinach and feta mixture, and stir until well combined.
5. divide the mixture evenly among the muffin cups.
6. bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the muffins are set and golden brown on top.
7. remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.
8. enjoy these delicious spinach and feta breakfast muffins!
ingredients_list: spinach, feta, cheese, whole, wheat, flour, egg, milk, baking, powder, salt, black, pepper

title: Breakfast tacos with egg, cheese, and salsa (400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Mexican origin)
raw_text: 27. Breakfast tacos with egg, cheese, and salsa (400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Mexican origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 small tortillas
- 4 large eggs
- 1 cup shredded cheese (cheddar or mexican blend)
- 1/2 cup salsa
- salt and pepper to taste
- olive oil for cooking
preparation:
1. in a non-stick pan, heat a drizzle of olive oil over medium heat.
2. crack the eggs into a bowl and beat them lightly with a fork. season with salt and pepper.
3. pour the beaten eggs into the heated pan and cook, stirring occasionally, until they are scrambled and fully cooked.
4. warm the tortillas in a separate pan or in the microwave until they are pliable.
5. divide the cooked scrambled eggs evenly among the tortillas.
6. top each tortilla with shredded cheese and salsa.
7. fold the tortillas in half, forming tacos.
8. if desired, heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and lightly toast the assembled tacos for a minute on each side until the cheese melts and the tortillas are slightly crispy.
9. serve immediately and enjoy your delicious breakfast tacos!
ingredients_list: tortilla, egg, shredded, cheese, cheddar, mexican, blend, salsa, salt, pepper, taste, olive

title: Ricotta and berry
raw_text: 30. Ricotta and berry-stuffed French toast (380 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, American origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 slices of thick-cut bread
- 1/2 cup of ricotta cheese
- 1/4 cup of mixed berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, and raspberries)
- 2 large eggs
- 1/4 cup of milk
- 1 tablespoon of sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract
- butter or oil for cooking
- powdered sugar for dusting (optional)
- maple syrup for serving
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, combine the ricotta cheese and mixed berries. mix well until the berries are evenly distributed.

2. make two sandwiches by spreading the ricotta and berry mixture evenly between two slices of bread. press the sandwiches together gently.

3. in a shallow dish, whisk together the eggs, milk, sugar, and vanilla extract until well combined.

4. heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat and add a small amount of butter or oil.

5. dip each sandwich into the egg mixture, allowing it to soak for a few seconds on each side. make sure both sides are well coated.

6. place the dipped sandwiches onto the skillet and cook for about 3-4 minutes per side, or until golden brown and slightly crispy.

7. remove the french toast from the skillet and transfer to a serving plate.

8. optional: dust the french toast with powdered sugar for added sweetness.

9. serve the ricotta and berry-stuffed french toast warm with maple syrup drizzled on top.

enjoy your delightful ricotta and berry-stuffed french toast!
ingredients_list: bread, ricotta, cheese, berry, strawberry, blueberry, raspberry, egg, milk, sugar, vanilla, extract, butter, sugar, maple, syrup

title: Banana walnut muffins (250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts, American origin)
raw_text: 33. Banana walnut muffins (250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts, American origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 ripe bananas
- 1/4 cup vegetable oil
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 cup chopped walnuts
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c). grease a muffin tin or line with muffin liners.
2. in a mixing bowl, mash the ripe bananas until smooth.
3. add the vegetable oil, sugar, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and salt to the mashed bananas. mix well.
4. sift the all-purpose flour, baking powder, and baking soda into the bowl with the banana mixture. stir until just combined.
5. fold in the chopped walnuts.
6. divide the batter evenly among the prepared muffin cups, filling each about 3/4 full.
7. bake in the preheated oven for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
8. remove from the oven and let the muffins cool in the tin for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. serve and enjoy your delicious banana walnut muffins!
ingredients_list: banana, vegetable, sugar, vanilla, extract, cinnamon, salt, flour, baking, powder, baking, soda, walnut

title: Yogurt and fruit smoothie (200 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, American origin)
raw_text: 35. Yogurt and fruit smoothie (200 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, American origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup of low-fat yogurt

preparation:

title: Cream cheese stuffed strawberries (160 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, American origin)
raw_text: 36. Cream cheese stuffed strawberries (160 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, American origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 large strawberries
- 2 tablespoons cream cheese
preparation:
1. wash the strawberries under running water and pat them dry with a paper towel.
2. cut off the stems of the strawberries to create a flat base for stuffing.
3. use a small knife to carefully hollow out the center of each strawberry, creating a small cavity.
4. in a small bowl, mix the cream cheese until it becomes smooth and creamy.
5. spoon the cream cheese into a piping bag or a small plastic bag with the corner cut off.
6. gently squeeze the cream cheese into each strawberry, filling the hollowed-out cavity.
7. place the stuffed strawberries on a plate and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to chill.
8. serve the cream cheese stuffed strawberries as a delicious, low-calorie treat. enjoy!

title: Almond butter and banana toast (300 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts, American origin)
raw_text: 44. Almond butter and banana toast (300 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts, American origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 slices of whole wheat bread
- 2 tablespoons of almond butter
- 1 ripe banana, sliced
preparation:
1. toast the slices of bread until they are golden and crispy.
2. spread 1 tablespoon of almond butter on each slice of toast.
3. arrange the banana slices on top of the almond butter on one slice of toast.
4. place the other slice of toast on top to create a sandwich.
5. cut the sandwich diagonally into two equal portions.
6. serve and enjoy your almond butter and banana toast!
