title: Breakfast BLT with avocado (380 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, American origin)
raw_text: 45. Breakfast BLT with avocado (380 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, American origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 slices of bacon
- 4 slices of whole wheat bread
- 4 large lettuce leaves
- 1 ripe avocado, pitted and sliced
- 4 slices of tomato
- 2 tablespoons mayonnaise
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. place the bacon slices on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for about 12-15 minutes, or until crispy. alternatively, you can cook the bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crispy.
3. while the bacon is cooking, toast the bread slices.
4. once the bacon is done, remove it from the oven (or skillet) and let it cool on a paper towel to remove any excess grease.
5. take each slice of toasted bread and spread a tablespoon of mayonnaise on one side.
6. place two lettuce leaves on each piece of bread, followed by a slice of tomato and a few slices of avocado. season with salt and pepper.
7. divide the crispy bacon into two portions, and place two slices on top of each sandwich.
8. cover each sandwich with another slice of bread, mayo side down, to form a blt sandwich.
9. slice the sandwiches diagonally in half and serve immediately.

enjoy your delicious and healthy breakfast blt with avocado!
ingredients_list: bacon, whole, wheat, bread, lettuce, leaf, avocado, pitted, tomato, mayonnaise, salt, pepper, taste

title: Vegetable and cheese strata (320 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, American origin)
raw_text: 47. Vegetable and cheese strata (320 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, American origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4-5 slices of bread
- 1 cup of chopped vegetables (such as bell peppers, onions, and spinach)
- 1 cup of shredded cheese (such as cheddar or mozzarella)
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup of milk
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. grease a small baking dish that can hold two portions.
3. cut the bread slices into small cubes or tear them into chunks.
4. spread half of the bread cubes in the greased baking dish.
5. in a separate bowl, mix the chopped vegetables and shredded cheese.
6. spread half of the vegetable and cheese mixture over the bread cubes in the baking dish.
7. repeat the layering process with the remaining bread cubes and vegetable-cheese mixture.
8. in another bowl, beat the eggs together with the milk, salt, and pepper.
9. pour the egg mixture over the bread and vegetables in the baking dish.
10. gently press down the ingredients to ensure they are fully soaked in the egg mixture.
11. cover the baking dish with aluminum foil.
12. bake in the preheated oven for about 35-40 minutes or until the strata is set and golden brown on top.
13. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
14. cut the strata into portions and serve warm.

note: you can customize this recipe by adding other vegetables, herbs, or spices of your choice. enjoy!
ingredients_list: bread, vegetable, bell, pepper, onion, spinach, shredded, cheese, cheddar, mozzarella, egg, milk, salt, pepper, taste

title: Ricotta and cherry
raw_text: 54. Ricotta and cherry-stuffed French toast (380 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, American origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 slices of bread (preferably brioche or challah)
- 1/2 cup ricotta cheese
- 1/2 cup pitted cherries, chopped
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- butter for cooking
- maple syrup for topping (optional)
preparation:
1. in a medium-sized bowl, combine the ricotta cheese and chopped cherries. mix well until evenly incorporated.
2. lay out the bread slices and spread the ricotta and cherry mixture evenly on 2 slices of bread. place the remaining slices on top to create 2 sandwiches.
3. in a shallow dish, whisk together the eggs, milk, sugar, and vanilla extract until well combined.
4. heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat and add a pat of butter. allow it to melt and coat the surface of the pan.
5. dip each sandwich into the egg mixture, being sure to coat both sides well. allow any excess egg mixture to drip off.
6. place the dipped sandwiches onto the heated skillet and cook for about 3-4 minutes per side, or until golden brown and crispy.
7. once cooked, remove the french toast from the pan and transfer to plates. cut each sandwich in half diagonally and serve hot.
8. optionally, drizzle with maple syrup for added sweetness. enjoy your delicious ricotta and cherry-stuffed french toast!
ingredients_list: bread, preferably, brioche, challah, ricotta, cheese, pitted, cherry, egg, milk, sugar, vanilla, extract, butter, maple, syrup, topping

title: Egg and cheese breakfast roll
raw_text: 55. Egg and cheese breakfast roll-ups (320 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, American origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large eggs
- 1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 2 whole wheat tortillas
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, whisk the eggs until well beaten.
2. stir in the shredded cheddar cheese and season with salt and pepper.
3. heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and spray with cooking spray.
4. pour half of the egg mixture into the skillet, tilting to cover the bottom evenly.
5. cook for 2-3 minutes or until the edges start to set and the bottom is golden brown.
6. carefully flip the egg mixture using a spatula and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes on the other side.
7. repeat steps 3-6 with the remaining egg mixture.
8. place one cooked egg tortilla on each whole wheat tortilla and roll up tightly.
9. cut each roll-up in half and serve warm. enjoy your delicious egg and cheese breakfast roll-ups!
ingredients_list: egg, shredded, cheddar, cheese, salt, pepper, taste, whole, wheat, tortilla

title: Savory oatmeal with bacon and eggs (400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains eggs, American origin)
raw_text: 56. Savory oatmeal with bacon and eggs (400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains eggs, American origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup rolled oats
- 2 cups water
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 4 slices bacon
- 2 eggs
- 1 green onion, chopped
- 1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a saucepan, bring water to a boil. add the rolled oats and salt, reduce heat, and simmer for about 5 minutes or until the oats are cooked to your desired consistency. stir occasionally.
2. while the oats are cooking, cook the bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crispy. once cooked, transfer the bacon to a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess grease. crumble the bacon into small pieces and set aside.
3. in the same skillet, fry the eggs to your preferred doneness (fried or scrambled).
4. divide the cooked oats into two bowls. top each bowl with half of the crumbled bacon, fried eggs, chopped green onion, and shredded cheddar cheese.
5. season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. serve immediately and enjoy your savory oatmeal with bacon and eggs!
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, water, salt, bacon, egg, green, onion, shredded, cheddar, cheese, salt, pepper, taste

title: Greek yogurt and berry parfait (350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Greek origin)
raw_text: 57. Greek yogurt and berry parfait (350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Greek origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup greek yogurt
- 1 cup mixed berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)
- 2 tablespoons honey
- 1/2 cup granola
preparation:
1. in a bowl, mix the greek yogurt and honey until well combined.
2. spoon a layer of the yogurt mixture into two serving glasses or bowls.
3. add a layer of mixed berries on top of the yogurt.
4. sprinkle a layer of granola over the berries.
5. repeat the layers until the glasses or bowls are filled, ending with a layer of granola on top.
6. serve immediately and enjoy your greek yogurt and berry parfait!
ingredients_list: greek, yogurt, berry, strawberry, blueberry, raspberry, honey, granola

title: Quiche Lorraine with spinach (400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, French origin)
raw_text: 58. Quiche Lorraine with spinach (400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, French origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 refrigerated pie crust
- 4 slices of bacon, chopped
- 1 cup of spinach, chopped
- 1/2 cup of swiss cheese, shredded
- 1/2 cup of milk
- 2 large eggs
- salt and pepper to taste
- pinch of nutmeg
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. roll out the pie crust and press it into a 9-inch tart or pie pan. trim any excess crust hanging over the edge.
3. in a skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy. remove the cooked bacon from the skillet and drain it on paper towels. leave about 1 tablespoon of bacon grease in the skillet.
4. in the same skillet with the bacon grease, add the chopped spinach and sauté until wilted, for about 2-3 minutes. remove from heat.
5. in a medium bowl, whisk together the milk, eggs, salt, pepper, and nutmeg until well combined.
6. sprinkle half of the shredded swiss cheese over the prepared pie crust. follow by scattering the cooked bacon and sautéed spinach evenly on top.
7. pour the milk and egg mixture over the ingredients in the pie crust, making sure it fills the gaps.
8. sprinkle the remaining shredded swiss cheese on top.
9. place the quiche in the preheated oven and bake for about 25-30 minutes, or until the center is set and the top is golden brown.
10. once cooked, remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

enjoy your delicious quiche lorraine with spinach!
ingredients_list: pie, crust, bacon, spinach, swiss, cheese, shredded, milk, egg, salt, pepper, taste, pinch, nutmeg

title: Banana pecan pancakes (350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts, American origin)
raw_text: 59. Banana pecan pancakes (350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts, American origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 tablespoon granulated sugar
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 ripe banana, mashed
- 1/2 cup buttermilk
- 1/4 cup milk
- 1 large egg
- 1 tablespoon unsalted butter, melted
- 1/4 cup chopped pecans
- maple syrup, for serving
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
2. in a separate bowl, combine the mashed banana, buttermilk, milk, egg, and melted butter. mix well.
3. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and gently stir until just combined. be careful not to overmix; a few lumps are okay.
4. fold in the chopped pecans.
5. heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat. lightly grease with cooking spray or a small amount of butter.
6. pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the skillet for each pancake. cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook the other side until golden brown.
7. repeat with the remaining batter, adjusting the heat as needed.
8. serve the banana pecan pancakes warm with maple syrup.
9. enjoy your delicious american-style banana pecan pancakes!
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, baking, powder, baking, soda, salt, banana, buttermilk, milk, egg, unsalted, butter, pecan, maple, syrup

title: Mexican-style breakfast wrap with eggs and black beans
raw_text: 60. Mexican-style breakfast wrap with eggs and black beans (400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains eggs, Mexican origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large eggs
- 1/4 cup black beans, cooked and drained
- 1/4 cup salsa
- 1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 2 whole wheat tortillas
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro (optional)
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a bowl, whisk the eggs until well beaten. season with salt and pepper to taste.
2. heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and spray it with cooking spray or add a small amount of oil.
3. pour the beaten eggs into the skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, until they are scrambled and cooked through.
4. warm the tortillas in a microwave or on a dry skillet over low heat until pliable.
5. place the tortillas on a clean surface and divide the scrambled eggs evenly between them.
6. top the eggs with black beans, salsa, shredded cheese, and cilantro (if desired).
7. roll up the tortillas tightly, folding in the sides as you go.
8. if desired, heat a skillet over medium heat and lightly toast the wraps on each side until the cheese melts and the tortilla is slightly crisp.
9. cut the wraps in half diagonally and serve immediately.

enjoy your mexican-style breakfast wrap with eggs and black beans!
ingredients_list: egg, black, bean, salsa, shredded, cheddar, cheese, whole, wheat, tortilla, fresh, cilantro, salt, pepper, taste

title: Tomato and mozzarella bruschetta (320 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Italian origin)
raw_text: 61. Tomato and mozzarella bruschetta (320 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Italian origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 slices of italian bread
- 1 large tomato, diced
- 1/4 cup fresh mozzarella cheese, diced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons fresh basil leaves, chopped
- 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. place the slices of bread on a baking sheet and toast them in the oven until golden brown, about 5-7 minutes.
3. in a bowl, combine the diced tomato, mozzarella cheese, minced garlic, chopped basil leaves, and extra virgin olive oil. mix well.
4. season the tomato and mozzarella mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
5. remove the toasted bread from the oven and let it cool for a minute.
6. spoon the tomato and mozzarella mixture evenly onto each slice of toasted bread.
7. drizzle a little extra virgin olive oil over the top.
8. serve immediately and enjoy your delicious tomato and mozzarella bruschetta!
ingredients_list: italian, bread, tomato, fresh, mozzarella, cheese, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, basil, leaf, virgin, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Sausage and egg breakfast burrito (380 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains eggs, American origin)
raw_text: 62. Sausage and egg breakfast burrito (380 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains eggs, American origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large eggs
- 4 sausage links
- 1/4 cup diced onion
- 1/4 cup diced bell pepper
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro
- salt and pepper to taste
- 2 large flour tortillas
- 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
preparation:
1. in a non-stick skillet, cook the sausage links over medium heat until browned and cooked through. remove from skillet and slice into bite-sized pieces.
2. in the same skillet, add the diced onion and bell pepper. sauté until softened, about 3-5 minutes.
3. in a bowl, whisk together the eggs, chopped cilantro, salt, and pepper. pour the egg mixture into the skillet with the sautéed vegetables and cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, until the eggs are scrambled and cooked through.
4. warm the flour tortillas in a pan or microwave until pliable.
5. divide the scrambled eggs and sausage evenly between the tortillas. sprinkle shredded cheddar cheese on top.
6. roll up the tortillas tightly, tucking in the sides as you go.
7. optional: heat a clean skillet over medium heat and lightly toast the burritos on each side for a couple of minutes until the cheese is melted and the tortillas are lightly crispy.
8. cut each burrito in half and serve hot.
ingredients_list: egg, sausage, link, onion, bell, pepper, fresh, cilantro, salt, pepper, taste, flour, tortilla, shredded, cheddar, cheese

title: Baked eggs with asparagus and Parmesan (320 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Italian origin)
raw_text: 64. Baked eggs with asparagus and Parmesan (320 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Italian origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large eggs
- 8 asparagus spears
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- salt and black pepper to taste
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. trim the tough ends of the asparagus spears and discard. cut the asparagus into 2-inch pieces.
3. heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. add the asparagus and sauté for about 3-4 minutes until slightly tender. remove from heat.
4. grease two individual oven-safe dishes or ramekins with olive oil.
5. divide the sautéed asparagus evenly into the dishes.
6. crack two eggs into each dish over the asparagus.
7. sprinkle the grated parmesan cheese over the eggs.
8. season with salt and black pepper to taste.
9. place the dishes on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for about 10-12 minutes or until the eggs are cooked to your desired doneness.
10. remove from the oven and let it cool for a minute before serving.
11. enjoy your baked eggs with asparagus and parmesan while still warm.
ingredients_list: egg, asparagus, spear, parmesan, cheese, salt, black, pepper, taste, olive

title: Banana chocolate chip muffins (300 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, American origin)
raw_text: 65. Banana chocolate chip muffins (300 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, American origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 ripe banana
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 1/4 cup vegetable oil
- 1/4 cup milk
- 1/2 tsp vanilla extract
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 tsp baking powder
- 1/4 tsp baking soda
- 1/4 tsp salt
- 1/4 cup chocolate chips
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c). line a muffin tin with paper liners.
2. in a mixing bowl, mash the ripe banana using a fork until smooth.
3. add sugar, vegetable oil, milk, and vanilla extract to the mashed banana. mix well until combined.
4. in a separate bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
5. gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients. stir until just combined. do not overmix.
6. fold in the chocolate chips.
7. divide the batter equally among the prepared muffin cups.
8. bake in the preheated oven for about 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
9. remove from the oven and let the muffins cool in the tin for a few minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. serve and enjoy!
ingredients_list: banana, sugar, vegetable, milk, vanilla, extract, flour, baking, powder, baking, soda, salt, chocolate, chip

title: Almond joy smoothie (250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts, American origin)
raw_text: 68. Almond joy smoothie (250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts, American origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup of almond milk
- 1 frozen banana
- 2 tablespoons of unsweetened shredded coconut
- 2 tablespoons of unsweetened cocoa powder
- 2 tablespoons of almond butter
- 1 teaspoon of honey (optional)
- ice cubes (optional)
preparation:
1. in a blender, combine the almond milk, frozen banana, shredded coconut, cocoa powder, almond butter, and honey (if desired).
2. blend until smooth and creamy, adding ice cubes if you prefer a thicker consistency.
3. pour the smoothie into two glasses and garnish with a sprinkle of shredded coconut, if desired.
4. serve immediately and enjoy the delicious almond joy smoothie!

(note: if you have any allergies or dietary restrictions, please check the ingredients to ensure they are suitable for your needs.)

title: Caramelized onion and goat cheese tart (320 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, French origin)
raw_text: 70. Caramelized onion and goat cheese tart (320 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, French origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 sheet of puff pastry
- 2 large onions, sliced
- 1 tablespoon butter
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 2 ounces goat cheese
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh thyme leaves for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. roll out the puff pastry sheet to fit a tart pan or baking dish, and place it in the pan.
3. in a large skillet, melt the butter and olive oil over medium heat.
4. add the sliced onions to the skillet and sauté until soft and golden brown, about 15-20 minutes. stir occasionally to prevent burning.
5. sprinkle sugar over the caramelized onions and continue cooking for an additional 5 minutes to enhance the caramelization.
6. season the onions with salt and pepper to taste.
7. spread the caramelized onions evenly over the puff pastry.
8. crumble the goat cheese on top of the onions, distributing it evenly.
9. bake in the preheated oven for approximately 20 minutes, or until the puff pastry is golden brown and the goat cheese is slightly melted.
10. remove from oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
11. garnish with fresh thyme leaves before serving.
12. cut into portions and enjoy your delicious caramelized onion and goat cheese tart!
ingredients_list: puff, pastry, onion, butter, olive, sugar, ounce, goat, cheese, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, thyme, leaf, garnish

title: Blueberry almond muffins (250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts, American origin)
raw_text: 71. Blueberry almond muffins (250 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts, American origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup almond flour
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 1/2 cup plain greek yogurt
- 1/4 cup milk
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 egg
- 1/2 cup fresh blueberries
- 1/4 cup sliced almonds
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c) and line a muffin tin with paper liners.
2. in a mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, almond flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
3. in a separate bowl, whisk together the melted butter, greek yogurt, milk, vanilla extract, and egg.
4. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. do not overmix; a few lumps are okay.
5. gently fold in the fresh blueberries and sliced almonds.
6. divide the batter evenly among the muffin cups, filling each about 3/4 full.
7. bake for approximately 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
8. remove from the oven and allow the muffins to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. serve and enjoy your delicious blueberry almond muffins!

title: Vegetarian breakfast quiche with broccoli and feta (350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, American origin)
raw_text: 72. Vegetarian breakfast quiche with broccoli and feta (350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, American origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large eggs
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1/2 cup chopped broccoli
- 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. in a bowl, whisk together the eggs and milk until well combined. season with salt and pepper.
3. add the chopped broccoli and crumbled feta cheese to the egg mixture. stir to evenly distribute the ingredients.
4. grease a small baking dish or individual ramekins with cooking spray or butter.
5. pour the egg mixture into the prepared dish(es), dividing it evenly.
6. place the dish(es) in the preheated oven and bake for about 25-30 minutes, or until the quiche is set and slightly golden on top.
7. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

title: Zucchini and goat cheese frittata (320 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Italian origin)
raw_text: 73. Zucchini and goat cheese frittata (320 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Italian origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large eggs
- 1 small zucchini, thinly sliced
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 ounces goat cheese, crumbled
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh basil leaves for garnish
preparation:
1. in a medium-sized bowl, beat the eggs until well combined. season with salt and pepper.
2. heat the olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. add the minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute until fragrant.
3. add the sliced zucchini to the skillet and sauté for about 5 minutes until softened and slightly golden.
4. pour the beaten eggs over the zucchini in the skillet. allow the mixture to cook undisturbed for about 5 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is still slightly runny.
5. sprinkle the crumbled goat cheese evenly over the frittata. place a lid on the skillet and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the cheese has melted and the frittata is fully cooked.
6. remove the skillet from heat and let the frittata rest for a few minutes.
7. carefully slide a spatula around the edges of the skillet to loosen the frittata. carefully transfer it to a cutting board or serving plate.
8. cut the frittata into two portions and garnish with fresh basil leaves.
9. serve hot or at room temperature. enjoy!
ingredients_list: egg, zucchini, thinly, clove, garlic, minced, olive, ounce, goat, cheese, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, basil, leaf, garnish

title: Swiss cheese and mushroom omelette (350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Swiss origin)
raw_text: 77. Swiss cheese and mushroom omelette (350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Swiss origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large eggs
- 1/4 cup swiss cheese, grated
- 1/2 cup mushrooms, sliced
- 2 tablespoons unsalted butter
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. in a bowl, beat the eggs until well combined. season with salt and pepper.
2. in a non-stick skillet, melt 1 tablespoon of butter over medium heat.
3. add the sliced mushrooms to the skillet and sauté until they turn golden brown, about 5 minutes. remove from the skillet and set aside.
4. reduce the heat to low and add the remaining tablespoon of butter to the skillet.
5. pour in the beaten eggs, swirling the pan to evenly distribute them.
6. cook the eggs until the edges start to set, then sprinkle the grated swiss cheese evenly over the omelette.
7. add the sautéed mushrooms on one half of the omelette.
8. using a spatula, carefully fold the empty side of the omelette over the mushrooms.
9. continue cooking until the omelette is fully set and the cheese has melted, about 2-3 more minutes.
10. slide the omelette onto a serving plate.
11. garnish with fresh parsley and serve hot.

note: the nutrition information provided is an estimate and may vary based on portion size and specific ingredients used.
ingredients_list: egg, swiss, cheese, mushroom, unsalted, butter, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Breakfast pizza with eggs, bacon, and cheese (400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, American origin)
raw_text: 83. Breakfast pizza with eggs, bacon, and cheese (400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, American origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pre-made pizza dough
- 4 slices of bacon
- 4 large eggs
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven according to the pizza dough package instructions.
2. cook the bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crispy. remove from the skillet and drain on paper towels. crumble the bacon into small pieces.
3. roll out the pre-made pizza dough onto a greased baking sheet or pizza stone.
4. bake the pizza dough in the preheated oven until slightly golden, usually about 5-7 minutes.
5. remove the partially baked pizza dough from the oven and carefully crack the eggs onto it, evenly spacing them apart.
6. sprinkle the crumbled bacon and shredded cheddar cheese over the pizza, making sure to cover the eggs.
7. season with salt and pepper, to taste.
8. return the pizza to the oven and bake for about 10-12 minutes, or until the eggs are cooked to your desired level of doneness.
9. remove from the oven and allow it to cool slightly before slicing and serving.
10. enjoy your delicious breakfast pizza with eggs, bacon, and cheese!

title: Quinoa breakfast cookies with dried fruits and nuts (350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts, American origin)
raw_text: 84. Quinoa breakfast cookies with dried fruits and nuts (350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts, American origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup quinoa
- 1/2 cup almond flour
- 1/4 cup dried cranberries
- 1/4 cup chopped walnuts
- 1/4 cup chopped almonds
- 2 tablespoons maple syrup
- 1 tablespoon coconut oil, melted
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. cook the quinoa according to package instructions and let it cool completely.
3. in a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, almond flour, dried cranberries, chopped walnuts, chopped almonds, maple syrup, melted coconut oil, cinnamon, salt, and vanilla extract. mix well until everything is evenly combined.
4. take about 1/4 cup of the mixture and shape it into a cookie on the prepared baking sheet. repeat with the remaining mixture, placing the cookies about 2 inches apart.
5. bake in the preheated oven for 15-18 minutes or until the cookies are golden brown around the edges.
6. remove from the oven and let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes. then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely. 
7. serve and enjoy!
