title: Cabbage and sausage breakfast skillet (380 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, German origin)
raw_text: 85. Cabbage and sausage breakfast skillet (380 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, German origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 ounces of smoked sausage, sliced
- 1/2 small cabbage, thinly sliced
- 1 small onion, thinly sliced
- 1 clove of garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons of butter
- 1/4 cup of chicken broth
- salt and pepper to taste
- 2 large eggs
- 1/4 cup of grated cheese (cheddar or swiss)
preparation:
1. in a large skillet, heat the butter over medium heat until melted.
2. add the sliced sausage and cook until browned on both sides.
3. remove the sausage from the skillet and set aside.
4. in the same skillet, add the sliced onion and minced garlic. sauté until the onion becomes translucent.
5. add the sliced cabbage to the skillet and cook until it starts to wilt, about 5 minutes.
6. pour the chicken broth into the skillet and stir to combine. season with salt and pepper.
7. reduce the heat to low, cover the skillet, and cook for about 10-15 minutes, or until the cabbage is tender.
8. once the cabbage is cooked, remove the lid and increase the heat to medium-high.
9. create two wells in the cabbage mixture and crack an egg into each well.
10. sprinkle the grated cheese evenly over the skillet.
11. cover the skillet and cook for about 5 minutes, or until the eggs are cooked to your liking and the cheese has melted.
12. remove from heat and serve the cabbage and sausage breakfast skillet hot.

enjoy your delicious german-inspired cabbage and sausage breakfast skillet!
ingredients_list: ounce, smoked, sausage, cabbage, thinly, onion, thinly, clove, garlic, minced, butter, chicken, broth, salt, pepper, taste, egg, cheese, cheddar, swiss

title: Veggie omelette with zucchini and goat cheese (350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, French origin)
raw_text: 90. Veggie omelette with zucchini and goat cheese (350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, French origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 small zucchini, thinly sliced
- 1/2 small onion, thinly sliced
- 4 large eggs
- 2 tablespoons goat cheese, crumbled
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh herbs (such as basil or parsley), for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. heat one tablespoon of olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
2. add the sliced zucchini and onion to the skillet and sauté until they soften and turn slightly golden, about 5-7 minutes. remove from heat and set aside.
3. in a bowl, whisk the eggs together until frothy. season with salt and pepper.
4. return the skillet to medium heat and add the remaining tablespoon of olive oil.
5. pour the whisked eggs into the skillet, spreading them evenly.
6. cook the omelette for about 2 minutes, until the edges start to set.
7. sprinkle the sautéed zucchini and onions evenly over one half of the omelette.
8. crumble the goat cheese over the vegetables.
9. gently fold the other half of the omelette over the filling using a spatula.
10. cook for another 2-3 minutes, until the omelette is fully set and the cheese starts to melt.
11. slide the omelette onto a serving plate and cut it in half to serve two portions.
12. garnish with fresh herbs if desired.
13. serve hot and enjoy your delicious veggie omelette with zucchini and goat cheese!
ingredients_list: olive, zucchini, thinly, onion, thinly, egg, goat, cheese, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, herb, basil, parsley, garnish

title: Cauliflower and feta frittata (350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Italian origin)
raw_text: 93. Cauliflower and feta frittata (350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Italian origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups cauliflower florets
- 4 large eggs
- 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil
- 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. steam the cauliflower florets until they are fork-tender. drain and set aside.
3. in a mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, feta cheese, parmesan cheese, basil, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
4. heat olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium heat.
5. add the steamed cauliflower to the skillet and sauté for 2-3 minutes.
6. pour the egg mixture over the cauliflower and gently stir to evenly distribute the ingredients.
7. cook for about 3-4 minutes, until the edges start to set.
8. transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the frittata is set and slightly golden on top.
9. once cooked, remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
10. cut the frittata into two portions and serve warm. enjoy your delicious cauliflower and feta frittata!
ingredients_list: cauliflower, floret, egg, feta, cheese, parmesan, cheese, fresh, basil, garlic, powder, salt, pepper, taste, olive

title: Peanut butter and jelly overnight oats (380 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts, American origin)
raw_text: 94. Peanut butter and jelly overnight oats (380 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains nuts, American origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup rolled oats
- 2 tablespoons chia seeds
- 2 tablespoons peanut butter
- 2 tablespoons jelly (your choice of flavor)
- 1 1/2 cups almond milk
- 1 tablespoon honey (optional)
- 1/4 cup chopped peanuts (optional)
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, combine the rolled oats and chia seeds.
2. add the peanut butter, jelly, almond milk, and honey (if using) to the bowl. stir well to combine all the ingredients.
3. divide the mixture evenly into two mason jars or containers with lids.
4. close the lids tightly and refrigerate overnight or for at least 6 hours to let the oats soften and absorb the liquid.
5. once ready to serve, give the oats a good stir. if the mixture seems too thick, you can add a little more almond milk.
6. sprinkle chopped peanuts on top for added crunch and flavor (optional).
7. enjoy your peanut butter and jelly overnight oats!
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, chia, seed, peanut, butter, jelly, flavor, almond, milk, honey, peanut

title: Breakfast quesadilla with eggs and cheese (400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Mexican origin)
raw_text: 96. Breakfast quesadilla with eggs and cheese (400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Mexican origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large eggs
- 4 small flour tortillas
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 1/4 cup chopped onion
- 1/4 cup chopped bell pepper
- 1/4 cup chopped tomato
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin
- salt and pepper to taste
- cooking spray or vegetable oil
preparation:
1. in a bowl, beat the eggs until well combined. set aside.
2. heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat and spray with cooking spray or add a little vegetable oil.
3. add the chopped onion and bell pepper to the skillet and sauté for 3-4 minutes until they begin to soften.
4. add the beaten eggs to the skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, until they are scrambled and fully cooked. season with salt, pepper, and ground cumin.
5. remove the skillet from heat and set aside.
6. heat another skillet or griddle over medium heat. place one tortilla on the skillet and sprinkle with 1/4 cup of shredded cheddar cheese.
7. spread half of the scrambled eggs mixture over the cheese, then sprinkle with chopped tomatoes and fresh cilantro.
8. top with another tortilla and gently press down with a spatula. cook for 2-3 minutes until the bottom tortilla is crispy and golden brown.
9. carefully flip the quesadilla to the other side and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the cheese is melted and the second tortilla is crispy and golden brown.
10. repeat the process with the remaining tortillas and ingredients to make the second quesadilla.
11. remove the quesadillas from the skillet and let them cool slightly before slicing.
12. serve hot and enjoy your delicious breakfast quesadillas with eggs and cheese!
ingredients_list: egg, flour, tortilla, shredded, cheddar, cheese, onion, bell, pepper, tomato, fresh, cilantro, ground, cumin, salt, pepper, taste, spray, vegetable

title: Yogurt and fruit smoothie bowl (350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, American origin)
raw_text: 97. Yogurt and fruit smoothie bowl (350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, American origin)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup plain yogurt
- 1 cup frozen mixed berries
- 1 ripe banana
- 1 tablespoon honey
- 2 tablespoons granola
- fresh fruit for topping (e.g. sliced strawberries, blueberries, or kiwi)
preparation:
1. in a blender, combine the plain yogurt, frozen mixed berries, ripe banana, and honey.
2. blend until smooth and creamy.
3. pour the smoothie mixture into two bowls.
4. top each bowl with a tablespoon of granola and fresh fruit of your choice.
5. serve immediately and enjoy the refreshing and nutritious yogurt and fruit smoothie bowl.
ingredients_list: plain, yogurt, frozen, berry, banana, honey, granola, fresh, fruit, topping, strawberry, blueberry, kiwi

title: Whole wheat toast with avocado
raw_text: 6. Whole wheat toast with avocado: 180kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 slices of whole wheat bread
- 1 ripe avocado
- salt and pepper to taste
- optional toppings: sliced tomatoes, sprouts, or lemon juice
preparation:
1. toast the whole wheat bread slices until golden brown.
2. while the bread is toasting, cut the avocado in half and remove the pit. 
3. scoop out the avocado flesh into a small bowl and mash it with a fork until smooth.
4. add salt and pepper to the mashed avocado and mix well.
5. once the toast is ready, spread the mashed avocado evenly onto each slice.
6. if desired, add additional toppings such as sliced tomatoes, sprouts, or a squeeze of lemon juice for extra flavor.
7. serve immediately and enjoy your whole wheat toast with avocado!
ingredients_list: whole, wheat, bread, avocado, salt, pepper, taste, topping, tomato, sprout, lemon

title: Mini spinach and feta muffins
raw_text: 8. Mini spinach and feta muffins: 220kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon dried basil
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 cups fresh spinach, finely chopped
- 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 1/4 cup finely chopped red onion
- 1/4 cup milk
- 2 large eggs
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c) and grease a mini muffin tin.
2. in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, oregano, basil, and black pepper.
3. add the chopped spinach, crumbled feta cheese, and chopped red onion to the bowl and mix well.
4. in a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, eggs, and olive oil until well combined.
5. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. be careful not to overmix.
6. spoon the batter into the greased muffin tin, filling each cavity about 3/4 full.
7. bake for 12-15 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
8. remove the muffins from the oven and let them cool in the tin for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. serve the mini spinach and feta muffins warm or at room temperature. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, baking, powder, baking, soda, salt, dried, oregano, dried, basil, black, pepper, fresh, spinach, feta, cheese, red, onion, milk, egg, olive

title: Almond flour pancakes with berries
raw_text: 11. Almond flour pancakes with berries: 300kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains nuts.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup almond flour
- 2 tablespoons coconut flour
- 2 tablespoons melted butter
- 3 eggs
- 1/4 cup almond milk
- 1 tablespoon honey (optional)
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the almond flour, coconut flour, baking powder, and salt.
2. in another bowl, whisk together the eggs, almond milk, melted butter, honey (if using), and vanilla extract.
3. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until well combined and a smooth batter forms.
4. allow the batter to rest for 5-10 minutes, giving the flours some time to absorb the liquid.
5. heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat and lightly grease with butter or cooking spray.
6. pour about 1/4 cup of the batter onto the skillet for each pancake.
7. cook the pancakes for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and cooked through.
8. remove the pancakes from the skillet and set aside.
9. in a small saucepan, warm the mixed berries over low heat until they start to release their juices, about 3-4 minutes.
10. serve the almond flour pancakes with the warm berry sauce on top.
11. optionally, you can also top them with additional fresh berries and a drizzle of honey.
12. enjoy your delicious almond flour pancakes with berries!
ingredients_list: almond, flour, coconut, flour, butter, egg, almond, milk, honey, vanilla, extract, baking, powder, salt, berry, strawberry, blueberry, raspberry

title: Mini vegetable samosas
raw_text: 12. Mini vegetable samosas: 320kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup vegetable oil
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup water

for the filling:
- 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, potatoes, etc.), finely chopped
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ginger, grated
- 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
- 1/2 teaspoon garam masala
- 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (optional)
- salt to taste
- vegetable oil for frying
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine flour, vegetable oil, and salt. mix well until the mixture resembles breadcrumbs.
2. gradually add water and knead to form a smooth dough. cover the dough and let it rest for 15-20 minutes.
3. in a pan, heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil. add cumin seeds and let them sizzle.
4. add chopped onions, minced garlic, and grated ginger. sauté until onions turn translucent.
5. add chopped vegetables, turmeric powder, garam masala, red chili powder (if using), and salt. mix well and cook for 5-7 minutes until the vegetables are cooked through. remove from heat and let the filling cool down.
6. divide the dough into small lemon-sized balls. roll each ball into a thin circle.
7. cut each rolled circle into half. take one half-circle and fold it into a cone shape, using water to seal the edges.
8. fill the cone with the vegetable filling, about 1-2 tablespoons. seal the top edges of the cone with water, ensuring the filling is completely enclosed.
9. repeat steps 7 and 8 with the remaining dough and filling.
10. heat vegetable oil in a deep pan or fryer. once the oil is hot, carefully add the samosas and fry on medium heat until they turn golden brown and crispy.
11. remove the samosas from the oil and place them on a paper towel to absorb excess oil.
12. serve hot with chutney or sauce of your choice.

enjoy your mini vegetable samosas!
ingredients_list: flour, vegetable, salt, water, filling, vegetable, carrot, pea, potato, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, cumin, seed, turmeric, powder, garam, masala, red, chili, powder, salt, taste, vegetable

title: Avocado and egg toast
raw_text: 15. Avocado and egg toast: 400kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and eggs.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 ripe avocado
- 2 slices of bread
- 2 eggs
- salt and pepper to taste
- optional toppings: diced tomatoes, sliced red onion, chopped cilantro, hot sauce
preparation:
1. slice the avocado in half, remove the pit, and scoop out the flesh into a small bowl. mash the avocado with a fork until creamy, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
2. toast the bread slices until golden brown.
3. while the bread is toasting, heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. crack the eggs into the skillet, and season with salt and pepper. cook the eggs to your desired doneness (e.g., sunny-side up, over easy, etc.).
4. once the bread is toasted, spread the mashed avocado evenly onto each slice.
5. place a cooked egg on top of each avocado-covered bread slice.
6. if desired, add toppings such as diced tomatoes, sliced red onion, chopped cilantro, or hot sauce.
7. serve the avocado and egg toast immediately and enjoy!
ingredients_list: avocado, bread, egg, salt, pepper, taste, topping, tomato, red, onion, cilantro, hot, sauce

title: Zucchini fritters with tzatziki sauce
raw_text: 16. Zucchini fritters with tzatziki sauce: 430kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large zucchinis
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 green onions, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh dill
- 2 large eggs, beaten
- olive oil, for frying

for the tzatziki sauce:
- 1 cup greek yogurt
- 1/2 cucumber, grated and drained
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1 tablespoon chopped fresh dill
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. grate the zucchinis using a box grater or food processor. place the grated zucchinis in a colander and sprinkle with salt. let them sit for 10 minutes to drain excess moisture. squeeze out any remaining liquid using a clean towel.
2. in a large bowl, combine the grated zucchinis, flour, baking powder, salt, pepper, minced garlic, chopped green onions, and fresh dill. mix well.
3. add the beaten eggs to the zucchini mixture and stir until everything is combined.
4. heat a large skillet over medium heat and add enough olive oil to coat the bottom.
5. spoon the zucchini mixture into the hot skillet, forming small fritters. flatten each fritter slightly with the back of a spoon.
6. cook the fritters for about 2-3 minutes per side until golden brown. remove from the skillet and drain on a paper towel-lined plate.
7. to make the tzatziki sauce, combine the greek yogurt, grated and drained cucumber, minced garlic, lemon juice, chopped fresh dill, salt, and pepper in a bowl. stir well to combine.
8. serve the zucchini fritters with the tzatziki sauce on the side. enjoy!
ingredients_list: zucchini, flour, baking, powder, salt, black, pepper, clove, garlic, minced, green, onion, fresh, dill, egg, olive, tzatziki, sauce, greek, yogurt, cucumber, clove, garlic, minced, lemon, fresh, dill, salt, pepper, taste

title: Rice cakes with smoked salmon
raw_text: 17. Rice cakes with smoked salmon: 450kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains fish.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups of cooked rice
- 4 ounces of smoked salmon
- 2 tablespoons of chopped fresh dill
- 1 tablespoon of lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons of mayonnaise
- salt and pepper to taste
- cooking oil
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine the cooked rice, chopped fresh dill, lemon juice, mayonnaise, salt, and pepper. mix well until all ingredients are evenly incorporated.
2. take a handful of the rice mixture and shape it into a small cake. repeat this step until all the mixture is used.
3. heat a frying pan over medium heat and add a small amount of cooking oil.
4. place the rice cakes in the frying pan and cook for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and crispy.
5. while the rice cakes are cooking, thinly slice the smoked salmon into strips.
6. once the rice cakes are cooked, remove them from the heat and let them cool slightly.
7. top each rice cake with a strip of smoked salmon.
8. garnish with additional chopped fresh dill, if desired.
9. serve the rice cakes with smoked salmon as a delicious appetizer or snack. enjoy!
ingredients_list: rice, ounce, smoked, salmon, fresh, dill, lemon, mayonnaise, salt, pepper, taste

title: Oatmeal cookies with raisins
raw_text: 18. Oatmeal cookies with raisins: 480kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, softened
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 1/2 cup brown sugar, packed
- 1 large egg
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 1/2 cups old-fashioned oats
- 1 cup raisins
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c). 
2. in a mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, salt, and ground cinnamon. set aside.
3. in a separate large bowl, cream together the softened butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
4. beat in the egg and vanilla extract until well combined.
5. gradually add the dry flour mixture to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
6. stir in the oats and raisins until evenly distributed throughout the dough.
7. drop rounded tablespoonfuls of dough onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, spacing them about 2 inches apart.
8. bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
9. allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. enjoy your homemade oatmeal cookies with raisins!
ingredients_list: flour, baking, soda, salt, ground, cinnamon, unsalted, butter, sugar, brown, sugar, egg, vanilla, extract, fashioned, oat, raisin

title: Mini apple pies
raw_text: 19. Mini apple pies: 500kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, cold and cubed
- 1/4 cup cold water
- 3 cups apple, peeled and diced
- 1/4 cup granulated sugar
- 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour and salt.
2. add the cold, cubed butter to the bowl and use a pastry cutter or your fingers to cut the butter into the flour mixture until it resembles coarse crumbs.
3. gradually add the cold water to the bowl, mixing until the dough comes together.
4. divide the dough in half and shape each half into a disc. wrap them in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
5. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
6. in a separate mixing bowl, combine the diced apples, granulated sugar, all-purpose flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, and lemon juice. stir until the apples are evenly coated.
7. on a lightly floured surface, roll out one disc of dough to be about 1/8 inch thick. use a round cookie cutter or a glass to cut out circles approximately 4 inches in diameter.
8. place each circle of dough into a greased muffin tin, pressing it gently against the sides and bottom.
9. spoon the apple mixture into each dough-lined muffin cup, filling them to the top.
10. roll out the other disc of dough and cut out smaller circles or shapes to use as decorative tops for the pies, or simply use a fork to seal the pies closed.
11. place the decorative dough shapes or sealed dough on top of each pie, pressing the edges to seal.
12. make a small slit in the top of each pie to allow steam to escape during baking.
13. bake the mini apple pies in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes or until the crust is golden brown.
14. remove from the oven and allow the pies to cool for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
15. serve the mini apple pies warm or at room temperature. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, salt, unsalted, butter, water, apple, sugar, flour, ground, cinnamon, ground, nutmeg, lemon

title: Quinoa energy balls
raw_text: 20. Quinoa energy balls: 520kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains nuts.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup cooked quinoa
- 1/2 cup nut butter (such as almond or peanut butter)
- 1/4 cup honey or maple syrup
- 1/4 cup ground flaxseed
- 1/4 cup shredded coconut
- 1/4 cup chocolate chips
- 1/4 cup chopped nuts (such as almonds or walnuts)
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, nut butter, honey or maple syrup, ground flaxseed, shredded coconut, chocolate chips, chopped nuts, and vanilla extract. stir well to combine.
2. once the mixture is well combined, place it in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes to firm up and make it easier to handle.
3. after the mixture has chilled, remove it from the refrigerator and use your hands to shape it into small balls, about 1 inch in diameter.
4. place the quinoa energy balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. you can space them close together as they won't spread while baking.
5. once all the mixture has been rolled into balls, place the baking sheet in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour to allow the energy balls to firm up even more.
6. after the energy balls have chilled, they are ready to be enjoyed! store them in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.
ingredients_list: quinoa, nut, butter, almond, peanut, butter, honey, maple, syrup, ground, flaxseed, shredded, coconut, chocolate, chip, nut, almond, walnut, vanilla, extract

title: Mini cheese and spinach puffs
raw_text: 23. Mini cheese and spinach puffs: 600kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 package (10 oz) frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained
- 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/2 cup cream cheese, softened
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- 2 sheets puff pastry, thawed
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c). line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a mixing bowl, combine the drained spinach, mozzarella cheese, parmesan cheese, cream cheese, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. stir until well combined.
3. roll out one sheet of puff pastry onto a lightly floured surface. cut into small squares or circles using a cookie cutter.
4. place a spoonful of the spinach and cheese mixture onto each puff pastry piece. fold the pastry over to create a mini puff, sealing the edges.
5. repeat the process with the remaining puff pastry sheet and filling mixture.
6. place the mini cheese and spinach puffs on the prepared baking sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown and puffed up.
7. remove from the oven and let cool slightly before serving. enjoy as a tasty appetizer or snack!
ingredients_list: frozen, spinach, thawed, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, parmesan, cheese, cream, cheese, garlic, powder, salt, pepper, taste, sheet, puff, pastry, thawed

title: Baked falafel bites with tahini sauce
raw_text: 24. Baked falafel bites with tahini sauce: 630kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and sesame.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 can (15 oz) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
- 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped
- 1/2 small red onion, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional)
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1/4 cup breadcrumbs

for the tahini sauce:
- 1/4 cup tahini
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons water
- salt to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).

2. in a food processor, combine the chickpeas, cilantro, parsley, red onion, garlic, cumin, coriander, salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper (if using), lemon juice, and olive oil. pulse until well combined but still slightly chunky.

3. transfer the mixture to a bowl and stir in the breadcrumbs. mix well until the mixture holds together.

4. shape the mixture into small falafel balls, about 1-1.5 inches in diameter, and place them on a greased baking sheet.

5. bake the falafel bites in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, flipping them halfway through, until they are golden brown and crispy.

6. meanwhile, prepare the tahini sauce by combining tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic, water, and salt in a small bowl. whisk until smooth and creamy.

7. once the falafel bites are cooked, remove them from the oven and let them cool slightly before serving.

8. serve the baked falafel bites with the tahini sauce on the side for dipping. enjoy!
ingredients_list: chickpea, fresh, cilantro, fresh, parsley, red, onion, clove, garlic, minced, cumin, coriander, salt, black, pepper, cayenne, pepper, lemon, olive, breadcrumb, tahini, sauce, tahini, lemon, clove, garlic, minced, water, salt, taste

title: Stuffed mushrooms with feta
raw_text: 25. Stuffed mushrooms with feta: 650kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 12 large mushrooms
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 cup bread crumbs
- 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c). 
2. remove the stems from the mushrooms and chop them finely.
3. heat the olive oil in a pan over medium heat. add the chopped onion and minced garlic, and sauté until golden and fragrant, about 5 minutes.
4. add the chopped mushroom stems and sauté for an additional 3 minutes, until softened.
5. stir in the bread crumbs and cook for another 2 minutes until they are slightly toasted.
6. remove the pan from heat, and let the mixture cool for a few minutes.
7. in a bowl, combine the sautéed mixture with the crumbled feta cheese, chopped parsley, salt, and pepper. mix until well combined.
8. lightly grease a baking dish. stuff each mushroom cap with the filling, allowing it to mound slightly.
9. place the stuffed mushrooms in the baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender and the filling is golden brown on top.
10. remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving. enjoy!
ingredients_list: mushroom, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, bread, crumb, feta, cheese, fresh, parsley, salt, pepper, taste

title: Sweet potato and black bean quesadillas
raw_text: 26. Sweet potato and black bean quesadillas: 680kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and diced
- 1 can black beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 small red onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- salt and black pepper to taste
- 4 large tortillas
- 1 cup shredded cheese (cheddar or mexican blend)
- fresh cilantro, for garnish
- greek yogurt or sour cream, for serving
preparation:
1. in a large pan, heat olive oil over medium heat. add the diced sweet potatoes and cook until tender, about 10-12 minutes.
2. add the red bell pepper, red onion, and garlic to the pan and cook for an additional 3-4 minutes, until the vegetables are softened.
3. stir in the black beans, cumin, chili powder, paprika, salt, and black pepper. cook for another 2-3 minutes until the flavors are well combined.
4. remove the mixture from heat and set aside.
5. preheat a separate pan or griddle over medium heat.
6. place one tortilla on the pan and sprinkle with a quarter of the shredded cheese.
7. spoon a quarter of the sweet potato and black bean mixture onto one half of the tortilla.
8. fold the tortilla in half, pressing down gently with a spatula to seal the quesadilla.
9. cook for 2-3 minutes on each side, until the tortilla is crispy and the cheese is melted.
10. repeat with the remaining tortillas and filling.
11. remove the quesadillas from the pan and let them cool slightly before cutting into triangles.
12. garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with greek yogurt or sour cream on the side. enjoy!
ingredients_list: sweet, potato, black, bean, red, bell, pepper, red, onion, clove, garlic, minced, cumin, chili, powder, paprika, salt, black, pepper, taste, tortilla, shredded, cheese, cheddar, mexican, blend, fresh, cilantro, garnish, greek, yogurt, sour, cream

title: Pancakes with maple syrup and bacon
raw_text: 27. Pancakes with maple syrup and bacon: 700kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and pork.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 tablespoons granulated sugar
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 1 large egg
- 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted
- maple syrup, for serving
- bacon, cooked crispy, for serving
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
2. in another bowl, whisk together the buttermilk, egg, and melted butter.
3. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. be careful not to overmix; it's okay if there are a few lumps.
4. preheat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat.
5. scoop 1/4 cup portions of the batter onto the skillet, spreading it slightly with the back of a spoon into a circular shape.
6. cook until bubbles form on the surface of the pancake, then flip and cook for another minute or until golden brown.
7. remove the cooked pancakes from the skillet and keep warm.
8. in a separate skillet, cook the bacon until crispy. place it on paper towels to drain any excess grease.
9. serve the pancakes topped with crispy bacon, and drizzle with maple syrup.
10. enjoy your delicious pancakes with maple syrup and bacon!
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, baking, powder, baking, soda, salt, buttermilk, egg, unsalted, butter, maple, syrup, bacon, crispy

title: Baked ham and cheese sliders
raw_text: 32. Baked ham and cheese sliders: 860kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and pork.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 12 slider buns
- 12 slices of ham
- 12 slices of cheese (such as swiss or cheddar)
- 1/2 cup mayonnaise
- 1/4 cup melted butter
- 1 tablespoon dijon mustard
- 1 tablespoon poppy seeds
- 1 tablespoon dried minced onion
- 1/2 teaspoon worcestershire sauce
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. slice the slider buns in half and place the bottom halves in a baking dish.
3. spread a thin layer of mayonnaise onto each bun.
4. fold each slice of ham in half and place it on top of each bun.
5. follow by placing a slice of cheese on top of the ham.
6. spread another layer of mayonnaise onto the top halves of the slider buns and place them on top of the cheese to complete the sliders.
7. in a small bowl, whisk together melted butter, dijon mustard, poppy seeds, dried minced onion, and worcestershire sauce until well combined.
8. pour the butter mixture evenly over the slider buns, making sure to cover all of them.
9. cover the baking dish with aluminum foil.
10. place the sliders in the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the sliders are heated through.
11. remove the foil and bake for an additional 5 minutes, or until the buns are lightly toasted.
12. remove from the oven and serve warm. enjoy!
ingredients_list: bun, ham, cheese, swiss, cheddar, mayonnaise, butter, dijon, mustard, poppy, seed, dried, minced, onion, worcestershire, sauce

title: Croissant with cream cheese and jam
raw_text: 34. Croissant with cream cheese and jam: 920kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 croissants
- 4 tablespoons cream cheese
- 4 tablespoons jam (your choice of flavor)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. cut the croissants in half horizontally to create a top and bottom half.
3. spread 2 tablespoons of cream cheese on the bottom half of each croissant.
4. spread 2 tablespoons of jam on top of the cream cheese.
5. place the top half of the croissant over the jam and cream cheese.
6. repeat steps 2-5 for the second croissant.
7. place the croissants on a baking sheet.
8. bake in the preheated oven for about 10 minutes, or until the croissants are golden brown and crispy.
9. remove from the oven and let them cool slightly before serving.
10. enjoy your delicious croissant with cream cheese and jam!
ingredients_list: croissant, cream, cheese, jam, flavor

title: Bagel with lox and cream cheese
raw_text: 36. Bagel with lox and cream cheese: 980kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten, fish, and dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 bagel
- 100 grams of smoked salmon (lox)
- 2 tablespoons of cream cheese
- optional toppings: sliced red onion, capers, dill
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. slice the bagel in half horizontally.
3. place the bagel halves on a baking sheet and toast them in the preheated oven until they turn golden brown, about 5-7 minutes.
4. remove the bagel halves from the oven and let them cool for a minute.
5. spread the cream cheese evenly on each bagel half.
6. top one bagel half with smoked salmon (lox). 
7. optional: add sliced red onion, a few capers, and fresh dill on top of the salmon.
8. place the other bagel half on top to make a sandwich.
9. serve and enjoy your delicious bagel with lox and cream cheese!

note: you can customize the toppings according to your preference.
ingredients_list: bagel, gram, smoked, salmon, lox, cream, cheese, topping, red, onion, caper, dill

title: Carrot cake with cream cheese frosting
raw_text: 37. Carrot cake with cream cheese frosting: 1000kcal per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten and dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 2 cups grated carrots
- 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar
- 1/2 cup vegetable oil
- 1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce
- 4 large eggs
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
- 1/4 teaspoon salt

for the cream cheese frosting:
- 8 ounces cream cheese, softened
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, softened
- 4 cups powdered sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c). grease and flour a 9x13-inch baking pan.
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the grated carrots, sugar, vegetable oil, applesauce, eggs, and vanilla extract. mix well.
3. in a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
4. gradually add the dry ingredients to the carrot mixture and mix until just combined.
5. pour the batter into the prepared baking pan and spread it evenly.
6. bake in the preheated oven for about 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
7. remove the cake from the oven and let it cool completely in the pan on a wire rack.
8. in the meantime, prepare the cream cheese frosting. in a mixing bowl, beat the cream cheese and butter together until creamy and smooth.
9. gradually add the powdered sugar and continue beating until well combined and fluffy. mix in the vanilla extract.
10. once the cake has cooled, spread the cream cheese frosting evenly over the top.
11. cut into slices and serve. enjoy your homemade carrot cake with cream cheese frosting!
ingredients_list: flour, carrot, sugar, vegetable, unsweetened, applesauce, egg, vanilla, extract, baking, powder, baking, soda, ground, cinnamon, ground, nutmeg, salt, cream, cheese, ounce, cream, cheese, unsalted, butter, sugar, vanilla, extract

title: Apple and cinnamon granola bars
raw_text: 38. Apple and cinnamon granola bars: 200kcal per portion, 5 portions, contains gluten.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups old-fashioned oats
- 1 cup unsweetened applesauce
- 1/4 cup honey
- 1/4 cup almond butter
- 1/2 cup chopped dried apples
- 1/4 cup chopped almonds
- 1/4 cup raisins
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c) and line an 8x8-inch (20x20 cm) baking pan with parchment paper.
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the oats, chopped dried apples, chopped almonds, raisins, ground cinnamon, and salt. mix well.
3. in a separate microwave-safe bowl, heat the applesauce, honey, almond butter, and vanilla extract until melted and well combined. this usually takes about 30 seconds to 1 minute in the microwave.
4. pour the wet mixture over the dry ingredients and stir until everything is evenly coated.
5. transfer the mixture to the lined baking pan and press it down firmly and evenly.
6. bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
7. remove from the oven and let it cool completely in the pan before cutting into bars.
8. once cooled, use a sharp knife to cut into bars or squares.
9. store the granola bars in an airtight container for up to 1 week. enjoy as a delicious and nutritious snack on-the-go!
ingredients_list: fashioned, oat, unsweetened, applesauce, honey, almond, butter, dried, apple, almond, raisin, ground, cinnamon, vanilla, extract, salt

title: Mini spinach and feta quiche
raw_text: 41. Mini spinach and feta quiche: 660kcal per portion, 5 portions, contains gluten and dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 sheet of puff pastry
- 1 cup of fresh spinach, chopped
- 1/2 cup of feta cheese, crumbled
- 4 eggs
- 1/2 cup of milk
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c) and lightly grease a mini muffin tin.

2. cut the puff pastry sheet into small squares that fit into the muffin tin. place each square into the individual muffin cups, pressing the dough against the sides and bottom.

3. in a mixing bowl, combine the chopped spinach and crumbled feta cheese.

4. in a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, and pepper.

5. spoon the spinach and feta mixture into each puff pastry cup, filling about halfway. 

6. pour the egg mixture over the spinach and feta, filling each cup almost to the top.

7. bake in the preheated oven for about 15-18 minutes, or until the quiches are puffed and golden brown on top.

8. allow the quiches to cool slightly before removing them from the muffin tin. serve warm or at room temperature.

9. enjoy your mini spinach and feta quiches!
ingredients_list: puff, pastry, fresh, spinach, feta, cheese, egg, milk, salt, pepper, taste

title: Peanut butter and banana energy balls
raw_text: 42. Peanut butter and banana energy balls: 800kcal per portion, 5 portions, contains nuts.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup rolled oats
- 1/2 cup peanut butter
- 1/4 cup honey
- 1 ripe banana, mashed
- 1/4 cup chopped nuts (optional)
- 1/4 cup chocolate chips (optional)
- 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon (optional)
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the rolled oats, peanut butter, honey, and mashed banana.
2. if desired, add chopped nuts, chocolate chips, and cinnamon to the mixture.
3. stir well until all ingredients are evenly incorporated.
4. place the mixture in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes to firm up.
5. once chilled, use your hands to roll small portions of the mixture into balls.
6. arrange the energy balls on a baking sheet or plate lined with parchment paper.
7. repeat until all the mixture is used.
8. store the energy balls in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week.
9. enjoy as a quick and nutritious snack!
ingredients_list: rolled, oat, peanut, butter, honey, banana, nut, chocolate, chip, cinnamon

title: Stuffed bell peppers with quinoa and feta
raw_text: 43. Stuffed bell peppers with quinoa and feta: 840kcal per portion, 5 portions, contains dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 bell peppers (any color)
- 1 cup cooked quinoa
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tomato, diced
- 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes. set aside.
3. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
4. add the diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet and sauté until the onion becomes translucent.
5. stir in the diced tomato and cook for another 2 minutes.
6. add the cooked quinoa, dried oregano, salt, and pepper to the skillet. mix well.
7. remove the skillet from heat and stir in the crumbled feta cheese and chopped fresh parsley.
8. stuff each bell pepper with the quinoa-feta mixture and place them in a baking dish.
9. bake the stuffed bell peppers in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, until the peppers are tender and the filling is heated through.
10. serve the stuffed bell peppers hot as a main dish or as a side dish with your favorite sauce if desired. enjoy!
ingredients_list: bell, pepper, color, quinoa, onion, clove, garlic, minced, tomato, feta, cheese, fresh, parsley, olive, dried, oregano, salt, pepper, taste

title: Honey mustard chicken wings
raw_text: 47. Honey mustard chicken wings: 1600kcal per portion, 5 portions, contains gluten.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 pounds chicken wings
- 1/4 cup honey
- 2 tablespoons dijon mustard
- 2 tablespoons whole grain mustard
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a large bowl, mix together the honey, dijon mustard, whole grain mustard, olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, salt, and black pepper.
3. add the chicken wings to the bowl and toss them in the marinade until well coated. let them marinate for at least 30 minutes, or up to overnight in the refrigerator.
4. once marinated, place the chicken wings on the prepared baking sheet, leaving space between each wing.
5. bake the wings in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes, or until they are cooked through and crispy. you can flip them halfway through cooking to ensure even browning.
6. remove the wings from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving. serve hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: pound, chicken, wing, honey, dijon, mustard, whole, grain, mustard, olive, lemon, clove, garlic, minced, salt, black, pepper

title: Banana and chocolate protein smoothie
raw_text: 48. Banana and chocolate protein smoothie: 1800kcal per portion, 5 portions, contains dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 ripe banana
- 1 cup milk (dairy or plant-based)
- 1 scoop chocolate protein powder
- 1 tablespoon honey or maple syrup
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/4 cup ice cubes
preparation:
1. peel and slice the banana into chunks.
2. in a blender, add the banana slices, milk, chocolate protein powder, honey or maple syrup, vanilla extract, and ice cubes.
3. blend everything until smooth and creamy.
4. taste and adjust the sweetness if needed by adding more honey or maple syrup.
5. pour the smoothie into a glass and enjoy immediately.
ingredients_list: banana, milk, dairy, plant, scoop, chocolate, protein, powder, honey, maple, syrup, vanilla, extract, ice, cube

title: Cheese and vegetable quesadillas
raw_text: 49. Cheese and vegetable quesadillas: 2000kcal per portion, 5 portions, contains gluten and dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large flour tortillas
- 1 cup shredded cheese (cheddar, mozzarella, or a blend)
- 1/2 cup sliced vegetables (bell peppers, onions, mushrooms, zucchini, etc.)
- 2 tablespoons butter or oil
preparation:
1. heat a large skillet over medium heat.
2. place one tortilla in the skillet and sprinkle half of the shredded cheese evenly over the tortilla.
3. arrange the sliced vegetables on top of the cheese.
4. sprinkle the remaining cheese over the vegetables.
5. place the second tortilla on top to create a quesadilla.
6. cook for about 2-3 minutes per side, or until the tortillas are crispy and the cheese is melted.
7. remove from the skillet and let it cool for a minute.
8. cut the quesadilla into wedges and serve hot.
9. repeat the process with the remaining ingredients to make the second quesadilla.
ingredients_list: flour, tortilla, shredded, cheese, cheddar, mozzarella, blend, vegetable, bell, pepper, onion, mushroom, zucchini, butter

title: Sundried tomato and feta stuffed mushrooms
raw_text: 53. Sundried tomato and feta stuffed mushrooms: 800kcal per portion, 10 portions, contains dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 12 large button mushrooms
- 1/2 cup sundried tomatoes, chopped
- 1/2 cup feta cheese, crumbled
- 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. wash the mushrooms, remove the stems, and pat them dry.
3. in a bowl, combine the sundried tomatoes, feta cheese, parsley, garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
4. spoon the filling into the mushroom caps, pressing it firmly.
5. place the stuffed mushrooms on a baking sheet.
6. bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender and the filling is melted and golden.
7. remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.
8. garnish with additional chopped parsley, if desired.
9. enjoy these delicious sundried tomato and feta stuffed mushrooms as an appetizer or a side dish.
ingredients_list: mushroom, sundried, tomato, feta, cheese, fresh, parsley, clove, garlic, minced, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Mini spinach and cheese turnovers
raw_text: 55. Mini spinach and cheese turnovers: 1200kcal per portion, 10 portions, contains gluten and dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups fresh spinach, chopped
- 1 cup shredded cheese (such as cheddar or mozzarella)
- 1/4 cup finely chopped onion
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 package store-bought puff pastry sheets
- 1 egg, beaten
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the onions and garlic, and sauté until they become translucent and fragrant.
3. add the chopped spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted, about 2-3 minutes. remove from heat and let it cool slightly.
4. in a bowl, combine the cooked spinach mixture with the shredded cheese. season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. on a lightly floured surface, roll out the puff pastry sheets to about 1/4 inch thickness. cut out small squares or circles using a cookie cutter or knife.
6. place a spoonful of the spinach and cheese mixture onto half of each pastry piece, avoiding getting too close to the edges.
7. fold the pastry over the filling to create a turnover shape. press the edges with a fork to seal them together.
8. place the turnovers on the prepared baking sheet and brush each one with the beaten egg.
9. bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes or until the turnovers turn golden brown and crispy.
10. remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving. enjoy!
ingredients_list: fresh, spinach, shredded, cheese, cheddar, mozzarella, onion, clove, garlic, minced, olive, salt, pepper, taste, puff, pastry, sheet, egg

title: Assorted mini quiches (spinach, mushroom, and cheese)
raw_text: 61. Assorted mini quiches (spinach, mushroom, and cheese): 300kcal per portion, 20 portions, contains gluten and dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 sheet of frozen puff pastry, thawed
- 1 cup cooked spinach, drained and chopped
- 1 cup mushrooms, sliced
- 1 cup shredded cheese (such as cheddar or swiss)
- 4 eggs
- 1/2 cup milk
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. on a lightly floured surface, roll out the puff pastry sheet to make it slightly thinner.
3. cut the puff pastry into small circles or squares to fit into a mini muffin tin.
4. press each piece of puff pastry into the muffin tin, making sure it forms a cup shape.
5. in a skillet, sauté the mushrooms until they release their moisture and start to brown. remove from heat and set aside.
6. in a bowl, beat the eggs and milk together. season with salt and pepper.
7. place a teaspoon of chopped spinach, a few slices of mushrooms, and a sprinkle of cheese into each puff pastry cup.
8. pour the egg mixture over the filling in each cup, filling them about 2/3 full.
9. bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the quiches are puffed and golden brown.
10. remove from the oven and allow them to cool slightly in the muffin tin.
11. serve warm and enjoy as an appetizer or snack.
ingredients_list: frozen, puff, pastry, thawed, spinach, mushroom, shredded, cheese, cheddar, swiss, egg, milk, salt, pepper, taste

title: Homemade hummus with pita chips
raw_text: 62. Homemade hummus with pita chips: 600kcal per portion, 20 portions, contains gluten.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 can of chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1/4 cup of tahini
- 2 tablespoons of lemon juice
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1/4 cup of olive oil
- salt, to taste
- pita bread, for serving
preparation:
1. in a food processor, combine the chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, and a pinch of salt. 
2. process the mixture until it becomes smooth and creamy.
3. slowly drizzle in the olive oil while the food processor is running until the hummus reaches your desired consistency.
4. taste and adjust the seasoning with additional salt if needed.
5. transfer the hummus to a bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to mingle.
6. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c).
7. cut the pita bread into small triangles or strips.
8. arrange the pita pieces on a baking sheet and brush them lightly with olive oil.
9. bake in the preheated oven for about 10-15 minutes or until they turn crispy and golden brown.
10. remove the pita chips from the oven and let them cool before serving with the homemade hummus.
11. enjoy your homemade hummus with fresh pita chips.
ingredients_list: chickpea, tahini, lemon, clove, garlic, minced, olive, salt, taste, pita, bread

title: Grilled shrimp skewers with lemon and garlic
raw_text: 63. Grilled shrimp skewers with lemon and garlic: 800kcal per portion, 20 portions, contains shellfish.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound of large shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 2 lemons, sliced
- 4 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- wooden skewers, soaked in water
preparation:
1. preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
2. in a bowl, combine the minced garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
3. add the peeled and deveined shrimp to the bowl and toss to coat them evenly with the garlic mixture.
4. thread the marinated shrimp onto the soaked wooden skewers, alternating with slices of lemon.
5. place the shrimp skewers onto the preheated grill and cook for about 2-3 minutes per side, or until the shrimp turn pink and opaque.
6. remove the grilled shrimp skewers from the grill and serve hot. enjoy!
ingredients_list: shrimp, deveined, lemon, clove, garlic, minced, olive, salt, pepper, taste, wooden, skewer, soaked, water

title: Mini beef sliders with caramelized onions
raw_text: 66. Mini beef sliders with caramelized onions: 1400kcal per portion, 20 portions, contains gluten.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound ground beef
- 1 onion, sliced
- 2 tablespoons butter
- salt and pepper to taste
- 6 mini burger buns
- optional toppings: cheese, lettuce, tomato, mayo, ketchup, etc.
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, season the ground beef with salt and pepper. mix well using your hands, ensuring the seasoning is evenly distributed.
2. divide the beef mixture into 6 equal portions. roll each portion into a ball, then flatten it slightly to form a mini patty shape.
3. heat a large skillet over medium heat. place the beef patties in the skillet and cook for about 3-4 minutes per side, or until they reach your desired level of doneness. remove the patties from the skillet and set aside.
4. in the same skillet, melt the butter over medium-low heat. add the sliced onions and cook, stirring occasionally, until they become caramelized and golden brown. this process may take around 15-20 minutes. season the onions with salt and pepper to taste.
5. while the onions are caramelizing, prepare the mini burger buns. slice them in half horizontally and lightly toast them if desired.
6. assemble the mini sliders by placing a beef patty on each bun bottom, followed by a spoonful of caramelized onions. add any desired toppings, such as cheese, lettuce, tomato, mayo, ketchup, etc. top with the other half of the bun.
7. serve the mini beef sliders immediately and enjoy!
ingredients_list: ground, beef, onion, butter, salt, pepper, taste, burger, bun, topping, cheese, lettuce, tomato, mayo, ketchup

title: Mini crustless vegetable quiches
raw_text: 68. Mini crustless vegetable quiches: 1800kcal per portion, 20 portions, contains dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup diced vegetables (such as bell peppers, mushrooms, onions, spinach)
- 1/2 cup shredded cheese (such as cheddar or mozzarella)
- 4 large eggs
- 1/4 cup milk
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- cooking spray
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c) and lightly grease a muffin tin with cooking spray.
2. in a mixing bowl, combine the diced vegetables and shredded cheese.
3. in a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, and black pepper until well combined.
4. pour the egg mixture over the vegetables and cheese, and stir to evenly distribute.
5. divide the mixture evenly among the muffin tin cups, filling each about 3/4 full.
6. bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the quiches are set and slightly golden on top.
7. remove from the oven and let cool in the muffin tin for a few minutes.
8. use a small knife to gently loosen the quiches from the edges of the tin, then carefully transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. serve warm or at room temperature, and enjoy!
ingredients_list: vegetable, bell, pepper, mushroom, onion, spinach, shredded, cheese, cheddar, mozzarella, egg, milk, salt, black, pepper, spray

title: Mini sweet potato and black bean sliders
raw_text: 70. Mini sweet potato and black bean sliders: 2200kcal per portion, 20 portions, contains gluten.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 medium sweet potatoes
- 1 can black beans, rinsed and drained
- ½ cup breadcrumbs
- ½ cup finely chopped red onion
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- ½ teaspoon salt
- ½ teaspoon pepper
- 1 tablespoon olive oil

for the sliders:
- slider buns
- lettuce leaves
- sliced tomatoes
- sliced red onion
- optional toppings: avocado slices, mayo, mustard
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. pierce the sweet potatoes with a fork a few times and place them on a baking sheet. bake for 45-60 minutes, or until tender.
3. let the sweet potatoes cool slightly, then peel and mash them in a large bowl.
4. add the rinsed and drained black beans to the bowl and mash them together with the sweet potatoes.
5. add the breadcrumbs, finely chopped red onion, ground cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper to the sweet potato-black bean mixture. mix well until all the ingredients are combined.
6. shape the mixture into small patties, about the size of sliders.
7. heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. place the patties in the skillet and cook for about 3-4 minutes on each side, until they are crispy and browned.
8. remove the patties from the skillet and place them on a paper towel to drain any excess oil.
9. to assemble the sliders, place a sweet potato-black bean patty on a slider bun.
10. top with lettuce leaves, sliced tomatoes, and sliced red onion.
11. add any optional toppings you desire, such as avocado slices, mayo, or mustard.
12. secure the sliders with toothpicks, if needed, and serve. enjoy your mini sweet potato and black bean sliders!
ingredients_list: sweet, potato, black, bean, breadcrumb, red, onion, ground, cumin, chili, powder, salt, pepper, olive, slider, bun, lettuce, leaf, tomato, red, onion, topping, avocado, mayo, mustard

title: Baked chicken tenders
raw_text: 71. Baked chicken tenders: 300kcal per portion, 50 portions, contains gluten.
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 1 pound chicken tenders 
- 1 cup breadcrumbs 
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese 
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder 
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika 
- 1/2 teaspoon salt 
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper 
- 2 eggs
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c). 
2. in a shallow dish, combine the breadcrumbs, grated parmesan cheese, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and black pepper. mix well. 
3. in a separate shallow dish, beat the eggs. 
4. dip each chicken tender into the beaten eggs, then dredge it in the breadcrumb mixture, pressing gently to adhere. 
5. place the breaded chicken tenders on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or lightly greased. 
6. bake for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. 
7. remove from the oven and let the chicken tenders cool for a few minutes before serving. 
8. serve with your favorite dipping sauce, such as ketchup or honey mustard. enjoy!
ingredients_list: chicken, tender, breadcrumb, parmesan, cheese, garlic, powder, paprika, salt, black, pepper, egg

title: Mini chocolate chip muffins
raw_text: 72. Mini chocolate chip muffins: 600kcal per portion, 50 portions, contains gluten.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
- ½ cup granulated sugar
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- ½ teaspoon salt
- ½ cup milk
- ¼ cup vegetable oil
- 1 large egg
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- ½ cup mini chocolate chips
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c). grease or line a mini muffin pan with paper liners.
2. in a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
3. in a separate bowl, combine the milk, vegetable oil, egg, and vanilla extract. whisk until well combined.
4. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. be careful not to overmix; a few lumps are fine.
5. gently fold in the mini chocolate chips.
6. spoon the batter into the prepared mini muffin pan, filling each cup about 2/3 full.
7. bake for 10-12 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
8. allow the mini muffins to cool in the pan for 5 minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. serve and enjoy these delicious mini chocolate chip muffins!
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, baking, powder, salt, milk, vegetable, egg, vanilla, extract, chocolate, chip

title: Oatmeal raisin energy balls
raw_text: 74. Oatmeal raisin energy balls: 1000kcal per portion, 50 portions, contains gluten.

ingredients:

- 1/2 cup raisins
- 1/2 cup almond butter
- 1/4 cup honey
- 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/4 cup shredded coconut (optional)
preparation:
1. in a food processor, pulse the oats until they are finely ground.
2. add the raisins, almond butter, honey, cinnamon, and vanilla extract to the food processor. pulse until well combined and the mixture becomes sticky.
3. if desired, pour the shredded coconut onto a small plate.
4. using your hands, roll the mixture into small balls, about 1 inch in diameter.
5. if using shredded coconut, roll each ball in the coconut until coated.
6. place the energy balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
7. allow the energy balls to firm up in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving.
8. store the oatmeal raisin energy balls in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to one week.

raw_text: 78. Cinnamon sugar pretzels: 1800kcal per portion, 50 portions, contains gluten.
ingredients:
ingredients:

- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar

preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c). 
2. spread the pretzels evenly on a baking sheet.
3. pour the melted butter over the pretzels, making sure to coat them thoroughly.
4. in a small bowl, mix together the granulated sugar and ground cinnamon.
5. sprinkle the cinnamon sugar mixture over the pretzels, making sure to distribute it evenly.
6. toss the pretzels gently with your hands or a spatula to ensure they are coated in the cinnamon sugar mixture.

title: Roasted nuts and dried fruit mix
raw_text: 82. Roasted nuts and dried fruit mix: 600kcal per portion, 100 portions, contains nuts.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup almonds
- 1 cup cashews
- 1 cup walnuts
- 1 cup dried cranberries
- 1 cup dried apricots
- 1 cup dried cherries
- 1/4 cup honey
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit (175 degrees celsius) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a large bowl, combine the almonds, cashews, and walnuts.
3. in a small bowl, mix together the honey, olive oil, and salt until well combined.
4. pour the honey mixture over the nuts and toss until all the nuts are coated.
5. spread the nuts evenly on the prepared baking sheet.
6. roast the nuts in the preheated oven for about 12-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown, stirring halfway through the cooking time to ensure even roasting.
7. once the nuts are roasted, remove them from the oven and allow them to cool completely.
8. once the nuts have cooled, add the dried cranberries, dried apricots, and dried cherries to the bowl.
9. toss everything together until the nuts and dried fruits are well mixed.
10. transfer the roasted nuts and dried fruit mix to an airtight container for storage.
11. enjoy as a snack or use as a topping for salads, yogurt, or desserts.

title: Mini scones (plain, chocolate chip, and raspberry)
raw_text: 88. Mini scones (plain, chocolate chip, and raspberry): 1800kcal per portion, 100 portions, contains gluten and dairy.
ingredients:
i can provide you with the ingredients and preparation steps for mini scones (plain, chocolate chip, and raspberry). 

plain mini scones:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup granulated sugar
- 1 tablespoon baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, cold and cubed
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract


1. preheat your oven to 425°f (220°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. mix well.
3. add the cold butter to the flour mixture. using a pastry cutter or your fingers, cut the butter into the flour until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
4. make a well in the center of the mixture and add the milk and vanilla extract. stir until just combined, being careful not to overmix.
5. turn the dough onto a lightly floured surface. knead it gently a few times to bring it together.
6. roll the dough out to a 3/4-inch thickness. using a mini scone cutter or a small round cookie cutter, cut out mini scones from the dough.
7. place the mini scones on the prepared baking sheet and bake for about 12-15 minutes, or until they are lightly golden on top.
8. remove from the oven and allow the mini scones to cool on a wire rack before serving.

chocolate chip mini scones:
ingredients:
- same ingredients as plain mini scones, plus 1/2 cup chocolate chips

 
1. follow the same preparation steps for plain mini scones until step 3.
2. add the chocolate chips to the flour mixture and combine well.
3. continue with the remaining steps from the plain mini scones recipe (steps 4-8).

raspberry mini scones:
ingredients:
- same ingredients as plain mini scones, plus 1/2 cup fresh or frozen raspberries
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 425°f (220°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. mix well.
3. add the cold butter to the flour mixture. using a pastry cutter or your fingers, cut the butter into the flour until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
4. make a well in the center of the mixture and add the milk and vanilla extract. stir until just combined, being careful not to overmix.
5. turn the dough onto a lightly floured surface. knead it gently a few times to bring it together.
6. roll the dough out to a 3/4-inch thickness. using a mini scone cutter or a small round cookie cutter, cut out mini scones from the dough.
7. place the mini scones on the prepared baking sheet and bake for about 12-15 minutes, or until they are lightly golden on top.
8. remove from the oven and allow the mini scones to cool on a wire rack before serving.

chocolate chip mini scones:
ingredients:
- same ingredients as plain mini scones, plus 1/2 cup chocolate chips

preparation: 
1. follow the same preparation steps for plain mini scones until step 3.
2. add the chocolate chips to the flour mixture and combine well.
3. continue with the remaining steps from the plain mini scones recipe (steps 4-8).

raspberry mini scones:
ingredients:
- same ingredients as plain mini scones, plus 1/2 cup fresh or frozen raspberries

preparation:
1. follow the same preparation steps for plain mini scones until step 3.

title: Yogurt-covered pretzels
raw_text: 91. Yogurt-covered pretzels: 300kcal per portion, 200 portions, contains gluten and dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups pretzels
- 1 cup greek yogurt
- 2 tablespoons honey
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, combine greek yogurt, honey, and vanilla extract. mix well until fully combined.
2. add the pretzels to the yogurt mixture. stir gently until all the pretzels are coated with the yogurt mixture.
3. line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
4. using a fork or tongs, remove each pretzel from the yogurt mixture, allowing any excess to drip off. place them on the prepared baking sheet.
5. repeat the process until all pretzels are coated and arranged on the baking sheet.
6. place the baking sheet in the refrigerator for about 1-2 hours, or until the yogurt coating is firm.
7. once the yogurt coating is firm, remove the pretzels from the refrigerator and enjoy!
8. you can store the yogurt-covered pretzels in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

title: Assorted mini sliders (beef, turkey, and veggie)
raw_text: 95. Assorted mini sliders (beef, turkey, and veggie): 1200kcal per portion, 200 portions, contains gluten.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound ground beef
- 1 pound ground turkey
- 1 cup cooked quinoa
- 1 cup bread crumbs
- 1/2 cup diced onion
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1 teaspoon salt

- mini slider buns
- assorted toppings (lettuce, tomato, cheese slices, etc.)
- condiments (ketchup, mustard, mayonnaise, etc.)
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine ground beef, ground turkey, cooked quinoa, bread crumbs, diced onion, minced garlic, chopped parsley, grated parmesan cheese, salt, and black pepper.
2. mix the ingredients together until well combined.
3. shape the mixture into mini-sized patties, about 2 inches in diameter.

6. assemble the sliders by placing the cooked patties on mini slider buns.
7. add your desired toppings such as lettuce, tomato, cheese slices, and any other preferred additions.
8. finally, top with condiments like ketchup, mustard, mayonnaise, or any other of your choice.
9. serve and enjoy the assorted mini sliders as a tasty treat or appetizer.

title: Mini spinach and feta triangles
raw_text: 96. Mini spinach and feta triangles: 1400kcal per portion, 200 portions, contains gluten and dairy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 package of frozen spinach, thawed and drained
- 1 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 package of phyllo dough (16 sheets)
- 1/2 cup melted butter
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a large bowl, combine the thawed spinach, feta cheese, parmesan cheese, minced garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper. mix well until all the ingredients are evenly combined.
3. lay out one sheet of phyllo dough on a clean surface and brush it with melted butter. place another sheet of phyllo dough on top and brush it with butter as well. repeat this process until you have stacked four sheets of phyllo dough.
4. cut the stacked phyllo dough into strips, about 2 inches wide.
5. place a teaspoon of the spinach and feta mixture at the bottom of each strip of phyllo dough. fold the bottom edge of the dough over the filling to form a triangle. continue folding the dough, as if folding a flag, until you reach the end of the strip. repeat this process with the remaining phyllo dough and filling.
6. place the mini spinach and feta triangles on the prepared baking sheet and brush the tops with melted butter.
7. bake in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the triangles are golden brown and crispy.
8. remove from the oven and let cool slightly before serving. enjoy these delicious mini spinach and feta triangles!
ingredients_list: frozen, spinach, thawed, feta, cheese, parmesan, cheese, clove, garlic, minced, olive, lemon, dried, oregano, salt, black, pepper, phyllo, dough, sheet, butter

title: Assorted mini pies (apple, cherry, and pecan)
raw_text:
100. Assorted mini pies (apple, cherry, and pecan): 2200kcal per portion, 200 portions, contains gluten, nuts, and dairy.

Please note that the portions and calorie counts provided are approximate and may vary depending on the specific ingredients and preparation methods used. It's always best to double-check the nutritional information for accurate serving sizes and calorie counts. Enjoy your kosher morning snacks!
ingredients:
ingredients:
- for the pie crust:
  - 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
  - 1 teaspoon salt
  - 1 cup unsalted butter, cold and cubed
  - 1/4 to 1/2 cup ice water

- for the apple pie filling:
  - 4 cups peeled and thinly sliced apples
  - 1/2 cup granulated sugar
  - 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
  - 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
  - 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
  - 1 tablespoon lemon juice

- for the cherry pie filling:
  - 2 cups pitted cherries
  - 1/2 cup granulated sugar
  - 2 tablespoons cornstarch
  - 1/4 teaspoon almond extract

- for the pecan pie filling:
  - 1 cup chopped pecans
  - 1/2 cup dark corn syrup
  - 1/4 cup granulated sugar
  - 2 tablespoons melted butter
  - 2 large eggs
  - 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
  
- additional:
  - egg wash (1 beaten egg mixed with a tablespoon of water)
  - granulated sugar (for sprinkling)
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the flour and salt to make the pie crust. add the cold butter cubes and use a pastry cutter or your fingers to cut the butter into the flour until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.

2. gradually add ice water, starting with ¼ cup, and mix until the dough comes together. add more water as needed. divide the dough into three equal portions, shape each into a disc, wrap in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.

3. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).

4. in a bowl, combine the sliced apples, sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, and lemon juice for the apple pie filling. toss until the apples are evenly coated.

5. in a separate bowl, mix the pitted cherries, sugar, cornstarch, and almond extract for the cherry pie filling. stir until well combined.

6. for the pecan pie filling, combine the chopped pecans, dark corn syrup, granulated sugar, melted butter, eggs, and vanilla extract. mix until all the ingredients are thoroughly incorporated.

7. roll out one portion of the refrigerated pie crust dough on a lightly floured surface. use a round cookie cutter or a glass to cut circles slightly larger than the size of your mini pie tins. press the dough circles into the tins.

8. fill each pie crust with a spoonful of the desired filling, making sure not to overfill.

9. roll out another portion of the pie crust dough and cut smaller circles or shapes to create the pie lids. place the lids on top of each pie and seal the edges with a fork or crimp with your fingers.

10. brush the tops of the mini pies with the egg wash and sprinkle with granulated sugar.

11. place the mini pies on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes until the crust is golden brown and the fillings are bubbling.

12. remove from the oven and let the pies cool before serving.

enjoy your assorted mini pies!
taste:
Pie Crust: salty
Apple Pie Filling: sweet
Cherry Pie Filling: sweet
Pecan Pie Filling: sweet
ingredients_list: pie, crust, flour, salt, unsalted, butter, ice, water, apple, pie, filling, thinly, apple, sugar, flour, ground, cinnamon, ground, nutmeg, lemon, cherry, pie, filling, pitted, cherry, sugar, cornstarch, almond, extract, pecan, pie, filling, pecan, dark, corn, syrup, sugar, butter, egg, vanilla, extract, egg, wash, egg, water, sugar, sprinkling

title: Mini Vegetable Puffs
raw_text: 3. Mini Vegetable Puffs: 45 kcal per portion, 20 portions, contains gluten, originated in India.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, cold and cubed
- 1/2 cup cold water
- 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, corn)
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon cumin seeds
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
- 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon garam masala
- salt to taste
- oil for frying
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, combine the flour and salt. add the cold butter cubes and mix with your fingertips until the mixture resembles bread crumbs.
2. gradually add cold water, a little at a time, and mix until the dough comes together. knead gently until a smooth dough forms. cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
3. in a pan, heat some oil and add cumin seeds. once they crackle, add the chopped onions and garlic. sauté until golden brown.
4. add the mixed vegetables, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. cook for a few minutes until the vegetables are cooked through. set aside to cool.
5. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
6. take the chilled dough and divide it into small balls. roll each ball into a thin circle.
7. place a spoonful of the vegetable filling in the center of each circle. fold the dough over to form a half-moon shape. seal the edges by pressing with a fork.
8. place the mini vegetable puffs on a baking tray lined with parchment paper. brush the tops with oil or egg wash for a golden color.
9. bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the puffs turn golden brown and crisp.
10. remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving. enjoy the mini vegetable puffs as a delicious snack or appetizer.
ingredients_list: flour, salt, unsalted, butter, water, vegetable, carrot, pea, corn, onion, clove, garlic, minced, cumin, seed, turmeric, powder, red, chili, powder, garam, masala, salt, taste
