title: Cheese Quesadillas
raw_text: 19. Cheese Quesadillas: 180 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, originated in Mexico.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 tortillas
- 2 cups shredded cheese
- 1/4 cup diced onion
- 1/4 cup diced bell pepper
- 1 jalapeno, seeded and diced (optional)
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro
- salt and pepper to taste
- vegetable oil for cooking
preparation:
1. in a bowl, mix together shredded cheese, diced onion, diced bell pepper, diced jalapeno (if using), chopped cilantro, salt, and pepper.
2. heat a large non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat.
3. place one tortilla in the skillet and spread a generous amount of the cheese mixture evenly over the tortilla.
4. top with another tortilla, and press down gently.
5. cook for about 2-3 minutes, or until the bottom tortilla is lightly browned and crisp.
6. flip the quesadilla with a spatula and cook for another 2-3 minutes, until the cheese is melted and tortilla is crispy.
7. transfer the cooked quesadilla to a cutting board and let it cool for a minute before cutting it into wedges or squares.
8. repeat steps 3-7 with the remaining tortillas and cheese mixture.
9. serve the cheese quesadillas warm with your choice of salsa, guacamole, or sour cream, if desired. enjoy!

title: Popcorn
raw_text: 21. Popcorn: 90 kcal per portion, 8 portions, contains corn, no origin.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1/2 cup popcorn kernels
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- salt (to taste)
preparation:
1. in a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
2. add the popcorn kernels to the pot and cover with a lid.
3. shake the pot gently to evenly distribute the oil and prevent burning.
4. continue shaking the pot occasionally to prevent the popcorn from sticking to the bottom.
5. once you hear the kernels starting to pop, reduce the heat to medium and continue shaking the pot.
6. keep shaking until the popping slows down to a few seconds between pops.
7. remove the pot from the heat and let it sit for a minute to allow any remaining kernels to pop.
8. carefully remove the lid, as hot steam may escape.
9. season the popcorn with salt to taste, and toss it gently to distribute the salt evenly.
10. serve immediately and enjoy!
ingredients_list: popcorn, kernel, vegetable, salt, taste

title: Sweet and Sour Meatballs
raw_text: 25. Sweet and Sour Meatballs: 190 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains soy, originated in China.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound ground beef
- 1/2 cup breadcrumbs
- 1/4 cup milk
- 1 egg
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 onion, diced
- 1 cup pineapple chunks
- 1/2 cup ketchup
- 1/4 cup brown sugar
- 1/4 cup apple cider vinegar
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 2 tablespoons water
preparation:
1. in a bowl, mix together ground beef, breadcrumbs, milk, egg, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper. shape the mixture into small meatballs.

2. heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. add meatballs and cook until browned on all sides. remove the meatballs from the skillet and set aside.

3. in the same skillet, add bell pepper and onion. cook until they soften, about 5 minutes. 

4. add pineapple chunks, ketchup, brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, and soy sauce to the skillet. stir well to combine. 

5. in a small bowl, mix together cornstarch and water until dissolved. add this mixture to the skillet and stir until the sauce thickens.

6. return the meatballs to the skillet and simmer for another 5 minutes, or until the meatballs are cooked through.

7. serve the sweet and sour meatballs over rice or noodles. enjoy!
ingredients_list: ground, beef, breadcrumb, milk, egg, garlic, powder, salt, black, pepper, vegetable, bell, pepper, onion, pineapple, ketchup, brown, sugar, apple, cider, vinegar, soy, sauce, cornstarch, water

title: Rice Krispie Treats
raw_text: 26. Rice Krispie Treats: 100 kcal per portion, 10 portions, contains rice, originated in the United States.
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 3 tablespoons of butter
- 4 cups of mini marshmallows
- 6 cups of rice krispies cereal
preparation:
1. in a large saucepan, melt the butter over low heat.
2. add the marshmallows to the saucepan and stir until completely melted and well combined with the butter.
3. remove the saucepan from heat.
4. gradually add the rice krispies cereal into the saucepan and mix until all the cereal is coated with the marshmallow mixture.
5. transfer the mixture into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish.
6. press the mixture firmly into the dish using a greased spatula or your hands.
7. let it cool for about 30 minutes until set.
8. cut into squares or desired shapes and serve.
ingredients_list: butter, marshmallow, rice, krispies, cereal

title: Oatmeal Cookies
raw_text: 30. Oatmeal Cookies: 150 kcal per portion, 6 portions, contains gluten, originated in Scotland.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup unsalted butter, softened
- 1 cup packed brown sugar
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 3 cups rolled oats
- 1 cup raisins (optional)
- 1/2 cup chopped nuts (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a large mixing bowl, cream together the softened butter, brown sugar, and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
3. beat in the eggs, one at a time, followed by the vanilla extract.
4. in a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, salt, and ground cinnamon.
5. gradually add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture, mixing well after each addition.
6. stir in the rolled oats until well combined. if desired, mix in the raisins and chopped nuts as well.
7. drop rounded tablespoonfuls of dough onto the prepared baking sheet, spacing them about 2 inches apart.
8. bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the cookies are golden brown around the edges.
9. remove from the oven and let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. enjoy your delicious oatmeal cookies! they can be stored in an airtight container for up to 1 week.
ingredients_list: unsalted, butter, brown, sugar, sugar, egg, vanilla, extract, flour, baking, soda, salt, ground, cinnamon, rolled, oat, raisin, nut

title: Parmesan Crisps
raw_text: 35. Parmesan Crisps: 100 kcal per portion, 8 portions, contains dairy, originated in Italy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup grated parmesan cheese
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
3. spoon about 1 tablespoon of grated parmesan cheese onto the prepared baking sheet, spreading it out into a thin, even layer. leave some space between each mound of cheese, as it will spread while baking.
4. repeat step 3 with the remaining parmesan cheese, making as many mounds as desired.
5. place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for about 5-7 minutes, or until the cheese has melted and turned golden brown.
6. remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the parmesan crisps cool for a few minutes on the baking sheet to allow them to harden.
7. carefully remove the crisps from the baking sheet using a spatula or your fingers.
8. serve immediately as a snack or use as a garnish for soups, salads, or any dish that could use a crispy, cheesy touch.

enjoy your parmesan crisps!
ingredients_list: parmesan, cheese

title: Black Bean Dip
raw_text: 40. Black Bean Dip: 85 kcal per portion, 8 portions, contains garlic, originated in Mexico.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cans (15 ounces each) black beans, drained and rinsed
- 1/4 cup diced onion
- 1/4 cup diced bell pepper
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and diced
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- juice of 1 lime
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
preparation:
1. in a food processor or blender, combine the black beans, onion, bell pepper, garlic, and jalapeno pepper. pulse until combined but still slightly chunky.
2. add the cumin, chili powder, salt, lime juice, cilantro, and olive oil. process until smooth.
3. taste and adjust the seasoning as desired.
4. transfer the dip to a serving bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to allow the flavors to meld together.
5. serve the black bean dip chilled with tortilla chips or vegetable crudités.
6. enjoy!
ingredients_list: can, ounce, black, bean, onion, bell, pepper, clove, garlic, minced, jalapeno, pepper, seeded, ground, cumin, chili, powder, salt, lime, fresh, cilantro, olive

title: Berry Crumble Bars
raw_text: 48. Berry Crumble Bars: 130 kcal per portion, 6 portions, contains gluten, originated in the United States.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup cold unsalted butter, cut into small pieces
- 1 large egg
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 2 cups mixed berries (such as raspberries, blueberries, and blackberries)
- 1/4 cup granulated sugar (for topping)
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
preparation:
1. preheat oven to 375°f (190°c). grease a 9x13-inch baking pan and set aside.
2. in a medium bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
3. add cold butter pieces to the flour mixture. using a pastry cutter or your fingers, cut the butter into the flour until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
4. in a small bowl, lightly beat the egg and vanilla extract together. add the egg mixture to the flour mixture and stir until combined and crumbly.
5. reserve about 1 1/2 cups of the crumb mixture and set aside.
6. press the remaining crumb mixture evenly into the prepared baking pan.
7. in a separate bowl, combine the mixed berries, sugar, and cornstarch. gently toss to coat the berries with the sugar and cornstarch mixture.
8. sprinkle the berry mixture evenly over the crust in the baking pan.
9. crumble the reserved crumb mixture evenly over the berries.
10. bake in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the fruit filling is bubbly around the edges.
11. remove from the oven and allow to cool completely in the pan before cutting into bars.
12. once cooled, cut into squares or bars and serve. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, baking, powder, salt, unsalted, butter, piece, egg, vanilla, extract, berry, raspberry, blueberry, blackberry, sugar, topping, cornstarch

title: Cheese Sticks
raw_text: 55. Cheese Sticks: 120 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy, no origin.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 mozzarella cheese sticks
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 1 cup breadcrumbs
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon dried basil
- vegetable oil, for frying
- marinara sauce, for dipping
preparation:
1. start by cutting the mozzarella cheese sticks in half, resulting in 16 smaller sticks.

2. in separate shallow bowls, place the flour, beaten eggs, and breadcrumbs.

3. to season the breadcrumbs, add garlic powder, dried oregano, and dried basil. mix well.

4. take each mozzarella stick and coat it in flour, then dip it into the beaten eggs, and finally roll it in the seasoned breadcrumbs, ensuring it's fully coated. repeat this process for all the cheese sticks.

5. place the coated cheese sticks on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and freeze them for about 30 minutes. this will help the cheese sticks hold their shape while frying.

6. in a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat until it reaches around 350°f (175°c).

7. carefully place the frozen cheese sticks in the hot oil, frying them in batches for about 2-3 minutes or until golden and crispy.

8. use a slotted spoon or tongs to remove the cheese sticks from the oil and transfer them to a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.

9. repeat the frying process with the remaining cheese sticks.

10. serve the cheese sticks hot with marinara sauce for dipping. enjoy!
ingredients_list: mozzarella, cheese, stick, flour, egg, breadcrumb, garlic, powder, dried, oregano, dried, basil, vegetable, marinara, sauce, dipping

title: Spicy Roasted Almonds
raw_text: 57. Spicy Roasted Almonds: 150 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains tree nuts, originated in Spain.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups almonds
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. in a mixing bowl, combine the almonds, olive oil, smoked paprika, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, and salt. toss until the almonds are coated evenly.
3. spread the almonds in a single layer on a baking sheet.
4. roast the almonds in the preheated oven for about 10-12 minutes, or until they are slightly golden and fragrant.
5. remove the almonds from the oven and let them cool before serving.
6. store the spicy roasted almonds in an airtight container to maintain their crunchiness.

enjoy!
ingredients_list: almond, olive, smoked, paprika, cayenne, pepper, garlic, powder, salt

title: Mini Tacos
raw_text: 61. Mini Tacos: 120 kcal per portion, 6 portions, contains gluten, originated in Mexico.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound ground beef
- 1 small onion, diced
- 1 small green pepper, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 packet taco seasoning
- mini flour tortillas
- shredded lettuce
- diced tomatoes
- shredded cheese
- sour cream
- salsa
preparation:
1. in a skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat, breaking it up with a spoon. cook until browned and no longer pink, about 5-7 minutes.
2. add the diced onion, green pepper, and minced garlic to the skillet. cook until the vegetables are softened, about 5 minutes.
3. sprinkle the taco seasoning over the meat and vegetables. stir well to combine. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.
4. warm the mini flour tortillas in a microwave or on a skillet until soft and pliable.
5. to assemble the mini tacos, spoon a small amount of the beef mixture onto each tortilla. top with shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, shredded cheese, sour cream, and salsa as desired.
6. serve immediately and enjoy your mini tacos!
ingredients_list: ground, beef, onion, green, pepper, clove, garlic, minced, packet, taco, seasoning, flour, tortilla, shredded, lettuce, tomato, shredded, cheese, sour, cream, salsa

title: Roasted Garlic and Potato Wedges
raw_text: 63. Roasted Garlic and Potato Wedges: 130 kcal per portion, 6 portions, contains garlic, no origin.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large potatoes
- 6 cloves of garlic
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon dried rosemary
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh parsley for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
2. wash and dry the potatoes. cut them into wedges, leaving the skin on.
3. peel and mince the garlic cloves.
4. in a large bowl, combine the potato wedges with minced garlic, olive oil, dried rosemary, salt, and pepper. toss until well coated.
5. arrange the potato wedges in a single layer on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
6. roast the potatoes in the preheated oven for about 30-35 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy on the outside.
7. remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes. garnish with fresh parsley if desired.
8. serve the roasted garlic and potato wedges as a delicious side dish or snack. enjoy!
ingredients_list: potato, clove, garlic, olive, dried, rosemary, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Mediterranean Bruschetta
raw_text: 66. Mediterranean Bruschetta: 140 kcal per portion, 6 portions, contains gluten, originated in Italy.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 french baguette
- 2 ripe tomatoes
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil
- 1/4 cup fresh basil leaves, chopped
- 1/4 cup feta cheese, crumbled
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. slice the french baguette into 1/2-inch thick slices.
3. arrange the bread slices on a baking sheet and toast them in the oven for about 5 minutes, until they become crispy and slightly browned.
4. while the bread is toasting, dice the tomatoes into small pieces.
5. in a bowl, combine the diced tomatoes, minced garlic, extra virgin olive oil, and chopped basil leaves. mix well.
6. once the bread slices are toasted, remove them from the oven and let them cool slightly.
7. rub each bread slice with the minced garlic clove.
8. spoon the tomato mixture onto each bread slice, spreading it evenly.
9. sprinkle crumbled feta cheese on top of each bruschetta.
10. season with salt and pepper to taste.
11. serve and enjoy immediately as an appetizer or snack.
ingredients_list: french, baguette, tomato, garlic, clove, minced, virgin, olive, fresh, basil, leaf, feta, cheese, salt, pepper, taste

title: Sweet Potato and Black Bean Tacos
raw_text: 74. Sweet Potato and Black Bean Tacos: 170 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten, no origin.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 medium sweet potatoes, peeled and diced
- 1 can black beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 8 small flour tortillas
- toppings: diced avocado, chopped cilantro, salsa, sour cream (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the sweet potatoes, black beans, olive oil, cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. toss well to coat the sweet potatoes and beans evenly with the spices and oil.
3. spread the sweet potato and black bean mixture evenly on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
4. roast in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the sweet potatoes are tender and slightly crispy.
5. while the sweet potatoes are roasting, warm the flour tortillas on a stovetop or in the microwave.
6. once the sweet potatoes are ready, remove them from the oven.
7. place a scoop of the roasted sweet potato and black bean mixture onto each warmed tortilla.
8. top with diced avocado, chopped cilantro, salsa, and sour cream if desired.
9. serve the sweet potato and black bean tacos immediately and enjoy!
ingredients_list: sweet, potato, black, bean, olive, ground, cumin, chili, powder, garlic, powder, salt, pepper, taste, flour, tortilla, topping, avocado, cilantro, salsa, sour, cream

title: Nutella Banana Wrap
raw_text: 75. Nutella Banana Wrap: 200 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and hazelnuts, no origin.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 large tortilla wrap
- 2 tablespoons nutella
- 1 ripe banana, sliced
preparation:
1. lay the tortilla flat on a clean surface.
2. spread the nutella evenly over the entire surface of the tortilla.
3. place the sliced bananas in a single layer on top of the nutella.
4. starting at one end, roll the tortilla tightly into a wrap, making sure to tuck in the sides as you go.
5. cut the wrap in half and serve immediately. enjoy!
ingredients_list: tortilla, wrap, nutella, banana

title: Coconut Shrimp
raw_text: 84. Coconut Shrimp: 160 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains shellfish, originated in Southeast Asia.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 1 cup shredded coconut
- 1 cup panko breadcrumbs
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon paprika
- 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
- 2 eggs
- vegetable oil, for frying
preparation:
1. in a shallow dish, mix together the shredded coconut and panko breadcrumbs.
2. in a separate dish, combine the flour, salt, black pepper, paprika, and garlic powder.
3. in another dish, beat the eggs.
4. dip each shrimp into the flour mixture, then into the beaten eggs, and finally coat it with the coconut and breadcrumb mixture. press gently to adhere the coating.
5. repeat the dipping and coating process for each shrimp.
6. heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or deep fryer to 350°f (180°c).
7. carefully add the breaded shrimp to the hot oil, working in batches to avoid overcrowding the pan.
8. fry the shrimp for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and crispy.
9. remove the cooked shrimp from the oil and transfer them to a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.
10. repeat the frying process until all shrimp are cooked.
11. serve the coconut shrimp hot with your favorite dipping sauce, such as sweet chili sauce or mango salsa.
12. enjoy!
ingredients_list: shrimp, deveined, shredded, coconut, panko, breadcrumb, flour, salt, black, pepper, paprika, garlic, powder, egg, vegetable

title: Baked Garlic Parmesan Potato Wedges
raw_text: 89. Baked Garlic Parmesan Potato Wedges: 180 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, originated in the United States.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large potatoes
- 3 tablespoons olive oil
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- 1/2 teaspoon dried rosemary
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 425°f (220°c).
2. wash the potatoes and cut them into wedges, leaving the skin on.
3. in a large bowl, combine olive oil, minced garlic, parmesan cheese, dried thyme, dried rosemary, paprika, salt, and pepper. mix well.
4. add the potato wedges to the bowl and coat them evenly with the mixture.
5. arrange the coated potato wedges in a single layer on a baking sheet.
6. bake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes or until the wedges are golden brown and crispy.
7. serve the baked garlic parmesan potato wedges hot as a side dish or appetizer. enjoy!
ingredients_list: potato, olive, clove, garlic, minced, parmesan, cheese, dried, thyme, dried, rosemary, paprika, salt, pepper, taste

title: Smashed Avo Toast
raw_text: 98. Smashed Avo Toast: 90 kcal per portion, 8 portions, contains gluten, no origin.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 ripe avocados
- 4 slices of bread
- 1 lemon
- salt and pepper to taste
- optional toppings: cherry tomatoes, feta cheese, red pepper flakes, microgreens
preparation:
1. cut the avocados in half, remove the pits, and scoop the flesh into a bowl.
2. mash the avocado with a fork until desired chunkiness is achieved.
3. squeeze the juice of half a lemon onto the mashed avocado and mix well.
4. add salt and pepper to taste and mix again.
5. toast the bread slices until they are crispy and golden.
6. spread a generous amount of the mashed avocado on each slice of toast.
7. sprinkle optional toppings such as cherry tomatoes, crumbled feta cheese, red pepper flakes, or microgreens on top of the avocado.
8. squeeze a little more lemon juice on top if desired.
9. serve immediately and enjoy!
ingredients_list: avocado, bread, lemon, salt, pepper, taste, topping, cherry, tomato, feta, cheese, red, pepper, flake, microgreens

title: Mini Cheese Knishes
raw_text: 99. Mini Cheese Knishes: 160 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten and dairy, no origin.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups flour
- 1 tsp baking powder
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 2 tbsp vegetable oil
- 1/2 cup water
- 1 cup cottage cheese
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
- 1/4 cup chopped green onions
- 1/4 tsp black pepper
- 1/4 cup melted butter
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder, and salt.
2. add vegetable oil and water to the bowl and mix until the dough comes together.
3. knead the dough on a lightly floured surface for about 5 minutes or until smooth.
4. cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rest for 30 minutes.
5. in a separate bowl, mix together cottage cheese, parmesan cheese, parsley, green onions, and black pepper.
6. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
7. divide the dough into small balls, approximately 1 inch (2.5 cm) in diameter.
8. on a floured surface, roll out each dough ball into a circle about 4 inches (10 cm) in diameter.
9. place a spoonful of the cheese mixture onto one half of each circle of dough.
10. fold the other half of the dough over the filling, forming a half-moon shape.
11. press the edges of the dough together to seal the filling inside.
12. place the mini knishes onto the prepared baking sheet.
13. brush the tops of the knishes with melted butter.
14. bake the knishes for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown.
15. remove from the oven and let cool slightly before serving. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, baking, powder, salt, vegetable, water, cottage, cheese, parmesan, cheese, fresh, parsley, green, onion, black, pepper, butter

title: Mujadara
raw_text: 4. Mujadara - 280 kcals per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten (Lebanon).
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup brown lentils
- 1 cup long-grain white rice
- 3 medium onions
- 4 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- salt and pepper to taste
- 3 cups water
preparation:
1. rinse the lentils under cold water, then place them in a saucepan with 2 cups of water. bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes until the lentils are tender. drain and set aside.
2. in a separate saucepan, rinse the rice under cold water until the water runs clear. drain and set aside.
3. slice the onions thinly. in a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. add the sliced onions and cook until they become caramelized and golden brown, stirring occasionally. this process may take around 20 minutes.
4. once the onions are caramelized, remove half of them from the skillet and set aside for topping the dish later.
5. to the skillet with the remaining half of the caramelized onions, add the drained lentils, rice, cumin, cinnamon, salt, and pepper. stir well to combine all the ingredients.
6. pour in 1 cup of water and bring to a boil. reduce heat to low, cover the skillet, and simmer for about 20-25 minutes until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.
7. while the mujadara is cooking, heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. add the reserved caramelized onions and cook for a few minutes until they are crispy.
8. serve the mujadara hot, topped with the crispy onions. enjoy!
cuisine: Mujadara is typically Middle Eastern cuisine.
ingredients_list: brown, lentil, long, grain, white, rice, onion, olive, cumin, cinnamon, salt, pepper, taste, water

title: Pico de Gallo with Tortilla Chips
raw_text: 10. Pico de Gallo with Tortilla Chips - 120 kcals per portion, 1 portion, contains gluten (Mexico).
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 medium tomato, diced
- 1/2 small red onion, finely diced
- 1/2 jalapeno pepper, seeded and finely chopped
- 1/2 lime, juiced
- 1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
- salt to taste
- pepper to taste
- 15 tortilla chips
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine the diced tomato, finely diced red onion, and finely chopped jalapeno pepper.
2. squeeze the juice of the half lime over the mixture and toss to combine.
3. add the chopped fresh cilantro to the bowl and season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. mix everything together gently until well combined.
5. let the pico de gallo sit for about 15 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. serve the pico de gallo with the tortilla chips on the side.
7. enjoy your pico de gallo with tortilla chips!
ingredients_list: tomato, red, onion, jalapeno, pepper, seeded, lime, fresh, cilantro, salt, taste, pepper, taste, tortilla, chip

title: Chocolate Dipped Strawberries
raw_text: 18. Chocolate Dipped Strawberries - 80 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy (USA).
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 large strawberries
- 4 ounces of dark chocolate chips
- 1 teaspoon of vegetable oil
preparation:
1. wash and dry the strawberries thoroughly. leave the green tops intact.
2. in a microwave-safe bowl, combine the dark chocolate chips and vegetable oil.
3. melt the chocolate by microwaving in 30-second increments, stirring well after each interval until smooth and fully melted.
4. dip each strawberry into the melted chocolate, allowing any excess chocolate to drip off.
5. place the chocolate-dipped strawberries on a parchment-lined baking sheet or plate.
6. place the strawberries in the refrigerator to set for about 30 minutes.
7. once the chocolate has hardened, remove the strawberries from the refrigerator.
8. serve the chocolate-dipped strawberries as desired. enjoy!
ingredients_list: strawberry, ounce, dark, chocolate, chip, vegetable

title: Sushi
raw_text: 19. Sushi - 250 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains fish, soy (Japan).
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 200g sushi rice
- 4 sheets of nori seaweed
- 200g fresh fish (such as salmon or tuna), thinly sliced
- soy sauce, for serving
preparation:
1. rinse the sushi rice under cold water until the water runs clear. drain well.
2. place the rice in a saucepan and add 300ml of cold water. bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover. cook for about 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the water has been absorbed.
3. once the rice is cooked, remove it from the heat and let it sit, covered, for about 10 minutes to steam and cool slightly.
4. while the rice is cooling, lay a bamboo sushi mat on a clean surface and place a sheet of nori seaweed on top.
5. wet your hands with water to prevent sticking, then take a small handful of rice and spread it evenly over the nori, leaving about a 1cm border at the top.
6. lay a few slices of fish over the rice, making sure to cover the entire area.
7. starting from the bottom, roll the sushi tightly using the bamboo mat, pressing gently to secure everything together.
8. repeat the process with the remaining nori, rice, and fish.
9. use a sharp knife to slice each roll into bite-sized pieces, about 1.5-2cm thick.
10. serve the sushi with soy sauce for dipping.

enjoy your homemade sushi!
ingredients_list: sushi, rice, sheet, nori, seaweed, fresh, fish, salmon, tuna, thinly, soy, sauce

title: Cheese Quesadilla
raw_text: 31. Cheese Quesadilla - 290 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, dairy (Mexico).
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 flour tortillas (gluten-containing)
- 1 cup shredded cheese (dairy-containing)
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
preparation:
1. preheat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat.
2. place a tortilla flat on the skillet and sprinkle half of the shredded cheese evenly over it.
3. fold the tortilla in half to cover the cheese.
4. press down gently with a spatula and cook for 2-3 minutes until the bottom tortilla is golden brown.
5. flip the quesadilla and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the other side is golden brown and the cheese is completely melted.
6. remove from the skillet and repeat the process with the remaining tortillas and cheese.
7. once all quesadillas are cooked, cut each one in half to make two portions.
8. serve hot as is or with your favorite dipping sauce. enjoy!
ingredients_list: flour, tortilla, gluten, containing, shredded, cheese, dairy, containing, vegetable

title: Baked Falafel Bites
raw_text: 36. Baked Falafel Bites - 160 kcals per portion, 5 portions, contains gluten (Middle East).
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 can chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons fresh parsley, chopped
- 2 tablespoons fresh cilantro, chopped
- 2 tablespoons flour (gluten-containing)
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- salt and pepper, to taste
- cooking spray
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c) and lightly grease a baking sheet with cooking spray.
2. in a food processor or blender, combine the drained chickpeas, chopped onion, minced garlic, fresh parsley, and fresh cilantro. pulse until the mixture is well combined but still slightly chunky.
3. transfer the mixture to a mixing bowl and add the flour, ground cumin, ground coriander, baking powder, salt, and pepper. stir well to combine all the ingredients thoroughly.
4. using clean hands, shape the mixture into small bite-sized falafel balls, about 1-1.5 inches in diameter, and place them onto the prepared baking sheet.
5. lightly spray the falafel bites with cooking spray to help achieve a crispy texture.
6. bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the falafel bites are golden brown and crispy on the outside.
7. remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.
8. serve the baked falafel bites as an appetizer, snack, or as a filling for pita bread sandwiches or wraps. 

each portion of these baked falafel bites contains approximately 160 calories. enjoy!
ingredients_list: chickpea, onion, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, parsley, fresh, cilantro, flour, gluten, containing, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, baking, powder, salt, pepper, taste, spray

title: Chocolate Mousse
raw_text: 49. Chocolate Mousse - 220 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy (France).
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 100g dark chocolate 
- 2 eggs 
- 2 tablespoons sugar 
- 1/2 cup heavy cream 
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
preparation:
1. chop the dark chocolate into small pieces and melt it in a heatproof bowl over simmering water or using a microwave in short intervals.
2. separate the egg yolks from the whites and set aside.
3. in a mixing bowl, whisk the egg yolks with the sugar until they become pale and creamy.
4. slowly pour the melted chocolate into the egg yolk mixture, whisking continuously.
5. in another bowl, whip the heavy cream until soft peaks form. add vanilla extract and continue whipping until stiff peaks form.
6. gently fold the whipped cream into the chocolate mixture until well combined.
7. in a separate clean mixing bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form.
8. fold the egg whites into the chocolate mixture, being careful not to overmix.
9. divide the mousse evenly into two serving glasses or bowls.
10. refrigerate for at least 2 hours or until set.
11. serve chilled and enjoy your homemade french chocolate mousse!
ingredients_list: dark, chocolate, egg, sugar, cream, vanilla, extract

title: Caramelized Onion Tartlet
raw_text: 55. Caramelized Onion Tartlet - 210 kcals per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten, dairy (France).
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 1 sheet of frozen puff pastry (gluten-containing)
- 2 large onions, thinly sliced
- 2 tablespoons of unsalted butter (dairy)
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1/4 cup of crème fraîche (dairy)
- fresh thyme leaves, for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
2. roll out the puff pastry sheet and cut it into three equal portions.
3. place the pastry portions on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and set aside.
4. in a large skillet, melt the butter and olive oil over medium heat.
5. add the sliced onions to the skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, until they become soft and golden brown, approximately 20-25 minutes.
6. season the caramelized onions with salt and pepper to taste.
7. divide the caramelized onions evenly among the three pastry portions, spreading them out in the center.
8. using a spoon, dot each tartlet with small amounts of crème fraîche.
9. bake the tartlets in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the puff pastry turns golden brown and puffy.
10. remove the tartlets from the oven and let them cool slightly before serving.
11. garnish each tartlet with fresh thyme leaves.
12. serve the caramelized onion tartlets warm or at room temperature. enjoy!
ingredients_list: frozen, puff, pastry, gluten, containing, onion, thinly, unsalted, butter, dairy, olive, salt, pepper, taste, fra, che, dairy, fresh, thyme, leaf, garnish

title: Matzah Ball Soup
raw_text: 58. Matzah Ball Soup - 230 kcals per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten (Jewish).
ingredients:
sure! here's the recipe for matzah ball soup:

ingredients:
- 1/2 cup matzah meal (gluten-containing)
- 2 eggs
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 2 tablespoons chicken broth (gluten-free)
- 4 cups chicken soup (gluten-free)
- 1 carrot, peeled and sliced
- 1 celery stalk, sliced
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh dill for garnish
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the matzah meal, eggs, vegetable oil, and chicken broth. mix well until it forms a thick batter-like consistency. let the mixture rest for 15 minutes in the refrigerator.
2. in the meantime, bring the chicken soup to a boil in a separate pot. add the carrot and celery slices, and simmer until they become tender.
3. in a large pot, bring lightly salted water to a boil. remove the matzah mixture from the refrigerator and wet your hands. roll the mixture into small balls, about the size of a walnut, and drop them gently into the boiling water. cook the matzah balls for about 20 minutes, or until they become firm and cooked through.
4. using a slotted spoon, transfer the cooked matzah balls from the water to the simmering chicken soup. let them simmer in the soup for an additional 10 minutes to absorb the flavors.
5. season the soup with salt and pepper to taste. remove from heat.
6. serve the matzah ball soup hot, garnished with fresh dill. enjoy!

note: each portion of this recipe has approximately 230 kcals and makes 3 portions. please ensure that all ingredients are gluten-free if you have gluten restrictions.
ingredients_list: matzah, ball, soup, matzah, gluten, containing, egg, vegetable, chicken, broth, gluten, chicken, soup, gluten, carrot, celery, stalk, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, dill, garnish

title: Tapioca Pudding
raw_text: 61. Tapioca Pudding - 180 kcals per portion, 3 portions, contains dairy (World).
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1/4 cup tapioca pearls
- 2 cups milk
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- pinch of salt
preparation:
1. rinse the tapioca pearls under cold water, then soak them in water for 30 minutes.
2. in a medium saucepan, combine the soaked tapioca pearls, milk, sugar, and salt.
3. place the saucepan over medium heat and bring the mixture to a gentle simmer, stirring continuously.
4. reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until the tapioca pearls are translucent and tender.
5. stir in the vanilla extract.
6. remove the saucepan from the heat and let the pudding cool for a few minutes.
7. transfer the pudding to individual serving dishes or bowls.
8. allow the pudding to cool completely, then refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or until chilled and set.
9. serve the tapioca pudding cold and enjoy!

nutritional information (per portion):
- calories: 180
- serving size: 3 portions
- contains dairy
ingredients_list: tapioca, pearl, milk, sugar, vanilla, extract, pinch, salt

title: Cucumber Bites with Herbed Cream Cheese
raw_text: 67. Cucumber Bites with Herbed Cream Cheese - 160 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy (Various).
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large cucumbers
- 8 ounces cream cheese
- 1 tablespoon fresh parsley, chopped
- 1 tablespoon fresh dill, chopped
- 1 tablespoon fresh chives, chopped

1. start by washing the cucumbers thoroughly. slice them into discs, about 1/4 inch thick. set them aside.
2. in a mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese, chopped parsley, dill, and chives. mix well until all the ingredients are evenly incorporated.
3. season the herbed cream cheese mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
4. take a cucumber slice and spread a generous amount of the herbed cream cheese mixture on top.
5. repeat the process for the remaining cucumber slices.
6. if desired, garnish the cucumber bites with sliced cherry tomatoes, olives, or minced herbs.
7. place the prepared cucumber bites on a serving platter and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
8. serve chilled and enjoy your delicious cucumber bites with herbed cream cheese!

title: Baked Brie with Cranberry Sauce
raw_text: 71. Baked Brie with Cranberry Sauce - 290 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy (France).
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 200g brie cheese
- 100g cranberry sauce
- 2 tablespoons sliced almonds
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 180°c (350°f).
2. place the brie cheese on a baking dish or a heatproof plate.
3. bake the brie for about 10-15 minutes or until it starts to melt and soften.
4. while the brie is baking, warm the cranberry sauce in a small saucepan on low heat.
5. once the brie is done, remove it from the oven and transfer it to a serving plate.
6. pour the warm cranberry sauce over the top of the melted brie.
7. sprinkle the sliced almonds on top of the cranberry sauce.

title: Pistachio Dark Chocolate Bark
raw_text: 72. Pistachio Dark Chocolate Bark - 230 kcals per portion, 6 portions, contains tree nuts (USA).
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup dark chocolate chips
- 1/2 cup shelled pistachios, roughly chopped
- 1/4 teaspoon sea salt
preparation:
1. line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. melt the dark chocolate chips in a microwave-safe bowl in 30-second intervals, stirring in between each interval, until smooth and melted.
3. pour the melted chocolate onto the prepared baking sheet and spread it out into a thin layer using a spatula.
4. sprinkle the chopped pistachios evenly over the melted chocolate.
5. sprinkle the sea salt evenly over the pistachios.
6. place the baking sheet in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes or until the chocolate is completely set.
7. once set, break the bark into pieces using your hands or a knife.
8. store the pistachio dark chocolate bark in an airtight container at room temperature for up to a week.

each portion of pistachio dark chocolate bark contains approximately 230 kcals. enjoy!

title: Rice Paper Veggie Rolls
raw_text: 73. Rice Paper Veggie Rolls - 80 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains soy (Vietnam).
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 rice paper sheets
- 1 carrot, julienned
- 1 cucumber, julienned
- 1 bell pepper, julienned
- 1 small avocado, sliced
- 4 lettuce leaves
- 4 sprigs of fresh mint
- 4 sprigs of fresh cilantro
- 4 sprigs of fresh thai basil
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon honey or maple syrup (optional for sweetness)
- 1 tablespoon lime juice
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, combine soy sauce, rice vinegar, lime juice, honey or maple syrup (if using), salt, and pepper. set aside as a dipping sauce.
2. fill a shallow dish or large plate with warm water. dip one sheet of rice paper into the water for a few seconds until it softens. lay it flat on a clean surface.
3. place a lettuce leaf on the lower third of the rice paper. add a small portion of carrot, cucumber, bell pepper, avocado, mint, cilantro, and thai basil on top.
4. fold the bottom of the rice paper over the filling and tightly roll once. fold in the sides and continue rolling tightly until the seam is sealed.
5. repeat steps 2-4 with the remaining rice paper sheets and filling ingredients.
6. serve the rice paper veggie rolls with the dipping sauce on the side. enjoy!
taste: The key taste profile in this recipe is sour.

title: Poppy Seed Cake
raw_text: 74. Poppy Seed Cake - 220 kcals per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten (Various).
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 1/4 cup poppy seeds
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter, softened
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1 large egg
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (180°c) and grease a small cake pan with butter or cooking spray.
2. in a mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, poppy seeds, baking powder, and salt. mix well.
3. add the softened butter and mix until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
4. in a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, egg, and vanilla extract.
5. pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
6. pour the cake batter into the greased pan and smooth the top.
7. bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
8. remove the cake from the oven and let it cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. once cooled, cut the cake into 3 equal portions.
10. serve and enjoy!

note: please check the specific gluten-containing ingredients used in your brand of poppy seeds to ensure they are gluten-free.
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, poppy, seed, baking, powder, salt, unsalted, butter, milk, egg, vanilla, extract

ingredients:

title: Brown Butter Almond Madeleines
raw_text: 80. Brown Butter Almond Madeleines - 120 kcals per portion, 5 portions, contains gluten, tree nuts (France).
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2/3 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 2 large eggs
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 teaspoon almond extract
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter
- 1/4 cup sliced almonds
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c). grease and flour a madeleine pan.

2. in a mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. set aside.

3. in another bowl, lightly beat together the eggs, vanilla extract, and almond extract.

4. in a small saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. continue to cook the melted butter, stirring occasionally, until it turns golden brown and emits a nutty aroma. be careful not to let it burn. remove from heat and pour the browned butter into a small bowl.

5. pour the egg mixture into the dry ingredients and mix until well combined.

6. slowly add the browned butter while stirring, and mix until the batter is smooth.

7. fill each madeleine cavity with about a tablespoon of batter.

8. sprinkle the sliced almonds over the batter, pressing them gently to adhere.

9. bake for about 10-12 minutes, or until the edges of the madeleines turn golden brown and the centers are puffed up.

10. remove the madeleines from the pan and let cool on a wire rack before serving.

enjoy the delightful brown butter almond madeleines from france!
ingredients_list: flour, sugar, baking, powder, salt, egg, vanilla, extract, almond, extract, unsalted, butter, almond

title: Baba Ghanoush Stuffed Pita Pockets
raw_text: 82. Baba Ghanoush Stuffed Pita Pockets - 220 kcals per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten (Middle East).
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 medium eggplants
- 3 tablespoons tahini
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 teaspoon cumin powder
- salt, to taste
- 3 whole wheat pita pockets
- 1 tomato, sliced
- 1/4 red onion, sliced
- fresh parsley, for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. prick the eggplants with a fork and place them on a baking sheet. roast in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, or until the eggplants are soft and tender.
3. remove the eggplants from the oven and allow them to cool slightly. once cooled, peel off the skin and mash the flesh with a fork or blend in a food processor until smooth.
4. in a bowl, combine the mashed eggplant, tahini, minced garlic, lemon juice, cumin powder, and salt. mix well until all the ingredients are incorporated.
5. cut each pita pocket in half and gently open the pockets to create a pocket for stuffing.
6. stuff each pita pocket with the baba ghanoush mixture, dividing it evenly among the 6 halves.
7. fill each pita pocket with sliced tomatoes and red onions, and garnish with fresh parsley.
8. serve the baba ghanoush stuffed pita pockets immediately or store them in an airtight container in the refrigerator for later consumption. enjoy!
ingredients_list: eggplant, tahini, clove, garlic, minced, lemon, cumin, powder, salt, taste, whole, wheat, pita, pocket, tomato, red, onion, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Cheese and Garlic Crackers
raw_text: 90. Cheese and Garlic Crackers - 140 kcals per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten, dairy (USA).
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter, cold and cubed
- 3 tablespoons cold water
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c). line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a medium-sized bowl, whisk together the flour, salt, and garlic powder.
3. add the shredded cheddar cheese to the flour mixture and toss until well combined.
4. add the cold, cubed butter to the flour and cheese mixture. use a pastry cutter or your fingers to cut the butter into the mixture until it resembles coarse crumbs.
5. gradually add the cold water, 1 tablespoon at a time, and mix until the dough comes together.
6. transfer the dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead it a few times until it becomes smooth.
7. roll out the dough to about 1/8-inch thickness.
8. use a cookie cutter or a knife to cut the dough into desired cracker shapes.
9. transfer the cut crackers onto the prepared baking sheet, leaving a small space between each.
10. bake the crackers in the preheated oven for about 10-12 minutes, or until they turn golden brown and crispy. keep an eye on them, as they can burn quickly.
11. once baked, remove the crackers from the oven and let them cool on a wire rack before serving.
12. enjoy your homemade cheese and garlic crackers!
ingredients_list: flour, salt, garlic, powder, shredded, cheddar, cheese, unsalted, butter, water

title: Poppy Seed Muffins
raw_text: 93. Poppy Seed Muffins - 200 kcals per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten (Various).
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour 
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar 
- 1/4 teaspoon salt 
- 1/2 tablespoon baking powder 
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted

title: Chocolate Covered Pretzels
raw_text: 98. Chocolate Covered Pretzels - 180 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (USA).
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 ounces of gluten-containing pretzels
- 8 ounces of semi-sweet chocolate chips
preparation:
1. line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set it aside.
2. in a microwave-safe bowl, melt the chocolate chips in the microwave on low heat, stirring every 20-30 seconds until smooth and fully melted. be careful not to overheat the chocolate to avoid burning it.
3. dip each pretzel into the melted chocolate, ensuring it is fully coated. use a fork or a chocolate dipping tool to lift the pretzel out of the chocolate, allowing any excess chocolate to drip off.
4. place the chocolate-covered pretzels on the prepared baking sheet, spacing them apart to prevent sticking together.
5. once all the pretzels are dipped and arranged on the baking sheet, transfer it to the refrigerator or freezer to allow the chocolate to harden. this usually takes about 15-20 minutes in the refrigerator or 10-15 minutes in the freezer.
6. once the chocolate has hardened, remove the baking sheet from the refrigerator/freezer and let the pretzels come back to room temperature.
7. serve and enjoy! store any leftovers in an airtight container at room temperature.

note: each portion is calculated to be approximately 180 calories. adjust the serving size and portions accordingly based on your dietary needs.

title: Moroccan Chickpea Soup (300 calories per portion, serves 6, contains legumes, origin
raw_text: 6. Moroccan Chickpea Soup (300 calories per portion, serves 6, contains legumes, origin: Morocco)
ingredients:
moroccan chickpea soup:

ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 large onion, diced
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 carrots, peeled and chopped
- 2 celery stalks, chopped
- 1 red bell pepper, chopped
- 1 can (400g) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1 can (400g) diced tomatoes
- 4 cups vegetable broth
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1 teaspoon ground paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional for spice lovers)
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh cilantro or parsley, for garnish
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
2. add the diced onion and minced garlic, sauté until they become translucent and fragrant.
3. stir in the chopped carrots, celery, and red bell pepper. cook for about 5 minutes, until the vegetables begin to soften.
4. add the drained and rinsed chickpeas and diced tomatoes to the pot. stir well to combine.
5. pour in the vegetable broth and add the ground cumin, coriander, paprika, cinnamon, and cayenne pepper (if using). season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. bring the soup to a simmer and let it cook for about 20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the flavors have melded together.
7. taste and adjust the seasoning if needed.
8. serve the moroccan chickpea soup hot, garnished with fresh cilantro or parsley.
9. enjoy your nutritious and flavorful soup!
ingredients_list: moroccan, chickpea, soup, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, carrot, celery, stalk, red, bell, pepper, chickpea, tomato, vegetable, broth, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, ground, paprika, ground, cinnamon, cayenne, pepper, spice, lover, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, cilantro, parsley, garnish

title: Grilled Salmon with Roasted Vegetables (450 calories per portion, serves 2, contains fish, origin
raw_text: 7. Grilled Salmon with Roasted Vegetables (450 calories per portion, serves 2, contains fish, origin: USA)
ingredients:
grilled salmon with roasted vegetables:
ingredients:
- 2 salmon fillets (6 oz each)
- 1 zucchini, sliced
- 1 yellow squash, sliced
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 red onion, sliced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar
- 1 teaspoon dried herbs (such as thyme, rosemary, or oregano)
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
2. in a large bowl, combine the sliced zucchini, yellow squash, red bell pepper, and red onion.
3. in a separate small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, dried herbs, salt, and pepper.
4. pour the dressing over the vegetables and toss to coat.
5. place the salmon fillets skin-side down on a plate. season with salt, pepper, and a drizzle of olive oil.
6. add the marinated vegetables to a grill basket or use aluminum foil to create a makeshift basket.
7. place the salmon and vegetable basket on the preheated grill. close the lid and cook for about 4-6 minutes per side, or until the salmon is cooked through and the vegetables are tender and slightly charred.
8. remove the salmon and vegetables from the grill. let the salmon rest for a few minutes before serving.
9. serve the grilled salmon alongside the roasted vegetables. optionally, garnish with fresh herbs. enjoy!
cuisine: Grilled Salmon with Roasted Vegetables is a recipe of the Mediterranean cuisine type.
ingredients_list: salmon, roasted, vegetable, salmon, fillet, zucchini, yellow, red, bell, pepper, red, onion, olive, balsamic, vinegar, dried, herb, thyme, rosemary, oregano, salt, pepper, taste

title: Spaghetti Squash Pad Thai (350 calories per portion, serves 4, contains nuts and shellfish, origin
raw_text: 8. Spaghetti Squash Pad Thai (350 calories per portion, serves 4, contains nuts and shellfish, origin: Thailand)
ingredients:
: thai)

ingredients:
- 1 spaghetti squash
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 small red onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 carrot, julienned
- 8 ounces shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 1/4 cup chopped roasted peanuts
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
- 2 tablespoons lime juice
- 2 tablespoons fish sauce
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon brown sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes (optional)
- lime wedges, for serving
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. cut the spaghetti squash in half lengthwise and remove the seeds and pulp. place the halves cut side down on a baking sheet.
3. bake the spaghetti squash for 40-45 minutes, until the flesh is tender and easily scraped with a fork. let it cool slightly.
4. while the squash is baking, heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
5. add the diced red onion, minced garlic, sliced red bell pepper, and julienned carrot to the skillet. cook for 3-4 minutes, until the vegetables are softened.
6. push the vegetables to one side of the skillet and add the shrimp to the other side. cook for 2-3 minutes, until the shrimp turns pink and is cooked through.
7. push everything to the sides of the skillet, creating a well in the center. pour the beaten eggs into the center and scramble until cooked.
8. using a fork, scrape the cooked flesh of the spaghetti squash into the skillet and mix it with the cooked vegetables, shrimp, and eggs.
9. in a small bowl, whisk together the lime juice, fish sauce, soy sauce, brown sugar, and red pepper flakes (if using).
10. pour the sauce over the skillet mixture and toss everything together until well combined. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes to heat through.
11. remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the chopped roasted peanuts and fresh cilantro.
12. serve the spaghetti squash pad thai hot, garnished with lime wedges on the side.

enjoy your delicious thai-inspired spaghetti squash pad thai!

title: Lentil and Vegetable Curry (300 calories per portion, serves 6, contains legumes, origin
raw_text: 9. Lentil and Vegetable Curry (300 calories per portion, serves 6, contains legumes, origin: India)
ingredients:
: indian)

ingredients:
- 1 cup dried red lentils
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon curry powder
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric
- 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional for extra spice)
- 2 carrots, chopped
- 2 potatoes, diced
- 1 bell pepper, chopped
- 1 zucchini, chopped
- 1 can (400g) diced tomatoes
- 1 can (400ml) coconut milk
- salt, to taste
- fresh cilantro, for garnish
preparation:
1. rinse the red lentils thoroughly under cold water and set aside.
2. heat the vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat. add the chopped onion and minced garlic, and sauté until the onion becomes translucent.
3. add the curry powder, ground cumin, ground turmeric, ground ginger, and cayenne pepper (if desired) to the pot. stir well to coat the onion and garlic in the spices and cook for about 1 minute.
4. add the chopped carrots, diced potatoes, bell pepper, and zucchini to the pot. stir to combine with the spices.
5. pour in the diced tomatoes (with their juices) and coconut milk. stir well to combine all the ingredients.
6. bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low. cover the pot and let the curry simmer for about 25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the lentils are cooked.
7. taste and season with salt as needed.
8. serve the lentil and vegetable curry hot, garnished with fresh cilantro. enjoy!

- calories: 300kcal

- protein: 12g
- fat: 11g
- fiber: 9g

title: Shakshuka with Feta Cheese (400 calories per portion, serves 4, contains dairy and eggs, origin
raw_text: 11. Shakshuka with Feta Cheese (400 calories per portion, serves 4, contains dairy and eggs, origin: Israel)
ingredients:
: middle eastern)

ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon ground chili powder (optional)
- 1 can (400 grams) crushed tomatoes
- 4-6 large eggs
- 100 grams feta cheese, crumbled
- salt and pepper, to taste
- fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat.
2. add the chopped onion and diced red bell pepper to the pan. sauté until they start to soften and become translucent, about 5 minutes.
3. stir in the minced garlic, ground cumin, ground paprika, ground coriander, and ground chili powder (if desired). cook for another minute until the spices become fragrant.
4. add the crushed tomatoes to the pan and season with salt and pepper. simmer the mixture for about 10 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly.
5. make small wells in the sauce with a spoon and crack each egg into a separate well. be careful not to break the egg yolks.
6. cover the skillet or pan with a lid and cook for about 8-10 minutes or until the eggs are cooked to your desired level of doneness. if you prefer runny yolks, cook for a shorter time.
7. sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese over the shakshuka and garnish with freshly chopped parsley.
8. serve the shakshuka hot with toasted crusty bread or pita on the side. enjoy!

title: Roasted Eggplant and Hummus Wrap (350 calories per portion, serves 2, contains gluten, origin
raw_text: 14. Roasted Eggplant and Hummus Wrap (350 calories per portion, serves 2, contains gluten, origin: Middle East)
ingredients:
middle eastern)

ingredients:
- 1 large eggplant
- olive oil
- salt and pepper
- 4 whole wheat wraps
- 1 cup hummus
- 1 medium tomato, thinly sliced
- 1 small red onion, thinly sliced
- 1 cup shredded lettuce
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
- juice of 1 lemon
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. dice the eggplant into small cubes, approximately 1-inch in size.
3. place the diced eggplant on a baking sheet, drizzle with olive oil, and season with salt and pepper.
4. roast the eggplant in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, until the cubes are tender and slightly golden brown.
5. while the eggplant is roasting, warm the whole wheat wraps in a dry skillet over medium heat until pliable. set aside.
6. once the eggplant is roasted, remove from the oven and let it cool slightly.
7. spread approximately 1/4 cup of hummus onto each whole wheat wrap, leaving a small border around the edges.
8. divide the roasted eggplant cubes evenly between the wraps, spreading them on top of the hummus.
9. top with sliced tomatoes, red onions, shredded lettuce, and chopped fresh parsley.
10. squeeze fresh lemon juice over the filling.
11. carefully roll the wraps, tucking in the sides, until they are tightly sealed.
12. slice each wrap in half and serve immediately.

enjoy your delicious roasted eggplant and hummus wraps!
ingredients_list: middle, eastern, eggplant, olive, salt, pepper, whole, wheat, wrap, hummus, tomato, thinly, red, onion, thinly, shredded, lettuce, fresh, parsley, lemon

title: Israeli Couscous Salad with Roasted Vegetables (250 calories per portion, serves 4, contains gluten, origin
raw_text: 18. Israeli Couscous Salad with Roasted Vegetables (250 calories per portion, serves 4, contains gluten, origin: Israel)
ingredients:
: middle eastern)

ingredients:
- 1 cup israeli couscous
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 yellow bell pepper, diced
- 1 zucchini, diced
- 1 eggplant, diced
- 1 red onion, sliced
- 4 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped
- 1/4 cup fresh mint, chopped
- 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).
2. cook the israeli couscous according to the package instructions. drain and set aside.
3. in a large baking sheet, toss the diced red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, zucchini, eggplant, and sliced red onion with 2 tablespoons of olive oil, balsamic vinegar, dried oregano, ground cumin, salt, and pepper.
4. spread the vegetables in a single layer on the baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
5. in a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked israeli couscous with the roasted vegetables.
6. drizzle the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil over the couscous and vegetables. toss well to combine.
7. add the fresh parsley, mint, and crumbled feta cheese to the bowl. gently toss to incorporate.
8. season with additional salt and pepper if needed.
9. serve the israeli couscous salad as a main dish or as a side dish. enjoy!

title: Moroccan Grilled Lamb Chops with Mint Yogurt Sauce (500 calories per portion, serves 2, contains dairy, origin
raw_text: 19. Moroccan Grilled Lamb Chops with Mint Yogurt Sauce (500 calories per portion, serves 2, contains dairy, origin: Morocco)
ingredients:
moroccan grilled lamb chops with mint yogurt sauce:

ingredients:
- 4 lamb chops
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- salt and pepper to taste
- cooking oil for grilling

for the mint yogurt sauce:
- 1/2 cup plain greek yogurt
- 1 tablespoon fresh mint leaves, finely chopped
- 1 tablespoon fresh cilantro leaves, finely chopped
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, mix together the cumin, coriander, paprika, cinnamon, salt, and pepper.
2. rub the lamb chops with the spice mixture, ensuring they are coated evenly. let it marinate for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight in the refrigerator.
3. preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
4. lightly oil the grill grates or pan to prevent sticking.
5. grill the lamb chops for about 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare, or adjust the cooking time according to your preference.
6. while the lamb chops are grilling, prepare the mint yogurt sauce. in a small bowl, combine the greek yogurt, mint, cilantro, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. mix well until all ingredients are thoroughly combined.
7. remove the lamb chops from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes.
8. serve the grilled lamb chops with a dollop of mint yogurt sauce on top.
9. enjoy your moroccan grilled lamb chops with mint yogurt sauce!

note: you can serve this dish with roasted vegetables, couscous, or a side salad for a complete meal.

title: Italian Caprese Panini (400 calories per portion, serves 2, contains dairy, origin
raw_text: 21. Italian Caprese Panini (400 calories per portion, serves 2, contains dairy, origin: Italy)
ingredients:
l: italy):

ingredients:
- 4 slices of whole grain bread
- 1 large tomato, sliced
- 8 ounces of mozzarella cheese, sliced
- 1/4 cup of fresh basil leaves
- 2 tablespoons of balsamic vinegar
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat a panini press or a large skillet over medium heat.
2. drizzle olive oil over one side of each bread slice.
3. place the bread slices, oil side down, on a clean surface.
4. layer the tomato slices, mozzarella slices, and basil leaves on two of the bread slices.
5. drizzle balsamic vinegar over the filling and season with salt and pepper.
6. place the remaining bread slices on top to form sandwiches, oil side facing up.
7. transfer the sandwiches to the preheated panini press or skillet.
8. if using a panini press, close the lid and cook for about 4-5 minutes, or until the bread is crispy and the cheese is melted.
9. if using a skillet, place a heavy pan or a sandwich press on top of the sandwiches to press them down, and cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until the bread is crispy and the cheese is melted.
10. once done, remove the panini from the press or skillet and let them cool for a minute.
11. cut each panini in half and serve warm.

enjoy your delicious italian caprese panini!

title: Sushi Bowl with Smoked Salmon (350 calories per portion, serves 2, contains fish and gluten, origin
raw_text: 23. Sushi Bowl with Smoked Salmon (350 calories per portion, serves 2, contains fish and gluten, origin: Japan)
ingredients:

title: Greek Lemon Chicken Soup (300 calories per portion, serves 6, contains gluten and eggs, origin
raw_text: 25. Greek Lemon Chicken Soup (300 calories per portion, serves 6, contains gluten and eggs, origin: Greece)
ingredients:
: greek)

ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 carrots, diced
- 2 celery stalks, diced
- 6 cups chicken broth
- 1 cup cooked chicken breast, shredded
- 1/2 cup orzo pasta
- 3 large eggs
- juice of 2 lemons
- salt and pepper, to taste
- fresh parsley for garnish
preparation:
1. in a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the onion and garlic and sauté until translucent.
2. add the carrots and celery, and continue to cook for another 5 minutes.
3. pour in the chicken broth and bring to a boil.
4. reduce the heat to low and add the shredded chicken and orzo pasta. simmer for about 8-10 minutes, or until the orzo is cooked al dente.
5. in a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs and lemon juice until well combined.
6. slowly pour about a cup of the hot broth from the pot into the egg mixture, while continuously whisking, to temper the eggs and prevent them from curdling.
7. pour the egg mixture back into the pot while stirring continuously.
8. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes on low heat, stirring constantly, until the soup thickens slightly.
9. season with salt and pepper to taste.
10. remove from heat and garnish with fresh parsley.
11. serve the greek lemon chicken soup hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: greek, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, carrot, celery, stalk, chicken, broth, chicken, breast, shredded, orzo, pasta, egg, lemon, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Mexican Black Bean Salad with Avocado Dressing (300 calories per portion, serves 4, contains legumes, origin
raw_text: 27. Mexican Black Bean Salad with Avocado Dressing (300 calories per portion, serves 4, contains legumes, origin: Mexico)
ingredients:
mexican black bean salad with avocado dressing:

ingredients:
- 2 cups canned black beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 cup corn kernels (fresh or frozen)
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 small red onion, diced
- 1 ripe avocado
- 1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
- 1 small jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced
- 2 tablespoons lime juice
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1/2 teaspoon cumin
- salt and black pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, combine the black beans, corn, bell pepper, and red onion.
2. in a blender or food processor, blend the avocado, cilantro, jalapeno, lime juice, olive oil, cumin, salt, and black pepper until smooth and creamy. if needed, add a splash of water to thin out the dressing.
3. pour the avocado dressing over the black bean mixture and stir gently to combine all ingredients.
4. adjust seasonings according to taste, adding more salt, pepper, or lime juice if desired.
5. serve immediately or chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. divide the salad into four portions and serve as a side dish or as a main course for a light lunch or dinner.
7. enjoy your mexican black bean salad with avocado dressing!

note: feel free to add additional vegetables or toppings such as diced tomatoes, sliced radishes, or crumbled cheese for extra flavor and texture.

title: Indian Masoor Dal (300 calories per portion, serves 6, contains legumes, origin
raw_text: 29. Indian Masoor Dal (300 calories per portion, serves 6, contains legumes, origin: India)
ingredients:
india):

ingredients:
- 1 cup masoor dal (red lentils)
- 2 cups water
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1-inch piece of ginger, grated
- 1 teaspoon cumin seeds
- 1 teaspoon mustard seeds
- 1 teaspoon turmeric powder
- 1 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust according to spice preference)
- 1 teaspoon garam masala
- salt to taste
- fresh cilantro, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. rinse the masoor dal under cold water until the water runs clear. drain and set aside.
2. in a large pot, bring 2 cups of water to a boil. add the masoor dal and simmer on medium heat until the lentils are cooked and soft, stirring occasionally. this takes about 15-20 minutes. remove from heat and set aside.
3. in a separate pan, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. add the cumin seeds and mustard seeds, and let them sizzle for a few seconds until they start to crackle.
4. add the chopped onion to the pan and sauté until it becomes translucent and lightly golden.
5. stir in the minced garlic and grated ginger, and cook for another minute until aromatic.
6. add the turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala to the pan, and cook for a minute to release the flavors.
7. transfer the cooked masoor dal to the pan with the onion and spice mixture. mix well, and season with salt to taste.
8. simmer the dal for an additional 5-10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
9. serve the indian masoor dal hot, garnished with chopped cilantro. it can be enjoyed with steamed rice, naan bread, or roti.
ingredients_list: india, masoor, dal, red, lentil, water, vegetable, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, cumin, seed, mustard, seed, turmeric, powder, red, chili, powder, spice, preference, garam, masala, salt, taste, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Falafel Salad with Tahini Dressing (250 calories per portion, serves 4, contains gluten, origin
raw_text: 30. Falafel Salad with Tahini Dressing (250 calories per portion, serves 4, contains gluten, origin: Middle East)
ingredients:
middle eastern). 

ingredients:
- 1 cup dried chickpeas
- 1 small onion, roughly chopped
- 3 garlic cloves
- 1/2 cup fresh parsley, chopped
- 1/2 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional)
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 tablespoons flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 4 cups mixed salad greens
- 1 cucumber, sliced
- 1 tomato, diced
- 1/4 red onion, thinly sliced
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh mint (optional)

for the tahini dressing:
- 1/4 cup tahini
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons water
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. place dried chickpeas in a large bowl and cover with water. let them soak overnight. drain and rinse before using.
2. in a food processor, combine the soaked chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, cilantro, cumin, coriander, cayenne pepper (if using), salt, and black pepper. pulse until the mixture comes together like a coarse paste.
3. transfer the chickpea mixture to a mixing bowl. add flour and baking powder. mix well until all the ingredients are evenly combined. if the mixture seems too loose, add a bit more flour.
4. shape the mixture into small patties, about 2 tablespoons each, and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. refrigerate for 15-20 minutes to firm up.
5. meanwhile, preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c). after refrigeration, bake the falafel patties for 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway through, until they are golden brown and crispy.
6. in a bowl, combine the mixed salad greens, cucumber, tomato, red onion, and fresh mint (if using). toss well.
7. in a separate small bowl, whisk together tahini, lemon juice, water, olive oil, minced garlic, salt, and pepper, until smooth and creamy.
8. to serve, divide the salad mixture onto four plates. top each with 3-4 warm falafel patties. drizzle with tahini dressing. enjoy!

title: Teriyaki Salmon with Sesame Broccoli (450 calories per portion, serves 2, contains fish, origin
raw_text: 31. Teriyaki Salmon with Sesame Broccoli (450 calories per portion, serves 2, contains fish, origin: Japan)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 salmon fillets
- 1/4 cup teriyaki sauce
- 2 tablespoons honey
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon sesame oil
- 2 cups broccoli florets
- 1 tablespoon sesame seeds
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).

2. in a small bowl, mix together the teriyaki sauce, honey, soy sauce, and sesame oil.

3. place the salmon fillets in a baking dish and season with salt and pepper. pour the teriyaki sauce mixture over the salmon, making sure to coat both sides evenly. marinate for about 15 minutes.

4. while the salmon is marinating, steam or blanch the broccoli florets until they are tender but still crisp. set aside.

5. heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and add the sesame seeds. toast them for a few minutes until they turn golden brown. remove from heat and set aside.

6. place the marinated salmon in the preheated oven and bake for about 12-15 minutes or until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.

7. while the salmon is baking, lightly sauté the steamed broccoli florets in a small amount of sesame oil for a few minutes until they are heated through.

8. remove the salmon from the oven and serve it alongside the sesame broccoli. sprinkle the toasted sesame seeds on top of the broccoli for added flavor and presentation.

9. enjoy your delicious teriyaki salmon with sesame broccoli!
ingredients_list: salmon, fillet, teriyaki, sauce, honey, soy, sauce, sesame, broccoli, floret, sesame, seed, salt, pepper, taste

title: Sweet and Sour Tofu Stir
raw_text: 35. Sweet and Sour Tofu Stir-Fry (250 calories per portion, serves 4, contains soy, origin: China)
ingredients:
ingredients for sweet and sour tofu stir-fry:
- 1 block of extra firm tofu, drained and cut into cubes
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 green bell pepper, sliced
- 1 small onion, sliced
- 1 cup pineapple chunks, canned or fresh
- 1/4 cup tomato ketchup
- 3 tablespoons rice vinegar
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons brown sugar
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 1/2 cup water
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, for frying
- salt and pepper to taste
- cooked rice, for serving
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, whisk together tomato ketchup, rice vinegar, soy sauce, brown sugar, cornstarch, and water. set aside.
2. heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
3. add tofu cubes to the skillet and season with salt and pepper. stir-fry until tofu is golden brown on all sides. remove from the skillet and set aside.
4. in the same skillet, add sliced bell peppers and onion. stir-fry for about 3-4 minutes until they start to soften.
5. add the pineapple chunks to the skillet and stir-fry for an additional minute.
6. pour the sweet and sour sauce over the vegetables in the skillet. cook for a few minutes until the sauce thickens.
7. add the fried tofu cubes back to the skillet and stir until everything is evenly coated with sauce.
8. remove from heat and serve the sweet and sour tofu stir-fry over cooked rice. enjoy!

title: Italian Minestrone Soup (300 calories per portion, serves 6, contains gluten, origin
raw_text: 36. Italian Minestrone Soup (300 calories per portion, serves 6, contains gluten, origin: Italy)
ingredients:
al-gluten-free):

ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 carrots, diced
- 2 celery stalks, diced

3. pour in the diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, and water. add the dried basil, dried oregano, dried thyme, bay leaf, salt, and pepper. stir to combine.

: greece).
