raw_text: 39. Mexican Quinoa Stuffed Peppers (350 calories per portion, serves 4, contains legumes, origin: Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 bell peppers (any color)
- 1 cup quinoa
- 1 cup black beans, cooked and drained
- 1 cup corn kernels, fresh or frozen
- 1/2 cup diced tomatoes
- 1/2 cup diced red onion
- 1/2 cup chopped cilantro
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 cup shredded cheese (cheddar or mexican blend)
- optional toppings: sour cream, guacamole, salsa
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds and cores. set aside.
3. rinse the quinoa under cold water to remove any bitterness.
4. in a saucepan, add quinoa and two cups of water. bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for about 15 minutes or until the quinoa is cooked and the water is absorbed.
5. in a mixing bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, black beans, corn, diced tomatoes, red onion, cilantro, cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper. mix well to combine.
6. stuff each bell pepper with the quinoa mixture, packing it tightly. place the stuffed peppers in a baking dish.
7. sprinkle the shredded cheese over the top of each stuffed pepper.
8. cover the baking dish with foil and bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes or until the peppers are tender and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. remove from the oven and let the stuffed peppers cool for a few minutes before serving.
10. serve the mexican quinoa stuffed peppers with optional toppings such as sour cream, guacamole, or salsa. enjoy!
taste: The key taste profile of this recipe is savory/umami.

: thailand):

5. add the cooked rice noodles and tofu back to the pan. pour the sauce mixture over the noodles and toss to coat everything evenly. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until heated through.
6. remove from heat and add the bean sprouts. toss gently to combine.

8. serve with lime wedges on the side for squeezing over the dish. enjoy your vegan pad thai!

ingredients:
ating from the middle east):

ingredients:
- 1 cup canned chickpeas

- salt to taste
- 2 large whole wheat tortillas
- 1/2 cup purple cabbage, thinly sliced

7. starting from one side, tightly roll up each tortilla into a wrap, tucking in the edges as you go.

title: Mexican Enchilada Stuffed Bell Peppers (350 calories per portion, serves 4, contains gluten, origin
raw_text: 50. Mexican Enchilada Stuffed Bell Peppers (350 calories per portion, serves 4, contains gluten, origin: Mexico)
ingredients:
mexico):

ingredients:
- 4 bell peppers (any color)
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 pound ground beef (or your choice of protein)
- 1 tablespoon chili powder
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 cup cooked rice
- 1 cup canned black beans, drained and rinsed
- 1 cup corn kernels (fresh or frozen)
- 1 cup enchilada sauce
- 1 cup shredded cheese (cheddar or mexican blend)
- optional toppings: chopped cilantro, diced tomatoes, sliced jalapenos, sour cream
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c). line a baking dish with foil or lightly grease it.
2. cut off the tops of the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes. place the bell peppers upright in the prepared baking dish.
3. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the diced onion and minced garlic, and sauté until the onion becomes translucent.
4. add the ground beef to the skillet and cook until browned, breaking it up into smaller pieces with a spatula.
5. sprinkle the chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, and black pepper over the beef mixture. stir well to incorporate the spices.
6. mix in the cooked rice, black beans, and corn kernels. cook for another 2-3 minutes until heated through.
7. pour the enchilada sauce over the beef mixture and stir to combine. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the sauce is heated.
8. spoon the beef and rice mixture into each bell pepper until they are filled to the top.
9. sprinkle shredded cheese over the stuffed bell peppers.
10. cover the baking dish with foil and bake for 25 minutes. then, remove the foil and bake for another 10 minutes until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
11. remove from the oven and let the stuffed bell peppers cool for a few minutes.
12. serve the mexican enchilada stuffed bell peppers with optional toppings such as chopped cilantro, diced tomatoes, sliced jalapenos, and sour cream. enjoy!

title: Moroccan Quinoa Pilaf with Roasted Vegetables (300 calories per portion, serves 6, contains legumes, origin
raw_text: 54. Moroccan Quinoa Pilaf with Roasted Vegetables (300 calories per portion, serves 6, contains legumes, origin: Morocco)
ingredients:
: moroccan;)

ingredients:
- 1 cup quinoa
- 2 cups vegetable broth
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 yellow bell pepper, diced
- 1 zucchini, diced
- 1 large carrot, diced
- 1 small eggplant, diced
- 1 small onion, diced
- 3 cloves garlic, minced

- 1 teaspoon ground coriander

- 1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric

- fresh cilantro, for garnish

1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. in a saucepan, rinse the quinoa under cold water. drain well.

4. meanwhile, in a large baking sheet, toss the diced bell peppers, zucchini, carrot, eggplant, onion, and minced garlic with olive oil. sprinkle with cumin, coriander, cinnamon, turmeric, and cayenne pepper (if using). season with salt and pepper.
5. spread the vegetables evenly on the baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
6. in a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, roasted vegetables, and drained chickpeas. toss gently to mix all the ingredients together. adjust seasoning with more salt and pepper if needed.
7. serve the moroccan quinoa pilaf warm, garnished with fresh cilantro. enjoy!

title: Israeli Sabich Salad (250 calories per portion, serves 4, contains gluten and eggs, origin
raw_text: 66. Israeli Sabich Salad (250 calories per portion, serves 4, contains gluten and eggs, origin: Israel)
ingredients:
israel). 

ingredients:
- 4 pita breads
- 4 hard-boiled eggs, sliced
- 1 large eggplant

preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).

7. to assemble the salad, place a warm pita bread on each plate. layer the sliced hard-boiled eggs and roasted eggplant rounds on top.
8. spoon the tomato-cucumber mixture over the eggs and eggplant.
9. drizzle the dressing over the salad and serve immediately.

enjoy your delicious israeli sabich salad!

title: Greek Moussaka with Eggplant and Beef (500 calories per portion, serves 2, contains dairy and eggs, origin
raw_text: 67. Greek Moussaka with Eggplant and Beef (500 calories per portion, serves 2, contains dairy and eggs, origin: Greece)
ingredients:
: greek

ingredients:
- 1 large eggplant
- 1/2 lb ground beef
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 can diced tomatoes
- 1 tsp dried oregano
- 1/2 tsp dried thyme
- 1/2 tsp cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp nutmeg
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1/4 cup breadcrumbs
- 2 cups béchamel sauce
- 1 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 2 eggs, beaten
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. slice the eggplant into 1/4-inch thick rounds and sprinkle with salt. let sit for 15 minutes to draw out excess moisture. rinse and pat dry.
3. heat a large skillet over medium heat and brown the ground beef. add the onion and garlic and cook until translucent.
4. stir in the diced tomatoes, oregano, thyme, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, and pepper. simmer for 10 minutes.
5. in a separate skillet, heat some oil over medium-high heat. fry the eggplant slices until golden brown on both sides. drain on paper towels.
6. in a greased baking dish, arrange a layer of eggplant slices on the bottom. sprinkle with breadcrumbs.
7. spread half of the meat mixture over the eggplant.
8. repeat with another layer of eggplant and the rest of the meat mixture.
9. in a bowl, combine the beaten eggs and béchamel sauce. pour over the top of the dish, ensuring it covers evenly.
10. sprinkle grated parmesan cheese over the top.
11. bake in the preheated oven for 40-45 minutes, or until the top is golden and bubbly.
12. allow to cool slightly before serving. enjoy your greek moussaka!
ingredients_list: greek, eggplant, ground, beef, onion, clove, garlic, minced, tomato, dried, oregano, dried, thyme, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, pepper, taste, breadcrumb, chamel, sauce, parmesan, cheese, egg

mexico):

raw_text: 73. Greek Spanakopita Stuffed Mushrooms (250 calories per portion, serves 4, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Greece)
ingredients:
greek spanakopita stuffed mushrooms:

ingredients:
- 16 large white mushrooms
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 10 ounces frozen spinach, thawed and drained
- 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
- 1/2 teaspoon dried dill
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1/4 cup breadcrumbs

1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).

6. remove the skillet from heat. stir in the feta cheese, parmesan cheese, parsley, dried dill, salt, and pepper. mix well until the cheeses melt and the mixture is well combined.
7. spoon the spinach mixture into the mushroom caps, filling each one generously.
8. sprinkle breadcrumbs over the stuffed mushrooms.
9. bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender and the tops are golden brown.
10. remove from the oven and allow to cool for a few minutes before serving.
11. serve the greek spanakopita stuffed mushrooms as an appetizer or a side dish, hot or at room temperature. enjoy!

ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 package (14 ounces) firm tofu, drained and cubed
- 1/2 cup unsalted dry roasted peanuts
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1-inch piece of ginger, grated
- 2 green onions, sliced
- 2 dried red chili peppers, chopped (optional for spiciness)
- 1/4 cup low sodium soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon hoisin sauce
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 1/4 cup water
- steamed rice, for serving
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
2. add the tofu cubes to the hot skillet and cook until lightly browned on all sides. remove the tofu from the skillet and set aside.
3. in the same skillet, add the peanuts and toast them for 2-3 minutes until fragrant. remove the peanuts from the skillet and set aside.
4. in the same skillet, add the garlic, ginger, green onions, and dried red chili peppers (if using). stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
5. in a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, rice vinegar, hoisin sauce, cornstarch, and water until well combined.
6. pour the sauce mixture into the skillet and stir to coat the vegetables.
7. add the tofu and toasted peanuts back into the skillet, stirring gently to combine everything.
8. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the sauce has thickened and everything is heated through.
9. serve the kung pao tofu over steamed rice and enjoy!
ingredients_list: china, vegetable, ounce, tofu, unsalted, roasted, peanut, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, green, onion, dried, red, chili, pepper, spiciness, sodium, soy, sauce, rice, vinegar, hoisin, sauce, cornstarch, water, rice

title: Vegan Lentil and Mushroom Bolognese (350 calories per portion, serves 4, contains legumes, origin
raw_text: 78. Vegan Lentil and Mushroom Bolognese (350 calories per portion, serves 4, contains legumes, origin: Italy)
ingredients:
: italian).

ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 8 ounces mushrooms, sliced
- 1 cup green lentils, rinsed
- 1 can (14 ounces) diced tomatoes
- 1 can (6 ounces) tomato paste
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
- salt and pepper to taste

preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.

3. add the sliced mushrooms to the pot and cook until they start to release their moisture.
4. stir in the green lentils, diced tomatoes, tomato paste, vegetable broth, dried oregano, dried basil, dried thyme, salt, and pepper. mix well.
5. bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the pot. let it simmer for about 30 minutes or until the lentils are tender.
6. while the sauce is simmering, cook the whole wheat spaghetti according to the package instructions. drain and set aside.
7. once the lentils are tender, taste the sauce and adjust the seasoning if needed.
8. serve the lentil and mushroom bolognese over the cooked whole wheat spaghetti.
9. garnish with fresh herbs if desired and enjoy!

title: Greek Grilled Halloumi Salad (350 calories per portion, serves 2, contains dairy, origin
raw_text: 79. Greek Grilled Halloumi Salad (350 calories per portion, serves 2, contains dairy, origin: Greece)
ingredients:
greek grilled halloumi salad:

title: Israeli Falafel Salad (300 calories per portion, serves 4, contains gluten, origin
raw_text: 82. Israeli Falafel Salad (300 calories per portion, serves 4, contains gluten, origin: Israel)
ingredients:
: israeli

ingredients:
- 1 cup canned chickpeas, drained
- 1 small onion, chopped finely
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- salt and pepper to taste
- 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 4 cups mixed salad greens
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1 cucumber, diced
- 1/2 red onion, sliced
- greek yogurt or tahini sauce for serving
preparation:
1. in a food processor, combine the chickpeas, onion, garlic, cumin, coriander, cayenne pepper, parsley, cilantro, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. pulse until well combined but still slightly chunky.
2. transfer the mixture to a bowl and stir in the flour until the mixture can hold its shape.
3. shape the mixture into small patties, about 1 inch in diameter.
4. heat the vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. cook the patties for about 4-5 minutes on each side, until they are golden brown and crispy. you may need to do this in batches.
5. remove the patties from the skillet and let them cool slightly.
6. in a large bowl, combine the salad greens, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, and red onion. toss to mix well.
7. divide the salad mixture among four plates and top each with the falafel patties.
8. serve the salad with a dollop of greek yogurt or drizzle with tahini sauce if desired.
9. enjoy your israeli falafel salad!

title: Italian Eggplant Parmesan (400 calories per portion, serves 2, contains gluten and dairy, origin
raw_text: 83. Italian Eggplant Parmesan (400 calories per portion, serves 2, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Italy)
ingredients:
italy):

ingredients:
- 1 large eggplant
- 1 cup breadcrumbs (gluten-containing)
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese (dairy)
- 1 egg
- 1 cup marinara sauce
- 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese (dairy)
- olive oil for frying
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh basil leaves for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. slice the eggplant into 1/4-inch thick rounds. sprinkle salt over the slices and let them sit for about 15 minutes to draw out excess moisture. pat dry with paper towels.
3. in a shallow dish, combine the breadcrumbs and grated parmesan cheese.
4. in another shallow dish, beat the egg.
5. dip each eggplant slice into the beaten egg, allowing any excess to drip off, then coat it in the breadcrumb and parmesan mixture. press lightly to adhere.
6. heat about 1/4 inch of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. fry the coated eggplant slices in batches until golden brown on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side. transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to remove excess oil.
7. in a small bowl, mix the marinara sauce with salt and pepper to taste.
8. spread a thin layer of the marinara sauce in the bottom of an oven-safe dish. arrange half of the fried eggplant slices over the sauce. top with half of the shredded mozzarella cheese.
9. repeat the layering process with the remaining eggplant slices, marinara sauce, and mozzarella cheese.
10. bake in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
11. remove from the oven and let it cool slightly before serving.
12. garnish with fresh basil leaves if desired.
13. serve hot and enjoy your italian eggplant parmesan!
ingredients_list: italy, eggplant, breadcrumb, gluten, containing, parmesan, cheese, dairy, egg, marinara, sauce, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, dairy, olive, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, basil, leaf, garnish

title: Moroccan Lentil and Vegetable Stew (300 calories per portion, serves 6, contains legumes, origin
raw_text: 84. Moroccan Lentil and Vegetable Stew (300 calories per portion, serves 6, contains legumes, origin: Morocco)
ingredients:
: moroccan)

ingredients:
- 1 cup red lentils, rinsed
- 1 onion, diced
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 carrots, diced
- 2 zucchinis, diced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 can (14 oz) diced tomatoes
- 4 cups vegetable broth
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 tablespoon ground cumin
- 1 tablespoon ground coriander
- 1 teaspoon ground turmeric
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh cilantro or parsley, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. in a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the diced onion and minced garlic, and sauté until they become translucent and fragrant.
2. add the ground cumin, ground coriander, ground turmeric, paprika, and cinnamon to the pot, stirring well to coat the onion and garlic mixture.
3. add the diced carrots, zucchinis, and red bell pepper to the pot. stir and cook for a few minutes until the vegetables start to soften.
4. pour in the diced tomatoes with their juice and the rinsed red lentils. stir to combine.
5. add the vegetable broth to the pot and bring the mixture to a boil. reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the lentils and vegetables are tender.
6. season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. serve the moroccan lentil and vegetable stew hot, garnished with fresh cilantro or parsley.

note: you can adjust the spices according to your taste preference. additionally, you can serve the stew with couscous or crusty bread for a complete meal.

title: Greek Gyro Wrap with Tzatziki Sauce (400 calories per portion, serves 2, contains dairy, origin
raw_text: 85. Greek Gyro Wrap with Tzatziki Sauce (400 calories per portion, serves 2, contains dairy, origin: Greece)
ingredients:
: greek)

ingredients:
- 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breast
- 1 tsp dried oregano
- 1 tsp dried dill
- 1 tsp garlic powder
- 1 tsp onion powder
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 tbsp olive oil
- 4 greek pita breads
- 1 cup diced tomatoes
- 1 cup shredded lettuce
- 1/2 cup diced cucumber

for the tzatziki sauce:
- 1 cup greek yogurt
- 1/2 cup grated cucumber
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1 tbsp fresh lemon juice
- 1 tbsp chopped fresh dill
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, mix together the dried oregano, dried dill, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper.
2. rub the chicken breasts with the spice mixture, ensuring they are evenly coated.
3. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. add the chicken breasts and cook for about 6-8 minutes per side, or until cooked through. remove from heat and let cool slightly.
4. while the chicken is cooling, prepare the tzatziki sauce. in a medium bowl, combine the greek yogurt, grated cucumber, minced garlic, lemon juice, chopped dill, salt, and pepper. stir well to combine. set aside.
5. slice the cooked chicken into thin strips.
6. warm the greek pita breads in the oven or microwave, according to package instructions.
7. to assemble the gyros, spread a generous amount of tzatziki sauce onto each warm pita bread. top with sliced chicken, diced tomatoes, shredded lettuce, and diced cucumber.
8. fold the pita bread over the filling and secure with a toothpick, if necessary.
9. serve the greek gyro wraps immediately and enjoy!

title: Chinese Vegetable Spring Rolls (250 calories per portion, serves 4, contains gluten and soy, origin
raw_text: 86. Chinese Vegetable Spring Rolls (250 calories per portion, serves 4, contains gluten and soy, origin: China)
ingredients:
: china).

ingredients:
- 8 spring roll wrappers
- 1 cup shredded cabbage
- 1 cup shredded carrots
- 1 cup bean sprouts
- 1/2 cup sliced mushrooms
- 1/4 cup sliced green onions
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon sesame oil
- 1 teaspoon minced garlic
- 1 teaspoon grated ginger
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- vegetable oil for frying
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, combine the shredded cabbage, carrots, bean sprouts, mushrooms, and green onions.
2. in a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, sesame oil, minced garlic, grated ginger, salt, and black pepper.
3. pour the soy sauce mixture over the vegetable mixture and toss until well coated. let the mixture marinate for about 15 minutes.
4. place a spring roll wrapper on a clean work surface. spoon about 2 tablespoons of the vegetable mixture onto the bottom third of the wrapper.
5. fold the bottom edge of the wrapper over the filling, and then fold the sides inward. roll up tightly from the bottom to the top, sealing the edges with a bit of water to ensure they stick.
6. repeat with the remaining spring roll wrappers and vegetable mixture.
7. heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or deep-fryer to about 375°f (190°c).
8. carefully place the spring rolls, a few at a time, into the hot oil and fry until golden brown and crispy, about 2-3 minutes per side.
9. remove the spring rolls from the oil and drain on paper towels.
10. serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce such as sweet chili sauce, soy sauce, or plum sauce.

enjoy your chinese vegetable spring rolls!

title: Greek Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken Breast (400 calories per portion, serves 2, contains dairy, origin
raw_text: 90. Greek Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken Breast (400 calories per portion, serves 2, contains dairy, origin: Greece)
ingredients:
greek spinach and feta stuffed chicken breast:

ingredients:
- 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 2 cups fresh spinach leaves
- 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 1 tablespoon chopped fresh dill
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. on a cutting board, slice each chicken breast open horizontally without cutting all the way through, creating a pocket for the filling.
3. season the inside of the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
4. in a skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the minced garlic and sauté for about 1 minute until fragrant.
5. add the spinach leaves to the skillet and cook until wilted, about 2-3 minutes.
6. remove the skillet from heat and stir in the crumbled feta cheese, fresh dill, and lemon juice. mix well to combine.
7. stuff the spinach and feta mixture into the pocket of each chicken breast.
8. use toothpicks to secure the chicken breasts, ensuring that the filling remains inside.
9. season the outside of the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
10. place the stuffed chicken breasts in a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and no longer pink in the center.
11. once cooked, remove the toothpicks and let the chicken rest for a few minutes before serving.
12. serve the greek spinach and feta stuffed chicken breast with a side salad or steamed vegetables, if desired.

enjoy your delicious greek spinach and feta stuffed chicken breast!
ingredients_list: greek, spinach, feta, stuffed, chicken, breast, boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, fresh, spinach, leaf, feta, cheese, garlic, clove, minced, fresh, dill, lemon, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Italian Spinach and Ricotta Ravioli (350 calories per portion, serves 2, contains gluten and dairy, origin
raw_text: 91. Italian Spinach and Ricotta Ravioli (350 calories per portion, serves 2, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Italy)
ingredients:
italy):

ingredients:
- 200g all-purpose flour
- 2 large eggs
- 200g fresh spinach
- 200g ricotta cheese
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 2 tablespoons grated parmesan cheese
- salt and pepper to taste
- olive oil for cooking
preparation:
1. in a large mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour and a pinch of salt. create a well in the center of the flour.
2. crack the eggs into the well and gradually incorporate the flour into the eggs. mix until a dough forms.
3. transfer the dough to a lightly floured surface and knead it for about 5 minutes until it becomes smooth and elastic. wrap it in plastic wrap and let it rest for 30 minutes.
4. meanwhile, bring a pot of salted water to a boil. add the fresh spinach and blanch for 1-2 minutes until wilted. drain and let the spinach cool.
5. once the spinach has cooled, squeeze out any excess moisture and chop it finely.
6. in a mixing bowl, combine the chopped spinach, ricotta cheese, minced garlic, grated parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper. mix until well combined.
7. divide the pasta dough into two portions. roll out each portion into a thin rectangular sheet using a rolling pin or a pasta machine.
8. spoon small portions of the spinach and ricotta mixture onto one sheet of the pasta dough, leaving some space between each spoonful.
9. place the second sheet of pasta dough over the filling and press gently to seal the edges of the ravioli.
10. use a ravioli cutter or a sharp knife to cut out individual ravioli squares or circles.
11. bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. cook the ravioli for about 3-4 minutes until they float to the surface.
12. while the ravioli is cooking, heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat. add the minced garlic and cook until fragrant.
13. drain the cooked ravioli and add them to the pan with the garlic. gently toss to coat the ravioli in the garlic-infused oil.
14. serve the italian spinach and ricotta ravioli hot, garnished with additional grated parmesan cheese if desired. enjoy!
ingredients_list: italy, flour, egg, fresh, spinach, ricotta, cheese, garlic, clove, minced, parmesan, cheese, salt, pepper, taste, olive

title: Moroccan Couscous Salad with Roasted Vegetables (300 calories per portion, serves 4, contains gluten, origin
raw_text: 92. Moroccan Couscous Salad with Roasted Vegetables (300 calories per portion, serves 4, contains gluten, origin: Morocco)

moroccan couscous salad with roasted vegetables:

- 1 cup couscous

title: Chinese General Tso's Chicken (400 calories per portion, serves 2, contains gluten, soy, and peanuts, origin
raw_text: 93. Chinese General Tso's Chicken (400 calories per portion, serves 2, contains gluten, soy, and peanuts, origin: China)
ingredients:
: china).

ingredients:
- 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 1/4 cup cornstarch
- 1/4 teaspoon salt

- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon fresh ginger, minced
- 1/2 cup chicken broth

- 2 tablespoons hoisin sauce
- 1 tablespoon honey

preparation:

6. in a separate bowl, whisk together chicken broth, soy sauce, rice vinegar, hoisin sauce, honey, and red pepper flakes. pour this mixture into the skillet with garlic and ginger.
7. stir the sauce mixture in the skillet and let it simmer for a few minutes until it thickens slightly.
8. return the cooked chicken to the skillet and toss it in the sauce until evenly coated. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
9. if desired, sprinkle chopped peanuts over the chicken and stir to combine.

11. garnish with sliced green onions before serving. enjoy!

title: Mexican Beef Tacos with Guacamole (400 calories per portion, serves 2, contains gluten, origin
raw_text: 95. Mexican Beef Tacos with Guacamole (400 calories per portion, serves 2, contains gluten, origin: Mexico)
ingredients:
origin mexico) 

ingredients: 
- 200g ground beef
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 small soft flour tortillas (gluten-containing)
- 1 avocado
- 1 small tomato, diced
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
- 1/2 lime, juiced
preparation:
1. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the chopped onion and minced garlic, and cook until the onion becomes translucent.
2. add the ground beef to the skillet and break it up with a wooden spoon. cook until the beef is browned and cooked through.
3. sprinkle the ground cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper over the beef. stir well to evenly distribute the spices.
4. reduce the heat to low and let the beef simmer for a few minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
5. while the beef is simmering, prepare the guacamole. cut the avocado in half, remove the pit, and scoop out the flesh into a bowl. mash the avocado with a fork until smooth.
6. add the diced tomato, chopped cilantro, and lime juice to the mashed avocado. mix well to combine all the ingredients.
7. warm the flour tortillas in a dry skillet or in the oven according to the package instructions.
8. to assemble the tacos, place a spoonful of the beef mixture onto each tortilla. top with a generous spoonful of guacamole.
9. fold the tortillas in half and serve immediately. enjoy your delicious mexican beef tacos with guacamole!

vietnam)

- 2 cups cooked rice noodles
- 1 cup shredded carrots
- 1 cup thinly sliced cucumbers
- 1 cup fresh bean sprouts
- 1/2 cup fresh mint leaves
- 1/2 cup fresh cilantro leaves
- 1/4 cup chopped roasted peanuts

for the peanut sauce:
- 1/2 cup creamy peanut butter
- 3 tablespoons soy sauce
- 3 tablespoons rice vinegar
- 2 tablespoons maple syrup
- 1 tablespoon hoisin sauce
- 1 tablespoon sriracha sauce (optional)
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 2-3 tablespoons water (for thinning the sauce)
preparation:
1. prepare a large shallow dish or plate filled with warm water.
2. dip one rice paper wrapper into the water for about 10 seconds or until it softens. place it on a clean surface.
3. on one edge of the wrapper, place a small handful of rice noodles, followed by a handful of shredded carrots, cucumbers, bean sprouts, mint leaves, and cilantro.
4. sprinkle with a pinch of chopped peanuts.
5. fold the sides of the wrapper towards the center and tightly roll it up, similar to a burrito.
6. repeat steps 2-5 with the remaining ingredients until all the rolls are assembled.
7. for the peanut sauce, whisk together the peanut butter, soy sauce, rice vinegar, maple syrup, hoisin sauce, sriracha sauce (if using), and minced garlic in a medium bowl. add water gradually to thin the sauce to the desired consistency.
8. serve the summer rolls with the peanut sauce on the side for dipping.
9. enjoy the vegan vietnamese summer rolls as a light and refreshing meal or appetizer!
ingredients_list: vietnam, rice, wrapper, rice, noodle, shredded, carrot, thinly, cucumber, fresh, bean, sprout, fresh, mint, leaf, fresh, cilantro, leaf, roasted, peanut, peanut, sauce, creamy, peanut, butter, soy, sauce, rice, vinegar, maple, syrup, hoisin, sauce, sriracha, sauce, garlic, clove, minced, water, sauce

title: Italian Margherita Pasta (350 calories per portion, serves 2, contains gluten and dairy, origin
raw_text:
100. Italian Margherita Pasta (350 calories per portion, serves 2, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Italy)

Please note that the calorie counts provided are approximate and may vary depending on specific ingredient brands and preparation methods.
ingredients:
: italy)

ingredients:
- 200g whole wheat spaghetti

- 4 ripe tomatoes, diced

preparation:
1. cook the whole wheat spaghetti according to the package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.

title: Grilled Chicken Caesar Salad
raw_text: 4. Grilled Chicken Caesar Salad - 350 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, Italian
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 cups of romaine lettuce, washed and chopped
- 1 cup of cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1/4 cup of grated parmesan cheese
- 1/4 cup of caesar dressing
- 1/4 cup of croutons
preparation:
1. preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
2. season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
3. grill the chicken for about 6-8 minutes per side or until the internal temperature reaches 165°f (75°c).
4. remove the chicken from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into thin strips.
5. in a large bowl, combine the romaine lettuce, cherry tomatoes, and parmesan cheese.
6. add the sliced grilled chicken to the bowl.
7. drizzle the caesar dressing over the salad and toss to coat evenly.
8. divide the salad into four portions.
9. top each portion with croutons.
10. serve immediately and enjoy your grilled chicken caesar salad!

title: Israeli Sabich Sandwich
raw_text: 27. Israeli Sabich Sandwich - 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains eggs, Israeli
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 pitas
- 2 eggs (hard-boiled and sliced)
- 1 small eggplant (sliced into thin rounds)
- 1 tomato (sliced)
- 1/4 red onion (thinly sliced)
- handful of fresh parsley (chopped)
- tahini sauce
- amba sauce (mango pickle sauce)
- vegetable oil
- salt
- pepper
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. place the sliced eggplant on a baking sheet and brush both sides with vegetable oil. sprinkle with salt and pepper.
3. roast the eggplant slices in the oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until they become golden and tender.
4. while the eggplant is roasting, slice the tomato, red onion, and hard-boiled eggs.
5. warm the pitas in a toaster or oven until they become soft and pliable.
6. once the eggplant is ready, remove it from the oven and set aside.
7. to assemble the sandwiches, spread a generous amount of tahini sauce on each pita.
8. then, layer the eggplant slices, tomato, red onion, and sliced hard-boiled eggs on top.
9. drizzle some amba sauce over the fillings.
10. sprinkle with freshly chopped parsley.
11. fold the pitas in half to create a sandwich and serve immediately.

enjoy your israeli sabich sandwich!

title: Chinese Orange Chicken
raw_text: 49. Chinese Orange Chicken - 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Chinese
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup cornstarch
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1/4 cup orange juice
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons honey
- 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon orange zest
- 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes (optional)
- 1/4 cup chicken broth
- 1/4 cup chopped green onions (for garnish)
- cooked rice (for serving)
preparation:
1. start by cutting the chicken breasts into bite-sized pieces.
2. in a large mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, cornstarch, salt, and black pepper.
3. toss the chicken pieces in the flour mixture, making sure they are coated evenly.
4. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
5. add the coated chicken pieces to the skillet and cook until they are golden brown and crispy. this should take about 5-6 minutes.
6. in a separate bowl, whisk together the orange juice, soy sauce, honey, rice vinegar, orange zest, and red pepper flakes (if using).
7. pour the sauce mixture into the skillet with the chicken and stir well to coat the chicken pieces.
8. lower the heat to medium and let the sauce simmer for 2-3 minutes.
9. add the chicken broth to the skillet, stirring continuously, and let it simmer for another 2-3 minutes or until the sauce thickens slightly.
10. remove the skillet from the heat and garnish with chopped green onions.
11. serve the chinese orange chicken over cooked rice and enjoy!
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, flour, cornstarch, salt, black, pepper, vegetable, orange, soy, sauce, honey, rice, vinegar, orange, zest, red, pepper, flake, chicken, broth, green, onion, garnish, rice

title: Israeli Shawarma with Hummus
raw_text: 55. Israeli Shawarma with Hummus - 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Israeli
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 300g boneless chicken thighs
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric
- salt, to taste
- black pepper, to taste
- 2 small pita breads
- 4 tablespoons hummus
- 1/2 cup diced cucumber
- 1/2 cup diced tomato
- 1/4 cup diced red onion
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the olive oil, lemon juice, ground cumin, ground coriander, paprika, turmeric, salt, and black pepper.
2. add the chicken thighs to the bowl and toss to coat them evenly with the marinade. let the chicken marinate for at least 30 minutes.
3. heat a skillet or grill pan over medium heat. cook the chicken thighs for about 5-7 minutes on each side, or until they are cooked through and slightly charred. remove from heat and let them rest for a few minutes.
4. slice the cooked chicken into thin strips.
5. warm the pita breads in a toaster or oven.
6. spread 2 tablespoons of hummus onto each pita bread.
7. divide the sliced chicken evenly between the two pita breads.
8. top with diced cucumber, tomato, red onion, and chopped parsley.
9. roll up the pita breads tightly, cut them in half diagonally, and serve.

enjoy your israeli shawarma with hummus!
ingredients_list: boneless, chicken, thigh, olive, lemon, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, paprika, turmeric, salt, taste, black, pepper, taste, pita, bread, hummus, cucumber, tomato, red, onion, fresh, parsley

title: Chinese Kung Pao Chicken
raw_text: 56. Chinese Kung Pao Chicken - 350 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains peanuts, Chinese
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
- 1/4 cup unsalted peanuts
- 1/2 cup diced red bell pepper
- 1/2 cup diced green bell pepper
- 1/2 cup diced onion
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon hoisin sauce
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes (adjust according to spice preference)
- 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper
- steamed white rice, for serving
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, rice vinegar, hoisin sauce, cornstarch, and black pepper until well combined. set aside.
2. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. add the chicken and cook until browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
3. in the same skillet, add the diced red bell pepper, green bell pepper, and onion. cook for 3-4 minutes, or until the vegetables are slightly softened.
4. add the minced garlic and red pepper flakes to the skillet with the vegetables. cook for an additional 1 minute.
5. return the cooked chicken to the skillet and pour the prepared sauce over the chicken and vegetables. stir to coat everything evenly.
6. add the unsalted peanuts to the skillet and stir to combine.
7. cook the mixture for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
8. serve the kung pao chicken over steamed white rice and garnish with additional peanuts, if desired. enjoy!
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, piece, unsalted, peanut, red, bell, pepper, green, bell, pepper, onion, clove, garlic, minced, soy, sauce, rice, vinegar, hoisin, sauce, cornstarch, vegetable, red, pepper, flake, spice, preference, ground, black, pepper, white, rice

title: Greek Moussaka Casserole
raw_text: 61. Greek Moussaka Casserole - 350 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, Greek
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 large eggplant
- 1 lb diced lamb
- 1 cup diced onion
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 can diced tomatoes
- 1 tsp dried oregano
- 1 tsp dried thyme
- 1/2 tsp ground cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1/4 tsp black pepper
- 1/4 cup red wine
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1 cup greek yogurt
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 1/4 cup breadcrumbs
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. slice the eggplant into 1/4-inch thick rounds, sprinkle with salt, and let sit for 20 minutes to remove excess moisture. rinse the eggplant slices and pat them dry.
3. in a large pan, brown the lamb over medium heat. add onion and garlic, and cook until softened.
4. stir in diced tomatoes, oregano, thyme, cinnamon, salt, and black pepper. simmer for 10 minutes.
5. add red wine and continue to cook for another 5 minutes until the sauce thickens.
6. in a separate bowl, mix together greek yogurt and beaten eggs.
7. grease a casserole dish with non-stick cooking spray. layer half of the eggplant slices on the bottom of the dish.
8. spread half of the lamb mixture over the eggplant, followed by half of the yogurt mixture. repeat the layers.
9. sprinkle grated parmesan cheese and breadcrumbs on top.
10. cover the casserole dish with aluminum foil and bake for 40 minutes.
11. remove the foil and bake for an additional 10 minutes until the top is golden brown.
12. let the moussaka rest for a few minutes before serving. enjoy!
ingredients_list: eggplant, lamb, onion, clove, garlic, minced, tomato, dried, oregano, dried, thyme, ground, cinnamon, salt, black, pepper, red, wine, parmesan, cheese, greek, yogurt, egg, breadcrumb

title: Israeli Shakshuka with Feta
raw_text: 63. Israeli Shakshuka with Feta - 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Israeli
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large eggs
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 1 red bell pepper, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground paprika
- 1/4 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper (optional, for heat)
- 1 can (14 ounces) diced tomatoes
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
- fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. add the chopped onion and red bell pepper to the skillet. sauté for about 5 minutes until they are softened.
3. stir in the minced garlic, ground cumin, ground paprika, and ground cayenne pepper (if using). cook for an additional minute until the spices are fragrant.
4. pour the diced tomatoes into the skillet, including the juice. season with salt and pepper to taste. bring the mixture to a simmer and let it cook for about 10 minutes, or until the tomatoes have thickened slightly.
5. using a spoon, create four indentations in the tomato mixture. carefully crack an egg into each indentation.
6. cover the skillet and let the eggs poach in the tomato mixture for about 6-8 minutes, or until the egg whites are cooked but the yolks are still runny (adjust cooking time according to your preference).
7. remove the skillet from heat and sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese on top.
8. garnish with fresh chopped parsley.
9. serve hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: egg, olive, onion, red, bell, pepper, clove, garlic, minced, ground, cumin, ground, paprika, ground, cayenne, pepper, ounce, tomato, salt, pepper, taste, feta, cheese, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Greek Souvlaki Skewers
raw_text: 66. Greek Souvlaki Skewers - 350 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, Greek
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 lb (450 g) boneless, skinless chicken breast
- 1 tbsp olive oil
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tsp dried oregano
- 1 tsp dried thyme
- 1 tsp dried rosemary
- 1 tsp dried basil
- 1 tsp salt
- 1/2 tsp black pepper
- 1/4 cup greek yogurt
- juice of 1 lemon
- 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped
- 1/4 cup fresh mint, chopped
- 1/2 cucumber, diced
- 1/2 cup cherry tomatoes
- 1/4 red onion, sliced
- 4 pita breads
preparation:
1. cut the chicken breast into 1-inch cubes and place them in a bowl.
2. in a separate small bowl, combine the olive oil, minced garlic, dried oregano, dried thyme, dried rosemary, dried basil, salt, and black pepper to make the marinade.
3. pour the marinade over the chicken cubes and toss them to coat evenly. let the chicken marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes (or overnight for the best flavor).
4. preheat the grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.
5. in a small bowl, mix together the greek yogurt, lemon juice, chopped parsley, chopped mint, and a pinch of salt to make the tzatziki sauce. set it aside.
6. thread the marinated chicken cubes onto skewers, alternating with cherry tomatoes and red onion slices.
7. place the skewers on the preheated grill and cook for about 12-15 minutes, turning occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through and has a nice char.
8. while the chicken is cooking, warm the pita bread on the grill for a minute on each side.
9. serve the greek souvlaki skewers with the warmed pita bread, diced cucumber, and the homemade tzatziki sauce. enjoy!
taste: The key taste profile in this recipe is savory (umami).
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, olive, clove, garlic, minced, dried, oregano, dried, thyme, dried, rosemary, dried, basil, salt, black, pepper, greek, yogurt, lemon, fresh, parsley, fresh, mint, cucumber, cherry, tomato, red, onion, pita, bread

title: Mexican Shrimp Tacos
raw_text: 71. Mexican Shrimp Tacos - 350 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy and shellfish, Mexican
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 lb (450g) shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 2 tbsp olive oil
- 1 tbsp mexican seasoning (chili powder, cumin, paprika, garlic powder)
- salt and pepper to taste
- 8 small tortillas
- 1 cup shredded lettuce
- 1 cup diced tomatoes
- 1/2 cup diced red onion
- 1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro
- 1/2 cup sour cream
- 1/4 cup crumbled queso fresco or feta cheese
- lime wedges for serving
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, toss the shrimp with olive oil, mexican seasoning, salt, and pepper until well coated.
2. heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. add the shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes per side until pink and cooked through. remove from heat.
3. warm the tortillas in a dry skillet or toaster oven until soft and pliable.
4. to assemble the tacos, place a few shrimp on each tortilla. top with shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, red onion, and fresh cilantro.
5. drizzle with sour cream and sprinkle with crumbled queso fresco or feta cheese.
6. serve with lime wedges on the side for squeezing over the tacos.
7. enjoy your delicious mexican shrimp tacos!
taste: The key taste profile in this recipe would be sour.

title: Italian Eggplant Parmesan
raw_text: 77. Italian Eggplant Parmesan - 400 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, Italian
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large eggplants
- 2 cups marinara sauce
- 1 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 1 cup breadcrumbs
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c) and lightly grease a baking dish.
2. slice the eggplants into 1/4-inch thick rounds. sprinkle salt over the slices and let them sit for about 15 minutes to remove excess moisture. pat dry with paper towels.
3. in three separate shallow bowls, place the flour in one, beaten eggs in another, and breadcrumbs mixed with oregano in the third.
4. dip each eggplant slice into the flour, then into the beaten eggs, and finally into the breadcrumb mixture, making sure they are coated evenly.
5. heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. fry the coated eggplant slices in batches until golden brown on both sides. remove and drain on a plate lined with paper towels.
6. spread a thin layer of marinara sauce on the bottom of the prepared baking dish. arrange a layer of fried eggplant slices on top of the sauce.
7. sprinkle grated parmesan cheese over the eggplant layer, followed by a layer of shredded mozzarella cheese.
8. repeat the layers until all the eggplant slices are used, ending with a layer of cheese on top.
9. bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. let it cool for a few minutes before serving. serve the italian eggplant parmesan with a side of spaghetti or a fresh salad.

enjoy your delicious and creamy italian eggplant parmesan!
ingredients_list: eggplant, marinara, sauce, parmesan, cheese, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, flour, egg, breadcrumb, olive, dried, oregano, salt, pepper, taste

title: Vietnamese Bun Cha
raw_text: 78. Vietnamese Bun Cha - 400 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains meat, Vietnamese
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 lb ground pork
- 1 lb pork belly, thinly sliced
- 2 tablespoons fish sauce
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon lime juice
- 4 ounces rice vermicelli noodles
- 1 cup fresh mint leaves
- 1 cup fresh cilantro leaves
- 1 cup fresh bean sprouts
- 1 cup pickled carrots and daikon (available at asian grocery stores)
- 2 fresh red chilies, thinly sliced
- 1 head lettuce, washed and separated into leaves
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the ground pork, fish sauce, sugar, and minced garlic. mix well and let marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
2. in a separate bowl, mix the soy sauce, vegetable oil, rice vinegar, and lime juice to make the marinade for the pork belly. add the sliced pork belly to the marinade and let it sit for at least 30 minutes.
3. cook the marinated ground pork in a skillet over medium heat until browned and cooked through. set aside.
4. heat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. grill the marinated pork belly slices until cooked and slightly charred, about 2-3 minutes per side. remove from heat and set aside.
5. cook the rice vermicelli noodles according to package instructions. drain and rinse with cold water to stop the cooking process. set aside.
6. arrange the lettuce leaves, mint leaves, cilantro leaves, bean sprouts, pickled carrots and daikon, and sliced fresh chilies on a platter.
7. to assemble the bun cha bowls, divide the cooked ground pork, grilled pork belly slices, and rice vermicelli noodles into 4 serving bowls.
8. serve alongside the platter of lettuce leaves and toppings. guests can create their own rolls by wrapping the ingredients in the lettuce leaves and dipping into the pickled carrots and daikon.
9. enjoy the vietnamese bun cha!
ingredients_list: ground, pork, pork, belly, thinly, fish, sauce, soy, sauce, sugar, clove, garlic, minced, vegetable, rice, vinegar, lime, ounce, rice, vermicelli, noodle, fresh, mint, leaf, fresh, cilantro, leaf, fresh, bean, sprout, pickled, carrot, daikon, asian, grocery, store, fresh, red, chilies, thinly, head, lettuce, washed, separated, leaf

title: Mexican Chicken Tamales
raw_text: 83. Mexican Chicken Tamales - 400 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, Mexican
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 lb chicken breast, cooked and shredded
- 2 cups masa harina (corn flour)
- 1 ½ cups chicken broth
- 4 oz cream cheese, softened
- ½ cup salsa verde
- 1 tsp ground cumin
- 1 tsp chili powder
- 1 tsp garlic powder
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 cup corn kernels
- 4 oz monterey jack cheese, shredded
- 8 corn husks, soaked in water
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, combine the masa harina, chicken broth, softened cream cheese, salsa verde, cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, and salt. mix until well combined and the masa forms a smooth dough-like consistency.
2. fold in the shredded chicken, corn kernels, and shredded monterey jack cheese until evenly distributed throughout the masa mixture.
3. drain and pat dry the soaked corn husks. take one corn husk and spread about ¼ cup of the masa mixture onto the husk towards one of the wider ends, leaving space on the sides to fold.
4. fold the sides of the husk towards the center, enclosing the masa mixture and forming a tightly wrapped tamale. fold the bottom end of the husk to seal it.
5. repeat the process with the remaining corn husks and masa mixture.
6. place a steamer basket in a large pot filled with about 2 inches of water. arrange the tamales vertically in the steamer basket, with the open ends facing up.
7. cover the pot and steam the tamales on medium heat for about 1 ½ to 2 hours, or until the masa is firm and easily pulls away from the husks.
8. remove the tamales from the pot and allow them to cool slightly before serving.
9. serve the mexican chicken tamales warm and enjoy!

note: you can garnish the tamales with additional salsa, cheese, cilantro, or sour cream, if desired.
ingredients_list: chicken, breast, shredded, masa, harina, corn, flour, chicken, broth, cream, cheese, salsa, verde, ground, cumin, chili, powder, garlic, powder, salt, corn, kernel, monterey, jack, cheese, shredded, corn, husk, soaked, water

title: Israeli Shakshuka with Spinach
raw_text: 99. Israeli Shakshuka with Spinach - 400 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, Israeli
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 can (400 grams) crushed tomatoes
- 2 cups fresh spinach
- 4 large eggs
- 1/4 cup feta cheese, crumbled
- fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
2. add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the skillet and sauté until softened and fragrant.
3. add the sliced red bell pepper to the skillet and cook for a few minutes until slightly softened.
4. stir in the ground cumin, ground paprika, ground turmeric, salt, and pepper. cook for another minute to toast the spices.
5. pour in the crushed tomatoes and bring the mixture to a simmer. cook for about 5 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. stir in the fresh spinach and cook until wilted.
7. create four small wells in the tomato mixture and crack one egg into each well. cover the skillet with a lid and cook until the eggs reach your desired level of doneness. around 5 minutes for slightly runny yolks.
8. sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese over the eggs and remove the skillet from heat.
9. garnish with fresh parsley and serve immediately. enjoy your israeli shakshuka with spinach!
ingredients_list: olive, onion, garlic, clove, minced, red, bell, pepper, ground, cumin, ground, paprika, ground, turmeric, salt, pepper, taste, gram, tomato, fresh, spinach, egg, feta, cheese, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Greek Moussaka Lasagna
raw_text:
100. Greek Moussaka Lasagna - 400 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, Greek

Please note that these nutritional information and origin countries are approximate and can vary based on specific ingredients and preparation methods.
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 large eggplant, sliced into 1/4 inch thick rounds
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 pound ground beef or lamb
- 1 can (14 ounces) crushed tomatoes
- 2 tablespoons tomato paste
- 1 tablespoon dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 cup milk
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1 cup greek yogurt
- 1 large egg, beaten
- 1/4 cup breadcrumbs
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c). arrange the eggplant slices on a baking sheet and brush both sides with olive oil. season with salt and pepper. bake for about 15 minutes until tender and slightly golden. set aside.
2. in a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. add chopped onion and minced garlic. sauté until translucent and fragrant, about 2-3 minutes.
3. add ground beef or lamb to the skillet and cook until browned, breaking it up with a spoon. drain any excess fat.
4. stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, dried oregano, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg, salt, and pepper. simmer for 10-15 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly. adjust seasoning if needed.
5. in a separate saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. stir in flour until well combined. gradually whisk in milk and cook until the sauce thickens, about 2-3 minutes. remove from heat and stir in grated parmesan cheese. let the sauce cool slightly.
6. in a small bowl, combine greek yogurt with beaten egg. mix well.
7. begin assembling the moussaka lasagna. in a lightly greased baking dish, layer half of the cooked eggplant slices. spread half of the meat sauce over the eggplants. repeat the layers with the remaining eggplant and meat sauce.
8. pour the greek yogurt mixture over the top layer and spread it evenly. sprinkle breadcrumbs on top.
9. bake in the preheated oven for about 30-35 minutes until the top is golden and bubbly.
10. allow the greek moussaka lasagna to cool for a few minutes before serving. cut into 4 portions and enjoy your delicious and satisfying meal!
taste: The key taste profile in this recipe is savory.

title: Grilled Salmon with Lemon
raw_text: 2. Grilled Salmon with Lemon - 250 kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains fish, origin: United States
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 salmon fillets
- juice of 1 lemon
- salt
- black pepper
- olive oil
preparation:
1. preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
2. season the salmon fillets with salt and black pepper on both sides.
3. squeeze the lemon juice over the salmon fillets, ensuring they are evenly coated.
4. brush the grill grates with olive oil to prevent sticking.
5. place the salmon fillets on the grill and cook for about 4-6 minutes per side, or until the flesh flakes easily with a fork.
6. while grilling, baste the salmon occasionally with the remaining lemon juice.
7. once cooked, remove the salmon from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.
8. serve the grilled salmon with lemon wedges on the side for an extra burst of citrus flavor.

note: you can serve this grilled salmon with a side of steamed vegetables or a fresh salad for a complete and nutritious meal.
cuisine: Grilled Salmon with Lemon - Cuisine type: Seafood
ingredients_list: salmon, fillet, lemon, salt, black, pepper, olive

title: Pasta Carbonara
raw_text: 3. Pasta Carbonara - 450 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains eggs, origin: Italy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 320g spaghetti
- 200g pancetta or bacon, diced
- 3 large eggs
- 80g grated parmesan cheese
- salt, to taste
- black pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. fill a large pot with water and add salt. bring the water to a boil.
2. cook the spaghetti in the boiling water according to the package instructions until al dente.
3. in a large skillet, cook the pancetta or bacon over medium heat until crispy. remove from heat and set aside.
4. in a bowl, whisk together the eggs, parmesan cheese, salt, and black pepper until well combined.
5. drain the cooked spaghetti and immediately return it to the pot. pour the egg mixture over the hot spaghetti and toss well to coat the pasta with the mixture.
6. add the cooked pancetta or bacon to the pot and toss again to combine everything evenly.
7. let the pasta carbonara sit for a few minutes to allow the heat from the pasta to cook the eggs and create a creamy sauce.
8. serve the pasta carbonara hot, garnished with additional grated parmesan cheese and black pepper, if desired. enjoy!
ingredients_list: spaghetti, pancetta, bacon, egg, parmesan, cheese, salt, taste, black, pepper, taste

title: Beef Kebabs with Tzatziki
raw_text: 7. Beef Kebabs with Tzatziki - 400 kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: Greece
ingredients:
greece.

ingredients:
- 300g beef sirloin, cut into cubes
- 1 red bell pepper, cut into chunks
- 1 red onion, cut into chunks
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper to taste
- wooden skewers, soaked in water

for the tzatziki:
- 1/2 cucumber, grated
- 200g greek yogurt
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 1 tablespoon fresh dill, chopped
- 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. mix well.
2. add the beef cubes to the marinade and toss to coat. allow it to marinate for at least 30 minutes in the fridge.
3. while the beef is marinating, prepare the tzatziki. in a separate bowl, combine the grated cucumber, greek yogurt, minced garlic, chopped dill, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. mix well and let it chill in the fridge.
4. preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
5. thread the marinated beef, bell pepper, and red onion onto the soaked wooden skewers, alternating the ingredients.
6. place the skewers on the preheated grill and cook for about 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally, until the beef is cooked to your desired level of doneness.
7. once cooked, remove the skewers from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes.
8. serve the beef kebabs with tzatziki on the side. enjoy!
ingredients_list: greece, beef, sirloin, cube, red, bell, pepper, red, onion, olive, lemon, garlic, clove, minced, dried, oregano, salt, pepper, taste, wooden, skewer, soaked, water, tzatziki, cucumber, greek, yogurt, garlic, clove, minced, fresh, dill, fresh, lemon, salt, pepper, taste

title: Baked Cod with Garlic and Herbs
raw_text: 12. Baked Cod with Garlic and Herbs - 200 kcal per portion, 3 portions, contains fish, origin: United Kingdom
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 3 cod fillets
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon of fresh parsley, chopped
- 1 tablespoon of fresh dill, chopped
- 1 tablespoon of fresh chives, chopped
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. in a small bowl, combine the minced garlic, chopped parsley, dill, chives, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
3. place the cod fillets in a baking dish.
4. spread the garlic and herb mixture evenly over the fillets.
5. bake the cod in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
6. serve hot and enjoy your healthy and flavorful baked cod with garlic and herbs!

title: Sushi Rolls (Avocado, Cucumber, and Carrot)
raw_text: 20. Sushi Rolls (Avocado, Cucumber, and Carrot) - 300 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains fish, origin: Japan
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 sheets of nori (seaweed)
- 2 cups of cooked sushi rice
- 1 avocado, sliced
- 1 cucumber, julienned
- 2 carrots, julienned
- 1/2 pound of fresh fish (such as tuna or salmon), sliced into strips

for the dipping sauce:
- soy sauce
- wasabi
- pickled ginger (optional)
preparation:
1. lay a bamboo sushi mat on a clean surface and place a sheet of nori on top of it.
2. wet your hands with water to prevent the rice from sticking. spread 1/2 cup of sushi rice evenly over the nori, leaving a 1-inch border at the top.
3. arrange a few slices of avocado, cucumber, carrot, and fish in a row along the bottom edge of the rice.
4. using the bamboo mat, tightly roll the sushi by folding the bottom edge over the fillings. apply gentle pressure to create a firm roll. moisten the top border of the nori with water to seal the roll.
5. repeat the process with the remaining ingredients to make a total of 4 sushi rolls.
6. once all the rolls are made, use a sharp knife dipped in water to slice each roll into bite-sized pieces.
7. serve the sushi rolls on a plate with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger on the side for dipping.
8. enjoy your homemade sushi rolls!

origin: sushi rolls are a traditional japanese dish that originated in japan.
ingredients_list: sheet, nori, seaweed, sushi, rice, avocado, cucumber, carrot, fresh, fish, tuna, salmon, strip, dipping, sauce, soy, sauce, wasabi, pickled, ginger

title: Lentil Salad with Feta
raw_text: 38. Lentil Salad with Feta - 300 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, origin: Middle East
ingredients:
lentil salad with feta:

ingredients:
- 1 cup dried lentils
- 2 cups water
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 cucumber, peeled and diced
- 1/4 cup red onion, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped
- 1/4 cup feta cheese, crumbled
- 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. rinse the lentils under cold water and remove any debris or stones.
2. in a medium-sized saucepan, combine the lentils and water. bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce to a simmer and cook for 20-25 minutes, or until the lentils are tender but still hold their shape. drain any excess water.
3. in a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked lentils, diced red bell pepper, diced cucumber, finely chopped red onion, and chopped parsley.
4. in a separate small bowl, whisk together the extra virgin olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper to make the dressing.
5. pour the dressing over the lentil mixture and toss gently to combine.
6. sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese over the salad and gently stir to distribute it evenly.
7. taste and adjust the seasoning if needed.
8. divide the lentil salad into four portions and serve immediately.
9. enjoy your lentil salad with feta!

origin: this recipe is an original creation.
ingredients_list: lentil, salad, feta, dried, lentil, water, red, bell, pepper, cucumber, red, onion, fresh, parsley, feta, cheese, virgin, olive, lemon, salt, pepper, taste

title: Baked Teriyaki Chicken
raw_text: 49. Baked Teriyaki Chicken - 400 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains soy, origin: Japan
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 1/2 cup soy sauce
- 1/4 cup brown sugar
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon ginger, grated
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 2 tablespoons water
- sesame seeds for garnish (optional)
- green onions for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a small saucepan, combine the soy sauce, brown sugar, minced garlic, and grated ginger. heat over medium heat until the sugar has dissolved.
3. in a separate small bowl, mix the cornstarch and water together until smooth. add this mixture to the saucepan and stir well.
4. cook the sauce over medium heat, stirring constantly, until it thickens to a glaze-like consistency. this should take about 2-3 minutes. remove from heat.
5. place the chicken breasts in a baking dish and pour the teriyaki sauce over them. make sure to coat both sides of each chicken breast.
6. bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and reaches an internal temperature of 165°f (75°c).
7. remove the baked teriyaki chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.
8. optional: garnish with sesame seeds and chopped green onions before serving.
9. divide the chicken into 4 portions and serve with steamed rice or vegetables.

enjoy your homemade baked teriyaki chicken!
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, soy, sauce, brown, sugar, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, cornstarch, water, sesame, seed, garnish, green, onion, garnish

title: Salmon and Asparagus Foil Packs
raw_text: 57. Salmon and Asparagus Foil Packs - 350 kcal per portion, 3 portions, contains fish, origin: United States
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 3 salmon fillets
- 1 bunch of asparagus
- 1 lemon, sliced
- 3 tablespoons of olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh dill, chopped (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. prepare three sheets of aluminum foil, each large enough to fully enclose a salmon fillet and asparagus.
3. lay a salmon fillet on each foil sheet.
4. trim the ends of the asparagus and divide the bunch into three equal portions. place one portion of asparagus beside each salmon fillet.
5. drizzle each salmon fillet and asparagus with a tablespoon of olive oil.
6. season the salmon and asparagus with salt and pepper to taste.
7. place a few slices of lemon on top of each salmon fillet.
8. fold the foil over the salmon and asparagus, sealing the edges to form a packet. make sure it is tightly sealed to keep in the juices.
9. place the foil packets on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and the asparagus is tender.
10. remove the foil packets from the oven and carefully open them. be cautious of the hot steam.
11. serve the salmon and asparagus on plates, garnishing with fresh dill if desired.
12. enjoy your salmon and asparagus foil packs!
ingredients_list: salmon, fillet, bunch, asparagus, lemon, olive, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, dill

title: Tomato Basil Mozzarella Skewers
raw_text: 65. Tomato Basil Mozzarella Skewers - 250 kcal per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, origin: Italy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 large tomatoes
- 8 small mozzarella balls
- fresh basil leaves
- salt
- pepper
- olive oil
- balsamic vinegar
preparation:
1. rinse the tomatoes and cut them into small bite-sized pieces.
2. drain the mozzarella balls and pat them dry with a paper towel.
3. take a skewer and start threading the ingredients in the following order: tomato, mozzarella ball, basil leaf. repeat this pattern until all the ingredients are used.
4. season the skewers with a pinch of salt and pepper.
5. drizzle the skewers with olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
6. place the skewers on a serving platter and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.
7. serve chilled and enjoy!
cooking_style: the cooking style of this recipe is not specified, as it does not involve any actual cooking. this recipe would fall under the category of "uncooked" or "raw".

title: Vegetarian Tikka Masala
raw_text: 67. Vegetarian Tikka Masala - 350 kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: India
ingredients:
india.

ingredients:
- 1 cup paneer, diced
- 1 cup mixed vegetables (bell peppers, onions, tomatoes)
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1-inch piece of ginger, grated
- 2 teaspoons tikka masala spice mix
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 cup tomato puree
- 1/2 cup heavy cream
- salt to taste
- fresh cilantro, chopped (for garnish)
- cooked basmati rice or naan bread (for serving)
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat. add the chopped onions and cook until they turn translucent.
2. add the minced garlic and grated ginger to the pan. cook for another minute until fragrant.
3. add the tikka masala spice mix, ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder, and paprika to the pan. stir well to combine the spices with the onion mixture.
4. add the diced paneer and mixed vegetables to the pan. stir-fry for a few minutes until the vegetables begin to soften.
5. pour in the tomato puree and stir well to coat the paneer and vegetables with the sauce.
6. reduce the heat to low and cover the pan. let it simmer for about 10 minutes to allow the flavors to blend together.
7. stir in the heavy cream and season with salt according to your taste.
8. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly.
9. serve the vegetarian tikka masala over cooked basmati rice or with naan bread. garnish with fresh cilantro.
10. enjoy your delicious and creamy vegetarian tikka masala!
ingredients_list: india, paneer, vegetable, bell, pepper, onion, tomato, vegetable, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, tikka, masala, spice, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, turmeric, powder, paprika, tomato, puree, cream, salt, taste, fresh, cilantro, garnish, basmati, rice, naan, bread

title: Homemade Pizza (Choice of Toppings)
raw_text: 70. Homemade Pizza (Choice of Toppings) - 350 kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten and dairy, origin: Italy
ingredients:
italian 

ingredients:
- 1 ½ cups of all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon of instant yeast
- ½ teaspoon of salt
- ¾ cup of warm water
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
- tomato sauce
- mozzarella cheese
- choice of toppings (e.g., pepperoni, mushrooms, onions, bell peppers, olives, etc.)
preparation:
1. in a mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, instant yeast, and salt.
2. gradually add the warm water and olive oil to the dry ingredients. mix until a dough forms.
3. transfer the dough to a floured surface and knead for about 5 minutes until it becomes smooth and elastic.
4. place the dough in a greased bowl, cover it with a clean kitchen towel, and let it rise in a warm place for about 1 hour or until doubled in size.
5. preheat your oven to 450°f (230°c).
6. once the dough has risen, divide it into 2 equal portions. roll each portion into a round shape or the desired shape for your pizza.
7. transfer the pizza dough to a baking sheet or pizza stone.
8. spread tomato sauce evenly over the dough, leaving a border around the edges.
9. sprinkle mozzarella cheese over the sauce, and add your choice of desired toppings.
10. bake in the preheated oven for about 12-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese has melted and started to bubble.
11. remove the pizza from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
12. enjoy your homemade pizza! serve it hot.

note: feel free to experiment with different toppings and seasonings to suit your taste.
ingredients_list: italian, flour, yeast, salt, water, olive, tomato, sauce, mozzarella, cheese, topping, pepperoni, mushroom, onion, bell, pepper, olive

title: Mediterranean Salad with Grilled Chicken
raw_text: 73. Mediterranean Salad with Grilled Chicken - 350 kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: Mediterranean
ingredients:
of the recipe: mediterranean.

ingredients:
- 1 chicken breast
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 cups mixed salad greens
- 1/2 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1/2 cup cucumber, sliced
- 1/4 cup kalamata olives, pitted
- 1/4 cup feta cheese, crumbled
- 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons fresh parsley, chopped
preparation:
1. preheat your grill to medium-high heat.
2. in a small bowl, combine olive oil, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. brush the chicken breast with this mixture.
3. grill the chicken breast for about 6-8 minutes on each side or until cooked through. remove from heat and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing into thin strips.
4. in a large salad bowl, combine mixed salad greens, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, kalamata olives, and feta cheese.
5. in a separate small bowl, whisk together red wine vinegar, lemon juice, minced garlic, fresh parsley, salt, and pepper to make the dressing.
6. drizzle the dressing over the salad ingredients and toss to coat.
7. divide the salad between two plates or bowls.
8. arrange the grilled chicken strips on top of the salad.
9. serve immediately and enjoy your mediterranean salad with grilled chicken!
