title: Beef and Broccoli Casserole
raw_text: 76. Beef and Broccoli Casserole - 400 kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains soy, origin: United States
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 250g beef, thinly sliced
- 2 cups broccoli florets
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon oyster sauce
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 1/4 cup water
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 180°c (350°f).
2. in a small bowl, mix together soy sauce, oyster sauce, cornstarch, water, minced garlic, salt, and pepper. set aside.
3. heat the vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat. add the beef slices and cook until browned. remove from the pan and set aside.
4. in the same pan, add the broccoli florets and sauté for a few minutes until they start to soften. remove from heat.
5. in a baking dish, arrange the cooked beef and steamed broccoli evenly.
6. pour the sauce mixture over the beef and broccoli, ensuring all ingredients are coated.
7. cover the baking dish with foil and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the casserole is heated through and the sauce has thickened.
8. remove from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.
9. serve the beef and broccoli casserole warm and enjoy!

note: adjust the seasonings according to your taste preference.
ingredients_list: beef, thinly, broccoli, floret, garlic, clove, minced, soy, sauce, oyster, sauce, cornstarch, water, salt, pepper, taste, vegetable

title: Falafel Wrap with Tahini Sauce
raw_text: 78. Falafel Wrap with Tahini Sauce - 350 kcal per portion, 3 portions, contains sesame, origin: Middle East
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup canned chickpeas
- 1/2 small onion, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons fresh parsley, chopped
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 3 large tortilla wraps
- 1 cup lettuce, shredded
- 1 medium tomato, sliced
- 1/2 small cucumber, sliced
- 1/4 red onion, thinly sliced

tahini sauce:
- 2 tablespoons tahini paste
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 tablespoon water
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. rinse the chickpeas and drain well. place them in a food processor along with the chopped onion, minced garlic, parsley, cumin, coriander, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper. pulse until the mixture is well combined but still slightly chunky.
2. transfer the mixture to a bowl and stir in the flour and baking powder until fully incorporated. allow the mixture to rest for 10 minutes.
3. meanwhile, prepare the tahini sauce by combining tahini paste, lemon juice, water, minced garlic, salt, and pepper in a small bowl. whisk until smooth and set aside.
4. heat vegetable oil in a frying pan over medium heat. shape the chickpea mixture into small patties and carefully place them in the hot oil. cook for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until golden brown and crispy. remove from heat and drain on a paper towel.
5. warm the tortilla wraps according to package instructions or on a stovetop skillet.
6. spread a generous amount of tahini sauce onto each warmed tortilla. layer shredded lettuce, tomato slices, cucumber slices, and red onion on top.
7. place 2-3 falafel patties on each wrap, slightly overlapping.
8. fold the sides of the tortilla wraps over the filling, then roll them up tightly.
9. cut each wrap in half diagonally and serve immediately.

note: this recipe contains sesame, so it is not suitable for individuals with sesame allergies.
ingredients_list: canned, chickpea, onion, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, parsley, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, cayenne, pepper, salt, black, pepper, flour, baking, powder, vegetable, tortilla, wrap, lettuce, shredded, tomato, cucumber, red, onion, thinly, tahini, sauce, tahini, paste, lemon, water, clove, garlic, minced, salt, pepper, taste

title: Lemon Herb Roasted Salmon
raw_text: 79. Lemon Herb Roasted Salmon - 400 kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains fish, origin: United States
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 salmon fillets (about 4-6 ounces each)
- 1 lemon, sliced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon fresh dill, chopped
- 1 tablespoon fresh parsley, chopped
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. place the salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
3. drizzle the olive oil over the fillets and spread the minced garlic evenly.
4. squeeze the juice of half a lemon over the salmon, and place the remaining lemon slices on top.
5. sprinkle the fresh dill and parsley over the fillets, followed by salt and pepper to taste.
6. gently rub the herbs and seasonings into the salmon to ensure even distribution.
7. bake in the preheated oven for about 12-15 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
8. serve the lemon herb roasted salmon hot with a side of your choice, such as steamed vegetables or roasted potatoes.
9. optionally, you can squeeze the juice of the remaining half lemon before serving for extra freshness. enjoy!
ingredients_list: salmon, fillet, ounce, lemon, olive, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, dill, fresh, parsley, salt, pepper, taste

title: Garlic Butter Shrimp with Pasta
raw_text: 82. Garlic Butter Shrimp with Pasta - 400 kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains shellfish, origin: Italy
ingredients:
spain.

ingredients:
- 200g shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 150g pasta (of your choice)
- 3 tablespoons unsalted butter
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 tablespoon fresh parsley, chopped
- 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes (optional)
- salt and pepper, to taste
- lemon wedges, for serving
preparation:
1. bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook the pasta according to the package instructions. drain and set aside.
2. in a large skillet, heat the butter and olive oil over medium heat.
3. add the minced garlic and red pepper flakes (if using) to the skillet and sauté until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
4. add the shrimp to the skillet and cook until they turn pink and are cooked through, around 2-3 minutes per side. season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. add the cooked pasta to the skillet with the shrimp, tossing everything together to combine.
6. cook for an additional minute or so until the pasta is coated in the garlic butter sauce.
7. remove from heat and stir in the chopped parsley.
8. divide the garlic butter shrimp with pasta into two equal portions and serve with lemon wedges on the side.
9. enjoy your delicious garlic butter shrimp with pasta!

title: Shakshuka with Feta
raw_text: 85. Shakshuka with Feta - 350 kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains dairy, origin: Israel
ingredients:
shakshuka with feta - 350 kcal per portion - 2 portions - contains dairy - origin: middle eastern

ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1/2 onion, chopped
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon chili flakes (optional, adjust to taste)
- 1 can (400 grams) crushed tomatoes
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 large eggs
- 50 grams feta cheese, crumbled
- fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. heat olive oil in a large, deep skillet over medium heat.
2. add chopped onion and bell pepper to the skillet and cook until they begin to soften, about 5 minutes.
3. stir in the minced garlic and cook for an additional minute.
4. add ground cumin, paprika, and chili flakes (if using) to the skillet and cook for another minute to release their flavors.
5. pour the crushed tomatoes into the skillet and season with salt and pepper to taste. stir well to combine all the ingredients.
6. lower the heat to medium-low and let the sauce simmer for about 10-15 minutes, allowing it to thicken slightly.
7. carefully make four small wells in the sauce and crack the eggs into the wells. make sure to space them out evenly.
8. cover the skillet with a lid and let the eggs cook in the tomato sauce for about 5-7 minutes, or until the whites are set but the yolks are still runny.
9. sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese over the eggs and place the lid back on for another 2 minutes or until the cheese begins to melt.
10. remove from heat and garnish with freshly chopped parsley.
11. serve hot with crusty bread or pita on the side.

enjoy your delicious shakshuka with feta!
ingredients_list: shakshuka, feta, portion, dairy, origin, middle, eastern, olive, onion, bell, pepper, clove, garlic, minced, ground, cumin, paprika, chili, flake, taste, gram, tomato, salt, pepper, taste, egg, gram, feta, cheese, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Grilled Tofu with Peanut Sauce
raw_text: 99. Grilled Tofu with Peanut Sauce - 300 kcal per portion, 2 portions, contains peanuts, origin: Various
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 block of tofu
- 1/4 cup of soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon of maple syrup
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
- 2 tablespoons of peanut butter
- 1 tablespoon of lime juice
- 1 clove of garlic, minced
- 1/4 teaspoon of ginger powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- chopped peanuts for garnish
- fresh cilantro leaves for garnish
preparation:
1. begin by pressing the tofu to remove excess moisture. place the tofu block on a plate lined with paper towels. place another layer of paper towels on top, followed by a heavy object like a plate or a cast-iron skillet. let it sit for about 20 minutes.

2. in a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, maple syrup, olive oil, minced garlic, ginger powder, salt, and pepper. this will be the marinade for the tofu.

3. once the tofu is pressed, slice it into 1/2-inch thick slices. place the tofu slices in a shallow dish and pour the marinade over them. let them marinate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 2 hours if you have the time.

4. while the tofu is marinating, prepare the peanut sauce. in a small saucepan, combine peanut butter, lime juice, and a tablespoon of water. heat the mixture over low heat, stirring constantly until it becomes smooth and creamy. remove from heat and set aside.

5. preheat the grill to medium-high heat. once heated, lightly oil the grill grates to prevent sticking.

6. remove the tofu slices from the marinade, shaking off any excess liquid. place them on the grill and cook for about 3-4 minutes per side, or until grill marks appear and the tofu is heated through.

7. remove the grilled tofu from the grill and let it cool for a few minutes. slice each piece of tofu into bite-sized strips.

8. serve the grilled tofu with a drizzle of peanut sauce on top. sprinkle with chopped peanuts and fresh cilantro leaves for additional flavor and garnish.

enjoy your grilled tofu with peanut sauce!
ingredients_list: tofu, soy, sauce, maple, syrup, olive, peanut, butter, lime, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, powder, salt, pepper, taste, peanut, garnish, fresh, cilantro, leaf, garnish

of mediterranean cuisine.

title: Grilled steak with roasted asparagus – 600 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains beef
raw_text: 10. Grilled steak with roasted asparagus – 600 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains beef

ingredients:
- 2 steaks (preferably ribeye or sirloin)
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 bunch of asparagus

title: Spinach and feta stuffed chicken breast – 450 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains poultry (origin
raw_text: 13. Spinach and feta stuffed chicken breast – 450 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains poultry (origin: Greece)
ingredients:
al source) and dairy:

ingredients:
- 3 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 2 cups fresh spinach
- 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. using a sharp knife, cut a pocket into each chicken breast by slicing horizontally through the thickest part of the breast, being careful not to cut all the way through.
3. in a sauté pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the spinach and cook until wilted, about 3-4 minutes. season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. remove the sautéed spinach from the heat and let it cool slightly. once cooled, mix in the crumbled feta cheese.
5. stuff each chicken breast with the spinach and feta mixture, being careful not to overstuff.
6. season the outside of the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
7. heat a skillet over medium-high heat and add olive oil. sear each chicken breast for about 2-3 minutes on each side until golden brown.
8. transfer the seared chicken breasts to a baking dish and place in the preheated oven.
9. bake for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and reaches an internal temperature of 165°f (74°c).
10. remove from the oven and let the chicken rest for a few minutes before serving.
11. slice the chicken breasts into portions and serve with your favorite side dishes.
12. enjoy your spinach and feta stuffed chicken breast!
ingredients_list: dairy, boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, fresh, spinach, feta, cheese, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Sushi rolls with avocado and cucumber – 380 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains fish (origin
raw_text: 14. Sushi rolls with avocado and cucumber – 380 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains fish (origin: Japan)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 sheets of nori (seaweed)
- 2 cups sushi rice
- 1/2 cup rice vinegar
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 avocado, sliced
- 1 small cucumber, julienned
- 8 ounces sushi-grade fish of your choice (e.g., salmon, tuna), sliced
- soy sauce, for dipping
preparation:
1. rinse the sushi rice under cold water until the water runs clear. drain well.
2. in a medium saucepan, combine the sushi rice with 2 cups of water. bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, for 15 minutes or until the rice is tender.
3. in a small bowl, mix together the rice vinegar, sugar, and salt until the sugar and salt are dissolved.
4. transfer the cooked rice to a large bowl. pour the vinegar mixture over the rice and gently toss to coat the rice evenly. allow the rice to cool to room temperature.
5. place a sheet of nori on a sushi mat or a piece of plastic wrap.
6. wet your hands with water and grab a handful of sushi rice. spread the rice evenly over the nori, leaving a 1-inch border at the top.
7. lay a few slices of avocado and cucumber evenly across the bottom third of the rice.
8. arrange a few slices of fish on top of the avocado and cucumber.
9. using the mat or plastic wrap, tightly roll up the sushi from the bottom, applying gentle pressure to keep the roll nice and tight. seal the seam by moistening the border of the nori with a bit of water.
10. repeat steps 5-9 with the remaining nori, rice, avocado, cucumber, and fish.
11. use a sharp knife to slice each sushi roll into bite-sized pieces.
12. serve the sushi rolls with soy sauce for dipping. enjoy!
ingredients_list: sheet, nori, seaweed, sushi, rice, rice, vinegar, sugar, salt, avocado, cucumber, ounce, sushi, fish, salmon, tuna, soy, sauce, dipping

al from italy):

title: Borscht with sour cream – 250 calories per portion, 6 portions, contains dairy (origin
raw_text: 21. Borscht with sour cream – 250 calories per portion, 6 portions, contains dairy (origin: Russia)

borscht with sour cream – 250 calories per portion, 6 portions, contains dairy

ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons olive oil

- 4 cups vegetable broth
- 2 cups cabbage, shredded
- 2 cups diced tomatoes
- 1 tablespoon tomato paste
- 1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar
- 1 teaspoon sugar

preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
2. add the onion, carrots, and celery. cook until the vegetables are softened, about 5 minutes.
3. stir in the garlic and cook for an additional minute.
4. add the grated beets and vegetable broth to the pot. bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 20 minutes, or until the beets are tender.
5. stir in the cabbage, diced tomatoes, tomato paste, apple cider vinegar, sugar, salt, and pepper. simmer for another 10 minutes.
6. taste and adjust the seasoning as necessary.
7. serve the borscht hot, garnished with a dollop of sour cream on top of each portion.

title: Teriyaki salmon with jasmine rice – 480 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains fish (origin
raw_text: 23. Teriyaki salmon with jasmine rice – 480 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains fish (origin: Japan)
ingredients:
al recipe source unknown):

ingredients:
- 2 salmon fillets
- ¼ cup soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons honey
- 2 tablespoons rice vinegar
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 1 teaspoon grated ginger
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 1 tablespoon water
- 2 cups cooked jasmine rice
- optional garnish: chopped green onions
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. in a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, honey, rice vinegar, minced garlic, and grated ginger.
3. place the salmon fillets in a shallow dish and pour the teriyaki sauce over them, ensuring they are well coated. marinate for at least 15 minutes.
4. meanwhile, in a separate small bowl, mix the cornstarch and water to create a slurry.
5. transfer the marinated salmon fillets to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. reserve the marinade for later.
6. bake the salmon in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until cooked through and flaky.
7. while the salmon is baking, heat a small saucepan over medium heat. pour in the reserved marinade and bring it to a simmer.
8. add the cornstarch slurry to the simmering marinade, stirring constantly until the sauce thickens. remove from heat.
9. serve the cooked salmon over a bed of jasmine rice and drizzle with the teriyaki sauce. 
10. garnish with chopped green onions, if desired.
11. enjoy your teriyaki salmon with jasmine rice!

note: the nutritional information provided is an estimation and may vary depending on specific ingredients used.

al from the recipe):

title: Cilantro lime grilled chicken with Mexican rice – 550 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains poultry (origin
raw_text: 30. Cilantro lime grilled chicken with Mexican rice – 550 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains poultry (origin: Mexico)
ingredients:
ingredients for cilantro lime grilled chicken:
- 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 2 tablespoons of fresh cilantro, chopped
- 2 tablespoons of lime juice
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
- 1 clove of garlic, minced
- salt and pepper to taste

ingredients for mexican rice:
- 1 cup of long-grain rice
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
- 1/4 onion, chopped
- 1 clove of garlic, minced
- 1 cup of chicken broth
- 1/2 cup of tomato sauce
- 1/2 teaspoon of cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon of chili powder
- 1/4 cup of frozen corn kernels
- 1/4 cup of canned black beans, rinsed and drained
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine the chopped cilantro, lime juice, olive oil, minced garlic, salt, and pepper. mix well.
2. place the chicken breasts in a shallow dish and pour the marinade over them. make sure they are coated evenly. let them marinate for at least 30 minutes.
3. preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
4. remove the chicken from the marinade and discard the excess marinade. place the chicken on the preheated grill and cook for about 6-8 minutes per side, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°f (74°c).
5. while the chicken is grilling, prepare the mexican rice.
6. in a saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the chopped onion and minced garlic, then sauté until they become translucent.
7. add the rice to the saucepan and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the rice becomes slightly golden.
8. pour in the chicken broth, tomato sauce, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. stir well to combine.
9. bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover the saucepan, and let it simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed.
10. in the last 5 minutes of cooking, add the frozen corn kernels and canned black beans to the saucepan. stir gently to incorporate them.
11. once the chicken is cooked, remove it from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it.
12. serve the grilled chicken slices on a plate alongside the mexican rice. garnish with additional fresh cilantro if desired.
13. enjoy your delicious cilantro lime grilled chicken with mexican rice!
taste:
cilantro lime grilled chicken: sour
mexican rice: umami

title: Chili-lime grilled fish tacos
raw_text: 42. Chili-lime grilled fish tacos – 400 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains fish (origin: Mexico)

al recipe):

ingredients:
- 1 lb white fish fillets (such as cod or tilapia)
- 2 tbsp olive oil
- juice of 2 limes
- 2 tsp chili powder
- 1 tsp paprika
- 1 tsp cumin
- 1/2 tsp garlic powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- 8 small flour tortillas
- 1 cup shredded lettuce
- 1/2 cup diced tomatoes
- 1/4 cup diced red onion
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
- 4 tbsp greek yogurt or sour cream (optional)
- lime wedges for serving
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, combine the olive oil, lime juice, chili powder, paprika, cumin, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. stir well to make the marinade.
2. place the fish fillets in a shallow dish and pour the marinade over them. make sure the fish is evenly coated. let it marinate for at least 30 minutes, or refrigerate overnight for more flavor.
3. preheat the grill to medium-high heat. oil the grates to prevent sticking.
4. grill the fish fillets for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until cooked through and flaky. remove from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes.
5. while the fish is resting, warm the flour tortillas on the grill for about 30 seconds per side, or until lightly toasted.
6. to assemble the tacos, flake the grilled fish into smaller pieces. divide the fish evenly among the tortillas.
7. top each taco with shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, diced red onion, and chopped fresh cilantro. add a dollop of greek yogurt or sour cream if desired.
8. serve the tacos with lime wedges on the side for squeezing over the top.
9. enjoy your delicious chili-lime grilled fish tacos!

title: Lemon herb roasted chicken with quinoa – 500 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains poultry
raw_text: 44. Lemon herb roasted chicken with quinoa – 500 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains poultry
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 whole chicken, about 3-4 pounds
- 3 lemons
- 4 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons of fresh rosemary, finely chopped
- 2 tablespoons of fresh thyme, finely chopped
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 cup of quinoa
- 2 cups of water or chicken broth
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 425°f (220°c).
2. rinse the chicken under cold water and pat it dry with paper towels. place it in a roasting pan.
3. cut two of the lemons in half and squeeze the juice over the chicken. place the squeezed lemon halves inside the chicken cavity.
4. in a small bowl, mix together the minced garlic, chopped rosemary, chopped thyme, olive oil, salt, and pepper. rub this mixture all over the chicken, making sure to coat it thoroughly.
5. take the remaining lemon and slice it into rings. arrange the lemon slices around the chicken in the roasting pan.
6. roast the chicken in the preheated oven for about 1 hour to 1 hour and 15 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 165°f (75°c). baste the chicken with the pan juices every 15-20 minutes.
7. while the chicken is roasting, prepare the quinoa. rinse the quinoa under cold water to remove any bitterness. in a saucepan, bring the water or chicken broth to a boil. add the rinsed quinoa, reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 15 minutes or until all the liquid is absorbed. fluff the quinoa with a fork.
8. once the chicken is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it rest for about 10 minutes. slice the chicken into portions.
9. serve each portion of chicken with a side of cooked quinoa. enjoy!
ingredients_list: whole, chicken, pound, lemon, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, rosemary, fresh, thyme, olive, salt, pepper, taste, quinoa, water, chicken, broth

title: Lemon garlic salmon with quinoa and steamed broccoli – 450 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains fish
raw_text: 51. Lemon garlic salmon with quinoa and steamed broccoli – 450 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains fish
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 salmon fillets (about 4-6 oz each)
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 lemon, juiced
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 cup quinoa
- 2 cups water
- 2 cups broccoli florets
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. in a small bowl, combine the minced garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper.

4. bake the salmon in the preheated oven for about 12-15 minutes, or until it flakes easily with a fork.
5. while the salmon is baking, rinse the quinoa under cold water.
6. in a medium-sized saucepan, bring 2 cups of water to a boil. add the rinsed quinoa and reduce the heat to low. cover and simmer for about 15 minutes, or until all the water is absorbed and the quinoa is tender.
7. in a separate pot, steam the broccoli florets until they are tender but still crisp, usually about 5-7 minutes.
8. divide the cooked salmon, quinoa, and steamed broccoli into two portions.
9. serve the lemon garlic salmon on a bed of quinoa alongside the steamed broccoli.

title: BBQ chicken with sweet potato wedges – 550 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains poultry
raw_text: 54. BBQ chicken with sweet potato wedges – 550 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains poultry
ingredients:
ingredients:

- 2 chicken breasts, boneless and skinless
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 tablespoons barbecue sauce
- 2 sweet potatoes
- 1 tablespoon paprika
- 1 tablespoon garlic powder
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 425°f (220°c).

2. start by preparing the sweet potato wedges. wash the sweet potatoes thoroughly and cut them into wedges. leave the skin on for extra texture and nutrients.

3. in a large bowl, combine the sweet potato wedges with 1 tablespoon of olive oil, paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. toss until the wedges are evenly coated.

4. place the seasoned sweet potato wedges on a baking sheet, making sure they are arranged in a single layer. bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes or until they are tender and slightly crispy.

5. while the sweet potatoes are cooking, prepare the bbq chicken. season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper on both sides.

6. in a large skillet over medium heat, add the remaining tablespoon of olive oil. once hot, add the chicken breasts to the skillet and cook for about 5-6 minutes per side or until they are cooked through and golden brown.

7. brush the barbecue sauce over the cooked chicken breasts, coating them evenly. cook for an additional 1-2 minutes to allow the sauce to caramelize slightly.

8. remove the chicken breasts from the skillet and let them rest for a couple of minutes. then, slice them into thin strips.

9. serve the bbq chicken alongside the sweet potato wedges. enjoy!

note: feel free to serve this dish with a side salad or your favorite vegetables to complete the meal. adjust the seasoning and spice level as desired.

- 2 pita breads
- 1/4 cup tahini sauce
- 1/4 cup greek yogurt
- juice from 1/2 lemon
- 1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley
- optional toppings: sliced tomatoes, cucumbers, and onions
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine the olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, ground cumin, ground coriander, ground paprika, ground turmeric, salt, and black pepper. mix well to create a marinade.
2. slice the chicken breasts into thin strips and place them in a ziplock bag or a bowl. pour the marinade over the chicken and toss to coat evenly. allow the chicken to marinate for at least 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
3. while the chicken is marinating, preheat a grill or grill pan over medium heat.
4. cook the marinated chicken on the grill for about 5-7 minutes per side, or until it is cooked through and slightly charred. remove from heat and let it rest for a couple of minutes. slice the cooked chicken into smaller pieces.
5. to make the tahini sauce, in a small bowl, whisk together the tahini sauce, greek yogurt, lemon juice, and chopped fresh parsley until well combined. add salt and pepper to taste.
6. warm the pita breads either on the grill or in a lightly greased skillet until they are soft and pliable.
7. to assemble the chicken shawarma, spread a generous amount of tahini sauce onto each warmed pita bread. top with sliced chicken and desired toppings such as tomatoes, cucumbers, and onions.
8. fold the pita breads over the filling, cut in half if desired, and serve immediately.

enjoy your delicious and flavorful chicken shawarma with pita bread and tahini sauce!

title: Fish and chips with tartar sauce – 500 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains fish (origin
raw_text: 68. Fish and chips with tartar sauce – 500 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains fish (origin: United Kingdom)
ingredients:
fish and chips with tartar sauce:

ingredients:

for the batter:

- 1 tablespoon fresh dill, chopped

8. while the fish and chips are cooking, prepare the tartar sauce. in a small bowl, combine the mayonnaise, chopped pickles, capers, fresh dill, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. mix well until all ingredients are fully incorporated.
9. once the fish and chips are ready, serve them hot with a dollop of the tartar sauce on the side.

title: Lemon herb grilled chicken with roasted vegetables – 480 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains poultry
raw_text: 71. Lemon herb grilled chicken with roasted vegetables – 480 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains poultry
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 3 chicken breasts

- 1 zucchini, sliced

- 1 yellow bell pepper, sliced

- fresh parsley for garnish
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine the lemon juice, lemon zest, olive oil, minced garlic, dried thyme, dried rosemary, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. mix well.
2. place the chicken breasts in a shallow dish and pour the marinade over them. coat the chicken evenly and let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
3. preheat your grill over medium heat. if using an outdoor grill, make sure it is well-oiled to prevent sticking.
4. while the grill is preheating, preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
5. in a separate baking dish, combine the sliced zucchini, red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, red onion, balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper. toss the vegetables to coat them in the vinegar and seasonings.
6. place the baking dish with the vegetables into the preheated oven and roast for 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and slightly caramelized. stir occasionally.
7. while the vegetables are roasting, remove the marinated chicken from the refrigerator and discard the excess marinade.
8. place the chicken breasts on the preheated grill and cook for about 6-8 minutes on each side, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°f (74°c). cooking time may vary depending on the thickness of the chicken breasts.
9. once the chicken is cooked, remove it from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes. then, slice it into strips or leave it whole, according to your preference.
10. serve the grilled chicken alongside the roasted vegetables. garnish with fresh parsley for added freshness and flavor.
11. enjoy your lemon herb grilled chicken with roasted vegetables!

title: Orange glazed chicken with quinoa and steamed broccoli – 550 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains poultry
raw_text: 79. Orange glazed chicken with quinoa and steamed broccoli – 550 calories per portion, 2 portions, contains poultry
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 1 cup orange juice
- 2 tablespoons honey
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon grated ginger
- 1 cup quinoa
- 2 cups chicken broth
- 2 cups broccoli florets
- salt and pepper to taste
- cooking oil
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, mix together orange juice, honey, soy sauce, minced garlic, and grated ginger to make the glaze. set aside.
2. season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
3. heat some cooking oil in a pan over medium heat. add the chicken breasts and cook until browned on both sides and cooked through, about 6-8 minutes per side. set aside.
4. in a separate saucepan, bring the chicken broth to a boil. add the quinoa, reduce the heat, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until the quinoa is cooked and the liquid is absorbed. fluff with a fork.
5. in another saucepan or steamer, steam the broccoli until tender-crisp, about 5-7 minutes.
6. while the broccoli is steaming, pour the glaze mixture into a small saucepan and bring to a boil. reduce heat and simmer for about 5 minutes until the glaze thickens.
7. brush the cooked chicken with the glaze on both sides.
8. divide the cooked quinoa, steamed broccoli, and glazed chicken breasts into two portions.
9. serve the orange glazed chicken on top of the quinoa and with a side of steamed broccoli. enjoy!

title: Herb and lemon roasted chicken with mashed potatoes – 550 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains poultry
raw_text: 92. Herb and lemon roasted chicken with mashed potatoes – 550 calories per portion, 3 portions, contains poultry
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 whole chicken, approximately 3 pounds
- salt and pepper to taste
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh herbs (such as rosemary, thyme, and parsley)
- juice of 1 lemon
- 4 medium potatoes, peeled and quartered
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 1/4 cup milk or cream
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. rinse the chicken and pat it dry with paper towels. season the chicken, inside and out, with salt and pepper.
3. in a small bowl, mix together the olive oil, chopped herbs, and lemon juice. rub the herb and lemon mixture all over the chicken, making sure to coat it evenly.
4. place the chicken in a roasting pan and place it in the preheated oven. roast for about 1 hour or until the chicken is cooked through and golden brown. use a meat thermometer to ensure the internal temperature reaches 165°f (74°c).
5. while the chicken is roasting, prepare the mashed potatoes. place the quartered potatoes in a large pot and cover them with cold water. add salt to taste and bring the water to a boil. cook the potatoes until they are fork-tender, about 15-20 minutes.
6. drain the cooked potatoes and return them to the pot. add butter and milk/cream to the potatoes. mash the potatoes until smooth and creamy. season with salt and pepper, if desired.
7. once the chicken is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before carving.
8. serve the herb and lemon roasted chicken with mashed potatoes on the side. enjoy!

japan 

ingredients:

- 1/4 cup soy sauce (gluten-free if needed)
- 2 tablespoons honey
- 2 tablespoons rice vinegar
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ginger, grated
- 2 cups cooked white or brown rice
- 1 tablespoon sesame seeds
- 2 green onions, sliced
preparation:
1. in a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce, honey, rice vinegar, minced garlic, and grated ginger to make the teriyaki sauce.

7. serve the cooked salmon over a bed of cooked rice. drizzle some of the thickened teriyaki sauce over the salmon and rice.
8. garnish with sesame seeds and sliced green onions. enjoy!

- 4 hamburger buns (gluten-containing)

1. preheat your oven to 325°f (162°c).

6. in a large skillet or saucepan, heat the bbq sauce over medium heat.

8. cook the pork in the bbq sauce for another 5-10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until heated through.
9. split the hamburger buns and lightly toast them if desired.

11. if using, add additional toppings such as coleslaw, pickles, and sliced onions.
12. place the top half of the bun on each sandwich to complete it.
13. serve the bbq pulled pork sandwiches hot and enjoy!

1. heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. add the onion, jalapeno pepper, and garlic to the skillet. sauté until the onion is translucent and the peppers are softened.
3. add the black beans, diced tomatoes, cooked rice, cumin, chili powder, paprika, salt, and black pepper to the skillet. stir well to combine all the ingredients. cook for 5-7 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
4. warm the tortillas in a separate skillet over low heat or according to the package instructions.
5. spoon the bean and rice mixture onto each tortilla, dividing it equally among them.
6. fold the sides of each tortilla inwards, then roll it up tightly to form a burrito.
7. serve the spicy black bean burritos as is or optionally top them with shredded cheese, sliced avocado, sour cream, or salsa.
8. enjoy your flavorful and filling spicy black bean burritos!

title: Lemon Garlic Shrimp Scampi
raw_text: 31. Lemon Garlic Shrimp Scampi - 300 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (pasta), Origin: Italy
ingredients:
america

- 1 lb (450 g) medium-sized shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 8 oz (225 g) linguine pasta

preparation:
1. cook the linguine pasta according to package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.

4. add the shrimp to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes per side, until pink and cooked through. remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
5. increase the heat to medium-high and add the lemon juice and white wine (or chicken broth) to the skillet. bring the mixture to a boil and let it reduce for about 2-3 minutes.
6. reduce the heat to low and add the cooked linguine pasta and chopped parsley to the skillet. toss to coat the pasta in the sauce.
7. return the cooked shrimp to the skillet and gently toss everything together to combine. season with salt and pepper to taste.

title: Beef Stroganoff with Egg Noodles
raw_text: 32. Beef Stroganoff with Egg Noodles - 450 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (noodles), Origin: Russia
ingredients:
russia.

ingredients:
- 1 pound beef sirloin, sliced into thin strips
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 8 ounces mushrooms, sliced
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 1 cup beef broth
- 1/4 cup sour cream
- 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour
- 1 tablespoon worcestershire sauce
- salt and pepper to taste
- 8 ounces egg noodles
preparation:
1. cook the egg noodles according to package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.
2. in a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. add the chopped onion and minced garlic, sauté until they become translucent and fragrant.
3. increase the heat to medium-high and add the sliced beef. cook until browned on all sides.
4. remove the beef from the skillet and set aside. in the same skillet, add the sliced mushrooms and cook until they release their moisture and start to brown.
5. sprinkle the flour over the mushrooms and stir well to coat. cook for another minute or until the flour is fully incorporated.
6. slowly pour in the beef broth while stirring constantly. return the cooked beef to the skillet and stir in the worcestershire sauce. season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. reduce the heat to low and simmer the mixture for about 10 minutes or until the beef is tender and the sauce has thickened slightly.
8. stir in the sour cream, making sure it is well combined with the sauce. cook for an additional minute to heat through.
9. serve the beef stroganoff over the cooked egg noodles. enjoy!

title: Chicken Cordon Bleu
raw_text: 39. Chicken Cordon Bleu - 500 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (breadcrumbs), Origin: Unknown
ingredients:
: french

ingredients:
- 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 4 slices of ham
- 4 slices of swiss cheese
- 1 cup of breadcrumbs (gluten-free if desired)
- 1/2 cup of all-purpose flour (gluten-free if desired)
- 2 eggs, beaten
- salt and pepper to taste
- cooking oil for frying
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. use a meat mallet to flatten each chicken breast, making them about 1/4 inch thick.
3. season both sides of the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
4. place a slice of ham and a slice of swiss cheese on top of each chicken breast.
5. roll up each chicken breast tightly, securing with toothpicks if necessary.
6. in three separate shallow bowls, place the flour, beaten eggs, and breadcrumbs.
7. coat each rolled chicken breast in flour, dip into the beaten eggs, then coat with breadcrumbs, pressing gently to adhere.
8. heat cooking oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
9. fry the chicken cordon bleu rolls until golden brown on all sides, about 4-6 minutes per side.
10. transfer the chicken rolls to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the cheese is melted.
11. remove toothpicks before serving.
12. serve the chicken cordon bleu hot with your favorite sides, such as mashed potatoes or steamed vegetables.

note: nutrition information may vary depending on specific ingredient brands and preparation methods.

title: Beef and Vegetable Stir
raw_text: 47. Beef and Vegetable Stir-Fry - 350 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (soy sauce), Origin: Unknown
ingredients:
american

- 1 pound of beef (sirloin or flank steak), thinly sliced
- 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil

title: Szechuan Shrimp
raw_text: 51. Szechuan Shrimp - 350 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains shellfish, Origin: China
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound of shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 1 tablespoon szechuan peppercorns
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 4 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 inch ginger, grated
- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 green bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 small onion, thinly sliced
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon honey
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch, dissolved in 2 tablespoons water
- salt to taste
- fresh cilantro, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. in a dry skillet, toast the szechuan peppercorns over medium heat until fragrant. remove from the skillet and crush them using a mortar and pestle.
2. heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. add the minced garlic, grated ginger, and crushed szechuan peppercorns. stir-fry for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
3. add the sliced bell peppers and onion to the wok and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until slightly softened.
4. push the vegetables to the side of the wok and add the shrimp. stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until the shrimp turn pink and opaque.
5. in a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, and salt. pour the sauce into the wok and stir to coat the shrimp and vegetables.
6. stir in the cornstarch mixture to thicken the sauce. cook for an additional minute until the sauce is thick and glossy.
7. remove from heat and garnish with chopped cilantro.
8. serve the szechuan shrimp hot with steamed rice or noodles.

note: this recipe contains shellfish, so make sure to check for any allergies or dietary restrictions before serving.

title: Burrito Bowl with Grilled Chicken
raw_text: 55. Burrito Bowl with Grilled Chicken - 400 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (rice), Origin: Mexico
ingredients:
: mexican.

ingredients:
- 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 teaspoons chili powder
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 cup cooked rice (can use white or brown rice)
- 1 cup canned black beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 cup corn kernels, cooked
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1 avocado, sliced
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
- juice of 1 lime
- 4 tablespoons salsa
- 4 tablespoons sour cream
- 4 tablespoons shredded cheese
- optional toppings: sliced jalapenos, sliced black olives, diced red onion
preparation:
1. preheat the grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.
2. in a small bowl, mix together olive oil, chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper to make the marinade. brush the marinade onto both sides of the chicken breasts.
3. grill the chicken for about 6-8 minutes per side, or until cooked through. remove from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes, then slice it into thin strips.
4. in a large bowl, combine cooked rice, black beans, corn, cherry tomatoes, avocado slices, chopped cilantro, and lime juice. toss to mix well.
5. divide the rice and vegetable mixture into four bowls.
6. top each bowl with the grilled chicken slices.
7. drizzle each bowl with salsa and sour cream.
8. sprinkle shredded cheese over each bowl.
9. add any optional toppings as desired.
10. enjoy your delicious burrito bowl with grilled chicken!

title: Chicken Parmesan Sub
raw_text: 58. Chicken Parmesan Sub - 550 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (bread), Origin: Italy
ingredients:
italy.

ingredients:
- 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 large eggs
- 1 cup breadcrumbs
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1/4 cup olive oil
- 1 cup marinara sauce
- 4 sub rolls
- 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- fresh basil leaves, for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. place the chicken breasts between two sheets of plastic wrap and pound them to an even thickness using a meat mallet or rolling pin.
3. in three separate bowls, place the flour, beaten eggs, and breadcrumbs mixed with parmesan cheese, dried basil, dried oregano, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
4. dip each chicken breast into the flour, then the beaten eggs, and finally, coat with the breadcrumb mixture, pressing gently to adhere.
5. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. cook the breaded chicken breasts for about 4-5 minutes on each side until golden brown and cooked through. repeat with the remaining chicken breasts, if necessary.
6. remove the chicken from the skillet and place on a baking sheet. spoon marinara sauce over each chicken breast and sprinkle with shredded mozzarella cheese.
7. bake the chicken in the preheated oven for about 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. slice each sub roll in half and lightly toast them if desired.
9. place a chicken breast on each sub roll and spoon additional marinara sauce over it if desired. garnish with fresh basil leaves, if desired.
10. serve the chicken parmesan subs immediately and enjoy!

note: you can serve this dish with a side salad or roasted vegetables to complete the meal.

title: Beef and Vegetable Curry
raw_text: 65. Beef and Vegetable Curry - 450 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains nuts (cashews), Origin: Unknown
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 500g beef, thinly sliced
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 onion, thinly sliced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon ginger, minced
- 2 teaspoons curry powder
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional, adjust to taste)
- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 green bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 carrot, julienned
- 1 cup green beans
- 1 cup beef or vegetable broth
- 1 cup coconut milk
- 1/2 cup cashews, chopped
- fresh cilantro, chopped (for garnish)
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. in a large skillet or dutch oven, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
2. add the onion, garlic, and ginger to the skillet and sauté until the onion becomes translucent.
3. add the beef to the skillet and brown it on all sides.
4. in a small bowl, combine the curry powder, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and cayenne pepper (if using).
5. sprinkle the spice mixture over the beef and stir well to coat.
6. add the red and green bell peppers, carrot, and green beans to the skillet.
7. stir in the beef or vegetable broth and coconut milk, then bring the mixture to a simmer.
8. reduce the heat to low, cover the skillet, and let the curry simmer for about 30 minutes, or until the beef is tender and the flavors have melded together.
9. meanwhile, toast the cashews in a dry skillet over medium heat until they become golden and fragrant.
10. once the curry is done, stir in the cashews and season with salt and pepper to taste.
11. serve the beef and vegetable curry over steamed rice or with naan bread.
12. garnish with freshly chopped cilantro. enjoy!
note: make sure to mention in case someone has nut allergies.

title: Mexican Chicken Enchilada Casserole
raw_text: 70. Mexican Chicken Enchilada Casserole - 450 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (tortillas), Origin: Mexico
ingredients:
of dish: mexico.

ingredients:
- 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 can (15 ounces) black beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 can (15 ounces) diced tomatoes
- 1 can (4 ounces) diced green chilies
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- salt and pepper to taste
- 6 corn tortillas
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- fresh cilantro, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the chopped onion, minced garlic, and diced bell pepper. sauté until the vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes.
3. push the vegetables to one side of the skillet and add the chicken breasts. cook until browned on both sides and cooked through, about 6-8 minutes per side. remove the chicken from the skillet and shred it using two forks.
4. return the shredded chicken to the skillet and add the black beans, diced tomatoes, diced green chilies, chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. stir well to combine and simmer for 5 minutes.
5. spray a 9x9-inch (23x23 cm) baking dish with cooking spray. place 2 tortillas on the bottom of the dish, overlapping if necessary.
6. spread half of the chicken mixture over the tortillas. sprinkle with 1/3 cup shredded cheddar cheese.
7. repeat with another layer of tortillas, chicken mixture, and cheese.
8. top with the remaining 2 tortillas and sprinkle with the remaining cheese.
9. cover the baking dish with foil and bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. remove the foil and bake for an additional 5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. serve hot, garnished with freshly chopped cilantro. enjoy your mexican chicken enchilada casserole!

note: this recipe is estimated to have 450 calories per portion, and it contains gluten from the corn tortillas.

2. cook the ziti pasta according to package instructions until al dente. drain well and set aside.
3. in a large skillet, cook the italian sausage over medium heat until browned and cooked through, breaking it up into small pieces with a spatula or spoon. remove any excess grease.
4. add the minced garlic to the skillet and cook for another minute until fragrant. stir in the marinara sauce, dried oregano, dried basil, and red pepper flakes (if using). season with salt and black pepper to taste. simmer for 5 minutes.
5. in a separate bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, shredded mozzarella cheese, and grated parmesan cheese. mix well.
6. in the greased baking dish, layer half of the cooked ziti pasta. spread half of the meat sauce over the pasta. then, spoon half of the ricotta cheese mixture over the sauce. repeat the layers with the remaining ingredients.
7. cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and place it in the preheated oven. bake for 20 minutes.
8. remove the foil and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes or until the cheese is bubbly and golden brown.
9. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes. garnish with fresh parsley before serving.
10. serve hot and enjoy this delicious baked ziti with italian sausage!

note: the nutritional information provided is an estimate and may vary depending on the specific ingredients used and portion sizes.
ingredients_list: italian, ziti, pasta, italian, sausage, casing, marinara, sauce, ricotta, cheese, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, parmesan, cheese, clove, garlic, minced, dried, oregano, dried, basil, red, pepper, flake, salt, black, pepper, taste, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Thai Yellow Curry with Chicken
raw_text: 75. Thai Yellow Curry with Chicken - 500 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains shellfish (fish sauce), Origin: Thailand
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 500g boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 2 tablespoons yellow curry paste
- 1 can (400ml) coconut milk
- 1 cup chicken broth
- 2 tablespoons fish sauce
- 2 tablespoons brown sugar
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 yellow bell pepper, sliced
- 1 small yellow onion, sliced
- 1 cup sliced mushrooms
- 1 cup snap peas
- fresh cilantro for garnish
- cooked jasmine rice, for serving
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large pot or wok over medium heat.
2. add the yellow curry paste and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly to release the flavors.
3. add the chicken to the pot and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
4. pour in the coconut milk and chicken broth, stirring well to combine.
5. stir in the fish sauce and brown sugar, then add the bell peppers, onion, mushrooms, and snap peas.
6. bring the curry to a simmer and cook for 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
7. taste and adjust seasoning with more fish sauce or brown sugar if desired.
8. serve the thai yellow curry over jasmine rice, garnished with fresh cilantro. enjoy!

title: Beef Tostadas
raw_text: 76. Beef Tostadas - 400 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (tortillas), Origin: Mexico
ingredients:
: mexico.

ingredients:
- 1 lb ground beef
- 1 tbsp vegetable oil
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tsp ground cumin
- 1 tsp chili powder
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1/2 tsp black pepper
- 4 medium-sized corn tortillas
- 1 cup refried beans
- 1 cup shredded lettuce
- 1/2 cup diced tomatoes
- 1/2 cup diced avocado
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
- 1/4 cup sour cream
- 1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese
preparation:
1. in a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. add the diced onion and minced garlic, and sauté until softened.
2. add the ground beef to the skillet, and cook until browned and cooked through.
3. stir in the ground cumin, chili powder, salt, and black pepper, and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together. remove from heat.
4. in a separate skillet, heat a small amount of vegetable oil over medium-high heat. add the corn tortillas, one at a time, and fry until they become crispy and lightly golden. transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain any excess oil.
5. spread a layer of refried beans onto each fried tortilla.
6. top the tortillas with the cooked ground beef mixture, spreading it evenly.
7. garnish each tostada with shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, diced avocado, chopped fresh cilantro, sour cream, and shredded cheddar cheese.
8. serve immediately and enjoy!

note: if you have any dietary restrictions or preferences, feel free to adjust the recipe accordingly.

title: Lemon Garlic Butter Scallops
raw_text: 77. Lemon Garlic Butter Scallops - 300 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains shellfish, Origin: Unknown
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 16 large scallops
- 4 tablespoons unsalted butter, divided
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
- zest of 1 lemon
- salt and pepper to taste
- chopped parsley for garnish
preparation:
1. pat the scallops dry with a paper towel and season both sides with salt and pepper.
2. in a large skillet, melt 2 tablespoons of butter over medium-high heat.
3. add the scallops to the skillet and cook for about 2-3 minutes per side until they are golden brown and opaque in the center. transfer the cooked scallops to a plate and set aside.
4. in the same skillet, melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter. add minced garlic and cook for about a minute until fragrant.
5. stir in lemon juice and lemon zest, then season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. return the cooked scallops to the skillet and toss them in the lemon garlic butter sauce until fully coated.
7. cook for an additional minute or until the scallops are heated through.
8. serve the lemon garlic butter scallops immediately, garnished with chopped parsley. enjoy!
ingredients_list: scallop, unsalted, butter, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, lemon, zest, lemon, salt, pepper, taste, parsley, garnish

title: Chicken Piccata
raw_text: 80. Chicken Piccata - 400 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (flour), Origin: Italy
ingredients:
chicken piccata:

ingredients:
- 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- salt and black pepper, to taste
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1/4 cup chicken broth
- 1/4 cup fresh lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons capers, drained
- 2 tablespoons butter
- chopped fresh parsley, for garnish
preparation:
1. start by pounding chicken breasts to an even thickness of about 1/2 inch. season each side with salt and black pepper.
2. in a shallow dish, combine flour with a pinch of salt and pepper. dredge each chicken breast in the flour mixture, shaking off any excess.
3. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. place chicken breasts in the skillet and cook for about 3-4 minutes per side, or until cooked through and golden brown. remove the cooked chicken from the skillet and set aside.
4. in the same skillet, add the chicken broth and lemon juice. scrape the bottom of the skillet to release any browned bits. let the liquid reduce for about 2 minutes.
5. stir in the capers and butter. allow the butter to melt and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly.
6. return the chicken breasts to the skillet and coat them with the sauce. cook for an additional 1-2 minutes to warm through.
7. serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley.

note: this recipe contains gluten from the flour used for dredging the chicken.
ingredients_list: chicken, piccata, boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, flour, salt, black, pepper, taste, olive, chicken, broth, fresh, lemon, caper, butter, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Mongolian Beef
raw_text: 81. Mongolian Beef - 500 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (soy sauce), Origin: Mongolia
ingredients:
mongolian beef recipe:

ingredients:
- 1 pound (450 grams) beef sirloin, thinly sliced
- 1/4 cup cornstarch
- 3 tablespoons vegetable oil, divided
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon fresh ginger, grated
- 1/2 cup low-sodium soy sauce (gluten-containing)
- 1/2 cup water
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes (optional)
- 4 green onions, sliced diagonally
- cooked rice, to serve
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, coat the thinly sliced beef with cornstarch, shaking off any excess.
2. heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
3. add the beef slices to the skillet and cook until browned, stirring occasionally. this should take about 2-3 minutes. once browned, transfer the beef to a plate and set aside.
4. in the same skillet, add the remaining tablespoon of vegetable oil, garlic, and ginger. cook for about 1 minute until fragrant.
5. in a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, water, brown sugar, and red pepper flakes (if desired).
6. pour the sauce mixture into the skillet with the garlic and ginger. bring to a simmer and cook for about 2 minutes, allowing the sauce to thicken slightly.
7. return the cooked beef slices to the skillet and stir to coat them evenly with the sauce. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the beef is heated through.
8. stir in the sliced green onions and cook for another minute.
9. serve the mongolian beef over cooked rice and enjoy it warm.

note: this recipe yields approximately 4 portions, with each portion containing approximately 500 calories.
ingredients_list: mongolian, beef, gram, beef, sirloin, thinly, cornstarch, vegetable, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, ginger, sodium, soy, sauce, gluten, containing, water, brown, sugar, red, pepper, flake, green, onion, rice

title: Pad See Ew
raw_text: 82. Pad See Ew - 400 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (noodles), Origin: Thailand
ingredients:
: thailand

ingredients:
- 8 ounces wide rice noodles
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 8 ounces boneless chicken breast, sliced
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 2 cups broccoli florets
- 1 cup thinly sliced carrots
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce (gluten-free if needed)
- 2 tablespoons oyster sauce
- 1 tablespoon brown sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/4 cup chicken broth
- 2 green onions, chopped
- lime wedges, for serving
preparation:
1. cook the rice noodles according to package instructions. drain and set aside.
2. in a large wok or skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
3. add the minced garlic and cook for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
4. add the sliced chicken breast to the skillet and cook until browned and cooked through, about 5-6 minutes.
5. push the chicken to one side of the skillet and add the beaten eggs to the other side. scramble the eggs until cooked.
6. add the broccoli florets and sliced carrots to the skillet. cook for about 3-4 minutes until the vegetables are slightly tender.
7. in a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, oyster sauce, brown sugar, black pepper, and chicken broth. pour the sauce mixture into the skillet and stir well to coat everything.
8. add the cooked rice noodles to the skillet and toss everything together until well combined and heated through.
9. stir in the chopped green onions.
10. divide the pad see ew into 4 portions and serve hot with lime wedges on the side.

enjoy your homemade pad see ew!
ingredients_list: thailand, ounce, wide, rice, noodle, vegetable, clove, garlic, minced, ounce, boneless, chicken, breast, egg, broccoli, floret, thinly, carrot, soy, sauce, gluten, needed, oyster, sauce, brown, sugar, black, pepper, chicken, broth, green, onion, lime, wedge

title: Pesto Pasta with Grilled Chicken
raw_text: 84. Pesto Pasta with Grilled Chicken - 500 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (pasta), Origin: Italy
ingredients:
italy

ingredients:
- 8 oz pasta (gluten-containing, such as spaghetti or fusilli)
- 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 2 cups fresh basil leaves
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 1/4 cup pine nuts
- 2 garlic cloves
- 1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil
preparation:
1. bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. cook the pasta according to the package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.
2. heat a grill pan or outdoor grill over medium-high heat. season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper. grill for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until cooked through. remove from heat and let rest for a few minutes. slice the chicken into thin strips.
3. in a food processor, combine the basil leaves, parmesan cheese, pine nuts, garlic cloves, and a pinch of salt and pepper. pulse until the ingredients are coarsely chopped.
4. with the food processor running, slowly pour in the olive oil until the pesto sauce is well-combined and smooth.
5. in a large mixing bowl, toss the cooked pasta with the pesto sauce until evenly coated.
6. divide the pesto pasta among four plates. top each portion with grilled chicken slices. serve hot and enjoy!
ingredients_list: italy, pasta, gluten, containing, spaghetti, fusilli, boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, basil, leaf, parmesan, cheese, pine, nut, garlic, clove, virgin, olive

title: Honey Sesame Chicken
raw_text: 86. Honey Sesame Chicken - 400 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (soy sauce), Origin: Unknown
ingredients:
china- 

ingredients:
- 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 1/4 cup low sodium soy sauce (gluten-free if needed)
- 1/4 cup honey
- 2 tablespoons sesame oil
- 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon grated fresh ginger
- 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes (optional, for heat)
- 2 tablespoons sesame seeds
- 2 green onions, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. in a medium bowl, whisk together soy sauce, honey, sesame oil, rice vinegar, cornstarch, minced garlic, grated ginger, and red pepper flakes (if using). set aside.
2. cut the chicken breasts into bite-sized pieces and place them in a large zip-top bag. pour the sauce mixture over the chicken, seal the bag, and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes (or up to 24 hours for maximum flavor).
3. heat a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. add the marinated chicken and cook until golden brown and cooked through, about 6-8 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. sprinkle sesame seeds over the chicken and continue to cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, until the seeds are toasted.
5. remove from heat and garnish with chopped green onions.
6. serve over steamed rice or with your favorite side dishes.

enjoy your delicious honey sesame chicken!

title: Greek Gyros
raw_text: 87. Greek Gyros - 550 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (pita bread), Origin: Greece
ingredients:
greek gyros:

ingredients:
- 1 lb (450g) boneless, skinless chicken breast or lamb, thinly sliced
- 4 pita breads
- 1 cup greek yogurt
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 large tomato, sliced
- 1 small red onion, thinly sliced
- 1 cup shredded lettuce
- tzatziki sauce (optional, for serving)
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine the greek yogurt, minced garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper. stir well to combine and set aside.

2. heat a large skillet or grill pan over medium-high heat. add the thinly sliced chicken or lamb and cook until fully cooked and slightly browned, about 5-7 minutes. remove from heat and set aside.

3. warm the pita breads in a toaster, oven, or on a skillet until soft and pliable.

4. to assemble the gyros, spread a generous amount of the yogurt sauce on one side of each pita bread. top with a few slices of cooked chicken or lamb, tomato slices, red onion slices, and shredded lettuce.

5. optional: drizzle some tzatziki sauce over the toppings for extra flavor.

6. roll up the pita bread tightly, enclosing the fillings. cut each gyro in half diagonally.

7. serve the greek gyros immediately and enjoy!

note: the origin of greek gyros is greece.
ingredients_list: greek, gyro, boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, lamb, thinly, pita, bread, greek, yogurt, garlic, clove, minced, lemon, olive, dried, oregano, salt, black, pepper, tomato, red, onion, thinly, shredded, lettuce, tzatziki, sauce

title: Coconut Shrimp Curry
raw_text: 90. Coconut Shrimp Curry - 350 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains shellfish, Origin: Unknown
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 lb (450g) shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 1 tbsp coconut oil
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 tbsp grated fresh ginger
- 1 tbsp curry powder
- 1 can (14 oz) coconut milk
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 cup snap peas
- 1 tbsp fish sauce
- 1 tbsp lime juice
- fresh cilantro, for garnish
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. in a large skillet, heat the coconut oil over medium heat. add the chopped onion and cook until softened and translucent, about 5 minutes.
2. stir in the minced garlic, grated ginger, and curry powder. cook for an additional 2 minutes, stirring constantly to prevent burning.
3. add the coconut milk and vegetable broth to the skillet, stirring well to combine with the onion mixture. bring to a simmer.
4. add the red bell pepper and snap peas to the skillet. cook for 4-5 minutes, until the vegetables are crisp-tender.
5. stir in the shrimp, fish sauce, and lime juice. cook for another 3-4 minutes, until the shrimp are pink and cooked through.
6. season with salt and pepper to taste. remove from heat and garnish with fresh cilantro.
7. serve the coconut shrimp curry over steamed rice or cauliflower rice for a low-carb option.
8. enjoy the delicious and flavorful coconut shrimp curry!

title: Chicken Pad Thai

chicken pad thai

title: Beef Bulgogi
raw_text: 95. Beef Bulgogi - 500 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten (soy sauce), Origin: South Korea

: korean

title: Chicken and Broccoli Alfredo
raw_text: 97. Chicken and Broccoli Alfredo - 600 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy, Origin: Unknown
ingredients:
: italy

ingredients:
- 2 chicken breasts, sliced into thin strips
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 4 cups broccoli florets
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 cup heavy cream
- 1 cup grated parmesan cheese
- salt and pepper to taste
- 8 ounces fettuccine pasta
preparation:
1. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the chicken breast strips and cook until they are no longer pink in the center, about 5-7 minutes. remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
2. in the same skillet, add the broccoli florets and minced garlic. sauté for 3-4 minutes until the broccoli is tender-crisp.
3. meanwhile, cook the fettuccine pasta according to package instructions. drain and set aside.
4. return the chicken to the skillet with the broccoli. pour in the heavy cream and bring to a simmer. cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. stir in the grated parmesan cheese until it melts into the sauce. season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. add the cooked fettuccine pasta to the skillet and toss to coat it evenly with the sauce.
7. divide the chicken and broccoli alfredo into 4 portions. serve hot and enjoy your delicious italian dish!

title: Greek Moussaka Stuffed Peppers
raw_text:
100. Greek Moussaka Stuffed Peppers - 350 calories per portion, 4 portions, contains dairy (cheese), Origin: Greece

(Continued in the next message)
ingredients:
: greece

ingredients:
- 4 large bell peppers
- 1 pound ground beef
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1 can (14-ounce) diced tomatoes
- 1/4 cup tomato paste
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 cup cooked rice
- 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- fresh parsley, for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cut off the tops of the peppers and remove the seeds and membranes.
3. heat a large skillet over medium heat and cook the ground beef until browned. remove any excess fat.
4. add the diced onions and minced garlic to the skillet and cook until the onions are translucent.
5. stir in the dried oregano, dried basil, and ground cinnamon.
6. add the diced tomatoes and tomato paste to the skillet, and season with salt and pepper. stir well to combine.
7. simmer the mixture for about 10 minutes until the flavors meld together.
8. in a separate bowl, mix together the cooked rice, feta cheese, and grated parmesan cheese.
9. stuff each bell pepper with the rice and cheese mixture, then place them in a baking dish.
10. pour the tomato and ground beef sauce over the stuffed peppers.
11. cover the baking dish with foil and bake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until the peppers are tender.
12. remove the foil and continue to bake for an additional 5 minutes, or until the tops of the stuffed peppers are slightly browned.
13. remove from the oven and let the stuffed peppers cool for a few minutes before serving.
14. garnish with fresh parsley and serve hot.

enjoy your greek moussaka stuffed peppers!

title: Chicken curry with basmati rice
raw_text: 4. Chicken curry with basmati rice - 420 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains lactose, dairy, gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil
- 2 tablespoons of curry powder

- 1 cup of chicken broth

preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat.
2. add the chopped onion and minced garlic, and sauté until they become soft and fragrant.
3. add the chicken pieces to the skillet and cook until they are browned on all sides.
4. sprinkle curry powder over the chicken and stir to coat.
5. pour in the coconut milk, chicken broth, soy sauce, and brown sugar. stir well to combine.
6. add the sliced red bell pepper, carrot, and frozen peas to the skillet. season with salt and pepper.

title: Teriyaki salmon with steamed broccoli
raw_text: 5. Teriyaki salmon with steamed broccoli - 380 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains soy, gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 salmon fillets
- 4 tablespoons teriyaki sauce
- 2 cups broccoli florets
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 2 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon honey
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1/2 teaspoon ginger, grated
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. place the salmon fillets in a baking dish and pour 2 tablespoons of teriyaki sauce over each fillet. spread evenly to coat.
3. in a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, honey, garlic, and ginger. set aside.
4. place the broccoli florets in a steamer basket over boiling water and steam for about 5-6 minutes, or until tender. remove from heat and set aside.
5. heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. season the salmon fillets with salt and pepper, then place them skin-side down in the skillet. cook for 3-4 minutes until the skin is crispy and the salmon is browned.
6. flip the salmon fillets and brush them with the soy sauce-honey mixture. cook for an additional 3-4 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked to your desired level of doneness.
7. serve the teriyaki salmon with steamed broccoli on the side. drizzle the remaining teriyaki sauce from the baking dish over the salmon and broccoli.
8. enjoy your delicious teriyaki salmon with steamed broccoli!
ingredients_list: salmon, fillet, teriyaki, sauce, broccoli, floret, olive, sodium, soy, sauce, honey, clove, garlic, minced, ginger, salt, pepper, taste

title: Shrimp scampi with angel hair pasta
raw_text: 7. Shrimp scampi with angel hair pasta - 480 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains shellfish, gluten, lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound (450g) shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 8 ounces (225g) angel hair pasta
- 4 tablespoons (60g) unsalted butter
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/4 cup (60ml) white wine
- 1/4 cup (60ml) chicken or vegetable broth
- juice of 1 lemon
- 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes (optional)
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 2 tablespoons (30g) fresh parsley, chopped
- grated parmesan cheese, for serving (optional)
preparation:
1. bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. cook the angel hair pasta according to the package instructions. drain and set aside.
2. in a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. add the minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute, until fragrant.
3. add the shrimp to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes until they start turning pink. flip the shrimp and cook for another 2 minutes until fully cooked through. remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
4. pour the white wine into the skillet and let it simmer for about 2 minutes to cook off the alcohol. add the chicken or vegetable broth, lemon juice, and red pepper flakes (if using). simmer for another 2-3 minutes.
5. return the shrimp to the skillet and toss to coat them in the sauce. cook for an additional minute. season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. divide the cooked angel hair pasta among 4 plates. top with the shrimp and sauce. sprinkle with chopped parsley and grated parmesan cheese (if desired).
7. serve immediately and enjoy your delicious shrimp scampi with angel hair pasta!
ingredients_list: shrimp, deveined, ounce, angel, hair, pasta, unsalted, butter, clove, garlic, minced, white, wine, chicken, vegetable, broth, lemon, red, pepper, flake, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, parsley, parmesan, cheese

title: Ham and cheese stuffed chicken breast with roasted potatoes
raw_text: 8. Ham and cheese stuffed chicken breast with roasted potatoes - 450 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 4 slices of ham
- 4 slices of cheese (cheddar, swiss, or your choice)
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 tablespoon olive oil

for the roasted potatoes:
- 4 medium-sized potatoes, washed and cut into small cubes
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 teaspoon dried rosemary (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).

2. pat dry the chicken breasts and make a pocket in each one by cutting a horizontal slit along the side. be careful not to cut through entirely.

3. stuff each chicken breast with a slice of ham and a slice of cheese. season the outside of the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.

4. heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. place the stuffed chicken breasts in the skillet and cook for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until they are lightly browned.

5. transfer the browned chicken breasts to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until fully cooked and the cheese is melted and bubbly.

6. meanwhile, prepare the roasted potatoes. in a bowl, toss the potato cubes with olive oil, salt, pepper, and dried rosemary (if using), until they are well coated.

7. arrange the seasoned potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. roast in the preheated oven for approximately 25-30 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy, flipping them halfway through.

8. remove the chicken and potatoes from the oven. let the chicken rest for a few minutes before serving.

9. serve the ham and cheese stuffed chicken breasts with the roasted potatoes. enjoy!

note: if lactose intolerance is a concern, choose lactose-free cheese options or use dairy-free cheese alternatives. ensure that all ingredients used are lactose-free.
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, ham, cheese, cheddar, swiss, salt, pepper, taste, olive, roasted, potato, potato, washed, cube, olive, salt, pepper, taste, dried, rosemary

title: Moroccan lamb tagine with couscous
raw_text: 10. Moroccan lamb tagine with couscous - 600 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten, lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 500g lamb shoulder, cut into chunks
- 2 tablespoons oil
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 teaspoons ground cumin
- 2 teaspoons ground coriander
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1 teaspoon ground ginger
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric
- 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional, for extra spice)
- 400g can diced tomatoes
- 2 tablespoons tomato paste
- 2 carrots, peeled and sliced
- 1 zucchini, sliced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 200g dried couscous
- 300ml vegetable or chicken broth
- salt, to taste
- fresh cilantro or parsley, chopped (for garnish)
preparation:
1. heat oil in a large pot or tagine over medium heat.
2. add the lamb shoulder and cook until browned on all sides. remove from the pot and set aside.
3. in the same pot, add the diced onion and minced garlic. sauté until softened and fragrant.
4. add the ground cumin, coriander, cinnamon, ginger, paprika, turmeric, and cayenne pepper (if using). stir well to coat the onions and garlic with the spices.
5. return the lamb shoulder to the pot and add the diced tomatoes, tomato paste, carrots, zucchini, and red bell pepper. stir everything together.
6. pour enough water (or additional broth) to cover the ingredients. season with salt to taste.
7. bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. cover the pot and let it simmer for 2-3 hours, or until the lamb is tender and flavorful.
