8. while the tagine is simmering, prepare the couscous according to the package instructions. typically, you would pour the dried couscous into a bowl and add hot chicken or vegetable broth. cover and let it sit for 5 minutes until the couscous absorbs the liquid. fluff the couscous with a fork.
9. serve the lamb tagine over a bed of couscous. garnish with freshly chopped cilantro or parsley. enjoy your moroccan lamb tagine with couscous!
ingredients_list: lamb, shoulder, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ground, cumin, ground, coriander, ground, cinnamon, ground, ginger, paprika, turmeric, cayenne, pepper, spice, tomato, tomato, paste, carrot, zucchini, red, bell, pepper, dried, couscous, vegetable, chicken, broth, salt, taste, fresh, cilantro, parsley, garnish

title: Beef and vegetable kebabs with quinoa
raw_text: 11. Beef and vegetable kebabs with quinoa - 480 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains soy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound beef (cut into cubes)
- 1 red bell pepper (cut into chunks)
- 1 yellow bell pepper (cut into chunks)
- 1 zucchini (sliced)
- 1 red onion (cut into wedges)
- 1 cup quinoa
- 2 cups water
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- skewers
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine the beef cubes with soy sauce, olive oil, salt, and pepper. allow it to marinate for about 30 minutes.
2. meanwhile, rinse the quinoa under cold water and drain.
3. in a pot, bring 2 cups of water to boil. add the quinoa and reduce the heat to low. cover and cook for 15-20 minutes until the water is absorbed and quinoa is fluffy.
4. preheat the grill or grill pan over medium heat.
5. thread the marinated beef cubes, bell peppers, zucchini, and red onion onto skewers.
6. grill the kebabs for about 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally, until the beef is cooked through and the vegetables are tender. 
7. serve the kebabs with cooked quinoa. enjoy!
ingredients_list: beef, cube, red, bell, pepper, yellow, bell, pepper, zucchini, red, onion, wedge, quinoa, water, soy, sauce, olive, salt, pepper, taste, skewer

title: Chicken and vegetable fried rice
raw_text: 12. Chicken and vegetable fried rice - 420 kcals per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten, soy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups cooked white rice
- 1 chicken breast, diced
- 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, corn)
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce (gluten-free if needed)
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
2. add the diced chicken and cook until it is no longer pink in the center. remove it from the skillet and set aside.
3. in the same skillet, add the remaining tablespoon of vegetable oil and sauté the garlic and onion until they become fragrant and lightly browned.
4. add the mixed vegetables to the skillet and cook for a few minutes until they are tender.
5. push the vegetables to one side of the skillet and add the cooked rice to the other side. stir fry the rice for a few minutes until it is heated through.
6. return the cooked chicken to the skillet and mix well with the rice and vegetables.
7. drizzle the soy sauce over the mixture and stir to combine. season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, allowing the flavors to blend. remove from heat.
9. divide the fried rice into 3 portions and serve hot.

enjoy your delicious chicken and vegetable fried rice!
ingredients_list: white, rice, chicken, breast, vegetable, carrot, pea, corn, vegetable, clove, garlic, minced, onion, soy, sauce, gluten, needed, salt, pepper, taste

title: Lentil soup with crusty bread
raw_text: 13. Lentil soup with crusty bread - 300 kcals per portion, 6 portions, vegetarian, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 carrots, diced
- 1 celery stalk, diced
- 1 cup dried lentils, rinsed
- 4 cups vegetable broth
- 1 bay leaf
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 tablespoon tomato paste
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
- crusty bread (gluten-containing) for serving
preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. add the diced onion and sauté until translucent, about 5 minutes.
2. add the minced garlic, diced carrots, and diced celery to the pot. cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3. add the rinsed lentils, vegetable broth, bay leaf, dried thyme, salt, and pepper to the pot. stir well to combine.
4. bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 30 minutes, or until the lentils are tender.
5. remove the bay leaf from the pot and stir in the tomato paste. cook for an additional 5 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. taste and adjust the seasoning as desired. stir in the chopped fresh parsley.
7. serve the lentil soup hot with crusty bread on the side. enjoy!
ingredients_list: olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, carrot, celery, stalk, dried, lentil, vegetable, broth, leaf, dried, thyme, salt, pepper, taste, tomato, paste, fresh, parsley, crusty, bread, gluten, containing

title: Grilled shrimp and vegetable skewers with wild rice
raw_text: 14. Grilled shrimp and vegetable skewers with wild rice - 350 kcals per portion, 3 portions, contains shellfish
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound of shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 1 zucchini, cut into thick slices
- 1 red bell pepper, cut into chunks
- 1 yellow bell pepper, cut into chunks
- 1 red onion, cut into chunks
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- 2 tablespoons of lemon juice
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- salt and black pepper, to taste
- 1 cup of wild rice
- 2 cups of water
preparation:
1. start by preheating the grill to medium-high heat.
2. in a bowl, combine the olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, salt, and black pepper.
3. add the shrimp to the bowl, toss to coat, and let them marinate for about 10 minutes.
4. thread the shrimp, zucchini slices, bell pepper chunks, and onion chunks onto skewers.
5. place the skewers on the preheated grill and cook for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until the shrimp is pink and slightly charred, and the vegetables are tender.
6. while the skewers are grilling, prepare the wild rice. in a saucepan, combine the wild rice and water. bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for about 25-30 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the water is absorbed.
7. once the skewers and wild rice are cooked, remove them from the heat.
8. serve the grilled shrimp and vegetable skewers over a bed of wild rice and enjoy!
cuisine: Grilled shrimp and vegetable skewers with wild rice is a recipe classified as "Grilled."
ingredients_list: shrimp, deveined, zucchini, red, bell, pepper, yellow, bell, pepper, red, onion, olive, lemon, clove, garlic, minced, salt, black, pepper, taste, wild, rice, water

title: Chicken pesto pasta with sun
raw_text: 15. Chicken pesto pasta with sun-dried tomatoes - 480 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten, lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 ounces of chicken breast, cut into bite-sized chunks
- 8 ounces of gluten-free pasta (such as brown rice or quinoa pasta)
- 1/4 cup of pesto sauce (store-bought or homemade)
- 1/4 cup of sun-dried tomatoes, chopped
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
- salt and pepper, to taste
- grated parmesan cheese (optional, for serving)
preparation:
1. cook the pasta according to the package instructions. drain and set aside.
2. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
3. season the chicken breast chunks with salt and pepper, then add them to the skillet. cook until fully cooked and slightly browned, around 6-8 minutes.
4. add the cooked pasta and sun-dried tomatoes to the skillet with the chicken.
5. pour the pesto sauce over the pasta and chicken mixture. stir well to combine, ensuring all ingredients are coated with the sauce.
6. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, until everything is heated through.
7. remove from heat and divide the pasta mixture into 4 portions.
8. serve hot, sprinkled with grated parmesan cheese if desired.
9. enjoy your chicken pesto pasta with sun-dried tomatoes!
ingredients_list: ounce, chicken, breast, ounce, gluten, pasta, brown, rice, quinoa, pasta, pesto, sauce, sun, dried, tomato, olive, salt, pepper, taste, parmesan, cheese

title: Grilled steak with mashed sweet potatoes
raw_text: 16. Grilled steak with mashed sweet potatoes - 600 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains lactose
ingredients:
grilled steak with mashed sweet potatoes - 600 kcals per portion; 2 portions; contains lactose

ingredients:
- 2 steaks (preferably ribeye or sirloin), about 8 ounces each
- 2 medium-sized sweet potatoes
- 1/4 cup milk (or lactose-free milk alternative)
- 2 tablespoons butter (or lactose-free butter alternative)
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your grill to medium-high heat.
2. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
3. wash the sweet potatoes and pierce each potato several times with a fork.
4. place the sweet potatoes on a baking sheet and bake them in the preheated oven for about 45-60 minutes, or until they are soft and easily mashed.
5. while the sweet potatoes are baking, season the steaks with salt and pepper on both sides.
6. grill the steaks on the preheated grill for about 4-5 minutes per side for medium-rare, or adjust the cooking time according to your preference.
7. once the sweet potatoes are cooked, remove them from the oven and let them cool slightly.
8. cut the sweet potatoes in half lengthwise and scoop out the flesh into a mixing bowl.
9. add the milk (or lactose-free milk alternative) and butter (or lactose-free butter alternative) to the bowl with the sweet potato flesh.
10. mash the sweet potatoes using a potato masher or a fork until smooth and creamy. season with salt and pepper to taste.
11. let the steaks rest for a few minutes before slicing them against the grain into thin slices.
12. serve the grilled steak with a generous portion of mashed sweet potatoes on the side.

enjoy your delicious grilled steak with mashed sweet potatoes!
ingredients_list: steak, sweet, potato, portion, lactose, steak, preferably, ribeye, sirloin, ounce, sweet, potato, milk, lactose, milk, butter, lactose, butter, salt, pepper, taste

title: Baked salmon with quinoa and roasted asparagus
raw_text: 18. Baked salmon with quinoa and roasted asparagus - 450 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 salmon fillets
- 1 cup quinoa
- 1 1/2 cups water
- 1 bunch asparagus
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. in a saucepan, bring water to a boil and add quinoa. reduce heat, cover, and simmer for about 15 minutes or until all water is absorbed. remove from heat, fluff with a fork, and set aside.
3. rinse the asparagus and trim the tough ends. place the asparagus on a baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil. season with salt and pepper to taste. toss gently to coat.
4. place the baking sheet with asparagus in the oven and roast for about 10-12 minutes or until tender and slightly crispy. remove from the oven and set aside.
5. season both sides of the salmon fillets with salt and pepper. place the fillets on a separate baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
6. bake the salmon in the preheated oven for about 12-15 minutes or until cooked through and flaky. cooking time may vary depending on the thickness of the fillets.
7. once the salmon is cooked, remove from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.
8. divide the cooked quinoa and roasted asparagus between two plates.
9. place a salmon fillet on top of each plate and serve hot.

enjoy your baked salmon with quinoa and roasted asparagus!
ingredients_list: salmon, fillet, quinoa, water, bunch, asparagus, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Vegetarian lasagna with garden salad
raw_text: 19. Vegetarian lasagna with garden salad - 300 kcals per portion, 6 portions, vegetarian, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 9 lasagna noodles
- 2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1 cup ricotta cheese
- 1 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 2 cups marinara sauce
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 zucchini, sliced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 cup sliced mushrooms
- 2 cups spinach leaves
- 3 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste

for the garden salad:
- 6 cups mixed salad greens
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1 cucumber, sliced
- 1/4 red onion, thinly sliced
- 1/4 cup balsamic vinaigrette dressing
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. cook the lasagna noodles according to the package instructions. drain and set aside.
3. in a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. add the diced onion and minced garlic, and sauté until onions are translucent.
4. add the sliced zucchini, bell pepper, and mushrooms to the skillet. cook for about 5 minutes, or until the vegetables are softened.
5. stir in the spinach leaves and cook for an additional 2 minutes until wilted. season with salt and pepper.
6. in a separate bowl, combine the ricotta and parmesan cheese.
7. to assemble the lasagna, spread a thin layer of marinara sauce on the bottom of a baking dish. place three lasagna noodles on top.
8. spread half of the ricotta cheese mixture over the noodles, followed by half of the vegetable mixture. sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. repeat the layers.
9. top the lasagna with the remaining sauce and mozzarella cheese.
10. bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
11. while the lasagna is baking, prepare the garden salad by combining the mixed salad greens, cherry tomatoes, sliced cucumber, and red onion in a large salad bowl.
12. drizzle the balsamic vinaigrette dressing over the salad and toss to coat evenly.
13. once the lasagna is cooked, allow it to cool for a few minutes before serving. serve each portion of vegetarian lasagna with a side of garden salad.

enjoy your delicious vegetarian lasagna with garden salad! each portion should be around 300 calories.
ingredients_list: lasagna, noodle, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, ricotta, cheese, parmesan, cheese, marinara, sauce, onion, clove, garlic, minced, zucchini, bell, pepper, mushroom, spinach, leaf, olive, salt, pepper, taste, salad, salad, green, cherry, tomato, halved, cucumber, red, onion, thinly, balsamic, vinaigrette

title: Lemon herb roasted chicken with steamed green beans
raw_text: 20. Lemon herb roasted chicken with steamed green beans - 400 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 chicken breasts
- 2 lemons
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon dried herbs (such as thyme, rosemary, or oregano)
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 lb fresh green beans
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. rinse the chicken breasts under cold water and pat them dry with paper towels.
3. in a small bowl, squeeze the juice of one lemon and add the olive oil, minced garlic, dried herbs, salt, and pepper. mix well.
4. place the chicken breasts in a baking dish and pour the lemon and herb mixture over them. make sure all sides of the chicken are well coated.
5. cut the other lemon into thin slices and place the slices on top of the chicken breasts.
6. roast the chicken in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes or until the chicken reaches an internal temperature of 165°f (74°c).
7. while the chicken is roasting, steam the green beans until they are tender yet still crisp. this usually takes about 5-7 minutes.
8. once the chicken is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.
9. serve the lemon herb roasted chicken with steamed green beans on the side.
enjoy your delicious, 400-calorie per portion meal!
ingredients_list: chicken, breast, lemon, olive, clove, garlic, minced, dried, herb, thyme, rosemary, oregano, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, green, bean

title: Beef tacos with avocado salsa and black beans
raw_text: 21. Beef tacos with avocado salsa and black beans - 500 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:

- 500g beef (such as flank steak or sirloin), thinly sliced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 tablespoon chili powder
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 can black beans, rinsed and drained
- 8 small tortillas (gluten-free if needed)
- avocado salsa:
  - 2 avocados, diced
  - 1 tomato, diced
  - 1/4 cup red onion, finely chopped
  - 1 jalapeno, seeded and minced
  - juice of 1 lime
  - salt to taste
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine the chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper. rub this mixture evenly onto the beef slices.
2. heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. add the onion and minced garlic and sauté until softened and fragrant.
3. add the beef slices to the skillet and cook for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until cooked to your desired level of doneness. remove from heat and set aside.
4. in a separate saucepan, heat the black beans over medium heat until warmed through.
5. to make the avocado salsa, combine the diced avocado, tomato, red onion, jalapeno, lime juice, and salt in a bowl. mix well to combine.
6. warm the tortillas in a dry skillet or in the microwave.
7. assemble the tacos by layering a spoonful of black beans, some slices of beef, and a spoonful of avocado salsa onto each tortilla.
8. serve hot and enjoy!

note: make sure to check the labels of the tortillas and other ingredients to ensure they are gluten-free, if needed. adjust portion sizes accordingly to meet your desired calorie intake.
ingredients_list: beef, flank, steak, sirloin, thinly, olive, chili, powder, ground, cumin, garlic, powder, salt, black, pepper, onion, clove, garlic, minced, black, bean, tortilla, gluten, needed, avocado, salsa, avocado, tomato, red, onion, jalapeno, seeded, minced, lime, salt, taste

title: Spinach and mushroom stuffed chicken breast with roasted sweet potatoes
raw_text: 22. Spinach and mushroom stuffed chicken breast with roasted sweet potatoes - 450 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 cups fresh spinach, chopped
- 1 cup mushrooms, sliced
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 tablespoon butter (use lactose-free butter if lactose-intolerant)
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese (optional, omit if avoiding lactose)
- 4 small sweet potatoes
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).

2. begin by preparing the chicken breasts. lay each chicken breast flat on a cutting board and carefully slice through the center, horizontally, without cutting through the entire breast. this will create a pocket for the filling. season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper on both sides.

3. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the sliced mushrooms and cook until they start to brown, about 5 minutes. add the minced garlic and chopped spinach, and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the spinach wilts. remove from heat.

4. stuff each chicken breast pocket with a portion of the spinach and mushroom mixture. if using, sprinkle each chicken breast with grated parmesan cheese. secure the opening with toothpicks.

5. heat the butter in the same skillet over medium-high heat. once melted, add the stuffed chicken breasts and cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side until they develop a golden brown crust.

6. transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken reaches an internal temperature of 165°f (74°c).

7. while the chicken is baking, prepare the roasted sweet potatoes. wash and peel the sweet potatoes, then cut them into small cubes. place the cubed sweet potatoes on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.

8. place the sweet potatoes in the oven alongside the chicken and roast for 20-25 minutes, or until they are soft and nicely browned.

9. once the chicken and sweet potatoes are cooked, remove from the oven. allow the chicken to rest for a few minutes before removing the toothpicks. serve the stuffed chicken breasts with the roasted sweet potatoes on the side. enjoy!
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, spinach, mushroom, clove, garlic, minced, olive, butter, lactose, butter, lactose, parmesan, cheese, omit, lactose, sweet, potato, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Thai green curry with tofu and jasmine rice
raw_text: 24. Thai green curry with tofu and jasmine rice - 420 kcals per portion, 4 portions, vegetarian, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 onion, thinly sliced
- 3 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 tablespoon green curry paste (make sure it contains no shrimp paste if vegetarian)
- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 green bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 can (14 oz) coconut milk
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce (make sure it's gluten-free if needed)
- 1 tablespoon brown sugar
- 1 block (14 oz) firm tofu, cubed
- 1 cup baby corn, cut into halves
- 1 cup snow peas
- fresh basil leaves, for garnish
- lime wedges, for serving
- cooked jasmine rice, for serving
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
2. add the sliced onion and minced garlic to the skillet and sauté until the onion becomes translucent.
3. stir in the green curry paste and cook for about 1 minute, until fragrant.
4. add the sliced red and green bell peppers to the skillet and cook for another 2 minutes, until slightly softened.
5. pour in the coconut milk, vegetable broth, soy sauce, and brown sugar. stir to combine.
6. bring the mixture to a simmer and add the cubed tofu. cook for about 10 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.
7. add the baby corn and snow peas to the skillet and cook for an additional 5 minutes, until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
8. remove the skillet from heat and garnish with fresh basil leaves.
9. serve the thai green curry over cooked jasmine rice and accompany with lime wedges for squeezing over the curry.
10. enjoy your delicious vegetarian thai green curry with tofu and jasmine rice!
ingredients_list: vegetable, onion, thinly, garlic, clove, minced, green, curry, paste, shrimp, paste, vegetarian, red, bell, pepper, thinly, green, bell, pepper, thinly, coconut, milk, vegetable, broth, soy, sauce, gluten, needed, brown, sugar, tofu, baby, corn, half, pea, fresh, basil, leaf, garnish, lime, wedge, jasmine, rice

title: Chicken and vegetable paella
raw_text: 26. Chicken and vegetable paella - 550 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains shellfish, lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cups chicken breast, diced
- 1 cup prawns, peeled and deveined
- 1 cup mussels, cleaned and debearded
- 2 cups white rice
- 1 onion, diced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 green bell pepper, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 tomatoes, diced
- 1 cup frozen peas
- 4 cups chicken broth
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1 teaspoon turmeric
- salt and pepper to taste
- olive oil for cooking
preparation:
1. heat a large paella pan or a wide, shallow skillet over medium heat. add olive oil and cook the chicken breast until browned. remove from the pan and set aside.
2. in the same pan, add the prawns and cook until they turn pink. remove and set aside.
3. add the mussels to the pan and cook until they open. discard any unopened mussels and set aside.
4. in the same pan, add more olive oil if needed, then add the onion, bell peppers, and garlic. sauté until the vegetables are softened.
5. add the diced tomatoes and cook for a few minutes until they start to break down.
6. stir in the rice, paprika, turmeric, salt, and pepper. cook for a couple of minutes, stirring constantly.
7. pour in the chicken broth and bring to a simmer. reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and let it cook for about 20 minutes or until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed.
8. stir in the frozen peas, cooked chicken, prawns, and mussels. cook for a few more minutes until everything is heated through.
9. remove from heat and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.
10. enjoy the delicious chicken and vegetable paella, making sure to remove any shellfish for those with shellfish allergies or preferences.
ingredients_list: chicken, breast, prawn, deveined, mussel, debearded, white, rice, onion, red, bell, pepper, green, bell, pepper, clove, garlic, minced, tomato, frozen, pea, chicken, broth, paprika, turmeric, salt, pepper, taste, olive

title: Baked ziti with Italian sausage
raw_text: 27. Baked ziti with Italian sausage - 450 kcals per portion, 5 portions, contains gluten, lactose
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 1 pound italian sausage
- 12 ounces ziti pasta
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 can (14.5 ounces) diced tomatoes
- 1 can (8 ounces) tomato sauce
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- fresh basil leaves, for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (175°c).
2. in a large skillet, cook the italian sausage over medium heat until browned. remove from skillet and set aside.
3. cook the ziti pasta according to the package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.
4. in the same skillet, sauté the chopped onion and minced garlic until fragrant and translucent.
5. add the diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, dried basil, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper to the skillet. cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. return the cooked italian sausage to the skillet and stir well to combine with the sauce. let it simmer for another 5 minutes.
7. in a large baking dish, combine the cooked ziti pasta with the sausage and sauce mixture. stir well to evenly distribute everything.
8. sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese and grated parmesan cheese over the top of the pasta.
9. cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.
10. remove the foil and bake for an additional 10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
11. allow the baked ziti to cool slightly before serving. garnish with fresh basil leaves, if desired.
12. serve hot and enjoy your delicious baked ziti with italian sausage!
ingredients_list: italian, sausage, ounce, ziti, pasta, onion, clove, garlic, minced, ounce, tomato, ounce, tomato, sauce, dried, basil, dried, oregano, salt, black, pepper, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, parmesan, cheese, fresh, basil, leaf, garnish

title: Grilled shrimp and pineapple skewers with quinoa
raw_text: 30. Grilled shrimp and pineapple skewers with quinoa - 380 kcals per portion, 3 portions, contains shellfish
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound of large shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 1 cup of pineapple chunks
- 1 cup of cooked quinoa
- 2 tablespoons of olive oil
- 2 tablespoons of soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon of honey
- 1 tablespoon of lime juice
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- salt and pepper to taste
- wooden skewers, soaked in water
preparation:
1. in a large bowl, whisk together the olive oil, soy sauce, honey, lime juice, minced garlic, salt, and pepper.
2. add shrimp to the bowl and toss to coat the shrimp in the marinade. let it marinate in the fridge for at least 30 minutes.
3. preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
4. thread the marinated shrimp and pineapple chunks alternately onto the soaked wooden skewers.
5. grill the skewers for about 2-3 minutes per side, or until the shrimp is cooked through and pink.
6. while the skewers are grilling, heat the cooked quinoa according to the package instructions.
7. serve the grilled shrimp and pineapple skewers over a bed of cooked quinoa.
8. garnish with fresh herbs or a squeeze of lime juice, if desired.
9. enjoy your delicious grilled shrimp and pineapple skewers with quinoa!
cuisine: Grilled shrimp and pineapple skewers with quinoa - Cuisine type: Fusion
ingredients_list: shrimp, deveined, pineapple, quinoa, olive, soy, sauce, honey, lime, clove, garlic, minced, salt, pepper, taste, wooden, skewer, soaked, water

title: Lemon garlic roasted salmon with roasted vegetables
raw_text: 31. Lemon garlic roasted salmon with roasted vegetables - 500 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains lactose
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 2 salmon fillets
- 2 lemons
- 4 cloves of garlic
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes
- 1 red bell pepper
- 1 yellow bell pepper
- 1 zucchini
- 1 red onion
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
- 2 tablespoons grated parmesan cheese (optional, omit if lactose intolerant)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. slice one lemon into thin rounds and set aside.
3. crush the garlic cloves and combine them with the juice of the remaining lemon, salt, pepper, and olive oil in a small bowl.
4. place the salmon fillets skin side down on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, and brush them with the lemon garlic mixture.
5. lay the lemon slices on top of the salmon fillets.
6. in a separate bowl, combine the cherry tomatoes, sliced bell peppers, zucchini, and red onion. toss them with the remaining lemon garlic mixture.
7. arrange the vegetable mixture around the salmon fillets on the baking sheet.
8. season the vegetables with salt and pepper, to taste.
9. place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and roast for about 20-25 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
10. sprinkle the roasted vegetables with fresh parsley and parmesan cheese (optional).
11. serve the lemon garlic roasted salmon with the roasted vegetables. enjoy!
ingredients_list: salmon, fillet, lemon, clove, garlic, salt, pepper, taste, olive, cherry, tomato, red, bell, pepper, yellow, bell, pepper, zucchini, red, onion, fresh, parsley, parmesan, cheese, omit, lactose

title: Chicken quesadillas with guacamole
raw_text: 32. Chicken quesadillas with guacamole - 450 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 large flour tortillas (gluten-containing)
- 1 cup shredded cheese (such as cheddar or mexican blend)
- 1 avocado
- 1 small tomato, diced
- 1/4 cup diced red onion
- 1 tablespoon fresh lime juice
- 1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro
- salt to taste
preparation:
1. start by preparing the guacamole. in a medium bowl, mash the avocado until smooth. add diced tomato, red onion, lime juice, cilantro, and salt. mix well and set aside.
2. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
3. in a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. season the chicken breasts with chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper on both sides.
4. cook the seasoned chicken in the skillet for about 6-8 minutes per side until cooked through. remove from the skillet and let it rest for a few minutes. then, shred the chicken using two forks.
5. lay out 2 tortillas on a baking sheet. sprinkle half of the shredded cheese evenly on each tortilla. next, divide the shredded chicken equally between the two tortillas. top with the remaining cheese and cover with the other two tortillas.
6. place the baking sheet with the assembled quesadillas in the preheated oven and bake for about 5-8 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the tortillas are lightly toasted.
7. remove from the oven and let them cool for a minute or two. cut each quesadilla into quarters.
8. serve the chicken quesadilla quarters with a side of guacamole. enjoy!
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, olive, chili, powder, cumin, paprika, salt, pepper, taste, flour, tortilla, gluten, containing, shredded, cheese, cheddar, mexican, blend, avocado, tomato, red, onion, fresh, lime, fresh, cilantro, salt, taste

title: Seafood pasta with white wine garlic sauce
raw_text: 38. Seafood pasta with white wine garlic sauce - 550 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains shellfish, gluten, lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 350g linguine pasta (gluten)
- 350g mixed seafood (such as shrimp, mussels, and squid) (shellfish)
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 cup white wine
- 1 cup vegetable or fish stock
- 1/2 cup heavy cream (lactose)
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese (lactose)
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. cook the linguine pasta according to the package instructions. drain and set aside.
2. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the minced garlic and sauté until fragrant and lightly golden.
3. add the mixed seafood to the skillet and cook until they turn pink and opaque, stirring occasionally. this usually takes about 5-7 minutes.
4. pour in the white wine and let it simmer for about 2 minutes to reduce slightly.
5. add the vegetable or fish stock to the skillet and simmer for another 5 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
6. stir in the heavy cream and bring the sauce to a gentle simmer. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly.
7. add the cooked linguine pasta to the skillet and toss gently to coat the pasta with the sauce.
8. sprinkle with grated parmesan cheese and chopped parsley. stir well to combine.
9. season with salt and pepper according to taste.
10. serve the seafood pasta immediately, divided into 4 portions, and enjoy!
ingredients_list: linguine, pasta, gluten, seafood, shrimp, mussel, squid, shellfish, olive, clove, garlic, minced, white, wine, vegetable, fish, stock, cream, lactose, parmesan, cheese, lactose, fresh, parsley, salt, pepper, taste

title: Cheese and vegetable
raw_text: 39. Cheese and vegetable-stuffed bell peppers - 350 kcals per portion, 4 portions, vegetarian, contains lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 large bell peppers (any color)
- 1 cup cooked rice
- 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 1/2 cup diced tomatoes
- 1/2 cup diced zucchini
- 1/2 cup diced red onion
- 1/4 cup diced mushrooms
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 tbsp olive oil
- 1 tsp dried basil
- 1/2 tsp dried oregano
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes. rinse the peppers under cold water and set them aside.
3. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the garlic and cook until fragrant.
4. add the diced tomatoes, zucchini, red onion, and mushrooms to the skillet. cook for about 5 minutes until the vegetables soften.
5. stir in the cooked rice, dried basil, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. cook for another 2-3 minutes to combine the flavors.
6. remove the skillet from heat and stir in the shredded cheddar cheese until melted and well combined.
7. stuff each bell pepper with the vegetable and cheese mixture, packing it tightly.
8. place the stuffed peppers in a baking dish and cover with foil.
9. bake for 25-30 minutes or until the peppers are tender and the filling is heated through.
10. remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.
11. enjoy your delicious cheese and vegetable-stuffed bell peppers!
ingredients_list: bell, pepper, color, rice, shredded, cheddar, cheese, tomato, zucchini, red, onion, mushroom, clove, garlic, minced, olive, dried, basil, dried, oregano, salt, pepper, taste

title: Eggplant Parmesan with spaghetti
raw_text: 40. Eggplant Parmesan with spaghetti - 450 kcals per portion, 4 portions, vegetarian, contains gluten, lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 eggplants
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 3 eggs, beaten
- 2 cups breadcrumbs (gluten-containing)
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese (vegetarian-friendly)
- 1 teaspoon italian seasoning
- salt and pepper to taste
- 3 cups marinara sauce
- 2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese (vegetarian-friendly)
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil
- 8 ounces spaghetti (gluten-containing)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. slice the eggplants into 1/2-inch thick rounds.
3. set up a breading station with three shallow bowls: one with flour, one with beaten eggs, and one with breadcrumbs mixed with parmesan cheese, italian seasoning, salt, and pepper.
4. dredge each eggplant slice in flour, dip into the beaten eggs, then coat with the breadcrumb mixture. repeat for all slices.
5. heat some oil in a large skillet over medium heat. fry the breaded eggplant slices until golden brown on both sides. remove from the skillet and drain them on paper towels to remove excess oil.
6. in a baking dish, spread a thin layer of marinara sauce on the bottom. arrange half of the eggplant slices on top of the sauce.
7. pour another layer of marinara sauce over the eggplant, then sprinkle half of the mozzarella cheese and half of the fresh basil on top.
8. repeat the layers using the remaining eggplant, marinara sauce, mozzarella cheese, and basil.
9. bake in the preheated oven for about 25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. meanwhile, cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions. drain.
11. serve the eggplant parmesan over cooked spaghetti. enjoy a delicious vegetarian meal!

note: please make sure to double-check all ingredients for potential sources of gluten and lactose if you have specific dietary restrictions or allergies.
ingredients_list: eggplant, flour, egg, breadcrumb, gluten, containing, parmesan, cheese, vegetarian, italian, seasoning, salt, pepper, taste, marinara, sauce, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, vegetarian, fresh, basil, ounce, spaghetti, gluten, containing

title: Chicken and broccoli Alfredo
raw_text: 41. Chicken and broccoli Alfredo - 500 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten, lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 chicken breasts, boneless and skinless
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 head of broccoli, cut into small florets
- 250 grams gluten-free pasta
- 1 cup heavy cream
- 1 cup grated parmesan cheese
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. cook the gluten-free pasta according to the package instructions. drain and set aside.
2. in a large saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute until fragrant.
3. cut the chicken breasts into thin strips and add them to the pan. cook until they are no longer pink in the center, about 5-6 minutes.
4. remove the cooked chicken from the pan and set aside.
5. in the same pan, add the broccoli florets and sauté until they are tender-crisp, about 5 minutes.
6. return the chicken to the pan with the broccoli and add the cooked pasta. stir to combine.
7. pour in the heavy cream and grated parmesan cheese, stirring constantly until the cheese has melted and the sauce is creamy.
8. season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. divide the chicken and broccoli alfredo into 4 portions and serve immediately.

enjoy your gluten and lactose-containing chicken and broccoli alfredo, each portion containing 500 kcals!
ingredients_list: chicken, breast, boneless, skinless, olive, clove, garlic, minced, head, broccoli, floret, gram, gluten, pasta, cream, parmesan, cheese, salt, pepper, taste

title: Baked cod with lemon butter sauce and roasted vegetables
raw_text: 42. Baked cod with lemon butter sauce and roasted vegetables - 380 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains lactose
ingredients:
sure! here's the recipe for baked cod with lemon butter sauce and roasted vegetables:

ingredients:
- 2 cod fillets
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 2 cups mixed vegetables (such as carrots, zucchini, and bell peppers), diced
- 2 teaspoons garlic powder
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons unsalted butter
- fresh parsley for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).

2. season the cod fillets with salt and pepper on both sides. place them on a baking dish.

3. in a separate bowl, toss the mixed vegetables with olive oil, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.

4. spread the vegetables evenly around the cod fillets in the baking dish.

5. bake in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes or until the cod is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.

6. meanwhile, prepare the lemon butter sauce. in a small saucepan, melt the butter over low heat. stir in the lemon juice and continue cooking for a few more minutes. remove from heat.

7. once the cod and vegetables are done, transfer them to serving plates.

8. drizzle the lemon butter sauce over the baked cod.

9. garnish with fresh parsley if desired.

10. serve the baked cod with lemon butter sauce and roasted vegetables immediately and enjoy!

note: make sure to check the labels of all the ingredients you use, as lactose can be present in unexpected sources.
ingredients_list: baked, cod, lemon, butter, sauce, roasted, vegetable, cod, fillet, salt, pepper, taste, olive, vegetable, carrot, zucchini, bell, pepper, garlic, powder, lemon, unsalted, butter, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Spinach and ricotta stuffed chicken breast with quinoa
raw_text: 43. Spinach and ricotta stuffed chicken breast with quinoa - 450 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 boneless and skinless chicken breasts
- 2 cups of fresh spinach, chopped
- 1 cup of ricotta cheese
- 1/4 cup of grated parmesan cheese (optional)
- 1/4 teaspoon of garlic powder
- 1/4 teaspoon of onion powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 cup of quinoa
- 2 cups of water or chicken broth
- 1 tablespoon of olive oil
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a large bowl, combine the chopped spinach, ricotta cheese, parmesan cheese (if using), garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper. mix well.
3. using a sharp knife, carefully cut a pocket into each chicken breast, being careful not to cut all the way through.
4. stuff each chicken breast with the spinach and ricotta mixture, dividing it equally among the four chicken breasts.
5. secure the opening of each stuffed chicken breast with toothpicks to keep the filling inside.
6. season the outside of the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
7. heat the olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat.
8. carefully add the stuffed chicken breasts to the skillet and cook for about 3 minutes on each side, or until the chicken is browned.
9. transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for about 25-30 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through and the filling is hot and bubbly.
10. while the chicken is baking, cook the quinoa according to the package instructions, using water or chicken broth for added flavor.
11. once the chicken is done, remove it from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.
12. remove the toothpicks from the chicken and slice each breast into thick slices.
13. serve the stuffed chicken breast slices over a bed of cooked quinoa.
14. enjoy your spinach and ricotta stuffed chicken breast with quinoa!

note: if you are lactose intolerant, you can substitute the ricotta cheese with a lactose-free alternative or omit it altogether.
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, fresh, spinach, ricotta, cheese, parmesan, cheese, garlic, powder, onion, powder, salt, pepper, taste, quinoa, water, chicken, broth, olive

title: Vegetable curry with coconut milk and basmati rice
raw_text: 44. Vegetable curry with coconut milk and basmati rice - 350 kcals per portion, 4 portions, vegetarian, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 bell pepper, sliced
- 1 carrot, sliced
- 1 zucchini, sliced
- 1 cup cauliflower florets
- 1 cup broccoli florets
- 2 tablespoons curry powder
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground turmeric
- 1 can (400 ml) coconut milk
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- salt and pepper to taste
- 2 cups cooked basmati rice
- fresh cilantro, for garnish
preparation:
1. heat the vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat.
2. add the diced onion and minced garlic. sauté until the onion becomes translucent.
3. add the sliced bell pepper, carrot, zucchini, cauliflower, and broccoli to the pan. cook for a few minutes until the vegetables start to soften.
4. in a small bowl, mix together the curry powder, cumin, and turmeric. add the spice mixture to the pan and stir well to coat the vegetables.
5. pour in the coconut milk and vegetable broth. stir to combine everything.
6. season with salt and pepper to taste. bring the mixture to a gentle simmer, then cover and let it cook for about 15-20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
7. while the curry is cooking, prepare the basmati rice according to the package instructions.
8. serve the vegetable curry over cooked basmati rice. garnish with fresh cilantro.
9. enjoy your delicious vegetable curry with coconut milk and basmati rice!
ingredients_list: vegetable, onion, clove, garlic, minced, bell, pepper, carrot, zucchini, cauliflower, floret, broccoli, floret, curry, powder, ground, cumin, ground, turmeric, coconut, milk, vegetable, broth, salt, pepper, taste, basmati, rice, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Grilled pork chops with sweet potato mash
raw_text: 49. Grilled pork chops with sweet potato mash - 500 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:

- 2 pork chops
- 2 medium-sized sweet potatoes
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- 2 tablespoons butter (use lactose-free alternative if needed)
- 1/4 cup lactose-free milk
- fresh parsley for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat your grill to medium-high heat.
2. season both sides of the pork chops with salt and pepper.
3. place the pork chops on the grill and cook for about 4-5 minutes per side or until they reach an internal temperature of 145°f (63°c). adjust cooking time based on the thickness of the pork chops.
4. while the pork chops are grilling, peel and chop the sweet potatoes into small cubes.
5. in a pot, bring water to a boil and add the sweet potato cubes. cook for about 15-20 minutes or until the potatoes are fork-tender.
6. drain the cooked sweet potatoes and transfer them back to the pot.
7. mash the sweet potatoes with a potato masher or fork until smooth.
8. stir in the butter (or lactose-free alternative) and lactose-free milk until well combined. season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. once the pork chops are done grilling, remove them from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes.
10. serve the grilled pork chops with a dollop of sweet potato mash on the side.
11. garnish with fresh parsley if desired.
12. enjoy your delicious grilled pork chops with sweet potato mash!
ingredients_list: pork, chop, sweet, potato, olive, salt, pepper, taste, butter, lactose, needed, lactose, milk, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Caprese stuffed chicken breast with quinoa
raw_text: 50. Caprese stuffed chicken breast with quinoa - 450 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains lactose, gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 2 large tomatoes, sliced
- 8 ounces fresh mozzarella cheese, sliced
- 1 cup cooked quinoa
- 2 tablespoons fresh basil, chopped
- salt and pepper to taste
- olive oil for drizzling
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cut a pocket into each chicken breast by carefully slicing horizontally through the thickest part, being careful not to cut all the way through.
3. stuff each pocket with tomato slices, mozzarella slices, and a spoonful of cooked quinoa. press the edges of the chicken together to seal the pocket.
4. season the stuffed chicken breasts with salt, pepper, and chopped basil.
5. place the chicken breasts in a baking dish and drizzle with olive oil.
6. bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
7. serve the caprese stuffed chicken breast with a side of cooked quinoa and enjoy!
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, tomato, ounce, fresh, mozzarella, cheese, quinoa, fresh, basil, salt, pepper, taste, olive, drizzling

title: Grilled vegetable skewers with couscous
raw_text: 51. Grilled vegetable skewers with couscous - 300 kcals per portion, 4 portions, vegetarian, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 zucchini
- 1 yellow bell pepper
- 1 red bell pepper
- 1 red onion
- 8 cherry tomatoes
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 cup couscous
- 2 cups vegetable broth
- fresh basil leaves for garnish (optional)
preparation:
1. soak wooden skewers in water for about 15 minutes to prevent them from burning.
2. cut the zucchini, bell peppers, and red onion into bite-sized pieces.
3. thread the vegetables onto skewers, alternating between the different vegetables.
4. in a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, oregano, salt, and pepper. brush the mixture over the skewered vegetables.
5. preheat a grill or grill pan over medium heat. grill the vegetable skewers for about 10-15 minutes or until the vegetables are slightly charred and tender.
6. meanwhile, prepare the couscous. in a saucepan, bring the vegetable broth to a boil. stir in the couscous, cover, and remove from heat. let it sit for about 5 minutes or until all the liquid is absorbed. fluff the couscous with a fork.
7. serve the grilled vegetable skewers over a bed of couscous. garnish with fresh basil leaves if desired.
8. enjoy your delicious and healthy grilled vegetable skewers with couscous!

note: make sure to check the packaging of couscous to ensure it is gluten-free if needed.
ingredients_list: zucchini, yellow, bell, pepper, red, bell, pepper, red, onion, cherry, tomato, olive, dried, oregano, salt, pepper, taste, couscous, vegetable, broth, fresh, basil, leaf, garnish

title: Coconut curry shrimp with jasmine rice
raw_text: 52. Coconut curry shrimp with jasmine rice - 400 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains shellfish
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1/2 pound of shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 1 tablespoon of coconut oil
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon of curry powder
- 1/2 teaspoon of turmeric
- 1/2 teaspoon of cumin
- 1 can (13.5 oz) of coconut milk
- 1 tablespoon of fish sauce
- 1 tablespoon of lime juice
- 1 tablespoon of brown sugar
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh cilantro, for garnish
- jasmine rice, cooked according to package instructions
preparation:
1. heat the coconut oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. add the chopped onion and sliced bell pepper to the skillet. sauté until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
3. add the minced garlic, curry powder, turmeric, and cumin to the skillet. stir well to coat the vegetables with the spices.
4. add the shrimp to the skillet and cook until they turn pink, about 2-3 minutes per side.
5. pour in the coconut milk and stir in the fish sauce, lime juice, and brown sugar. season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. simmer the mixture for 5-7 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
7. serve the coconut curry shrimp over jasmine rice.
8. garnish with fresh cilantro and enjoy!
ingredients_list: shrimp, deveined, coconut, onion, red, bell, pepper, clove, garlic, minced, curry, powder, turmeric, cumin, coconut, milk, fish, sauce, lime, brown, sugar, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, cilantro, garnish, jasmine, rice, instruction

title: Mushroom and spinach risotto
raw_text: 54. Mushroom and spinach risotto - 350 kcals per portion, 4 portions, vegetarian, contains lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 200g risotto rice
- 900ml vegetable broth
- 200g mushrooms, sliced
- 200g spinach, chopped
- 50g grated parmesan cheese (optional, omit if vegan)
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. in a large pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the chopped onion and minced garlic, and sauté until softened and fragrant.
2. add the risotto rice to the pan and stir well, coating the rice with the oil and onion mixture.
3. gradually add the vegetable broth to the pan, about 200ml at a time, stirring continuously until the liquid is absorbed before adding more. repeat this process until all the broth has been added and the rice is cooked and creamy. this usually takes around 20-25 minutes.
4. while the risotto is cooking, heat a separate pan over medium heat and add the sliced mushrooms. cook until the mushrooms release their moisture and become golden brown. remove from heat and set aside.
5. once the risotto is cooked, stir in the chopped spinach and cooked mushrooms. cook for another 2-3 minutes until the spinach wilts.
6. if desired, stir in grated parmesan cheese until melted and incorporated into the risotto. season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. divide the risotto into four portions and serve hot. optionally, garnish with a sprinkle of grated parmesan cheese on top. enjoy your mushroom and spinach risotto!
ingredients_list: olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, risotto, rice, vegetable, broth, mushroom, spinach, parmesan, cheese, omit, vegan, salt, pepper, taste

title: Teriyaki beef with broccoli and noodles
raw_text: 55. Teriyaki beef with broccoli and noodles - 420 kcals per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten, soy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 400g beef steak, thinly sliced
- 2 cups broccoli florets
- 200g egg noodles
- 3 tablespoons teriyaki sauce
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. cook the egg noodles according to the package instructions, then drain and set aside.
2. in a large pan, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
3. add the minced garlic and sauté for about 1 minute until fragrant.
4. add the beef slices to the pan and cook until browned, for about 2-3 minutes per side.
5. add the broccoli florets to the pan and stir-fry for another 3 minutes, until they start to soften.
6. in a small bowl, mix together the teriyaki sauce and soy sauce.
7. pour the sauce mixture into the pan and stir until everything is well-coated.
8. cook for another 2 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly.
9. season with salt and pepper to taste.
10. serve the teriyaki beef with broccoli over a bed of cooked egg noodles.
11. enjoy!

note: make sure to check if all the ingredients you are using are specifically labeled gluten-free if you have a gluten intolerance or allergy.
ingredients_list: beef, steak, thinly, broccoli, floret, egg, noodle, teriyaki, sauce, soy, sauce, vegetable, garlic, clove, minced, salt, pepper, taste

title: Pesto and sun
raw_text: 56. Pesto and sun-dried tomato stuffed chicken breast with roasted potatoes - 450 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 1/2 cup sun-dried tomatoes, chopped
- 1/4 cup basil leaves
- 1/4 cup pine nuts
- 2 cloves of garlic
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese (optional, skip if lactose-free)
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 2 tablespoons olive oil, divided

for roasted potatoes:
- 4 medium-sized potatoes, cubed
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).

2. in a food processor, combine the sun-dried tomatoes, basil leaves, pine nuts, garlic, grated parmesan cheese (if using), salt, and pepper. blend until you achieve a thick paste. if the mixture is too dry, drizzle in 1 tablespoon of olive oil to reach desired consistency.

3. make a horizontal incision in each chicken breast to create a pocket for the stuffing. be careful not to cut all the way through. season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.

4. stuff each chicken breast with a generous amount of the pesto and sun-dried tomato mixture.

5. in a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium-high heat. sear the stuffed chicken breasts on each side until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes per side.

6. transfer the seared chicken breasts to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and no longer pink in the center.

7. while the chicken is baking, prepare the roasted potatoes. in a bowl, toss the cubed potatoes with olive oil, salt, and pepper. spread them out on a baking sheet in a single layer.

8. place the baking sheet with the potatoes in the oven alongside the chicken. roast for 20-25 minutes, or until the potatoes are crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.

9. serve the pesto and sun-dried tomato stuffed chicken breasts with the roasted potatoes as a side. enjoy!
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, sun, dried, tomato, basil, leaf, pine, nut, clove, garlic, parmesan, cheese, lactose, salt, pepper, taste, olive, roasted, potato, potato, olive, salt, pepper, taste

title: Vegetarian nachos with black beans and cheese
raw_text: 57. Vegetarian nachos with black beans and cheese - 380 kcals per portion, 4 portions, vegetarian, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 bag of tortilla chips
- 1 can (15 oz) of black beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 cup shredded cheese (cheddar, monterey jack, or a blend)
- 1 small onion, diced
- 1 small tomato, diced
- 1 jalapeno, thinly sliced (optional)
- 2 tablespoons chopped cilantro
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/2 teaspoon chili powder
- salt to taste
- 1/4 cup sour cream (optional)
- salsa or guacamole for serving (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. spread a single layer of tortilla chips on a baking sheet or oven-safe dish.
3. in a small bowl, mix the black beans, diced onion, cumin, chili powder, and salt.
4. spoon half of the black bean mixture evenly over the tortilla chips.
5. sprinkle half of the shredded cheese on top of the black bean mixture.
6. repeat with another layer of tortilla chips, black bean mixture, and cheese.
7. top with diced tomato, jalapeno slices (if desired), and chopped cilantro.
8. bake in the preheated oven for about 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. remove from the oven and let it cool slightly.
10. serve the vegetarian nachos with sour cream, salsa, or guacamole on the side, if desired.
11. enjoy your delicious and vegetarian nachos with black beans and cheese!
ingredients_list: tortilla, chip, black, bean, shredded, cheese, cheddar, monterey, jack, blend, onion, tomato, jalapeno, thinly, cilantro, ground, cumin, chili, powder, salt, taste, sour, cream, salsa, guacamole

title: Grilled salmon with dill sauce and roasted vegetables
raw_text: 58. Grilled salmon with dill sauce and roasted vegetables - 500 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 salmon fillets
- 1 teaspoon olive oil
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 tablespoon fresh dill, chopped
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice

for the roasted vegetables:
- 1 cup diced vegetables (e.g. bell peppers, zucchini, eggplant, cherry tomatoes)
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- salt and pepper, to taste

for the dill sauce:
- 1/4 cup greek yogurt (lactose-free if needed)
- 1 tablespoon fresh dill, chopped
- 1 teaspoon lemon juice
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
2. brush the salmon fillets with olive oil and season with salt, pepper, and fresh dill.
3. place the salmon fillets on the grill and cook for about 4-5 minutes per side, or until cooked through. remove from the grill and squeeze lemon juice over the salmon.
4. meanwhile, preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
5. in a baking dish, combine the diced vegetables with olive oil, salt, and pepper. toss well to coat the vegetables evenly.
6. roast the vegetables in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly charred.
7. in a small bowl, mix together the greek yogurt, fresh dill, lemon juice, salt, and pepper to make the dill sauce.
8. serve the grilled salmon with roasted vegetables on the side, drizzled with the dill sauce.
9. enjoy your grilled salmon with dill sauce and roasted vegetables!
cuisine: The cuisine type of the recipe is "American"
ingredients_list: salmon, fillet, olive, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, dill, lemon, roasted, vegetable, vegetable, bell, pepper, zucchini, eggplant, cherry, tomato, olive, salt, pepper, taste, dill, sauce, greek, yogurt, lactose, needed, fresh, dill, lemon, salt, pepper, taste

title: Lemon herb roasted chicken with quinoa and steamed vegetables
raw_text: 59. Lemon herb roasted chicken with quinoa and steamed vegetables - 550 kcals per portion, 4 portions, gluten-free, contains lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 whole chicken
- 2 lemons
- 4 cloves of garlic
- 2 tablespoons of chopped fresh herbs (such as rosemary, thyme, or parsley)
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 cup of quinoa
- 2 cups of water or chicken broth
- assorted vegetables of your choice (such as carrots, broccoli, and green beans)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. rinse the chicken and pat it dry with paper towels.
3. cut one lemon into slices and set aside.
4. in a small bowl, mix together the juice of the second lemon, minced garlic, chopped herbs, salt, and pepper.
5. rub the lemon herb mixture evenly all over the chicken, including under the skin.
6. place the lemon slices inside the chicken cavity.
7. place the chicken on a roasting pan or baking dish, breast-side up.
8. roast the chicken in the preheated oven for about 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°f (74°c). the exact cooking time may vary depending on the size of the chicken.
9. while the chicken is roasting, rinse the quinoa under cold water. in a saucepan, bring the water or chicken broth to a boil. add the rinsed quinoa, reduce the heat to low, cover, and let it simmer for about 15 minutes or until all the liquid is absorbed. fluff the quinoa with a fork.
10. in a separate pot, bring water to a boil and steam the assorted vegetables until they are tender but still crisp. drain any excess water.
11. once the chicken is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before carving.
12. serve the sliced lemon herb roasted chicken with a portion of cooked quinoa and steamed vegetables.
13. enjoy your gluten-free and lactose-containing lemon herb roasted chicken with quinoa and steamed vegetables!
ingredients_list: whole, chicken, lemon, clove, garlic, fresh, herb, rosemary, thyme, parsley, salt, pepper, taste, quinoa, water, chicken, broth, assorted, vegetable, carrot, broccoli, green, bean

title: Spicy honey glazed shrimp with jasmine rice
raw_text: 60. Spicy honey glazed shrimp with jasmine rice - 420 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains shellfish
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 12 large shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon red pepper flakes
- 3 tablespoons honey
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1 teaspoon grated fresh ginger
- 2 cups cooked jasmine rice
- salt, to taste
- fresh cilantro, for garnish
preparation:
1. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat.
2. add the minced garlic and red pepper flakes to the skillet. sauté for about 1 minute until the garlic becomes fragrant.
3. add the shrimp to the skillet and cook for about 2-3 minutes per side until they turn pink and opaque.
4. in a small bowl, mix together the honey, soy sauce, and grated ginger.
5. pour the honey mixture over the cooked shrimp in the skillet. stir well to coat the shrimp evenly.
6. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, allowing the sauce to thicken and glaze the shrimp.
7. while the shrimp is glazing, season the cooked jasmine rice with salt to taste.
8. divide the jasmine rice into two serving bowls or plates.
9. place the glazed shrimp on top of the rice, dividing them equally between the two portions.
10. garnish with fresh cilantro leaves.
11. serve immediately and enjoy your spicy honey glazed shrimp with jasmine rice!
ingredients_list: shrimp, deveined, olive, clove, garlic, minced, red, pepper, flake, honey, soy, sauce, fresh, ginger, jasmine, rice, salt, taste, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Chicken marsala with mashed potatoes and green beans
raw_text: 62. Chicken marsala with mashed potatoes and green beans - 500 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 chicken breasts
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 8 ounces mushrooms, sliced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 cup marsala wine
- 1 cup chicken broth
- 1/4 cup heavy cream (substitute with lactose-free cream if lactose intolerant)
- 1 tablespoon butter (substitute with lactose-free margarine if lactose intolerant)
- 1 pound potatoes, peeled and diced
- 1/2 cup lactose-free milk
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 pound green beans, trimmed
preparation:
1. season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper. dredge them in flour, shaking off any excess.
2. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. add the chicken breasts and cook for about 6 minutes on each side, or until they are golden brown and cooked through. remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
3. in the same skillet, add the sliced mushrooms and minced garlic. cook for about 5 minutes, or until the mushrooms have softened.
4. deglaze the skillet with marsala wine, scraping any browned bits from the bottom. stir in the chicken broth. bring the mixture to a simmer and let it cook for about 5 minutes, or until the liquid has reduced slightly.
5. stir in the heavy cream (or lactose-free cream) and butter (or lactose-free margarine). cook for an additional 2 minutes, or until the sauce thickens slightly.
6. meanwhile, cook the diced potatoes in boiling water until tender. drain the potatoes and return them to the pot. mash them using a potato masher or fork. gradually add lactose-free milk while mashing until desired consistency is reached. season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. steam or blanch the green beans until they are crisp-tender, about 4-5 minutes. drain and set aside.
8. divide the chicken marsala, mashed potatoes, and green beans into 4 portions. serve and enjoy!
ingredients_list: chicken, breast, salt, pepper, taste, flour, olive, ounce, mushroom, clove, garlic, minced, marsala, wine, chicken, broth, cream, lactose, cream, lactose, butter, lactose, margarine, lactose, potato, lactose, milk, salt, pepper, taste, green, bean

title: Stuffed zucchini boats with ground turkey
raw_text: 63. Stuffed zucchini boats with ground turkey - 350 kcals per portion, 4 portions, gluten-free, contains lactose
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 2 medium zucchini 
- 1 pound ground turkey 
- 1 small onion, chopped 
- 2 garlic cloves, minced 
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano 
- 1 teaspoon dried basil 
- 1/2 teaspoon salt 
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper 
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese 
- 1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese 
- fresh parsley, chopped for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c). 
2. cut the zucchini in half lengthwise and scoop out the center flesh, creating boat-shaped zucchini halves. 
3. chop the scooped out zucchini flesh and set aside. 
4. in a large skillet, heat a tablespoon of oil over medium heat. 
5. add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the skillet. sauté for about 2-3 minutes until they become fragrant and slightly softened. 
6. add the ground turkey to the skillet and cook until browned, breaking it up into small pieces with a spoon. 
7. add the chopped zucchini flesh, dried oregano, dried basil, salt, and black pepper to the skillet. stir everything together and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes. 
8. remove the skillet from heat and stir in the parmesan cheese until well combined. 
9. arrange the zucchini boats in a baking dish and spoon the turkey mixture evenly into each boat. 
10. sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese over the tops of the zucchini boats. 
11. cover the baking dish with foil and bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the zucchini is tender and the cheese has melted and turned golden brown. 
12. once cooked, remove from the oven and let them cool slightly. 
13. garnish with chopped fresh parsley before serving. divide the stuffed zucchini boats into 4 portions and serve hot. enjoy!
ingredients_list: zucchini, ground, turkey, onion, garlic, clove, minced, dried, oregano, dried, basil, salt, black, pepper, parmesan, cheese, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, fresh, parsley, garnish

title: Vegetarian tikka masala with basmati rice
raw_text: 64. Vegetarian tikka masala with basmati rice - 300 kcals per portion, 4 portions, vegetarian, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 cup basmati rice
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 small onion, diced
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 tablespoon ginger, grated
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 zucchini, diced
- 1 cup diced tomatoes
- 1 cup tomato puree
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- 1 tablespoon tikka masala spice blend (make sure it's vegetarian and gluten-free)
- 1/2 cup coconut milk
- 1 cup cooked chickpeas
- salt and pepper to taste
- fresh cilantro, for garnish
preparation:
1. cook the basmati rice according to package instructions and set aside.
2. heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
3. add the diced onion, minced garlic, and grated ginger. sauté until fragrant and the onions are translucent.
4. add the diced bell pepper and zucchini to the skillet and cook until slightly softened.
5. stir in the diced tomatoes, tomato puree, vegetable broth, and tikka masala spice blend. season with salt and pepper to taste.
6. reduce the heat and let the mixture simmer for about 15 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
7. stir in the coconut milk and cooked chickpeas. cook for an additional 5 minutes until heated through.
8. serve the tikka masala over the cooked basmati rice and garnish with fresh cilantro.
9. enjoy your vegetarian tikka masala with basmati rice!
ingredients_list: basmati, rice, vegetable, onion, garlic, clove, minced, ginger, bell, pepper, zucchini, tomato, tomato, puree, vegetable, broth, tikka, masala, spice, blend, vegetarian, gluten, coconut, milk, chickpea, salt, pepper, taste, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Baked coconut shrimp with pineapple fried rice
raw_text: 65. Baked coconut shrimp with pineapple fried rice - 400 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains shellfish, lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 12 large shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 1/2 cup shredded unsweetened coconut
- 1/4 cup breadcrumbs
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
- 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
- 1 egg, beaten
- cooking spray

for the pineapple fried rice:
- 1 cup cooked rice (preferably white or jasmine)
- 1/2 cup pineapple chunks
- 1/2 cup diced red bell pepper
- 1/4 cup diced onion
- 1/4 cup frozen peas
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce (or tamari for gluten-free)
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/4 teaspoon ground ginger
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. in a bowl, combine the shredded coconut, breadcrumbs, salt, black pepper, and garlic powder. mix well.
3. place the flour in a separate bowl and the beaten egg in another bowl.
4. dip each shrimp into the flour, shaking off any excess, then dip it into the beaten egg, and finally coat it with the coconut breadcrumb mixture. press the coating gently to adhere to the shrimp. repeat with all the shrimp.
5. place the coated shrimp on the prepared baking sheet and lightly spray them with cooking spray.
6. bake the shrimp in the preheated oven for about 12-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy.
7. meanwhile, heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. add the diced onion and red bell pepper. sauté for about 3-4 minutes, until they become slightly softened.
8. add the cooked rice, pineapple chunks, frozen peas, garlic powder, and ground ginger to the skillet. stir well to combine.
9. add the soy sauce (or tamari), and continue to cook for another 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally, until everything is well heated through.
10. season the pineapple fried rice with salt and pepper to taste.
11. divide the pineapple fried rice into two plates and serve alongside the baked coconut shrimp.

enjoy your delicious baked coconut shrimp with pineapple fried rice! each portion contains approximately 400 calories. note that this recipe contains shellfish and lactose.
ingredients_list: shrimp, deveined, shredded, unsweetened, coconut, breadcrumb, salt, black, pepper, garlic, powder, flour, egg, spray, pineapple, rice, rice, preferably, white, jasmine, pineapple, red, bell, pepper, onion, frozen, pea, soy, sauce, tamari, gluten, vegetable, garlic, powder, ground, ginger, salt, pepper, taste

title: Chicken and mushroom pasta bake
raw_text: 66. Chicken and mushroom pasta bake - 480 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten, lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 300g dried pasta (gluten)
- 350g chicken breast, cooked and shredded
- 200g mushrooms, sliced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 400ml tomato passata
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 200g grated cheese (lactose)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 180°c (350°f).
2. cook the pasta according to the package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.
3. in a large frying pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the minced garlic and chopped onion. sauté until the onion becomes translucent.
4. add the sliced mushrooms and cook until they start to release their liquid and become slightly golden.
5. stir in the tomato passata, dried oregano, dried basil, salt, and black pepper. cook for a few minutes until well combined.
6. in a large bowl, combine the cooked shredded chicken, cooked pasta, and the sauce mixture. mix until everything is evenly coated.
7. transfer the mixture into a baking dish and sprinkle the grated cheese on top.
8. bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes or until the cheese is golden and bubbly.
9. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving. enjoy your delicious chicken and mushroom pasta bake!

title: Spinach and feta stuffed chicken breast with sweet potato mash
raw_text: 69. Spinach and feta stuffed chicken breast with sweet potato mash - 450 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 1 cup fresh spinach leaves, chopped
- 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste

for the sweet potato mash:
- 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
- 1/4 cup lactose-free milk
- 1 tablespoon lactose-free butter
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. slice a pocket into each chicken breast, being careful not to cut all the way through.
3. in a bowl, mix together the chopped spinach and crumbled feta cheese.
4. stuff each chicken breast with the spinach and feta mixture.
5. season the stuffed chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
6. heat olive oil in an oven-safe pan over medium-high heat.
7. sear the stuffed chicken breasts on both sides until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes per side.
8. transfer the pan into the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and no longer pink in the center.
9. while the chicken is baking, prepare the sweet potato mash.
10. place the sweet potato cubes in a large pot and cover with water. bring to a boil and cook until tender, about 10-15 minutes.
11. drain the sweet potatoes and return them to the pot.
12. add lactose-free milk and lactose-free butter to the pot. mash the sweet potatoes until smooth and creamy.
13. season with salt and pepper to taste.
14. serve the spinach and feta stuffed chicken breast alongside the sweet potato mash.
enjoy your spinach and feta stuffed chicken breast with sweet potato mash!

title: Butternut squash and lentil curry with basmati rice
raw_text: 70. Butternut squash and lentil curry with basmati rice - 400 kcals per portion, 4 portions, vegetarian, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 medium-sized butternut squash, peeled, deseeded, and cut into small cubes
- 1 cup dried lentils
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 thumb-sized piece of ginger, grated
- 1 red chili, finely chopped (optional, adjust according to your spice preference)
- 1 tablespoon curry powder
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground coriander
- 1 teaspoon turmeric
- 1 can (400ml) coconut milk
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- salt and pepper, to taste
- fresh cilantro, for garnish (optional)
- basmati rice, for serving
preparation:
1. cook the basmati rice according to the package instructions.
2. in a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. add the chopped onion, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped red chili (if using). sauté for about 5 minutes until the onions become translucent.
3. add the curry powder, ground cumin, ground coriander, and turmeric to the pot. stir well to coat the onions and spices evenly.
4. add the diced butternut squash to the pot and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. rinse the lentils under cold water, then add them to the pot along with the coconut milk and vegetable broth. stir to combine all the ingredients.
6. season with salt and pepper, then bring the curry to a boil. reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for approximately 20-25 minutes, or until the butternut squash and lentils are tender.
7. serve the butternut squash and lentil curry over a bed of basmati rice. garnish with fresh cilantro, if desired. enjoy your delicious vegetarian curry packed with flavor and nutrients!
(note: adjust the seasoning and spices according to your taste preference.)

title: Garlic butter shrimp with angel hair pasta
raw_text: 71. Garlic butter shrimp with angel hair pasta - 500 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten, shellfish, lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound angel hair pasta
- 1 pound shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 4 tablespoons unsalted butter
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes (optional)
- salt and black pepper to taste
- 2 tablespoons fresh parsley, chopped
- grated parmesan cheese (optional, for topping)
preparation:
1. cook the angel hair pasta according to the package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.
2. in a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
3. add the minced garlic and red pepper flakes (if using) to the melted butter and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
4. add the shrimp to the skillet and season with salt and black pepper. cook the shrimp for 2-3 minutes on each side until pink and cooked through.
5. remove the skillet from heat and mix in the cooked angel hair pasta. toss everything until well coated with the garlic butter sauce.
6. sprinkle fresh parsley over the shrimp and pasta mixture.
7. serve hot and top with grated parmesan cheese if desired.

note: make sure to check ingredient labels for any potential allergens or dietary restrictions as they may vary between brands.
