title: BBQ pulled pork with cornbread and coleslaw
raw_text: 72. BBQ pulled pork with cornbread and coleslaw - 600 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains lactose
ingredients:
ingredients for bbq pulled pork:
- 1.5 lbs (680g) pork shoulder
- 1 cup bbq sauce (check for lactose-free option)
- 1/4 cup brown sugar
- 2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar
- 1 tablespoon worcestershire sauce (check for lactose-free option)
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1 teaspoon onion powder
- salt and pepper to taste

ingredients for cornbread:
- 1 cup cornmeal
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup granulated sugar
- 1 tablespoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup lactose-free milk
- 1/4 cup vegetable oil
- 1 large egg

ingredients for coleslaw:
- 3 cups shredded cabbage
- 1 carrot, grated
- 1/4 cup mayonnaise (check for lactose-free option)
- 2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar
- 1 tablespoon granulated sugar
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 325°f (160°c).
2. in a mixing bowl, combine the bbq sauce, brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper for the pulled pork. whisk well.
3. place the pork shoulder in a baking dish and pour the bbq sauce mixture over it, making sure it's evenly coated.
4. cover the dish with aluminum foil and place it in the preheated oven. let it cook for about 3-4 hours, or until the pork becomes tender and easily shreds with a fork.
5. while the pork is cooking, prepare the cornbread. in a mixing bowl, combine the cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
6. in another bowl, whisk together the lactose-free milk, vegetable oil, and egg.
7. pour the wet mixture into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
8. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c) and pour the cornbread batter into a greased 9x9 inch baking dish.
9. bake for around 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. set aside to cool.
10. for the coleslaw, in a large bowl, combine the shredded cabbage and grated carrot.
11. in a separate small bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, apple cider vinegar, sugar, salt, and pepper to make the dressing.
12. pour the dressing over the cabbage mixture and toss until well coated. refrigerate until ready to serve.
13. once the pork is done cooking, remove it from the oven, and using two forks, shred the meat.
14. serve the bbq pulled pork with a side of cornbread and coleslaw. enjoy!
taste:
The key taste profile in the bbq pulled pork recipe is sweet.

The key taste profile in the cornbread recipe is sweet.

The key taste profile in the coleslaw recipe is sour.
ingredients_list: pork, shoulder, bbq, sauce, lactose, option, brown, sugar, apple, cider, vinegar, worcestershire, sauce, lactose, option, garlic, powder, onion, powder, salt, pepper, taste, cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking, powder, salt, lactose, milk, vegetable, egg, shredded, cabbage, carrot, mayonnaise, lactose, option, apple, cider, vinegar, sugar, salt, pepper, taste

title: Vegetarian enchilada casserole with black beans and cheese
raw_text: 73. Vegetarian enchilada casserole with black beans and cheese - 380 kcals per portion, 4 portions, vegetarian, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 onion, diced
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 zucchini, diced
- 1 cup cooked black beans
- 1 cup corn kernels
- 1 can diced tomatoes
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- 8 small flour tortillas
- 2 cups shredded cheese (cheddar or mexican blend)
- chopped fresh cilantro, for garnish
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. add the diced onion and minced garlic, and sauté until fragrant and translucent.
3. add the diced bell pepper and zucchini to the skillet, and continue cooking until they are slightly softened.
4. stir in the cooked black beans, corn kernels, diced tomatoes, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. allow the mixture to simmer for about 10 minutes to combine the flavors.
5. in a greased baking dish, spread a thin layer of the bean and vegetable mixture on the bottom.
6. place a tortilla on top, followed by a layer of shredded cheese. repeat this layering process until all the ingredients are used, ending with a layer of cheese on top.
7. cover the casserole dish with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.
8. remove the foil and continue baking for another 10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
10. garnish with chopped fresh cilantro if desired.
11. cut into portions and enjoy your vegetarian enchilada casserole!
ingredients_list: olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, bell, pepper, zucchini, black, bean, corn, kernel, tomato, cumin, chili, powder, salt, pepper, taste, flour, tortilla, shredded, cheese, cheddar, mexican, blend, fresh, cilantro, garnish

title: Moroccan vegetable tagine with couscous
raw_text: 77. Moroccan vegetable tagine with couscous - 300 kcals per portion, 4 portions, vegetarian, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 onion, sliced

- 1 red bell pepper, sliced
- 1 yellow bell pepper, sliced
- 2 carrots, sliced
- 1 small eggplant, cubed

preparation:
1. heat the olive oil in a large pot or tagine over medium heat.
2. add the sliced onion and minced garlic, sauté until softened and fragrant.
3. add the sliced red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, carrots, eggplant, and zucchini to the pot.
4. stir in the diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, cumin, coriander, turmeric, cinnamon, paprika, salt, and pepper.
5. bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
6. while the tagine is simmering, prepare the couscous according to the package instructions.
7. fluff the cooked couscous with a fork and divide it evenly among four serving bowls.
8. ladle the vegetable tagine over the couscous in each bowl.

title: Honey garlic chicken with broccoli and brown rice
raw_text: 78. Honey garlic chicken with broccoli and brown rice - 420 kcals per portion, 3 portions, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 3 chicken breasts
- 3 tablespoons honey
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce (make sure it's gluten-free if needed)
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 3 cups broccoli florets
- 1 cup brown rice
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. cook the brown rice according to the package instructions.
2. in a mixing bowl, combine the honey, minced garlic, soy sauce, and a pinch of salt and pepper. mix well.
3. place the chicken breasts in a ziplock bag and pour the honey garlic marinade over them. seal the bag and massage the marinade into the chicken. let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
4. heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
5. remove the chicken from the marinade, reserving the remaining marinade.
6. place the chicken in the skillet and cook for 6-8 minutes per side, or until fully cooked and golden brown. remove the cooked chicken from the skillet and set it aside.
7. in the same skillet, add the broccoli florets and cook them for about 5 minutes until they are tender-crisp.
8. meanwhile, in a small saucepan, pour the reserved marinade and bring it to a boil. reduce the heat and let it simmer for 5 minutes until it thickens slightly.
9. slice the cooked chicken into thin strips.
10. serve the cooked brown rice, topped with the honey garlic chicken strips and steamed broccoli. drizzle the thickened marinade over the dish.
11. enjoy your delicious honey garlic chicken with broccoli and brown rice!

title: Baked cod with tomato
raw_text: 79. Baked cod with tomato-caper sauce and roasted vegetables - 380 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 cod fillets
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1 tablespoon capers
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- 2 cups mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, zucchini, and carrots)
- fresh herbs for garnish (such as parsley or basil)
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. in a small bowl, mix together the cherry tomatoes, capers, minced garlic, 1 tablespoon of olive oil, salt, and pepper.
3. place the cod fillets in a baking dish and pour the tomato-caper mixture over them.
4. bake in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes or until the cod is cooked thoroughly.
5. while the cod is baking, prepare the roasted vegetables. cut the mixed vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
6. place the vegetables on a baking sheet, drizzle with 1 tablespoon of olive oil, and season with salt and pepper.
7. roast the vegetables in the oven for about 20-25 minutes or until they are tender and slightly browned.
8. once the cod and vegetables are cooked, divide them into two portions and serve. garnish with fresh herbs if desired.

enjoy your lactose-containing baked cod with tomato-caper sauce and roasted vegetables!

title: Spinach and cream cheese stuffed chicken breast with wild rice
raw_text: 80. Spinach and cream cheese stuffed chicken breast with wild rice - 450 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 2 cups fresh spinach, chopped
- 1 cup cream cheese, softened
- 1 teaspoon minced garlic
- 1/2 teaspoon onion powder
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 cup uncooked wild rice
- 2 cups water or chicken broth
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a medium bowl, combine the spinach, cream cheese, minced garlic, onion powder, salt, and pepper. mix well until everything is evenly combined.
3. lay the chicken breasts flat on a cutting board. use a sharp knife to cut a slit horizontally into each breast, being careful not to cut all the way through. the goal is to create a pocket for the stuffing.
4. stuff each chicken breast with an equal amount of the spinach and cream cheese mixture. use toothpicks to secure the openings if needed.
5. place the stuffed chicken breasts in a baking dish.
6. in a separate saucepan, bring the water or chicken broth to a boil. add the wild rice, reduce the heat, cover, and simmer for about 30 minutes or until the rice is cooked and tender.
7. while the rice is cooking, bake the stuffed chicken breasts in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and no longer pink in the center.
8. remove the toothpicks from the chicken and serve it alongside the cooked wild rice. enjoy your spinach and cream cheese stuffed chicken breast with wild rice!

note: if you are lactose intolerant, you can try using lactose-free cream cheese or substitute it with a lactose-free cheese alternative that suits your dietary needs.
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, fresh, spinach, cream, cheese, minced, garlic, onion, powder, salt, pepper, taste, wild, rice, water, chicken, broth

title: Chicken and sausage gumbo with white rice
raw_text: 82. Chicken and sausage gumbo with white rice - 550 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
- 1/2 pound smoked sausage, sliced
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup vegetable oil
- 1 large onion, diced
- 1 green bell pepper, diced
- 2 celery stalks, diced
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 4 cups chicken broth
- 1 can diced tomatoes (14.5 ounces)
- 2 bay leaves
- 2 teaspoons cajun seasoning
- 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 cup white rice
- 2 cups water
preparation:
1. in a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. add the flour and cook, stirring constantly, until the mixture turns a dark brown color (this is called making a roux). be careful not to burn it.

2. add the diced onion, bell pepper, celery, and minced garlic to the pot. cook for 5 minutes until the vegetables start to soften.

3. add the chicken thighs and smoked sausage to the pot. cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.

4. pour in the chicken broth and diced tomatoes. stir in the bay leaves, cajun seasoning, dried thyme, salt, and pepper.

5. bring the gumbo to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 45 minutes to 1 hour, until the chicken is cooked through and the flavors have melded together.

6. while the gumbo is cooking, prepare the white rice. in a separate pot, bring 2 cups of water to a boil. add the white rice, cover the pot, and simmer for 15-20 minutes until the rice is tender and the water is absorbed.

7. once the gumbo is done simmering, remove the bay leaves and discard.

8. serve the chicken and sausage gumbo over a bed of white rice. enjoy while hot.

note: if you have lactose intolerance, ensure that the sausage you use does not contain lactose as an ingredient.
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, thigh, piece, smoked, sausage, flour, vegetable, onion, green, bell, pepper, celery, stalk, clove, garlic, minced, chicken, broth, tomato, ounce, leaf, cajun, seasoning, dried, thyme, salt, pepper, taste, white, rice, water

title: Lasagna rolls with spinach and ricotta
raw_text: 83. Lasagna rolls with spinach and ricotta - 400 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten, lactose
ingredients:
ingredients: 
- 8 lasagna noodles 
- 2 cups of ricotta cheese 
- 2 cups of spinach, chopped 
- 1 cup of marinara sauce 
- 1 cup of shredded mozzarella cheese 
- 1/4 cup of grated parmesan cheese 
- 1/2 teaspoon of salt 
- 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c). 
2. cook the lasagna noodles according to the package instructions until they are al dente. 
3. in a mixing bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, chopped spinach, salt, and black pepper. stir well until everything is evenly mixed. 
4. lay the cooked lasagna noodles flat on a clean surface. spoon the ricotta and spinach mixture evenly onto each noodle, spreading it from one end to the other. 
5. starting from one end, tightly roll up each lasagna noodle with the filling inside. 
6. spread a thin layer of marinara sauce on the bottom of a baking dish. place the lasagna rolls seam-side down in the dish. 
7. pour the remaining marinara sauce over the top of the lasagna rolls, making sure they are fully covered. 
8. sprinkle the shredded mozzarella cheese and grated parmesan cheese evenly on top of the rolls. 
9. cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake for about 20 minutes. 
10. remove the foil and continue baking for another 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly, and the rolls are heated through. 
11. once ready, remove from the oven and let the lasagna rolls cool for a few minutes before serving. 
12. divide into 4 portions and enjoy your delicious and nutritious lasagna rolls with spinach and ricotta!
ingredients_list: lasagna, noodle, ricotta, cheese, spinach, marinara, sauce, shredded, mozzarella, cheese, parmesan, cheese, salt, black, pepper

title: Szechuan beef with jasmine rice
raw_text: 84. Szechuan beef with jasmine rice - 480 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten, sesame
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 500g beef steak, sliced into thin strips
- 3 tablespoons soy sauce (gluten-free if needed)
- 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon hoisin sauce (gluten-free if needed)
- 1 tablespoon honey
- 2 teaspoons sesame oil
- 2 teaspoons szechuan peppercorns, crushed
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon ginger, grated
- 1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 green bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1 medium onion, thinly sliced
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 2 cups cooked jasmine rice
- spring onions, for garnish
- sesame seeds, for garnish
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine soy sauce, rice vinegar, hoisin sauce, honey, sesame oil, szechuan peppercorns, minced garlic, and grated ginger. mix well.
2. add the beef strips to the marinade, making sure each piece is coated. let it marinate for at least 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
3. heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
4. add the marinated beef to the pan and stir-fry for 4-5 minutes until browned and cooked through. remove from the pan and set aside.
5. in the same pan, add the sliced bell peppers and onion. stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until slightly tender.
6. return the cooked beef to the pan with the vegetables and stir fry for an additional minute to combine and heat through.
7. serve the szechuan beef over cooked jasmine rice.
8. garnish with chopped spring onions and sesame seeds.
9. enjoy your gluten-containing, sesame-infused szechuan beef with jasmine rice!

title: Lemon herb roasted salmon with quinoa and roasted vegetables
raw_text: 85. Lemon herb roasted salmon with quinoa and roasted vegetables - 500 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 salmon fillets
- 1 lemon, sliced
- 1 tablespoon fresh rosemary, chopped
- 1 tablespoon fresh thyme, chopped
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 cup quinoa
- 2 cups water or vegetable broth
- 1 cup mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, zucchini, and cherry tomatoes), diced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 2 tablespoons fresh parsley, chopped
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. prepare a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
3. place the salmon fillets on the baking sheet and season them with salt and pepper.
4. top each fillet with lemon slices, rosemary, and thyme.
5. roast the salmon in the preheated oven for about 12-15 minutes, or until it is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
6. while the salmon is roasting, prepare the quinoa. rinse it under cold water and drain.
7. in a separate pot, bring the water or vegetable broth to a boil. add the quinoa and reduce the heat to low.
8. cover the pot and simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until the quinoa is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.
9. while the quinoa is cooking, toss the diced mixed vegetables with olive oil, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
10. spread the vegetables on a separate baking sheet and roast them in the oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are roasted and tender.
11. once the salmon, quinoa, and vegetables are cooked, divide them onto two plates.
12. sprinkle each portion with fresh parsley.
13. serve the lemon herb roasted salmon with quinoa and roasted vegetables immediately. enjoy!
ingredients_list: salmon, fillet, lemon, fresh, rosemary, fresh, thyme, salt, pepper, taste, quinoa, water, vegetable, broth, vegetable, bell, pepper, zucchini, cherry, tomato, olive, fresh, parsley

title: Stuffed mushrooms with cream cheese and spinach
raw_text: 86. Stuffed mushrooms with cream cheese and spinach - 350 kcals per portion, 4 portions, vegetarian, contains lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 16 medium-sized mushrooms
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 cups fresh spinach, chopped
- 1/2 cup cream cheese (make sure it is lactose-free if necessary)
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese (optional)
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 350°f (180°c).
2. clean the mushrooms by removing the stems and gently wiping off any dirt.
3. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
4. add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the skillet and sauté until they become translucent and fragrant.
5. add the chopped spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted.
6. remove the skillet from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. once the spinach mixture has cooled slightly, stir in the cream cheese until well combined. season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. take each mushroom cap and generously stuff it with the cream cheese and spinach mixture.
9. place the stuffed mushrooms on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
10. sprinkle the grated parmesan cheese (if using) evenly over the stuffed mushrooms.
11. bake in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender and the cheese on top is golden and bubbly.
12. remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving.
13. serve the stuffed mushrooms as a delicious appetizer or as a side dish. enjoy!
ingredients_list: mushroom, olive, onion, clove, garlic, minced, fresh, spinach, cream, cheese, lactose, salt, pepper, taste, parmesan, cheese

title: Beef and broccoli pasta with creamy garlic sauce
raw_text: 87. Beef and broccoli pasta with creamy garlic sauce - 480 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten, lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 8 oz pasta (gluten-containing)
- 1 lb beef sirloin, thinly sliced
- 2 cups broccoli florets
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 cup heavy cream (contains lactose)
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese (contains lactose)
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. cook the pasta according to package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.
2. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat.
3. add the beef slices to the skillet and cook until browned on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side. remove from the skillet and set aside.
4. in the same skillet, add the minced garlic and sauté for 1 minute until fragrant.
5. add the broccoli florets to the skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes until they become slightly tender.
6. reduce the heat to low and pour in the heavy cream. stir well to combine.
7. add the grated parmesan cheese to the skillet and stir until the sauce is smooth and creamy.
8. season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. return the beef slices to the skillet and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until they are cooked through and the sauce is heated.
10. serve the beef and broccoli pasta over the cooked pasta.
11. garnish with additional parmesan cheese, if desired.
12. enjoy your creamy beef and broccoli pasta!

title: Ratatouille with couscous
raw_text: 88. Ratatouille with couscous - 350 kcals per portion, 4 portions, vegetarian, contains gluten
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 eggplant, chopped into cubes
- 1 zucchini, chopped into cubes
- 1 yellow bell pepper, chopped into cubes
- 1 red bell pepper, chopped into cubes
- 1 onion, chopped
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 can (400g) diced tomatoes
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 cup couscous
- 1 ½ cups vegetable broth
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. in a large oven-safe pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
3. add the chopped eggplant, zucchini, bell peppers, onion, and garlic to the pan. cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally until the vegetables start to soften.
4. pour in the diced tomatoes, dried basil, dried thyme, salt, and pepper. mix well to combine.
5. transfer the pan to the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and slightly caramelized.
6. while the ratatouille is cooking, prepare the couscous. in a separate saucepan, bring the vegetable broth to a boil.
7. remove the broth from heat and stir in the couscous. cover and let it sit for 5 minutes until the couscous absorbs the liquid.
8. fluff the couscous with a fork to separate the grains.
9. serve the ratatouille over a bed of couscous in individual bowls or on plates.
10. enjoy your delicious vegetarian ratatouille with couscous, each portion providing approximately 350 calories!

title: Honey soy glazed chicken with sesame noodles
raw_text: 89. Honey soy glazed chicken with sesame noodles - 420 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains gluten, soy
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 chicken breasts
- 4 tablespoons honey
- 4 tablespoons soy sauce (gluten-free if needed)
- 2 tablespoons sesame oil
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ginger, grated
- 2 servings of noodles (gluten-free if needed)
- 2 tablespoons sesame seeds
- 2 green onions, sliced
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. in a bowl, mix together honey, soy sauce, sesame oil, minced garlic, and grated ginger.
3. place the chicken breasts in a baking dish, and pour the honey soy sauce mixture over them, ensuring they are well coated. reserve a little sauce for brushing later.
4. bake the chicken in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is fully cooked and juices run clear.
5. while the chicken is baking, cook the noodles according to package instructions.
6. once the noodles are cooked, drain them and transfer to a large mixing bowl.
7. in the same mixing bowl, add the reserved honey soy sauce mixture and toss the noodles to coat them evenly.
8. sprinkle sesame seeds over the noodles and toss again.
9. slice the cooked chicken breasts into thin strips.
10. divide the sesame noodles onto two plates and top each with sliced chicken.
11. garnish with sliced green onions.
12. serve the honey soy glazed chicken with sesame noodles immediately and enjoy!

note: please double-check the ingredients to ensure they meet your dietary needs and restrictions.

title: Greek chicken gyros with tzatziki sauce and pita bread
raw_text: 90. Greek chicken gyros with tzatziki sauce and pita bread - 550 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains gluten, lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 2 teaspoons dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 4 pita breads
- 1 cup diced tomatoes
- 1 cup sliced cucumbers
- 1/2 cup diced red onion
- tzatziki sauce (see recipe below)

for the tzatziki sauce:
- 1 cup greek yogurt (lactose-free if needed)
- 1/2 cup grated cucumber
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 tablespoon chopped fresh dill
- 1 tablespoon minced garlic
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. in a bowl, combine the olive oil, lemon juice, dried oregano, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. mix well.
2. place the chicken breasts in a shallow dish and pour the marinade over them. make sure the chicken is evenly coated. let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight.
3. preheat the grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.
4. remove the chicken from the marinade and discard any excess marinade.
5. grill the chicken for about 5-6 minutes per side, or until cooked through and nicely charred. remove from heat and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing.
6. while the chicken is resting, prepare the tzatziki sauce. in a bowl, combine greek yogurt, grated cucumber, lemon juice, chopped dill, minced garlic, salt, and pepper. stir well to combine. refrigerate until ready to use.
7. warm the pita breads on the grill or in a toaster oven for a few seconds on each side.
8. to assemble the gyros, lay each pita bread flat and spread a generous amount of tzatziki sauce on it.
9. thinly slice the grilled chicken and divide it equally among the pita breads.
10. top with diced tomatoes, sliced cucumbers, and diced red onion.
11. fold the sides of the pita bread over the filling, roll it up tightly, and secure with a toothpick if needed.
12. serve the greek chicken gyros with extra tzatziki sauce on the side, if desired.

enjoy your delicious greek chicken gyros with tzatziki sauce and pita bread!
ingredients_list: boneless, skinless, chicken, breast, olive, lemon, dried, oregano, garlic, powder, salt, pepper, taste, pita, bread, tomato, cucumber, red, onion, tzatziki, sauce, tzatziki, sauce, greek, yogurt, lactose, needed, cucumber, lemon, fresh, dill, minced, garlic, salt, pepper, taste

title: Shrimp scampi with linguine
raw_text: 91. Shrimp scampi with linguine - 480 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains shellfish, gluten, lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 1 lb linguine
- 1 lb shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 4 tablespoons butter
- 4 tablespoons olive oil
- 1/2 cup white wine
- 1/4 cup fresh lemon juice
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
- salt and pepper to taste
- crushed red pepper flakes (optional, for heat)
- grated parmesan cheese (optional, for garnish)
preparation:
1. cook the linguine according to the package instructions until al dente. drain and set aside.
2. in a large skillet, melt the butter and olive oil over medium heat.
3. add the minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes.
4. increase the heat to medium-high and add the shrimp to the skillet. cook for 2-3 minutes until they turn pink and opaque.
5. remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
6. in the same skillet, add the white wine and lemon juice. bring to a simmer and cook for 2-3 minutes to reduce slightly.
7. return the cooked shrimp to the skillet and toss to coat them in the sauce.
8. add the cooked linguine to the skillet and toss well to combine with the sauce and shrimp.
9. season with salt, pepper, and crushed red pepper flakes (if desired) to taste.
10. sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve immediately.
11. optional: garnish with grated parmesan cheese before serving.

enjoy your delicious shrimp scampi with linguine!
ingredients_list: linguine, shrimp, deveined, clove, garlic, minced, butter, olive, white, wine, fresh, lemon, fresh, parsley, salt, pepper, taste, red, pepper, flake, parmesan, cheese, garnish

title: Miso-glazed salmon with jasmine rice and steamed vegetables
raw_text: 95. Miso-glazed salmon with jasmine rice and steamed vegetables - 500 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 2 salmon fillets
- 2 tablespoons miso paste
- 1 tablespoon honey
- 1 tablespoon rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce (ensure it is lactose-free)
- 1 cup jasmine rice
- 2 cups water
- a mixture of steamed vegetables of your choice (e.g., broccoli, carrots, snow peas)
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 400°f (200°c).
2. in a small bowl, mix together the miso paste, honey, rice vinegar, and soy sauce until well combined.
3. line a baking sheet with parchment paper and place the salmon fillets on it.
4. brush the miso glaze evenly over the salmon fillets.
5. bake the salmon in the preheated oven for about 12-15 minutes or until cooked to your desired doneness.
6. meanwhile, rinse the jasmine rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
7. in a saucepan, combine the rinsed rice and water. bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
8. once boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover, and let the rice simmer for about 10-12 minutes or until all the water is absorbed and the rice is tender.
9. in a separate steamer or steaming basket, steam the vegetables until crisp-tender.
10. season the steamed vegetables with salt and pepper to taste.
11. divide the cooked rice, steamed vegetables, and miso-glazed salmon onto two plates.
12. serve immediately and enjoy your delicious miso-glazed salmon with jasmine rice and steamed vegetables!

note: remember to check the labels of the ingredients you use to ensure they are lactose-free. additionally, measurements and cooking times may vary, so adjust as needed.
ingredients_list: salmon, fillet, miso, paste, honey, rice, vinegar, soy, sauce, lactose, jasmine, rice, water, vegetable, broccoli, carrot, pea, salt, pepper, taste

title: Mexican stuffed bell peppers with ground beef and rice
raw_text: 96. Mexican stuffed bell peppers with ground beef and rice - 450 kcals per portion, 4 portions, contains lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 bell peppers (any color)
- 1 pound ground beef
- 1 cup cooked rice
- 1/2 cup diced onion
- 1/2 cup diced tomatoes
- 1/2 cup black beans
- 1/2 cup corn kernels
- 1/2 cup shredded lactose-free cheese
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- salt and pepper to taste
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds. set aside.
3. in a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
4. add the diced onion and cook for 2-3 minutes until translucent.
5. add the ground beef, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. cook until the beef is browned and cooked through.
6. drain any excess fat from the skillet.
7. stir in the cooked rice, diced tomatoes, black beans, and corn kernels. cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until heated through.
8. place the bell peppers in a baking dish.
9. fill each bell pepper with the ground beef and rice mixture, pressing it down lightly.
10. sprinkle the shredded lactose-free cheese on top of each stuffed bell pepper.
11. cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the bell peppers are tender and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
12. remove from the oven and let the stuffed bell peppers cool for a few minutes before serving.
13. serve the mexican stuffed bell peppers hot, and enjoy!

title: Baked coconut shrimp with mango salsa and jasmine rice
raw_text: 98. Baked coconut shrimp with mango salsa and jasmine rice - 420 kcals per portion, 2 portions, contains shellfish, lactose
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 10 large shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 1/2 cup shredded coconut
- 1/4 cup bread crumbs
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon paprika
- 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 egg, beaten
- cooking spray

for the mango salsa:
- 1 ripe mango, peeled and diced
- 1/4 cup red bell pepper, diced
- 1/4 cup red onion, diced
- 1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
- 1 tablespoon lime juice
- salt and pepper to taste

for the jasmine rice:
- 1 cup jasmine rice
- 2 cups water
- pinch of salt
preparation:
1. preheat the oven to 425°f (220°c).

2. in a shallow dish, mix together shredded coconut, bread crumbs, salt, black pepper, paprika, and garlic powder.

3. set up a breading station with three shallow dishes: one with flour, one with beaten egg, and one with the coconut breadcrumb mixture.

4. dip each shrimp into flour, then coat in beaten egg, and finally roll in the coconut breadcrumb mixture, pressing gently to adhere. repeat with all the shrimp.

5. place the coated shrimp on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. spray the tops of the shrimp with more cooking spray.

6. bake the shrimp in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through.

7. while the shrimp are cooking, prepare the mango salsa. in a bowl, combine diced mango, red bell pepper, red onion, cilantro, lime juice, salt, and pepper. mix well and set aside.

8. in a saucepan, combine jasmine rice, water, and a pinch of salt. bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and fluffy.

9. once everything is ready, divide the baked coconut shrimp, mango salsa, and jasmine rice into two portions.

10. serve the baked coconut shrimp alongside the mango salsa and jasmine rice. enjoy your flavorful and nutritious meal!
cuisine: The cuisine type of this recipe is "fusion."
ingredients_list: shrimp, deveined, shredded, coconut, bread, crumb, salt, black, pepper, paprika, garlic, powder, flour, egg, spray, mango, salsa, mango, red, bell, pepper, red, onion, fresh, cilantro, lime, salt, pepper, taste, jasmine, rice, jasmine, rice, water, pinch, salt

title: Stuffed bell peppers with couscous, chickpeas, and feta
raw_text:
100. Stuffed bell peppers with couscous, chickpeas, and feta - 350 kcals per portion, 4 portions, vegetarian, contains lactose

(Continued below...)
ingredients:
ingredients:
- 4 bell peppers (any color)
- 1 cup couscous
- 1 can chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh mint
- 1/4 cup chopped red onion
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon ground paprika
- salt and pepper, to taste
preparation:
1. preheat your oven to 375°f (190°c).
2. cut off the tops of the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membrane. set them aside.
3. in a medium-sized saucepan, bring 1 cup of water to a boil. add the couscous, cover, and remove from heat. let it sit for 5 minutes, then fluff with a fork.
4. in a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked couscous, chickpeas, feta cheese, parsley, mint, red onion, olive oil, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. mix well to ensure everything is evenly combined.
5. stuff each bell pepper with the couscous mixture, filling them all the way to the top. place the peppers upright in a baking dish.
6. bake the stuffed bell peppers in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the peppers are tender and the filling is heated through.
7. once cooked, remove from the oven and let them cool slightly before serving. enjoy your stuffed bell peppers with couscous, chickpeas, and feta as a delicious vegetarian meal!
ingredients_list: bell, pepper, color, couscous, chickpea, feta, cheese, fresh, parsley, fresh, mint, red, onion, olive, ground, cumin, ground, paprika, salt, pepper, taste
